Summary Heading: Near Disneyland and Santa Ana airport
Summary: Well….some good, some bad.  We were staying here for the National Championship Football game and we wanted to be near Santa Ana airport.    The property is located down the street from the Disneyland entrance. I walked each day to get more exercise but it’s over .8 mile away. Many hotels are on the same street but closer. The hotel’s rooms are getting quite old and probably need a remodel soon. Although - the rooms are nicely sized and included a large supply of towels, shampoo etc.  Breakfast is not included in the rate but I get 2 free breakfasts nightly due to my Bonvoy status. The breakfast was very good.   Staff were nice. They did not provide daily housekeeping unless you stayed more than 2 days. My safe never worked properly even after maintenance “fixed” it.  So, you
Room tip: All rooms are noisy from traffic. Bring earplugs, if you need quiet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Offered to upgrade our room as we were not comfortable. very kind staff and great service. Torise was exceptional with meeting all our requests and expectations. Loved the resort and all that it offered us.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Reasonable price for a nice quality hotel
Summary: Conveniently located and easy to get in/out. Friendly and helpful staff. One of my “go to” places near Disneyland. I like that parking is gated, it feels more secure. Overall clean and well maintained.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is GREAT! I was a little nervous from other reviews but was so pleasantly surprised! Rooms were clean, staff was SO accommodating, loved the 24 hour hot tub and pool and the restaurant has great food!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great service from staff and entire hotel
Summary: The rooms were nice and clean..lots of pillows. The resturaunt store and coffee  shop were such an added plus with no car. The staff was best I think I've had so accommodating. Great having a 24 hour pool and spa.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I normally book hotels direct. But this time i wanted to try out a new travel service which offered me a much lower rate than booking direct. This is fine if you are looking for a clean room and bed nothing more. When i checked in i was given a room on first floor and as close to the freeway as you can get, facing away from the park towards the freeway. I suspect this was done because i did not book direct. So, if you are looking for a room without road noise, with a view of fireworks, you might have better luck if you dont go through 3rd party app. Luckily i didn’t care about view. However, the road noise is substantial for the rooms facing the fwy and is heard inside the room. So, if you are a light sleeper, this can be a problem and i would look elsewhere. Also, the bed was
Room tip: Avoid rooms facing fwy. Plenty of parking.

Summary Heading: Grungy and needs repairs - No hot water in shower, broken faucet, no help w/front desk
Summary: My room had no hot water in the shower. The faucet turned 360 degrees several times until it came off. That's a long overdue repair that maintenance, housekeeping, and management clearly overlooked. It didn't just happen in a single night. It's such a shame, too. The check-in process was wonderful. But, no, I'd never return. When I told the front desk staff at check-out about the shower, they were completely incapable of offering so much as a 10% discount for having a cold shower. They were ridiculous. There are so many hotels near Disneyland, choose another.
Room tip: They'll try to sell you a room looking at the pool - it's as noisy as the rooms that...

Summary Heading: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE
Summary: Stayed here with my husband and 2 small children. Upon check in, the room was not ready, they told us they would text when the room was ready. Never received a text. Husband called later in the evening and we were advised the room was ready. Arrived at the hotel tired post Disney day. We were given our room keys and room number. Made our way to what we thought was our room, open the door, and it was fully lived in. Thank goodness no one was in the room, but still how scary is that?! We then had to go back down to the lobby and they were confused and insisted that it was our room. We had not been into our room yet because we were told it wasn’t ready. They attempted to make it up to us by giving us a drink at the bar and free breakfast for the morning. Then we got to our room and

Summary: The best hotel and the best view of the fireworks! Really great service! Rooms are modern and clean! In the front ask for Jeremy pusher he is the best, kind and really helpful, need any questions ask him!

Summary Heading: Not the best, not the worst
Summary: We recently stayed here for a five night stay, and I was very apprehensive after reading negative reviews. There were both positives and negatives- the positives include very kind and accommodating staff, clean and welcoming lobby, lovely pool area (not overly large but clean), easy walking distance to Disneyland Resort and the Anaheim Convention Center.  The hotel does not have inside corridors, therefore if you want natural light in your room, you will expose your room to anyone walking by. They were doing renovations during our stay and very loud grinding/drilling noises occurred during the afternoons which made it impossible to rest (we understand that it happens and can’t be a quiet task but it did negatively impact our stay). Our hotel room was clean, however the king size

Summary: This hotel is beyond filthy!!! In fact, this is hands down the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed in. The dirt and grime in my room was literally so visible, I spent the first 45 minutes in my room cleaning the floors and wiping down all of the room's sticky surfaces. Upon checkout, I realized I had been charged for parking; however, I didn’t park a car. I went down to the front desk first thing in the morning to have the charges corrected and have since had to spend a lengthy call to the hotel in order to have the charges reversed.    The only benefit to this hotel is it is a convenient walking distance to Disneyland but with that said, I would not recommend staying at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim.

Summary: Unfortunately, we didn't have the best stay at this property. We went to Disneyland for a quick day trip and wanted to stay near the park. The only positive of our stay was the quick walk from this hotel to the parks. It was convenient to walk down Harbor Blvd and be at the parks within 15 min. Beyond the location, this property falls short in all other areas. While it's nice to be able to see the fireworks from the property, you can't hear anything during the show and it was more disruptive than fun. While our room was on the top floor, we were facing the freeway and heard freeway noise 24/7. The bed was uncomfortable and the pillows provided no support. While it's obvious the room was renovated over the years, you can still see the dated parts of the room. The shower pressure

Summary: I first would like to say I really enjoyed our stay at The Four Points Sheraton Anaheim. (Marrott). Went there for two reason one to a softball national Tournament and have my granddaughter have a great vacation.  The staff was exceptional Especially Hany and Linda at the front desk.  The rooms are big and spacious. We had breakfast each Moring at the hotel. A very good verity and the waiters and host was friendly. Also has drinks at the bar and excellent cocktails. Had dinner there the first night a good variety and large portions and very flavorful. The hotel is close to many places such as Disneyland and Starbucks across the street plus their coffee is made with it in the deli.  I really liked that the pool stayed open 24 hrs. after a long day you could go and unwind in the

Next time l will Uber or pay to park. The hotel room was clean. The lobby was really nice. I wish our rooms were as updated but again it was clean. There is a security gate all around the sidewalk, at the rooms, that can only be opened with a room key. That was a good feature because of all of the transient people randomly walking through the parking lot and surrounding area. Housekeeping only comes to your room on the third day. Summary Heading: THE BEST HOTEL FOR ANY FAMILY HANDS DOWN

Summary Heading: Nice enough Hotel 15 min walk from DisneyLand
Summary: This place will never win awards, its old and tired wedged between two noisy roads and if Disney was not so close by it would have been torn down years ago..  However, Disney is nearby and people need somewhere to stay. I picked this place as I had some Marriott points and to be honest whist not the most attractive option locally it's was more than sufficient for my needs.  The room was not too noisy and whilst old it was clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and amenities were great.  Sure there are better,  fancier hotels that may be nearer but at the price we paid I was more than happy, oh aand who don't love free coffee in the morning?

Summary: This hotel is expensive and nothing to write home about. The dryer didn't work, the front desk doesn't give out quarters. There are no do not disturb signs and housekeeping came by several times and opened the door. The parking is scarce. Then the elevator didn't work and I had to carry all my luggage down 5 floors.

Summary: Finding a Marriott branded hotel near Disneyland for a reasonable nightly rate was difficult.  The Four Points Sheraton was among the lowest priced but still very expensive for what the place is.  Located very close to the freeway which was very noisy at all hours.  About a 15 minute walk to Disneyland.  Guest rooms are accessed by outdoor corridors so this feels more like a motel.  Rooms were very basic and dated.  This hotel has been around for many years.  I remember staying here back in 2003 when it was the Holiday Inn.

Summary Heading: Walkable to Disneyland and good value
Summary: If you are looking for a Bonvoy hotel near Disneyland, this property is the best value. As it is also walkable to Disneyland, so you don't have to spend money on parking or an Uber. (And you can pick up breakfast at McDonalds or Panera on the way)   It is very close to the freeway, and so you can hear the white noise of the cars rushing by. The hotel rooms are well-worn--bathrooms could use an upgrade.    But if you are going to Disneyland, and are mostly looking for a place to lay your head down in between days, this is a good place for you!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am a Marriott Bonvoy member and stay at all types and locations.  I wanted to take my son for his birthday so selected this location since it was close to Disneyland.    The room was well used…bathroom had mold in the shower and shower curtain had mold.   The hotel is so loud.  We didn’t sleep at all.  I even have a white noise machine I travel with and it made no difference.   When I spoke to the front desk about the noise she said oh I know it’s super loud.    If you want any sleep after or before a Disney visit don’t stay here!

Summary Heading: If negative stars could be given, it would still be too high a rating

Summary: We stayed here many years ago when it was the Ménage Hotel and I thought it was pretty nice and reasonably priced. The 2nd time we stayed it was still the Ménage and things went downhill.  Fast forward to now and the hotel is now Four Points Sheraton and the hotel rooms haven’t been renovated in 15 years. It started at check in when we were told we couldn’t check in till 3pm. We came back at 3:30 and my daughter’s room still wasn’t ready, they had to wait an additional hour. The rooms smell like dirty feet, the bed feels like the frame is falling apart, the pillows are barely pillows and feel like they are 20 years old. The bathroom floor is grimy in the corners. We got one bar of soap to use in the shower and wash our hands. After a full day at the park coming back to rest at

Summary: Location was great for Disneyland. Rooms were clean . I loved the lobby and the swimming pool. Super modern. Overall very satisfied,  Definitely will recommend to friends and family. I enjoyed stay at four points Anaheim .

Summary Heading: Reasonable price and staff are great
Summary: With the price …. I think it’s totally worth it. We arrived at 11a and was told the room will be ready by 2pm. We went to Downtown Disney for a walk and grabbed something to eat, came back at 1pm. They asked if there is any specific floor we like to stay, we just want to get into a room so it doesn’t matter - and it’s super hot so ya..we will take whatever room is ready! Yay!  So they gave us a room on the 1st floor at 1pm check it. Which is great! Walked into the room. The AC not working. Housekeeper next door came and checked but not working so she told us to call Front desk. We waited for about 10 mins and the maintenance guy came and fixed it. No big deal! The only odd thing there is no luggage rack and no glass/ cups at all in the room. Not even disposable cup… humm again..
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I did a quick trip to Disneyland for the weekend . We stayed here for two nights and we had a great stay. We had a king bed , with sofa bed. Our room was specious. The shower head was low for my husband, but the water pressure was great. In the shower, there are soap, shampoo and conditioner dispenser.  Our blow dryer was missing, so I called the front desk, and Krystal was so helpful and brought on up to our room. Customer service is top notch here.  We did face the highway, and we could hear the noise from our room, but it was not that bad. We could see the fireworks from our room. The parks are walkable (15 minutes to the gate) The ART stops at the hotel , as well. We did have the breakfast buffet , one morning. The buffet was 18 dollars, for eggs,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not at all what I expected.
Summary: We were on the 4th floor #458, which is sandwiched between two storage rooms and the service elevator. Not much in the way of freeway noise, but the service staff does start early in the morning and apparently forgets there's a guest room nearby.   The A/C unit was not working properly, nor was the sink. A call to the front desk remedied the sink, but all they did to the A/C was turn it down to 60. It still blew warm air. The next day we spoke with the front desk in person and they had the maintenance supervisor respond to our room. After a small bit of tinkering, they ended up replacing the unit and cold air was not a problem the rest of our stay (temps were high during our stay 90-95).   This place is old and has a motor lodge / motel feel. The carpets in the room were very
Manager Response: Dear Paul,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding these issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.  Sincerely, Jesus S

Summary: We adored our stay at the Four Points by Sheraton!   The staff here really go above and beyond for their guests. Every staff member we talked to was extremely friendly and did everything they could to make sure we had a great stay.   The beds are  comfortable and the rooms are spacious. There is also plenty of guest parking which is always a plus.   I also loved how close this hotel is to Disneyland. It took us about 15 minutes to walk there everyday.   The Four Points is our new go-to hotel in Anaheim.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very easy to check in and out... staff was great. Very friendly. The room was huge and very clean. I recommend to anyone that has children. It's very spacious. Planning on returning on our next vacation to California.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After being on lockdown for a year, it was great to be able to have a wonderful experience and excellent customer service provided by staff.  The rooms clean, staff was friendly and professional.  Clint was very knowledgeable and helpful with recommendations and directions for things to do with our 4 year old.  I highly recommend this location if you’re looking for a 5 star experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Came here for a 3 night stay with family and friends to visit Disneyland and explore LA. We like to stay at Marriott  properties when we travel, however this hotel did not feel like a Marriott but more like a run down cheap motel. The photos online did not match to what we arrived to. There were people  lingering and going in between parked vehicles in the lot that looked suspicious. We checked in very late past midnight and when we got to the room we immediately were disappointed. The furniture in the room is wore down, paint chipped, the phone in the room is filthy, stains on bedding and towels,  the carpet in the room had crumbs, a hair pin and sticky substance throughout the flooring. I called the front desk and asked if we could checkout without being penalized, the agent
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean & organized. Rooms are neat and spacious.  Everyone (staff) are friendly & very helpful. Love coming here & yes the food were so tasty & very delicious. Close to shopping center,, restaurants,  & to Disneyland.  I recommend this place. 5 🌟
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff were great, they made me Feel at home, they made sure I am comfortable. My room was nice and clean. The location is close to Disneyland, so you can literally walk. Nice heated pool.  The food at the restaurant was great, with a lkttle touch of asian fusion.  I will stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean, Safe, and Close to Proximities
Summary: This was my 1st time in the area, and the staff was extremely helpful and polite.  My room was clean and welcoming.  I enjoyed the pool extremely.  I had a minor issue with my heat, and they came and fixed right away.  The breakfast food was fantastic.  The hotel itself was very quiet during my week stay This was important so i could work during the day.  I will be booking my stay here next time,definitely!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Filthy, unsafe, health hazard in terrible disrepair - So much has changed here.
Summary: I haven't traveled in well over a year due to the pandemic, however I'm a Marriott Bonvoy Titanium Elite member and have stayed at this location many times previously.  I stayed here so often, the entire staff recognized me whenever I'd come in. They appear to be gone now. If you didn't know, Marriott bought Sheraton hotels about seven years ago, so the Four Points is now a Marriott property.  I work in public health and safety with manufacturers and government agencies, including FDA, CDC, OSHA, the State of CA Dept of Health and Human Services, as well as local agencies, and I have several health conditions that leave me immunocompromised and at high risk. I am a very seasoned, avid business traveler, and through the pandemic, I have worked on about a dozen Emergency Use
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Touch of Disney/it’s in the details of things
Summary: This was my first time staying here and I took the advice to get a high floor for the noise. That worked out good for the freeway but not Harbor Blvrd. Hotel needs noise dampening windows. One of the amenities that a basic motel will have is an in room coffee maker and cups. Ice bucket had no liner. None was found in my room. A room to sleep four only had two full size towels. Room service to get more towels took 30 mins and a repeat call to them. For a one night or two night stay this hotel is worth it. If you need coffee the coffee bar down in lobby has it for free.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I travelled to Socal from Central Cal with my friend as a short stay-cation.  I've been to the Anaheim area before and wasn't very impressed... And without Disneyland being open, I had lower expectations for the area... plus, throughout the pandemic, I have been having low expectations for all hotels..  but I was blown away here!  The front desk staff were very friendly. The lobby is very beautiful. The room, which we reserved at around $125, was very good given the price. When I was checking out, the front desk staff reminded guests to wear masks when entering the building... which not too many hotels are doing enough of these days.  Once Disneyland opens, I'd love to come back and stay at this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here twice in two weeks. The rooms are clean but there was no body location the first time and the one available the second time was obviously used. The common floor downstairs looked dirty. And people in the hallway woke me up once.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This motel should have their franchise pulled from Marriott for the current state of the hotel. The pool area looked nice but was closed by the government. The elevator that was reported broken months earlier was still not working for the time I was there In December 2020. The room I was assigned smelled horribly of mildew to find the carpet under the sink wet but not from the sink. The tub faucet did not shut off dripping a steady stream and if the shower diverter was left on the water dripped out of the shower bounced off the tub spout and soaked the rug. The balance of the rug was filthy from dirt or mildew leaving my feet and socks black. The furnishings were well abused and left signs of hard use. The AC filter had not been cleaned in months requiring me to wipe off the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Once amazing but now is so sad
Summary: This is my favorite hotel but now I'm not sure. When Disneyland was open, this was my go to spot. When I wanted to go to Anaheim, this was my go to spot. I recommend this hotel to everyone even when it was the old Hotel Menage.   I just recently stayed and it was so disappointing. I got an amazing rate but the clientele has become very sketchy. I was there for 3 nights and during my stay, the police were there twice and once I witness an arrest. The main lobby elevator was out of service so we had to use the other one. It almost became a joke of "what would we find today?" as there were half eaten tacos, cigarette butts, trash and really all it needed was a vacuum and a wipe down. All the outdoor areas were littered with trash, more cigarettes butts and it honestly was just so
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Dated, older hotel that is in need of updates and modernizing
Summary: I was very disappointed in my stay at this hotel.  The front desk staff was great and the room seemed to be cleaned thoroughly.   However, the room smelled of bleach and it felt very musty.  The elevator was really disgusting.  The flooring of the elevator was pulling up and it was just dirty.  The parking lot was very sketchy as well.  Lots of people hanging out in the parking lot and there is not enough lighting or pathways to the hotel, especially if you park in the back.  There is no side door access to the hotel and you have to go in through the front door.  The rooms definitely need to be updated with furniture and linens.   The sheets seemed to be clean, but this property was nowhere near the level of other Four Points properties.  I would not stay here again. :(
Manager Response: Dear Kelly P,   We recognize your time is valuable and appreciate the feedback you have provided on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.  Maintaining a clean atmosphere within our guest rooms and common areas is always a key priority, especially during these unprecedented times. On behalf of the entire team at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim, I sincerely apologize for falling short of not only meeting your expectations, but ours as well. Rest assured, the feedback provided will be shared with the appropriate hotel team to ensure we consistently deliver upon guest expectations.  As a valued guest, we appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback.  We also recognize these are unusual times and we thank you for choosing to stay with us.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: So let’s start with the pics I took, just a few things that you would think the Sheridan would be better at maintaining. The unsettling smell by the sink is also to be noted. The mosquitoes were the worst part of it all. Overall, I thought the Sheridan would upkeep much better than what I saw, especially during a pandemic!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed here for work and picked this place myself because it was the ;east expensive in the area and I was trying to save my boss some money.  Not worth it.  A dump!  Garbage was never picked up around the property; security gates were unlocked at all times; elevators didn't work; bugs n the room; vacant rooms all over that were unmade and the shades were up to see; large groups of people taking over the pool area for what seemed to be a day at the pool.  Don't do it!  I wasn't going to leave this last point but the survey asks if anyone at the hotel speaks Spanish .  What I would say is all the guests definitely spoke Spainish.  Not a native English speaking person in site as far as guest go.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed in hotels all over the world and my experience at the Four Points Sheraton in Anaheim is easily the worst experience of my life.Checked in on a Friday and the lady at the front desk was actually very nice and pleasant. I also advised her that I will be extending my stay for an extra night and she said to simply come over to the front desk the next morning to get new keys.  So next morning after extending my stay, I went out briefly, came back around 11:30am and the housekeeping had gone into my room and literally junked all my stuff.I was beyond shocked! I had lots of items in the room. Food and drinks in the fridge and she dumped everything into the same bag. She even opened the safe where I had very important and sensitive documents and dumped them as well.  So
Manager Response: none

Summary: I book a room on hotels.com instead of the Marriott App due to the price was $20 cheaper for May 28th. I booked a 2 queen Poolside room but was given a handicap 1 king accessible room. The room was really outdated. The bed was missing sheets, toilet was clogged upon entering the room and was told by front desk the manger cannot come out to speak. The front desk literally handed me a plunger saying u can unclog the toilet. I asked for a room change and employees refused. I love Marriott but this has to be the worse 4 Points Marriott owns. I do not recommend staying here.  Plus the light switch is falling down off the wall.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beds are terrible. Shower leaked. Furniture broken. Staff, however were great. Parking fees are a bit high. The walk isn't bad to Disney, about 15 minutes. The store in the hotel had great prices. Check them out for Disney lanyards! Super cheap! Pool looked nice but too cold to use it. Fireworks from Disneyland are VERY LOUD!! Hotel does provide earplugs but anyone with PTSD or anxiety may not do well because with the echo it sounds like bombs. Car alarms go off every night for several minutes along with the fireworks.
Manager Response: Dear krausclan4,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: Staff here is excellent-friendly, welcoming and always smiling.  The staff however can not overcome several issues:  This place is crazy loud-everywhere!  The noise from the adjacent interstate is inescapable and I pity the poor people who are closer than we were.  Walls are obviously paper thin-every door slam, every conversation as people walk by at any hour, everything permeates your room!  There is clearly no sound proofing of any type, anywhere!  If you assume I’m being too particular then come and stay here and you will learn the hard way!  It is walkable to Disneyland which is why we are here.  Be aware that you will walk over the very busy I-5 interstate.  We walked back after dark one evening and none of us felt safe as we shared the bridge with some “locals”-again you
Manager Response: none

Summary: we have been to disneyland many times and stayed  at quite a few hotels. Usually we find one we like and stick with it until it is unavailable.  Recently we booked a package stay and the four points was the only available in the price range we wanted for such a spur of the moment trip.  I have jogged all over the resort area and know most of the properties so I could confirm that the walk is not too bad, so we booked it.  Knowing the proximity to the freeway i was concerned, since i am a light sleeper, and even though we literally got the closest room to the freeway possible, I was amazed that we did not have noise issues(with the ac fan on high all night to mask things).  The lower area of the hotel is well done, along with a great outdoor/pool area.  The rooms have been
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for President's Day weekend with my family of 4 (older teens).  Great location!! less than a mile from the front entrance to Disneyland properties.  Certainly within walking distance to enjoy the park then come back to the hotel for some needed respite, then back to the park.  They also have a nice, serviceable pool area with a hot tub. No pool side service but you can order at the bar/restaurant inside and bring it out to the pool.  Fireworks show at Disneyland can be seen easily from the pool area which was nice.  Downside is the BOOM is BIG when the fireworks show is going on so be prepared for that.  Also freeway noise is a problem as the hotel is on the corner of two busy streets and adjacent to the freeway.  The beds were comfortable and the room was clean.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is an easy 15-minute walk to or from Disneyland.   Despite being located next to the freeway, the rooms are fairly quiet, but earplugs are provided.   Room 406 was much quieter than Room 426, as the higher numbers are in a swing closer to the freeway.  The staff couldn't be nicer, however.  Our room wasn't made up on our last day for some reason, which was disappointing after a 12-hour day at the park.  Retrieving ice (for comforting sore feet) was a journey as the machines couldn't be further away from the main wing.  The restaurant food was good...fish and chips.  The rooms are old but were clean.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: All we needed for an enjoyable week at Disneyland!
Summary: After reading all the reviews, we were a bit apprehensive for our stay, and we are relieved and delighted to have enjoyed five nights at the Four Points. True--in terms of comparable establishments with our same Bonvoy points/experiences--it's less plush (thus the four stars instead of 5), but it was everything we needed for our stay and purpose. The staff--in all regards--went above and beyond. From the folks in the Tru Grits restaurant (don't miss the happy hour!), the front desk staff, housekeeping, and to to the helpful gentleman who came to fix our TV remote, everyone was kind and went above and beyond in their care, questions, and support. We felt taken care of. The room was basic but absolutely fine. It's true that a microwave in every room would go a long way, but we
Manager Response: none

Summary: There are many hotels around the theme parks. Prices vary based on proximity and level of comfort. Four Points is an average hotel, reasonably priced and within 20 minutes walk from Disneyland main gate. Lobby is basic as is the restaurant. Room is clean and above all, the king size bedding is very good. What makes Four Points worth this review is the way GM Clint’s staff, particularly Front Manager James and house sleuth Chris solved a problem which was not their fault. I had ordered several items from Amazon to be delivered to the hotel and held pending my arrival. When I arrived, there was no trace of anything. Finally most of the items were found in the GM’s office. Amazon had failed to indicate the shipping notes with my name. They were anonymously labelled. Four Points
Manager Response: none

Summary: Reading previous reviews in relation to the noise from interstate 5 we were nervous about this. Yes it was very noisy but location/comfy beds, block out curtains, friendly staff, free morning coffee 6-9 am and happy hour food sharing plates more than made up for this.  We booked 2 rooms and our 3 kids loved the pool and spa - they loved the 10 min walk to Disneyland entrance.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Road noise, old, stay only for proximity to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for a night while on work trip to Anaheim - it was the only reasonably-priced Bonvoy property in area and there's probably a reason why. The hotel itself is fine, it is aging but well maintained, and service is good. However most, if not all, of the rooms are accessed via a corridor facing the outside of the building which means one would keep the shades closed to prevent anyone walking past to look in - the rooms are essentially windowless. Hotel sits right next to the freeway which means road noise day and night. On the bright side, it is within short driving (but not walking) distance to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for short business trip - not for vacation
Summary: The hotel is located opposite of Disney park right at a heavy traffic highway. Pretty loud, but isolation of the windows is good. Nevertheless, even with the nice pool area it is not a vacation hotel, not a family hotel. The restaurant is nice, food is good, so is the bar and stuff is very friendly.
Manager Response: Dear michaelkK664MN,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding the noise. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: We stayed here for six nights and really enjoyed our stay. This was a combination of visiting family in the area and going to Disneyland trip. On a Disney note it’s about a 15 minute walk from the lobby to the entrance of Disney. We felt we got more hotel for the buck than by staying across the street from the Disney gate.   We can’t attest to anyone else’s experience but we’d like to address to the traffic noise that was brought up in other reviews: half the rooms face I-5. It didn’t effect our hotel room experience whatsoever. We slept great every night and once we were in the room we couldn’t hear a thing. You could hear the noise in the pool area because of the location but if people were swimming and having conversations it wasn’t very noticeable. While having coffee on the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Recently got back from a 3 night stay at hotel. While staff is very friendly and accommodating the hotel itself could use a makeover. #1 Hotel is out dated, and has exterior corridors.  #2 stayed in room 529, pillows were soft and lumpy.  #3 Bathroom tiny, toilet running constantly.  #4 Loud noise coming from somewhere this would happen at least once every hour. #5 Had to call front desk for toilet paper, I guess housekeeping didn't notice the roll only had 2 sheets left on it. #6 Woken up at 5:55 a.m. by loud speaker in our hotel room alerting us there is an emergency in the hotel and we needed to evacuate. Went downstairs with all the other guests, only to be told it was false alarm and we could return to our room. Positive note-hotels alert system does work. #7 PRO - hotel
Manager Response: Dear Meany1972,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding these issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary Heading: Safety issue and bad customer service!!!
Summary: We stayed 4 Days/3nights at this property (room is ok, nice distance walk to Disneyland and  has a great view of the pool and fireworks at night from the theme parks).  It would have been great if 2 of the elevators are  working due to busy weekend/holiday. Hotel room door is not closing properly and water is leaking/dripping noise in the bathroom. Our car got broke in at their parking lot which is pretty close and adjacent to the front entrance of the hotel right next to parking gate bar. So do not leave anything in your car, leave nothing!!!! (Parking lot is not secured, easy access).  We reached out to notify front desk but we did not feel their concern, it seems like they didn’t care and just handed out the incident form to complete. The exact word that they said ‘this has
Manager Response: Dear JuanBrusko,  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel managers to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent any of the issues you mentioned from occurring in the future.  Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed for a week with our family of four. The bathroom is tiny. The shower leaks all over the floor. The light switches and baseboards were dirty. There weren’t enough towels for four guests.  There were no towel racks, so we hung our towels on hangers in the closet.  Surfaces were dirty. Also, the city shuttle to Disneyland sped through the parking lot, failed to stop and cost us an extra hour in the morning.  We walked after learning that lesson. Our parents stayed at Candy Cane Inn and had a wonderful stay. Comparable price and clean rooms and private shuttle. Lesson learned. We will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Oregonfamilytrip,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding the room and bed. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We chose this hotel because it was markedly cheaper than the other chain hotels near Disney. We thought it was due to the proximity of the highway which we felt we were willing to risk.   Our visit started out great. The valet was very polite and helpful. At the front desk, they welcomed us with a smile, polite conversation, (and cookies!), and even gave my daughter a Disney balloon (the kind they sell in the park).  From there it basically went down hill...   We got to our room after a long day of travel to find we’d been placed in a room with one bed and there was no crib for my youngest despite our request.   I managed to get us moved to a room with two beds and asked for a crib while I was at the front desk. 90 minutes later it hadn’t shown up so my wife called down for a
Manager Response: Dear bengJ4592CC,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding the room and bed. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary Heading: Friendly staff. Decent location. Absolutely AWFUL cleaning crew.
Summary: I am a lifetime Titanium Elite so I've stayed at a number of Marriott locations as I traveled a lot for work. While this trip was a personal/leisure trip, this was one of the worst experiences I've had at a Marriott chain hotel.  Pros:  ++ Front desk people were incredibly friendly + The manager onsite was responsive and attentive to our issue  Cons:  --- THE CLEANING STAFF IS THE ABSOLUTE WORST AND UNPROFESSIONAL OF ANY HOTEL I'VE BEEN AT. We had late checkout on our last day until 4 PM. We had the "Please Come Back Later" sign on our door. We went to go load our car with some of our luggage around 11:15 AM and when we came back up into our room, we noticed that the curtain on our window had been raised, the door was cracked open with the deadbolt to prevent it from shutting,
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank You so much for your honest feedback. We always strive to provide the best customer service at the Four Points by Sheraton in Anaheim. This will be shared with all department managers and we hope so serve you again in the near future.

Summary: Super friendly staff here. Airport shuttle can be arranged through reception. 10 minute walk to Disney Land. Taco Bell across the road. Rooms aren't the most modern, but still comfortable and well looked after. A decent gym too. We enjoyed our 3 night stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here over Thanksgiving.  The trip to Disneyland was long as the Grapevine was closed.  We arrived at 5PM on Thanksgiving and checked in.  Check in was quick.  Front desk staff helpful.    The hotel grounds are nice, entrance nice, lobby nice, then you go up to the rooms.  A dark maze of outdoor halls.  The rooms are strictly functional and nothing more.  No extras.  No niceties.  I made a phone call and was looking for a pen and pad to write down some reservations info.  Nada.  We'd been in the car for 11 plus hours so everyone wanted to drop bags, eat and relax.  The weather was TERRIBLE so we opted to get take out from the hotel restaurant.  There are no other restaurants nearby.  We didn't get room service because my wife wanted a glass of wine from the bar while we
Manager Response: Dear irishdice,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. My name is James Chu and I am the Front Office Manager at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim. It has come to my attention that the service you received during your recent stay did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  The experience you described is not characteristic of the level of service our associates strive to provide. I would love the opportunity to hear more about your recent stay in an effort to prevent this issue from occurring in the future.
