Summary Heading: Stop over on the way home from Cancun to Melbourne
Summary: Stayed here as part of a five day stop over before travelling home, looked like a reasonable location and close to Disney,   positives   . Close to Disney, only about a 15 minute walk from Four Points  . Value for money to a point  . Close to public transport  . Check in was an issue (will get back to that)  . Check out was efficient   . We lost one of the door entry cards and was not an issue, also was locked out and was quickly rectified  Negatives  . Check in was a terrible encounter as the clerk informed that there was no booking for us and initially refused to take our itinerary with the booking number, eventually gave them the documentation and they still did not bring our booking up, after a short while they found the booking, they didn’t spell the name correctly, given
Manager Response: Hi 492Terrencea,  Thank you for the feedback and we will be talking with the agent. At no time should they ever be rude like that. We have also spoken with the housekeeping manager about the sheets. We do hope that next time you are in the area you will try us again.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel is decent at its core. The rooms are standard, but nothing fancy. If you are looking for a place to just sleep cause you are busy during the day, this place is sufficient. This location is easily within walking distance to Disney. WARNING: the rooms are very loud due to being right on interstate and very close to Disneyland fireworks. The hotel does provide ear plugs to guests though! Nothing bad about the hotel! Bell hop workers were wonderful! Best part of the hotel if you ask me!
Manager Response: Hi Devd91,  We have informed the Valet company about the great note about our staff. We do try to make every guest feel special from the moment you walk in and glad they could do this. We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton

Summary: The hotel was clean and the rooms were very nice. But being right next to the freeway the noise is unbelievable! When they give you complimentary ear plugs, it should tell you something. The pool area is beautifully landscaped and very nice. But it's even closer to the freeway noise!
Manager Response: HI Astromandsn,  We are glad you your room was nice and are sorry about the noise. The ear plugs are actually for the fireworks that go off 1/4 mile away on weekends but could be used to sleep as well. We are sorry about the noise and wish we could do something about this.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton

Summary: Nice clean hotel, but unfortunately my son's treasured blanket was gathered up with the linens.  When we got back from Disneyland, we went to the front desk to ask to see the lost and found, they told us that they didn't have the key to the lost and found or to housekeeping.  This seems a little strange.  They weren't super nice, helpful or understanding.  We were leaving early the next day before housekeeping got there to open the door to the lost and found.  We called as soon as we got home a few hours later and the blanket was not found.  Three days later it's still missing.  They haven't called back and seem indifferent to our loss.  My son has had this blanket his whole life and is heartbroken to have lost it.  Really disappointed in their response - surely the blanket is
Manager Response: Hi Travellingmomandad,  We are truly sorry about not finding the blanket. We have worked with the Housekeeping manager and all of the laundry ladies to keep an eye out for the blanket. If we do find it we will be in contact with you right away. Lost and found is in a secure area due to some very high valuable items (Laptops, Jewelry, and ect.) Only authorized personal have access to this area. Again, we are truly sorry about this and will keep looking.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton

Summary: I am a titanium elite with Marriott and since the merge to create the Bonvoy this is my first visit to a non Marriott hotel.  WORST HOTEL STAY.  EVER.   There is mildew all over the floor by the air conditioner.  The drain in the shower and sink do not work.  The sink fawcet fell apart, the handle came off.   The fireworks are so loud from Disney they shook the hotel walls.  It sounded like gunfire and scared everyone in the room.  Kids were screaming up and down the outside hall for hours.   And it is NOT a safe walk to Disney.  Several blind corners across a freeway overpass where cars exiting the freeway could easily hit pedestrians.  We spent $100 on Lyft rides to and from Disney.   Plus: large room. Huge desk.   It’s a huge no from me.
Manager Response: Dear Jeanne,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding these issues. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention about the mildew, the sink and other inconsistencies. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.

Summary Heading: Disneyland hotel - Experience depends on room location
Summary: Four Points by Sheraton is a tale of two hotels, depending on where your room is located!  Overall this a decent hotel. The lobby area and pool/hot tub are all lovely, and the rooms were clean and decently spacious with minifridges. Beds were comfortable and the room was very dark with the shades drawn.  But the hotel backs up to the freeway. You do NOT want to be on the freeway side of the hotel, as it is LOUD. The hotel rooms are all on the exterior side, so it can feel like a glorified motel on the freeway side. We were able to switch rooms (thank you, front desk staff!) after the first night, and it was significantly better. Very quiet and pleasant. So if you can, request a room on the front parking lot side or the pool side and you will enjoy your stay!   The hotel is an
Manager Response: Dear TarheelsNJ,  Thank you for choosing The Four Points Anaheim for your recent stay.  We know that you have many options when choosing where to stay in Anaheim, the fact that you choose our hotel is an honor to us.   We are happy to hear you enjoyed our 24/7 heated pool and Jacuzzi. We do hope you have another opportunity of serving you again in the future. Sincerely,  Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel

Summary: If you're looking for a hotel close to Disney, there are far better options (especially at almost $300 per night). We've stayed at both the Camelot Inn and Hilton Anaheim (2 opposite ends of the price spectrum) and I'd recommend either of those instead.  We stayed here for 3 nights based on a recommendation from a friend - multiple elevators didn't work on several occasions, rooms had no hot water (luke warm), our bathroom sink was leaking all over the floor and the traffic noise from the highway that is right beside the "hotel" (let's face it, this is a glorified motel) is crazy loud.  I've stayed at our Four Points hotels before and have liked them - this place just gives a bad name to the Four Points Sheraton brand.
Manager Response: Dear jeff-from-hamilton,  We are sorry that we did not provide you with a rewarding experience during your recent stay at our hotel.  Your satisfaction is very important for us to improve our services, and we appreciate your feedback.  Your comments will help us correct these issues.  We hope you’ll consider staying with us again the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,

Summary: Disappointed in our experience.  When we arrived they tried checking us into an occupied room.  That guest wasn't too happy when we tried checking in.  Then they moved us into the room right next too them.  We saw the reviews prior to checking in about the road noise.  Wow, they were all correct.  The noise is too much.  Hard to sleep. Ran out of soap and shampoo.  Asked the front desk to fill the containers, which wasn't done.  Had to go back to the front desk to ask again.  Made 5 separate trips to the front desk during our stay with issues.    How to bicker everyday with the breakfast staff about the number in our party being able to eat.  As a Platinum Marriott member I would expect better service.  Overall it just felt like the staff didn't care.  On the positive side, it
Manager Response: Dear 396gabrielw,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel. I am sorry that your experience did not meet your expectations. Please allow me to express my sincerest apologies. Your feedback is very important to us, and I am saddened to hear that you did not have a pleasant stay. Please rest assured that we are taking the appropriate measures to address the problem and prevent any future occurrences. We continuously strive to meet your needs and expectations. We appreciate the time you took to share your concerns, and it is our hope that you will give us the opportunity to better serve you in the future.  Sincerely,

Summary: We wanted a place to crash during the day for our Disney visit. Clean, solid room. Friendly staff.  There is a great happy hour at the bar. You can walk to Disney, but Uber is a $10 ride away. Would definitely come back.
Manager Response: Dear jassmine_b, Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel. We are happy to hear you enjoyed our bar and liked this location.  We continuously strive to exceed your expectations. I will share your comments with our team for improvement. Thank you again for sharing your experience.  We look forward to the opportunity of serving you in the future. Sincerely,

Summary: Checkin was very friendly and efficient.  The walk to our room was through quite dark corridors which gave a kind of a basement feeling.  Room was okay with a lot of noise from passing traffic, but we were already aware of that before we booked.Breakfast is definitely not worth the money. The second morning we bought a granola yoghurt at the store and ate it at the pool which was a much better option.  When we arrived back to our room after Disney, our keycard was blocked.  Reception told us that my Visacard did not work, neither did my husbands.  This was impossible and to prove it to the reception I went to get money from the ATM machine where my card was functioning perfectly.  The would contact their IT manager to fix the problem.  Next morning, at checkout, still the same
Manager Response: Dear BelgiumPatrick,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, nice location, but oh, the road noise!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for three nights in September.  The location to Disneyland is excellent. ART shuttle stops here to pick us visitors.  Although a nice hotel, it is clearly in need of renovation. It's looking dated.  Rooms were tidy, but the bathroom only included the toilet and bath/shower. The vanity was located in the lounge/bedroom - rather unusual.  The downside to this hotel is the road noise. It is located bang in the middle of three busy roads. And the road noise never ceased from day to night. We were provided with ear plugs, but they were next to useless.  At night, there was a definite gap showing around the door jam, which was letting in more road noise.  The laundry facility was located in the remote, open spot on the bottom floor. The road noise there was worse.
Manager Response: Dear DavidF9837,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: I ordered the Ahi tuna salad. Five super thin slivers of blackened ahi over a bag of lettuce. Literally a bag of random lettuce. Did I mention skimpy thin pieces of tuna? I did. Very sad and disappointing. Unfortunately I’m staying at the hotel attached to this place (Sheraton Four Points Anaheim) and this is the only restaurant. Service is great but for price of that salad they made bank off of me! I guess I’ll try another menu item. I guess.
Manager Response: Dear jama80,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us regarding your recent stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel.  We appreciate your comments regarding the quality of the food at our restaurant and I can assure you, it will be shared with the appropriate department to ensure they are addressed and corrected.  Hope to give us another chance to make thing right.  Sincerely,

Summary Heading: A good standard motel near Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights in August 2019. Overall, our experience was good, it was within walking distance to Disneyland, the staff were lovely and friendly and we would stay here again. My only negative is that the motel desperately needs to update their beds and linen - they're extremely well used and the bed we had has started to sink in/squeak as well as the quilt has lots of hard bits throughout it, I assume from years of wear and tear. A couple of things when making you decision to stay here -   - While it is within walking distance to Disneyland, I would be careful if travelling with small children as you are required to walk down very busy roads and cross over traffic. I would still recommend this motel however I'd be considering a shuttle or Uber.   - I'd highly
Manager Response: Dear JordanW29891,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent stay with us. Your comments have been shared to the respective managers so we can address areas of our service needing improvement.  Thank you for bringing these points to our attention.  I am delighted to hear you were pleased with the exceptional service provided by Junior.  Your gratitude and appreciation will be shared with him.  Thank you again for staying with us and  we look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.    Sincerely, Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Wonderful staff, excellent location, fireworks = amazing!!!
Summary: I stayed here for 6 nights in August. What a wonderful hotel with a fantastic location to Disneyland-around a 10 minute walk. I found the staff so incredibly friendly and helpful and gave me an extra hour to check out! Honestly all the reviews about the freeway noise worried me before going there, however once i arrived and found my room right on the freeway side, i didn't even need to ear plugs-the AC drowns out a lot of the noise. The fireworks every night at 9:30pm were an absolute highlight. If you go down to the pool you get an uninterrupted view of them!! Beds are comfy, rooms are spacious and shower pressure if perfect.   The only downsides i had were: The hotel restaurant buffet breakfast isn't that great and they could make it a lot better than what it was and the pool
Manager Response: Dear travellerP278946,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel. We are happy to hear you enjoyed the experience with our staff and the views of the Disney fireworks. Your concern regarding the quality of breakfast will be discussed with our chef and Food and Beverage Director.  Thank you for bringing  to our attention.  We continuously strive to exceed your expectations.  Thank you again for choosing us to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel and we look forward to the opportunity of serving you again. Sincerely, Management

Summary Heading: Great staff, good location and the freeway noise!
Summary: Decided on Four Points as it was close to Disneyland, a good location right off the freeway and the price was right.  First, let’s get the CONs out of the way. If your looking for a nice, peaceful, and relaxing hotel this isn’t for you. As mentioned in the many below reviews, the hotel is right off the Interstate 5 freeway and you will hear the traffic noise 24/7. This didn’t bother us as they provide ear plugs and the AC unit runs which drowns out the outside noise. In addition, we came back late from Downtown Disney and our sink was backed up and decided to wait until the morning to call it in. We called the front desk in the morning and they came and fixed it with no further issues. No fault of the hotel as a sink doesn’t clog overnight it does take time, wonder why previous
Manager Response: Dear James C,  Thank you for the time to share full experience at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel.  Your satisfaction is very important for us to continue to improve our services and products.  We look forward to the opportunity of serving you in the future.  Thank you again for choosing us to stay.  Regards,

Summary: My wife and I came down to Disneyland for a couple of days and we stayed at the Four Points in Anaheim and we loved it!    The staff was super friendly every time we came to the desk.   The room was clean and very spacious. We staying in a room with a king size bed and there was more than enough room for the 2 of us. And the bed is delightful!  The Hotel was a quick walk to the park. It is north of the park and most of the hotels in the area are south so there isn’t as much foot traffic to get to and from the park. You do have to cross over the 5.    The pool and hot tub were open 24 hours which is extremely nice after a long day in the park.   And perhaps you have read that their is road noise from the surrounding streets and the freeway and that is correct. But they provide
Manager Response: Dear scottj6399,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel.  We continuously strive to exceed your expectations. I will share your comments with our team for improvement. Thank you again for sharing your experience and we look forward to seeing you soon.  Sincerely, Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim

Summary: -Great staff! -Not right across the street but quick walk, stopped at Panera on the way in to Disneyland for quick breakfast. -Pool open 24 hours which is awesome and the fact you can SEE the fireworks very well from the pool area is super cool. -Live about an hour away (without traffic) -Liked the free water and coffee in the room.  -would stay here again -clean and updated room
Manager Response: Dear deartori, Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel.  We continuously strive to exceed your expectations. I will share your comments with our team for improvement. Your comments are incredibly importance for us.  It was truly our pleasure to welcome you and look forward to your next visit.  Thank you again for the 5 Star review. Sincerely, Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim

Summary: We LOVE this hotel. We would easily recommend this hotel to all of our friends and family who are looking to visit the Disneyland Resort without breaking the bank. When we booked this hotel, it was the cheapest option within walking distance to the S. Harbor Blvd entrance to Disneyland. (11 minutes)  Pros - BEST BEDS IN ANAHEIM - I can' say enough about these beds. I even prefer them to the Disneyland Hotel beds and that's saying a lot - Newly updated rooms have really cleaned this place up. That said, the tile in the bathroom and the tub still hasn't been updated. - The pool area is way better than other hotels at the same price point - The staff is AWESOME (huge shout out to Hani) - Great view of the Disneyland Fireworks at night.  Cons: - The traffic noise. This hotel is
Manager Response: Dear honesthotelreview.  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel.  We continuously strive to exceed your expectations. I will share your comments with our team for improvement. Thank you again for sharing your experience and we look forward to the opportunity of serving you again. Sincerely,

Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel for a 2 night stay enabling a day at Disney. It is very close to Disney and is an easy walk if you are able bodied.    The staff was wonderful.  We were able to buy park tickets right at the front desk.   The night we checked in my wife and I went to enjoy a drink at the pool bar but were surprised to see it closed.  It was only around 7:00 PM.  We were able to get a drink at the bar inside and bring it outside.  It is clearly a family hotel which was nice.  Lots of excited travellers around.  Our room was quite large – TV was large.  A bit of a musty smell but that is typical for hotels where room access is from the open air.  We were told this hotel has the best view of the Disney fireworks short of being inside the park itself.  We didn’t see
Manager Response: Dear DavidL,  Thank you for the time to share your experience at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim.  I am sorry to hear the Palapa bar by the swimming pool was closed.  I will ensure to look into this.  Also you missed the fireworks from Disneyland. Unfortunately not all rooms have the fireworks views however if you go to the our 24/7 swimming pool/spa, you can enjoy it.  Hope to give us another chance to make things right. Thank you again for choosing us to stay. Sincerely,

Summary Heading: This property got stuck in the 70's
Summary: My overall belief is that this property is outdated in style, décor, architecture, and functionality. This hotel reminds us more of a roadside motel rather than a 21st century hotel that’s located within walking distance to one of California’s major tourist attractions. By the way, this hotel being so close to the highway only adds to the motel feeling. I really don’t see how they can improve in these aspects even if management wants to. It’s hard for me to suggest any kind of recommendation other than tearing this building down and erecting a new one. Adding to the downside of this review, I have to say that prices are in complete discordance with the property. I was driven to stay in this hotel because I’m a Bonvoy member but if I had known the conditions of the property I
Manager Response: HI Eddel,  We are truly sorry about your experience here at the Four Points Anaheim. We are happy to here that you liked our staff which are best part of the property! We are consistently learning how to improve our overall product and strive to have an exceptional experience here. We hope that you may reconsider us in the future.  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed at Four Points by Sheraton for a softball tournament. It was perfect for our team. Every night we saw the Disney fireworks from the pool. The restaurant was very good. Happy hour from 4-6 we took advantage of as drinks and appetizers were $5.00. Rooms were very clean. Bed very comfortable. The problems we had were the second elevator was broke the second day we arrived until we left. That was a problem as the hotel was booked. We did take the stairs to 4th floor but this could pose a problem for some people. Also we were in need of laundry services. The dryer was down in one section and several teams needed them. Of course that was down the entire week. Overall, the trip was wonderful. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The morning wait staff is
Manager Response: Dear Z4175FSnancyb,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent visit at our hotel and please accept our sincerest apologies for the disturbance you have experienced during your stay due to the elevator.  Your satisfaction is very important for us to improve our services and products.  We value your comments and welcome the opportunity to serve you again. Sincerely,

Summary: The place was clean and walking distance to Disneyland. Its good for families that only want to visit Disneyland. If you have plans to visit outside the area. You may want to choose a hotel in that location. Transportation is not good from this location to Los Angeles. To even have someone take you into L.A. you will spend about $300 if you get a ride from the hotel. The trip is about an hour. Shuttle service  from the hotel is expensive including tours. Their are shuttle services for tours in the Disneyland area. This hotel is not connect to Disneyland. We took a lift to Disneyland. We also took a Lift to get something to eat. No hotel shuttle available. You can catch the  bus outside if you log into the app on your phone. The people and service were nice. The fire works were
Manager Response: Dear Istrong2016,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel.  We continuously strive to exceed your expectations. I will share your comments with our team. Thank you again for sharing your experience and we look forward to the opportunity of serving you soon.  Sincerely,

Summary: Our family (2 adults and 2 teenagers) stayed here for 3 nexts last week. While the hotel is more of a motel (outside entry) and the rooms were dated - it worked well for us.   Advantages: Pool is open 24 hours a day and is nice. Hot tub was nice. A Great location to watch Disney fireworks is by the pool at 9:30pm. Also, you can walk to and from Disneyland. It is about a 20-25 minute walk, but you save the $25 parking fee and can be back “home” much faster. Might be a hard walk with really young kids. Room has a fridge. Valet was prompt with getting our car.  Disadvantages: Bathroom is really small. Beds are very worn out. Outside entry lets bugs into the room. Noisy because of highway. The hefty parking fee of $16 for self park or $19 for valet is too much.
Manager Response: Dear ReginaD,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us regarding your recent stay. We are happy to see you enjoyed our 24/7 pool and liked this location.  We always strive to ensure you are comfortable and feel welcomed at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim.   We appreciate your staying with us and hope to see you again.    Sincerely, James Chu Front Office Manager

Summary: We needed to extend our stay one day after our stay at Disney’s Grand Californian. We booked the Four Points and it was perfect for our one extra night.   When we arrived we valeted our car as that was cheaper than it had been to park overnight at the Grand Californian. The valet host was very kind and professional each time we interacted.   When we entered the lobby it was clean, and there was no line to check-in. While I checked, my boyfriend enjoyed complimentary chocolate chip cookies at the front desk.   I forgot to get anyone’s name, but everyone we interacted with was great. An older gentleman checked us in quickly, provided answers to all of our questions, and sent us on our way.  Our room had complimentary water bottles, coffee, and free WiFi.   Our bathtub had a few
Manager Response: Dear nicoleamero,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel.  We continuously strive to exceed your expectations. I will share your comments with our team to improve our services and product. Thank you again for sharing your experience and we look forward to the opportunity of serving you in the near future. Sincerely,  James Chu Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Does not seem like a Sheraton Marriott!!!
Summary: I have stayed at the four points several times and they are the lowest end of the brand but some things are expected even at that level. The hotel is old and dated. It says it’s remodelled but I do not see it. Bathrooms old and yuck. Really dark rooms. I am platinum and when I arrived they said they upgrade me. We get our room 540 and the beds look old and well used and not like the nice Sheraton beds. The room is so loud from the freeway but they have earplugs sitting by the bed. The black out shade is broken hanging so people can see in and you can’t fix it. Call front desk and they call maintenance. Guy comes up to fix but he says it’s broken and was just a temp fix. I assumed as it was a plastic crappy blackout shade. We have to switch rooms as everyone can see in our room
Manager Response: Dear crystaldiannes,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary Heading: Handy to Disneyland.  Unusual Room Configuration
Summary: My wife, youngest daughter and I stayed at the Four Points as part of a stopover to Europe and in order to visit Disneyland.  The proximity to the Disneyland parks is excellent, they are short 15 minute walk away.   The hotel was clean and the staff at reception very welcoming.  I found the room configuration to be unusual.  The bathroom was very small and the vanity was in the room itself.  Obviously some architect at some point thought this was a good idea.  They were wrong. I prefer my bathroom (in its entirety) to be seperate from my bedroom.  The size of the bathroom in my room left no where to leave clothing.  Not ideal when sharing with family.    In all other respects the hotel was fine.  Be warned that the proximity to the freeway means there's a load of vehicle noise.
Manager Response: Dear JUSTIN,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent guest being unhappy with the size of our hotel rooms from occurring in the future.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary Heading: Delightful hotel minutes away from Disney.
Summary: Overall I was very pleased with my stay at The Four Points by Sheraton. The rooms are comfortable and fairly sized for a family of 3. I mainly want to give recognition to James from front desk for his outstanding customer service throughout the duration of my stay.
Manager Response: Dear 78erickyanez, Thank you for the review.  I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and you were pleased with the exceptional service provided by James.  Your gratitude and appreciation will be shared with him.  We look forward to seeing you again soon, here at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim Hotel. Sincerely,  Hotel Manager

Summary: We recently stayed four nights here at the four point during a trip to Disney and we had a wonderful experience. I was impressed with the helpful staff, clean common areas, comfy beds and amazing view of the fireworks show. Before the trip I was concerned about the road noise from the freeway. We ended up having a room very near the road and when the door was shut I didn't even notice it. Now the fireworks are loud, but also a major bonus to be able to watch them from right outside your door. The pool was also great for our kid and the restaurant was an added bonus. We ended up eating there three times and every time was great. One extra great thing for me was there is a Starbucks across the street that is off the normal path of tourist. Quick easy breakfasts and coffee for the
Manager Response: Dear Erinkathleen332,  On behalf of the entire hotel team, we want to thank you for sharing your most memorable experiences with us during your recent stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim.  It is always encouraging to hear positive feedback, particularly when it comes from those who matter the most – you! By taking pride in putting people first, we are not only executing the mission of our founders, but exceeding the expectations of our valued guests.  Please note your feedback has been shared with the hotel team as a critical way of understanding how we can continue to deliver great experiences. Thank you for staying at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and we hope you choose to create more memories here whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary Heading: Do not stay here next to freeway and noisy
Summary: I write this at 5am and the noise outside the room is bad.  You know there is a problem when they leave you earplugs on the bed. The photos of the pool area make this hotel look inviting but I was definitely disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Warwilin,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: This hotel is a little different as the rooms are accessed along open corridors rather than internally as in most hotels. Each room has a window onto the corridor so this is something to remember. It did not affect us and the rooms are approached from the hotel foyer. The rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Disney World and each night at 9:30 we had a great view of the spectacular fireworks display from the balcony outside our rooms. The breakfast is excellent with a very wide choice of food and drinks. We used the restaurant and were very happy with it. We found the hotel staff very friendly, courteous and helpful. This hotel is very convenient to the 2 theme parks for anyone who wishes to walk there. I can readily say this hotel met all our needs.
Manager Response: Dear Vincent1609,  Thank you so much for the review.  We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate you sharing your full experience.  Thank you again for choosing us to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim.   We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future. Regards,

Summary: Hotel is located right next to the Santa Ana Freeway and is constantly noisy, even with the door closed. Rooms are clean and comfortable, however, Disneyland and restaurants are inconvenient a distance from the hotel. Walking is about 20-25 mins to Disneyland. Self serve laundry is antiquated and hotel is run down and in need of a renovation. Staff are friendly most times. Lifts are sometimes slow. I would not stay there again, preferring to stay closer towards Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Jim,   Thank you for the feedback.   I was very disappointed to read that your experience was well below your expectations, and not at all in line with the service level that I expected for our guest.  Please accept my sincere apology.  We take your comments very seriously, and will use them to help us improve. I hope we will have the chance to welcome you in the future to demonstrate our commitment to improvement.  Again, please accept my apology for your less than satisfactory stay.   Sincerely,

Summary: We were disappointed with this hotel, to say the least.  It is basically a 5-story motel. The website and photos do a good job of hiding it, but all the rooms are outside entry.  This results in lots of flying insects being let in by housekeeping.  The room itself was relatively clean, but the shower has the refillable shampoo/soap dispensers, which were empty upon arrival and then not even filled by housekeeping the next day (luckily we brought our own).  The hotel is also EXTREMELY LOUD.  It borders the highway and two busy roads with 24-hour traffic.  Part of the problem was the room door, which had a large gap under it.  I partially corrected this by stuffing a towel under it each night, but it was still pretty loud.  Lots of other things didn’t quite work properly, like the
Manager Response: Dear fjm10491,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: Worst room in the place with freeway noise into the room on the 2nd floor.  Save your points.  Shuttle machine broken.  Not a great start to the trip.  Hotel looks much nicer than Old Ménage hotel and staff seemed nice.  My app indicated I would get an upgrade and my room is by no means an upgrade.
Manager Response: Dear DAYE,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent guest being in rooms that they are not comfortable in from occurring in the future.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: My partner and I stayed here the week before last during our LA and Vegas road trip holiday.  Although we didn’t use any of the hotel facilities so to speak as we had a lot of plans however we have no complaints whatsoever from our experience.  The staff were very kind, professional and accommodating and the room was very nice, the bathroom however a bit outdated compared to the rest of the room.  The location is very good with plenty of shops and restaurants nearby and it’s in walking distance of Disney.  We only used the shop for a Pizza one evening during our stay and although it was fine we wished we’d have gone out to Pizza Press just up the road which is not only better quality but also better value for money.  We’d recommend this hotel and we are already looking to
Manager Response: Dear 10carlh,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us regarding your recent stay.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and experience with our staff and the property.  We look forward to welcoming you back to the property.  Thank you again for choosing us to stay.  Sincerely,

Summary: Biggest standout was friendly staff. We only had breakfast in the restaurant which was just good usual buffet breakfast but I can’t comment on their lunch or dinner service.  The room was big, clean and the bed very comfy! I’ve read in other reviews that people complained of the noise.. that can’t be helped and honestly we didn’t find it an issue at all, they provide ear plugs anyway! We got to watch the Disney fireworks from the balcony, also visible from the large pool area.  Such a close walk to the theme parks and very affordable.   Once again, the staff were amazing from start to finish!
Manager Response: Dear Brigitte M,  Thank you so much for the 5 Star review.  We are thrilled to read your feedback and greatly appreciate the time you’ve taken to acknowledge the effort of our team members.  I will be sharing your comments with them as a reminder that their hard work does not go unnoticed, and that it truly makes positive impact on our guests.  We can't wait for your next visit. Sincerely,  Hotel Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim

Summary Heading: Interior features did not live up to the Marriott reputation
Summary: This hotel does not live up to the Marriott reputation purely based on its outdated interior features.  The interior looked like that of a roadside motel.  The pool did, however, look much bigger and better than any comparable hotels nearby.  Staff was professional and friendly.  Freeway noise was quite bad, but given its physical location, there may not be much that can be done.  However, whenever they can upgrade their building, improving noise reduction would help themselves as well as their guests.
Manager Response: Dear wz4wwky,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: This is ok hotel!  The rooms are nice but the bathroom is tiny. The pool area is very nice but you hear constant noise from the freeway and  everywhere in the hotel, they even give you earplugs in your room. The hotel restaurant is pretty good too. It's about a 15minute walk to Disneyland and Uber would cost about $6.50.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: All the comforts at just the right price.
Summary: I'm a very regular guest at Marriott hotels. I've stayed at most of the locations around Anaheim, CA. As a Titanium Elite Bonvoy member, I've seen more than my fair share of Marriott properties - at least 95 stays.  I haven't stayed at a Sheraton since Marriott bought the brands a few years ago, and I've always wanted to try a Four Points. I can't tell you how happy I am that I did.  The location is perfect if you're a family going to Disneyland or a business traveler. I happen to be both... It's a very quick shuttle ride to the parks or a nice walk (less than a mile). It's right off the highway, so it's very accessible. You can get your Disney tickets at the hotel as well, and the staff was stellar - great people, friendly, smiling faces and always happy to help.   The property
Manager Response: none

Summary: For travelers to Disney, it's right outside the gates.  On the downside it sits right over the 105 freeway and is noisy.  They give you earplugs to sleep in.  Rooms are a little dated, but aren't the rooms in every 4 points?  Staff was very friendly.  Parking is $16 a day.  Pool and hot tub are basic, not a water slide kind of place.  Restaurant downstairs was OK, again very fast friendly service.
Manager Response: Dear island138,   Whether you were traveling for business or pleasure, thank you for choosing the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim to accommodate your travel needs.    Our hope is that all our guests experience a peaceful environment during their stay. That said, it was brought to my attention that your stay was interrupted by a loud disturbance caused by the freeway. I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and will take the necessary steps to ensure this is an isolated incidence.  It was a pleasure to have you as our guest and we look forward to serving you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: easy walk to front gate of Disney - average hotel, nothing special - beds were the best part - no breakfast included - out motor home has the same size bathroom - freeway noise, but did not disturb my sleep. couldn't find an ice machine...
Manager Response: Dear Joeybodie,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent guest from being unsatisfied with their stay from occurring in the future. Sincerely, James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: We chose this based on accessibility to Disneyland, using points for the room.  The hotel has a nice pool, but it was closed the night of our arrival.  There were no fireworks the night we stayed, but you might be able to see them from the hotel. The rooms could use some maintenance and updating. There is a fair amount of noise from the highway.  Staff were not overly friendly.  Parking is reasonable.  The walk to Disneyland took about 15 minutes.  Be careful with small children as you have to cross the exit ramp from the freeway and walk along a busy stretch of Harbor Boulevard.  Would try a different option next time.
Manager Response: Dear DavidR554,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent from being unsatisfied with their stay from occurring in the future.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: We  stayed  here for a few times and we had a great experience at the hotel & the  restaurant  Couple weeks ago we held our annual valentines gala. The foods are Delicious. The venue and decoration are beautiful.  The staff is so friendly and accommodating.  Thanks to the event coordinator host dhy Moncada she exceeds our expectations.
Manager Response: none

Summary: new remodled rooms are great. they put a glass wall up on the harbour blvd side that blocks a lot of noise.  at 1030 roy said it was cold and i went to turn on the heater but it didnt work.  i called the front desk and they said they would have somebody come.  i called again at 11pm and the girl said she would have a manger call me.  about 1115 a guy shows up with a little space heater (about 12" square) i thought really?  but it worked and warmed up the whole room in about 1/2 hour.  so they were going to get 1 star for that but they gave me a $50 refund the next day to go up to 4 stars.  the breakfast buffet was nice too.  great sausages.  the remodel looks great an i love the location and feel of this motel
Manager Response: none

Summary: A beautiful facility that is well maintained and staffed with welcoming and knowledagble associates. I can see the fireworks in my room. I like this hotel’s restaurant’s foods . We order lobster roll,  Garlic noodle and beef noodle soup .  Their foods are very delicious. We have good memories when we stay here .
Manager Response: none

Summary: It's only an 8 minute walk to Disneyland.  My room was clean, comfortable . The pool is nice and look like a resort. We was very relax when we stay here . I can see fireworks in my room. The staff was all very friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Two things I struggled to get past: the bed is beyond useful life, and I cant get the smell of bad 80s dating scene men's shampoo out of my hair. I booked this for a family trip to Disney,  and as a 4oad warrior I've come to expect the resort locales to often be subpar since they are so busy. But there is really no excuse for the conditions of the bed, mkee than an 1" divot on each side.  The room was clean an housekeeper above average. Good conditions of linens, carpets, cleanliness. Now, for the shampoo, what the heck are they thinking??? This crap is stroger than a 1970s playboy's cologne. Comment from outside the bathroom, I can smell it out here. Fortunately, I'm thinking, I traveled with my kids baby shampoo, but 3 rinse and repeat, and I still smell, I cant get the smell
Manager Response: Dear Roadtrooper123,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary Heading: Does the trick if you're on a budget
Summary: This hotel is quite old and in between two busy roads but if you are visiting Disney on a budget it is well worth it. Just a 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney/Parks. Room was huge and clean. Air con is very loud however in our double room on the ground floor we couldn't hear the traffic. Would stay here again
Manager Response: none

Summary: Arrived at approx 11am for a one night stay, Had checked in online, They didn't have my room ready but no probs, dropped my bags and went over to Disney for the day. As an SPG Gold Elite I was upgraded to a "Pool View" which I thought was nice of them   Hotel location is great, $6 for an Uber to the park gate or walk 15 minutes. Room was extremely clean and smelt good, I'm not a fan of the Motel Style external corridors to access the room, but seems to be the norm in California at this price point.  Bed was comfortable, Water Pressure was horrendous but water was warm. Quite a spacious room.  The Jacuzzi and Pool is open for 24 hours which is a nice touch, but more on that later - If you get a "Pool View" on a 4th or 5th floor you'll have great view of the Fireworks (Truly
Manager Response: Dear Blaqjaq84,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. Summary: We stayed at Four Point Sheraton when attending NAMM. It has seen better days! All of us had issues with the room keys. The hotel sits right off a highway and from what I could tell, you could here it no matter what room you were in. To be fair, there were foam ear plugs provided in the room. The housekeeping was really inconsistent, some days they didn't replenish coffee, other days no body lotion, etc. The floor was clearly not always mopped. Sadly, this hotel is a bit past it's best
Manager Response: Dear Mo C,  Thank you for taking the time to fill out our guest satisfaction survey. When it comes to the affected rooms can you please inform me which had the key lock issues. I would like to ensure that engineering does fix those problems from reoccurring. I also want to apologize for the noise. We are surrounded by the I-5 and it does make it had for guest who are sensitive to noise. I it not our intention to place guest in rooms that make it hard to sleep we were just in a sold out situation that caused us to have little option when it came to location. With housekeeping we are doing daily training when it comes to better servicing our guest that will improve the room being consistently replenished.  Thank you,  James Chu

Summary Heading: Better off staying at a Motel 6!
Summary: As a Marriott platinum member we were offered an upgrade to a "better" room, but the only benefit was a "pool view" which could not be seen from inside the room but rather only from the balcony outside the room which was used for exterior entry to the room. The room itself did not have a standard bathroom, and there was not enough dresser space to unload one full suitcase no less two cases, so we had to live out of our luggage during our 5-night stay!  The one and only restaurant had very obvious ceiling water damage with was disgustingly ugly AND active leaks into the dining room when it rained!!! One of two elevator banks was completely out of service during out entire stay and we were not warned about the exorbitant parking charges when we made our reservations: $16/day for
Manager Response: Dear GMG1951,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding these issue that you experienced during your stay. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization. Thank you for your loyalty and we will work on these issues to ensure we have them fixed and handled for future guest and reservations.  Sincerely,  James Chu Front Office Supervisor Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: We came here for an end of the year lunch treat! The hotel is pet friendly and has a wonderful outdoor tiki bar with tables. The pool looked nice with plenty of lounge chairs and sofas. The food from the resturant was incredible, only overshadowed by their excellent customer service. The beef short ribs were fall off the bone lovely! The staff went above and beyond and we were not even staying at the hotel. The bread pudding dessert is a must have! They even accommodated our wee dog by serving him a hamburger patty which he loved! I was actually disappointed we weren't checking in. Four star service and food at the Four Points! We will be back but this time with luggage.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice room, comfy bed, friendly staff, good price. If you only intend on sleeping here between park visits, then it's a great value.  They provide earplugs but I travel with my own and had a great sleep.    Note- They are very close to a couple busy roads and provide earplugs.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Deal with the noise for Disney!
Summary: Great location if you’re only there to access Disneyland, but terrible if you want a good night sleep! We booked a ‘city view room’ and ‘enjoyed’ a large palm tree view out the window but no view of anything. Couldn’t hear each other speak over the freeway noise at all hours. Sadly we left something special we bought in San Fran in the cupboard and after days of phone calls (including one only 2 hours after we checked out), being told ‘we can’t do anything about it’ and being redirected to a website to report the lost item which has still not gotten back to us 7 days later after many emails, we are definitely disappointed with this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Kshayne,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.   Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent guest from not receiving proper service from the associates from occurring in the future.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Office Supervisor Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary Heading: Good value, near to Disney but very very noisy !!
Summary: Yes I had read that this was near a busy road, but I must say it’s not 1 Road but a intersection. For people from England, it’s like having a bedroom right next to the M25 !! Yes that bad, but on the plus side it is a 15 minute walk to Disney. The hotel itself is fine, the staff are friendly , the poor is nice and the hotel restaurant is actually really good. So I would still recommend it, after a while you do get used to the noise.
Manager Response: Dear Sozlovesholisays,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent guest being disrupted by the road noise from occurring in the future. Each department have started on-going training to better service our guest.  Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Desk Interim Manager Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary Heading: Good price, nice staff, just really noisy
Summary: Of course this is a loud location to have a hotel but there are perks: walk to Disney, pay less, easy highway access! It was clean, comfortable, and had an easy check in and out. Important tips- parking is not free but less than most Disney hotels, the pool is 24 hours, the rooms facing loading dock are loud at 6 am due to unloading trucks, there is a restaurant there with a small deli type option. We did not eat there but reviews were good. We chose a room on the 4th floor facing the courtyard by the pool. Not sure if any rooms would be quiet but I did see some club level rooms on the 2nd floor so I suppose these are the quietest. Sheraton is now a Marriott/SPG property so points apply.
Manager Response: JodieS93940,  Thank you for filling out this review about your stay. I do want to apologize about the noise from the freeway. We do have rooms locations that are quieter. If you every visit Anaheim again we would love to have the opportunity to regain your trust in our hotel. Again, I sincerely apologize about the noise you experienced during your stay and hope to have to pleasure of servicing you again in the near future. Thank you for you business and your review.  Best Regards,  James Chu Front Desk Interim Manger

Summary: Last minute choice due to issues with air travel. But it worked out well for us. It was a good niy sleep and a great location.  Check-in clerk was very nice and arranged for an upgraded room.  The coffee shop in the lobby looked very nice
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed there for 2 nights to go to Disneyland. It is an average hotel.  The hotel is quite old and requires some renovations in the rooms.  The room had a leaking faucet, the only plug in by the sink/mirror did not work, and no body wash in the dispensers. The staff is friendly and professional.  There is a reason why there are ear plugs left at the night stands, loud traffic, you can hear noises from the upper floors sometimes and anyone walking by your room. Close walk to Disneyland. We got this room on airmiles points, thank goodness.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to Disney and Good Price
Summary: The facility is a 20 minute walk to Disneyland.  At $100/night plus taxes it was a reasonable hotel with nice pool/jacuzzi/restaurant/bar. The hotel staff were for the most part on top of things.  Francisco, the evening bar/restaurant manager, was great!  We would stay there again just for him.  The other staff were pleasant. Our one big complaint was the maid service.  Every day (four days) the maid forgot something...washcloths, coffee cups, cream, something...and a call to the front desk fixed it, but still frustrating. The other downside is it's right on a very busy and noisy highway...South Harbor Ave.  They even provided ear plugs in the room.
Manager Response: Hi Barry W,  We appreciate your business and are happy to you that we are a great value. We will be speaking with our housekeeping staff on making sure that they replenish all items in the rooms. We do provide the ear plugs for the fireworks that go off at 9:30 since they are right next to our Hotel. We do hope you see us again soon.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great alternative to resort/convention centre hotels! Easy access to Disney
Summary: I attended BlizzCon 2018 and booked my stay through the SPG app. I chose this Hotel because I am in SPG rewards member and the fact that I wasn’t too picky about needing to stay right next to the convention center. The hotel staff was professional and friendly, and they were quick to answer any questions or concerns that I had throughout my stay. The room was clean, and the beds were very comfortable. The only quirk I would point out about the room is that there is no light in the middle of the room; therefore, some areas of the room was not lit enough in my opinion. There is and ART ticket machine in the lobby and it if you prefer Uber, it is between a $7-$12 ride to/from the convention centre. If you want picky about how far away you might need to travel to Disney and the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were very pleased with our stay in this Hotel in Anaheim,as it meet our main requirement, to be in walking distance to Disneyland. George on the front desk was great and the rooms were well appointed. We would recommend this hotel to friends and family,and will use again on our return to Anahiem.Thx Bruce & Leeann NZ
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff is wonderful, and that goes a long way.  It's an older property, and they've tried to keep it up.  10 minute walk to Disneyland along a very busy street.  Our room faced the highway, and this sums it up:  The room comes with complementary ear plugs.  I'm serious.  The highway noise is significant, but if you put the A/C fan on constant, the white noise masks the traffic noise (except the sirens).  Try to get the pool side, as it is quieter, and you can see the fireworks at Disneyland.  Strange thing - there was a flyer that said you can opt out of housekeeping and get a few points.  We had kids and a messy room, so this seemed like a good idea. So we opted out, but they showed up every day anyway.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Well what can we say as usual another Sheraton Hotel that has not disappointed  Great service and great rooms even the club room was excellent good breakfasts and canapés with drinks at night. We will be back
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Category 3 hotel with 5* service in beginning of stay and went downhill
Summary: The hotel is situated by a freeway and a lower tier Marriott hotel. Even though the hotel recently went through a renovation, you can tell it was mostly a paint job and quite sloppy workmanship. However, what drove me to give the hotel a 5 star was the customer service. My family and I are stayed on rewards points for a week and we were upgraded to a suite although the suite lacked common amenities as the other suites on the property. Instead of a sofa, we had a chair which looked quite odd in large room. When we brought this up to the staff, they addressed the issue by bringing us a roll away bed. The blinds were also broken. The hotel staff tried to resolve most of the issues and I appreciated the customer service and the friendliness. A note to management: there’s a lot of
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent a week in this hotel. We got a King bed with a sofa bed for our 10 year old. All staff were amazing! They all work together as a team. The Tru Grits Buffet was very good, the restaurant staff were fast and made sure everyone's needs were met. The king bed was very comfortable after long days in the theme parks. Thank you for having a hot tub. Now for the negatives; everything costs extra, parking & shuttle. The walk to the Disneyland is okay, but you do have to cross over the freeway. The pool was too cold & the hot tub was too small and very foamy (dead skin). Overall, we would come back here again because of the staff, the on-site restaurant and the comforts of the room.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location for Disney but that’s about all.
Summary: We went to Disney for the day and decided to stay at this hotel. It is about 9 minute walk to Disney so a good location. We didn’t check in to the hotel until we got back from the park at 10.30pm. After walking near on 10 miles and being exhausted I didn’t think the location of the hotel on the freeway would be a problem. Oh how wrong was I!   Our room was freezing cold and the air con and heat didn’t work. We had about a 2cm gap under the front door where there was no seal. It was right on the freeway and despite being exhausted, it was so noisy that even with ear plugs I couldn’t sleep. You expect it to be a bit noisy next to the freeway but it was utterly ridiculous.  When people walk past your room on the hall way and are speaking, it feels like they are in the room with

Summary Heading: Too Noisy - Highways on all sides of the hotel
Summary: The hotel was fairly empty, but still got a room close to one of the main roads and could hear vehicles all night.  In addition, my room was next to a loading zone for the hotel and early in the morning there was a commercial vehicle backing into the loading zone with that loud beeping.  Didnt sleep well with the traffic.  The walk to the park is a busy walk with the highway traffic.  While the room was clean and the beds were comfortable, I wouldnt recommend this place for a relaxing vacation due to the noise.  Even the pool area wasnt relaxing because you could just head cars the entire time.  Parking fee is 16$ and its not underground.  Also, the key only worked half the time in the parkade. Overall, fine for a night, but not good for a family if you are looking for a quiet

Summary: I decided to check in with a friend to stay closer to Disney. For the money, this Four Points is quite the steal! We had such a lovely time, restaurant was great, and short walk to the park! I would 100% recommend. The place is quite family oriented as well!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have previously stayed at the hotel 6 years ago when it was the ménage. Over all a similar experience. Personally I liked the restaurant before the revamp. But over all the rooms very clean. Walking distance from Disney ruffly 10 minutes.

Summary Heading: Perfect location but can get noisy
Summary: If you are in the Disney area this is the perfect location for a quick walk to the parks and downtown Disney area. Rooms were lovely and clean, abit dark but that’s just down to the build of the property. Again with the location it’s above the interstate and next to a busy main road, whilst in the room this soon drowns out. What is noisy however was when the hotel was having deliveries at 5-8am in the morning, the position of our room meant we heard it all. We did soon settle back to sleep but we did wake up every morning for the 3 nights we stayed here. Good location to watch the fireworks display at Disney, happy hour at the bar area. I would stay again but will probably research other hotels as well.

Summary: Cheap budget place to stay close to Disneyland. Sorrounded by highway traffic, rooms are dated and noisy. We did not use the pool but it looked good. Take a shuttle for $5 to disneyland or walk close to a mile.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney which is what we wanted
Summary: I was a little apprehensive about staying here due to reviews. Check in was fast and staff friendly, it was 1130 at night tho, Check out even faster. Rooms a little dated and the bathroom smelt like urine and lingered. Turning the shower on was like a puzzle. Weird room set up as the basin outside of the bathroom on carpet. The bed a little squashy and the sheets were going a little off color. The noise if your a light sleeper is really bad from the freeway and other rooms. The lift somewhat slow and scary at the same time. Didn't eat at this hotel due to spending 10 days at buffet breakfasts before this and was getting a little same same so cant say anything on this. House keeping was rude even after I said we were checking out the same women came and banged on our door 2 more
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here to allow us to visit Disneyland. Could not fault the hotel in any way. The shuttle to the hotel is $3 each way (there is even a ticket machine in the foyer). The shuttle runs very regularly. On the return trip get off at the service station opposite the hotel will save you a 20 minute trip and there is a crossing to get across the traffic. We had our room upgraded at check-in which was very nice. We had a pool view room which is away from the traffic so quieter. Rooms are clean and have plenty of space. We had breakfast each day as it is $14 for the buffet for adults. The food was fresh and replenished very quickly. There is a good choice, enough to suit everyone. Staff are courteous and attentive
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel for a Trip to Disney
Summary: We spent a week at this hotel in October/November 2018. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The restaurant on the ground floor was very well priced and full of yummy food. The pool and spa were clean and made the stay just a little bit nicer, especially as we had been traveling for a few weeks already and provided a nice area to relax. The rooms could do with a bit of updating, but were still nice.  The hotel is located next to two major freeways, but we never had any issues with noise. It was an easy 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland which was very convenient for us. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: During our spring school break, we stopped in Anaheim to take the boys to Disneyland. The Four Points was perfect for this stopover!  The hotel is surrounded by major roadways, so if you are a light sleeper, then be aware of the traffic noise. It is nonstop, sometimes light, sometimes heavy, but there in the background all the time.  That said, my family (myself, wife, two boys, 4 & 7) had a great stay. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Disney parks. There is a pay-for shuttle, but we are all reasonably fit, so we walked.   We had a standard two double bed room, tv, air conditioning, free wi-fi. There was a bar fridge and tea & coffee service. The room was clean, the beds comfortable, however it did show wear. Given how close the hotel to Disney, they must be in
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked this hotel for its proximity to Disneyland, which is excellent. Upon arrival we were told that we couldn't have our rooms as the previous guests were allowed late check out as they were members or something like that. This was a bit annoying as 4pm is already a very late check in and we were travelling with a 2 year old. The staff apologized and said if we didn't want a pool view we could have our room now, but because we had booked our room through a third party we wouldn't be refunded the difference in price. We said we will wait for what we paid for and went for a drive to Walmart. This policy needs reviewing as check in across America is already very late.  We came back and were able to check in, the rooms were spacious and clean. The restaurant downstairs is
Manager Response: none

Summary: Not a bad hotel to stay at if you’re visiting Disneyland, which is just a short walk down the road. The pool is nice, but could use some regular attention with a staff member keeping it tidy (often towels and such left laying about cause folks don’t know how to place in provides bins) ... but other than that the onsite restaurant is great & the staff are friendly and welcoming. The room was also spacious enough for our family of 4.   Would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel itself is a little dated but that was our only query. Staff were lovely and the food in the restaurant was fantastic! The location to Disneyland resorts was great and if we were too tired from a day at the parks the ART shuttles dropped us off at the door. Thank you 😊
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is a bit tired but nice outdoor pool and bar area  Our room faces Disney and we can see the castle and the fireworks from our window  The food in the restaurant is very good  The breakfast buffet decent if you can overlook the California prices My bed is completely warn and needs replacing  Hotel is located on busy freeway and quite noisy
Manager Response: Dear 138stanleyn,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Office Supervisor Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: I chose this hotel because online it is stated the hotel is a half mile from Disneyland. It very well may be but you are walking over the 405. There are closer hotels. The hotel is good about allowing you to leave your vehicle while you visit Disneyland so you save on parking at Disneyland. There is a $5 shuttle ticket you can purchase if you don’t want to walk but it only comes every 25-30 minutes. We chose to walk to and from Disneyland. There is also the option of taking an Uber which is about $6.  You can tell the hotel was an older hotel that had been remodeled. I found our room to be modern and clean. We did struggle getting into our room because the door was a bit jammed.   The pool area looked enjoyable but we ran out of time. The reason I gave this review only 4 out of
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, great location, nice restaurant
Summary: This is very close to Disneyland (close enough to walk, although it would be a long-ish walk) and even has a little on-site store with Disney merchandise. You can also buy Disneyland tickets here at the hotel. There's a nice pool with plenty of seating as well as a cute outdoor bar. There's a cafe/bakery/coffee bar in the lobby as well as a restaurant that serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I had lunch here and the food was good. The room was very clean and comfortable.   The negatives for me: it's an outside corridor hotel, which I didn't realized when I booked it - totally my fault for not checking. It is at a noisy intersection and there was a lot of traffic noise...it didn't bother me but it may have bothered some.   The lobby/restaurant was inviting and clean...the
Manager Response: Dear Jill R,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations.
