Summary: Our family just enjoyed a one week stay at this nice hotel.  We had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks!  It was awesome!  We found it to be about a 15min walk to the Disneyland gates.  The rooms & beds were comfortable.  There is a great spot in the lobby to purchase coffee, refreshments, fruit cups, yogurt, bakery items, a quick breakfast choices!  The inhotel restaurant has a great breakfast buffet, reasonably priced.  Valet arranged transportation for us to places too far to walk to.  The grandchildren enjoyed the beautiful hotel pool.   We found this an ideal hotel for our family.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a great visit at the Four Points by Sheraton. Recently renovated, modern look, great restaurant, friendly and helpful staff, and only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  It is located near the freeway but I was surprised how much sound is blocked with the door and window closed. They have a shuttle available to Disneyland for a small price when you get exhausted from all the walking and the pool is open 24 hours. The restaurant looks great and the food and drink were excellent. It doesn't get any more convenient than it being downstairs near the lobby.  All of the staff members we encountered were very friendly and they made our trip that much better. Thank you!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family recently stayed here and it was overall a lovely hotel. It was the perfect walking distance from the parks. We loved that the pool was open 24/7. Our room was comfortable. The staff were friendly. My only issue was when we checked out, my crefit card was charged for the our stay. The issue with that is I had already paid for our stay through Get Away Today three mintha prior to our trip.  Management was notified and the charges were reversed, but it took a couple days, which put a damper on our trip as it was a sizable amount that I’d budgeted for using on our vacation. Despite thag snafu, I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Flew from Uk to stay and visit Disney
Summary: We are still in the hotel and leave tomorrow, thought I would review now:-  The good  Very friendly and helpful staff, particularly the front desk After a very long flight check in was very smooth  The room is spacious, with 2 queen size beds, that are the most comfortable, I have ever slept in with luxury linen and pillows to match  Plenty of facilities in the room, iron and board, coffee machine, hair dryer a good one too, shampoo, conditioner and body wash a plenty. Room and bathroom was kept very clean by friendly and helpful room attendants. A huge tv with lots of channels including Disney. The facilities in the hotel are good, you can get practically anything you need. We ate dinner in the restaurant and it was tasty, fast and friendly service. The pool area is really nice
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice hotel with pool and workout room. They do charge for parking. Nice places to eat and shop at hotel. Clean and staff are great. It is close enough to Disney if you don't mind a good walk. The only issue is the elevator stops at just about every floor to pick up a cleaning maid for room service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel when it was called another name, I think the Ménage.....which was not a bad stay. However, this stay was brilliant! We were allocated a poolside room on the ground floor and it was perfect. It was quiet - as the sound of traffic can be very loud on the floors above. The staff were lovely and housekeeping staff were so accommodating. We walked to and from Disneyland, went on a tour and rested by the pool. We ate frequently at the restaurant and enjoyed every meal. Happy hour was also a bonus and our stay was perfect. If I were asked by friends or family where they should stay- I would recommend the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great team members make a hotel!
Summary: With the recent merger of Marriott and Sheraton, I decided to give them a chance. So glad I did. A special shout out  to Dy and William. The mark of a good team is when they find solutions. Dy and William were earnest in their desire to help this customer happy. Lets face it, a great location, 24 hour pool, Disney fireworks are all great....but without a good team, just another nice hotel. Clint Beckett the GM has done a good job with his team! Will return again soon!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: close to Disney for a good price
Summary: The pictures look nicer than it is, but I was still very happy with my stay. They have since renovated since I was there. I would definitely stay here again. The restaurant was a bit pricey for what you get. Very nice view of the Disney fireworks at night. It was faster to walk to disney than to wait for their shuttle.
Manager Response: none

Summary: 4 point by Sheraton in Anaheim, is truly a terrible hotel.  Staying there made me feel like a statistic rather than a person.  Not only is the hotel staff inconsiderate and rude.  But the rooms are dirty and rundown.  We recently stayed over Labor Day weekend, never again.  We reserved a king they put us into a queen room, rather than talking to us they just said we were confused about our reservation.  When I showed them the actual paperwork they said they could move us tomorrow.  The walls are paper thin.  The sink didn’t even drain,  I couldn’t even shave my face.  The second room they put us in was like retribution.  The sink didn’t work the blackout curtain wouldn’t pull up.  The bed was dirty.  No artwork on the walls it was more like an institutional prison cell.  When I

Summary: Had the pleasure of staying her 4 nights months. Location is perfect - walking distance to Disneyland, spacious rooms and short drive to malls and outlets. Very clean hotel, with helpful staff. Swimming pool open all hours which is amazing! We were lucky enough to have a room that faces Disneylabd so we had nightly firework displays which was breathtaking!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the property for family vacation on July on our visit to Disney. The property is beautiful especially the pool area. We checked in passed midnight but the hotel reserved our room. They have good breakfast option. The bathroom is bit outdated but generally clean.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Ideal location for Disney with clean, modern and well priced rooms. F&B reasonably priced and good quality, loads of families with kids here which ensure hotel and pool is always lively.  The hotel has a nice cafe and toy shop too and can arrange transport for Universal etc.  The property is next to a busy highway and you can not avoid the 2130hr Disney firework show, so if you like your hotels quiet this is maybe not the one. We had no issues with this however.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stay in the heart of LA
Summary: This place is OLD. the bathroom is terrible. The location for those who want to go to LA is way too far, I don’t recommend it. The staff was very nice with us, they were very friendly. The price was reasonable for the place.

Summary Heading: No Free Parking Nor breakfast + Noisy
Summary: Pros: Ample rooms  Cleanliness  17 minute walk to Disney  Staff was nice   Cons: Parking is 16 dollars per day really expensive considering you’re not right in front of Disney. Breakfast isn’t included. Rooms on our side were extremely noisy @ night.  A/C never got the room cold enough at all.  I have stayed other times @Hotel Indigo and it was a much more pleasant stay than in this hotel, parking was free and breakfast was included. For a couple more dollars I would totally stay in a hotel like that instead of this one. They’re pretty much the same walking distance from the park’s entrance.

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disneyland,  fireworks view
Summary: We booked the hotel using our points for visiting families. The location is a five minute walk to Disneyland. The room are newly renovated,  as gold members we were  allowed late check out which was great because there was a place to relax and stay away from the heat and head out to the park a bit later.  There is a restaurant and café at the ground floor, they have good selections.  There is a 7-eleven and a mini mart across.  The hotel has full view of the fireworks.  It is a nor frills hotel but the service is at par with all the SPG hotels.  I am thinking of booking at the hotel for just one of our weekend getaways,  just to view the fireworks :-).
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has a very friendly staff.  The rooms were clean enough. Unfortunately our room was not in the greatest shape, poor New York style water pressure and it was extremely loud. The walls are thin.  Budget friendly but I like the Anaheim Mariott Convention Center so much Moreau’s the prices are comparable.
Manager Response: Dear maryannf1,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.   Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent the loud water pressure from occurring in the future.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim. Summary: Ugh... like the other reviews state... this place should not be a Sheraton. Previously we stayed at the Majestic across the street which used to be a Sheraton and there is no comparison between the two. So here’s the review: My baseline for a budget hotel is simply be clean, quiet and don’t cause me any issues. This place fails on all of those: 1) Its literally on the freeway with loud traffic noise. 2) Good news is you can hardly hear the traffic noise in your room because the AC is loud enough to cover it but good luck sleeping  3) Elevators are small and no AC so super hot in the summer 4) Housekeeping didn’t restock coffee 5) Door keys kept failing having us to hike back to the front desk multiple times.  On positive side staff was nice but not enough to make up for this
Manager Response: Dear timbo2003,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent guest not being properly serviced from occurring in the future.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Office Supervisor Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: This property does not represent four points. The place is run down. I read the reviews prior to booking but they made promises to change. So I gave it a try. We arrived to our room, the toilet cover seat was down. I lifted to use the toilet. There was tried urine and pubic hairs on the seat. Then I started to inspect the room. The carpet was dirty. There were papers from a previous stay. I complained. They cleaned it. But no compensation other than a few points refunded. We decided not to stay due the lack of cleanliness.
Manager Response: Dear Sara H,   We recognize your time is valuable and appreciate the feedback you have provided on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.  Maintaining a fresh atmosphere within our guest rooms and common areas is always a key priority. On behalf of the entire team at Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim, I sincerely apologize for falling short of not only meeting your expectations, but ours as well. Rest assured, the feedback provided will be shared with the appropriate hotel team to ensure we consistently deliver upon guest expectations.  As a  valued guest, thank you for choosing us to accommodate you during your travels. We hope to see you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim!  Sincerely, James Chu Front Office Supervisor Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: I was expecting much more from the Sheraton name. The hotel staff was great. Very nice and accommodating. The first of the issues I had was its location sitting on one of California's busiest freeways. Interstate 5. So loud!! Even in the pool I had a hard time relaxing cuz of the noise. Second issue: the first night I filled a cup of water and luckily looked at it before I drank it. It was a really white chalky color. Grossed me out. They do offer complementary bottled water, but I like rinsing my toothbrush in the sink. Finally one night I went into Tru Grits to get a beer and I stood there for 5 to 10 minutes and was never even acknowledged.  Pool is nice. The bar by the pool is nice.  Definitely much better places to stay around Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear DustLong,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely,  James Chu Front Office Supervisor Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: We arrived at 1pm with 8 week old baby, were told our room would not be ready before 3pm and they’d send an e-mail to let us know. We’ve been home two days and still no e-mail. We were able to leave our luggage with them until we returned and our room was ready. Staff were friendly enough. Our room key would not work and when he came up he told us we need to really bang the door by the lock then try the keycard again. We had to do this often which was annoying. We saw many guests doing the same thing. Often we were unable to enter the pool area for the same reason. Rooms are basic especially the bathroom. The plug in the sink did not work. The beds were clean and comfortable. There is free WiFi which was a hit or a miss. Cable tv is available but a list of where the stations are
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place should be in the Motel 6 or Ramada chain, not SPG.  Room and decor are aged but it does serve its purpose for a decent place to sleep.  Maybe the other lower chain would have been half the price for the same purpose.  It's on a really busy street with cars zooming by all nite and the noisy AC click on and off all nite.  Lite sleeper BEWARE.
Manager Response: Hi Toothxt,  We are truly sorry about your experience here at the Four Points Anaheim. We have upgraded the rooms from new furniture and meet all Four Points standards in the room. We are sorry about the noise from the streets and are looking into ways to help with this.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: I stayed here September 2016, pre-remodel which was one of the worst stays ever at an SPG property. I was contacted by the manager Carolynn who apologized for the condition which I understood.   I decided to give it another try and unfortunately, this property continues to disappoint. Yes, you’re close to Disneyland but you are also right next to the freeway so be prepared for a noisy nights sleep.   Things happen, but there are parts that still make this place seem dated despite the updates.   The elevator was out of order and looks like it been beat up. The wall patch job in the restroom is poor and looks like a cheap motel (see photos). Even more disappointing was the gentleman at the front desk who was apathetic to my concerns.   As for SPG upgrades, you don’t get a welcome
Manager Response: Hi Teresa,  We are truly sorry about your experience here at the Four Points Anaheim. Could you please email me at Skylar.Knowlton@fourpointsanaheim.com to let me know more information about who checked you and what room you were in?  We are consistently growing as a hotel and want to make sure things are in place for training.  Thank you  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: Great place to stay. Convenient location. Clean. Staff respectful and helpful. Watched Disneyland fireworks from the beautiful landscaped pool area. Buffet breakfast tasty. Disneyland shuttle bus came right to driveway.
Manager Response: none

Summary: No, it's not a fancy place but it does serve as a clean, comfortable base for a visit to Disneyland. Everyone I came in contact with was friendly and helpful. The beds were comfortable and it's just a quick $6 Uber to Disneyland.  The few cons... The rug was filthy. I mean my feet were BLACK after 5 minutes.  The hot tub was wildly over chlorinated and needed anti foam treatment.  No decent food within walking distance.  Bottom line: I would absolutely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Expected A Bit More From This Hotel...
Summary: We recently stayed here for our Disneyland vacay. At the last minute I had to bring my small 14 y/o dog along as my pet sitter had to go out of town. Luckily the hotel allows small animals so it worked out good. However upon check-in the hotel does not charge a deposit. I had the full amount charged to my card the first night then for the next three days I had $50 charged to my card?? I found that quiet odd and I have never stayed in a hotel that didn't charge $100-$200 upfront for incidentals and then upon checkout the remainder. I also had unnecessary charges on my bill for $7.55 for some sort of Palapa Bar which we didn't even know what that was for as we never went to the bar. Also because we had a dog in our room they never cleaned the room which they said they would if we
Manager Response: Dear katilenzi,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent miscommunication about authorizations from occurring in the future.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Office Supervisor Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: My partner & I recently stayed here for 2 nights while on vacation to disneyland. Hotel was clean and friendly - room was quite a big size. It's a 15/20min walk to disneyland or you can pay $5 per person each day to catch the bus which comes to the hotel every 15 mins - very convenient in the heat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: we had a fantastic stay, the rooms were clean and big, walking distance to disneyland, excellent view for the nightly fireworks. Restaurant had good food and service.The only issue we had was the attitude and service from the front desk we had on 1 day out of the 4 that we stayed, otherwise we had a great time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Located less than half a mile from the main gate at Disneyland and California Adventure this hotel is a good choice. Offering a shuttle service to the Park, very good food, nice pool area, clean rooms and very comfortable beds, this is a very affordable place to stay. Staff are very helpful to  newby Disney visitors.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We usually stay at neighboring Starwood or Hilton properties but booked this hotel due to availability.  I'm a little surprised this is a Starwood hotel.  The rooms were very dark with dingy carpet and outdated fixtures.  However, the property overall was clean.  The beds were ok.  The pool looked nice but we didn't go in.  The breakfast buffet wasn't memorable.  Service was a bit slow.  We will chose to spend a bit more money or points and stay at a nicer property next time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I’m not sure what was going on with the SPG group when they added this the line up but it is well below any standard let alone SPG. It’s in the middle of 2 highways and 2 other main roads. Pool is dirty and the spa had god knows what floating in it. I saw a false fingernail sitting on the side. I left my cup pool side after a drink and it was still ther 4 hours after I had left! The lift had the same dirt in it for the entire 3 days I was there. The aircon is loud enough to drown out the sound of the traffic but the bathroom door was louder again. The bathroom was tiny! Checkin was slow and didn’t seem to have any rooms ready on time. On the last day all the cards stopped working so you couldn’t open pool gate or get into your room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Checking was a little rocky as we had asked for a pool view and fold out couch for our son and we got neither.  They did eventually accommodate the request we made when we booked six months ago. The easiest way to describe our stay is to break out pros and cons.  Pros: great pool area with a view of the Disney fireworks each night, close proximity to the park with a 10-15 minute walk, nice 2 hour happy hour each night, comfortable beds Cons: relatively underwhelming service from hotel staff, laundry facilities on our side of the hotel were not functioning so we had to haul all of our laundry across the hotel to wash and dry, daily cleaning of our room was not thorough and staff did not restock any amenities over our five days with the exception of new coffee packets one day and
Manager Response: HI Christy B,  Thank you for letting me know about the about the issues of staff to housekeeping. We care constantly training our staff to better assist with reservations and housekeeping as well. We hope that you consider staying with us again as we grow to better accommodate our guests.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Asst. General Manager

Summary: Our money was worth staying here...yeah its next to the freeway. HOWEVER like some people stated, when you got your AC & T.V. on, theres no problem.  Its close to Disneyland & we were able to watch the fireworks just outside our room.  Staff was friendly. Next time we'll be staying here again. Thank you for a wonderful experience!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for two nights before returning to UK. Had pool side room view which meant watching Disney fireworks from outside landing fantastic view can’t be missed. Pool quiet in the day time but busy late afternoon when kids return from Disney Very comfortable bed
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The worst hotel you want to stay in with your family!
Summary: It’s on the freeway with extremely loud road noise in most rooms. And they don’t tell you this on the website or when you book a room. Most people go to that city to visit Disneyland hoping for a good night’s sleep before the hectic days at Disneyland. You can’t achieve that with this hotel. I would not recommend this property to anyone and request the hotel management to communicate the hotel’s issues to customers upfront.  And it’s so poor in terms of its condition and rooms etc.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Truly horrible experience- SPG has disappointed on this one.
Summary: This was a horrible experience, which was compounded by the horrible customer service that followed.   First, we found a dirty towel on the floor of the bathroom when we checked-in indicating the the room was not really cleaned between guests.  Second, the room reeked of smoke smell Third, the fire alarm went off TWO WHOLE NIGHTS  in a 3-day stay Fourth, the fire department was not notified of the fire alarm the first time and that was why it wasn't solved the first time around indicating that management couldn't have been bothered  Fifth, when called to complain about the experience, SPG customer service essentially said, "oh well"
Manager Response: Hi Notreallyrightnow,  We are truly sorry about the experience here at the Four points Anaheim. I have contacted the the housekeeping department to about the cleanliness issues and will use this as a training tool.   The fire alarm automatically lets the fire department know what is going on. The first night we had the situation under control and called them off due to turning the elevator off. We called the elevator company out and they told us everything was good to go. The next night the elevator was not in our control and let the fire department take control as protocol.   We are truly sorry again.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Managar

Summary Heading: Horrible experience - if you want to sleep do not stay here!
Summary: I travel a lot for work and stay in a lot of hotels, rarely complaining but this hotel did not have working keys, had fire alarms going off repeatedly in the middle of the night on multiple days, had staff who are unable to help, and was not very clean.  We booked this hotel on Priceline for a 3 day trip we were taking to Disneyland. The first day we checked in was fine - they were out Disney tickets and there is no shuttle but the walk to Disney is only about 15 minutes so no big deal. The duvet had makeup residue all over it and there was a bit of trash from previous guests on the floor but the bed was comfortable. We had a street facing room which was loud and the pool area was rarely cleaned up - dirty towels on all chairs and the ground but nothing horrible for the price.
Manager Response: Dear jfmorton16,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. My name is James Chu and I am the Front Office Supervisor at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim. It has come to my attention that the service you received during your recent stay did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  The experience you described is not characteristic of the level of service our associates strive to provide. I would love the opportunity to hear more about your recent stay in an effort to prevent this issue from occurring in the future.  Please let me know the best contact number and time to reach you, or feel free to contact me via phone anytime at (714) 758-0900. I look forward to speaking with you in order to restore your confidence in the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Office Supervisor Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: I have stayed at numerous Four Point and Sheraton hotels and have to say this one falls far below expectations of the brand. It is obviously recently remodeled so I was shocked to discover multiple outlets in the room didn't work making it difficult to charge phones and other devices. The room was clean so I'll give them that, and the beds were comfy.   However the walls are paper thin so you hear your neighbors conversation like they are in the room with you, and I won't get started in the freeway noise, which made sleeping difficult, bring earplugs if you stay here.   We dined in the hotel restaurant and the quality of food is on par with average hotel quality food, but overpriced.  Be prepared to pay for parking, $16 self parking with a nice walk back to the front door, or
Manager Response: Dear Jettaboy04,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. My name is James Chu and I am the Front Office Supervisor at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim. It has come to my attention that the service you received during your recent stay did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  The experience you described is not characteristic of the level of service our associates strive to provide. I would love the opportunity to hear more about your recent stay in an effort to prevent this issue from occurring in the future.  Please let me know the best contact number and time to reach you, or feel free to contact me via phone anytime at (714) 758-0900. I look forward to speaking with you in order to restore your confidence in the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Office Supervisor Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: This hotel is within walking distance to Disney, just about 1/2 mile.   Traffic noise is a little loud while walking outside or by the pool but in your room with the doors closed it’s barely noticeable.   Front desk employees were super helpful and friendly even when checking in very late.   Great hotel for a budget friendly hotel when all you need is a comfy bed to sleep on after a long day at the parks.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: No Service, No Amenities, No Nothing but a bad room, AVOID THIS TRAP
Summary: As I pulled in to hotel, pulled to front, a doorman rudely shouted, You can't park there! I said I am checking in, he said oh well you need to hurry?  WTF? So after the heavy set hispanic male and female got done texting....  yes both were and ignoring me the customer at the front counter. Wow.  SO when paying for very over priced room I asked if we could have a room facing DL for fireworks, he said yes. He then tells me if I want to park at hotel it will be $16 a day or $19 for valet. I asked where else can I park he said I could take my chances parking at gas station across street but definitely would be towed. I asked if they had a continental breakfast, he chuckled we have breakfast buffet for $17.99 again WTF???  We have to park so far from the hotel I can't believe I was
Manager Response: Dear GINGER32D,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent miscommunication like what you had from occurring in the future.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Office Supervisor Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: We did a Priceline express and ended up with this hotel. We were thrilled with the large rooms. The beds were comfortable also. The walk to Disney isn’t bad the first morning but after that it is just not as convenient as the closer hotels. Kids were too tired to make the trek that night and the next morning. Add in the parking fee and it is the same price as most. The fireworks were cool to see from our balcony. The service wasn’t great. The pool area was pretty trashed and out of towels the first day, better the next two days. Our room did not get cleaned the first day, I called at 4 and they said they were behind and still working, at 7 it was still not done. I went down to the desk and they said all but one had left for the day and they would make sure it was done. We went
Manager Response: Hi Reneej789,  We are so happy enjoyed the beds and our rooms. We are sorry that service was not up to our standards. We will utilize this as training to ensure that we do not allow this to happen again. We do hope to see you back again.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: If you’re looking for a hotel to rest your head at after a long day of theme parks and beaches, then this one’s for you. Clean rooms, restaurant, gift shop and best of all 24 hr pool. Plus if you need recommendations see Lisa at the front desk! She’s amazing
Manager Response: none

Summary: The property was beautiful and the staff was friendly when we arrived. My husband and I took our two kids to Disneyland and stayed at this hotel this past weekend. My husband took a shower and while he was getting dressed someone started knocking on our door. We said we were coming, we just needed to get dressed. The guy OPENED OUR HOTEL ROOM DOOR while my husband was undressed, my two kids (age 6 and 2) were in the room and I was sitting on the bed. We shut the door and he kept knocking. He told us that the smoke alarm had gone off and that we were going to be charged over $200 EXTRA. First off, we don't smoke. Both of our kids were in the room and my husband wasn't even dressed. He was extremely rude to my husband while he was trying to tell him we weren't smoking. Clearly the
Manager Response: Dear desiraejarvais,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim and providing your honest feedback on the Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent the inconvenience of your stay being disrupted by our staff looking out for the fire alarm from occurring in the future. We will definitely try to have all staff members show more compassion and be more sensitive to situations like the one you went through.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Sincerely, James Chu Front Office Supervisor Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim james.chu@fourpointsanaheim.com (714) 758-0900

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights on a multi-centre trip. The room was lovely and clean with a  view of the Disney castle and fireworks at night! Close walk to Disney, which we did several nights.  We did eat at the restaurant at the hotel and we didn't think it was the best food, however that was personal choice of ours.  We did get free car parking with our booking which was good as it was quite expensive if we didn't.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was less luxurious than I was expecting for the brand, however I found that it suited my needs. The staff where excellent, onsite restaurant was good, pool was fine however the pool towels are too small. The walking distance to Disneyland is about 15 minutes there is a bus that comes to the hotel each 30 minutes u can buy your tickets on the ground floor for $5.00 as many trips as you like each day. The service station across the road is great for your daily needs and has a ATM, Starbucks and a Taco Bell.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My partner and I were extremely impressed with the four points during our 5 night stay. Hotel is a 10 minute walk to Disneyland or a $5 Uber. Facilities in the room were fantastic and the overall size was brilliant. We will be staying here on our next trip to Anaheim.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I took a short break to LA and stayed at Hotel Menage. Firstly I was unaware of the refurbishment work that was taking place until we arrived, but the work was taking place in the reception area and the rooms were unaffected.  The hotel is undergoing refurbishment as it is joining the spg group as a result the hotel sign was cover making locating the hotel difficult as you can see from the photo. The hotel is just off The freeway which may be a problem for some due to traffic noise, but it was not too much of an issue for us. The hotel does boast a 24hr swimming pool and Jacuzzi which was the major selling point to us and as my wife can testify was well worth it. Towels are supplied for the pool and are regularly stocked. The hotel is located opposite Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary: Went to a breakfast business meeting here recently..  Noticed the beautiful new decor, the room we met in had a natural woodsy feel and opened to a beautiful patio.  .Food was great..staff was superb and super attentive..made some great connections. parking was super easy and plentiful..hope they host more events here..Hotel is only 10 minutes walk to Disneyland and I understand there is an awesome view of the fireworks from many rooms..Only negative thing..right next to the 5 Freeway..may get a little noisy at times..but on a positive note easy freeway access to other local attractions..
Manager Response: none

Summary: Lets start with the good things,The restaurant  has nice food and staff were OK. Close to Disneyland.  Now the bad The noise of the 6 lane freeway next door in terrible  Booked a King room, they gave us a double, had a have a argue with staff to get correct room at 11pm at night..The hotel staff blamed our travel agent  Couldn't buy soap powder for washing machine. Felt very unsafe as people can walk through alleyway near the ground floor units No change at Café in Foyer (twice).. very unprofessional Room cleaning got worse over the week. until the bed wasn't made properly ... wont be back
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Too noisy and not ideal for Disneyland visit!
Summary: The hotel is average. Quiet noisy with the highway so close and fireworks! Service at the front desk is ok depending on who's on. Restaurant and cafe service is great. Cafe is a little overpriced.   Cleaners are ok, not the most hygienic when they clean, usingvthe same cloth for the toilet, bathroom sink and bench tops. Toilet also overflowed one day and it took a few hours for someone to come and fix it and clean up. No kettle or access to hot water for making tea but there is a dusty small coffee machine. Bad smell in foyer some days. Not an ideal place to stay if your visiting disneyland as there is closer hotels.
Manager Response: Hi. I'm sorry for all the problems that you had to experience on your stay. We provide on going training to our team so they are equip with the tools they need to be able to provide the customer service to all our guest at check in and during they're stay. Please during your next stay I would like  to meet you and do what I can to make you and your family have a pleasant stay.

Summary Heading: Way too noisy for a peaceful vacation
Summary: This hotel borders a very busy road and the freeway. In all honesty there were, what sounded like street races going on off an on through the night and ambulances and just general freeway static noise. It was so loud we ended up moving rooms. It didnt help. Bring your ear plugs as the walls are paper thin! This would not be ideal for small kids. This place was so gross and the hotel start were rude and unapologetic.  I hated that I wasted my money sleeping here.
Manager Response: Hi Hollyberries4,  We am truly sorry about your experience here at the Four Points Anaheim. We are looking into new ways to help with the noise of the highway. We are never want to hear that our staff is rude. Please email me at Skylar.Knowlton@fourpointsanaheim.com to let me know what exactly happened.   Look forward to hearing from you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: We had the best experience in this hotel.  We went for our friend's bachelorette party and we stayed 4 nights. Rooms were really spacious and always clean.  They have the option of having 2 rooms together, but since we were party of 9 and needed a bigger room with a rollaway, we couldn't get them together.  Personnel were really nice, we asked - a lot - for towels and they brought them as quick as they could.  They have a bar with happy hour. The snack on the lobby is delicious and, in case you're in for a midnight snack, there's a 24 hour grocery store crossing the street.  Best choice for a Disney trip! Definitely would stay there again!.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We needed three separate rooms for all of us and the staff were nice enough to put these all together. Two of the rooms had joining doors.   The hotel is close to the main roadway/highway. You could hear traffic all day and night. The fireworks from Disneyland can be seen to an extent from one side of the hotel and can be heard from all the sides.   This hotel was an ideal location for walking to the Disney Parks nearby so you didn’t need to worry about parking. Most of the higher end restaurants were the opposite direction from the parks though so if walking further for those this might not be the ideal location.   The staff were pleasant, the rooms were clean and there was a pool that was fantastic for the end of the day or just those relaxing days. The restaurant was good too
Manager Response: Thank you Ms. Patricia for the review for our hotel. we all work together as a whole team to provide the best customer service possible for our guest so that they can experience a pleasant stay. Thank you for your stay

Summary Heading: Perfect choice for a Disney Vacation
Summary: Stayed at the Four Points January 2018. Great proximity to the Disney parks, just a 15 minute walk (there is also a shuttle bus). Hotel was clean and modern with tasteful Disney artwork sprinkled around. The 24 hour heated pool and hot-tub were great to soak achy legs after a day at the parks. The hotel is next to a highway but we could not hear it from our room. What really made this place stand out was the staff, always friendly and super helpful. A huge shoutout to Mike at the front desk. Mike checked us in and upon finding out it was our anniversary, moved us to a room where we could watch the fireworks right from our balcony! We would see Mike when we came back to the hotel every night and he always gave us a big welcome and would ask about our day. Mike made us feel like
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 8 nights.  I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews on here, but everything was much better than expected.  Check in was quick and easy.  We stayed in room 357 which didn't have a great view and was kind of close to the road but that didn't really bother us.  The bed was very comfortable.  The black out curtains in the room were amazing!  Could have slept all day and not realised.  There is definitely some night time noise from the road but we didn't mind this.  There were a few minor things that caught my eye - chipping paint on the bottom of the bathroom door, and also we did notice a few stains on some of the bedding.  Housekeeping was good and I liked that we got water bottles every day.  Not the biggest deal though.  Free WIFI was great!
Manager Response: Hi JayneNZ1990,  We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us. We love the black out curtains too. We will be looking into the paint chipping and have contacted our laundry service about stains. We do hope that if you are back in town you will come see us.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Pluses and Minuses but a fine stay all things considered
Summary: For the hotels around Disneyland, the Four Points isn't bad. It's a 15 minute walk to the Disneyland or DCA main gates, or about a $5 Uber ride (just know that the main pickup/drop-off location at the Disneyland entrance gets really packed at certain times, when more people are coming/going... so even though an Uber will save you the walk, it might take longer if it's busy. Downtown Disney has a better pickup/drop-off location, but it's further to walk to the main gates). The pool at the Four Points is really nice... nicer than comparably priced hotels closer to the parks. People have complained about the road noise, as the hotel is right against the interstate, but I didn't think the noise level was all that bad. If you want NO ROAD NOISE at all when outside, then this isn't
Manager Response: Hi Rhirtz,   We are so happy that you had a good time at the Four Points by Sheraton. We do pride ourselves on giving great service. We do hope to see you again,  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: My son and I traveled to Disneyland And chose The Sheraton Four Points because it showed as being close to the park, had a very nice looking pool and I have been very happy with the Sheraton properties in the past.  Beware if you book here that the hotel butts up to the highway and it has extremely loud freeway noise. I specifically booked a room over looking the pool and was charged extra for it, only to find mour room was #438 which over looks the highway and to get the view we had to go out on walkway and look way to the left through the trees. Went down and argued with desk to have them remove “view charge” from our bill. Just be aware all their pool view rooms face the highway and they have very loud traffic noise! If outside we had to yell to hear each other. The pool is
Manager Response: Hi Janburnett,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback.  I am sorry to hear your stay with us has not been up to the standards of Four Points by Sheraton. One of our company values is we succeed only when we meet and exceed the expectations of our customers and I sincerely apologize we did not do so during your stay.   The experience you described is not characteristic of the level of service our associates strive to provide. We are typically very aware of the rate plans our guests book but if your confirmation does honor that complimentary parking or breakfast came with the reservation, we would honor.  At times, what the guest has on their letters does not match what is in our system but we are always willing to accommodate if needed.    I do sincerely hope you'll give us another try further down the line as we consistently improve each and every day to exceed the expectations of our guests.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: We stayed here on the recommendation of a couple getting married but were very disappointed at the standards. The hotel was recently taken over by the Sheraton Group and that can only be good, because the decor was so dated! The rooms were clean but faded. The entrance was painted concrete & faded. The poolside was the best feature - warm water but not deep enough to do any proper swimming. The pool is next to the freeway, so bring earplugs!   The bar was the expensive & we didn’t eat anything except the included breakfast, which was bland & boring. Save yourself some money - stay closer to Disney by spending less & head to Denny’s for breakfast. I’d never waste my time & money here again.
Manager Response: Hi Deborah B,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. It has come to my attention that the property did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  We did just recently convert into the Four Points which means all of our items must be of the Four Points brand standard.  We will work hard to maintain our newly renovated items while working on improving some items that need attention.  Again, we do thank you for staying at our property and hope you'll change your mind in the near future as we continue to make improvements to exceed the expectations of our valued guests.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: I was a little leery taking my kids here, with all the mixed reviews. I'll be the first to tell you, my doubts were dismissed when we walked in. The front desk staff is amazing! They are so friendly, professional, and willing to assist. They allowed us to check in early, around 11am, and even upgraded our room from a standard view to a pool view. We were on the 2nd floor, corner unit with not only views of the pool but also of Disneyland fireworks! The freeway is right there and can be loud from the outside, but once you are inside, it's barely noticeable. The ART pickup/dropoff is so convenient for going to Disneyland and well worth the additional fee. The room was very nicely appointed and very clean. We were there for a week and housekeeping was great at the beginning of our
Manager Response: Hi Dawn W,  We are ready to have you again! We will be looking into the Housekeeping issues and Valet. Thank you for letting us know about these things. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: Pleasant but perhaps a little far from action without free shuttle Staff were generally good except service in room dropped when we didn't leave tips Dai.y A couple of restaurant staff were great, one was lazy
Manager Response: Hi debbiesmith15,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. It has come to my attention that the service you received during your most recent stay at our property did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  Unfortunately, since we are located within the Anaheim resort area, all transportation is operated by the city of Anaheim and require the guests to purchase the tickets for the shuttle.  However, with regards to the room service, I will be sure to pass the feedback on to the general manager and all pertaining individuals to ensure a situation like this doesn't occur again in the future.  As we did just recently grand open, we are working diligently each and every day to exceed the standards expected by our valuable SPG/Marriott guests are expecting when they enter our property.  Please give us another try in the near future so that we may look to restore your confidence in the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim.  Should you choose to stay with us one more time, please give our property a call and ask for me so that I may ensure your next stay will be a magical one!  Sincerely, Management

Summary: We chose this hotel due to proximity to Disney and because we are an SPG cardholder. Upon arrival, we got checked in quickly and were impressed by the lobby and pool area. However, once we entered our room, I immediately noticed several stains on the bedding. I called the front desk and requested to be moved to a different room. We were moved to a room a few doors down and yet again, the bedding had multiple stains. I am not a crazy particular person, but the fact that the second room had stains, was incredibly disheartening. Even my husband said it was gross and agreed that it was not okay. I called the front desk again- they apologized and said that housekeeping could come change the sheets, but offered nothing else in exchange for the inconvenience. My husband and I both
Manager Response: Hi Casie I,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. It has come to my attention that the service you received during your most recent stay at our property did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  I will be sure to pass the feedback on to the general manager and all pertaining individuals to ensure a situation like this doesn't occur again in the future.  As we did just recently grand open, we are working diligently each and every day to exceed the standards expected by our valuable SPG/Marriott guests are expecting when they enter our property.  Please give us another try in the near future so that we may look to restore your confidence in the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim.  Should you choose to stay with us one more time, please give our property a call and ask for me so that I may ensure your next stay will be a magical one!  Sincerely, Management

Summary: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff was very authentically friendly at both the hotel and at the restaurant (Tru Grits- which has a great morning buffet-convenient before hitting up Disneyland). An easy 10 minute walk from the park (don't even have to cross the street) or around $7US for an Uber.   There is a Starbucks across the street and a gas station with lots of fresh fruit and kid friendly snacks to store in your fridge in your hotel room. There is also a Walmart grocery store about a 10 minute walk away.   Room was nothing too fancy but very comfortable. The entire premise, including the pool area, was very clean and well maintained.  Thanks for your hospitality!
Manager Response: Hi Sarah N,  Thank you for the kind compliments! We hope to see you again soon.   Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: Our family have loved staying here so much, both rooms are amazing ( no grumbles), it’s a very nice complex, we have another night here but it’s been the best start to our holiday we could have asked for.  Also the young guy who serves in the restaurant is a treasure. The food is great and they accomodated me being dairy free no problem at all. There was no baristas made coffee at night so he got me a hot tea with soy instead.  Would definitely recommend staying here. The kids have been to Disney and the zoo etc but their favourite thing was being in the pool at night time to watch the disney fireworks! Amazing
Manager Response: Hi Ginadannycamnbailey,   We are so happy you had the "Best stay ever." We love our guests and are always happy to help.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and when we checked in ,we asked for  a room with pool view and told us we have to pay $10 extra for each night.this is ridiculous and we had no choice but to pay as we want to enjoy our holiday. Apart from that the reciption staff were good specially Hany. The room was good size for 3 people and the  bed was comfortable.
Manager Response: Hi Hilda1965,  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. We do offer upgraded rooms/views for an additional fee. We do hope if you are in the area that you will see us again.   Thank you,  Skylar Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel is surrounded by a very busy freeway.  The noise is incredible even inside the room. The room is bland and somewhat sad but clean. I wish I were somewhere else.  The hotel price was high and I assumed a higher quality for a Sheraton.
Manager Response: Hi tmgen2018,  We are sorry that you had an experience like this. We are working to make sure noise is less a factor with upgraded noise windows. We do hope that you will see us again.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: We checked in for a three person shared room with two queen beds. It was a prepaid website deal. The hotel was pretty quiet so we asked whether we could get a bigger room with a cot so we’d each get our own sleeping space.  Debra at the front desk and manager Keoki did even better. We were comp’d an adjoining room so we each had a super comfy bed.  What I love about that was, not only the rooms, but that the management was empowered to make a decision right there to make their customers delighted. They didn’t have to fuss with getting a cot in and out and we guests were super happy with the extra room and sleeping arrangements.  We also enjoyed the Wednesday night snacks and drink we were offered Free in the little pub beside the front desk. Breakfast was also first rate. Made
Manager Response: Hi Frisbees,  We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay! We hope that to see you again soon!  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location but a horrible place to stay
Summary: The rate was good enough so I booked for three nights as we were doing a four day Disneyland tour. After an excellent stay at Sheraton Universal we looked forward to staying here but it was terrible.   The carpet smelled of steam clean chemicals and old smoke. The rooms are large but VERY dated. Staff were ok, not overly helpful but this is a busy establishment.   Yuk!
Manager Response: Hi Shane jacob Z,  Thank you again for choosing to stay with us here in Anaheim.  We appreciate the feedback given and will be working diligently each and every day to improve ourselves so that we may better service our guests in the future.  We hope to make some more improvements on our service and property very soon and wish for you to give us another try further down the line to see the changes we make!  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: Our first impression was to have the valet/door man texting while we struggled to get the front door opened with our luggage?! I mean come on man! You are hired to open the door for the guests! The front desk girl saw us struggle with the door and was indifferent, showed very little empathy. The Hotel is close to the front gates of Disneyland but the walk is scarier than any of the rides in the park. there is a narrow sidewalk over 1-5 that will put you inches from heavy traffic, watch the little ones! The room was very average, not what we had imagined for a Sheraton. The pool was nice and clean but very cold. The pool was a great place to see the fireworks if you wanted. Breakfast buffet on the Sunday we left was good
Manager Response: Hi Matthew K,  Thank you again for staying with us and taking the time to give us some valuable feedback.  I do sincerely apologize for the experience you had at our property as the service you received is not the standard for us.  We are currently working diligently each and every day to improve our service levels so that we may better serve our valuable guests.    I will be sure to let the appropriate individuals be aware of the service that was provided and what is expected of them.  I do hope you'll give us a try further down the line as we make our improvements.   Sincerely,  Management

Summary: Let's start with the good and work our way down.  The beds were comfy, we had fresh sheets and towels everyday, TV was good and the restaurant and pantry options are very helpful. All in all, I think the services were up to standard and you get what you pay for.  However, staff are another issue.  We were directed by our travel agency to approach the front desk so they can ring our shuttle service to book our shuttle from the hotel to another one we were staying that. The man we were talking to was obviously still in training and told us he doesn't know how to RING A BASIC NUMBER AND CONFIRM A SHUTTLE BUS!  Anyway, he said he will leave a message at the desk and someone else will handle it. A bit later on we approached the desk again to confirm that this man had indeed passed
Manager Response: Hi janenmortimer,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. My name is William Liu and I am the Duty Manager at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim. It has come to my attention that the service you received during your recent stay did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  The experience you described is not characteristic of the level of service our associates strive to provide. We currently do have some associates in training at the moment and are working to get them up to speed to better service our guests.  I do apologize for the billing issue and hope it has been rectified.  If not, please don't hesitate to contact us at 714-758-0900 so that I may better assist you.  I do hope you'll give us another try further down the line as we make improvements.  Sincerely, WILLIAM LIU Duty Manager Four Points Anaheim 714-758-0900

Summary: First, we called the morning of our arrival to make sure everything was OK with our reservation. We were simply told that we would be getting an accessible king room. We asked if there were any other rooms available since we don't need accessibility and we would rather let those who need it have it available. We were told that there were no other rooms available. Later when we checked in, about 4:00pm, we were told that our room would be on the first floor. We asked for a higher floor since we prefer that option. The clerk said that there was another accessible king room on the third floor that we could have. When we got to that room, the keys we were given would not work in the door lock. We went back to the front desk and they could not figure it out and sent engineering to
Manager Response: HI kth626,  We are truly sorry for this issues of the room, keys and the water issue. We have replaced both boilers of the hotel so this will never happen again. We are currently working on our key system to ensure every room is working correctly and this will be consistent preventive maintenance moving forwards. Again, we are so sorry and hope that you will reconsider us again next time you are in town.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Pretty Average - not up to Sheraton quality
Summary: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the 4-Points Sheraton in Anaheim.  This is my second 4-Points experience, and I have to say I do not like the brand as much as Courtyard or Doubletree.    This is definitely a family hotel.  Very close to Disneyland, with pretty good sized rooms.  First off, this is not really a hotel, but a remodeled motel.  The interiors are nicer, but not much different than you'd find at Holiday Inn.  What I liked:  The oddly named Tru Grit's restaurant was good.  We had a couple of dinners there that were very tasty.  The breakfast buffet was not great, pretty average for a lower-range hotel.  The pool area was well maintained and attractive.  Kids and adults seemed to enjoy it.  The public spaces were fairly new and well maintained.  There was a coffee
Manager Response: Hi Todd_Tomorrow,  We are truly sorry about the experience you had here at the Four Points by Sheraton. We have just finished our renovation and all beds were replaced 4 months ago. We are going to use this to train our staff to the proper protocol with the new brand. Thank you for letting us know. We hope to that you may reconsider staying here again.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: We spent three nights at this hotel in a room with two queen beds for for of us. The beds were comfy, the room clean and modern. We requested a room away from the highway, which was a good move, the traffic is so loud. The pool is heated and the kids enjoyed it. Sitting with them was nice, but the constant traffic noise made conversation difficult. It's a quick 10 minute (& straightforward) walk to the Disneyland parks. The staff were all helpful. Laundry service available during the week, or self serve with a couple of washing machines and dryers and lots of quarters (thankfully a change machine in the games room). We enjoyed it!
Manager Response: Hi Ginamchina12,  We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us. We love our pool too! We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: We just got home from staying a long weekend at this hotel. I am shocked to see all the "positive" reviews, honestly. We had a VERY different experience. I will just hit on the "main" issues.  First of all, upon returning back to the room on our last night we had a giant cockroach on the carpet. Thank goodness my husband told me and my daughters it was a beetle until we checked out the next morning!  Thank goodness it was out last night!  This hotel is right next to Interstate 5. It is the loudest hotel i have ever started at. Even with earplugs you can hear the traffic. The highway traffic is very loud.  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. That is the extent of anything positive I have to say about this hotel. We were in town for a National cheer competition and a
Manager Response: Hi LWhite17,  We are truly sorry about your stay at the Four Points Anaheim. We have contacted our pest control company to look into the bug situation. We will also be working with the engineering department to ensure that everything works properly. The housekeeping department has been training to ensure that a full clean is happening and we are starting to ensure the Manager is looking into every room to make sure full service is happening. We again are so sorry about this and are constantly using guest comments to improve our service. We hope that you will consider staying again.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel is awesome! First of all , I was so happy to see a restaurant within the hotel. Also a play area for children and a beautifully landscaped pool area. The room had fresh white bedspreads and extremely clean. I will definitely come here again.
Manager Response: Hi WJBROWN,  Thank you for staying with us! We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to having you come back!  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Customer Service Training needed for AM and PM Duty Managers
Summary: The Good:  Comfortable beds, close to Disneyland, ART buses usually have lots of room, clean, excellent customer service by most of the staff, good blackout curtains, good soundproofing.  Special Kudos to the Head Chef regarding his ability to accommodate our daughter who has severe peanut and tree nut allergies.  The Bad:  Hot water had issues in the morning.  Also, on our final night we got home from the parks late.  When we entered our room we noted the odor of cigarette smoke being pulled in through the air conditioning unit.  We made the mistake of not reporting it that night.  After we returned home from our trip, the hotel charged us $250 for smoking in the room.  Side note:  We don't smoke and our daughter is asthmatic so prolonged exposure to cigarettes would make her
Manager Response: Hi Angelica P,  Please email me directly at Skylar.Knowlton@fourpointsanaheim.com. I would like to discuss with you everything that happened.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: Recently stayed here for two nights.  Very nice public areas.  Great pool and patio area. Room was a little worn. Bathtub had chipped enamel.  No microwave but there was a mini fridge.  Very accommodating, helpful staff.  Fajrly good proximity to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hi Jrg47,  We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay at the Four Points Anaheim. We just finished re glazing the the tubs on April 3rd. We hope to see you again!  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Handy location, good soundproofing and blackout curtains
Summary: Checked in to the hotel and it seemed like a bit of a shambles. The water was switched off so after a 13 hour flight; I needed to head across the road to use the bathroom (not a huge deal as these things happen), but it again happened the next day.   We’d requested two rooms next to each other as my sister and brother in law were in one and my nephew (9) and I were in another - while they attempted to meet this request, we were in fact on opposite sides of the building to each other; but on the same floor and same end so there technically were no rooms between us.   This hotel is right on a highway so the soundproofing worked really well as you couldn’t hear a lot - and the blackout curtains were a treat against the California sun in the morning.   The location is really handy,
Manager Response: Hi Brooke-KiwiTraveller,  We are truly sorry about the water issue and we have addressed this to ensure this never happens again. We will be working with our front desk to ensure they know the locations of all rooms and to accommodate all request. We hope that next time you are in Anaheim you stay with us.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: Stayed here before with good experience but this time it was horrible.  Woke up on day 1 to find out they did not have any hot water.  After contacting front desk several times, we received several different stories.  My stay was booked with SPG points, so I called SPG to see if they could help get me into another SPG hotel.  They stated I would have to talk to the manager and also stated the manager had the option to return all my points, plus additional points if needed to book at another hotel.  Upon speaking with manager, she stated I needed to inquire with SPG.  NICE JOB PING PONGING ME BACK AT FORTH.   We ended up moving to the  Sheraton Park Hotel which required more points than they refunded.  Manager stated she would refund additional points. But I have not seen the
Manager Response: Hi Joebuyer,  We are truly sorry about about your experience here at the Four Points by Sheraton. We have talked about giving different explanations and will work hard to ensure that this never happens again. We also will ensure from now on that we let the guest know if anything like this happens again. We hope that you will reconsider and give us another try.   Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: This poor girl was being threatened and verbally assaulted, yet took the time to smile and acknowledge me as I walked back into the hotel. That young lady was cool as a cucumber. I’m glad she asked him to leave. Then called my room to make sure I was ok and apologized. Stay here and see Lisa! She’s amazing and she’ll take care of you
Manager Response: Hi Mcindy79,  Thank you for letting us know about our associate! We will recognize her on a job well done!  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Not the Sheraton quality I'm used to.
Summary: Apparently Sheraton only recently took over this property--whatever they paid it was too much--which was previously named The Menage;  I suspect you had to bring your own à trois.   In any event, I'm used to Sheraton being a better-than-average business/resort hotel, nice if somewhat bland and pasteurized.    The room was large, I'll give it that, and our east-facing room had black-out shades which I really appreciated.  But the decor was "early Industrial" with low quality furniture and the bathroom door had strips of veneer which had fallen away and peeling paint.     The location was good given that my wife was attending a convention at the convention center and I had joined her to go out to dinner at the Napa Rose, an annual event with us.  But I would have felt better if
Manager Response: Hi Trismegistus.  We are truly sorry about your experience at the Four Points Anaheim. We are currently going through the rooms to fix any issues that the contractors did not address. We hope that you do give us another chance after we finish going through all the rooms.   Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Short Walk To Disneyland, Very Comfortable Bed
Summary: This is a great hotel option when visiting Disneyland if all you require is a comfortable clean room and friendly service. It took us approx. 10 min to walk to Disneyland, although this does require crossing the on/off ramps from I5 (which is well lite and doesn’t feel unsafe at all). The accommodation is motel style. We didn’t have time to try the restaurant nor pool. The beds were super comfortable, something I would have have expected from a hotel of this style. The only downside, as mentioned by other reviews, is the noise from the I5. It wasn’t super load, nor did effect either of our sleep but you could hear the constant traffic. All in all, would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hi Dzedder,  We are so happy you enjoyed your stay at the Four Points Anaheim. We love our location and our beds are so Comfortable. (Four Points Comfort beds) We do hope you come see us again soon.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Very good hotel within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed for 5 nights in late October 2017.  Arrived from Melbourne at the hotel at 9.00am and was not expecting to be able to get access to our room until the afternoon however to our surprise our room was ready.  Reasonable sized room located on 4th floor facing S. Harbour Blvd so there was a fair level of traffic noise however after 12-14 hour days exploring Disneyland we had no problem sleeping.  Surprisingly this was the only hotel we stayed at (we stayed at 4) during our US trip that had USB outlets in the rooms.  Room was a little dated but clean and serviced every morning and good value for money.  Pool was a bonus and hot tub was used every night after our travels.  Didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on food selection or quality.  Starbucks, Taco Bell and Service
Manager Response: Hi Scott M,  Thank you for staying with us at the Four Points Anaheim. We love our 24 hour pool and we hope next time you can try our restaurant. We do hope ever in town again you would see us again.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Assistant General Manager

Summary: We arrived to this hotel after flying from Canada all day with a prepaid room through Expedia and was told by the staff at the front desk that unfortunately they did not have a room for us, the hotel was overbooked.  They did suggest they might be able to send us to a hotel in Irvine that was 13 miles away from Disneyland if they still had room but they had been sending people there all day so they were not sure if there was a room available.  As everyone knows the reason for staying at hotels by Disneyland is to walk to the park or take a shuttle from the hotel as this is why you are there. They would not pay for a cab to the other hotel and if there was room we would be paying for cabs back and forth for 3 days to Disneyland from Irvine. They also told us there was no
Manager Response: Hi Banhniuk2,  We are truly sorry about your experience here at the Four Points Anaheim. This was situation was truly our of control due to third party companies selling rooms which we did not have. We took action by contacting the third parties to try to have them help. They refused our requests and we took the initiative to relocate the reservations (at our expensive).   Please reach out to be directly at Skylar.Knowlton@fourpointsanaheim.com to discuss this further.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Operations Manager.

Summary: Walking distance to convention center, room was comfortable, quiet and beds were cozy. Many rooms had full balconies which are a total plus! Clean, large resort hotel. Diner like restaurants inside with good service.
Manager Response: Hi AnnieMF,  Thank you for stay with us! We love our beds too! We hope to see you again.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Operations Manager

Summary: Unfortunately, this property fell short of my expectations. First of all, the front desk associates don't know where the ice machines are, and all but 2 are either missing or inoperative. I was sent on a wild goose chase across the hotel several times on several floors before I found a working ice machine on the third floor. There was a plumbing issue and the entire lobby smelled like sewage on the first day. The card keys did not work to open the pool doors and we had to walk around to get in. On the second day we found a very large black insect in the bathroom, and were moved to another room. The manager on duty apologized and said they would take care of our parking charges for our trouble, but no offer of a bellman to help us move our luggage, so we did it ourselves..
Manager Response: Hi MRpolite01,  We are truly sorry to hear about your experience here. We have notified each respective department on the issues you received and will be ensuring that this experience is a one off. We hope that you come back and try us again.   Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton

Summary: Motel style rooms. From the photos, we thought we had a balcony but did not.  Lobby and restaurant were nice (good food). 10-15 min walk to Disney gates along the freeway. Cheap shuttle comes every 20 min if you prefer to get a ride.  Pool was small but nice and had a decent hot tub. Starbucks and convenience store right across the street (open early). They put out free coffee at 6 AM in the lobby with ‘to go’ cups. Buffet breakfast started at 7 AM so we never took advantage because we were on our way to the Park by then.
Manager Response: Hi GT,  Glad you had a good time at our hotel. Hopefully, you can enjoy the Buffet next time you are here.   Hope to see you again,

Summary: There is nothing wrong with the hotel itself, its just the location.  Its surrounded but very busy roads and the I5. On check-in I asked if the room was quiet, was told its 'very quiet' I was given 3rd floor right down the end of the corridor by I5.  It was awful, you could hear the traffic and it was as if I was sitting on the I5 - why the check-in guy lied I have no idea. So after trying for an hour to get to sleep -  we asked to move and was given a 2nd floor room overlooking the dunpsters.  It was a lot less noisy but not exactly quiet, you could hear the traffic from Ball and harbour and we had the bins being emptied at 6:30 am! I see no real reason to stay here, pay the extra $50 a night or so and stay further down Harbour. Its a shame as the rooms were ok, it was just too
Manager Response: Hi Gavvygavster1978,  We are sorry to hear about your experience here at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim. We would love to move the I5 but the city won't let us. We are working on getting upgrades to get the noise level down in the rooms and hope that you try us again.   Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Operations Manager

Summary: If you are like us, we don't spend much time in our room when visiting Disneyland Resort. The Four Points offers a comfortable room, cleanliness, plenty of towels for a very, very reasonable price.  The distance to the park entry is exactly 11 minute walk (but you do have to cross the exit ramp from the 5).  With our rate, breakfast was included. Basic fuel for the day, not a gourmet breakfast buffet by any means.  But the most impressive aspect of the hotel was its incredible staff. Could not have been more nice, more helpful and more generous with their time and attention. This is a new property for Starwood and everyone with a strong guest-facing role seems to have come from another Starwood property so the attention to detail is fantastic. It really made the difference with
Manager Response: Hi Drosen85,  Thank you for the review! We love our staff and they love the guests like yourself! We hope to see you again soon!.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Operations Manager

Summary: This was my second stay, the first after converting to Four Points. The renovation was impressive. More impressive was Mike at check-in...one of the best SPG check-ins in a very long time. This is the best value in the area if you know what to expect. It's a short walk to Disney and many restaurants. The hotel is built more like a motel with exterior access to rooms and exterior walkways to get around most of the property. The rooms feel like a nice motel withp small bathrooms, adjacent sink area, and floor mounted and controlled a/c. The TV, fixtures and furnishings are all new Four Points quality and the bed/bedding was new and comfortable. The on-site restaurant has good meals, reasonably priced. The pool is great. I don't like the heavy gates which give it a prison feel and
Manager Response: Hi Kauai-Biz-Traveler,  Thank you for the Great Review! We love our staff and Mike is great! We just gave him employee of the month! We hope to see you again soon!  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Operations Manager

Summary: We stayed for three nights while visiting Disney. Three hundred a night for a very run down, cheap motel. They have gates on all of the hallways that you need a key to get OUT of but can walk right in to from outside. I got locked in our hallway because I left the room without my key. Those gates are also very loud at night. It was a fifteen minute walk to the park across a highway. The white bedding was filthy. We would have told the staff about our stay but no one asked how anything was when we checked out. Just terrible.
Manager Response: Hi CateHB,  We are truly sorry about your experience here at the Four Points by Sheraton Anaheim. We have been working to fix the gate situation and will have everything fixed this month. We have also reached out to our laundry company about the bedding. This is not acceptable and will be corrected right away.   Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Operations Manager
