Summary: I stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton last year when it was still called the Menage. I had a wonderful time, thanks to my SPG points which got me upgraded to a suite. The room was fantastic- with plenty of living room space and a bathroom with a shower that had what seemed to be fifty jets.   Despite overlooking the pool, and being located near the 5 fwy (which was in view beyond the pool), the room itself was quiet. Outside the room, you could hear the people enjoying the pool as well as the traffic on the freeway, however, once inside your room with the door and window closed, it was very quiet (must be the soundproofing).  This time around, we were also promised a quiet room, but unfortunately due to the close proximity to Harbor Blvd (although the room did not overlook
Manager Response: Hi Love2travel2too,  Thank you for the review of the Four Points Anaheim. We have been working on training with all of our agents and staff to ensure our guests have a great stay. We are sorry about the noise and will be working to ensure that we find a way to limit it. We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Operation Manager

Summary: Blown away by the amazing customer service by Mike a front desk agent in the evening! He was so accommodating and truly went above and beyond! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Anaheim!
Manager Response: Hi Rachel D,  Thank you for letting us know about Mike. He got employee of the month! We hope to see you again!  Thank you,  Skylar Knowlton Operations Manager

Summary: The hotel is in a great location to access Disneyland and was excellent value considering it’s location.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  The food in the restaurant was really nice and great value - especially the happy hour cocktails and menu.  That being said we have stayed in other Four Points in SE Asia and the rooms didn’t quite hit the mark.  The bed was comfortable but the pillows were not - and there was no alternative options provided.  The room only had 2 coffee bags one for each of us (plus 1 decaf) 1 earl grey tea (which neither of us drink) and 1 decaf English breakfast tea.  As the restaurant doesn’t open until 7 (although they do have a grab and go bar that opens at 6:30) additional coffee and milk as well as normal breakfast tea might be a good
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a wonderful time on vacation and our room with king size bed was great! Beautifully updated and the staff were all very pleasant.  My only comments would be the lack of robes in the rooms (not a deal breaker but would be nice for the trek down to the pool/hot tub), and that one of the days housekeeping did not leave a full set of towels (again, not a deal breaker). Overall we had a wonderful experience and really enjoyed having the restaurant and cafe downstairs. They were convenient and saved us a few bucks rather than eating at the park. As a side note, we weren't sure if the hotel would be within walking distance of the park and it is, as long as you don't mind going over the freeway overpass. We did this a couple times but tended to take the $5 uber ride back and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nothing to write home about. It's ok. The food was ok and the rooms were ok. Three Disney shuttles in a row were full so we walked the 15 minutes to the park. The freeway noise was a bit obnoxious, but so constant it turned to white noise after a few hours.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I say nothing negative, however our first night was a disaster. It's close to the motorway so the noise levels are insane, however after mentioning this at reception the next morning they moved our entire party into new rooms without hesitation and it was perfect. They also arranged a tour at very short notice for us. The pool area is great- the bar tender we had was a bit grumpy but hey. Try and eat somewhere other than the restaurant on site as it's not the best but it's edible.  All in all, It's an average hotel with no real negatives so I'd recommend staying here.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great for Families or Tourists on a budget.  Not so great for Professional Travelers.
Summary: So I am lying in bed right now writing this review.   Why do you ask considering I have to be up in 4 hours for a meeting?  Because about every 30 minutes or so, someone drags luggage or a luggage vet across the tiles outside the door for an excruciatingly long, crackle ride down to their room ....and then inevitably back.     The layout is like a Motel 6 with rooms facing the outside of the building.   The hotel is currently undergoing a significant upgrade and is scheduled to transition to an a Four Points by Sheraton.   The lobby is bright and airy.  Best feature.  Inviting.  Modern.   Clean.    The rooms are relatively clean (I say relatively because there was a human hair in the shower that was very clearly not from me, but things happen), but dated but superficially
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this feedaback and we apologize for your current frustrations and would like to offer you a possible room move to a more quiet location of the hotel. Please feel free to reach. Me or the front desk to discuss immediately how we can turn this stay experience around. We take this feedback very serious and will be sharing this information with the needed teams.   Thank you. Nubia Doumerc Front office Manager 714 758 0900 Nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Perfect centralized location to all of the fun So Cal destinations--3 minutes from Disneyland parks.  The pool area was clean and had towels available, the hotel restaurant was delicious, the maid service was fantastic and the mattress/pillows were the most comfortable of any hotel I've ever stayed in.  When we reported an issue with our door, it was fixed immediately.  Yes, the bathroom was small, but it did the job.  The hotel is located right off the freeway, so traffic is loud, but we kept the fan running for white noise and we slept great. We'll definitely be staying here again on the next trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When we entered the hotel, we loved all the improvements. Lobby is nice and bright!  Mike checked us in and he was AMAZING!!!! As a Guest Services Manager at Resort on the central coast, I want all of my Front Desk Agents to be like Mike. Great energy, made us laugh, and overall GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! He also let us know we had a room with a view of the fireworks. That made our night so special. The beds were so comfy and we didn't mind it being 2 queens!   We did not get the name of the FD Agent who graciously gave us a 2pm late check out but she wished me a Happy Birthday and I very much appreciated that.  The only dislikes were not enough light in the bedroom, bellmen/valet gentlemen were not attentive enough or friendly and no bartender at the pool even though we had
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location by Disney can't be beat.  The buses stopped here often, but passes are not included in your stay.  It would have been helpful to know that before getting on the bus.  Room was very large, but bath and toilet was tiny.  Very hard to maneuver and it was not very clean.  Beds were comfortable, but really dark.  You could hear the noise from the highway so hard to sleep.  The pool and hot tub area was great for the kids. Excellent view of the Disney fireworks in the evening.    True Grit restaurant in hotel had great food.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for the size of the restrooms and the lack of cleanliness of your room. We have shared this feedback with the needed teams to take immediate action in ensuring our guest have a memorable stay.    Hotel Menage Management Team 714 758 0900

Summary Heading: Just on the side of the Freeway - Quite Noisy
Summary: The overall impression of the hotel is average. But the Hotel is right along the Freeway (Interstate 5) so there is quite a lot traffic noise. Hence you need to use earplugs in order to sleep. The cleanness is fine and pool area good. Breakfast is nothing special.  If you want to go for Disney Land, the location is good. But other than that, I would look else where. Hotel is generally over priced and I did expect more for the price we payed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback in regards to your stay. we apologize for the location of your room being noisy and not placing you in a better location of the hotel. We are very challenged by the freeway and the fact that the hotel is an outdoor hotel, however please email me in the future to ensure we have you in a quieter location. We do however have the pool view rooms and firework rooms facing the 5 freeway so that is typically the rooms under the highest demand.   Please speak to me directly should you have any other questions or concerns.  Hotel Management  Nubia Doumerc 714-758-0900 Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Poor quality and in need of renovation.
Summary: Okay, so I rarely complain about hotels because they have never been terrible and the staff are always helpful. Which is the only reason I gave this hotel three stars. Their staff were extremely helpful however, being a clean freak.. I cannot say how disappointed I was in the tub/shower. The tub was yellow and I wasn’t about to go in without something on my feet so I had to wear my flip flops. Beds were comfy though, we had a good sleep but the rooms really need an upgrade. Feels a little gloomy almost.  Was an o.k stay but probably wouldn’t stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how your experience was at our hotel. We would like to apologize for the bathroom not meeting your expectation. We have brought this to the design teams attention to try and make improvements as we finalize the details of the hotel renovation. Please call or email me if you would like to speak to me directly.   Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager 714-758-0900 nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com

Summary: ave this place a chance after reading the reviews. But I don't recommend it. Stayed 4 nights with 3 days at Disneyland. Maybe 15 min walk to the gates from front door of hotel along a busy street. Not too bad, but I don't care for this. It's loud and you really have to pay attention to what these drivers are doing when you cross in a cross walk. This hotel feels like it is in the middle of no-where, with loud traffic noise constantly. Nothing is around here for alternatives in eating or picking small items up...2 gas stations but that's pretty much it in this urban sprawl. Well there is a starbucks and taco bell if thats your desire near the gas station. The pool is 24 hrs which is nice I guess if you're coming back from the park late, but the hot tub was disgusting. It needs to
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, please call me directly to speak more on these concerns. we take feedback such as this very serious.  Nubia Doumerc 714-758-0900 Front Office Manager nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com

Summary: The Hotel changed names mid stay, so we joked we upgraded.  Our stay was for 5 nights, and we enjoyed it. I was a bit concerned by the traffic noise, when going up to our room - but once the door was shut, all was well. Our kingsize bed was so comfy, so were the pillows. I would have given 5 stars but the bathrooms are teeny. The staff were wonderful, everyone of them that we met were great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Sheraton 4 Points Now but Still Charming
Summary: Yep, the hotel is right by the 5 freeway so you get some freeway noise. It's an urban location in the middle of busy streets and a vacation destination right next to Disneyland. The noise is negligible really since they play tunes by the hotel so it's festive rather than noisy. On the upper balconies, you can see right into Disneyland and firework  viewing by the pool is fun if you come back to your room early. The pool area is great, rooms are all recently remodeled, you are right across the street from a gas station with mini-mart, Starbucks and Taco Bell. Other restaurants and McDonalds are right down Harbor Blvd. near the Disneyland entrance. You are one shuttle stop away from the parks and the hotel is served by two different shuttle routes. If you miss the shuttle, the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were here 5 years ago and had a great time. That is why we returned. Saw some not so good reviews on the way down but decided to give it a chance. Glad we did. Comfy beds, clean rooms. Only downfall was our room never got cleaned while we were here for 3 days. Mike at the front desk is awesome.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Menage while we visited the Disney Parks and Knott's Berry Farm in October of 2017.  We were very satisfied with our stay! We had a renovated room which was nice, clean, and comfortable. From our room we looked over the pool and could see the top of the Matterhorn and Mickey's Fun Wheel.  As a light sleeper, I was concerned about the noise from the nearby freeway, but it didn't bother me at all.  The 24 hour pool was a huge selling feature for us! The pool is big, a little on the chilly side, but really nice to wind down in after a long day exploring the parks. We ate at the onsite restaurant several times and were very happy with our meals! I certainly didn't expect such great selection and quality from a "hotel restaurant".  All the staff we had
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here and aside from a mixup (I selected a day short of the planned stay and the hotel was sold out for other days) I had a great experience.   This hotel is advertised within walking distance although we didn't walk it much as we were exhausted from walking miles and miles around the parks we always took a Lyft home for a few dollars as opposed to the buses which are a small fee as well.   The rooms are clean and reasonably sized nice enough if your just spending the night. The pool was clean and there were always plenty of towels. Starbucks is a quick walk across the street as well.   Parking is $14 additional per day so keep that in mind. The hotel is also being renovated and is going to be a Four Points Sheraton so keep that in mind when your looking to find the
Manager Response: Thank you for this valued feedback. We are currently in the middle of the hotel transition and we do apologize for the signage not being displayed on the exterior of our hotel due to the brand needing to finalize our hotel completion. We are legally unable to advertise the hotel as a Four Points by Sheraton and due apologize for the hotel being hard to locate. We are working on a possible sign that says coming soon, etc...  Best,   Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager 714-758-0900

Summary Heading: Loved every inch of this Hotel
Summary: My Husband and I firmly believe that you should never judge a place just because they have a few bad reviews and once again that proved to be true! We were looking for a hotel that had quick access to Disneyland, a restaurant inside and a pool to relax by and this hotel met every requirement! The hotel was going through a renovation to become a Four Seasons by Sheraton and we were lucky to stay in one of their newly updated rooms. They let us check in a few hours early and gave us a no cost extra late checkout since our flight was late at night. Our stay was 7 days since we were on our honeymoon.The room was gorgeous, the bed was comfortable and although our room faced the freeway we couldn't hear a thing. We had a small problem with our toilet that they fixed right away and on
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Menage for 7 nights and found it to be great value for money. It’s proximity to Disneyland is great - there is the ART Shuttle available (for a small fee) or you can walk there in about 10-15 mins.   The hotel is currently undergoing some renovation as it is changing names to Four Points by Sheraton - but there is no disruption to guests.  The breakfast was ok - not much variety, but it was hot and was good to fill your tummy before a day at Disneyland.  If you want a cheap, clean stay - this is it!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hair and yellow dingy (urine?) bed sheets
Summary: When I checked into the hotel, I was actually pleasantry surprised with the restaurant, cafe, and the pool area with a jacuzzi. However, although I was in a newly remodeled room on the SPG floor, the room was a completely different story. At night, as I got into bed, I was horrified to find hairs, black spots scattered on my bed sheet with yellow (urine?) stains. I first thought, I hope those black spots are bed bugs. They weren't moving so I was safe but I don't know what those were. I just slept on the bed without sheets. The sheets looked like they belonged at a Motel 6 (or whichever motel is the cheapest). At that very minute, I was about to check out of the hotel but I did notice the mattress was new (remember the room was recently remodeled) so I just took off the sheets
Manager Response: We would like to personally speak to you in regards to the condition of your room and the cleanliness issues you expressed in your feedback. Please call me or email me directly to take immediate actions with the needed teams. We take feedback such as this very serious and I am sorry to hear we failed you on providing you the memorable stay you deserve.  Checking in to a dirty room is completely unacceptable and not common practice at our hotel. We apologize for this experience.   Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager 714-758-0900 nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com

Summary: I was so impressed with the staff and room!  Everyone was so friendly, warm and helpful.  The room was clean and fresh smelling...and the bed was amazing!!!  So perfect and comfortable.  I will always stay here when I’m in town again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here in a Traditional King Room from October 13-17.  Not going to lie I was worried prior to arrival based on the some of the reviews on here. Don't be!! This place is amazing!   This is being turned into a Four Points; from what I could tell all renovations were done.  Lobby was impeccably clean, and Mike who helped us check in was fantastic! Very nice and helpful!  we were given a room on the first floor facing S. Harbor blvd.  The room was recently renovated and clean! The bed..seriously the best bed I have ever slept in, and the linens were so comfy. It was hard to get out of bed in the morning!  Very nice large tv, sitting area, and nice small closest area.  The only area that I would maybe subtract half a star is the shower. I was unable to get the water to be as
Manager Response: none

Summary: It's hard to fault the location of Hotel Ménage, which is an easy 10-15 minute walk from the Disneyland entrance. It also has a good pool area, pleasant lobby/entrance and the restaurant was okay too. We could see the Disneyland fireworks from the pool area.  But the rooms left a lot to be desired. Dark, old, run down and in need of some serious renovation. The air conditioning was a big unit on the floor of the room, and when it turned on, it sounded like a jet taking off. It was too warm in the room NOT to run the air con, meaning one had to wear ear plugs to sleep.  The shower control was pretty wrecked, meaning one practically needed a pair of pliers to turn the shower on, and it didn't turn off completely, meaning there was water constantly running from the bath tap.  The
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback in regards to your overall stay with us. We would like to apologize for failing to meet your expectations and have shred your feedback with the needed departments. The hotel is still redesigning details to the restroom and rooms which should be completed by the end of November.  The hotel is awaiting new towels and inventory to complete the transformation as well.   Waiting for towels is completely unacceptable and I have spoken to the Director of Housekeeping to ensure we are always able to supply our guest with any of their needs in a timely matter.   Please email me if you would like to speak in more detail.  Thank you for your loyalty during this transformation.  Best,   Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com 714-758-0900

Summary: The Hotel Menage meets all. The staff is super friendly and helpful and the room was more than awesome. 5 minutes walk to the Disneyland park. Highly recommended nd we will stay here again. Glass elevators are cool. We could see the fireworks from our room.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect Place to Stay for Anaheim Adventures!
Summary: I mean a 24 hr pool & jacuzzi/ ping pong table? Walking distance to Disney Resorts? On-site bar, restaurant & coffee shop?! How could this hotel not be the obvious choice?!  It's priced slightly below competitors, and has the same amenities. You can definitely tell the hotel is not a new development, like others in the area, but the renovations in the works are giving it what it needs!!   To top it all off, their customer service was above & beyond. We were helped by Carolynn, James & Hany at the front desk who all knew how to make us feel at home during our stay. In addition the breakfast & service from Bogar, Toni & Gilbert at Tru Grits was phenomenal!!!  If you're heading to Anaheim/ OC area, don't miss this hotel!   Tips: - book a pool view room for firework views (check
Manager Response: none

Summary: This property is in mid transformation to becoming a four points. They have done a nice job of updating the property however the walls and floors have little to no sound barrier. The highway was not a big issue, however the couple next door and thier child were abnormally noisy even during the day.
Manager Response: Hi Kevin D,  We are truly sorry about the guests next door. We hope that you consider us in the future and will look for a quite area next time you stay.   Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton

Summary: The hotel itself was very clean however very dated & has seen better days. We were only there for two nights & that was enough. Great place to see the Fire Works, but very noisy in the mornings, no good if you need to sleep in. Reception staff were very friendly accomodating & helpful. The Restuarant & Bar was very good & staff very friendly & helpful. We believe that the Hotel is being updated and not before time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your valued feedback. We are excited to complete renovations and provide the quality hotel our guest deserve. We apologize for the overall stay experience being impacted by our transformation and hope you will see us again in the future once we are a completed hotel.   Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager 714 758 0900

Summary: We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to Disney.  We also saw that it was transitioning to a Four Points by Sheraton so we had high hopes.  When we arrived we were asked it we would like to "self park" or valet.  Let's be honest, it's impossible to self park because of the location of the self park lots so you really have to valet or hike quite a ways or checkin and unload then go park and hike back.  We were told our room had an excellent view of the fireworks.  Which was true but it was basically on the freeway.  Had I known, I would not have agreed to that location.  The front desk clerk was pleasant and helpful at check-in.  The area around the elevator was under construction so at any given time we had to take the stairs.  Being on the 4th floor that wasn't really
Manager Response: Hi Drherri2017,  I am truly sorry about your stay here at the Hotel Menage. We still in transition and we still have a lot of growing to due. I have talked with housekeeping and Engineering departments to discuss this further/train. We hope that after the transition you would consider coming back to the hotel.   Thank you, Skylar L Knowlton Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Best place to watch Disneyland Fireworks, including Disneyland.
Summary: The Hotel Manage (now Four Points) is a very nice party atmosphere hotel.  The lobby is L-shaped around the swimming pool giving it an indoor-outdoor feel, with rock'n'roll music playing.  The hotel centers around the pool area which has a very fun poolside bar.  Kudos to Raylene  our pool bar tender who goes out of her way to be nice and serve guests. The pool and Jacuzzi are open 24 hours a day!     There is also a bar inside at the restaurant.  All rooms open to the outside, keeping with the outdoor feel of the hotel.  This is an older hotel that has been upgraded.  It is the last shuttle stop before Disneyland (Unless you have a large family the shuttle is worth it to avoid Disney   Parking fees.)  This is not a place you want to go for peace and quiet.  The I-5 freeway is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Better than I thought it would be
Summary: We came on this site after booking our Disneyland vacation and we're a little worried about the reviews we read. I have to say the hotel is way better than a lot of people were posting it was. The rooms were nicely renovated and clean. The hotel staff were all friendly. There was a lot of freeway noise but I had read that and brought earplugs. There is an amazing view of the Disneyland fireworks from the pool area. I will say that they do need to offer more at the grab and go station. I would have liked to purchase a muffin from there rather than paying for the full breakfast buffet in the restaurant. Over all I would recommend this hotel. It is close to Disneyland and a Starbucks.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ruined expensive Disney trip with friends
Summary: Out of control wedding on the other side of the wall of our room and hotel refused to move us out of disgusting room party at the pool there was yelling at 3 o'clock in the morning offered me free valet parking even though I had no car didn't sleep front desk manager was unapologetic and did nothing for us bathroom was dirty and torn up this was nothing more than a motel and for this they charged $200 a night. Too tired to use our Disney tickets
Manager Response: Medanichangs,  I am truly sorry about your experience here at the Hotel. I have discussed this with the Sales department, Front Office Manager, and Housekeeping Manager.   Thank you,  Skylar l Knowlton

Summary: I got a reasonably good deal toward the end of renovations and I read all the bad reviews so I was mentally prepared for any shortcomings.  However my 2 day stay with my party of 4 had a great experience. The lobby was clean and never once experienced any bad customer service. They were accommodating and friendly. I was assigned the corner room near the freeway on floor 2.  While generally considered a "bad room" by most standards, the noise really didn't bother us.   The beds were comfortable and clean. The room was spacious for our stuff and lots of space on top of the desk.  Didn't use the pool but looked nice when I walked past it. The hotel is a quick walk to Disneyland which was nice, or easy uber ride of you don't want to walk.  I'd stay here again if the price is right!
Manager Response: none

Summary: For its class and price, this hotel isn't bad by any means, and I'd be happy to stay here again for the right price - but it's not spectacular, and for one that's transformed as a Four Points location, it probably doesn't meet my expectations of the brand. My room was comfortable & clean, but even with the renovations, it feels run down, and that especially extends to the exterior corridors. The pool & gym are nice amenities, and it's a comfortable walking distance to Disneyland, but there are many hotels surrounding it (with even closer locations to Disneyland) that are at the same price point, and also offer X-factors of some kind, so it's hard to choose this hotel as a first choice for Anaheim. Regardless, it's a good value hotel, and my stay was pleasant - but my stay would
Manager Response: Hi Hello-PB,  We are still in the process of renovating (including the corridors). We are updating the gym as well and look forward to best brews and BBQ (free local beer and BBQ). We hope to see you again.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton

Summary: The hotel is more like two stars even after renovations. Be careful of over charges. They still charged me for 3 day self parking even after I confirmed we didn't have a car at checkout. Of course, I didn't get a receipt for the charges. Lucky I checked my credit card account and found out while we were still travelling in the U.S.. I rang up and they refunded the charges.
Manager Response: Hi Elaine L,  Sorry about your experience here. We never want to overcharge anyone and glad we could fix the issue. Hope you had a safe trip home.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton

Summary: Booking for a trusted brand (hotel ménage) and from great past experiences to this new "Four points by Sheraton" was not only a disappointment but ensuring I will not stay at this hotel again. With SO many better options (the Clarion for less and Hilton for a little more) I truly believe that people will be disappointed staying here. During our stay for ONLY 4 nights and with no prior warning we encountered no running water throughout the hotel for 5+ hours (nice off the plane shower- NOPE) we had to add a night to our stay and after the first night our keys stopped working, the main elevator was shut down one afternoon and there were many broken gates (either the handles or key card readers) made it stairs or nothing, the power blew out in our room and we only had lights and
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We apologize we failed to meet your expectations and would like to speak directly to you in more detail to ensure we take immediate corrective actions.  Please contact me as we look forward in making things right.  Nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com 714 758 0900 Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: To say this place was just remodeled is pathetic!
Summary: To say this place was just remodeled is pathetic! The Motel (not Hotel) is disgusting! We thought we would give it a chance with the remodeled rooms and that was our first mistake. When we first got to our room, someone had already slept in the bed. I went down to the front desk and asked for another room. I was told they were booked solid. I showed him the pictures (Attached) and all of the sudden he found another room with 2 queens... Imagine that! Then he said we could move back into a room with a king bed the next day. While we were out the next day, they (the hotel staff) went into the room and grabbed all our personal Items including my wife's PURSE and took them to the new room without our permission! We left her wallet in the safe, so we had to get security to escort us
Manager Response: Brett1776,   We appreciate your feedback in regards to your stay and apologize for having failed to provide you a great stay experience.  We have had a lot of unfortunate renovation emergencies that have challenged some guest stay experiences such as yours. We have shared this information with the needed teams, and have addressed moving anyone's belongings without their consent. What you experienced is not common practice and We to make it up to you once the hotel is fully renovated and not under any construction that would impact your room or stay.   Thank you for your loyalty in staying with us during this trying time.   Best,  Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager  Hotel Menage soon to be Four Points 714-758-0900

Summary: We tried to check into our room that we reserved over the phone with the hotel directly. When checking in our card was being declined so we walked out to call company and when we came back the girl said that since we walked out she could no longer assist us. So instead of getting to sleep, we were forced to drive home 6 hours, Stopping in random neighborhoods to sleep. This hotel could have done a lot more to help us, we offered to pay cash, and somehow at 2:30 am they " no longer had our room available" we were gone for about 15 mins. This girl was very short with us, not willing to help us figure anything out. Definitely won't be supporting this hotel again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. I am very sorry you experienced such a thing with the front office team. Please email or call me to discuss what happened so that I can make this experience right.  Nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage 714-758-0900 Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel because we got a really good deal through Get Away Today. It is a 10 minute walk from Disneyland. Not a bad walk, but you do have to walk along a busy street. It also has the on and off ramps for the freeway that you have to cross. We just stopped and waited and didn't have any problems with cars stopping to let us cross. There is also a shuttle service available that we took one day and it is nice. Only downside to that was at the end of the day the shuttle gets full and you have to stand (possibly) and it took 30 min to get to our hotel. The hotel itself was not bad. It is still undergoing renovations, which we knew. The room had really comfy beds and pillows, nice closet space and a fridge. There are these weird gates you have to go through to get into
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with our hotel during our transformation.  We have  made the proper departments aware of your concerns and apologize for the issues with hot water. I have had a specialist check on the boilers to ensure this is not impacting our guest and everything has been taken care of.   We do hope we will see you again soon and hope you can experience the hotel in its entirety once it converts to Four Points by Sheraton. Nov. 2017.  Nubia Doumerc 714-758-0900 Front Office Manger

Summary Heading: Great feel, love the decor. Great restaurant.
Summary: Food is good, staff is great, rooms are nice. Pool is great... love the palm trees and the music playing, more of a couple and adult environment. Some freeway noise but not too bad. lots of entrances to the hotel no matter where you park.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Bidding Farewell to Hotel Ménage as we welcome Four Points by Sheraton
Summary: Hotel Ménage is undergoing its final stages of renovation as it takes on a new brand, Four Points by Sheraton, set to launch by the end of September 2017. The hotel is less than 5 minutes away from the main gates of Disneyland and about he same amount of time if you take the local ART shuttles ($5 for a day pass). They have valet parking for $16, operated by LAZ and self parking for $14. Once you enter the hotel, you'll notice their new restaurant Tru Grit to the right, which serves 3 meal services and happy hour. The hotel has a modest and inviting swimming pool, complete with a tiki bar and jacuzzi with ample seating for sunbathers. There is a mini deli located in the lobby that appears to be opening within the next few days. It has juices, desserts and caffeine of sorts, and
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback we are very excited about our transition in becoming a Four Points by Sheraton by the end of September 2017 and hope to see you agian soon once the hotel has met all of the brand standards.  Hotel Management

Summary: We only stayed for one night but the relaxing atmosphere and quiet pool area were exactly what we needed in the middle of our week long vacation in California. The pool area is amazing and I could imagine it being a very fun place to host a small party or get together with other guests to have some drinks at the bar. We ate a pizza from the restaurant which was okay but we also had breakfast in the morning which was a complete game changer. It was really good and it was exactly what we needed as we were running out the door. Special thank you to Ashley, the Front Desk Agent, who checked us in and out (must have been a long 2 days). Cheers.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful rating and sharing your feedback with us. It is guest like yourself that makes it possible to provide excellent customer service day in and day out and hope to see you again soon once the hotel is completed in 2017.  Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Excellent location, recently refurbished rooms with friendly staffs
Summary: Close to Disneyland. Nicely refurbished rooms with good insulation so highway noises are barely detectable inside your rooms.  Nice restaurant on site with fusion food and a well stocked bar.  Good quality bed dings and new linens due to recent upgrade to a Fourpoint.  Convenient onsite parking.  Friendly staffs.  Clean pool area with a well maintained pool but noisy due to adjacency to the hihyway.  Good values for money.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how your stay experience was. We do have a unique amenity in the 24 hour pool and hot tub facility for our guest to relax in after a long day at the parks. The pool area is patrolled nightly by security to ensure noise level is kept at a minimum during after hours.  We hope to serve you again once we complete our renovation in September 2017 and meet all of the Four Points brand standards.   Hotel Management.

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights with a 4 year old and 1 year old. Upon arrival I was worried about our kids, as we had problems with our previous stays accommodation. But the hotel staff were lovely. The hotel was full of children and families so we weren't out of place at all. Hotel is $6 uber away. 2 blocks walk, maybe 10-15 mins walk. Dated, but value for money.
Manager Response: Thank you for the 4 star rating and letting us know how your stay was with us. We are currently working on a kid zone in our lobby area for families to enjoy during their stay. Our 24 hour pool and hot tub is also the only one in all of Anaheim.   We appreciate you recognizing how kid friendly we are and hope to see you again soon once we officially open as a Four Points by Sheraton.   Nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com- Front Office Manager 714-758-0900

Summary Heading: This is actually a motel, with a nice pool
Summary: We went when it was under construction so we expected it to be a little chaotic, but it was pretty bad and weird. It's actually a motel, with out-facing doors and hallways. Inside, the facilities aren't much nicer - the paint on the walls is chipping off, none of the amenities matched (it honestly looked like the amenities were taken as leftovers from other hotels, where the shampoo was one type, the conditioner from another hotel brand, etc.), even the coffee cups and lids in the room didn't fit together. Because the rooms are outward facing, they are very loud - you hear all the cars, ambulances, etc. Not recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to express your concerns with our hotel as we transition in becoming a Four Points by Sheraton hotel.  I wanted to personally apologize for failing to meet your expectation on many levels and wanted to speak to you directly to take immediate action with the needed departments. I will be sharing this feedback with the needed teams and assure you that we will meet the brand standards once the hotel is fully renovated. The hotel does have outdoor corridors and sound proof windows to help with noise. The amenities are also in transition and will be completely changing to meet brand standards once we officially convert to a Starwood hotel. Please reach out to me at your convenience.  I look forward to speaking with you to make things right and address all your concerns.  Best,   Nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com 714-758-0900

Summary Heading: A smallish hotel that doesn't know it
Summary: I'm giving this place five stars, not because its a 5-star hotel, but because it acts like it.  I only needed a local place at a good price point to rest before I continued my travels.  I was greeted warmly by the valet, the front desk and the wait staff.  It was late, but everyone was upbeat and very friendly.  I had a room on the pool side of the hotel.  I heard some traffic noise, but not unlike home.  It was quiet in the hallways.  The pool was lit very nicely at night and attracted a lot of people sitting at the pool-side bar with a number of families enjoying the pool.  This hotel is near the stadium and the Honda Center, close to Hwy 5 and Hwy 57 & 91.    In the restaurant, I found generous portions and the food was decent.  I ordered the French Dip sandwich, which was
Manager Response: Mishywishy2016,   Thank you for sharing your review and rating us a 5 star. I am ecstatic to hear that our staff was the difference between us being just another hotel by Disneyland. We value our guest feedback and appreciate you sharing the details of your stay. We are very excited to meet brand standards once the hotel is completed by the end of September 2017.  The renovation has been a beautiful challenge for our teams, but reviews like yours make the transition worth every second we smile and greet our guest to ensure we deliver exceptional customer service.   I will be sharing this review with our staff and hope to see you back with us soon.  Best,   Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager.

Summary Heading: The wonderful staff made my stay
Summary: The staff were wonderful and they made me feel right at home. Geoffrey at the front desk; Kevin, Ramiro, and Jorge at the restaurants/patio area; Manuel with engineering were all very welcoming, Thank you!
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful feedback of how your stay experience was with us and I am so happy to hear you mention our team members by name. i will be sharing this review with them directly and hope to see you back with us soon once we officially convert to becoming a Four Points by Sheraton in September 2017.  Hotel Management

Summary: We stayed here last week.  There are signs in the hotel stating it is changing to a Four Point Sheraton hotel.  The staff were all very nice.  There were a lot of remodeling in the lobby, but the rooms were fine.  The pool is nice, if you have time to go there.  There is a hot tub as well. There is a bar which closed at midnight when we stayed.  The rooms were fine and there is a fridge in the room.  The best thing is that Disneyland is only a 16 minute walk from the hotel front door to the entrance of Disney.  There is a McDonald's on the way, if you want breakfast first, or dinner afterwards.  But it is very busy, because everyone goes there.  There is a Panera bread on the way also.  There is a Gas station with a mini mart across the street.  The location is good as it is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stay away - horrid place. Sheraton Four Points formerly Hotel Menage
Summary: This hotel was in the final stages of its remodel and rebranding as a Sheraton Four Points. The interior signage said Sheraton. The room amenities said Sheraton.   The employees were in Sheraton uniforms.  Signs indicated it would complete in August 2017, the same month I was there.  The room I was in had already been remodeled. I verified this 3x with front desk staff.  This was a horrible room. The 'new' furniture was broken, closet door would not close, the desks were scuffed and scratched. Of the two beds one had a sag so severe you could not lay flat in it without rolling to the floor. The tiles in the shower were moldy and ready to fall off.  The faucet was dirty when I checked in and was never wiped down while I was there.  The front desk staff came across as uninterested
Manager Response: Good day,  We are truly sorry that we did not live up to your expectations. We are still in transition to because the Four Points with new uniforms coming later next month. We will not be converting this month and have a few projects left from finishing the lobby, elevators, to having contractors finish one time around the hotel with issues that we have found. We will be receiving name tags once Marriott has approved every room. This looks like it may be a month or so before this process is finished. We are still working on training for Housekeeping. We hope that after transition we will be able to exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Management

Summary: We stayed at the Menage for 4 nights at the beginning of August. Even though it wasn't for long we had a great time. The hotel is in the process of being upgraded so there is evidence of building work but it didn't affect us at all. Our room was one of the newly refurbished ones so everything was like new. Super comfy beds and a big flat screen tv plus a nice armchair. We were room only so can't comment on the food. Every staff member we encountered was very kind and helpful. The pool was awesome as well. A nice size and there's even a small hot tub type pool which is lovely. Even though the hotel is near busy roads this could not be heard from the pool area. Our room was very clean and tidy with a nice view. Plus we had the added bonus of getting a free fireworks display from
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate you letting everyone know that you were pleased with our hotel despite the current transformation. It is guest feedback like yours that allows us to continue to provide exceptional service. We hope to see you in the near future once we are a completed, Four Points by Sheraton.  Best,  Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: WORST HOTEL IVE EVER STAYED AT
Summary: I was brought to your hotel because our company convention is held at the Anaheim Convention Center with well over 20K in attendance. My husband reside in Crownsville, Maryland. ACROSS the country ! We travel regularly, I even booked a few extra days so we could ENJOY the west coast since this was our first visit. So we were up early arrived at your hotel at 11:30, at that time I wasn't greeted, I was told that there was no vacantly. I said no worries I have made my reservation well over a month in advance, requesting a King size bed, We were told that our room wasn't yet ready and to sit out by the pool "it won't be long" mind you we came from the airport with well over $60 in food so I ask " Can I put my food in the fridge" you know to keep it COLD !! No Miss we don't have a
Manager Response: Good Day,  We are sorry about your experience here at the Hotel Menage. We have emailed you directly and would like for you to email us back.  Thank you,  Management Team

Summary: We have annual passes to Disneyland so we like to try out different hotels each time we come down to find the right one that fits all of our needs. Hotel Menage exceeded our expectations. The rooms were nice and clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the food at the hotel restaurant was very good. The pool is open 24 hours and they have happy hour so you can relax in the pool for a couple hours after a long day at Disneyland. Overall one of our best experiences at a hotel near Disneyland. Going back in October and will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and we appreciate you letting everyone know that you were pleased with our hotel despite the current transformation. It is guest feedback like yours that allows us to continue to provide exceptional service.   Best,   Management Team.

Summary: I heard a lot of good things about this hotel so I was very excited to check in and go to Disneyland for the week. We checked in on a Monday evening around 8pm after a  whole day of hanging out in San Diego so we were pretty tired. The lady who checked us in was very nice and asked us if a Queen room was okay because they ran out of King rooms we booked with. We were okay with it as a bed and shower were all we really wanted for the week. We noticed that parking where our room was was really limited and the elevator by the pool was creeky, smelly, and slow.   Tuesday went by fine but on Wednesday, when we came back later after a 15 hour day in Disneyland, we find out that they never cleaned our room?? Weird but I guess it happens. The next day we called to let them know that our
Manager Response: Andrew F,   Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay. Please email me directly so that we can talk in more detail exactly what happened with our staff and your overall hotel experience.   We take your feedback very serious and look forward to hearing from you to make things right.  Best,  Nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com Front Office Manager-Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Adjust your expectations, everything else is fine.
Summary: After reading the reviews, I need to adjust my expectations to fairly review this property, and I hope you will too. What I can tell you: 1. The location can't be beat. It's within walking distance to Disneyland and easy access to highways. 2. The hotel is renovating its public spaces. The lobby is less than grand, and there is only one elevator working. It's rebranding from Hotel Menage to Four Points. I was there during the weekend, and I didn't hear any renovation noises. 3. The front desk people are some of the most competent and nicest people in the hotel industry, given the circumstances they are given. 4. The rate is pretty reasonable for a property near Disney and under renovation.  What they could work on: 1. The hallways face outwards (either to inner courtyard or
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and letting us know in great detail about your stay. We are excited about the grand opening of our new, Four Points by Sheraton hotel officially opening at the end of September.   Should you return we are happy to unveil a brand new lobby, with a grab and go latte area, kid zone, and lounge space with unlimited wifi access.   We look forward to seeing you in the near future.  Best,   Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Another visit to a hidden gem
Summary: We stayed here in 2012, and we stayed again because of that experience. Very modern a boutique style hotel. Nice rooms, clean, and fun nightlife. A trolley stop for Disneyland is on the edge of the parking lot. Very convenient to get on and enjoy the Mouse. A romantic hotel but also kid friendly. Often cheaper than other mainstream hotel chains. You can purchase Park tickets in the lobby and other fun adventures are bookable here too.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know you had a great stay and enjoy the location of our hotel. We certainly have the ONLY 24 hour pool and hot tub in ANAHEIM to go along with the amazing fireworks directly over the pool from Disneyland.  We agree that we are a hidden gem and hope to see you again in the near future once we  convert officially to become a Four Points by Sheraton by the end of September 2017.  Best,   Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager

Summary: The hotel is handy to Disney land ,but is old and over used ,Beds were ok and the restaurant  True grit did good food ,,Only there two nights and happy to leave ,,There is alot of renovations taking place so might be nicer when finished . Alot of road traffic noise ,but had a good car park
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know your hotel experience. We take feedback like yours very serious and hope that you will return to our hotel once we are a fully completed hotel and convert to a Four Points by Sheraton.   We currently have opened most of our renovated lobby and are in the final stages of completion. We have addressed all the proper departments to let them know your concerns and be sure we are making the needed improvements to meet the brand standards and guest needs.   Please email me directly if you have any further questions in regards to your stay and would like to speak in more detail.  Best,   Management Team

Summary: Clean tiny room walking distance from Disneyland (great place to see the Disneyland fireworks from)   Staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was great. Kids loved the pool. Highly recommended for Disneyland visitors
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are excited to invite you back to our hotel once we officially convert to a Four Points by Sheraton, and offer to your kids a KID ZONE and grab and go area in our renovated lobby. The hotel is set to be completed by the end of September 2017.  Best,   Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager

Summary: Stayed here with extended family in 2014 and had a great experience. And the same can be said for this visit. It was awesome to see Frank the Bar Manager was still there and remembered us almost immediately which is amazing for such a busy Hotel in Disney Town.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had booked this hotel several months in advance.  When we got there they couldn't find our reservation despite the fact I had the hotel booking with me.  Our room wasn't ready when we got there - but we did get there early, so that is understandable.  They said they would text when the room was ready - which they never did.  The hote is currently undergoing renovation to become a Four Points by Sheraton. Our room was renovated - but not well. The toilet handle was loose and ran constantly unless you positioned it just right.  Other bathroom fixtures were also loose.  Rather than mini toiletries they had dispensers in the shower with shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel - but the dispensers didn't work.  They gave us the minimum amount of towels each day - 2 for 2 people. The
Manager Response: Andrea W.,   Thank you for taking the time to let us know how your stay went. We apologize for failing you in your overall experience with your room and hotel. We have noted your concerns with the needed departments to be sure we make the immediate needed changes to provide the stay our guest deserve.  Please email me directly if you would like to discuss in more detail concerns with your stay.   We do hope you will allow us to deliver on all levels in the future once we fully complete our hotel at the end of September and convert  to a, Four Points by Sheraton.  Best,   Management  Team

Summary: The rooms have been updated and nice. The pool area is open 24 hours (huge plus)and does have a very nice outdoor bar area to sit and watch the Disney fireworks (the view of the firework show is amazing). The staff are kind and helpful. I am only giving this property 3 stars because, the shuttle to the Disney park is an extra fee or you walk, and the property is very much in the middle of a renovation which, their website does advise. Our overall stay was nice, peaceful and joyful.
Manager Response: Dear kellilehr,   Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Hotel Ménage.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for not having a complimentary shuttle service to Disneyland. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   Sincerely, james chu Front Office Supervisor Hotel Menage soon to be Four Points by Sheraton james.chu@hotelmenage.com 714-758-0900

Summary: In the middle of a renovation to a full Four Points by Sheraton.  Once completed will be far better.  The rooms are now mostly renovated and they are nice. Comfortable.  Good size.   The pool area looks good except it's literally on the side of the highway.  The hotel location is great for Disney.  Walkable.   Recommend.
Manager Response: Dear Gma0917,   Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Hotel Ménage with us.   I am very sorry our current appearance was not what you had anticipated. We strive to maintain the highest standards, not only in service, but also with regards to maintaining the overall look and feel of the hotel. Unfortunately, this sometimes requires essential renovations in our guest areas.  As you noticed, we are currently undergoing a major renovation of our entire property. This is sure to provide a highly functional space and stylish décor that meet the modern needs of our valued guests, like you.   Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your past stay, I hope you will consider Hotel Ménage on your next visit to Anaheim so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.   Sincerely, james chu Front Office Supervisor Hotel Menage soon to be Four Points by Sheraton james.chu@hotelmenage.com 714-758-0900

Summary Heading: Definitely Not What I'd Call a 3 Star Hotel
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with family because we booked last minute and this appeared to be the best hotel available that was still reasonably priced. Both nights we had a hard time sleeping due to the noise. We had rooms near the front of the hotel facing the street and we could hear every large truck and bus that went by from our 4th floor hotel rooms. The wifi was so slow it was essentially not functional. On our 2nd day my fiance went back to the room to shower and his key got de-magnetized. It took him over half an hour to get a new one from the front desk because they were so slow. After his shower he realized that the maid had taken all the towels from the room except for single hand towel and face towel. He tried to call housekeeping for more but couldn't reach
Manager Response: Dear dorkeycorky,   Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Hotel Ménage.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for noise coming from the bus, the housekeeping staff not replenishing your towels, and you not enjoying the complimentary breakfast and restaurant service. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   Sincerely, james chu Front Office Supervisor Hotel Menage soon to be Four Points by Sheraton james.chu@hotelmenage.com 714-758-0900

Summary Heading: Wifi not good, Water spots all over car
Summary: The hotel rooms are a little outdated but clean and comfortable.  The wifi is very spotty and the valet parked my car near sprinklers(even though I have had this happen before and asked him to be careful) leaving hard water spots all over my car.  Cost me $100 to have it waxed to remove them.
Manager Response: Dear Calb797,   Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Hotel Ménage.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for your car have hard water spots. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   Sincerely, james chu Front Office Supervisor Hotel Menage soon to be Four Points by Sheraton james.chu@hotelmenage.com 714-758-0900

Summary Heading: Didn't love it, didn't hate it
Summary: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Menage July 2017 and whilst it wasn't terrible, we didn't overly love it and we probably wouldn't stay there again.  It did have a few perks, the pool area was lovely the drinks were fairly cheap, and it was a short walk to Disneyland. We had, what I am assuming was a newly updated room and for a new room I was quite underwhelmed. There was flaky paint coming off the roof in the bathroom, the drain in the bath was rusty and looked dirty, just not what I expected from a newly renovated room. We paid for a pool-view room and I'm not sure what happened there but we were put in a room facing a car park and a freeway. I'm not sure if there was a difference in price but overlooking the pool would have been preferable.  There was a fridge, would have
Manager Response: Dear Margot M,   Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Hotel Ménage.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the AC and traffic noise, your refrigerator being too cold, and the shower being way too small. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   Sincerely, james chu Front Office Supervisor Hotel Menage soon to be Four Points by Sheraton james.chu@hotelmenage.com 714-758-0900

Summary Heading: Saddest Place on Earth! Do not book!!
Summary: SADDEST PLACE ON EARTH!! I've never bother writing any kinds of reviews on google before but this one is a must. We booked with this hotel for our trip to DISNEYLAND, and on our way their with two small children we got a called from the hotel manager, saying that they have no room for us and that there's no point of coming by. I'm thinking can they do this to us!! We booked with you guys and gotten a confirmation ! The least they can do is find us another hotel if they were to give our room away but no. They just sent us off like that. We had to spend the night in the car with two small children!! Never book this hotel people. I wish I could give them no stars what so ever if there was that option!.
Manager Response: Dear Eileen N,   Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Hotel Ménage.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the hotel not having a room available for you and your family. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.   Sincerely, james chu Front Office Supervisor Hotel Menage soon to be Four Points by Sheraton james.chu@hotelmenage.com 714-758-0900

Summary: My husband and I stayed here during our couples trip . They were passing around a notice abou the elevators being out of service at 930pm and the employee walked into our room no knock or notice just walked in while my husband and I were trying to be intimate . According to the manager at this hotel it's okay for employees to violate guest privacy and it's ok for them to enter your room with no notice for it even if you or your family is naked or anything. I felt very violated and would never stay here again to me it's the worst 400 dollars I've ever spent on a hotel . Manager was rude and obviously no common sense . I suggest no one stay here at all it was the worst feeling in the world to hear a manger say that it's okay for their employee to see their guests naked or being
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to explain your experience in staying with us. We apologize for having fallen short in several area's and have reached out to the departments needed to ensure we are taking the needed steps to improve our overall guest experience.   I assure you that we take pride in delivering exceptional service and apologize for making you feel your privacy was violated. At no moment is entering a room without proper protocol acceptable. Should a guest have a do not disturb sign on the door we are unable to disturb our guest unless there is an emergency situation.  We will use this as a teachable moment going forward to ensure the safety of our guest first and foremost.  Please email directly if you have more you would like to discuss in regards to your stay.  Best,  Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com 714-758-0900

Summary: We stayed for 2 days on "Deluxe Room, 2 Queen Beds."  I can tell it was the nosiest hotel I've ever stayed in.  The room was fine, but it was the closest room to the elevator on the 5th.  Every time people get out and in, we heard loud bells, steps, and chatting even at 1AM.  Their refrigerator has been buzzing all the time because of being too old I guess.  So we heard noise from the SINGLE windows and the refrigerator for 24 hours, and of course, we couldn't sleep at night. I saw a man smoking in the pool just next to children.   I booked Menage after reading reviews and had read they answered to contact them about problems while customers in there. But I booked here over 2 months ago and knew all were booked for 4th of July weekends. I know they can't change our room. I won't
Manager Response: Tkml13,     Thank you for taking the time to explain your experience in staying with us. We apologize for having fallen short in several area's and have reached out to the departments needed to ensure we are taking the needed steps to improve our overall guest experience.   I assure you that we take pride in delivering exceptional service and apologize for not having offered you a room move to place you in a better location of our hotel.  Please email directly if you have more you would like to discuss in regards to your stay.  Best,  Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com 714-758-0900

Summary Heading: Amazing experience! Best Hotel from our trip on the west coast
Summary: Just back from a road trip on the west coast. We chose to stay in Anaheim as it was a great location and close to a lot of activities. We arrived quite late at night and nothing seemed like too much trouble. Our room was spacious and had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in,I think it could be because the pillows were awesome. The room also had a fridge which is a blessing when on holidays. Reception were always able to advise on the best places to go and help book you on tours. I think it was Mike he was always more than willing to help out particularly when we would always ask for the bats for the pin pong table. Even though the hotel is currently under renovations you would never know, the hotel is amazing and our room was modern and so large. I would definitely
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is fantastic. Our room was beautiful, the beds were so super comfy it was hard to get up in the morning. Our room was right outside the elevator on the 2nd floor next to the fitness center. That plus the renovation going on might make you think our stay was less than serene. But they have great walls because it was peaceful and restful. The staff was super friendly and responsive when we needed assistance. The food in the restaurant was fantastic and we would eat there before heading to the park each day. The bar and pool area are clean, comfortable, and relaxing. As an added bonus, you can see the fireworks perfectly from the patio, nestled in your comfy lounge chair, with no crowds. I am so impressed with this property and I won't stay anywhere else next time we are
Manager Response: none

Summary: Absolutely lovely villa even nicer than expected and our expectations were high after looking at the photos!! Lovely host that answered all our questions! The 10 of us stayed there the eve before Disney and adults and children all lived it equally!! Thank you so much Susan!! Lara xxx
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I was happy with this hotel
Summary: I stayed in this hotel for a week while attending a convention and visiting Disneyland.  As others have mentioned, the view of the fireworks is unbeatable (especially when compared with watching them at the park itself, where you have to fight with crowds of people to get a good view).    Unfortunately.  You don't get to hear the soundtrack or see the castle projection images, so you do lose a lot of the effect of the firework show.  They're still impressive, nonetheless.    Some reviews have laser-focused on the minor chips and scrapes in the building.  I, personally, didn't find the hotel to be "dirty" at all.  I thought it was kept up quite nicely.  Yes, it's clear that this hotel is quite old and some of the fixtures are a bit dated.  But, it's nothing that should stop you
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived on Sunday afternoon at around 2pm.  We checked in right away and were in our room in minutes.  The room was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable.  We noticed that the room was lacking wash clothes and hand towels.  We called the front desk and within 5 minutes we had wash clothes and hand towels.  The staff was excellent.   The happy hour by the pool was awesome from 3pm to 7pm.  The happy hour menu and drinks were second to none.  The pool is beautiful and inviting.  All this with Disneyland just a 15 minute walk away.  There is an Anaheim bus that stops in front of the hotel if you prefer that.  Checking out was also a breeze.  Watch out for the 15.00 per person breakfast!  The breakfast was good, but not that good.   Overall this is an excellent place to stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here for 14 nights. Business and pleasure.  This is by no mean a 4 star hotel, very average. The front desk service was great, very helpful. The house keeping was awful. Each day something was not replaced or missing. I had to contact the front desk on a daily basis. sometimes room towels weren't replaced.  Only a soap bar is provided.  Rooms very outdated but apparently being renovated. Also very noisy as right near freeway.    Wi Fi was overloaded so wasn't able to log in most times
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We do apologize for the experience with housekeeping not replenishing your room in a timely manner. We will be working closely with all our managers to be sure these issues do not reoccur.   I would love to invite you back to the hotel once we are a fully renovated Four Points by Sheraton. Please email me directly with any other details in regards to your past stay or any upcoming bookings you may plan with us.  Best,  Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager 714-758-0900 nubia.doumerc@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Our room was nice beds comfortable, clean Most staff were great including bar and cleaning but a couple of the men on the from desk were grumpy and seemed like everything a bother. Great pool kids spent many hours there . Have good priced washing machine and dryers good when travelling with kids  . Downside pool towels teeny tiny and no umbrellas . If noise worries you Hotel right on freeway so lots traffic noise less in rooms and didn't bother us but if noise sensitive not the place for you. Shuttle to Disney 5 mins cost $5.50 per adult for the day $2 for kids hint when coming back get the no 10. If get 11 have to do the whole 20 min loop . Food was nice and think good value and was fresh . Going through renovations but that didn't really inconvenience us at all
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We are happy to hear you were able to enjoy the staff's customer service and do apologize for the size of the towels at the pool.  We will be sharing all of your feedback with the needed departments as we fully renovate into a Four Points by Sheraton hotel.  Best,  Nubia Doumerc Front Office Manager 714-758-0900

Summary Heading: Best place to watch Disney fireworks!
Summary: This hotel is in the process of converting to Four-Points by Sheraton and I believe it should be done by July 2017.  So be prepared for some dusts.  However, the staffs are superb and if you visit after July 2017, you probably will enjoy a whole new hotel!  They also have the best location to watch Disney's fireworks at the comfort of your own backyard without waiting at Disney.  You can just relax with a glass of wine or drink at the hotel's courtyard that has indestructible view of the fireworks!  Additional note, the food at restaurant is above my expectation, worth trying!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked two rooms for family for 4 nights mid May this year. We called them a few days beforehand to request a renovated room on the top floor. Very happy with the renovated rooms. The décor is lovely, bed was so comfortable I felt like I was sleeping on a cloud. Free WIFI Staff were very friendly & helpful.  Our room was closest to the highway and although it can get loud, once we closed the door we hardly noticed it. Windows are double glazed.   Shuttle which runs every 20 mins is $5 for an all day pass but you can buy a 3 day pass and get it cheaper. Disneyland is only 5-10 mins away.  Convenient coin operated guest laundry you can access from top floor via elevator.  Tru Grits dining is next door, we went there a couple of times for breakfast. Small choice of cereal, cold
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were put down stairs facing the main carpark on the main road in a disability room, It had NO carpet it was freezing cold with a big gap under the door. The curtains were all ripped & see through with a gap between them.The bed was horrible & i didn't feel safe at all, I'm so glad i was only there 2 nights i couldn't do more than the. We went to the restaurant & the food was horrible the service was good though.It is walking distance for Disneyland & there is a shuttle bus but you have to pay.Only good thing is they have washing machines & dyers so we got all our washing done.
Manager Response: Good Day,  We are truly sorry about your experience. We are in transformation to becoming a Four Points with new beds and new rooms. If you ever have a problem with a room please let us know so we can try to fix the problem while you are here.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton

Summary: This Hotel is only 1/2 mile from Disneyland. This hotel was one of the best experiences I have ever had and I have stayed at many hotels over the years.  The staff all go out of their way to please their customers. One staff member gave me a ride to the airport because my shuttle never showed up. The Manager did everything possible to make my stay comfortable. Mike Garrett, front desk, tried for three hours to help me get some shuttle vouchers from Expedia. They would not fax them to the hotel. Finally, we gave up and I paid for my shuttle twice. I won't use expedia again for anything. I will, however, come back to the Menage. Thanks to Nubia, Hotel manager, and the staff who made my stay great!  There is an all day shuttle back and forth to Disneyland for $5.50.  Great value!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for one night on an impulse Disney trip. This hotel is a little close to the freeway (noise) under rennovation, and otherwise underwhelming two star hotel. The property is close to Disney and is in the process of being folded into the Starwood chain as a Four Points Sheraton. The staff was very helpful and had their act together. They handled the park tickets and bus shuttle information like pros.
Manager Response: Hi Alaskanabroad,  Thank you for staying at the Hotel Menage. We are in the process of the transformation and we are excited to have our 24 hour pool back. We hope you come back to visit after the transformation when we will offer more amenities and game room.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton

Summary: Where to start, had to pull my bell trolley up the room myself. Room looked like an office with a bed. No glasses in the room but instead plastic glasses. Room right next to the freeway. Was informed that the jacuzzi would be closed but so was the pool. They did a pool share with the Sheraton but whats the point of that, they had a shuttle service but again you don't want to have to wait for a bus to go to the pool.  The worst part with makes me question security, the rooms windows are on the corridors, so if somebody broke a window. They are in your room. If you open your blackout blinds people can see everything in your room even with the other blind closed.  Checked out after 2 nights  Its cheap for a reason!!!!
Manager Response: Hi BacardiGurpz,  We are sorry that you had to pull your own cart. I will get with Valet and make sure we train them on this. We are moving to a brand with Four Points by Sheraton which have room design this way. We have looked at glass cups but because of the whole report online about cleaning we feel that guest safety is extremely important to us. We are truly sorry we did not meet your expectations.   Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Operations Manager

Summary: Rooms were lovely, clean and have all facilities you need. But please note that hotel is having complete renovation and the pool and bar area totally closed till end of May!  Shame not told before arrival. Pool facilities are available with sister hotel and a free shuttle is included about 10 min drive away so not very convenient.
Manager Response: Hi Debbykim,  Thank you for your review! We are working on trying to get the pool up and get the pool up as soon as possible. We hope you join us after the renovations!  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Operations Manager

Summary: We stayed at the hotel and whilst still very much under construction, it didn't bother us. The pool wasn't in use, but it will be lovely when done. We visited the on site restaurant on our first night but wasn't impressed so didn't return (we are fussy with our food and struggled with American portion sizes) Location to Disneyland was great, but there are a lot more hotels closer. All in all it was a OK stay but not my usual standards. Great if budget conscious
Manager Response: Emily H,   We are are glad to see you enjoyed your stay with us. I will let our Restaurant Manager know about your concerns. We hope that next time you come to Anaheim you will stay with us to improve you stay with us.   Thank you,  Carolynn Terry Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: We didn't stay at the hotel but had dinner and stayed for the fireworks from Disneyland. Amazing place to watch them - outside!!! The service was excellent , attentive. We take all of our out of towners here to view the fireworks.
Manager Response: Hi Ocdolphingrayneil,  Thank you for your review! We love are firework show too! Hopefully, you can stay after our renovations are complete to have the full experience! Hope to see you again!  Skylar L Knowlton Operations Manager

Summary: Unfortunately while we were there they were undergoing renovations and the pool was not in use but that can't be helped and we still had a great stay! The rooms were lovely and clean and very big, the carpet was a bit worse for wear but all in all we loved our room and had a great nights sleep every night!
