Summary: Stayed here for a weekend trip to Disneyland! The hotel looks much worse on the outside than it does on the inside. Our room was pretty spacious and the beds were fine, the air conditioning worked and we had a mini fridge. The noise from the highway was a little bit loud but we got used to it after a couple hours. It was also very clean - we could smell how clean it was when we walked in (although we found whatever they sprayed as a room freshener to be a bit much, we were glad they didnt spray it the rest of our trip). The hotel needs an update badly however I do know that Starwood has acquired the property and renovations are planned. It took us about 10 minutes to walk to Disneyland from the hotel - you just cross the bridge and you are there! I can't comment on the food
Manager Response: Dear vmc13,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property. As you have mentioned above, This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. it is true that our location puts us in a close approximately to the Disneyland Resort Area. Thank you for your patience as we progress with our remodel. We would love to welcome you back in 2017 when our renovations have been complete!  Best travels,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Had read the reviews after booking his hotel and was a little concerned, but could not fault this hotel! The staff were amazing nothing was too much trouble for them, the room was clean, neat and had no problems at all. The tavern food and environment of the tavern was lovely, wait staff were friendly, helpful and polite. The meals were faultless ( we ate there the 4 nights we stayed there) 10 minute walk to Disney is a bonus to the wonderful hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Justbee79,  THANK YOU FOR YOUR FIVE STAR REVIEW!! Our staff goes above and beyond to ensure each guest stay is a memorable one. We are delighted you enjoyed our in-house dinning option, The American Tavern, throughout your stay. We are overjoyed you enjoyed your stay with us and would love to welcome you back!  Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura Front Office supervisor Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: My family and I booked this hotel because it was partnered with Disney and within walking distance. When we arrived our room was gross. You'll be able to see it beginning with the elevator up to the rooms. There were layers of dirt everywhere. The metal baseboards were peeling from the moisture in the bathroom. The walls everywhere were all marked up as well. The air conditioner sounded like an airplane taking off each time it turned on. The carpet had so much dirt, especially in the corners. Then there were the beds. Oh. My. Word. 😳 The box springs aren't covered so it's possible to see the layers of dirt and the stains. Gulp. The mattress was no better. The only reason that we stayed was because we were locked in by our vacation company. I feel that management has given up.
Manager Response: Dear Nursenatalie1985,  Thank you for sharing your experience. Hotel Menage strives for guest satisfaction that goes above industry standards and we apologize this was not the case with your stay. We greatly appreciate your feedback and have addressed your maintenance and cleanliness concerns with the proper department managers.   Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.   Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: I was surprised/disappointed that Starwood has this hotel in it's "collection". I was looking for a place for a 1 night stay, before the next leg of my trip. I would not stay here again. No brand name and I see why. A fake Tudor, of the 70's era, I would guess. The first room had a rusted, dripping tub faucet. I could never sleep listening to: Drip...Drip...Drip...all night long. The chalking around the sinks, was filthy. The room change helped a bit and staff was extremely accommodating. Have us free breakfast coupons for our trouble. Very friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Tradewind66,  Thank you for sharing your experience. Hotel Menage strives for guest satisfaction and we apologize this was not the case with your stay. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  We appreciate your feedback and have addressed your maintenance concerns with the proper department managers, please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.   Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, friendly staff and nearby Disney
Summary: Very friendly staff in the whole hotel, even when passing by or in the elevator the staff makes small talk with you.  Nearby Disney either by car or you use the city's shuttle bus which stops in front of the hotel. The food in the Tavern is nice as well and parking is no problem at the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Patricia S,   THANK YOU FOR YOUR FIVE STAR REVIEW!!!!!! Hotel Menage aims for guest experiences that will last a lifetime. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your overall stay and look forward to seeing you soon!  Best Travels,  Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Terrible conditions, dirty, no maintenance at all, rooms have no ventilation. we picked it because its part of spg hotels, honestly a disgrace for spg. 10 minutes from disney but we changed hotels and found much better options close by.
Manager Response: Hey Juan N,  I am truly sorry to hear about your experience here at the Hotel Menage. We are going to be going through a transformation with the WHOLE hotel. We look forward to having a new product with great services that only Starwood can give. News to come as Starwood Hotels enhances the hotel.  Thank you,  Skylar L Knowlton Operations Manager

Summary Heading: They say they are gonna update but going down hill fast
Summary: Price is cheap and location is close to Disneyland 10 min walk .5 mile . Looking a little run down and place is falling apart. Very loud free way noise but couldn't here it in room but no relaxing by the pool due to noise. Not sure how they are gonna fix that unless they inclose the pool area.  We stayed three nights we called about our tub running the first night and they came right away but said they couldn't do anything until the following day. Never got fixed never was followed up on or anything at check out didn't have a clue what I was talking about and asked if I called again the next day to report it again. I don't feel I should have to bug them about an issue in there room.   I could go on about the fridge not sealing and leaking everywhere but what's the point! They
Manager Response: Dear Nick S,   Thank you for sharing your experience. Hotel Menage strives for guest satisfaction and we apologize this was not the case with your stay. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  We appreciate your feedback and have addressed your maintenance concerns with the proper department managers, please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.   Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Great location. In need of updates!
Summary: The hotel is located a 10 min walk to disneyland. You can see and feel the firework show each night from the pool area. The room size was okay, but the bathroom was tiny. The bathroom reminded me of a dirty, dingy, cruise ship bathroom. Stains on the ceiling and no fan in the bathroom. The front desk staff were nice and friendly. I was very upset that our room wasn't cleaned. I left the room at 4am came back for a shower at 9 and then left again until 130 am. I was traveling with my family and needed clean towels. The night before we had to use 3 towels and a pool towel to dry the flooded floor from the shower leaking during a shower.  I didn't complain at 130 in the morning I was exhausted. In the morning I let the know how disappointed I was and they comped my 2 day parking
Manager Response: Dear Carrie C,   Thank you for taking the time to review our property and share your experiencing.   Hotel Menage strives for guest satisfaction and we apologize this was not the case with your stay. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  We have addressed you cleanliness concerns with the proper department managers, please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.   Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: We primarily picked this hotel due to its proximity to Disneyland. We had 3 rooms which were at the front of the hotel so you could hear the traffic but it was manageable. The only irritating thing was the reversing truck at 5am every morning who took 15-20mins to successfully reverse (he probably shouldn't have a license if it takes him this long). The rooms were tired but comfortable. Staff were friendly enough. Pool was nice and the spa was a godsend after walking around Disneyland. Fireworks can be seen from the balcony which was a pleasant surprise. Taco Bell and a service station is across the road and a 10min walk over the hill will lead you to many restaurants and the front entrance of Disneyland. We hired a car which was very beneficial and opened up more eating
Manager Response: Dear Belinda H,   Thank you for sharing your experience. Our location places us in the close proximity to Disney and wonderfully convenient restaurants nearby. This fall our hotel will also be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  Best Travels!  Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: You pay for what you get
Summary: We just came here for two nights as it was close to Disneyland so we didn't care. It was a good soft bed!  The only reason why this doesn't have five stars is because the shower leaked even with shower curtain! It was the biggest pain as the floor would be covered in water.
Manager Response: Dear Nicole H,   Thank you for your four star review. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017. We hope to see you once our renovations are complete!  Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: I knew I wanted to book our wedding at Hotel Menage the second I spoke with Brandi Bradford as well as when we met the amazing staff that warmly greeted us at the bar and front desk.   Brandi was able to answer all of my questions (Believe me, I had a lot of them) prior to our wedding and the days leading up to our special moment. She is such an amazing woman and we connected like we were long lost sisters.  Our wedding was so beautiful and we received so many compliments from our guests. For instance, the entrée that was served was absolutely delicious and our guests have even asked for recipes from the chef, Josephine.   I could not have done it without Brandi and the wonderful staff at Hotel Menage. I highly recommend anyone to host events here. The Pacific Ballroom is a
Manager Response: Dear Lisalane85,  THANK YOU FOR YOUR FIVE STAR REVIEW!!!!!!!!!! Our employees aim to make each guest experience an experience that lasts a lifetime.  We appreciate the kudos you gave our staff members and will make them aware of your kind words. We thank you for allowing us to create such special memory with you and sincerely look forward to seeing you soon!  Best travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: This hotel has a lot of pros and cons.  Pros:  Big rooms Close to Disneyland Large pool  Friendly and helpful staff Good AC Comfortable bed  Cons: Rundown Dated Depressing motel feel Generally dirty -- Bathtub was mildewy (we stayed only one night and skipped morning showers bc we were grossed out). Surrounded by extremely loud freeway. Even with doors/windows shut you can hear the noise quite clearly. To walk to Disney, you have to cross a highway on-ramp that does not have a light or stop sign. So while it's close enough to walk, I did not feel safe crossing that on-ramp with my toddler.  This is clearly a budget hotel that has gotten a minor facelift in order to charge higher prices. There are so many places to stay in Anaheim, I probably wouldn't stay here again. I booked on
Manager Response: Dear greensubmarine,   We appreciate you taking the time to review our hotel. Hotel Menage has recently joined the Starwood Hotels and Resorts Corporation will be reopening as Four Points by Sheraton - Anaheim in early 2017 with all new redesigned guest rooms and lobby that will hopefully exceed your expectations.   Regards,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Last week of holidays to meet grandkids.
Summary: My 1st impression at 1am in the morning was total disappointment.  However, after waking to a new day, I found this hotel to be quite amazing.  Awesome walking location to Disney & Transport terminal, THE BEST location to view night time fireworks, and although situation near major road/hey rooms very quiet & hugely spacious.  Food in restaurant was well above average for quality & price.  ALL STAFF WERE INCREDIBLE, helpful, polite and friendly.  We dont have kids and didn't want to be amongst 100's of children and while there were kids here, because the hotel wasn't over run with them it was actually quite pleasant.  Pool & spa area quite nice & clean.  We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Binnalee,   Thank you for your four star review and kind words about our staff. Our employees aim to make each guest stay a personal and memorable one! We are happy to hear you enjoyed one of the best views for the Disneyland fireworks in the Anaheim area! We sincerely hope to see you and your significant other soon!  Best travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: We were not able to check in early, instead we were checked in 40min late and "upgraded" to a "pool facing" room on the 4th floor that actually faced the freeway. The loud traffic noise could be heard all day and night. Room needs updating, several outlets didn't work, the AC unit in the room was full of dirt, dust and mold. I called about the AC unit, no one came to clean it so I did it myself. Several stains and even cigarette burns found on the sheets though it is a non smoking room. If any other hotels had available rooms at the time I would have changed hotels. Now I know why they had space available
Manager Response: Dear Megan B,   Our hotel strives to provide a service level that is above industry standards. We apologize if this was not the case during your stay with us. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  We have addressed you cleanliness concerns with the proper department managers, please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.   Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Nice room, but the traffic noise is terrible
Summary: The location betweeen higways all around is terrible and noisy. Nice pool area though, and friendly staff. We liked the american style breakfast buffet. This hotel is too far away from LA if you want to visit the city. Traffic jam almost 24h makes the ride in or out at least 1-2 hours.
Manager Response: Dear Ovibarbo,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed our All American breakfast buffet. Our location is in the heart of Anaheim, just moments from the 5 freeway, Disneyland and the Anaheim convention center. Our guest service desk provides a variety of transportation options if you are interested in exploring the greater Los Angeles Area.   Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor  sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Terrible bathroom and room in need of update
Summary: The traffic noise is terrible. The bathroom is in drastic need of a complete overhaul. Room cleanliness is average. Book somewhere else!!!! The lobby is ok and the staff were all helpful. I'll be expressing my disappointment to my travel agent.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for sharing your experience. Hotel Menage strives for guest satisfaction and we apologize this was not the case with your stay. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.   Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: I always stay at Starwood Hotels and am always very pleased with everything. I can't say the same for this place. We just checked in and am not waiting till check out for this review. I am here with my wife and kids on a Disney weekend trip. We booked two connecting rooms and right off the back, they didn't have them available. Finally checked in, hairs all over the shower, sinks and beds. We have killed 2 bugs on the wall and we have been in the room 25 minutes. Not what I expected from SPG. VERY DISAPPOINTING!
Manager Response: Dear Luislo619,  Thank you for sharing your experience. Hotel Menage strives for guest satisfaction and we apologize this was not the case with your stay. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We Thank you for being a Starwood preferred guest and we would love to welcome you back in 2017.   Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay,  Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Lobby is ok and staff are friendly
Summary: So my family went on a road trip going in a circle from LA to Phoenix to Vegas to San Fran and back to LA. We stayed at the menage both times in LA. Our first visit we were greated by friendly staff which was a plus. Upon arrival in our room we discovered it was quite dirty with the reminisce of the last guest still in the room. We found a baby bottle behind the curtain and the room was dirty in other places. However the hotel does offer a great pool and jacuzzi with a view of the disneyland fireworks which was nice to see. The first night we had the breakfast buffet which was around 10 dollars each. The buffet was quite poor with a small selection. On completing our roadtrip and returning for another night at the menage our second room was much better. The room was not only
Manager Response: Dear Arjan B,   Thank you for sharing your experience.  Hotel Menage strives for guest satisfaction and we apologize this was not the case with your stay. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  We have addressed you cleanliness concerns with the proper department managers, please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.   Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: We booked this hotel last minute through Priceline as an Express Deal which we pre paid, the hotel charged us again in full, they were very accommodating about reimbursing almost all of the charge when we called. The bottom sheet on the bed was about 10 inches too short, so the bottom 10 inches of the bed are a mattress pad only which is NOT removed and laundered. The bed was not very comfortable at all either. There was a very obvious reason why the lighting in the room was dim.  The bathroom was horrendous!!! Rather than remodeling the bathrooms the tub and tile was re-glazed very badly. When I gave my 3 small children a bath they were handing me flakes of the glazing which were literally floating loose in the bath water, it was a VERY short bath. The shelf in the closet was
Manager Response: Dear Marjorie R,  Thank you for sharing your experience. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We apologize you did not enjoy your stay with us. Hotel Menage aims for guest satisfaction that goes above industry standards and we apologize this was not the case with you.   Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.  Best travels,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor  sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Hotel was an average price for location and ammeities. Noisy outside by freeway. Our bathtub's paint was peeling.... The pool had a safety hazard. The pool light was detached from wall and the light was floating in the water with the wires hanging out. Pretty scary as we hoped none of us would be electricuted. Loved the fact that we could view the nighttime Disney fireworks from the pool and that the pool was always open 24 hrs. If the repairs were made I wouldn't mind returning here for the price we paid.
Manager Response: Dear Laura A,  Thank you for sharing your experience. We are happy to hear you enjoyed one of the best views for the Disneyland fireworks in the Anaheim area! This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor  sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Are you okay with freeway/highway noise
Summary: the pics and reviews looked great for this property so we booked it.  the first room was fine until cars were stopped at the intersection, then we heard horns, reving, and engines so we requested to be moved.  The next room on the other side of the hotel next to the freeway so again asked to be moved, okay a little further from the freeway, finally we asked for the room with the pool view on the 1st floor, well somebody already took it so they found us another room with a pool view, we decided it would work.  The rooms are small, and I was not aware they have a queen + king option, that is what they put us in, we loved having a king bed.  There is no dresser just a file cabinet looking dresser to store things.  Having the mini fridge is a great option.  The restaurant is really
Manager Response: Dear Shalayne S,   Thank you for taking the time to review our property. Our hotel aims to make each guest a positive one. We apologize if this was not the case for your stay. Our hotel is in close proximity to the 5 freeway, and standard traffic hours may be herd from certain rooms; we do encourage all of our guests to wait until the evening, when the traffic lightens up tremendously and the rush hour of southern California commuters dies down. We do also do recommend any guests with a "quiet preference" inform the guest service agent at check in, so we may accommodate accordingly.  We do have some wonderful changes that our property will be experiencing! This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017!  Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.  Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor  sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: If you are looking for a reasonable place to lay your head, this place is okay. I was disappointed. The room was poorly appointed, seemed dark and cave like, felt old and tired. I wish I had spent a little more in $$$ and stayed a little closer to the parks in much nicer accommodations. Will not choose this again...cheapened my Disney experience.
Manager Response: Dear Cynthia G,   Thank you for sharing your experience. Our hotel strives to provide a service level that is above industry standards. We apologize if this was not the case during your stay with us. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.  Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor  sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel but don't hold your breath for fancy.
Summary: Surprise that this is an SPG hotel. It didn't quite hold the SPG standards. Seemed middle of the road average. Doors open to the outside and the rooms are very much like motel rooms. Our room needed a deep cleaning, it didn't look like it had one for years.  Valet service was top notch. The guys out front were always on top of it.  Hotel Menage is on route near Disney and has a decent busing system that stops by the hotel every 20 minutes.  If you are not planning on spending a ton of time in your room and plan on being at Disney a majority of the time then this hotel is for you. Unless you are a light sleeper, because this hotel is very noisy. Since all doors open up towards the pool area sounds flow in the rooms.
Manager Response: Dear JoeyBaggz,   Thank you for taking the time to review our property. Hotel Menage has recently joined the Starwood Hotels and Resorts Corporation will be reopening as Four Points by Sheraton - Anaheim in early 2017 with all new redesigned guest rooms that will hopefully exceed your expectations. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed the fantastic firework view! We sincerely hope to see you soon.  Regards,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Spg hotel that could use a facelift
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights during a Disneyland trip. Used our star points. Rented 2 side by side rooms /good had a small view toward Disneyland, could see fireworks at night. Located by a freeway and very noisy outside the room , fairly good soundproofing. Ac was cold one side of room and hot on other. Dated decor and could use a good cleaning. Our toilet plugged up took 30 minutes to get service, guest service line didn't work had to use their outside phone  line for service . Had problems with personal safe also. Front desk help good and doormen. Would stay closer to Disneyland next time, it about a 1/2 mile walk, does have the ART bus line which is helpful, restaurants on the way to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Vickiwms,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Hotel Menage has recently joined the Starwood Hotels and Resorts Corporation will be reopening as Four Points by Sheraton - Anaheim in early 2017 with all new redesigned guest rooms that will hopefully exceed your expectations.   Regards,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: The hotel looks nice from the outside. Pool area was nice for the hotel. Seemed more like a motel. Our room needed a bit of an update. The bathroom fan was broken and tile grimy looking. The valet guys were awesome. Super friendly and polite. It was my sisters 10th and the nice women that checked us in brought her a birthday brownie. Very nice of her. The staff really made the hotel a 4 not a 3. If the rooms were updated it would probably be a 5 in my books. Don't believe the bad reviews. You get what you pay for. You can't expect a 4 seasons for the price of a super 8. Thanks for the great trip Ménage.
Manager Response: Dear Jessica H,   Thank you for your four star review and kind words about our staff. Our employees aim to make each guest stay a personal and memorable one! Hotel Menage has recently joined the Starwood Hotels and Resorts Corporation will be reopening as Four Points by Sheraton - Anaheim in early 2017 with all new redesigned guest rooms that will hopefully exceed your expectations! We hope to see you and your sister very soon!   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: We were here for a wedding on a Saturday. We did not spend the night here, but did spend several hours at the hotel. The place is nice, but not fancy. The lobby seems rather dated, and was extremely warm throughout our visit. We were all in suits and similar wedding attire, and everyone was sweating just sitting in the lobby. The lobby restaurant and bar were quite nice, and had a good selection of craft beers. The pool area was also nice, but it backs up to the interstate. Although a big wall keeps out most of the noise, you can still hear the traffic.  From the pool deck out back (and from rooms overlooking the pool), you can watch the fireworks show across the interstate at Disneyland.  The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. I can't comment on the guest rooms
Manager Response: Dear ERFSU82,  We appreciate you taking the time to review our hotel. Hotel Menage has recently joined the Starwood Hotels and Resorts Corporation will be reopening as Four Points by Sheraton - Anaheim in early 2017 with all new redesigned guest rooms and lobby that will hopefully exceed your expectations. We are glad you enjoyed your recent experience here at Hotel Menage and hopefully have you as over night guests in the near future.   Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: We had a great experience at Hotel Menage.  Everyone, from the front desk to all other staff we encountered, were friendly and helpful. We were there for our son's wedding. Brandi Bradfors,the wedding coordinator for the hotel, was a dream to work with. She was so warm and friendly. She was always available, working her magic, helping in every way, from the first visit to the very last minute of the reception. You are so lucky to have her. Thanks, Brandi, for all your hard work.
Manager Response: Dear carlabadger,   Thank you for your four star review! Our staff members aim to go above industry standards to make our guests feel especially welcomed. We appreciate the kudos you have given our staff members and will ensure they are made aware of your kind words. We are delighted your family and son enjoyed their wedding here with us. We hope to see you soon!   Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: A really good hotel so easy to get around to places from here as its also a bus stop for the number 10 and 11 buses bed comfortable and staff happy to help with everything the only reason not a 5 housekeeping twice didnt do our room properly and we had to ask for clean towels
Manager Response: Dear nannan04,   Thank you for your four star review. The ART is a great shuttle service provided by the city of Anaheim which allows you a quick and easy way to get transported to and from the hotel. We have addressed your concerns with the proper department managers to ensure the up most guest satisfaction. We thank you for your recommendations and look forward to your future stay.   Best travels,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: The hotel appears to have been redone recently. Our room looked pretty sharp with 2 beds, Samsung TV, and a small fridge. The lobby was clean with very friendly staff. Outside you will find a 24 hour pool. Outside you will also find an outdoor bar, plenty of chairs, and a ping pong table. At night you can watch the Disney fireworks from in the pool. I would say the view is better than watching from inside the park. I would definitely stay here again. Some complain about the traffic noise from the I-5, but I didn't find it to be a problem. Once in your room you can't hear a thing.
Manager Response: Dear Ryan R,  Thank you for your four stay review! Our proximity to the Disneyland Resort assures us we have one of the best views of the Disney fireworks in the area! We are delighted you enjoyed your stay with us and sincerely hope to see you soon!  Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Nice pool, hot tub.  Open 24/7.   Restaurant was ok.  I think what I liked most was the fireworks from Disney at 9pm every night except Tuesday and Wednesday.  Valet was worth it, only a buck extra per night.    Could use some outside cleaning, windows were dirty and maintenance seems a month or two behind.
Manager Response: Dear roger_boone,  THANK YOU FOR YOUR FIVE STAR REVIEW!!!!!Hotel Menage is delighted to hear you enjoyed your overall stay with us! Thank you for your kind words about our staff. Hotel Menage aims for guest satisfaction that goes above industry standards. We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel while visiting the Orange County area and sincerely hope to see you soon.  Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Thieving maids and awful reception staff
Summary: After a nice stay at this hotel in the previous year, I booked here again for myself and some of my companies high value clients, to attend Vidcon.  Upon arrival, the receptionist and manager both insisted for a good half an hour that I only had 3 rooms booked and not 4, it took a lot of persistence for them to magically find the 4th booking which they were trying to con me out of; this was after offering me an extortionate rate to re-book the room they claimed I didn't have. I spent a lot of that time just stood at reception for stupidly long periods while they went into the back, as if they thought I would go away. It seemed I wasn't the only customer with a problem because I had to stand waiting for more than 20 minutes to check in, and I was 1st in line with 2 other
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our first family trip to Anaheim  (Disneyland) the room and staff were Fantastic especially Kent who went out of his way to accommodate us very quickly after a 15hr flight with 2 young kids and helped us organised our trips.  Room was great which also over looked the pool area which had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks at night eventhough the highway is very close you can't hear the traffic on the room.  I would highly recommend staying here.
Manager Response: Dear Rachel S,   THANK YOU FOR YOUR FIVE STAR REVIEW!!! Our close proximity to the Disneyland Resorts ensures our guests have a spectacular view of the Disneyland Fireworks. Hotel Ménage takes great strides to make each guest stay a memorable one and we are happy that we have met those expectations with your stay! We appreciate the kudos you have given our staff members and will ensure they are made aware of your kind words. Thank you choosing to stay at our property during your trip to the Anaheim area and we sincerely hope to see you soon!   Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights. We enjoyed our stay. Room was great for what we needed. Check in was easy and staff was much more than willing to accommodate us. Had a pool view, that was very nice. Yes hotel stands next to the freeway, however no noise goes into your room. It was no big deal. I mean Disneyland is near the Freeway, therefore any nearby hotel is too. Restaurant was great. Frank in the bar was outstanding! Best drinks ever!! He was great, he loves his job and takes pride on what he does. Room service was amazing. We loved or stay. Last but not least, pool was wonderful!!! 24 hours, clean, heated and beautiful. We felt we definitely got what we paid for. Even the hostess at entrance where nice. Thank you to Menage staff  for your service.
Manager Response: Dear Irma A,   THANK YOU FOR YOUR FIVE STAR REVIEW! Hotel Menage aims to make each guest stay a personal and memorable one! We are happy that we have met those expectations with your stay. We appreciate the kudos you have given our staff members and will ensure they are made aware of your kind words. We appreciate you choosing to stay at our property during your trip to the Anaheim area and we sincerely hope to see you soon!   Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Location and service were wonderful. We loved the onsite restaurant and the 24/Hr access to the pool. It was also pretty close to the park which made it easy to walk (although it's over the freeway). However the bathrooms were fairly small and in desperate need of a remodel.
Manager Response: Dear Maribel H,   Thank you for your four star review. Hotel Menage aims to make each guest stay an experience that lasts a lifetime! We are overjoyed that you took advantage of our 24-Hour pool access and onsite American Tavern Eatery. Our Hotel has recently joined the Starwood family and this fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017! We hope to see you soon!  Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Caroline Terry helped make our stay  pleasant. Room near pool but noise was not an issue. Was always surprised when I opened the door to hear freeway noise. You do not hear it when you go into the room.
Manager Response: Dear AnnArchuleta,  Thank you for your four star review and your kind words about our guest service agent. We are delighted to hear our guest service agent was able to make your stay a special one! We hope to see you soon!  Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Very fair price for such a great location we got the shuttle every day to the parks it was extremely easy even in walking distance. The rooms were nice and the pool was really nice and had amazing views of the fireworks every night. Would definitely recommend
Manager Response: Dear Albie7877,   THANK YOU FOR YOUR FIVE STAR REVIEW!!!!!! Our location ensures our guests are in close proximity to the Disneyland area. We strive to ensure our guests experiences go above industry standards to make each experience one that will last a lifetime! We greatly appreciate your recommendations and look forward to seeing you soon!   BEST TRAVELS,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: This was rated as a 3 1/2 star hotel on spg.com. It's not. It's a decent 2 1/2 star motel. In my case I was here for a convention and paid $300 for a room. Based on the pictures, the rating, and the price I had much higher expectations. My bad for not doing enough research before booking.  The room was dark, the only window looked out onto the walkway (so keep the curtains shut if you want privacy), and the A/C rattled and sounded like a lawnmower. So you couldn't use it at night which is a problem in Anaheim in July. There were a few nice touches but otherwise the room was a converted motel and disappointing.  Also, they apparently stole my modem from 1996 to use for wifi. The wifi is free... but Slow.  Not impressive and I wouldn't recommend it.
Manager Response: Dear AnarchyJim,   Thank you for sharing your experience. Our hotel strives to provide a service level that is above industry standards. We apologize if this was not the case during your stay with us. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.  Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor  sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Like putting lipstick on a pig......
Summary: My husband booked this hotel based on the level of SPG points and its close proximity to Disneyland.  He viewed the pictures and thought this was going to be a lovely resort.  Well looks can be deceiving.  We arrived and the valet staff was very friendly and my husband checked us in at the front desk.  The lobby was bustling but nothing to write home about a few places to sit a restaurant located inside and a room with vending machines to get anything you might need.  The pool appeared very nice from the lobby.  We are upgraded to a pool view room and return to our car to park it.  We park at the back of the property and the first thing we notice was the noise from I-5.  We enter the back gate and find an elevator in a dark and dreary corridor.  The elevator barely got us to the
Manager Response: Dear swithygirl,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel, and for your kind words about our staff. We apologize if your experience with us was not a positive one. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.  Best travels,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor  sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: The staff gets an A they were friendly. but there were roaches in my room and one was crawling on me and the only thing they did was knock off the parking. They said its new owners that just took it over and that's all he could do.
Manager Response: Dear Dlyoshi,   Thank you for sharing your experience. Our hotel strives to provide a service level that is above industry standards. We apologize if this was not the case during your stay with us.  Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.  Best travels,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor  sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: This hotel ended up being exactly what I needed for a long weekend going to Knott Berry Farm. They had a nice pool area with the tiki bar. Inside the lobby there was plenty of vending machines another bar and a restaurant. They have plenty of seatinf in the lobby if you need to wait for your room…or you can drop off your suitcase if you're there before check-in and go right to the pool.   There's a quiet little business center off the office that allows you to print your boarding passes go online etc. if need be. Wi-Fi is included with your stay. What more do you need a wait you did a perfect view of the Disney fireworks every night !   The only reason I gave it four stars was because it was so noisy with the freeway being right next to it.
Manager Response: Dear Susie T,   Thank you for your four star review! Hotel Menage aims to make our guest experiences last a life time. We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us during your stay in the southern California area. We thank you for choosing our hotel.   Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura Front office supervisor sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Lots of potential but not quite there
Summary: Let me just preface this by saying.. I hate reading complaints.. I am not a complainer.. But.. I have to share this..   Friends of ours checked in a day before us and said they were disappointed in the cleanliness of the room.  The sheet on the bed doesn't cover the beds- so your legs and feet are on the hotel mattress.  I thought- well- maybe house keeping was in a hurry- ours will be fine.. Well- sadly, not the case- both of our beds were short sheeted. Front desk  blamed housecleaning and didn't really care.  I didn't think I would care but the more I think about it I actually think that is disgusting and not sanitary at all.  We cancelled our other night. Too bad that a lack of cleanliness and accountability will result in us never staying here.. Hope they can get this
Manager Response: Dear Kaci G,   Thank you for taking the time to review our property. Hotel Menage strives for guest satisfaction and we apologize this was not the case with your stay. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017.  We have addressed you cleanliness concerns with the proper department managers, please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.   Regards,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: We recently took our grandkids to Disneyland and stayed here. The accommodations were great. We had a two queen bed room. It even had a small refrigerator in it. Perfect for keeping drinks and snacks. This hotel is a short walk to Disneyland but seems like longer when you have 2 young boys and it's the end of the day.  We loved the pool. Also a great place to see the fireworks from Disneyland.  Couple of small down sides. The hallways were dark and dingy. Also the room numbers were hard to find. We had to walk around a bit to find our room. All and all a great stay.
Manager Response: Dear Passiongal,   Thank you for your four star review! We are delighted to hear you and your grandchildren enjoyed your overall stay with us during your trip to Disneyland Resort. This fall our hotel will be undergoing an extensive renovation and we will convert to a Four Points by Sheraton hotel in early 2017. The renovation will refresh our guest rooms, lobby, pool and more. We would love to welcome you back in 2017!  Best travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: This hotel is a very good hotel.  It's located next to Disneyland (15 min walk to main entrance).  Reception was fast and friendly, as was all staff we dealt with. Our room had coffee-making facilities plus small fridge. Breakfast is in the restaurant that forms part of the building.  It was reasonably priced and was quite good.  Wi fi is also free, and was a reasonable speed, with its availability to multiple devices. It has a good-sized pool and spa; outdoor and inside bars plus restaurant (the meals we had there were very nice).  The outdoor setting is very good. A shuttle is available to take people to Disneyland, however, we didn’t use it so don’t know how much it costs
Manager Response: Dear Mick B  Thank you for you four star review! Hotel Menage strives to make each guest experience a memorable one. We are truly delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us during your visit to the Anaheim area! The next time you stay with us be sure to try out the ART ( Anaheim Resort Transit). For just a flat daily fee of five dollars for adults and two dollars per child ( ages 2-9) you and your family may enjoy the added convenience of being shuttled to the Disney parks without the hassle of driving yourself; we are only one stop away! Hotel Menage appreciates your feedback and we look forward to seeing you soon.   Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: We booked this hotel to stay at for 2 days while we were visiting Disneyland, big mistake! We got the keys to our room and took a weird route to get to the room which was the only way to get to it. The room faced a fenced in parking lot and there was a door that locked behind you to the hotel which you needed a room key to actually get back in! So basically if you didn't have a room key you were trapped and couldn't get out of the Hotel in general. Seems safe right? When we first walked into our room we almost slipped and fell on the huge area of water coming from the mini fridge right by the door. The floors were glazed concrete and slippery when wet. The sleeper sofa was filthy and had stains everywhere, the bed was stained, the room was old and gross. I called the front desk
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were sold this accommodation as a 4 star hotel. We should have researched more. It was depressing, dark and dirty. It is advertised as a "Boutique Hotel." It is not. I am glad we were so busy that we only had to use the shower (when we got it fixed) and sleep in the bed. After a 13 hour flight and many thousands of dollars saved this accommodation was really disappointing. The front desk staff, with the exception of one, were at best, mildly helpful and friendly. The wifi was intermittent and I had to search for it. The website photos are all staged with amazing props and lighting. We saw very little that resembled those photos. With loads of hotels to choose from, this would be at the bottom of the list, in fact it wouldn't be on it.
Manager Response: Dear the4henz,   Thank you for taking the to review our hotel. Hotel Menage strives for guest satisfaction. We deeply apologize if this was not the case during your stay.   Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.  Regards,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Staff is great a good size pool and very close to Disney, in case you need it they have a shuttle bus to Disney (5 dlls round trip per/person), Rooms are ok,  ask for a pool view room to get a better view.
Manager Response: Dear GChavezB,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Hotel Menage has recently joined the Starwood Hotels and Resorts Corporation will be reopening as Four Points by Sheraton - Anaheim in early 2017 with all new redesigned guest rooms that will hopefully exceed your expectations. We hope to see you soon!  Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Travelled to Annaheim June 2014 to visit Disneyland. The hotel rooms are set out like morel rooms. Rooms clean and cosy but bathroom very old.  The defibetely need refurbishment. But overall very good Loved watching the nightly fireworks from pool At ospgere outside in pool garden area is perfect for relaxing
Manager Response: Dear OliviaRoseMelbourne,   Thank you for your four star review! Hotel Menage has recently joined the Starwood Hotels and Resorts Corporation will be reopening as Four Points by Sheraton - Anaheim in early 2017 with all new redesigned guest rooms that will hopefully exceed your expectations. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed the fantastic firework view! We sincerely hope to see you soon.  Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: I stayed at Hotel Menage for one night earlier this month. It is a new Starwood property, but it has not completed any of the renovations yet. I would not pay Starwood prices to stay here again, at least not until the remodel is finished. Our room was obviously run-down. The bathroom fixtures were rusted and the carpet was badly stained. I would not let my son walk around without his shoes on in the room because parts of the carpet were wet from the shower leaking.   I enjoy staying at Starwood hotels because they are comfortable and clean, regardless of the brand (Westin, Four Points, Sheraton, etc). This hotel was a complete disappointment, and I was relieved that we decided to only stay one night. Additionally, the manager who responded to my complaints seemed rather
Manager Response: Dear Miss Cummings,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Our hotel strives to make each guest stay a positive one; we apologize if this is was not the case during your stay with us. Our Boutique hotel has recently joined the Starwood family and is currently going through the proper renovations to transition to a Four Points by Sheraton come early next year.     Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience if you would like to further discuss your stay.  Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Close to the park with friendly staff
Summary: The room was clean but the bed isn't anything you'll write home about. Pretty average set up. The valet and lobby staff were friendly and pleasant to talk to. I don't recommend eating at the American Tavern restaurant unless you're desperate. Paying $12 for a burger and not getting fries with it is very strange.  The pool is open 24hrs but noise wasn't a big issue for us. We stayed on the 5th floor with a view overlooking it and Disneyland. They're not lying when they say you have a good view of the fireworks. The ART shuttle came every 20 minutes to make getting back from the park a breeze.
Manager Response: Dear Matthew C,   Thank you for taking the time to review our boutique hotel.  Our staff members aim to go above industry standards to make our guests feel especially welcomed. We appreciate the kudos you have given our staff members and will ensure they are made aware of your kind words.   Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: We loved almost everything about this hotel. Pool is 24hrs which was perfect because we hate leaving Disneyland when it closes and having the pool closed. We take a shuttle to and from park which is a reasonable price. The only thing I could say I wish they could change would be to add a microwave in rooms. The hotel has a perfect view to firework show which is amazing. Our overall experience was awesome.
Manager Response: Dear ClaudiaEspino,   Thank you for your four star review! We are delighted to hear  that you enjoyed our 24-hour pool! Hotel Menage takes great strides to make each guest stay a memorable one and we are happy that we have met those expectations with your stay. Our Boutique Hotel has recently joined the Starwood Resorts and Hotels Family and will be transitioning to a Four Points by Sheraton-Anaheim come early 2017. We appreciate you choosing to stay at our property during your trip to the Anaheim area and we sincerely hope to see you soon!   Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura  Front Office Supervisor  Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Would not return....beware of positive reviews.
Summary: Despite reading a mix of good and bad reviews, I decided to go ahead and book this resort for my recent California visit.  I liked the "tropical" look of the photos, but do not be deceived.  The majority of the hotel is very dark and does not give the feeling portrayed in photos.    I was very happy that I had only booked this hotel for a few nights and not the duration of the trip.  The room had a slight odor to it and had a bit of a damp feel.  I honestly hated being there.    I would highly advise against this resort for a reason that will likely be confusing.  The Disney fireworks were so unbelievably loud that if you didn't know they were about to start, you would swear there were bombs going off.  Very unpleasant and I would have been furious had I had young children/a
Manager Response: none

Summary: I read the reviews about this Hotel before I booked and they were better than most. When we arrived check in was fast and friendly, when we got to the room it was on the end by the highway very loud. So I called downstairs and they had no problem moving me to another room. Other than that our stay was great. Everyone that works there were friendly. I would stay again. My brother in law booked his room at the Disneyland hotel and said it was no different than our room here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Hotel Menage has solid location to the Disneys (Land, California Adventure, and Downtown) so by paying the parking fee ($18 or so) you can walk from the hotel past the highway, cross the street for breakfast (there is a Panera Bread and a McDonalds), then spend your day at the parks. Its not the most luxurious as it feels like a motel but it is a Disney partner resort.  One thing you will need to do is not to compare this or the area in general to a Florida Disney resort. You will see things that kind of ruin the magic (cast members waiting for the bus outside in their costumes next to the homeless who are sleeping on the benches being one of the big ones). But, if you are like me and trying to do Disney for as economically as possible, this is a good choice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice on the outside...yucky on the inside..
Summary: We stayed one night after this property. We had a room on the third floor facing the road. Upon check in, which was after 3, we went to our room. The carpet between the two beds was soaked! We had an event to get ready for so we got in the shower. The shower head was so crusted with calcium that the water did not even spray downwards. It sprayed out past the shower curtain! Which is why the carpet by the bathroom door was also soaked. I was under the impression that the rooms had been updated this spring . Which, I believe  Is not the case.  The bar area and the outdoor area are nice and the 24 hour access is great. Was not impressed with the staff or the room. Would probably not go back unless they do a major gut job remodel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I will start of by saying this place is good. Hence I didn't say it was amazing. I would definitely stay here again. Lets start with location, It is right off the 5 freeway so its very easy to get to. It is also very easy to get to Disneyland. It is less than 5 mins away. My wife and I left the park and came back to our hotel for an hour break/lunch and went back it was that easy (keep your parking ticket).  -It is 12 a day to park, or 13 for valet.   -I read online that people were saying it is loud at night they couldn't sleep (because of the 5 freeway). I am a light sleeper and my room was facing the pool which is the same way as the freeway and I COULDN'T HEAR ANYTHING. Don't be worried, you will sleep fine.  -The staff is incredible, they were so kind! -The hotel is OK not
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Just fine for time at Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is just fine for a trip to Disneyland. Pricing is average to low and location, while not directly across from Disneyland is within 3/4 of a mile (over a freeway) walk. But of course with all the walking you will be doing at Disneyland, it may be easier to take the shuttle which costs $5 per day for an all day pass.  This shuttle is run by the city, not by the hotel, so on the way to Disneyland it's non-stop, on the way back there are 3 stops prior to Hotel Menage. The hotel itself is a little old school as the rooms do open to the outdoors. We faced the pool and therefore the freeway also, but once the door was closed, the freeway noise was greatly reduced. Not near as bad as other reviewers have mentioned.  If you live in a city, this will not be a lot of noise. The
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for Disney
Summary: This is a great place to stay if you are planning to go to Disneyland. It is very close to the park. A $5 Uber ride will take you to the drop off zone at the front gate of Disney. We visited for the fourth of July and you can't beat that price. Check for package deals! Round trip flight from Seattle, and 4 nights at this hotel was a little over $400.  We had the shower light got out on us, but the service guy came up right away to fix it. The only things I have complaints about ate the power outlets and the bed frame (see photos). Oh, the bathroom is big too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am not typically someone who commits a lot of time to writing reviews, but I felt in this instance it was worth the time.  We stayed on points at this hotel.  Having stayed many times at the Sheraton down the road we decided to give this hotel a try due to the lower point value.  We also did read several reviews so we knew going in not to expect the standards to be as high as the Sheraton.  We checked in late after an evening flight and were given our room (402).  It was after midnight so we headed up, unpacked a little, and headed straight for bed.  The bed covers had some stains on them, and the carpet and bedding felt a little damp.  None the less we were very tired and fell straight to sleep.    We were up first thing to hit Disneyland, in the morning so got up quickly,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Sooooo on the fence with this one.  Room #543.  Liked the top level.  Ice machine area was empty, so we had to go to Main floor.  Didn't really mind the noise, enjoyed the fireworks view.  The lighting in the room was awful.  No overhead, and the vanity lighting was so dim.  Bathroom needs some updating for sure.  Carpet was kinda icky, didn't walk around without flip flops or shoes on.  Appreciated the staff, especially at the restaurant, but the maid staff rarely refilled our coffee packets, toilet paper or towels.  The in-room phone did not work at all...so any Guest Services or Room Service, etc...was not available.  Had to go down and get coffee from the restaurant (not complimentary) or go to front desk to ask for things.  The restaurant though was very accommodating....we
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly staff, free fireworks
Summary: The location is great, not too far from Disney and a Taco Bell, Starbucks and gas station directly across the road.   Staff upgraded us upon arrival free of charge and we could see the nightly fireworks from the balcony.   Check in staff were also extremely helpful in trying to assist us in setting up our GPS and when that failed, provided us with printed out directions to Universal Studios.   Little bit noisy as you are right next to the freeway but the doors muffle most of the sound.   The attached restaurant served good food. Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A great location for Disney, well priced and great service from the staff. The rooms are a little tired though. The pool and spa are nice and not too crowded. The food was of a good standard and served with a smile. Nothing really stands out here either as exceptional or as dreadful. Breakfast is a little lightweight  but all in all a good value base for the giant human trap set by a mouse
Manager Response: none

Summary: We decided to stay a couple of nights in Anaheim, so that one of the days, we could visit Disneyland and the other, just relax. The hotel is close to several venues but it is located next to the I-5 freeway which is very LOUD! We didn't know this, so you must prepare for this if you are staying there. The rooms definitely need updating and we talked to one of the staff who told us that this will be happening after the summer rush. Luckily, we brought an extension cord because my phone cord did not fit into their "light" plug-in's. I have included a couple photos where they cut around the plug-in. We still made the most of our stay and enjoyed the pool area. The grounds are beautiful and the staff was very nice and accommodating.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was older and the bathroom smelled of non draining water/mold, but otherwise the hotel was fine. Yes they charge $12 for parking. The pool and hot tub were nice.  The noise from the interstate was pretty loud.  You can see the Disney fireworks right from the pool. They is a bus service that goes every 20 minutes to and from the parks.  Its cheap and worth it.  Its only a 15 minute walk if you want to do that anyway.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location and staff were very friendly. The pool area is quite loud as its close to the highway.  Pool is open 24/7.  Restaurant on site was great. We ordered room service.   Rooms are okay, a little dated, but clean.   Within walking distance of the strip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Me, my wife and my 7 year old son stayed here for 9 nights.  All the staff were friendly and good at their jobs from the valets on up. The room was nice, 3rd floor over looking the pool. Cleaning staff did a nice job on our room every day and we're friendly.    Great views of the disneyland fireworks every night from right outside our room.  We enjoyed the pool every evening.  (Hottub was broken one day) Overall we were very happy with our stay and I recommend it to friends.  It's no 5 star resort but it was clean and we'll layed out and you can't get a much better location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is visually appealing from the outside. However the rooms are very outdated, they just feel old. The carpet is very dirty along with linen so ask for fresh linen. the bathrooms are small.  The a/c units aren't the best. The beds are lumpy and not comfortable at all. We also found a spider one night.  Motel 6 has nicer rooms.   The good things about this hotel are the staff, one of the cleaning ladies was amazing and the valet guy was the most helpful person of all.  The 24 hour pool was also very nice.  One hidden gem in anaheim is the restaurant/bar they have.  Food was excellent and delivered to our room within 15 minutes.   The best thing about this hotel when you aren't at disneyland is the view of the fireworks. They feel like they are literally feet away.   That
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently spent one night at this hotel and while I didn’t notice it on their website, this hotel is actually a motel (doors open to the outside, not to an interior hallway).  Normally, I tend to stay away from motel style rooms for personal security reasons, but I was already booked, so I made the most of it.  The room was fine overall.  You could tell they recently upgraded the furnishings, but the actual room hasn’t been renovated in quite some time (if ever).  The bed was comfortable and it was exceptionally quiet, especially considering my room faced the highway and the pool area.  I was very impressed with the sound proofing.  I went to the gym and they had a small amount of cardio equipment as well as some weights – they were all suitable.  After I was done, I checked
Manager Response: none

Summary: Within walking distance to Disney or can pay 5.00 for all day ticket on shuttle bus. The valet staff is fabulous. Checking in and out was easy and smooth. Utilized the laundry room which was well lit and operable. Our room overlooked the pool which was nice. The sound of traffic was awful, but closed the door and silence. The bathroom is where this room was lacking. Horrible smell, dated and the tub didn't drain well. Spent three days here and enjoyed the visit for the most part.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Elevator has a filthy carpet. The room smells really bad, smuly! I see carpet all around, even by the sink and it seens to be... err... not clean. I went to the nearest walmart, bought and applyed a bottle of febreeze to go through the night.  There's also another problem with the whole building: it's surrounded by highways. Sounds like you're watching a car race! Besides these two major problems, staff is ok and it's close enought to go walking to Disneyland/California Adventure Park/Downtown Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Recently visited, amazing location, staff were super friendly and helpful ensuring that  everything about the stay was great! Edwin who is at the front desk deserves an extra mention for his assistance and fantastic help!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights, really enjoyed it. Had a room on the 3rd floor facing the pool, nice and clean, good size. Could see the fireworks from Disneyland perfectly. Pool was lovely, bar and restaurant were great great. Staff were great especially Frank the bar manager. Bit of freeway noise but once you closer the door you couldn't hear it. Walking distance to Disneyland. Ask for room facing the pool. 👍🏽
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights in June. I shy away from staying close to Disney because the rooms seem to be over used, old, and over priced. This was pretty much that. Pictures looked beautiful but hotel was old up close. Remodeled with cheap upgrades, but still had that dirty old motel feel to it. The tub was downright scary, I'm in my 30's and was afraid I was going to slip and break a hip. Had to hold onto the kids the entire time for fear they would slip and crack their heads. The toilets are also old and yucky. Lighting in the room was bad which made me feel like it was dirty. Sock confirmed that carpet was dirty. The pluses... The 24hr pool! So nice to not have to worry about pool hours! It was warm too! Hot tub was great, hot and nice for sore muscles..... But, when the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Perhaps I am going to be a bit harsh in this review but maybe not. We started our honeymoon with 4 nights in san francisco then 4 nights in Las Vegas then 4 nights at the hotel menage anaheim. Well I was quite depressed when we arrived, dark dingy corridors and metal gates. The room was spacious but had a damp smell about it.  See photos attached. The bathroom was small with a limescale shower head and dirty tiles. After coming from Las Vegas this was very disappointing. However we thought of it as just a place to sleep. Originally we were going to relax by the pool the first day but the sound from the freeway was so off putting and the place lacked any kind of atmosphere. The saving grace to this place is Frank behind the bar in the evenings a true gentleman. Unfortunately if I
Manager Response: none

Summary: Walking distance to Disneyland, maybe not with small children though.   Nice pool area and lobby  Bed was very loud and the shower area was rather terrible. I showered with my jandels on. I'm not sure if it was unclean or just a terribly botched job of renovations. This was the only severe downside of this hotel.  It is right next to free way so outside of the rooms it is very loud but we had no problem with it once the door was closed. We could see the freeway from our room but couldn't hear it so we were happy with that.  You can also see the Disneyland fireworks. We could see it from our room/balcony. It's pretty amazing. They are so loud, all the car alarms go off.   Rooms were quite roomy and had a fridge which was nice   We got there well before check in and the front desk
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at Menage for 2 night.   It's a good hotel, handy to Disney, you can walk there in 15min or hop on shuttle which was very efficient ( $5 for all day return ) Door men and check in staff where friendly and helpful.   Rooms were spacious also clean and comfortable.   But possibly in need of a renovation to modernise them.  We were on freeway side and it was a little bit noisy but didn't worry us too much.   Wifi was good.   Pool and bar area looked nice, but a down side was people were smoking there which put us off using it.   Bar in the lobby was great for a cocktail or 2.     Overall we enjoyed our stay there and would consider staying there again.
Manager Response: Dear Roger R,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I'm pleased to hear that you found our staff helpful and our rooms clean.  We are looking forward to our full renovation, and we hope you will come and visit us again to enjoy the new rooms!  Warm regards, Rich

Summary Heading: Worst Starwood hotel I have every visited
Summary: My first, and last, visit to this “new” addition to the Starwood collection.  I stayed here for a short one night stay and was looking forward to having a new property to visit. Check in:  Easy enough. Recognized as a Platinum member, however I am used to a room upgrade not a room nightmare. Property: In my opinion, this is a motel, not a hotel.  Room doors face the parking lot and some face the very photogenic pool area.  I mention photogenic because it all looks much better in photos.  Some of the hallways are very dark and appear unsafe. Laundry machines are located in an open alcove near the elevators.  Parking lot is very dark in the evening. The entire property is in need of a complete overhaul.  Starwood frequently adds properties and does an excellent job of renovations.
Manager Response: Dear traveling_gal801,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I'm sorry that you did not enjoy your stay.  We use our guests opinions and comments to continually improve our operations for future guests, and your experience is being carefully reviewed by management.  Thank you again for staying with us.  Warm regards, Rich

Summary: This is a new addition to the Starwood collection...and I am not sure why.   Located just north of Disneyland, at a very busy freeway and streets intersection, this property is more of a motel than a hotel. Rooms are located on outside-facing walkways, and the noise from the Santa Ana Freeway is defining. A sign next to the elevator indicates they are renovating. And not a moment too soon.  Check in was smooth and friendly and I was recognized as a Starwood Platinum member. Room was assigned but no upgrade.  My room (207) was dated. The bedding was uncomfortable, with a mattress so soft, I practically disappeared on it. When I checked in to the room, the bed looked like after it was made, someone lied down on it. It was ruffled. (See photos.) Also, there was no bottled water in
Manager Response: Dear ChiefDennis,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I'm sorry that you had some concerns during your stay.  We value our guests' opinions and will review your comments carefully.  As a Starwood affiliate hotel, we are not yet branded, but offer our guests some of the same membership benefits that they enjoy at Starwood hotels, such as the ability to earn points during their stay.  We are looking forward to our renovation, and hope that you will visit again and see our new look.  Warm regards, Rich

Summary: We recently spent 4 days at this Hotel.  The rooms are comfy and very clean.  Bathroom small, but adequate.  The room could use better lighting in the bathrooms.  Hard to put makeup on in such a dimly lit room.  Nice bar and café.  Staff very friendly and accommodating.
Manager Response: Dear Marmel,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel, and for your kind words about our staff and facilities.  I'm so pleased you chose to spend your anniversary with us.  We hope you won't wait a year before visiting again!  Warm regards, Rich

Summary: Is regular hotel, nothing more that expected for the price. I will suggest add tissues in the room. and is unfortunate that the restaurant closes early. After that, the other option is to go to the Starbucks in front of the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear lydia c,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  We hope that you will visit us again so that you might enjoy some of our hotel's amenities.  Our beautiful pool has extended hours, and is absolutely the best place in the world from which to view the Disneyland fireworks.  The Palapa Bar is a tiki-style outdoor bar, open in the afternoons this summer by the pool deck.  We have a fitness center, guest laundry facilities, and a full-service restaurant.  We hope you will visit with us again and enjoy all that we have to offer.  Warm regards, Rich

Summary: Hotel is a little dated but renovations are in the works. Renovations didn't interfere with sleeping. Room is ok and location is favorable. They say they have bus service to Disney but this is a city service for a cost of three dollars a trip. If you can swing the few extra dollars stay at Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Dweyand,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.    I'm pleased that you were happy with our location.  Due to our proximity to Disneyland, many guests feel that the 10-15 minute walk to the main gates is preferable to the shuttle.  For those that prefer to ride, the Anaheim Resort Transit stops in our driveway for pickup regularly during the park's hours of operation.  We hope that you will visit with us again.  Warm regards, Rich

Summary Heading: Omg! There is no way this is a 3.5 star hotel!
Summary: No carpet in the room! Just concrete! No trash can and previous tenants poop stains in the toilet. The tub was peeling with black stains and mold around the grout. A cob web lines the ceiling behind the door in the toilet room. Dust covered the middle table between the two beds. Shockingly we stayed despite the flaws because we arrived late and didn't have many option. No comforters either, only thin blankets.   Gates close off sections of rooms. Those gates slam shut loudly, enough to awaken you multiple times a night. The room has a gnarly odor. Let me tell you, maybe they put me in the worst room since I booked on Priceline, not sure! But NEVER again!! Please be aware!
Manager Response: Dear Melissa H,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I am sorry that you had some problems with your stay.  Please feel free to contact the hotel directly if you feel you would like to discuss your concerns in more detail.  Warm regards, Rich

Summary: We stayed here for a week April 20-27th.  I did extensive research about this place before arriving so I knew exactly what I was getting, all the positives & the negatives.  This is a visually appealing property, the inner courtyard is very tropical.  The pool must be heated as it was the warmest pool I have ever been in, the hot tub as well, the hottest ever for a hotel.  Upon arrival we were greeted by the front desk & they were awesome our entire week.  They were so helpful.  We knew there was a parking charge of $12 a day but didn't know we could have the luxury of Valet parking our entire stay for $1 more per day.  We paid $13 a day & these guys hustled.  I seriously mean they RAN full spread to get your vehicle. Of course we tipped them everytime because they did such an
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not worth your money, slow service, dated rooms
