Best Travels,   Sureya Atoura Front Office Supervisor Sureya.atoura@hotelmenage.com

Summary: The staff are well informed from anything to do with Disneyland, shopping and other interests. Rooms were well appointed and clean. Housekeeping were excellent and we wished we could have the housekeeping come home with us to make our beds everyday !! Position to Disneyland was excellent with the nightly fireworks visible nightly was a bonus to our stay. We used the restaurant for dinners and breakfast and the food was tasty and servings generous and well priced. Thank you Menage foe making our stay memorable.
Manager Response: Dear TassMazz  Thanks for your review; our Service Team is truly dedicated to ensure our guests are comfortable accommodations experience an unparalleled level of service. We can’t wait to see you again!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: The nice thing about this hotel is how close it is to the Disneyland parks. There was a shuttle you could purchase from the hotel for $5 per person/round trip. The hotel was okay, it was really close to the street so it could be a bit noisy and the area is not the safest.
Manager Response: Dear Michelle D,  Thank you for your review.  Our proximity to Disneyland does make it convenient for our guest to visit the park by either walking or riding the ART shuttle.  Best travels,   Leo Flores Front Office Manager  leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: absolutely loved our stay there, staff were super friendly and everything was perfect.  was our first trip to the US and it couldn't have started better! walked to Disneyland was good, but after a long day i recommend the shuttle back! Restaurant was really nice and reasonably priced, bar staff were great!  only issue was wifi, but really, you're there to enjoy your holiday not be on the internet :) can't wait till we start organising our next trip - will definitely stay there again
Manager Response: Dear Kamu73  Thank you for your FIVE STAR REVIEW!  The Hotel Menage staff, strives to provide a level of service that is above industry standards.  We are happy that you enjoyed your stay, and look forward to seeing you on your next trip!  Best Travels  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: We stayed here twice last year, both time so we could go to Disneyland the first time we really like the hotel but a pipe burst in our room, staff were very helpful with helping moving room and getting our thing washed. We went back because staff are great we loved the location you can watch the firework and walk to Disneyland. The area is good and safe. Our room have always been clean and tidy, restocked daily. Bathroom could do with a bit of an update but otherwise would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear WoodyJ07  Thank you for your FIVE STAR REVIEW!  The Hotel Menage staff is dedicated to offering a level of service that is above industry standards.  We appreciate that you gave us another opportunity after the unfortunate incident on your first visit.  We look forward to your next visit!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: very close hotel for disneyland visit
Summary: The hotel was clean and very quaint however I had a small baby and found my room to be extremely loud.  It seemed like it was more of a party hotel than a family hotel and found there to be many older people with older children.
Manager Response: none

Summary: First of all when I think of "boutique" I think quaint and quirky yet still modern. This place  looks like someone painted over what they don't want to deal with. I must include that we were overcharged through Hotwire (never again will we use them) and paid way too much to stay in the basement hovels of this place. $300 CDN a night could get a 5 star hotel in Vancouver and yet here we are on a ground floor, blood on the hide-a-bed mattress, chipped and peeling enamel in the bathtub and dussssttyyy furniture everywhere. Thank goodness we only have to stay one night. The bed squeaks and gives anytime it gets sat on (we are of average height and weight) so any movement throughout the night is enough to wake the other person. Secondly there is no carpet in the room (but I guess
Manager Response: Dear Tellinatellina,  Thank you for posting your recent experience.  We apologize if your stay was not a pleasant one.  Please know that the issues that you have listed will not be overlooked. If you would like to further discuss your stay.  Please feel free to email us at the email listed below.  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: The staff were incredibly friendly and the Hotel was very clean and well kept. The room was great and we watched the Disneyland fireworks from the pool one night.There is a microwave in the foyer, and convenience stores across the street. We walked to Disneyland every day and the walk was fine and gave us time to eat breakfast on the way.  We had a fantastic time!
Manager Response: Dear Louise B,  Thank you for your FIVE STAR review!  Hotel Menage is happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay!  Our proximity to Disneyland does make it very convenient for our guest to either walk or take the ART over to the parks!  It also lets our guest enjoy the fireworks show from the pool area.  We look forward to your next visit!  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights in October when we took our kids to DIsneyland for Halloween time.    First off, let me say that this is most definitely and older hotel, so not everything is as up-to-date as some might like.  That being said, the room was clean, which is most important to me, and every staff member we encountered was happy to offer assistance of any kind.  Everyone was super friendly and we really enjoyed our stay.  The view of the fireworks from the pool was spectacular, and even from the balconies you could get a great view.  We had a room on the 4th floor right across from the elevators and it was surprisingly more quiet than I thought it would be.  There is a Starbucks just down the way, and a little mini market right next to it.  Down the block a little further
Manager Response: Dear ChristinaWard_2012,  Thank you so much for your pleasant words; our dedicated team enjoys hearing from Guest such as yourself and the great time that had with us.   Please look out for some exciting changes to come in the next few months.  Best Travel  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotel

Summary: Our family of eight stayed at the Ménage Hotel for four nights. It's location is good for an easy walk to Disneyland and local restaurants.  The rooms are large and comfortable and the facilities of the hotel served us well The on site restaurant was very good and we enjoyed a number of meals in it, the bar service was excellent A good family hotel, at a reasonable price
Manager Response: none

Summary: We paid 150$ per night but it was not worthy. The room is like a motel room, the only difference is that it is a little bit bigger. The Bathroom is old and unclean. Some of the lights lamps didn’t work which made the room kind of dark. One of the negative sides of staying in this hotel is its location: very close to highway which could be really annoying. However, it is very close to Disneyland (walking distance) and if you are lucky you could enjoy the Disney night fireworks’ ritual from your room as I did.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We stay here during EVERY Disney visit
Summary: I can't say enough about the Hotel Menage, we won't stay anywhere else. I love the fact that you can see the Disney fireworks from the hotel, so we don't have to wait around to see them in the crowded park. I always appreciate a hotel that has a bar or lounge inside the hotel, it gives me the option of "staying in" if we don't feel like venturing out somewhere for food or drinks.  We were a bit disappointed last time we went, however, because the outdoor bar was closed and we had to stay inside.  The food and drinks are pricy so beware.  Rooms and beds are comfortable.  The pool being open 24 hours is a huge perk, although the spa was filled with foam last time we were there. Wasn't very inviting.  I wish the parking was free.  Service has always been fantastic.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Hotel Menage is a very nice hotel within walking distance to Disneyland, but also on the ART stop.  They allowed us to check out a couple of rooms so we got to pick.  The first floor room had no carpet and had a high ceiling where you could see pipes.  It was a very nice room, but we selected the room on the 2nd floor.  This room had carpet and felt more comfortable to us.  We had a view of the pool which is heated and open 24 hour.  The kids loved jumping in the pool for a bit while on break from the Parks.  There is a poolside bar, however it was not open during our stay. From the pool area and those rooms facing the pool, you can watch the Disneyland Fireworks.  This Hotel also had an exercise room, but with all our walking we figured we had enough exercise.  The have an
Manager Response: Dear Terry7e,  Thank you so much for your FIVE STAR review!  Hotel Menage is thrilled to hear that you truly enjoyed your stay.    We look forward to your next visit!   Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We stayed for an extended weekend celebrating our anniversary and absolutely loved this spot. The #1 perk was the 24 hour pool and hot tub! The breakfast buffet was simple but good. The thing that drove me to write this review however was the staff. Kent checked us in and was incredibly nice and helpful. We showed up well before check in time but he was incredibly accommodating and got us in to a room early. Friendly staff like Kent are what make us return customers. The rates here are very competitive with other hotels close to Disneyland. Uber rides to and from the park and Downtown Disney were only $5 so we didn't bother with the shuttle, though that is a convenient option as well. It was so nice to be able to come back from the park at 1am and swim in the heated pool.  Also
Manager Response: Dear Barry S  Thank you for your FIVE STAR review.  Hotel Menage is dedicated to providing a level of service that is above industry standards.  We will definitely share the kind words that you had for Kent.  Best Travels!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Stayed at this hotel with hubby & three kids (21,15,15) from 25 Dec to 30 Dec, we had 2 rooms. Staff were lovely & very helpful, rooms were clean, we were a little away from the traffic side but not facing the pool side but the traffic noise was not an issue at all. We would happily stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Melissa D  Thank you for your review.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  We are always happy to help.  We look forward to see you and your family on your next visit!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: We just stayed over the holidays (9 days) in Dec. 2015.  I have never written a negative review before on a website because I know many things that are not pleasant at a hotel is not the fault of how the hotel is run.  My story is different.  This hotel only has 2 small laundry facilities which have a total of 3 dryers.  The morning of check out, I asked the desk person for a 15-30 min. extension for the 12 noon check out because the 5 loads of laundry I was doing with only 3 dryers might not get done.  You might say--why are you doing laundry on vacation--but our daughter doesn't live with us and needed her clothes to repack before her flight back to her home. The desk person said no!!!!  When I went down to check out at noon, I overheard one of the desk persons telling a phone
Manager Response: Dear Cathleen P  Thank you for sharing your experience.  Our staff strives to provide a service level that is above industry standards.  We apologize if this was not the case during your stay with us.  Please feel free to contact me at your earliest connivance to further discuss your stay.  Warm Regards,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: This is our second time at Hotel Menage.  This time our room was right above the dumpster.  At 6am they must have emptied 6 dumpsters.  It was extremely loud and we were unable to get back to sleep.  Additionally the room overlooked the busy intersection and there was constant noise.    The rooms were clean the and the staff is very helpful and friendly.    We ate at the restaurant twice and it was very price for not a lot of food.  Transportation to Disneyland is awesome.  The ART bus comes into the Menage parking lot.  You can purchase tickets at the hotel.  That is definitely a plus.    I don't think we will be returning though.
Manager Response: Dear Jsteele435  Thank you for posting your review. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the service level of our staff.   Our unique location and proximity to Disneyland, does have its advantages and some disadvantages.  We do offer different room types with different room locations throughout our hotel, with no visible view of the street and highway.  We would like the opportunity to earn your business again.  Please feel free to contact us at any time, to the email address listed below.     Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Multiple stays at this great hotel
Summary: My wife and I have stayed here many times and just keep coming back, it's a great hotel overall. It's within walking distance to Disneyland park OR there is a shuttle available (for purchase, the shuttle is part of the Anaheim transit system) for only $5 a day. The rooms are fairly spacious with BIG beds and a couch. All rooms have a flat screen TV and a mini-fridge. Staff has always been friendly and helpful. Two of the best features are the 24 hour pool/jacuzzi area and then at night the proximity to the fireworks, they are super close and very loud! Even if you don't have a room facing them you can walk over the balcony and enjoy them right in your face!  The hotel overall is a little dated, you can see it showing some age but with all the other positives we pretty much stay
Manager Response: Dear Trav619,  Thank you so much for posting your review!  We are thrilled to hear that Hotel Menage is your hotel of choice when visiting Disneyland.  Our proximity to Disneyland gives our guest a front row seat to the firework show, while enjoying our 24 hour pool and Jacuzzi.  We look forward to your next visit!  Best Travels  Leo Flores  Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: I was on a couples trip to Disneyland and we stayed at this hotel for one night.  It is about a 15 minute walk to the Disneyland gates, the only bad part of the walk is that you need to cross a highway on and off ramp.   I was ok crossing the on/off ramp just the two of us, but with kids I would not want to make that crossing in the dark.  A really good part about the hotel is the parking.  You have to pay, I think about $12, but that covers two days which I don't think any other hotels in the area do.  On your check out day you can stay parked there as long as you want.  The hotel actually had a really lively bar area in the lobby, which surprised me.    The entire hotel is fenced in, and you can only access it through the lobby or with your hotel room key, so it felt pretty
Manager Response: Dear Rachel A,  Thank you so much for your review!  Our parking policy is truly an advantage for guest that are looking to visit Disneyland  for multiple days!  We definitely look forward to your next visit!  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: Good location to Disney but traffic noise bad.
Summary: Hotel is in a great location with easy access to Disneyland. Food was excellent and the breakfast was yummy and great value. Rooms were small and dark and decor quite worn and old. It backs onto a freeway so traffic noise is an issue if you are a light sleeper. Based on the state of the rooms I wouldn't return to stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Suera and Edwin were absolutely amazing!!! Such fantastic friendly service and a lovely hotel. The rooms are comfortable and the lobby is very nice. Parking here is $12 here while at the park it is $18. And we are easily able to walk to the park entrance.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to chill after Disney!
Summary: 2 blocks away real close to park, gas stations with market and food all around. we are going back in FEB reasonable price. The bar is always open inside and out. The resturuant food is so/so but we usually eat at places outside of the hotel. The only downsid
Manager Response: none

Summary: Went on Vacation to Disneyland hoping to relax with my family. Upon arrival it didn't seem too bad front desk was helpful and the lobby looked nice, wish i could say that about the room. First off the lamps in the room had a nasty thick layer of dust and one of our lamps didn't work. The bedsheets had these nasty dark stains on them and when we pulled them off to flip them over the matress wasn't too pleasing of a view either. Thos place honestly made me feel as the room service does a careless job especially after i found a nasty pair of sox in plain sight sitting in the closet next 2 broken hangers. Also the fan in the restroom didn't work and the shower head wasn't a pleasant sight. I really held my self back from being negative because this was supposed to be a vacation and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here over Christmas and it was a great alternative to staying onsite at Disney. As other reviews said, it's a close walk to the park. You do walk over the highway but it's a straight walk down the road. I took the ART bus one day which costs $5 for a one-day multi-use pass. Hotel Menage is the last stop before the park so it's a quick ride.  Pros: Really comfortable beds. The best we had in our weeklong road trip.  We were in a room facing the pool which minimize the highway noise.  On-site restaurant is a nice options since nothing else is really walkable given the highway location.  The staff was really helpful from valet to front desk to restaurant.  Hotel is dog friendly and has a dedicated grassy area with baggies and a trash can.   Cons: The room has high
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice clean hotel. A little dated and I found the sink in the room rather than the bathroom a bit odd. The hotel is close to Disneyland but it's a fairly arduous walk uphill so best to use the shuttle bus which is NOT free. If you are unlucky to have noisy neighbours don't expect to sleep you can hear everything your neighbours are doing including showering. Staff were great and really friendly and helpful. I would stay again just bring earplugs.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: NIce hotel close to Disney parks
Summary: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights in late November and the rooms were great. The location to Dinseyland and California Adventure makes it even better, just a short 10/15 minute walk. Admittedly, after spending all day on your feet at the parks, this can be a bit of a hassle back at night but there is a cheap ART bus that stops right out front of the Menage so there is always that option too.  One downer here is the noise level from the highway and main road literally right next to the hotel. We didnt notice this noise though, although I have a feeling it was mostly because most nights we would just pass out tired in bed but this may be an issue for some people.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great staff but don't stay for that alone.
Summary: We stayed here for a considerably amount of time and safe to say we didn't enjoy our stay! The house cleaning staff are rude (Knocking on rooms with clearly visible DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door) and the room with the firework view was a terribly loud from them and the freeway in-front of the hotel. When it was our turn for the house cleaning to come in to clean at 4:30 in the afternoon they did such a poorly job at it. Rooms - were always dusty and not cleaned properly, lighting was terrible with only two lamps for lighting in the main bedroom.  After a week of checking out still waiting for the security deposit back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We came for our anniversary and they gave us 2 free cocktails and surprised us with a full cheese, nuts and fruit plate. They even brought us a complimentary bottle of wine! We were less than a 10 minute walk from the entrance to Disneyland and could have taken the shuttle if we wanted.  We could even hear and see the fireworks from our room! Everyone was so accommodating and friendly! I would highly recommend staying here, such a treat. We will definitely be staying here again :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect place to crash after long day at Disneyland
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights in October while we were in Disneyland. We requested early check-in when we booked since our flight got in at 9am from Vancouver, and they happily accommodated our request and when we got there at 10;30am our room was all ready for us :) It was within perfect walking distance to the park, 5-10 mins, which even after a long day at the park was not too long for our hurting feet. The rooms are nice, we had one facing harbour blvd. We could barely hear the noise from the roads like others said they could... But maybe it was because we were so tired after our days. The pool area was nice, although I think we only used it once... But the best part of the pool was it had a PERFECT view of the fireworks at the end of the night :) So instead of
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Menage was clean but in need of a remodel, especially the bathroom. Noisy but after ten hours at Disneyland we were too tired to notice. It's a  ten minute easy walk to Disneyland. The ART bus runs every twenty minutes and picks you up at the door. Great view of the fireworks.    The Menage has a great staff. Kent Tran is fantastic!  He was knowledgeable, friendly and helpful.   We would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is in a great location for a trip to Disneyland. We used Uber and it was cheaper and faster than paying for parking at the resort. The bellmen were incredibly helpful throughout our entire trip.   Our room faced the freeway and was a little noisy. Just bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper like me!   The pool was a highlight for our kids when we weren't at Disneyland!   This hotel is also a great place to watch the Disney fireworks!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: It's more than just a hotel. Personalized service no less!
Summary: It may not be the most aesthetically designed building in town but the service these guys provide make up what is lacking in that department, hence the five! Kudos to their manager Erik, Suraya and Lauren of the front desk and Toni of restaurant.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I would have been fine with this place if it was identified as a 2 star hotel, didn't charge a parking fee, and had at least free coffee and pastries in the morning. I stayed at a 2 star place across the street just a little over a year ago and it was a better experience. My room was decent but not especially clean, the wifi really didn't work, the pool was pretty nice but the hot tub was a little murky. They kind of up-play the poolside bar but it was dark and deserted. The evening staff when I checked in weren't very welcoming, but I have a feeling they have to deal with a lot of irritation from guests at check-in when they spring the parking fees and the security deposit on you. If you stay here, you won't be 100% miserable but I really don't think this place is deserving of
Manager Response: none

Summary: Friendly and professional services from the staff especially from the supervisor Erik and Frank (bar) . They gave us what we needed. The room we had is spacious and neat. We complained about a broken lamp and they fixed it right away.   The view is nice and from outside of our room you will see the Disney fireworks. And what I love is it is just an 8-minute walk going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Jett C,  Thank You so much for your FIVE STAR review!  Our staff strives to provide service that is above the industry standard.  We will definitely share the kind words you had for Erik and Frank.  We look forward to your next visit!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager  leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: one of the best hotels i have stayed during my east to west coast road trip. the pool was big, the bar was open till late hours, clean and tidy room, and with friendly staff.  excellent  reception was always extended by front desk personnel - Erik Libid, and warm smiles overflowing from Frank, at the bar section.
Manager Response: Dear Edgar C  Thank you so much for your FIVE STAR REVIEW.  Erik, and Frank both enjoy what they do, and they appreciate the recognition.  Best Travels!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: My family and I stayed here from October 24-31 and had a great time, from the staff to Frank the bartender (the best) all very friendly and helpful on just about everything we needed. We try our best to visit the Disneyland resort every year and living out of state can be expensive so we try to budget ourselves on all aspects well vacationing and I can say this place is perfect for it, you have a great pool open 24-7 awesome firework view refrigerator in room everything we needed to enjoy our stay. As for location it is a short walk to the parks 10-15 minutes but if you have a family like mine and spend the hole day at the park the walk back can be a little hard. We have stayed in plenty of Hotels around the Disneyland resort and they ALL have flaws. We would we stay here again
Manager Response: Dear Sleepy505,  Thank you so much for your review!  We are happy to hear that you found a great value in choosing our hotel.  We will share your kind words with Frank  We look forward to seeing you and your family soon!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary Heading: I wouldn't call it a boutique hotel...
Summary: We just got back from a one week stay at Hotel Menage and although we had a nice trip I wouldn't go out of my way to recommend this hotel. My major problem is the hotel labelling itself as a boutique hotel when I feel like it is just a few steps up from a motel. The rooms have been renovated recently but the work seems a bit shoddy (you can see paint drips, bathroom fixtures not installed properly). The rooms themselves feel a bit small. The toilet and shower area is separate from the sink area which I didn't mind but the fact that the coffee and tea station were on the bathroom vanity meant a lot less counter space. There was also no towel rack for hand towels or designated space for the mini fridge which just sat out in the open taking up more floor space. Minor details but
Manager Response: none

Summary: Not sure where my review for this place went...  We normally stay at hotels closer to the entrance of Disneyland.  This is a long walk for tired little kids at the end of the day.  I should have just taken a cab -- it doesn't cost that much for 3 people.  The best part of the hotel, of course, is the fabulous view of the Disney fireworks.  They are amazingly close, and you don't have a giant crowd of people packing you in, and afterwards you can go back into your hotel room and go to bed!  Just be careful not to get a room too close to the freeway.  The sound of traffic is very loud even from inside the room.  The restaurant is casual and tasty and we had both breakfast and dinner there.  The menu inside and outside are the same.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close enough, but far enough away
Summary: Just a one night stay here as we enjoyed a few days at Disney. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the park entrance, so you are close enough to access it, but far enough away to not be falling over children in Mickey Mouse ears every time you set foot outside. From the outside, the hotel is an odd sort of olive colour and to be honest, doesn’t look overly appealing, but inside it’s great.  Our room (Level 5) was large and modern, big bed, good shower and lots of room to move. All of the staff that we encountered were friendly and happy to help. There is a restaurant at the hotel, however we didn’t use it, so I’m not entirely sure what it provides and at what time. We did however avail ourselves of the free business centre to print off boarding passes etc. The hotel has a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel isn't very clean or updated....
Summary: I stayed at Hotel Menage for the Disney half marathon weekend. First off, the location is great since it's 10-15 mins walk from disneyland,you can also take the shuttle bus which comes every 15-20 mins and takes a couple minutes to get there. However other than the distance to Disney there are things where I wasn't impressed with and visitors should be aware of. This hotel is more like a motel than a hotel. Even though it was "renovated", the renovation probably only updated with new bed frame and sink area. The whole bathroom including the bath tub was very old. Bathtub and door were cracking and everywhere wasn't very clean. Also, during the first couple of nights we found out out of the 5 pillows that we had, 4 of them were dirty.....we had to ask for clean and fresh pillow
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is very close to Disneyland. If you like to get out and explore then I would recommend staying at the Menage. The breakfast buffet is very average for the price you have to pay. Parking is expensive and they are not willing to give any discounts for booking and paying in advance. The room was satisfactorily cleaned. The staff we're very helpful and knowledgeable. Pool is awesome and the beds are very comfortable. Fireworks at night but we knew that before booking.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the second time my husband and I have stayed here and it's still perfect. We arrived from Australia early in the morning and the staff were more than happy to let us use the bathrooms to freshen up and store our bags untill our room was ready. We had the pool view king room and it was great. Very spacious, bar fridge & what an amazing view from our balcony of the nighttime Disney fireworks. It has a big 24 hour pool, outdoor and indoor bar, restaurant and laundry which is handy when on holidays. Disney is only a short 15 minute walk or you can get the shuttle bus for a few dollars. There is a Starbucks and convenience store across the road and plenty of restaurants at Disney and around the area. Thanks to all the staff for another wonderful stay!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The family recently visited DISNEYLAND,which was great. Hotel menage was our choice hotel, and it was a very good place, the room was very clean, didn't smell of cigarettes, the beds were comfortable. The breakfast buffet was good. All the staff were extremely nice. The pool was great. And well stocked with towels. It always smelled nice when you walked in. The family wouldn't have any issues if we decide to stay again on the next visit. 👍well done.
Manager Response: none

Summary: First stay at Hotel Menage. Took the family to Disneyland for a 3 day trip. Hotel grounds were clean and well kept. Hotel staff was great. Rooms were typical size. This is a "garden style open facility" not an interior hall hotel. Just FYI, some people are concerned or not comfortable with large picture windows looking out into a common walkway. Didn't bother us. Rooms were clean and our room was freshened up everyday with helpful staff. Bathroom fan did not work. Beds and pillows were comfortable. Bar staff very friendly. Frank was the best. He took care of getting the kids something to drink while the adults ordered "after Disney beverages"! Breakfast buffet was good. Everything was fresh everyday. A little pricey for a family of 4 every morning but the food was good. Pool
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A good value close to Disneyland
Summary: Pros:  Price, great pool, nice bar area, good food Cons:  I lost my shins here :). No fridge in the our room.   I was here for travel agent familiarization.  We arrived too early to checkin (around noon).  The clerk at the front desk was courteous, as was everyone we encountered during our stay.  We stowed our bags and they said they would be delivered to our room later in the day.  We hopped on the ART shuttle and headed over to Disneyland.   This property is nice because it is currently covered by two art routes, so the service ended up faster than every 20 minutes for us (YMMV).  From this hotel, Disneyland is the next stop, so that is nice too for your anxious little ones!  I ended up coming back at about 5pm.  My luggage hadn't been delivered as of yet, but the bell man
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed 3 nights earlier this year, great location, friendly staff especially in the bar! Menu had a good selection, the room was comfortable and we had a lovely view of the pool. The pool is open 24 hours which is great, would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the hotel ménage for 5 nights and was thoroughly impressed by the cleaning staff who were efficient and always had a smile ready for me in the mornings. Room was always spotless and kept in order. Front desk staff however let the team down which is unfortunate given they're the first people you meet when walking in the door... There hardly ever seemed to be anyone behind the desk to begin with and then when there was someone there they were pretending to be super busy (one guy was on his phone) or talking to one another. Had to wait for a couple of them to finish their conversation (not work related) at one point before they spoke to me. Not a good look when you're so visible. Overall a nice hotel for the price point, great pool area and fantastic music choices. Rooms
Manager Response: none

Summary: Reading the 1-2 star reviews baffles me lol....it's really not that bad as they make it seem. Honestly, I was actually a bit nervous booking this hotel after reading these reviews, but I am glad it wasn't that bad. Yeah, the rooms may need to be updated such as the bathroom, coffee maker, and AC unit, but those things didn't bother us. Front desk agents were great, bar and 24 hour pool were a plus after a long day of walking to, from, and around Disneyland, and their beds are soft like clouds. Even though we were on the top floor facing the overpass, we could still hear traffic from our room but that didn't bother our sleep, even for my BF that is a light sleeper. Don't let those low reviews scare you, this hotel isn't as bad as it seems :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: With having drivin the last 245 miles down the coast ,then hit the LA traffic. We where 7 hours in the car and pretty much over it all, and just wanted to rest. We found the hotel very easy. We got a parking spot right out front. checking was a breeze and we where in our room with in 15mins of arriving. Brilliant. The Hotel is in a great location with only a 10 min walk to Disney Land and all the attractions. 2 blocks the other way is a Wall Mart and other shops and fast food outlets. We had dinner twice in the restaurant and it was great food , and ok prices. The Bar located along side was a wellcome site after a days outings . And Frank the bar man , new what drinks we wanted and had them set up as we waked to 20 feet from the lift to bar.  We ended up staying there 3 days .
Manager Response: Dear davidpaulae2015  We appreciate your FIVE Star review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay while with us.  We will definitely share your kind words with Frank.   We look forward to hosting your next trip!  Best travels   Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: Stayed for three nights and enjoyed it. You are a short walk to Disneyland. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Wondered initially why they seem to be the only hotel in the area to have a 24 hour pool. Located beside the I-5! You couldn't make enough noise to outdo that! The rooms however were quiet and clean. Bonus was watching the Disneyland fireworks from the pool!
Manager Response: Dear Tim F,  Thank you for your recent review!  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and found the value you were seeking during your visit to the Anaheim Resort area.  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leo.flores@hotelmenage.com

Summary: The rooms have been updated in the cheapest way possible. They looked dirty from being so old and un-maintained. They claimed an inside bar, an outside bar and a restaurant but all were ghost towns or unopened - the bar served a drink that tasted just plain dirty. The only positive things were friendly staff and being so close to Disneyland (15 minute trip on a sidewalk). It turned into a place to stick your luggage, sleep and shower but other than that not worth it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great place to stay for Disney visitors. It's also actually very affordable. Staying in a high floor meant that the noise was minimised. It's a good sized room, the bathrooms need a slight upgrade but still very functional. It does have a nice setting for the price. My only wish was that there were better tea making facilities (not a coffee drinker).   It's a short 10 - 15 minute walk to the Disney area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Okay place to lay your head
Summary: Had a room on fourth floor facing pool.  Road noise was SOOOOO loud when outside, but rooms have great sound-proofing.  Attached restaurant was expensive for low quality food,  Rooms were clean but could really use some tlc.  Never saw any staff at outside bar area, but lots of dirty dishes left from about 7pm on.  Felt very secure.  Lots of gates and key card required to go anywhere.  Valet and front desk staff very nice and pretty helpful.  ART bus only showed up about half the time it was supposed to.  Last stop before Disney so often over full, and last stop when returning from Disney, so a 10 min walk is often quicker!

Summary: If you understand that this hotel is a little older, everything is good.  It is located on the back side of Disneyland.  I had a great view to the fireworks which were nice but loud.  The road noise was pretty substantial.  The pool area looked really clean and nice. The staff were very pleasant. Restaurant was average.  They charge for parking here but it was reasonable at $13.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Fairly close to the main entrance to Disneyland and on shuttle route. Onsite bar and restaurant serving decent beer, wine and food. Rooms are a bit dated but otherwise fine. Good sound-proofing and air conditioning. On-site swimming pool and large deck area. Like most Disneyland hotels, surrounded by freeways. Convenience stores and restaurants close by. Reasonably priced valet parking
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had the opportunity to stay at this hotel with our family. It was fine, since our main goal was Disneyland, but the hotel was simply average. Nothing bad, but nothing great. The room was small with a huge random table. The bathroom was old and very outdated-- the tub didn't have a plug which made bathing children tricky.   Also when they say it's a block away from Disneyland, it's a LIE. it's a block away from the back of the park, but a long way from the entrance. You will need to buy a bus pass which is extra money.   Also, this hotel is right in the middle of the freeway so it's crazy noisy.

Summary Heading: Looks good at a quick glance, but is pretty rundown on closer inspection
Summary: Pros: The style is great, location for Disney is pretty good. Located on the ART line with a ticket kiosk in the lobby. Love the fact that the pool is 24 hours.  Bar/restaurant had good food and service. Seemed clean.  No coffee bar in the hotel but a decent Starbucks is across the street.  Cons: beds are uncomfortable. Like very uncomfortable. Lots of sort of broken shoddily repaired items all around the hotel. Things that would take almost no time to fix properly which is almost worse than major issues because it feels like they just don't care. No breakfast or shuttle to Disney included in the rates.   Would I stay here again? Probably not. There are a zillion hotels in the area and I would probably have chosen one closer to Disney and with better amenities.

Summary: booking the hotel is a problem, kept charging my credit randomly, concierge does not know his right info, bathroom floors only get cleaned once in a 10 day stay, always having to go to front desk for coffee, hot tub to low of water often, pool bathrooms are disgusting (don't use them), this hotel not what the pictures really look like

Summary Heading: Save Your Money--This is NOT a Boutique Hotel
Summary: This is a dingy, gloomy place, with creepy, dark tunnels that connect the outdoor routes to the rooms. A person could get mugged or raped in one of those places and no one would know. The rooms are dirty, rundown, and the beds sag. The walls are gouged and the bathroom is so icky, I don't want to know what its problems are. I'm told it was a branded hotel and is now an orphan. A management person told me that Sheraton is going to turn it into a Four Points, and if true, I'd say they have their work cut out for themselves. Until that happens, I'd advise you to avoid this pest hole. There are bugs in here and getting a box of tissues would require an act of Congress. Summary: Spent 1 week of our vacation from Australia here at the Menage with my family (2 teenage boys) and another family.  We had a blast.  10 minutes walk to Disneyland, 10 minute cab ride to the baseball.  Great food for a good price in hotel restaurant.  The staff were awesome with their help of all our questions.  Beds were very comfy and rooms were clean.  The fireworks from Disneyland were like they were just for us right above our heads. Thank you so much

Summary: This hotel sits right beside I 5 and has outside entrances instead of inside halls. The traffic from the highway made it very hard to sleep. The beds were comfortable and clean, but we can not recommend it due to the notice level. There is a nice pool and a coffee shop. Parking is $20

Once again we could see the fireworks from the end of the corridor, They seemed a lot louder than last time maybe its because of Disney's 60th anniversary? We had a small health issue and when we phoned down to reception Daisy was extremely helpful and caring and helps us contact a Dr.  The location is brilliant, really close to Disney and because its near 2 highways makes it super easy to get everywhere. Summary Heading: Don't listen to the negative reviews, would stay again!

The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the air-conditioner was working well. The fridge was handy and the shower had excellent pressure. All good points.  Although there was music playing around the pool area during the evening, the music was promptly turned off every night at 9pm (strictly enforced by hotel). I am a light sleeper and once I closed my door, I couldn't even hear the music prior to 9pm anyway. Summary: This is my 3rd stay at Hotel Menage and I have always had a great experience. Very close to Disneyland where you can Uber or take the bus that picks you up right in front. It is a great value and still close to Disneyland if you don't want to spend the high amounts at the Disney hotels. I will stay there again.

I do not see this listed anywhere.  I do not like surprise fees upon arrival. Rooms are very small and a bit worn out for the price. A big seller was the outdoor tiki bar...they never opened it for 3 days. Major let down.  It was perfect pool weather. Housekeeping is very bad.  See note below. Buffet breakfast (friendly staff) was tasty and reasonably priced energized us to have fun times at the park (easy walk to the park). All the Hotel staff (concierges, Front desk, Buffet staff, Bartenders, waitresses) were outstanding and more than willing to assist us and genuinely wanted us to have great stay.  They went above and beyond which helped us to relax and have confidence in accessing other services (eg Outlets at Orange Thanks Michael).  Bonus was a Taco Bell and Quicky mart (Chevron) across the street for a quick meal and beverages.

Sunday we stayed in our room until 4pm since it was extremely hot that day.  We counted 9 sirens passing by, but that was nothing compared to the number that passed in the night and the "cat fight" 2 doors down from us. Summary: It is impossible to be in a completely adult zone when you are near disney, but this is certainly as close as it gets.  The hotel isn't the fanciest, but it is a nice mid range boutique hotel.  The rooms have the basic necessities, and the common areas are really great.   The pool is the true highlight to this location, you can get a cocktail at the bar and hang at the pool.  The pool is also 24hrs which is a huge plus.  We did a long day at the park and just wanted to relax and the pool and spa were perfect.  There were some kids there, but it wasn't an explosion of toddlers running about.    The staff was also great, helpful and courteous.  If they did some upgrades to the furniture and fixtures in the rooms I think this hotel would be even better.  The restaurant was good

Summary: We stayed here for our disneyland trip. Room was clean and spacious and had everything we needed.  The hotel is nice and modern and the bar and reception staff were friendly and helpful. The pool was great. The hotel was close to the freewar so we were glad that our room was not facing it otherwise it could have had a lot of traffic noise. Best of all about the hotel was it's location.  Just a short 10 minute walk to disneyland and downtown Disney was amazing!

Summary: After reading many reviews, we decided to stay at this location.  We ha stayed here before, but back when it was a Holiday Inn.  We knew the walking distance, not bad, but a little tough after 17 hours in the parks.  It probably takes 10-15 minutes.  The good part is that there is really only 1 road to cross.    There were really no issues.  The room was clean.  The traffic noise on the Harbor Blvd side was not bad.  The pool area is pretty nice.  Only one elevator was working, but not a problem.  We did not eat at the resturant, nor did we get any drinks.  Pretty good price for the season.  The furniture could use updating in lobby and rooms.  WATCH OUT for the food end of the bed frame, OUCH!  My only issue is that I called in for reservation and gave my credit card

Summary: A great hotel to stay at when visiting Disneyland. ART shuttle bus arrives at hotel every 20 mins. Easy access to Outlets at Orange, Disneyland, The Cheesecake Factory at Garden Walk from hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a convenience store and Starbucks across road from hotel. Try the Nachos at the hotel restaurant - they are amazing. Very noisy outside due to close proximity to freeway. The pool was very dirty.

Summary: I love this hotel.  Great customer service from check-in until check-out.  The rooms are beautiful and clean and it's only a short 10 minute walk to Disneyland!  Watched the park fireworks from right outside my room the first night!  Spent quite a few hours at the bar in the lobby talking to other guest from around the world and the bartender Frank was the best!  I would definitely stay here again, and it's the only hotel I'll book when planning a trip to Disneyland.

And there's a wedding reception here, filled with celebrating twentysomethings madly buying many, many drinks at the inside bar. So, no shortage of customers. But the Palapa Bar is still closed.  That bears repeating. They're not opening their most popular feature on a Saturday night, with plenty of customers already on the premises, because they're understaffed. Excuse me?? Summary Heading: BEST hotel experience for a Disney vacation!
Summary: BEST hotel you can stay at for Disneyland! Everything was absolutely perfect! The location is a quick walk to Disneyland, has the perfect view for fireworks so you can get away from the crowded Mainstreet in the park, perfectly clean rooms (shoutout to housekeeping ),and wonderful front desk staff (especially valet parking guys, always opened the door for everyone coming in). We had a little issue when we first arrived with the AC, but the awesome maintenance guy Martin and the lovely ladies at the front handled it right away, got us in a new room, and even gave us complimentary drinks from the bar (such an unexpected but nice surprise). I will never stay at any other hotel again when coming to Disneyland!

Summary: This place is awesome.  I can have my little dog.  The pool and jacuzzi are open 24 hours and the place has a great atmosphere! Everyone was friendly. The only reason I took a start away is because they don't have comp breakfast. Other than that I can't complain.

Summary: Walking distance (10 mins) to Disneyland. Also has a shuttle every 10 mins or so. Taco Bell, Starbucks and a gas station across the street. Staff was friendly, attached restaurant was good, pool was fun, has a hot tub. And was well priced!

Summary Heading: Walking Distance to Disneyland - Great Choice!

The room was clean and spacious for what we paid. The bathroom was clean and there was more than enough space in the room to store our belongings. The lobby was nice and the breakfast at the hotel restaurant was worth the price, and the 24-hour hotel pool was a welcome site after a long day at DIsneyland. We were very pleased with this hotel and would most certainly stay here again when we will return to Disney.

Summary Heading: Two-star rooms in a three-and-a-half star property
Summary: The Hotel Menage is billed as a three-and-a-half star hotel on many websites. The rooms, however, are dated two-star quality, albeit with new furniture.  The grounds are nice and the staff was friendly, but the room quality was a big disappointment. This was our family's fourth trip to Disneyland in six years, we had stayed at the Red Lion, Camelot and Ayers previously.  For the price and distance to the park, we would return to any of these other hotels before returning here to the Hotel Menage.  Overall it wasn't a horrible experience, but it did fall below expectations.

That really really sucks and then you get charge $12 to park your car! That should be included in the hotel price and the front desk staff wasn't friendly at all! I give this hotel 2 star.

Summary: We make a yearly trip to the Disneyland Resort.  This year we stayed at the Hotel Ménage.  We thought the pool courtyard was very picturesque and relaxing.  The rooms were clean and the service was excellent.  The in house restaurant, American Grill, was also very good.  Request rooms facing pool and fireworks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just finished a week long stay at the Hotel Ménage. Myself and my fiancé had a beautiful single room with a king bed and sofa. It was exceptionally clean and we slept very well. We booked back in a April and were a little disappointed at the location of the room. It was in the centre of the hotel with one window that looked out into the hall. We felt like we were in a cave and slept the best sleep we have had in a long time. The staff were also exceptional each person helpful! They helped us arrange shuttles and plan our days in Anaheim and it was fantastic. The restaurant was good and had some fun happy hour specials. We ate there several times and had our food delivered to our spot by the 24 hour pool. We were in paradise and still were able to enjoy the fun at Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I checked in for two nights in this hotel. I got the one king bed room, with sofa bed. It was a nice room, its clean. Room: clean , has a nice rest room, very spacious. Though , they need to clean the shower head because its old and it has deposits from water.  Bed: king bed is just enough for me and my husband, though my son needs to sleep in sofa bed. The sofa bed was in very bad shape. I tried to lay down on it and i can hear and feeeeeeel the spring of the bed, its  very uncomfortable.  When I checked the bed sheets  it has crumbs on it and you can tell that they were not changed. Good thing i always bring  bed sheets with me to cover it , coz i know this will happen. I dont trust hotels.  Pool : its open 24 hours!!! Customer service: the lady in fron desk with long curly
Manager Response: none

Summary: Went to watch the fireworks from Disneyland. Disneyland fireworks get a 5 star, hotel Menage bar gets a star. Cant get coffee or tea outside, you have to go inside the hotel to the restaurant. Bar staff were not overly service oriented and they were not busy. Coffee wasnt great and not a great selection of desserts.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at several Anaheim hotels over the last 5 years (always a great experience) but I think this is our favorite so far. Yes it's a further walk to the parks but the 24 hr pool makes it worth it :) being able to relax in the Jacuzzi after a long day on your feet is unbeatable, and the kids loved being able to uss the pool after wards. Its easy to get to as well. Rooms were clean and decent sized, service was great and we lives the atmosphere of the hotel overall. We did have dinner in the hotel restaurant as well, which was fantastic!! We would definitely stay here again.

Summary: Clean and tidy. Very comfy bed and available wifi, not the strongest connection but it was enough to share some photos online which was all we needed. Lovely staff especially at the bar, I did read complaints about the traffic noise, and considering we were a road facing room we didn't have any issues. If you have been walking around Disneyland all day, you fall asleep fairly quickly!

Summary: With some help from a friend she referred me to Hotel Menage and it was a great experience ! Really easy to get to and so close to the Disney parks. Room was very spacious and comfortable. Had its own mini fridge so you can put drinks or food inside. For breakfast they have a buffet for only $13! Delicious and good variety of selection. Next time I plan a Disney trip I will be staying at hotel menage :)

The rooms were dusty, the carpets clearly not vacuumed, the bathrooms were stained and to make matters worse, the shower leaked. I tried calling the prepaid website, and of course was not able to get a hold of anyone.  I finally gave up after 70 mins of holding.  I then decided to try to work it out with the hotel. Summary: Great place to stay. About 10-15 minute walk to the park and Disney downtown. Staff were great. Our room was located by the highway but it wasn't that bad of a bother in any way. The pool was awesome, the room was good- some esthetics need to be updated it all around it was a great place. We have to give a huge shout out to Erik L. Reception at this hotel. Erik, you were amazing, so helpful, friendly and like we knew you as a friend all while maintaining your professionalism. You are a great example of hospitality!! We cannot thank you enough for being so great.  Lloyd and family

Summary: This was a trip with my three daughters and we stayed here because of the proximity to Disneyland and the price per night at this hotel.      Pro's Easy 10 minute walk to the Disney area, we left early enough to be at the parks for opening and walked back after closing.  Staff was very friendly and accomadating  The pool area was beautiful, I really would loved to have soaked in the hot tub, and spent time at the pool.  The area was very inviting.  We were in a fourth floor room with a king bed and sofa sleeper.  Beds were comfy and room was clean.  There is a refrigerator, safe and coffee maker in the room.  Cons:  The walk to the parks does pass through the local bus stop and you will pass folks sleeping on benches and such, we were not approached at all.  Parking does cost

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel before, but for some reason it's gotten really really dirty!  The shower was disgusting, there was a ton of buildup on the shower head, it felt like when the maids came in all they did was fix the bed and change the towels and not clean anything else.  There was dust and dirt everywhere, the closet smelled like mold so we didn't even hang any of our clothes for fear they would smell like mold too, and we had a spider and a couple of other bugs in our room!  The bed frames were too big for the mattress so we'd keep running into the frame and the beds felt so uncomfortable it was impossible to get a good nights sleep after a long day at the park, thank goodness we were only there 3 nights.  I will NOT be staying here again, their rates should be less than

Summary Heading: Would stay again for a short business trip but not a holiday.
Summary: I stayed at this hotel with my partner in march 2015. It was good enough for us. What i mean by that is that i wouldnt go out of my way to stay here again but it did do the job.  Plus's were that it was a 10min walk to disneyland, it was nice to be on the other side of the freeway and away from all the other hotels and business. The rooms were spacious. We stayed in a King size room. Staff was friendly and very helpful and the buffet breakfast was tasty and cheap. USD11 per person from what i remember. Oh and the rooms were modern. Minus's were that it was 10mins walk from other restaurants (but i did expect that). That walls seems to be covered in chipped paint and painted over. The shower pressure wasn't great, toilet paper was very rough and the bed could have been more

Summary Heading: Will definitely get the job done.
Summary: Hubby and I stayed here for 4 nights this past weekend while we were in Disneyland. I got a pretty good deal through Costco. After booking and reading some reviews of the hotel I was a feeling a little iffy on our choice. (Some reviews really need be taken with a grain of salt, seriously petty complaints) All in all this was a pretty nice hotel. It's not the nicest place we've stayed at, but it definitely wasn't the worst either.   The room was spacious and the bed surprisingly comfortable. I did find it a little odd that there was no fitted sheet over the mattress, just a single sheet, but alas it wasn't that big of a deal. Water pressure was great in the shower and we had hot water (unlike someone who complained of only cold water..maybe you weren't working it right?)
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location of this hotel is good if you are planning on doing disneyland, It is only a 10 minute walk and very easy to find. Staff are great and very helpful. The front desk helped us find restaurants with gluten free menus which was very helpful and they helped us organise a tour to san diego zoo. the rooms were spacious and comfy enough for what you pay for! The only problem that we had was the noise! its 24/7 and it is so loud! was the only thing that affected our stay here. across the road is a starbucks and it isnt to far of a drive from the outlets at orange. On one of the nights we got to see the fireworks from disney outside our room which was really fun and a good view. would recommend this hotel if you are a heavy sleeper and don't mind the noise.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was alright, not what we were expecting after reading the reviews. This is an older property, and the rooms need a facelift (tiny shower and toilet room). The pool area is nice and they have done a good job trying to compensate for the loud freeway noise by the pool with a fountain and loud music, but the soundproofing in the rooms need work. We live close to a busy freeway and are use to the noise at home, so were surprised to find it bothered us at night during our stay here. Good proximity to Disneyland, easy walk. Only real complaint was that the sheets were way too small for the beds; 1 foot short at bottom and at the sides and top - so we all ended up on bare mattresses by morning (gross). We asked this to be fixed for our second night, if they tried, we didn't

Summary: This was our 2nd time staying at the Hotel Menage in support of our week at Disneyland.  We again loved it.  The customer service was top notch.  When we checked into the room, we noticed that the TV wasn't working and that although cold air was coming out of the air conditioner, it wasn't blowing and wasn't cooling the back half of the room.  I called the desk and with in 10 minutes, someone was there and reset the TV and was checking the AC.  They immediately made the decision to replace the AC and was done withing 20 minutes.  Was very very happy with almost everything again this year.  The internet connection has vastly improved over last year.  About the only complaint I would have, or glitch to this trip, was regarding my 8 year old daughter.  She had a 1 foot square blue

Summary: My mother and I decided to go to Disneyland for the 60th Anniversary.  We booked through GetAwayToday and we only had one real disappointment.  When we arrived, we were told that a $50 nightly fee would be charged to our card and would be refunded once we left; however, we were unaware of such charge and it was discouraging.  When my family goes to Disneyland, we like to do all our dealings in cash. It helps minimize excessive spending.  Normally, it wouldn't be a problem, but my bank wasn't close enough to deposit money into. Therefor, I had to call a friend and ask her to deposit money for me and the hassle was just unbelievable. Definitely be warned of the hidden fees, it would have been much nicer to know before ruining the beginning of my vacation (and my birthday).  The

Summary: We stayed at Hotel Menage for the Disney portion of our USA holiday and it was great! Good service, clean rooms, amazing pool bar cocktails... from what I can remember... hahaha! Caters very well to the Aussies. :)

Summary: Stayed for 3 nights. staff were great, food in the restaurant was first class every night, great selection for breakfast. close to everything, and for places further away a shuttle from ART stops at the door every 20 minutes. would definately stay here again. Thank you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved this hotel even when next to freeway. Staff were friendly & helpful. Leo the front desk manager was awesome very helpful in every way. It was a short walk to Disneyland. The pool was open all night which was great as u get home late but can still relax in pool or spa. Could hear the traffic a little but got used to it not that bad!! Rooms were nice. We got given a pullout bed but after complaining they changed us to a room with 2 queen beds the next night. If u have a car very central to everything such as restaurants shops. Would go back to hotel ménage if staying in Anaheim. Could see Disney fireworks every night from pool or balcony areas was amazing.

Summary: We booked 2 queens for 4 of us and got lucky and one was a king! Very roomy, with a sink and counter outside of the bathroom, which works well for more than 2 persons. We also had a fridge, which was great, as it was hot while we were there.  The beds were comfy, and the towels were thick enough and not rough.  The pool and spa area were tropical and very nice! Used the pool, loungers, and tables and chairs.  The location was okay, close enough to Disneyland. But, not close to many restaurants, without driving. Taco Bell across the street only. They have a restaurant and we ate one meal there. Not cheap, but large portions of salad, which we had for lunch one time.  No free breakfast, but with the fridge, we were able to have muffins, etc. to tide us over.  Free wifi worked
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for three nights and had such a wonderful time, the rooms are very clean and everybody that works there are very friendly. The walk to Disneyland is short, we did the walk 2-3 times a day and loved it. I've stayed in higher end hotels and have never slept in a comfier bed, I loved it!! Although I didn't use the pool it is very inviting and looks beautiful. I will certainly be staying at hotel ménage for my next Disneyland trip!
Manager Response: none

Summary: You can definitely walk to Disney but be ready for your feet to fall off from all of the walking you will already be doing at the park,  its far enough away that is is unbearable after a day in the park and they do not offer a shuttle.  The walk back to the hotel was sketchy, there was a couple of cars pulled over on the bridge that we had to walk by and thought we were going to be abducted. Be ready to pay a large parking fee as well, and no shuttle? Rooms are ok and the building is kind of a maze to get around. Our room smelled terrible, like mildew and Axe body spray. Right next to highway 5 so plan on hearing road noise all night.  On the plus side, you can see the fireworks from one side of the hotel and the pool was nice and the Valet/Bellhop was very nice and helpful.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, great view of fireworks, but additional fees
Summary: Booked this hotel on Hotwire.com. It wouldn't have been my first choice considering the options in the area. It was OK, not great but not horrible. The room had a king size bed and fold out sofa. Had a small fridge. There was a microwave on the main floor by the lobby, but no in-room microwave. I think that they don't want to take away food business from hotel restaurants.   Good walking distance to the Disneyland. Not too far, even after a long day at Disneyland. Gated parking so you don't need to worry about non-guests taking advantage of close Disneyland parking.   There were resort (included in our hotwire fees apparently) and additional parking fees. Wi-Fi was always overloaded whenever I tried.   Pool was very nice and the best part of this hotel. It had bar and food.
Manager Response: Dear CoinTraveller,  Thank you so much for posting your review.  We are glad to hear that your overall experience was a positive one.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We stayed here over the 4th of July this year and it was very nice. The 24 hour pool was pretty sweet as was the fact that you had a decent view of the fireworks from the pool. The rooms were good, decent beds. All in all I would say it was very pleasant.
Manager Response: Dear Dezi T,  Thank you so much for your review!  Hotel Menage prides itself on having a 24 hour pool and Jacuzzi area, that gives our guest a little bit of a retreat after a long day at Disneyland.  We are happy to hear that you were able to experience the fourth of July fireworks from the pool area.  Looking forward to your next stay with us.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: Stayed here for two nights. Staff here are super friendly and very good looking. The pool is heated so its always busy. It has a party atmosphere around the pool. Music is played and there is a tiki bar near it. It reminded me of those party resorts at Cancun,Mexico.There is a jacuzzi spa next to the pool. Only reason I gave it three is because I had to wait twice for a room as I requested a pool view room but got a room facing the elevator and they had to change me again. Also my bathtub was not that clean...found another person's hair still in the bath and I don't have black hair. The room sizes are large. Bathrooms are very small. The location is excellent and the price was brilliant. I would recommend this place to families going to Disneyland. The beds were comfortable too.
Manager Response: Dear MrsTravelHappy,  Thank you for your review!  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay!  We are strive to provide and experience that is above industry standard.  We look forward to your next visit.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: The hotel is close to Disneyland but if you walking back at midnight we didn't feel that safe, you walk over the highway bridge which is okay. We had a pipe burst while staying all our thing so wet, the hotel took care of getting them all washed and dried by the next after noon and we also received $75 to use at the hotel as well as a new room. I would stay here again and tell others to stay here too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was not a hotel name I recognized but thanks to trip adviser and others reviews I booked it. Great comfy large room, nice pool area and yes you can see the Disneyland fireworks from the pool. Service excellent during check in and concierge ( Michael) very helpful in getting transportation to the airport setup. You can walk to Disneyland. I plan on coming back to Anaheim next year and will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best Place To Stay Near Disneyland
Summary: Lodging cost is always an important consideration during any Disney trip; the Menage's rooms are very reasonably priced, about 1/3 the cost of a stay on Disney property. Hotel Menage is located 0.8 miles from Disneyland, that's a 4 minute drive, a 12 minute walk, or just few minutes on the ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) shuttle which stops in the hotel's front driveway. You can buy a single or multi-day shuttle pass inside the hotel at a vending machine. A round trip ticket will also allow you to get a ride back to the Menage after a long day of walking. I love the comfortable, spacious, modern, clean & artfully decorated rooms. You can even see Disney's fireworks from the pool or hot tub (open 24 hours) with a nice, cold beverage in your hand from their poolside tiki bar !
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just checked out of the Menage, and couldn't be happier with my experience.  A very tropical, mature ambiance that sets itself apart from the rest of the neighborhood.  Close enough to Disney to walk, and once you're back, a nice escape from Disney.  Genuinely enjoyed the interactions with the staff, and my comfortable stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here with a coworker during the Natural Products show at the convention center. We stayed for two nights and we wish it was shorter. During the day and much more so at night, this hotel is dark. Getting from the lobby to the elevators we both used our phones as flashlights to navigate the halls. It was so dark and creepy that we used the buddy system (don't go anywhere alone). As petite females we did not feel safe in this hotel at night.  When I got to my room it was time to catch up on work emails after a day of traveling.  The internet signal was very weak and unable to give my laptop an IP address.  I tried to connect on my cell and the same problem happened so I picked up the phone to call the front desk.  It rang and rang, I kept calling back and no one answered.

Summary: My boyfriend and I have stayed here a few times and it's always great! This past trip to Disneyland was particularly impressive for us. We were staying 4 days 3 nights and had originally booked another hotel that was a little cheaper (trying to save some money) that turned out to be HORRIBLE. So on last minute notice we needed another room and having stayed at the Menage before, we thought we would give it a try. Thankfully they had a room available and were happy to book us on such short notice! They even offered us a room facing the pool. We should have just booked this hotel from the begining, we always have a good stay. The whole staff, from the front desk to the bartenders, is so friendly and ready to help! The pool is open 24hrs which is great because we sometimes stay

Summary: When we got there they only gave us one bed said we'd have to check the next day for 2 beds. In the morning switched to a 2 bed room left my money on the bathroom sink. Called and was told they would ask the maid (as it was 7:30 am when we switched rooms and left for disneyland) front desk said maid said no find. I know it was there as I switched shorts and accidentally left when we changed rooms. Second morning left for disneyland and come back and maid turned off AC walking back in the heat from a 15 to 20 minute walk to disney sweating to find a hot room.  Also Friday and Saturday night the pool was packed with kids some who said they live down the street and go swimming there. Hotel however was across the street from Taco Bell, nice.

Summary: Awesome location, about a mile from Disney, can walk or take bus. Good customer service, had no issues what so ever. Also within walking to distance to restaurants etc, however the food at the hotel seemed just fine. Would def stay here again for the value and price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here with my two little girls during a tip to Disney after an absolutely horrible night spent at a nearby hotel.  There are some absolute dumps around Disney, this ISN'T one of them.  This was, by far, the nicest place we stayed at during our entire California trip.  Close to Disneyland.  The 24hr pool and hot tub was a god send in the evenings after our Disney days.  The onsite bar gave this dad an excellent opportunity to unwind with a beer and the restaurant provided a slightly expensive but tasty breakfast buffet for us to start our day.  In the evenings the restaurant had this excellent chicken sandwich with a pretzel bun on the menu, one of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever had.  The major con to staying here is the close proximity to the highway.  I found that

Summary: Stayed at the Menage June28 to July05. We loved it! Front Desk staff is nice, approachable. Were able to answer any questions we had. Less than a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. IHOP, Denny's, McDonald's are all within walking distance as well. Pool & hot tub is open 24hrs, and can see the Disney fireworks from there. There is free WiFi. Beds were comfy, as were the pillows. Only had the breakfast buffet once while there; was ok, but not worth the money paid for it. Didn't really notice the noise from the I-5. Not nearly as bad as some think.  All in all, we had a great stay. Would recommend and stay here again!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nothing but check marks. Arrival check. Registration. Check. Service, ambience, great food, music, beers, family time till dark, wife n me at palapa bar till close check. Not a speck of dirty dust or lack of attention to anything. Yes, you are near the 5 freeway... But you're in SoCal, get over it... Traffics in every street. Walking distance? Yes... Walking: "walk to your destination" are you on Disneyland soil no... That's why the prices and rooms are less than the gougers. Good people selling a good product. Don't insult all those vacation nazis in the previous posts. A+ in my family album. Made my kids & wife 😜👍

Towels were like cardboard,  tub was dirty and stained and tons on patched holes in walls and doors.  The walls were so thin, i can here everything in the room next to me. This was a total waste on my money and the weekend was not romantic at all with the loud noises outside our door.

I find it completely unacceptable to offer a guest a pullout bed when they had several rooms with two beds especially since they were aware that we totaled four people in the room.

Summary Heading: Great hotel! But it's not ideal.
Summary: Beautiful hotel. We had a great experience with the staff. Check in was flawless and they even held an envelope I had delivered before we even checked in. Room was great and clean. Beds were comfortable and I'm pretty picky about that. I've read a lot of reviews about the noise, we had no problems with the noise and we stayed on the first floor right by the pool.  Housekeeping would take our old towels but kept forgetting to leave new ones. The front desk had towels delivered promptly. The walk to Disney is rough. It was doable but definitely not convienient. You must walk by some pretty busy roads. The walk there is all paved but there are crosswalk signals. There is a big hill to go up and over the freeway that you have to go over. It took us 15 minutes to walk to the parks.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great for business and bring the family!
Summary: Great location.  Great staff.  Beautiful landscape with a breathtaking (and ear numbing) view of the Disney fireworks display.  They have a wonderful and nicely priced happy hour and there's a Starbucks right across the street. The other big selling point is the 24 hour pool.  I never swim but I love the vibe at 3 am!  Speaking of vibe, the rooms are spacious and chic. My favorite rooms are the ones with the high ceilings with the visible vents.  Very urban lofty feel.   All and all the hotel Menage is a great value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here with my family for 3 days, and had a great stay.  The entire staff was very friendly and always willing to help.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  Pool area was a hit with the family.  From the previous reviews, I was a little afraid about the noise levels, but it wasn't bad at all.  We will definitely be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was given an inspection tour of the hotel and its amenities last week and I would definitely stay here. The rooms have been updated, the restaurant serves awesome meals and the pool is open 24 hrs. Do not be turned off by the noise from the highway or the pool area, the rooms are surprisingly quiet. Reasonably priced and located, but more suited for non-family groups- unless you want to go for that midnight swim while your kids are finally asleep.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I had a short stay, at this hotel, about 3 years ago.  The room we had was decent, clean and they even had a piano player at the bar.  Our only disappointment was the fact that we did not have very much time to enjoy the pool and the bar area more.  When my wife told me she had book us a room at the Hotel Menage again I was very excited.  We rolled in about 1am and were ready to check in.  The check in person could not find our full reservation payment and informed us that we would need to contact our credit card company.  Upon entering the room we were completely disappointed.  The room was covered in dust, you could barely close the bathroom door, the refrigerator did not keep anything cold, the TV didn't work... and the total shocker... There was no carpet in the
Manager Response: Dear Tommyaces1  We are truly surprised on your response; our Team works diligently to ensure that each Guest Experience is above Guest expectations. Our Housekeeping Team has   a combined 200+ years of experience and works diligently to clean, service, repair and inspect all our rooms, including the published “Loft Style” you were checked into.
