Our Menage Team is extremely Guest-centric and welcomes all Guest feedback as we are continuously improving on all aspects of our Boutique Hotel. We hope you encounter better travels for you and your family in the future and may you have a great Summer.   Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: My husband and I stayed here about 3 years ago and had a good experience. There was a piano player in the lobby, the bar was fully stocked, it was overall a great atmosphere to walk into. Our room then was clean, carpeted and looked updated. We were excited to stay again. That is, until we walked in on Friday night. No one was out front for luggage assistance or valet. The bar was empty, no piano, and it looked as though there had been an alcohol liquidation. We checked in and headed to our room. We weren't prepared for the long hike to get there. The room was less than ordinary. it was very disappointing. No carpet on the floors (acid stained concrete) and it looked like no one had even been in the room for at least a few weeks. There was dust on the desk and dresser and the
Manager Response: Dear Tomzkel,  We are truly surprised on your response; our Team works diligently to ensure that each Guest Experience is above Guest expectations.  As with any hotel and restaurant, business operations evolve over time; we found most Guests prefer   a variety of music offerings and unfortunately, you joined us on a weekend we do not have a piano player.  Our Housekeeping Team has   a combined 200+ years of experience and works diligently to clean, service, repair and inspect all our rooms, including the published “Loft Style” you were checked into.  At any time during a guests’ stay, should a Guest not experience any part of their stay throughout our Hotel and Restaurant, we are prepared to make it right and welcome feedback.  Our Menage Team is extremely Guest-centric and welcomes all Guest feedback as we are continuously improving on all aspects of our Boutique Hotel. We hope you encounter better travels for you and your family in the future and may you have a great Summer.   Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary Heading: Still good but a little rough around the edges
Summary: We always stay in this hotel when we go to Disneyland and the room is very nice and clean.  The only issue we had was the card reader to the pool entry was broken for the first 3 days.  The ice machine is missing on the 3rd floor, which was very inconvenient for us.  Also for the first 3 days the pool was not being looked after, dirty towels not being picked up etc.  Then after the 3rd day, it was kinda magical, all these issues stopped happening.  It was like the boss came back and whipped everyone back into shape.  Overall another good stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: They tried but missed the mark
Summary: We stayed here for one night to celebrate my husbands birthday. The overall feeling of the room was that they tried to make it new and modern, but is still felt old and worn down. The bathroom vanity and bed was nice. The shower was old and stained. I felt grossed out taking a shower in it. But overall, the price for the room reflected the room itself. A good choice for value. The reception area and bars in the hotel are very nice. It was close to Disneyland. We actually walked to downtown Disney from the hotel and walked back. I would give it 3.5 stars. If your looking for a hotel at a good price that is walking distance to Disneyland and your ok with a mediocre room, than this would be a good choice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic place to stay while at Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here twice during our month long US trip - the first 2 night just to chill out after being jetlagged from our flight & then for 3 nights when we did Disneyland & California adventure park. The place was affordable, in a fantastic location, and I absolutely loved the 24hr pool & the bar next to it. Each night my boyfriend & I would grab a couple of beers and hang out by the pool where we'd watch the Disneyland fireworks. An amazing way to finish the day.  The rooms were nice, staff were friendly & the breakfast buffet was well priced too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When booking this hotel through the Hotwire.com, I would not know the hotel name. After seeing the bad reviews about this hotel, I was unhappy and wanted to cancel this booking, which won't refund. Fortunately this hotel is very clean and excellent service. We( 7 people) booked 2 rooms connected together and  stayed 2 nights about $353.00. This hotel is very close to the Disneyland. If some family has children to visit Disneyland, highly recommend to stay with this hotel.  Swimming pool & hot tub are open 24 hours and happy meal & drink cost $5.00 per person. We did not eat at the restaurant, but at midnight we bought food and ate at the pool. This hotel has the microwave and ice maker close to the swimming area and each room has mini refrigerator, free coffee, and more. Please
Manager Response: none

Summary: The General Mgr and the overall staff at check in was amazing. I travel and this by far is the best stay. Marcus in valet was super helpful. The rooms were clean, pool open 24/7 which was cool for my son. You could see the fireworks from Disneyland perfect and it has a nice outdoor bar while the kids swim. I can't wait to visit again,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Took the grandkids to Disneyland so we stayed here. Extremely convenient to Disneyland and Disney Downtown etc. Rooms were very adequate but I should have done a little more research to realize that it's outside doors not interior hallways. Also it backs up to a major hi way with constant traffic noise. We also were awaken to a 15 minute disney fireworks show that was extremely loud even to the point of setting of car alarms so beware.  This may have been in other reviews but I didn't read many. The shuttle is very convenient and probably cheaper than parking at Disney at least for us and very easy to navigate.
Manager Response: Dear William M,  Thank you for taking the time out of your day to post your review.  Our unique locations offers easy access to the Disneyland Resort Area and also provides a front row view of the Disneyland fireworks.  Unfortunately we are surrounded by 2 major streets and the 5 freeway.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: Rooms were good, elevator was dirty, pool door gate furthest from the office did not work with the key. This could be improved.hhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhthis survey will not go thru til I use all spaces
Manager Response: Dear 694sandra  Thank you for your review.  Please know that we have completed repairs on all our gates to ensure guest are able to access pool area without any inconvenience.  We truly appreciate all feedback.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: I came here with my friend and 20 year-old daughter. I specifically selected this hotel because it was only a 1/2 mile walk to the park (there is ART transportation available, but we enjoyed the short walk). The staff is friendly and there is a bar/lounge and restaurant, as well as on outdoor bar by the pool. The rooms had a king and queen bed and were comfortable, albeit, my friend didn't like the firm pillows (I did, though). There were plenty of extra bath/hand towels (yay!) and a large flat-screen TV. Even though our room faced the freeway, I heard little to no freeway noise (which surprised me). The only criticism of our experience was when we went to pick up our car. We had it valeted ($13 a day) and when we went to pick it up, the gal didn't know which car was ours
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved this place, service was wonderful, pool area beautiful, food delicious most important very clean  rooms with extremely comfortable beads! It was first class at every turn. The bath tub stopper wasn't working, they sent someone to fix it so fast I wonder if they were just standing outside the door waiting for me to call  for something! Also we enjoyed the view of fireworks we watched both nights.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not quite the boutique hotel experience
Summary: So, for starters, our door to our room doesn't close at the top and everyday coming back from Disney, our room smells like sewer. We have to keep the door and window open for about an hour after returning for the day. They fixed the smell the first day by running water in the shower and spraying air freshener while we went to dinner. The bathroom is in bad need of routine maintenance. We are here for 5 days and his room could use about 5 days of repair. Again, the door doesn't close at the top, a daily sewer smell in our room, mold, peeling bathtub?, vents badly needing to be cleaned, Cracks in the ceiling. Yes, you can see the Disney fireworks from the hotel pretty much anywhere, and you can hear them too!  Don't go to sleep before 945pm as the fireworks literally shake the
Manager Response: Dear hotelsavvy,  We are sorry to learn that you experience with our hotel was not what you expected. Please feel free to email us using the email listed below.  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: The employees were very friendly and helpful. Ruby, a waitress in the restaurant, was the best server I have had in years. Don't believe the Yelp reviews, they are just very negative. I would never use the word negative to describe this hotel. I will be back, and give Ruby at big, fat raise! Donna

Summary: Had a pleasant stay everything was around you and close. Pool and jacuzzi open 24 hours was a plus for us. I would recommend the Hotel Menage to friends and family. With Disney down the street and easy access to the 5 fwy its location is unbeatable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great Hotel, friendly staff, great location and the rooms are fine. We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this hotel for families visiting Disney and knotts farm, food was good but plenty of choice around.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great sheets, comfortable mattress, nice pool, family friendly, friendly staff, unassuming, easy access to freeways but not noisy, quick walk to Disneyland, pet friendly, great view of nightly fireworks if not in the park, decent restaurant attached, nice bar, refrigerators in the room, for the money the best hotel in the area (and I've stayed at several).
Manager Response: none

Summary: Took the family to Disneyland last week and booked this hotel because it was a "Disneyland Good Neighbor Hotel.  We stayed long enough to book another Hotel (about 10 minutes). Both box springs on the beds were heavily stained and on of then was ripped. Please see pics.  I showed the pictures to the manager and he refunded my money without question.  We booked the Red Lion which was much better.
Manager Response: Dear Bruce B,  Thank you so much for posting your review.  Please know that since your departure we have corrected the issue of the box spring.  Hotel Menage management is committed to providing a clean and comfortable stay, and we are truly sorry if this was not the case for you.  Please feel free to contact me if there is anything else I can assist you with,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We traveled from Tucson, AZ to California for our wedding. We chose to stay at Hotel Menage because it was close to Disneyland. It is a super cute hotel with an awesome pool, not to mention a perfect view of the Disneyland fireworks. My only complaint was the bar closed at 11pm and room service ended around 10pm. After a late night at Disneyland we wanted to enjoy some late night munchies but there was nothing open. Frank who works the bar (while it's open) is awesome!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice motel within walking distance to Disneyland. Great restaurant, great food. Fantastic concierge and great bar staff. 24 hour pool and a great view of the nightly Disneyland fireworks. The rooms were clean and comfortable although starting to show a bit of wear and tear. Only downside was the traffic noise, although it didn't disturb our sleep, it was always in the background,
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Menage several years ago (2009) and thought the place was great.  The restaurant was affordable and the food was good.  We were there in December so never got to use the pool since it was cold.  My experience this time was a bit different.  The hotel rooms are dated and need work.  You can tell that the shower/bathtub tiles and tub have been painted over to make them look clean but it looks tacky.  They painted the drain which normally is chrome, it's ugly.  The rooms are DARK and very little lighting at the vanity. Maybe it's just me but I like to have more light when putting on my makeup in the morning.  There were a couple of nice things about the room worth noting: the flat screen TV is nice and there is a good variety of channels, I like having free Wi-Fi,
Manager Response: none

Summary: PROS Front desk and all other staff friendly and helpful. Convenient to Disneyland.  CONS Bed design is dreadful. Great if you want multiple bruises on shins. Room cleaning is not very good. Bath filthy (see pictures) to the extent I wanted to wear something on my feet in the shower! Plastic cups were not replaced. I have done a separate review for the resteraunt in which I mentioned my disgust at being presented with plastic forks for an over priced room service meal (server told me it was hotel policy). We did get metal steak knives so we could be trusted with them but not forks apparently. There is no information booklet provided in the room. This is a convenient plpace to stay to visit Disneyland if your expectations are not too high.
Manager Response: Dear jayvee1  Thank you for taking time out of your day to post you.  We are sorry if your stay was not the experience you expected.  Please know that your concerns will not be overlooked.  Best Travels,  Leo Flores  Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: I stayed at this hotel back when they still had the liquid bubble lamps out in front, it was so beautiful, I loved it.  We had a room right outside of the pool area, bottom floor on the corner. I loved being close to the pool bar grass hut, that was so cool. You can see the fireworks from the pool area or stand on the overpass and watch the fireworks.  I loved it all. The 'when did you travel' option doesn't show the year I stayed but it was a few years back.

Summary: We spent our honeymoon here and the staff and rooms are fantastic! Fireworks from the pool bar every night, and 10 minute walk to the parks. Get the fish tacos at the American Tavern! We would come back in a heartbeat.

Summary: What a total disappointment,  There are 2 things this hotel has going for it and that's it. firstly the location close to Disneyland itself and the staff. The room itself is a total let down, dated, old and dangerous. Manager Response: Dear Annette B,  Thank you for posting your review.  We are truly sorry that your stay was not a positive one. Summary Heading: Good for a place to crash after Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I just returned from this hotel after a week at DIsneyland. It's proximity to the park was fine, only a 10 minute walk, but after a long long day of roaming the park, the hill you have to climb to get back can be quite a pain.  The hotel is also right off a major freeway with traffic 24/7, making for quite a noisy evening. When your exhausted from wandering all day, you don't notice it, but the noise is enough to wake the dead sometimes.  The rooms were generally clean, though areas around the toilet were clearly missed. The AC in our room was old and in need of replacement. It made an exceptional amount of noise.  The restaurant was ok...my wife had a salad for lunch on our last day, and the lettuce was wilted and old. I had a turkey club and it was pretty good. The
Manager Response: none

Summary: I can get a room at any hotel but at Hotel Menage you get atmosphe and do I mean atmosphere. Let's just say that early morning pool scene is absolutely the best time for couples to take a swim or soak

Summary: Front desk has lots of local knowledge and knows how to interact with staff. In particular. Ashley has assisted in all questions and was extremely helpful. I highly recommend her services. Also. Alex was provided a service not like anyone else before

Summary Heading: Where do hotel room designers come from?
Summary: To me, having travelled a lot since retirement, I cannot understNd why some hoteliers do what they do! Common sense should prevail!!!  A safe at floor level, yes seriously! A bed that sits on an extended wooden frame a little above ankle height.. As attests to a new crop of bruises on both legs!  Maybe they should do a test room first and get some one to stay in it.... Get comments and feedback before they spend much money!!  Enough of that, have a look at the photos and you will see what I mean! Ask for a room AWAY from the freeway as the noise is constant! No- they are not bombs going off at 9.00pm, just very loud Disney fireworks, but they are well worth a look, so grB a beer and find a vantage spot at 2055. Bed was comfy, aircon cold and quiet, bathroom adequate, I like the

Summary: We travelled from NZ for our honeymoon and we were not disappointed!  From the moment we arrived we were treated well and made to feel at home,  Our room when we arrived was right next to the highway and was a tad noisy for us so we requested a different room to which this was actioned with no problem at all.  The staff were amazing... Thomas, a delightful young chap that welcomed us and helped us with our bags and actually remembered us throughout our stay.  Michael, helped us find what we needed to find and nothing was a bother.  Frank at the bar.. What a lovely fellow and a great host at the bar, his cocktail mixing skills are second to none. The pool area is a lovely oasis to forget about the world and a lovely relaxing end to a day at Disneyland.  The breakfast was amazing
Manager Response: none

Summary: We LOVE Disneyland and visit once every other month. We've stayed at several different hotels up and down Harbor. I must say Hotel Menage is definitely one of the best. All of their staff are friendly and accommodating (from Valets to Bartender to Leo the Hotel Manager) Everyone had the same sense of urgency when it came to customer service. The shuttle pick up is right outside the front door and runs about every 20 minutes. The rooms are clean. The pool area is very nice. This will be our hotel of choice from now on when visiting Disneyland. You will not be disappointed :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a lovely time at the Hotel Menage.  Valet service was outstanding. We always enjoy the restaurant and pool area.  Access to Disneyland is a nice feature.  Would like to see the rooms updated and sound proofed a bit more....
Manager Response: Dear 970heather.  Thank you so much for your review.  We are truly happy to hear that you enjoyed your visit to Hotel Menage.  We are constantly looking to do upgrades both to our public areas and rooms, we appreciate your feedback.    We look forward to your next visit.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary Heading: Great Stay and Close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised.  The rooms were nice and clean and the staff all very friendly.  Great pool area where you can watch the fireworks and have a nice drink from the bar.  The shuttle comes right to the hotel and is $5.00 per day or $12.00 3 days.  It takes you right to the main gate to both parks.  The last one stops 30 minutes from time of park closure & we missed it on our last night by 5 min.  Luckily it was not far to walk.  It's 2 long blocks up and over hwy 5 but only took us about 15 min and we got to see the fireworks along the way.  Beds firm which I prefer for my back and the only downfall was the pillows were too firm.  Other than that we loved it and got a good rate of $110.00 in May.  I was told afterwards that you can often
Manager Response: Dear TravelGirl929,  Thank you for posting your review!  We are happy that you truly enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to you next visit!  Leo Flores Front Office manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: My boyfriend and I were so ecstatic to stay at Hotel Ménage for our most recent Disneyland trip. I am a crazy Disney addict so it was important to stay at a hotel close to the parks and we were not disappointed. Hotel Ménage is the BEST hotel I've EVER stayed at! If I could give it a billion star rating I totally would in a heartbeat. The staff is the kindest and friendliest people ever. Management was outstanding and always made sure we were comfortable and happy. The front desk staff were so helpful and personable. The valets were so sweet and always asked us how are day went. And the room, OMG the room was FABULOUS! The bed was so comfortable and the room was always kept tidy and perfect. Coming from New Mexico, hospitality is extremely important and Hotel Ménage gives the

Summary: Did the 'mystery room' and ended up with a king bed and a queen sleeper couch.   staff: super friendly room: good size, clean, but found hair in bathroom bed: comfortable enough bathroom needs remodel  for $100 it did the job Starbucks across the street, you can walk to Disney

Summary: All the hotel staff was very nice and friendly. Our room was spacious and nice, facing to the pool where you can see Disneyland fireworks.Pool/jacuzzi open for 24 hours, which was nice, but they play music pretty loud all day and until late night. The hotel is right by the freeway, so you can hear the noise all day.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice comfortable hotel walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We booked a room with two queen beds for a family of 4. The room was big enough, bathroom a little small but adequate. Pool open 24 hours great for the kids. There is also a hot spa for parents who don't want to swim! You can see the Disney fireworks from the balcony which can be a plus but I would not recommend for a family with kids under 2 as they will be woken up by fireworks. This will be the same for any hotel walking distance from Disneyland. Walking distance to Disneyland around 20 minutes if you are used to walking. We did it there and back with kids 9 and 12. There is a shuttle bus you can pay for. FYI this hotel and all around Anaheim are about 20-30 mins from Huntington Beach so you could easily based yourself in Anaheim and drive down to the beach for the day which
Manager Response: none

Summary: I will most definitely be recommending the Hotel Menage to fellow kiwis and friends. It is within walking distance to Disney and you get to see the fireworks each night. A big thanks to David who was such a gentleman and made sure our stay ran smoothly. The staff was attentive at every turn and always willingly to help. Much thanks, and I hope to return soon.   Michelle, Gill and Malae
Manager Response: none

Summary: The lobby of this hotel is nice and the staff are extremely friendly but that is about all I have good to say.   The rooms are not particularly nice and they are super loud.  This hotel is located right off the freeway and is not insulated nearly well enough.  Even with white noise and fans it is difficult to sleep.   After just a few minutes in the pool we had terribly itchy rashy skin.  The walk to Disneyland is about 15min.
Manager Response: Dear barkingdaisy,  Thank you for taking time out of you day to post your review.  Unfortunately due to our proximity to Disneyland we are surrounded by two major streets and the 5 freeway.  We do have a few options for room locations. Some quieter than other. Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: This was my husband and I's first time returning to Hotel Menage since previously staying there in 2011. It's best amenities are it outdoor pool area as well as the bar (which does $5 happy hour everyday- a really nice break from high Disneyland prices) However, we found that the rooms are starting to look a bit run down and could use a little maintenance, including better bedding. The freeway noise is also quiet loud and noticeable. It is close enough to Disneyland- if you don't mind a bit of a walk, or the shuttle picks you up right out front. Overall, its a decent hotel with reasonable prices.

Summary: clean and neat but staff needs to talk to guests.  Not as close to the parks as advertised. Food was just okay for the price.  The room didn't have a hotel guide, hard to know what was available, hours etc.

Summary: The hotel was very nice and really convenient to Disneyland.  The shuttle stops right outside of the hotel.  Request a room that faces the fireworks.  Only problem was very late check-in.  Not happy about that!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel itself is nice, it is pretty and the staff is friendly.  The rooms were HORRIFIC. The mattress was the worst I have ever seen.  As soon as we removed the comforter you could see the lumps and bumps in the mattress, through the sheets. On each side of the king sized mattress were two giants indents from being slept on so much.  This left a big bump in the middle of the mattress, where is was less worn, but still gross. It was miserable to sleep on. I implore a manager to look at this bed (Room 415), it is beyond words unusable and disgusting.  Old Super 8 Motels have better mattresses than this. The faucet in the shower was falling off.  It took 2 of us to turn the water on without the faucet disconnecting.  It did tun on, but was stuck on scorching hot the entire time
Manager Response: Dear beckyhowell11  Thank you for your review and sharing areas of improvement; we strive to ensure a comfortable stay and correct any issues promptly and efficiently. We are sorry to know that wasn’t the case with your stay.  Your concerns will not be overlooked.  Please feel free to contact me.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: After several visits here, this one was disappointing. Major renovation to the restaurant area caused loud disruptive noise throughout lobby and resulted in bar area being taken over by restaurant. No ambiance whatsoever and both bar and restaurant experience were poor. New management should have made an effort to limit work hours and control noise during this flooring project, and offer some compensation to disturbed guests. We'll return, but not until this mess is cleaned up an things are back to normal.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'd rate it 4.5 stars out of 5 if I could do a half star rating. I must praise the wonderful service of the staff at Hotel Menage in helping with luggage, packages, directions and all from the moment we arrived. Staff was very friendly and extremely helpful.  Apart from a fridge that kept making this sharp noise, the room was clean, large, functional, and comfortable. Personally, I would prefer a firmer mattress. We got a room with the fireworks view and enjoyed that for a couple of nights. As the room faced the pool, there wasn't that much traffic noise. Music from the pool was loud the first night (probably because it was the weekend) but got better for the rest of our stay.  It's about 10 minutes walk from the hotel to Disneyland so this is a big plus - saves on parking at
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel service was great, everyone was very professional and friendly. I found that the price of the room and parking was not worth the quality of the room however. It was $12/ night to park your own car or $13/night for valet, ariving  at 2am there was no available parking so we opted for valet. The simply kept the car parked in the 15 min check in space we parked in ourselves and left it there throughout our stay. Our room was in a terrible location right near the service elevator and staff laundry facility. Due to the open air hallways, you can hear every single person or luggage cart rolling by at all hours of the night and day. Our room was decent enough, however poorly stocked on toiletries. Hotel location was great, within walking distance to downtown Disney and park
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my fourth stay at Hotel Menage.  The staff is always helpful.   The rooms are clean.  The bar offers great beverages as well as appetizers.  The pool area is relaxing and even has a ping pong table.   The Hotel is short walk to Disneyland and other attractions.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here twice and its been great. They have shuttles that take you and bring you back from Disneyland. Both time we have stayed facing the pool wich could get a little noisy but other than that it's awesome because at night time you're able to see the fireworks from Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear ElenaSalinas  Thank you so much for your FIVE STAR REVIEW!  We are thrilled to here you have enjoyed your visits with us.  We look forward to your next visit!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: My boyfriend and I decided to take an impromptu 3 day trip to Disneyland for their 60th anniversary and stayed at the Hotel Menage. This wasn't one of our Disney splurge trips which we take in October and December so staying at a more economical hotel was our goal this time around. We read a plethora of good reviews from several websites and decided to book a room for $90/nt + $12/day for parking.   Upon arrival we were greeted warmly by the valet and the warm greetings continued once we checked in at the front desk. The lobby was decent enough, painted with dark colors and they had a Tavern that was connected to the lobby area. The pool area had a very Polynesian feel to it and we were told it was open 24 hours. The friendly front desk agents gave us the keys to our room and we
Manager Response: none

Summary: I cannot say thank you enough to the Hotel Menage staff. From calling to handle the special request of an early arrival of half our party, to working out travel arrangements for another half that got stuck, every step of our trip was made easier & more pleasant by the staff on hand. The room was enormous and more than comfortable for a party of four, the property is adjacent to the freeway and still peaceful, and it's a 10 minute walk from the parks. This stay was just wonderful.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, welcoming staff, great rooms, and more!

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Menage the first time in September 2014, and we loved it, so naturally we decided to come back here in May for our second trip.  We got another king room and this time it was a pool view (last time was freeway) so the wifi worked in our room this time (by the pool is best place for it, darn, gotta sit by the pool!), and it was great. We know that a hotel room is a hotel room by now, we barely spent any time in there anyways. The hotel is an easy walk (for us) to Disneyland so we walked to and from the 5 days we were in the park, but it was a nice option to have the ART running also for a small fee ($5 for unlimited rides in 1 day, multi day passes available too).  We never had to open the front door for ourselves, the wonderful valet staff
Manager Response: Dear Lindsay-Sellar  Thank you for your review! Your compliments will be shared with our Team. We are happy to know that you enjoyed our accommodations and pool and were pleased with our American Tavern Eatery and Palapa Bar menu.   We have also just recently upgraded our WIFI,   Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: The hotel overcharged for my room charged me an upgrade fee for a room I had booked online at a specific price. Has not responded to my email about it. I have stayed here several times and always loved it. They have changed the restaurant it was expensive and not very good. With all the choices in the area I will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear TripAdvisor Member,  Thank you for taking the time out of your day to post your review.  If you could please e-mail me.  I would like to get more information on your stay, so I can further assist you.  Best Travels,   Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: Excellent hotel if you're planning a trip to Disneyland, it's just a short walk away and there are plenty of dining options on the way.   I booked one of the standard rooms and they were very clean and spacious. There was free WiFi in the room and I could connect multiple devices.   I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My favorite hotel for a Disney visit!
Summary: Hotel Menage is my go-to hotel for Disneyland trips!  I'm an annual placeholder who lives about 2 hours away, so I usually spend at least one night in Anaheim.  Hotel Menage has great placeholder rates, but their general rates are competitive for the area as well.  The rooms are clean and quiet, and also stylish.  I often meet up with friends at the bar in the beautiful pool area and we have a great time.  The hotel is right on the bus route for the park, but well within walking distance, too.  I highly recommend the breakfast buffet before you start your Disney day, as well.  Good food at a decent price!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The stay was just average, entrance, lobby, and pool very good but rooms average and not as great looking once your off to the rooms but I guess for under $100 not bad. In addition it's not too close to disneyland (over the overpass of highway 5)
Manager Response: none

Summary: So discusting! We have stayed at this hotel before 6 years ago close to Disney and it was ok for the price but this time...When we got into our room I started unpacking, putting things away, right away I found white panties at the top of a shelf, also my 4 year old came over and started bringing me things he found, a half full hand sanitizer bottle and some highliter markers, when my husband pulled down the sheets to go to bed there was blood on the sheets, he also noticed in the bathroom that there was hair particles on the wall painted over..bathroom was so grose, 6 years ago when we stayed here we have a picture of our son in the bed with this fluff pillow that is the same as the one there now and it looks like they have never replaced them! Beware!!
Manager Response: Dear Cedramb,  We are sorry to learn that you experience with our hotel was not what you expected. We make every effort with all aspect of our unique hotel to ensure that we deliver, clean comfortable accommodations, a superior dining menu and a service level that is above all other competitors in our area.  If you would like to further discuss your stay please feel free to contact me at any time using the email listed below.  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: Nice hotel with plenty of amenities.  The room was very clean, the linens were nice and the bed was very comfortable.  The bathroom was clean but in need of some freshening up.  Great place for families or anyone needing a nice place to stay near Disneyland.  I would definitely recommend it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We always stay here when we go to Disneyland, its such a short walk and you can see the fireworks at night. The pool area is great, the restaurant is convenient and very good. The staff has always been so friendly and super helpful. The rooms are pretty decent, not the best but almost great. We love this place and it is kid friendly but also appeals to people without kids, their happy hour and bar are great!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very Good hotel to stay at. Walking distance to Disneyland parks. Or take the shuttle that stops right out front of the hotel. Clean and spacious rooms good staff all around. Hotel bar. Pool heated at night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Quite a few of the reviews for Hotel Menage talk about the noise of the freeway - but if you have your door and window shut when you sleep you really don't notice it. Especially after a solid day at Disneyland! Spacious rooms, good amenities. Breakfast and dinner in the restaurant was tasty. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the third time I've made the trip, once with each of my kids for their 8th birthday present. Every time we have booked this hotel and consistently they have met and exceeded our expectations. The hotel is well maintained, the pool is pretty and open 24 hours and the hotel restaurant food is good value and delicious. The staff has been friendly and helpful and the location perfect for watching fireworks and getting to and from the park. The ART bus worked great for us. It's one stop to get there and the best value when you buy the multi day pass. All in all a perfect stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Geat hotel, close to Disneyland eith 24h pool and spa
Summary: There are mixed reviews on here. We visited in April. We stayed 2 weeks and found the hotel great. Great front desk service. Great location (only 10 min walk, or catch the bus. ). I had forgotten my phone charger, from Australia, and the front desk were more than happy to charge it on their office computer. The hotel rooms were clean. The best bit was howevr, the 24 hour pool and spa. After walking around Disney all day, it was great torelax in pool. Recommend.   1
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good proximity to Disneyland but loud freeway noise. Overall, great hotel.
Summary: Recent reviews almost made me change my hotel reservation at the last minute, but I am glad I didn't. We had several interactions with different hotel staff and every single one was very friendly and helpful. We had a king bed with a sofa pull out; the king bed was fairly comfortable but the pull out bed was not comfortable at all. The pool is open 24/7 which is nice after a long day in Disneyland. There is a GREAT view of the fireworks by the pool which was a huge plus since we couldn't watch them every night due to small children needing to go to bed. The only negative thing I can say is that the freeway (I-5) is less than 100 yards from the rooms so it is quite loud. Our room overlooked the pool which was perfect viewing for the fireworks but it also faces the freeway. I

Summary: We wanted to hit Disneyland at the last minute and needed a room that would allow dogs (big dogs).  My husband found this hotel and it was great.  Unfortunately our dog is too big to ride the shuttle, but the walk was under a mile so not too bad.  The staff were great and the room was great.  Will definately be staying there again. The pool area looks great too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I Stayed in hotel Menage a couple weeks ago... Was out at Disneyland for my birthday... This place just made me feel at home very friendly staff especially Eric Libid.... he was always willing to help and always looking to make my family's stay as comfortable as he could.... I recommend hotel menage over any other hotel in Anaheim area... I'm already planning my next visit... Thanks a lot Eric Libid and staff at Hotel Menage I look forward to seeing you in the near future
Manager Response: Dear Joseph T,  Thank you so much for your five star review.  We are trilled to hear that you truly enjoyed your stay. We look forward to you next visit.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: Modern and beautiful.  Comfortable and clean.  Truly felt safe and that this hotel was of such great quality.  The rooms looked great and the lobby and pool/bar area was gorgeous.  There's also a small fitness room and vending machines for snacks or ancillary items.  Fireworks can be seen on the poolside and it can get pretty loud.  Self parking is additional $12/day but I felt my car was safe and secure. There's an all day shuttle for a small fee that can take you back and forth to Disney (really helpful for families with small children or if family that can't handle the whole day there).  Even without the shuttle, it's only about a 10 minute walk away.  Check out is at 12PM which is an additional hour more than the typical check out time at other hotels. Loved it and will stay
Manager Response: Dear Michelle B,  Thank you so much for your FIVE STAR review.  We are happy to hear that you were able to experience and enjoy most of the amenities offered at Hotel Menage.  We look forward to your next visit.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: Great customer service, very clean. Loved that the hot tub and pool are open 24 hours. Only wish you didn't have to pay the $12 a night for parking.       The location is great for Disneyland we walked there each day.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Watch the Disneyland Fireworks from your balcony!
Summary: Such a convenient location! An easy walk away from Disneyland, with views of the Disneyland fireworks from the hotel! Great restaurant with tasty affordable food. A great place to base yourself when visiting Disneyland. Helpful staff who can help you with your Disneyland tickets, and anything you need.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I paid extra for "pool view " when it was freeway view. No toilet paper, had to call 2 times and took them 15 min to bring up toilet paper. Stayed in room 302 and the sofa was really old uncomfortable to even sit there. The heaters outside the pool didn't work. Front desk really rude and poor communication skills. Over horrible experience.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel for a few reasons
Summary: The Hotel Menage is the perfect location to stay if visiting Disneyland. It's off the beaten path of the other hotels, yet still walking distance to the park. Plus you have a perfect view of the fireworks! Besides the location, the staff always greeted us with a smile and made it a point to say hello (from the valet all the way to the housekeeping staff).  I would like to especially recognize Leo (Front Office Manager). For a Hotelier... "He gets it"!!! Even though some hotels will assign the "lesser valued" rooms to guests who book through 3rd party websites... Leo was very accommodating in fulfilling our room requests. We truly appreciated this as it made our entire experience much more pleasurable. Plus he genuinely seemed interested in making small talk with us upon
Manager Response: none

Summary: I wanted to like this hotel. But I didn't.  It backs up to the freeway, and that lovely pool in the picture is literally 40 feet from 10 lanes of freeway traffic generating a din that ruins the ambiance throughout the outdoor areas and carries into the rooms themselves.  I was also disappointed by their gastro-pub which featured a very small selection of brews served in an unremarkable room with a small choice of uninspired food.  Neither the "Gastro" nor "Pub" delivered on their names.The lobby area was dark and gloomy and the fluorescent lighting did nothing to cozy it up.   Our room was rather nice for the price point, and had a king size bed and flat screen tv.  Still, nothing about the hotel said "Boutique Hotel" to me, and for my money, I'd prefer a quieter location and
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff at Hotel Menage is always friendly and helpful. The staff goes out of their way to assist. They were out of one day park vouchers to purchase at the counter, so without asking a friendly girl offered to go online and purchase them direct from Disney for us. True customer service is going above and beyond without having to be asked, making a family trip all that much more enjoyable. I've stayed here a total of 3 times, and each time I'm more impressed. 100% will return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Hotel is only a 10 minute walk from Disneyland or just a bus ride away. With fantastic facilities and extreamly friendly and attentive staff to look after you. Hotel Menage is relaxing,welcoming and has an excellent view of the Disneyland Fireworks. For my first time in LA i have been let with a lasting experiance and will be coming back here again.

Summary: This was our 1st trip to Disneyland. It is a short 10 minute walk to Disneyland/California Adventure Park. The staff was very accomadating from the minute we arrived. Kent offered a late check out for $50 til 6PM....Worth IT!! We did ask for a Fireworks view room. Although it is near the highway, the noise was not a bother at all. The TAVERN at the Hotel has GREAT Food & Breakfast Buffet! The HOT TUB was perfect after 8 miles of walking each day. We did take a Cab to KNotts Berry Farm which Hotel Menage offfers a Flat Rate Cab option vs. metered.....Would HIghly reccommend and will stay here on the next visit!
Manager Response: Dear Michnmak,  Thank you so much for you FIVE STAR REVIEW!  We really appreciate your feedback. Summary: This place was not bad at all for the rate and considering the great location. The pool area is quite nice and the outdoor bar area is also cute. Unfortunately, the service at the bar was incredibly slow because they only had one bartender/server serving the entire pool area and the bar. She was working really hard and ever stopped, but as only one person she could only do so much. The valet team and front desk folks are also really information and friendly. We would def stay here again when going back to the Disney parks. One last thing, the rate for valet was also very reasonable for the location. We put the car in valet and ubered the rest of the time. It worked out great.
Manager Response: Dear Dawn P,  Thank you for you review. Please know that we really appreciate your feedback, and use it to improve the level of service that is provided to all our guest.  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager  leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary Heading: Third time visitors... not the same
Summary: We just got back from a 4 night stay at Hotel Menage. We have stayed here twice before, this time we booked on hotwire and got the Menage by chance.   Let me start off by saying the staff is great, valet especially. They run to get your vehicle and they are always welcoming.   This time though, our stay was quite different at the hotel. The room we stayed in was very run down, although the house keepers kept it "clean" the wear and tear is definitely beginning to show. Mold on tile in the shower, spackle marks on the wall, water marks on the ceiling, over all it just looks really bad. The first night we were there we had to call the front desk for a fitted sheet because there wasn't one on the bed, the mattress was covered with a flat sheet that didn't even cover the foot of the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location and service with a smile!
Summary: The guest service provided by this team is amazing! Working in hotels myself i know this is sometimes hard to come by! They are so helpful and nothing is too much! If you are going to disneyland then its the perfect location, there is a bus for five bucks but me and my partner work most times! And you get a good view of the fireworks from your hotel room, the rooms are a little outdated! But thats acceptable
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A nice hotel but it could be so much more.
Summary: Just up the street from Disneyland, this is a fine hotel to stay in.  The staff were friendly and extremely helpful.  Check-in and out was quickly done so we could get to our room as soon as possible.  Our room was fairly spacious with a comfy king size bed and a good selection of channels on the TV (including HBO)/  The restaurant was very good and well priced too,   There were a few things that I didn't like however.  The wifi was spotty at best and when you did manage to connect it was dial-up slow.  The bathroom was small and the bathtub was cracked in a few places.  Lastly there is the location which is a double edged sword.  Yes, you're close to Disney, but you're also at the corner of two busy boulevards and behind a major highway so there is always street noise.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It's a well done hotel conversion. Staff was very helpful and polite. Clean and nice I occomadations for the price. The only negative was the bathroom. The painted tub/shower was peeling and the door hits the toilet paper room. Not well laid it.
Manager Response: Dear Scott D,  Thank you So much for posting your review!  We are thrilled to hear that you found the value that you were looking for in Hotel Menage.  We are always working on updating every part of the Hotel including our restrooms.    We look forward to your next visit!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We've been going to this hotel for years when we go to Disneyland,  It is begging to show some age but they keep it clean.  We like it because the price is reasonable.  The restaurant has good food. But one of the main reasons is the pool and Jacuzzi is open 24 hours.  It's nice to get back from Disneyland and sit in the Jacuzzi, even if it's late, and relax.  It is a bit loud there with the freeway and sometimes more than a few people at the pool late. But we sleep with the tv on so the noise doesn't bother us.. It's also a great place to see the fireworks.
Manager Response: Dear Rodney H,  Thank you for posting your review!  We really appreciate your continued loyalty.  We are thrilled to hear that you enjoy, and take advantage of our 24 hour pool and Jacuzzi.  We look forward to your next visit!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We stayed at Hotel Menage for 7 nights in September 2012.  Myself, my husband, our two sons (7 & 10), plus Mother & Father-inlaw. Stayed on the 3rd floor at the Highway end.  Rooms were good - I thought they were quite spacious for the price.  Amenities as you would expect - clean and tidy.  The pool complex was lovely - really nice for winding down at the end of long days at Disney.  Location of the hotel to Disney was also good - you could walk (10 mins on the flat) - but the shuttle came regularly and was a good option for us.   Staff at the front desk were helpful and polite, but would have liked the bar/restaurant staff to have slighly better English. We had breakfast a few days which, although no huge selection, was of good quality and again reasonably priced.
Manager Response: Dear Erin M,  Thank you very much for your review.  We look forward to your next visit to Hotel Menage!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary Heading: Need more to be like Hotel Menage

We stayed in 205 which is within the view of the pool, yes people were swimming at night, and we were able to get a peaceful rest.  Our room was clean and beds were comfy too. Only thing was that the tub had a constant water drip, but can easily be fixed (hopefully soon).  Easy walk to Disneyland.  Breakfast was good.  Happy Hour is reasonable.  Wish you would extend smores night during the week too.  Whenever we encountered an employee, we were greeted with a "Hello" always asked if we needed anything and if we were enjoying our stay.  Please don't change and remind your staff, they are doing a
Manager Response: Dear Love2TravelSoYnot,  Thank you so much for your FIVE STAR review! We are thrilled to hear that you truly enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager  leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We stay at the Hotel Menage 2-3 times a year.  The staff is always friendly and the hotel is always clean.  We were a little disappointed that the hot tub was down for repair but happy that they are always trying to keep this establishment the best it can be.

Summary: i love this place, manager is so nice and he remembered me from staying there back in april, due to his kindness and a situation he refunded me my accommodation back i had book with a no refund if canceled. so thank full I'm booking this hotel for the 4th time as great rooms and best fire works from disneyland,

Summary Heading: 10 Minute walk to Disneyland... but Party Hotel
Summary: It wasn't terrible. The price was decent, the decor was nice, but the carpet in front of the bathroom sink was soaked and never did dry during our two night stay. We had to keep using bath towels over it... and the color of the soaked water was not, um, clean.  The management was very helpful with coordinating a surprise flower delivery for my wife, which was nice. And there was an empty mini fridge in the room where we could store a few snacks, which was also nice.  But the pool is open 24/7, which encourages partiers to run and scream at all hours down the outside halls, and in the morning, we were soooooo glad we were too tired to get in the hot tub because it was green. Gross.  We won't be staying here again. We already made reservations for our next Disneyland visit - at a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Psst - here's a secret for travelling families. This place has laundry facilities! Oh joy! Walked to Disneyland everyday. Friendly staff.  However ...... Two things to watch out for. Our room faced the pool & while our kids loved the loud piped music, it went on forever. I found it irritating, specially the night before Magic Morning. Also the shower was terrible. The spray always wet the carpet outside ( they should have just tiled there). The water temp was alarmingly hard to set (choose b/w freezing or scalding) & the bath filled up with water rather than draining away, suggesting a plumbing problem.  But
Manager Response: Dear Melody0418,  Thank you so much for your review!  We really appreciate that you took the time to post your review.  We look forward to serving you and your family again!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We spent 4 days at this hotel and didn't have any problems. We were on a family vacation for the Star Wars celebration at the convention center. The staff was helpful and friendly. The food was good. It's about what you would pay anywhere else in the area. The fireworks from Disneyland was right next to our hotel and we were lucky to get a room where we could see them. The noise from the freeway didn't bother us at all. We heard people at the bar and people swimming more then the cars on the freeway. The room was comfortable and clean. The only thing I would change would be the bed frames. They stick out far from the bed and thankfully no one banged their legs against it. On the day we were supposed to check out my wife got really sick. Rather then checking out I decided to

Summary: Stayed 2 nights for a recent Disneyland trip.  First and foremost, the staff was extremely nice including the valets who always greeted us be it morning or evening.  The lobby and bar/lounge set a nice first impression but everything past the lobby leaves a lot to be desired.    The rooms are tired and bare besides a monster size headboard.  Bathrooms are in serious need of updating.  As others have mentioned the free wifi does not work.  Better chance of getting a signal from the Starbucks across the street.  The rooms are not well insulated so you hear street traffic fairly easy.  A lot of little things didn't work well or were broken.  All of which just seem to be from a lack of maintenance.    For the price I expected more.  I know we are paying a premium because it's close

Summary: If you're planning a Disneyland trip, this is a great place to stay!  Literally not a mile away from Disneyland, if you want to skip the crowd, come here at the pool and it is the best place to watch the fireworks!  Upon our arrival I was greeted by a very friendly and knowledgeable valet, who directed me to the front desk.  Check-in was very easy.  The room had a great bed, loved the decor in the room.  Pool looks bigger in the pictures, but it was great because it was 24 hours and heated, so great for kids!    My only thing is, if you have a room that faces the pool expect to be exposed to the loud music that they play.  It was a little hard to put my little one to bed, so request a room that faces either Harbor Blvd, or Ball Rd.

Summary: I have stayed here at Hotel Menage many times. Tonight was a special night so I booked the European suite. The value received in the suite far outweighs the cost. This is a first class hotel from start to finish. The staff remembers your name and greets you accordingly.

Summary: This was a very nice hotel to stay at.  It's very close to Disneyland.  Walked once to disneyland, but it was so hot.  We decided to choose the ART shuttle, which takes you right to the disneyland front gates and back to the hotel (right to the front).  Walk is somewhat scary since it's right by the busy traffic with no siderails to keep the kids safe.  I recommend using the ART shuttle bus, especially if you have kids.  Staff is very friendly and when you need something, they get it done.  Laundry room area by the pool is a little darker than what I'd like, but go during the day time and it's fine.  Fireworks from disneyland is right above the pool area.  That was so awesome to see at night.  Kinda loud... But hey, it's fireworks right?  Sofabed sheets is my only complaint.

Summary: PROS- location ( best view -poolside- for the Disney fireworks, walking distance to Disney and restaurants, friendly and accomidating staff, breakfast buffet and happy hour food 2 thumbs up, rooms were clean, pool was fantastic! Summary: The hotel was very nice and clean. The pool area perfect for the kids when we weren't at the competition. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a very enjoyable and relaxing stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary: Great hotel, nice big clean rooms, good location and services to access Disney. All front desk staff were excellent who will go to the extra effort to ensure your stay is a good one Good pool and restaurant/bar  Would definitley stay again

Summary: The staff at this place is amazing! From the front desk staff (sureya) who helped us buy our Disneyland tickets, to our friendly food server (frank) to the cleaning staff, our week stay has been one of the best vacations we have ever experienced!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Awesome way to kick off our honeymoon
Summary: My wife and I wanted to start off our honeymoon by visiting DISNEYLAND. After looking into staying at Disneyland resorts we decided to stay at the Hotel Menage. What a great decision! From the moment we checked in till the time of our departure it was fantastic. Reception staff, cleaners, restaurant and bar staff ( Hi Frank😊👍) were always there with a smile. I highly recommend this great place and I look forward to staying there in a couple of years when we go back with the whole family.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay at Hotel Menage
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights with our 2 young kids and had a good stay. There is pool music, however it wasn't a problem because it is turned of around 10 - 11pm or so.The room was clean..we stayed on the 1st floor which has high ceilings so it made the room feel nice and open. Room service was prompt and the food was great. The property is well maintained and landscaped to give the pool area and bar a pleasant  feel. The property is close to Disneyland which was the purpose of our trip and a big plus. I feel you get more at this hotel than most others within its price range..I was more than satisfied with my stay and would definitely stay here again. Mydaughter really enjoyed the pool.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our travel agent Hotel Menage to us for value and reviews. It was a decent hotel, clean, and all the staff were friendly. The location is great as there is a service station across the road with a Starbucks and Taco Bell, and the hotel is literally behind Disneyland. They have ART shuttle buses that come by every 15 minutes which is cheap and convenient. They also have several different vending machines near the lobby for snacks, a decent pool and 2 bars. They also had free wifi. I would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I have stayed here four or five times now. The rooms are pretty big and modern with nice desks, HD TVs, a couch and coffee table and best of all, comfortable beds and bedding!! The breakfast buffet is definitely worth it. The only cons for me are the hotel bar and valet parking. I know hotel bars are always kinda pricey, but this one is beyond airport prices. Food prices seem reasonable and they do have a happy hour, but I haven't been around for it yet.  Be aware that you do have to pay for parking. $12/night for self parking or $13 for valet. I wish it was included in the price of the room but do appreciate the fact that they're employing people so...what are you going to do? :-)  Neither of those things will keep me from going back to the Menage.   Other than
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have never been to America and California, so I did not know what to expect and If my accommodation had not been satisfying then my whole perception of America would have been awful. But it was not the case, I found Hotel Menage to be adequate and exactly what I needed to make my first trip to America amazing. I found the staff friendly, amicable and they sometimes went beyond the call of duty to make sure my stay was pleasurable and hassle free (Thanks). I did read the other reviews and considered the other points of views, however as a single person travelling to this country for the first time, I found the hotel  Menage, its facilities and staff to be more than adequate and a great representation of the wonderful people that work in the hospitality industry in this part of
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Next door to Disney. Best Hotel I have been to.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel mainly because it is with walking distance to Disney and second, the price is worth it for all the amenities they offer.  If you go by car please take into consideration there is a parking fee, which its not high I gladly payed for it. I read a lot of complains about it being loud, however we did not have any issues with the noise, and our room was facing the pool area (considering we come from a big loud city).  The hotel looks amazing and smells great as soon as you enter, the food at the restaurant is god delicious!. At night it gets a little more romantic style.  They had mini fridge and free WiFi, it helped us a lot to keep our drink cool for the sunny days at Disney!  We will definitively stay again at this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I took my family to Disneyland over spring break for 3 days and stayed here at Hotel Menage. First off, there are so many upsides to this hotel. From my own opinion (which I pretend to believe everyone values) whoever is the designer/architect of the interior has a classy and exquisite taste. If there wasn't the noisy I-5 freeway right next to it I could've sworn we were at a high-end resort in Vegas. Although I brought my family here, my wife and I were able to enjoy sitting poolside sipping martinis while watching our kids play marco polo. And with the addition of a periodic shuttle service back and forth from Disneyland we didn't have to drive or take a cab there. This place spells class all over it and if we ever do Disneyland again over spring break I'm confident in this
Manager Response: none

Summary: My best friend and I stayed for  a long weekend. Busy party on one night  and the pool was busy but we waited til they left.  Clean rooms and awesome beds. Nothing we could gripe about other than the wind but  wasn't a big deal.  Fireworks were awesome and the workers were totally sweet and nice. See you in May!
Manager Response: Dear Sammy F,  Thank you so much for your FIVE STAR review! We are truly thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to May when you are with us for your next visit.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We stayed for two nights and everything was great. Great pool and poolside bar with fun music and a good vibe. Friendly staff, good food at the restaurant, comfy bed. Not the closest to disneyland and you have to walk along a very busy road.
Manager Response: Dear JeannieMae,  Thank you so much for your review!  We are thrilled to hear that you truly enjoyed your stay with us!  Our staff strives to provide the same great customer service you experienced.  We Look forward to having you as guest soon!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: The rooms were VERY clean, the staff was super helpful, especially the valet staff - Kenny in particular got us to the airport when our Super Shuttle never showed up so that we would not miss our flight home.  The only problem I saw was they have a great little outside bar / eating area - but it was so sadly under staffed.  I was in town for a convention and I would say the majority of the hotel was filled with convention attendees and this area was only staffed with 1 person.  He did a great job for being so poorly understaffed but this area would have really benefited for just the addition of a server!  Other than that everything else was great.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer K  Thank you so much for your review!  We will definitely share the kind words you had for Kenny.   Once again thank you, and best travels!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager  leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We had to be moved to three different rooms due to the doors being bent and not closing properly, to filthy dirty bathroom. The charge for room service is ridiculous; $3.50 per delivery plus 21% gratuity. Also, there is no table service for the outside bar or pool area. The one restaurant only has a breakfast buffet which is extremely limited and again no table service. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear Shawn B  Thank you for taking time out of your day to post your review. We strive to provide a great customer experience and we truly do apologize if this was not the case in your experience.  Please know that the issues you have listed will not be overlooked.  If you would like to further discuss the issues listed please feel free to contact me at any time.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary Heading: Another Perfect Stay at the Hotel Menage!!!
Summary: This was our second time staying at Hotel Menage..2 years ago to celebrate my wife's 50th Birthday and now for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Once again, from checking in to checking out, The Staff at the Menage are fantastic. Our room overlooking the pool was more than enough for our 4 night stay. The Disneyland Fireworks feel like there happening in your room there that close. An easy 10-15min walk to Disneyland Parks, a great breakfast buffet and a lovely pool area, Starbucks across the road. Would Definitely stay at The Hotel Menage again.
Manager Response: Dear Gorbie,  Thank you so much for your FIVE star review! Congratulations on your twenty fifth wedding anniversary! We are truly thrilled that your second visit to Hotel Menage was just as good as the first one.  Thank you for celebrating such a special occasion with us!  We hope to see you soon.  Leo Flores Front Office Manager  leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary Heading: Horrible front desk, don't stay here!
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights and If we had seen their little contract we would have definitely leave! The day we arrived front desk took 10 minutes to come out we could see the guy chillin on his desk and the bartender kept staring at us as if he didn't know what was going on. They held $200 as a security deposit for the room that they return back 3 to 4 business days on top of the price they give you! Your parking is $12 per night or $13 plus tips if you use the vallet services. Don't bother calling front desk from your room cause they won't pick up. The showers take about 10 to 15 to warm up. Other than that the American restaurant they have had great food and great service and so do the cleaning ladies but it does not correct the damage from the horrible people and horrible
Manager Response: Dear Paulafrioseco,  Thank you for your recent review.  We truly apologize if your experience was not a positive one.  Please know that the issues you outlined in your review will be addressed.  Best Travels   Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: The hotel was fine.  Clean enough, but nothing special.  The restaurant closed early, the beer was pretty expensive.  It was close enough for us to walk to Disneyland, but across the Interstate from all the restaurants and any evening activities. The garbage or laundry was was picked up outside our room every morning about 7:00am.  Not quiet. Fine - just boring.
Manager Response: Dear Boxler,  Thank you for taking time out or your day to post a review on your recent experiance.  We truly do apologize if we did not go above and beyond to provide a great guest experience.  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: The staff was super attentive, short walk to Disneyland, I noticed a lot of people were complaining about the "dangerous" walk to Disneyland, but its really not that bad, there is a side walk to walk on. Unless you decide to jump on the road. We had a toddler too, and I had no issues walking during day and night time. it took 10 minutes at most to get to Disneyland, maybe 15 minutes if you walk really slow.  rooms were clean, and beds were big.  So many people complain about it being a motel, but its actually pretty nice.  I was expecting the worst and was really worried after reading some of the reviews, but it was the opposite of it. I would definitely come back and stay here again!  Thank you for the wonderful experience!
Manager Response: Dear Leahalim  Thank you so much for your FIVE STAR review!  We are thrilled to hear that you truly enjoyed your stay.  Our team strives to provide a level of service that is above industry standards.  We are happy that you found the value you were looking for when visiting the Anaheim Resort area.  We look forward to seing you and your family soon!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary Heading: customer service could use a lot of improvement
Summary: problems checking in counter girl repeatedly stated that's not what I booked untilcopy of my reservation then she said we have problems with third party bookings and was shocked when I told her I booked through the menage website
Manager Response: Dear mitchmor1588,  Thank you for taking time out of your day to share your experience.  I truly do apologize if your experience was not a positive one. We pride ourselve in providing a level of service that is above industry standards, and we apologize if this was not the case in your experience.  Best Travels,   Leo Flores Front Office Manger leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: Although advertised as a boutique hotel, Hotel Menage is nothing more than a disguised motel. Nothing boutique about it. I recently attended a trade show in Anaheim, and was placed at the Hotel Menage. While the property is functional, there are many areas sorely in need of attention. The rooms have outside entrances which differentiates them from a hotel. My room had cracked and chipped baseboards, and needed a fresh coat of paint. Both my desk lamp and shower/tub light did not work. In addition, the toilet backed up badly during my stay. As other reviewers have mentioned, the Wifi was very spotty with only intermittent service. The décor of the room was very simple, and not representative of a boutique property. The one positive note was the friendliness of the employees.
Manager Response: Dear GeorgeW1111,  Thank you for sharing your experience.  We would like to apologize if your experience was not what you expected.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the level of service provided by our staff.  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We only stayed at the this hotel for one night as we were heading for San Diego early the next monring.  The hotel is in a great spot for Disney, literally not even a 5 minute drive away.  It was clean, staff were friendly, it had a bar, restaurant and pool area that all looked really nice.  We only used the bar area for one drink before heading to bed as we had been to a Basketball game in downtown LA.  Our room was facing the main the road but you hardly hear anything once in your room, it never disturbed us anyway.  Parking was about $12 per day if I remember rightly, you just need to get a permit from reception.  It did have free wi-fi which is always a bonus.    For anyone wanting a great location for Disney, I would recomend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear chunk1985,  Thank you so much for posting your review!  We truly are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay.  We are happy that you were able to experience the bar area.  We look forward having you as a guest soon!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: This place seems trendy/hip, and it is, however my kids and I had a great time relaxing in the pool and jacuzzi before heading to Disneyland the next day.  I saw non-kid families having a great time at the cabana and bar, having drinks.  I would use the valet, they have a great staff and are quick getting your luggage upstairs.  The rooms are well kept and nicely decorated.  You feel as though you are in a new place.  My kids loved the elevator because it is one that is external where you can see the pool from the elevator.  Stay here, you won't regret it.
Manager Response: Dear monica e,  Thank you so much for your FIVE star review!  We truly are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Our unique amenities make it a great place for both couples and families a like.  We look forward to serving you, and your family soon!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary Heading: Remodeled Motel. Dangerous Walk to Disneyland.
Summary: Summary: - It's a motel, not a hotel. - It's right next to a busy and loud freeway. - The walk to Disneyland is dangerous - If you leave anything after you check out, the housekeepers take it. - The wifi does not work, at all.  The pictures are misleading. It looks like a "boutique hotel" as they call it in the name. But it's really a remodeled motel with some modern looking furniture.  By definition, a motel has it's room doors facing outside, where a hotel the room doors face the interior. The doors are facing a busy freeway and it was very noisy.  It isn't a far walk to Disneyland but it's a dangerous walk especially when you walk back at night and/or you have small kids. You have to cross two streets where cars are getting on or off the freeway, then you have to walk on an
Manager Response: Dear polyester1970   Thank you for taking time out of your day to post your review.  We truly do apologize if your stay with us was not a positive one.  Please know that the issues you have listed will not be over looked.  If you would like to further discuss the issues you have listed please feel free to contact me at the email listed below.  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: I stayed at the hotel ménage in November 2014 for 12nights the staff where very friendly hotel rooms were very clean and tidy we could see the disneyland fireworks from the hotel every night hotel close to disneyland as we walked to and from every day had a great stay would stay again
Manager Response: Dear Daniel J,  Thank you so much for your FIVE star review!  We are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay.  We strive to provide friendly service that is above the industry standard.  We look forward to serving you as guest soon!  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We chose this hotel both in Nov 2014 and had such a great time that we went back in Jan 2015, love the location AND the staff, great property.  We could walk over to Disneyland easily in 12-15 min and have had great tips from the staff.  You have to love a hotel that treats their employees so well that they have been there a long time and know the local inside info.  Both Edgar and Kent were phenomenal.  This 2nd trip was during one of the DL marathons which meant Harbor Drive was closed to traffic till 8am- Kent was able to let us know that even during the marathons- when the flow of runners is heading away from the parks, we would be able to use the sidewalks to get there ourselves- no problem.  And we love the Taco Bell tucked right across the street, after a day of park
Manager Response: Dear T-2SanDiego,  Thank you for your FIVE star review!  We are happy to hear that you truly enjoy your visits to Hotel Menage.  We will definitely share your kind words with both Kent and Edgar.  We will see you soon.  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: I stayed here Tuesday (Feb 24) for one night. 31 yo, professional female with 1 other professional, 1 dog (55 lbs)  One of the things I really like about this hotel is the fact that they allow dogs (up to 60 lbs). My dog pretty much goes everywhere with me, so it is important to find a hotel that will allow her to stay. I am unsure if they allow the dogs to stay in the room unattended since I hire a pet-sitter to watch her while I am at the parks or doing other stuff.  When I stayed in this hotel the first time, 2 years ago, I had a nice room on the first floor right by the parking lot and requested the same room. It was already in use, so I got the one next to it and loved it just the same.   The rooms for dogs have exposed concrete and a huge rug in the middle of the 'living
Manager Response: Dear Quendallyn M,  Thank you so much for your pleasant words; our dedicated team enjoys hearing from Guest such as yourself and the great time that had with us.   We truly do love hosting guest with pets.  Best Travels,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, bad WiFi, make sure to check your bill
Summary: The Good: This hotel was a short walk to Disneyland and California Adventure.  It had a nice pool and hot tub that is open 24 hours a day.  The breakfast at the hotel restaurant was good and convenient.  The Bad:  The WiFi was very unstable and cut in and out all the time.  We booked a king room and when we first got to our room it only had a queen size bed.  We called the front desk and they apologized and moved us to a king room and gave us vouchers for breakfast.  Upon check-out I looked over our bill (and it's good I did) and they charged our room for the breakfast vouchers they gave us.  They did take the charge off when I pointed it out, but it is a little sketchy to me that they would even put the charge on the room in the first place as we would have paid for our "free"
Manager Response: Dear TravelingJohnB80,  Thank you for taking time out of your day to post your review. Please know that your feedback is truly appreciated.  We are happy to hear that we were able to resolve the issue with the billing in prompt manner.  Thank you,  Leo Flores Front Office Manager leof@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: The Hotel Menage does an exceptional job at marketing because the reality of the hotel is quite different to the magnificent photos on their website. Don't get me wrong, it is good value for money & the distance to Disneyland is very close.
