Summary: Decent hotel.   Pros: staff were excellent, walking distance to disneyland, nice restaurant, comfortable, great view of fireworks, self service laundry on site.  Cons: very close to freeway so quite noisy, nothing to do except disneyland, tiny bathroom, slow wifi.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are glad you enjoyed our friendly staff, our location to Disney and our great view of the fireworks.  Please know there are hundreds of things to do around the Anaheim area besides Disneyland - We have a full time Concierge available to answer any questions, make any suggestions, as well as arrange any activity your heart desires... all you have to do is ask!  Thank you for your candid comments.

Summary Heading: Best hotel for Disney! We loved it!
Summary: Very clean and nice- had 5th floor room facing pool- could hardly hear the freeway. Great happy hour by the pool with $5 cocktails and apps! Frank, the bartender, was great and Leo at check-in was very accommodating! We were welcomed as soon as we pulled up to the door. Just a great value, and hotel is lovely!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Based on the reviews I went forward with this hotel. There were a couple negative reviews but I took the chances. First of all I am so glad we booked here. Fast and easy check in made my husband feel very welcomed. We asked for a specific room and we got it. Already won over there. Lol then we get to our room and I was just... Amazed!! Very nice room, spacious and nicely decorated. The kids immediately said Wow mom this is nice! This is our first time staying here and for the price it's worth it. Hotel is not even a mile away from disneyland! Very nice property everything is gated makes me feel secure for us and the kids! We will be booking here in the future oh and btw they offer 10%off disneyland annual pass-holders! Take advantage lol and the king size bed.. Very comfy!!
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear about your recent experience at our hotel. Thank you for your kind words and compliments... we look forward to hosting you and your family again soon!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in a great location.
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights while in the area to see Disney etc.  Great location next to Disney (5 minute drive) and some restaurants, Starbucks, Walmart etc.   Our room had an outdoor entrance which overlooked the pool.  I thought this was nice as it was enjoyable being able to open the door and see if the pool was busy or get fresh air.  Our room was very clean, toilet and tub were separate from vanity area which was nice when travelling with a group-no fighting for bathroom and mirror time.   The restaurant in the lobby looked busy and had a decent menu (we didn't eat there though).   The pool and area was nice and grounds were well maintained but admittedly they need to update some of the sitting furniture as it was a bit worn.   I did wish there was an adult only pool section
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and you get nightly fireworks show
Summary: Our family recently stayed at the Hotel Ménage during Spring break. A friend of ours referred us to this hotel because it was a great hotel and it was walking distance to Disneyland.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. Christine at the front desk had us checked-in within minutes. The hotel itself was clean, and somewhat modern.  We were on the fifth floor on the Harbor Rd side and we were not bothered by any traffic noise.  Considering it was Spring break we didn't even hear people in adjacent rooms.    The hotel is located at the backside of the park were the fireworks go off.  We had front row seats to the fireworks nightly from our fifth floor balcony. After a long day at the park, it was great to watch a great firework show, turn around and walk into my room. Very
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and compliments to our friendly team! We are happy to know you had a great time with us, and we hope to host you and your family again in the future.

Summary Heading: Looking for good value close to disney? This is it!
Summary: Exceptional service. Kent went above and beyond to accommodate our high maintenance wives and bratty children! This was our second stay at the Ménage  and it won't be our last. The hotel offers valet parking, an awesome restaurant, gorgeous pool and a great view of the fireworks if you have to leave the park early. Disney's best value for sure.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post a review of your recent stay, and we are thrilled to have earned your loyalty! We look forward to hosting you and your families as you return to Disneyland. Thanks again for your kind words and recommendation.

Summary: Great location as hotel was about 15 minute walk across the bridge to Disney. Staff was very friendly. Room was rundown and noisy as it was next to the bar at the back of the restaurant. Room was not very clean as the mattress was stained with blood etc. Bed was hard and not comfortable. This is one step up from a motel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, great place to view fireworks
Summary: I recently stayed at the Hotel Menage.  I had read reviews raving about the view of the Disney fireworks, and I was not disappointed.   The Hotel Menage is a great place to view the fireworks.  I watched every night from my third floor balcony, and it was the next best thing to being there.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  The room itself was a decent size and clean.  We had one issue the first evening (the sink backed up), but a maintenance person showed up at our door almost immediately (within a half an hour) to fix the problem.  The pool area is wonderful, as is the poolside lounge and its staff.  My only complaint is that the wifi was extrememly unreliable.  Yes, I know that I was on vacation and should not be concerned about checking email, but email and data is a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are pleased to hear that you were so happy with the Disney fireworks show each night. Thank you for your compliments to our helpful and friendly staff, they are very appreciative. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again!

Summary: This hotel was close to disneyland. We walked sometimes and it took no longer than 10 min. I wouldn't do the walk if you have kids as its close to traffic on a busy road.  Being that you open your hotel door facing the road there is no barrier to traffic noise. However this didn't phase us as you are so tired from your day . Staff are very friendly and helpful. Restaurant  has nice food. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in April.  I have to pay the highest compliments to the entire staff.  From the bartenders (Haley & company) to the concierge (Erik in particular) and the restaurant staff...everyone went out of their way to make our stay and time in the area as flawless and stress free as possible.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit Disneyland and the surrounding area.  Bonus- 24 hour pool and hut tub!!
Manager Response: We really appreciate your compliments to our great staff members! Your kind words have been passed along, and we all look forward to hosting you again soon!

Summary Heading: Erik is my new travel agent!
Summary: I had a great stay with my family. He organized two rooms and set me up for my entire weekend get away. All the staff and the housekeeping made our stay a success. This 3 star hotel offers more than a typical Disney good neighbor hotel. You can't really rely on someone's bad review, its like judging the book by its cover. Thank you and we look forward to our next stay!
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay so much. Your kudo's to Erik's helpful service have been passed along. Thank you for your review and recommendations... we look forward to hosting you again!

Summary Heading: great location to Disneyland, great staff
Summary: We stayed for 6 nights last week and it was our first visit there. We found the beds comfortable and the hotel staff super friendly! The room was noisy, especially given the motel style where other guests tromp down the hallways at wee hours of the morning and wake up others. This is not the fault of the hotel nor their staff, so something we dealt with. The proximity to Disneyland is absolutely wonderful with a very brief walk over I-5 and you're in the park.   I would say to get 5 stars, the hotel should not allow 24-hour pool opening which causes wee-hour tromping of guests down the hallways. We also had one instance of an equipment alarm sounding at 2am and I had to alert security and the front desk to get it to stop. We also had one instance when the cleaning staff took our
Manager Response: none

Summary: My recent stay at Hotel Menage was simply flawless. From the arrival process, to the friendliness of the hotel staff, everything was so clean and organized. A HUGE difference from last years experience. I would like to mention "DAVID" in particular for the warm welcome as well as being so delightful in conversation as we were waiting to check in. He is a true asset to your company, and because of him I will be planning a return trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel, 10 minutes from the entrance to Disney
Summary: We stayed for 17 nights over Christmas & New year. The main things I took away from the Hotel was the friendliness of the staff, the quality of the rooms & the outstanding food available in the onsite restaurant. Our room overlooked the pool and the freeway, other reviews complain about the noise but after five minutes I didn't notice either of them and the nightly view we had of the Disney fireworks more than made up for it. The rooms are spotlessly clean and housekeeping staff do a fantastic job. My luggage went missing on out flight from the UK and didn't show up for a week and everyday reception staff went out of their way to help us contact the airlines, and when it finally did arrive night staff brought it straight to our room. The food is exceptional. Great value,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We  booked Hotel Menage four our 8 day Anaheim trip and it was a great fit.   Upon arrive we checked in, went up the glass elevator and easily found our room. I really enjoy the outdoor hallways as I usually find most hallways to be stuffy. Even thought the pool was open (It's open 24 hours) there was no noise. The room looked like it was recently redone and it looked great. I suggest a room facing the pool/highway so that you can see the fireworks from your hall if you wish.   The bathroom was clean and as was the pool. The pool had a little bar, not swim up, which I prefer. The hottub we did have to complain about a few times. It wasn't very hot at all the one night. More like lukewarm bath water. Someone did come out to check eventually after a long wait but just said it was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disney magic!
Summary: My family has stayed at the resort hotels at Disneyland all the times before our most recent trip. So I was wondering how this experience would rate! I have to say, what a great time! The room was just a hotel room, honestly, but we walked out to see the lovely pool area! Just across the road was the Disneyland Resort - EXCELLENT viewing spot for the fireworks every night from our room! Our small dog stayed with us in the room and he was quite happy too. The staff was all incredibly friendly and helpful. We ate dinner and Sunday brunch in the hotel's restaurant (American Tavern) and the prices were incredibly reasonable and everything was delicious. A great alternative to the Disney resorts. We walked to the park each day, which was about a mile once you got to the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Christine informed me to rate the hotel. I had a great experience here the room was clean the restrooms where nice and big, beautiful heated pool. All in all i would come back when visiting Disneyland since its literally right there (:
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Menage on a Monday and Tuesday night   The rooms were clean and comfortable.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  We had three rooms and then booked a suite for the just married couple and the suite was lovely.  There had been some damage guessing it was from the earthquake and they gave a discount on the room   there was no structure damage.  The restaurant was marginal  I thought 12.95 for the breakfast buffet was alot as unless you got it when they first brought it out it was cold  Only one waffel maker    The rates were reasonable as it was spring break When requesting something from customer service most often it came fast.  It took a while for the handicap toilet seat  I would definetely stay at this hotel again
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was Lonely Planets' "Top Choice", so we thought it'd be great. Not the case. Yes, it's a short walk to Disneyland, but you pay for it when you're trying to sleep. It's right next to the interstate and is not soundproofed. Otherwise, the staff is friendly and helpful, so that's a minor consolation, I guess...
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel Menage is within walking distance of Disneyland. That is the only thing is has going for it. We checked in late on Monday evening and hit the bed soon thereafter. The next morning when we went to shower, we noticed a personal body cleansing wand attached to the shower. Upon closer inspection, it was covered with what appeared to be lubrication or bodily fluid. The showerhead was also calcium encrusted. We informed the front desk immediately and they assured us the shower would be properly cleaned or the shower head would be replaced. That evening, after a full day at "The Happiest Place on Earth" we returned to the room and immediately went to inspect the shower. Not only had the showerhead not been properly cleaned, the wand was still attached and dirty. To make matters
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you want clean sheets
Summary: We stayed 5 days.  I noticed the same markings on our pillow cases on day 3 and wanted to see how long it would take house keeping to change our sheets.  Our family showers nightly before bed.    Well day 5 we still had the same sheets.  The tub/showers are old and chipping.  The bed frames are old and are to large for the smaller room.  I warned the family when we arrived keep shoes on because someone is going to stub their toe.  Low and behold my husband stubbed his toe so hard the second night when waking and returning from the restroom he ended up with a HUGE blood blister.  This hotel is nice if you DON'T stay in the rooms.  The dining area is nice as well as the pool.    They also charge $10.00 PER DAY just to park your car (which we discovered on the bill upon check out),
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not a boutique but a Best Western with a makeover
Summary: This hotel was a big disappointment. It is a $100 a night hotel NOT $200! Rooms are old and noisy. Glass is thin. Beds are marginal. Bar and restaurant close early (like everything else in Anaheim). Food was OK. Breakfast buffet $12.95 decent. The best part of this hotel is 24 hour pool and hot tub! Location is next to I-5 so better to get a room facing parking lot or ear plugs. When we checked in the room we had booked online was not available so we got free parking but had paid that much extra for the King room. They never cleaned our room. Oh well. Wouldn't stay again unless we were desperate.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just returned from another stay at the ménage, March 26th-30th. Our plane was late so we didn't end up checking in until midnight. Staff was helpful and pleasant as always even at that late hour. Nothing was open for food or drinks in the hotel at this hour on a Wednesday night so we settled for bed.  Bed was comfortable as was the bedding and the 6 pillows on the bed. The only problem with the bed is the low platform WATCH YOUR SHINS. Seriously be aware when you are walking around the bed. As other posters have commented the hotel is starting to show a bit of wear, bathtub coating peeling, we had two rooms one bathtub drain wasn't screwed into the tub the other rooms tub coating was peeling in quite a few places. That being said the room was clean and comfortable, I felt it
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind and detailed review of your recent stay. Your compliments and feedback are very much appreciated. All of us at Hotel Ménage are grateful for your loyalty and look forward to hosting you and your family again soon.

Summary: Close enough to Disneyland for a decent walk. Staff were attentive and friendly, room comfortable, fun Happy Hour. Big shout out especially to Andrew who organised 2 wheelchairs at a moments notice when we found we couldn't charge our motorised ones, helped us with Disneyland passes & greeted us by our first names every day. Special mention to Kent for the great recommendation of a Hollywood bus tour and Samantha who organised the tour quickly & efficiently. Our stay was wonderful thanks to everyone there! Will return and recommend to others.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Your shout-outs to Andrew, Kent and Samantha have been passed along, and your compliments are very much appreciated :) We are thrilled to know our friendly team has made such a wonderful impression, and we hope to hear from you the next time your travels bring you to the Anaheim area.

Summary: My family & I had a wonderful week at Hotel Menage after visiting from Australia. Friendly and helpful staff who were great at recommending things to do. They would also go the extra mile to made sure that all our disability needs were catered for and that we were comfortable. Comfortable rooms, yummy food, beautiful pool setting, conveniently located a short walk away from Disneyland and a magical view of the fireworks every night. I want to go back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Convenient to Disney Land, Affordable, Great Service & Nice Rooms!
Summary: Convenient location to Disney Land (within walking distance and also available shuttle), great friendly service, delicious and affordable breakfast buffet, nice pool & hot tub, clean and modern rooms, overall great trip!! Would highly recommend this hotel!!
Manager Response: We appreciate your complimentary review :) Thank you for choosing Hotel Ménage.. we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Noisy on the top floor, since it picks up the highway noise about 80 yards away. But a lower floor is significantly muffled since they have a 9 foot barrier [security] wall at ground level.   Overall a full 3.5 stars and our price was excellent on Hotels.com. If you have a car: we found the hotel well situated for the venues we were seeing:Hollywood Blvd., Natural History M., The Holocaust Museum, The Getty and Universal Studios and 6 flags.   The hotel contacted on the last day at 4:00 P.M. on our cell phone and reminded us that we had forgotten to check-out and asked us vacate ASAP or pay the extra day. We arrived back at the hotel at 5:00 and profusely apologized and the lady at the front recited the "you have to pay at least $70" which was about half price. We held our
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We are happy to hear of your positive experience, and we look forward to hosting your family again.

Summary: This place was fantastic, we walked to disney and caught the shuttle back. It was really close to food, shopping, disney, knotts etc. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The hotel bounces a little bit when big trucks go past on the freeway which I quess is normal but for someone that has been through a large earthquake it took a little bit of getting used too :). We had dinner in the restaurant and it was very nice. Everyone was helpful and the reception staff even printed directions for us. They posed for photos with our travel bears as well. The pool seamed a little bit dirty (leaves and stuff) but I think that was because we went at the end of the day and it had been quite windy. I will definitely be using this place as my Anaheim hotel. It felt very safe and secure.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear of your great stay with us! Thank you for your kind review and the great photo you posted :)  We look forward to hosting you both again, next time you return to Anaheim!

Summary: I went to Disney for the day and stayed at Hotel Manage. They have shuttle service to and from Disney for $5 all day per person so that was great! Really close to Disney.  Nice lobby, perfect for lounging and cocktails. Rooms were nice and clean. Jacuzzi was great the next day!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights. The room was clean & tidy although with the door open extremely noisy! The location is fantastic and a shuttle takes you directly to Disneyland for only $5 (unlimited travel to & from until 3am the following day) the breakfast buffet was good value for $12.95 and dinner was delicious! The best thing about this hotel is the location to the theme parks. The (heated)pool and spa looked lovely and were full all the time but we didn't have enough time to use it 😊
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review of your recent stay. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our location and restaurants, and we hope to see you both again soon!

Summary: Annual trip to Anaheim and I am undecided about this hotel.  Check in was painfully slow - they were training or had newbies on and the kid just could not get that I was in a hurry, despite me explicitly saying so. I had been travelling all day, had food spilt on me, and was needing to change clothes before going out to a meeting. Despite me saying that I was tired, was in a hurry, and eventually late, the desk clerk decided to check all four people in my party in, to explain the amenities and give directions to our rooms.  We thought the rooms were quite cavernous and a little creepy at times. You follow a dimly lit hallway to what looks like a dead end, before arriving to your room, which is next to the highway. You thought you were going to get sleep, were you?   To be fair,
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear of your frustrating day and seemingly slow check-in service. We take a lot of pride in our friendly and helpful front desk team, and I apologize that their attention to detail brought you further dismay. We feel it very important that we explain our amenities and make sure our guests feel taken care of from the beginning of their stay. Your feedback regarding housekeeping details have been noted and will be discussed with our team. Thank you for your candid comments.

Summary: My boyfriend and I arrived at Hotel Ménage at 8:30am and the friendly staff got us into a room straight away. The room was quite close to the highway so it was quite loud. The room is good. The building is a little dated but overall it has everything you need. It is not far from Disneyland. We walked the first day and then caught the shuttle for the other days. Great view of the fireworks display. Very friendly staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear you were able to enjoy an early check-in, our friendly staff and the nightly view of the Disneyland fireworks show. We hope you think of us again next time you travel to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great for a quick Disneyland trip
Summary: We stayed at Hotel Ménage with our 12 year old son for three days over his Spring Break from school. It was exactly what we needed. It was a 10 minute walk to the park gates. It's over the freeway, so a little further than the cluster of hotels right across the street. You need either kids in a stroller or old enough (10 and over, maybe) to handle the walk. We still had complaining at the end of the night!    The real gem of this hotel is fabulous staff and a really good restaurant. Our son has allergies to some perfume, sometimes. His eye swelled up. The staff stripped everything and replaced it all with linens and towels washed in a sensitive detergent. They offered us some Benadryl, too, though we didn't need it, since we always travel with it.   The restaurant was very good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here several times and it's always excellent. Really nice people and facility. The shuttle stops in front so you can go anywhere. Nice pool and spa and uncrowded. Rates are very good and the bar and restaurant are the best. We'll be back often!
Manager Response: Dear Cands2,  We are so grateful for your loyalty to our hotel! Thank you for your numerous great reviews. We look forward to continue hosting you both again and again as you visit Anaheim :) Warm Regards, Staff and Management, Hotel Ménage

Summary Heading: First time good, second time not so = bad bed not repeatable
Summary: We stayed here for two nights a few years ago with a Groupon or such that included a meal and parking for each day.  We had a great room that we could walk out from overlooking pool and see the Disney fireworks perfectly.  Freeway is loud, but once the door was closed couldn't hear it.  Jump ahead to March 2014.  Had ground floor room overlooking pool.  Not partial to cement floors, black ceiling and room was extremely dark.  Even with all five lamps on it wasn't well lit since the wattage was low on the bulbs.  Luckily the pool wasn't very busy, but disliked walking out of my room to cigar smoke from men at the pool bar.   The walk to Disneyland seems doable - but due to the freeway and inclines not pleasant.   Restaurant was decent, fair prices and interesting variety of
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review of your recent stay. We are sorry to hear that you were unsatisfied with your guest room this time around. I assure you, if you had mentioned your concerns to our front desk team, we would have been more than happy to relocate you to a room more similar to the one you stayed in previously. Your feedback is important to us as we continually strive for improvement.  Thanks again for your candid comments.

Summary: The Hotel Menage was very nice for the price. Great hotel if you are traveling with teenage kids. Close enough to the park and the bus service makes it easy to go back and forth. Rooms are nice and the staff was very friendly. Frank at the Palapa Bar was always great. Very friendly and provided great service. The hotel is both fun for kids (although I wouldn't recommend small children) and adults. Plenty to do for both. Now... the only negative..Our last night at the hotel their computer system went down. Apparently they were unable to process the bar tabs on your room. The problem is the bartender working didn't say anything. I asked for my check and he gave it to me. He was busy so I signed it and added tip etc...and left. This was around 10;45 or so. At 12:30 am (with my
Manager Response: Dear Tom M, Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and appreciate your shout-out to Frank at the Palapa Bar. Your compliments have been passed along.  I am so sorry to hear about your midnight call! That is truly a bad judgment call; we will have follow-up training regarding the appropriate times to alert a guest of any issue. Again, my apologies for disturbing you and your family at such an inappropriate hour. This is certainly not typical! We appreciate your loyalty and we look forward to hosting you and your family again soon. Warm Regards, Staff and Management, Hotel Ménage

Summary: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Menage. The staff was amazingly friendly, specially at the front desk and the pool bar! The pool is open 24 HOURS with the perfect temperature! how AMAZING! It is just  perfect to relax and enjoy the great weather. Thank you Hotel Menage Team, you definitely went beyond our expectations! We totally recommend this Hotel!
Manager Response: We are thrilled to receive your high recommendation! Thank you for your review... we look forward to hosting you and your family again soon!

Summary: We stayed here in February for 3 nights.  The restaurant was excellent, the serviced even better!!!  The rooms were nice and pretty clean.  I'm very picky about this.  There was some road noise but we put in probably the best located room in the hotel so it was not something that kept us awake.  However, on the 3rd night there was one male who yelled "woohoo" until about 2am.  He was down at the pool area.  Upon checkout the Manager approached us and asked how our stay was.  I let him know exactly as above and he was genuinely concerned about the "woohoo" guy.  He asked that next time I call the front desk and they would address it.  I believe he would.  The only thing that stops me from giving it a 5 is "woohoo" guy... We probably give it another try since we visit Anaheim
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review of your recent stay. We appreciate your feedback, and would indeed be happy to put an end to any raucous behavior in the pool that disturbs our guests. I apologize once again that the antics of another guest disrupted your overall positive experience. We appreciate your loyalty very much, and look forward to the opportunity to host you and your friends again soon!

Summary: We stayed here for a week recently and really enjoyed it. The positives were: - very close to Disneyland, 1 kilometre to the Disney admission gates measured on my GPS watch. The walk was a good way to start and end our days at Disneyland - good sized rooms with a very comfortable bed. We had the king bed and sofa for the two of us and had plenty of space. The bathroom just has a shower/bath and toilet with the wash basin/vanity in the main room but we found that more suitable than having it all in the bathroom. - great pool and hot tub - laundry facilities which were handy on our rest days - good tavern with food downstairs. On busy days when you were too tired to go out it was good to know there was good quality food available at reasonable prices. Great happy hour prices. -
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear the things you enjoyed about your recent stay! Thank you for your shout-out to Patrick; this has been passed along. Your candid comments and feedback are very much appreciated.

Summary: We had a family christmas holiday there. 9 of us stayed,walking distance to Disneyland, friendly staff,good burgers,nice pool and hot tub. We could watch the fireworks every night from the hotel. Which by the way are extremely loud so it will scare the crap out of you if your not expecting it lol.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear that your family of 9 enjoyed your week at our hotel. Thank you for taking the time to post your review! We look forward to hosting you all again soon :)

Summary: Had a good stay at the Menage. Eric on the front desk was very helpful. He went that extra mile for us. Room a bit dated.  I did not here any noise from  bar outside. After hearing people had complained about it. Hotel does need update. But the closeness to Disney makes it all worth while.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When I went to stay at the ménage with my friends, I had an amazing time! The staff was super friendly, and the restaurant was amazing! I don't know when I've had better hotel food. The pool and jacuzzi were the perfect temperature, and my bed was wayy more comfortable than my one back home! Overall very happy and surprised! Definitely would come back again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. Your compliments to our friendly team, our restaurant, and our property are very much appreciated. We look forward to hosting you again!

Summary: I stayed at Hotel Menage through a great deal I found on Groupon.  When we got there,  though,  I did see an advertised rate lower than the Groupon and that concerned me in regards to quality.     Upon check in (noon) our room want ready,  so we stored it and returned our rental car to avoid the parking fee.  We enjoyed our day at Disneyland and made plans with the hotel to check in late.  At the end of our day,  we boarded the shuttle.  They only take cash onboard, and have day passes for sale in the hotel lobby that you can purchase with card too.   The shuttle does stop at multiple hotels,  but definitely worth it.   The service of all the staff at the hotel was amazing! Prob the best thing of the hotel because nothing else does them justice.  When we got to our room, the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Your feedback and candid comments are valued, and we appreciate your compliments to our location, the great service provided by our team members, and our spacious guest rooms. Our apologies that your room was not more quiet; we get very mixed reviews about the hum of traffic, however, most guests find our hotel to be ideally located with convenient access to all Anaheim has to offer.

Summary Heading: Only if you enjoy the sound of I-5
Summary: When we arrived here, and went to our room, standing outside the door, my husband said "I can't hear you".  That's how loud the traffic noise is.  We moved to the other side, but it has 6 lane roads on each side anyway.  The online pictures were very deceptive, I had expected and  hoped for a more luxurious place to relax when back from long days at the park.  The pool area was ok, but again, so LOUD.  The rooms were nothing special. The only good things were the food at the restaurant was actually quite good, and the staff was very nice and helpful. The shuttle service was pretty good, the waits weren't too long, but it was just another thing to wait for, after waiting for every ride in the park!   If I go back to Disney, I will pay more, stay across the street (literally) or
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I can understand how overwhelming Anaheim can be regarding traffic and lines for everything in "The Happiest Place on Earth." With over 42 million visitors a year, the city of Anaheim has found that extensive highways and multiple lane city streets are the only way to handle the masses of visitors and vehicles. Our hotel is very conveniently located, however, that also means we are in the midst of all the action that is Anaheim. For some, this is a benefit; for others, a detriment.  We appreciate your feedback. Thank you for staying with us!

Summary: Friends, family and I stayed here back in October and from reading what most reviews that have been written I pretty much shared the same experience. First off let me say the Pros: The staff was great Form the Ladies at the front desk to the Bartender, my niece came along that has a disability and we received a handicap room which was nice and roomy and over seeing the pool. Now let me tell you the Cons: Yes the walls are very thin I was able to hear my neighbors from above and the room next door which cause me to loose a lot of sleep which did leave me in a grumpy mood and to top it off the people so called friends we invited ;( stole our tickets to Disneyland and gave them to there sons friend it was a total bad experience on this trip I can't blame the hotel for the tickets
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are glad to hear that you appreciated our friendly staff and bartenders, and that the accessible room provided for your niece was comfortable with a great view. We are very sorry to hear that your friends stole your tickets to Disneyland, thereby ruining your trip; that must have been extremely infuriating.  Thanks again for your candid comments.

Summary: This place was nice when you walked it, but very cold and not warming when you walk into the rooms.  It is industrial style with no carpet which makes the room chilly.  The beds were hard as rocks! I almost slept on the floor at one point.  The bath tub was painted over and chipping.  Plus, I had to clean our own bathroom!! Who does that on vacation?  When we got in the room I called the front desk asking of we could switch rooms because there was soap left in the tub, hair in the tub, and dirty towel in the corner.  The rest of the room was very clean.  We called the front desk to ask to switch rooms and the guy told me he would look into it and never called back.  We waited about an hour and tried again.  Needless to say, I was sick of calling (after 5 times) and bought
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Looks attractive online, but not worth it
Summary: I thought this might be our new regular place to stay near Disneyland, but I won't stay here again. The pictures make it look much nicer than it is. 24 hour pool and gym is a plus, but the pool isn't that great, so you won't want to spend much time there anyway.   The bathrooms are very tiny and dated. The rest of the room is decent. Noise is a major factor here as the walls are thin and the hotel is right next to the freeway. They also blast music in the mornings.   The shuttle service is terrible, I wouldn't recommend it. It's shared with other hotels that are further away and you have to wait for it to make its stops at those hotels before arriving at yours. It also doesn't come at regular times so you have to guesstimate.   The breakfast buffet is pretty good, but ours was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A slightly upgraded holiday inn on the highway
Summary: First they put me in a ground floor room- you had to walk around the back, past some seedy hotel offices, through the laundry room, unlocking security gates. It was dark and scary. They then put me on the fourth floor facing the i5. Sooooo loud- car noise all night long. Room was dark and worn out. Worst hotel and nights sleep I have had in years. The neighborhood is pretty sketchy too. Pass on this one!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here with my best friend for 3 days as we wanted to go to Disneyland and explore Anaheim, we found this hotel perfect as it was in walking distance to Disneyland however it was still far enough away that you got to escape all the kids and families. We walked to the park both days and didnt find it a hard walk although we are both in our early twenties, it only took 15-20 mins to walk there. The pool area is great with a spa and plenty of lounge chairs. There is a secure gate to ensure little kids cant just wander off to the pool unsupervised which makes it very safe. All the staff were friendly when it came to organising taxis and transfer. The room was clean and comfy and the gym was well maintained. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Disneyland!
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear about what you and your friends enjoyed about our hotel and location. Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your stay; we look forward to hosting you all again soon!

Summary: We bought a package deal through Costco and this was the hotel that was a Disney good neighbor hotel that came in the package. I have to say it was decently located though we definatly appreciated that we also received an ART pass. I cannot imagine walking to the park from this hotel!  The staff was very friendly and let us check in at 11am as we arrived in town earlier than expected. We felt that was very nice. Also we were able to keep our car int the parking lot after we checked out to enjoy the park on our last day. This elevated a huge hassle for us!   The rooms are basic and clean. I was a bit worried after seeing some of  the other reviews and pictures. I also knew what to expect a bit more and have realistic expectation. Honestly we didn't spend much time in the room or
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel with 2 friends.  I had previously stayed there and some of the staff remembered me.  I was greeted immediately.  The front desk staff, Patrick and Sergio, made sure that I had everything I needed.  I was using a rental electric scooter which was waiting for me when I arrived.  They offered to keep the scooter for me and see that it was charged every night.  One of the bell staff saw that I was sitting in the lobby waiting for my friend, and stopped to make sure everything was okay.  He continued to chat with me for a few minutes longer. The food in the restaurant is excellent! It is a great location with easy access to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Myself and my girlfriend and 2 friends stayed here for 4 nights. Great location for Disney land but a fairly long way from the beaches! Erik at the front desk was very helpful and looked after us when it came to tours. Would stay here again thanks!
Manager Response: We're so happy you and your friends enjoyed your recent stay :) Thank you for your comments.

Summary: Stayed here with 3 others on our first visit to Anaheim. We received a room with a king bed and a fold out double which is not that appealing for 4 adults. However, this was understandable as the hotel was booked out due to presidents day w.e. The next morning helpful staff moved us to a more suitable room with a king and queen bed. Rooms were spacious and clean. We were worried about the traffic as the location is next door against a major freeway, to be honest, never really heard any traffic! 15min walk to Disneyland and restaurants. The pool/bar/spa area was clean and appealing. Enjoyable stay! thanks Hotel Menage!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are so happy you and your friends enjoyed your stay. We hope that this was merely your first of many future visits to California, and that you will choose Hotel Menage again :)

Summary: For the price that we paid for this hotel we were pretty happy with what we got.  The rooms are clean and a great size, more than enough room for two of us and a lot of luggage (including ski bags!). You could hear the freeway, but once you closed the door it was fine and didn't keep us awake.  The bathrooms were tiny and could to with a bit of refurbishment.  We didn't use much of this hotels facilities as we were really just there for Disneyland.  For this, the hotel is in a great location.  It's at most a 10 minute easy walk to Disney straight down the freeway (footpath the whole way so safe).  The hot tub was nice, but often full with families and children as late as 10pm, which was a bit annoying but to be expected where we were I guess.  If you are travelling with kids
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review of your recent stay! We are so glad you had a chance during your busy stay to enjoy our restaurant and bar. Your shout out to Erik is very much appreciated.. he is indeed a wonderful and valuable member of our great team.

Summary: We moved from our Disney park hotel halfway through our CA holiday and I was dubious having booked this hotel from the UK before we left but it exceeded all expectations. The rooms were modern, comfy and fitted with all amenities we could possibly need. The pool area was lovely and relaxing! Really close to the Disney parks (we walked it in around 10 mins) and totally easy to navigate, just having to follow the one path. The staff were so friendly and a real credit to the hotel! We ate pretty much all our morning and evening meals at the hotel and the extensive range and wonderful menu never failed to disappoint. Thank you to all the staff and the awesome concierge's who gave us a laugh.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are thrilled to hear that we have exceeded your expectations. Your comments and compliments to our friendly staff are appreciated and have been passed along to them :)

Summary Heading: Lovely Stay, will stay again next time
Summary: Hotel was very clean and surprisingly quiet considering its position.   Access on from the I-5 and easy only about 2 minutes  About 15-20 minutes walk to Disneyland, and plenty of places to eat in the vicinity Meals in the hotel were nice.  The staff very friendly and helpful. The WiFi was very slow to the point where it wasn't really working but we had our phones with data so we managed ok.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here as a family of 4 in December for 5 nights.  This is a great hotel for Disneyland visits as it has everything you would need and is a 15 minute walk from Disneyland entrance.  Yes it is right next to huge freeway and noise is evident, but all other services are good.  Great pool area for kids inclusive of table tennis and spa with pool bar great for parents at end of day.  Didn't use the restaurant but did have room service one night with  no complaints.  Laundry facilities  and helpful front desk made our stay really enjoyable.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear about your enjoyable visit in December! Thank you for your candid comments. We hope to host you and your family again!

Summary: We stayed here last week for 4 days, this was our first time staying here and we're already planning our next trip! We have annual passes for Disneyland, so we go there often and this will now be our "go to" hotel!  From the moment we walked in and throughout our stay Donna made us feel welcomed. All of the valet guys were great too, we were greeted every time we arrived, and their service was great they were very attentive. Frank the bartender was also great. Everyone that worked there was pleasant and always nice. The restaurant had really good food, happy hour specials were great, and the dessert was amazing!!!! The hotel itself was very nice! The pool and spa being open 24 hours was a major plus! The bar by the pool was awesome as well, and we had a great view of fireworks
Manager Response: We are so thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your recent stay! Your compliments about our great team are very much appreciated and have been passed along to Donna, Frank, our housekeeping and our valet teams. We are all looking forward to hosting you again soon!

Summary: Hotel wasn't bad it's really pretty. The freeway noise wasn't an issue. Good service from valet and front desk. The room was nice but the bed was so uncomfortable. The pillows were awful!!  For the price we paid you would think the pillows would be soft. I didn't sleep at all the bed was hard as a rock. We had dinner at the restaurant there, seating arrangements were bad and the service was even worse. I won't be going back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your compliments and feedback. We are sorry to hear of your uncomfortable night of sleep. Please know, our main concern is for our guest's comfort and satisfaction. We are well aware that comfort to one may be discomfort to another. Our friendly staff strives to correct, or at least improve, any situation that is brought to their attention, and would have been more than happy to trade your pillows out for others you may find to be more comfortable, or even provide extra mattress pads to soften your bed... all you have to do is ask!  We appreciate your candid comments.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney and Excellent Food
Summary: Stayed at Hotel Menage with my husband and our 5-year old son about two weeks ago. We stayed Saturday through Thursday and had an excellent experience. We loved how close it was to Disney although we still ended up buying ART transit passes as our feet were so tired by the end of the day. I can imagine that the 24 hour pool would cause issues during peak seasons, but for an off-peak time of year, we only heard noise on Saturday night. The rest of the week was quiet. The staff was incredibly friendly, rooms were clean and tasteful - extremely comfortable, warm bed. The best part was the restaurant - affordable, tasty food. Happy hour is the best - ate the tangy wings every night! We never bothered with food anywhere else as the food there was so good - ate breakfast and dinner
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review. We are pleased to hear of your family's excellent experience with us. Your kind compliments to our friendly staff, comfortable and clean rooms, and our tasty restaurant are very much appreciated. We look forward to hosting you and your family again!

Summary: We stayed here for a week on a trip to Disneyland. It is the perfect balance of proximity to the park but enough distance to keep the prices down. Like everyone says, the staff are amazing! So friendly, always saying hi, asking how your day was. This hotel is busting with value. We still cant believe the experience we got for the price we paid.  Yes it is right on the freeway and there is road noise but nothing overly noticeable and the rooms are quiet.  Only are breakfast at the hotel once but it was good. Typical buffet and service was spectacular as usual.  We will certainly stay at Menage on our next visit!
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear about your week stay :) Thank you for your kind comments and compliments to our amazing staff. We are looking forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: This was my second stay at hotel menage. Great staff, nice clean facility and clean rooms. Breakfast was great, all you can eat for 12.99, can't beat that. Arrived at 12:30 and had an early check in. Would definitely stay for any trip I take to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Hotel was nice . I could see that it was once an older hotel that they re did. It is RIGHT by the freeway so be ready to hear cars for a portion of your stay . They will charge you for the Disneyland shuttle but its not too bad . Location is fantastic for getting to the park . I would not stay at this hotel during spring break with little ones . I feel that other hotels is the area would be better suited for families .If you are a single person, a couple, or if you are not traveling with children then this is the hotel for you . The food is not too expensive at the on site cafe and it was pretty tasty .
Manager Response: We appreciate your review and candid comments. Just a clarification for our readers: Hotel Ménage does not charge for the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) Shuttle to Disneyland; the fee for riding the shuttle is charged by the shuttle company. Whether you purchase the shuttle tickets from our concierge or from the shuttle driver, the prices are the same.

Summary: We checked in, with the hopes of having a nice couple of days. The problem was with the complimentary WiFi...or the lack thereof.  I work freelance, and having internet access is a must. We called, they reset the routers, and it worked for a short time. Then...it quit again. So, I went down, and they sent the maintenance staff to check the router again. It kicked back on, and so, we moved to another hotel.  We were fully prepared to have to battle to get any money back, but the owner, Patrick, wasn't having it. He refunded our entire stay to us without a fuss, and with profound apologies. He did ask us to give the hotel another try, which we will gladly do...just not when I have to work.  Before all of this, we had a great dinner in the restaurant, and highly recommend it to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your experience. While it is unfortunate that we were unable to accommodate your needs at the time, we are happy to hear that you could appreciate the great service Patrick was able to provide. We look forward to your return! Thanks again for your candid comments.

Summary: Great hotel friendly staff and I totally enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Affordable and clean freeness wifi close to Disneyland and other shops also. If I ever go back I will stay here again and it will be recommend to all I know.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I specifically chose this hotel for its proximity to Disneyland which was good as well as the pool and jacuzzi being open 24 hrs for my adult children which they loved. The rooms were spacious and beds were nice and firm which I need. The buffet breakfast was plentlyful and priced well and all the hotel service was good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Recently stayed here as to visit Disneyland. Walking distance to Disneyland, or there is a shuttle. Room was lovely and clean! Only small complaint would be the road noise, and noise from car park in mornings with trucks, etc. but this didn't upset our stay. Great happy hour, with food and drinks. Otherwise restraunt was lovely, ate dinner and breakfast here once. Which we enjoyed.  Couple of little shops across the road, very handy. Found the staff to be wonderful and very friendly. Big thanks for making our stay special. Would stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to know you enjoyed your stay, and we hope to host you again soon.

Summary Heading: Got the minimum of what I expected
Summary: We stayed here for a trip to Disneyland. The room was sufficient. The bed was a little less comfortable than I would have preferred and the pull out bed from the couch was not very nice at all. The room was generally clean, but felt a little run down.   We picked this hotel because we thought it would be close enough to walk to disneyland. If it had just been my wife and I, or if we had older kids it would have been an ok walk. However trying to do the walk with our 5 year old was longer than we could comfortably do. (especially at the end of the day) We ended up taking a taxi for the 2nd and 3rd days which was only about $5 each way.   The pool was big and fun to swim in for our daughter, but at night it was overrun by a bunch of drunk college kids that were obnoxiously loud
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We are disheartened to hear that it wasn't quite the experience we strive to provide for each guest. Your comments are heard, and we will review these with our management team. Thank you again for your candid comments.

Summary: The hotel  staff are amazing helped us with a issue at the front desk and got it sorted straight away. I was a bit hesitant about staying here as I had read a lot reviews saying it was bad, but I can say they were wrong I found the rooms very spacious and very clean. There's a safe in the room if you need to put personal items away that you don't want to loose. The pool area is always clean and tidy and we loved the happy hour as well. Being next to a main highway wasn't a issue for us as everyday we were doing something so when we came back  you were too tired to worry. Disneyland is only a 10min walk so everything is very close
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay. Thank you for your kind remarks and feedback. We hope to host you again, should your travels bring you back to the Anaheim area.

Summary: I'm sad to say that Hotel Menage is no longer my favorite hotel in the Disneyland Area. It appears to me they're slipping.  We book-ended a stay at a timeshare with nights at the Menage.  We've done this in the past as well and ended up visiting the Menage for dinner or happy hour even on nights we weren't staying there because we thought the food was that good.   This time, it seemed more like any other hotel with a restaurant.  They don't seem to know what to do with that space, I've seen three different restaurants there over the years.  We ate in the restaurant our first night, the food was good but not fantastic. There was a singer, I was sad, for a while we were the only ones there to hear him.    The service isn't quite what it used to be either.  We stayed two nights,
Manager Response: Dear tkrbl, First, I would like to thank you for your loyalty to our Hotel. Your yearly visits are truly appreciated! I am so sorry to hear the events of your most recent stay that have moved you to disappointment in us. I would love the opportunity turn this around and apologize personally for the way we fell short of your expectations. As you mentioned in your review, this is a fluke, and I will work to ensure you, and every guest, feels welcomed as a friend each time they return to our hotel.  Please know, our housekeeping and front desk teams have received supplemental training based on the feedback you have provided. Thank you for your candid comments. Please feel free to contact me any time. Sincerely, Jessica jessicak@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: My new go to hotel whenever I travel to Disneyland or anywhere in LA. I would call it my home away from home! We were extremly pleased with this hotel.Super friendly helpful staff. great location with 24 hour heated pool access and hot tub use! Very clean hotel and easy parking! Also you could sit around the pool have great appetizers and drinks at a great price. Wonderful delicious breakfast table service not just the basic get your food and go the waiter tasked to you and jokes and very charismatic. This is a family friendly but still is a great place for couples and singles. Bar in hotel was a plus. I really want to thank Erik Libid this man is an all around great person from helping us get the room that fit our needs to giving all the information we needed beyond our hotel
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your compliments and recommendation! We are thrilled to hear what a great experience you had with us. Your shout-out to Erik is so appreciated; he is a valuable member of our team. We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit!

Summary: This hotel was in a great location and the staff where excellent and made our stay very comfortable.  The $5 happy hour was the best.  The rooms where very clean and comfortable.  I am planning to go back Sept 2015 and I will definitely stay at the Hotel Menage.  HIGHLY recommended. :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Public spaces ok, but loud highway noise and minimum upgrades to existing 2 star hotel.
Summary: We were travelling to Disney for the weekend and say the Hotel online and looking at the images and boutique description decided to book. The staff at the front were very friendly, and public spaces on main floor are boutique like. However, our room had no noise buffering from the Interstate 5 right outside our door. The bathroom, carpeting and paint were no better than a 2 star motel. Mattresses were comfortable but pillows were not. The sink was outside the bathroom so if anyone is sleeping and you need to use the sink area, there is no privacy. Our breakfast for two adults and two children cost $75 with nothing but average food. Would not recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback. We are sorry to hear that you and your family were negatively affected by the nearby highway. We have put many barriers in place to quiet traffic, however, there is no escaping the fact that Anaheim is an extremely busy tourist city, and we are central to all the action. Your comments concerning your guest room have been noted and will be discussed with management. Thanks again for your feedback.

Summary: I recently took my family to Disneyland for our first vacation in years.  Disneyland itself was awesome, it's a good thing we were so occupied away from the hotel.  First impression:  Nice enough lobby, average restaurant downstairs, nice pool area.  Once we got to the room, I realized the lobby was the newer part of the hotel.  Our room wasn't horrible, but the beds and pillows were hard, the bathroom was TINY and the shower head was only partially functional.  The housekeeping service was very good, and the front desk staff was friendly.  We talked to them a lot because the wifi was out for our entire five night stay, so my son could not complete his homework.  This was especially disappointing.  Our room also happened to be juxtaposed between the busy freeway, and the vent
Manager Response: none

Summary: 200 or so fans arrived for the Canucks versus Ducks on Jan,6 at the Honda Center all at once. Stan H The hotel did not have  enough service staff to have all the rooms ready at once for the 12 noon check in so some of us had to wait 4 hours but the sun was shinning and hot out in the pool bar area and they did their best to make sure every got the food and beverages they wanted while we waited. Once we got our room it was nice, clean and quiet even though it faced the pool area and the several revelers after the game at the bar. Someone said it was noisy up till 1:00 am but always take ear plugs if you are a smart traveler, They gave us 2 for 1 coupons for the restaurant during the wait  and $40.00 room credits for a great breakfast the next morning.and have also given us a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Be careful on which room you are assigned when staying at this hotel. We booked two rooms at this hotel that was originally built as a TravelLodge. All rooms open onto an exterior hallway. I thought all of the rooms had additional security through hallway gates... until we got to our rooms. It opened up to a gated parking lot, but anyone from the outside could walk by the gates. We were only staying one night, so we didn't stress over it. When we walked into the room, we noticed that the floor in both of our rooms were concrete. Mine was painted, but my daughter's was not. We also had exposed pipes overhead. I've seen "industrial design" in restaurants, but not in a hotel room. They were painted dark gray to match the ceiling, but still ugly. Be sure to bring bedroom slippers,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in Hotel Menage for 4 nights. It was a decent stay. Decent and clean rooms. Claim to be a 4 star hotel more like a 3 star. Pics on the internet are decieving and outdated. But I guess because it is so close to disney it made it nice. its walking distance to disney about 2km if not slightly more. hotel staff were friendly.Aircon in the room was loud ad noisey, sounded like it needed a service. Overall it was a decent stay here, not to sure if I will stay here again though.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'd like to keep this review short because people tend to be impatient reading long reviews. My family and I booked our vacation at the Menage Hotel. In the lobby there was a big Christmas tree. The employees were friendly and approachable. But one employee stood out in customer service, Kent at the front desk. He really seemed like he knows what he's doing. I had a great experience and can't wait to come stay again at the Menage Hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked this holiday a week in advance and I don't usually bother to write reviews, but feel that this is one occasion that i should. We arrived at this lovely Christmas decorated hotel on 27 December 2013 around 9.30pm after driving from Manchester to heathrow then the long flight tired but excited.  Our transfer from the airport was long but we expected that what I didn't expect was when asked the driver what the usual rate for a tip was, he tried to make me pay for all 3 of us. I politely pointed out we had paid through Virgin and i just wanted to tip him but he got very aggressive.  I moved myself and kids into hotel reception where he followed and continued to demand money.  I gave my paperwork to the receptionist and asked for help.  A lovely lady called Vanessa came
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is in a good position for Disney and is within easy walking distance to the parks.  Staff were friendly and helpful throughout the stay giving good tips and advice on getting the best out of visiting the parks. The rooms themselves were clean and a good size, however the walk ways to the rooms were a bit grim and dark.  Unfortunately we had a pile of broken furniture left at the end of our walk way for the duration of our stay which was a bit of an eye sore.  We had a room on the back of the hotel, yes when exiting the room it was a little noisy but once in the room and hotel it wasn't an issue.  We ate in the restaurant on one night, the menu was good, staff friendly and of a good standard. Lovely fish Taco's! We also had breakfast on one morning which was again of a
Manager Response: none

Summary: It was our second stay at this hotel. The first time we stayed there, it was a brand-new hotel. This time, you could see that hotel is not well-maintained; chips off walls, discoloration, marks, bathtub has bumps in it, yellowish stains and shower heads have calcium build-up. I did not want to give a bath to my child in this hotel. When activated, the hot tub had some type mousse in it (?!).  When you take a king bed, there is also a sofa bed in the room. I could feel ALL of the mattress springs. Very poor quality mattress. We had to put to the sofa bed's cushions on the sofa bed so our daughter could sleep on it.  We had a great night sleep in the king size bed. Clean sheets, good pillows. It is noisy when you open the door, dut to the highway, but we couldn't hear anything
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice good sized room and location
Summary: We went here for a four day stay at Disneyland. We wanted to get something close by so that we could walk. Hotel ménage was a good 10-15 minute walk, which wasn't too bad for us. There were restaurants close by as well so it was convenient. The rooms were decent sized and looked modern actually. Kind of like a loft (at least the room we had). This was a good property to stay at. The only thing I don't like and for other hotels alike is that is the rooms can be access from outside. I prefer if you have to go through a main door.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent location for Disneyland - a short 10 minute walk down South Harbour Boulevard.  Hotel is clean, friendly staff, good buffet breakfast and restaurant.  Yes it's quite noisy because of the traffic - it's in a triangle between three very busy roads - but it didn't really bother us at all.  Would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a good location, a short walk to the theme parks down the road.  A couple of negative things - the highway directly behind the hotel can be very noisy at night, however you can't hear this from you room, but if you want to relax downstairs, it is noisy.  The carpet leading into the bathroom was soaked.  This was probably due to the shower curtain being on the outside of the tub before we got into the room.  I don't know why hotels use shower curtains - they just make a mess.  The bed was great, and the room was big and comfortable.  The staff were very friendly and helpful, and even sent us two bottles of champagne to help us celebrate our honeymoon.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to lay your head when exploring the theme parks!!
Summary: Hotel Menage is located across the freeway from Disneyland and California Park. It's a great place to stay if you really just want a place to lay your head at the end of a full day at the theme parks! There is a good vibe in the evenings around the pool, bar area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: More than a few things wrong with this hotel...the room design is not set up for privacy for anyone who needs to get ready in the morning, the bathrooms are so small they cant fit a full size bathtub in so forget about soaking in a relaxing tub after walking all day in disney land...the toilet made a hissing sound all night long and the tub stopper was broken and let by the hotel maids on the side of the tub..yuck! they dont give you enough blankets and play extremely loud music outside your room at all hours until you make a complaint...our phone was broken and when we called for anything we had to repeatedly call again and again to get them to bring us anything we needed...the staff was ok but this hotel is not somewhere i will ever stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I have stayed at Hotel Menage about 5 times.  We absolutely love everything about the hotel, from the location, to staff, to pricing and accommodations.  The food is phenomenal and pricing is very reasonable. The pool area is perfect.  There is a nice outside bar and the pool/Jacuzzi is open 24 hours.  You are able to see the Disneyland fireworks from a comfy lounge chair.  The staff is well trained and very professional.  They go above and beyond to make your stay the best possible.  There is nothing bad I could say about this place.  I look forward to many more trips!
Manager Response: Dear JuliaH32012, We are thrilled to have you and your family as loyal guests of our hotel! Thank you for your kind review, and repeated business. We look forward to hosting you all again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I have never stayed in a hotel in the area before as I have family that live in Gardena that I usually stay at if I go to LA, however I was going to Disneyland for the first time and decided to book this hotel, keep in mind that this hotel is in great walking distance if you want to walk to Disneyland or take the shuttle to there that they offer for a cheap price! I live about two hours away and coming from a road trip you always expect the first impression always justifies how your mood will slight be. However this hotel was not a problem at all! It had the most friendliest and nicest staff I have even seen or experienced at a hotel !! When I checked in I was nicely greeted, had my car parked as they offer valet parking for a price, and once I went it, it was amazing as the
Manager Response: Dear stevenjoshua1, Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We are so happy to hear that your had a great time, and that you will choose to stay with us again, next time you visit the Anaheim area. We look forward to seeing you again! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I am never written a review before but found these very helpful prior to my trip. We stayed at the ménage for five nights as a base for Disney and LA in general. Not sure what more you could ask for, for the price. The rooms were small but nice, newly renovated. Great view of the fireworks at night from the secluded tropical feeling pool area. A shout out to Eric at front desk, super accommodating gentlemen. Very helpful staff in general. The American tavern was well priced and very nice menu (especially after paying $65 for some generic hamburgers and chicken strips in Disney). If you need snacks, beer wine etc there is a gas station across the street and a Starbucks. All in all I was very happy with the selection of hotel for my family. The only warning I have is beware the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Accommodation, facilities, service and proximity to Disneyland made for a fantastic holiday.  Staff were extremely helpful and engaging.  Restaurant served excellent variety of food and drinks and was extremely well priced.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked 3 nights at Hotel Menage. We arrived early and were immediately checked in. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Ate at the restaurant quite a bit which had decent sized meals for a reasonable price. We liked it so much here we extended our stay for an extra night just so we could relax. The only downside would have been the noise from the freeway which pretty much just sounded like an air conditioning unit running all night long, which really didn't bother us. I mean we were exhausted each night from Disneyland so we slept straight through it, but for someone who sleeps lightly it might bother them. Otherwise a delightful stay with extremely helpful and nice staff. Would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Dear Harley M, Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay and extended an extra night to relax! Your compliments to our team are appreciated, and we look forward to hosting you again. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Relations

Summary: Hubby and I stayed here as part of our free-form, crash where we land, no stress honeymoon and the next time we're heading to Disneyland this is absolutely where we are staying. The hotel's a short 10 minute or so walk from the park and definitely suited to a grown up vacation. Some people (strange people) do bring their children here but overall it's a great happy hour from 4-7pm, modern decor and 24 pool and hot tub grown up awesomeness. Mad love to Amy K, who helped us get into the seriously amazing Africa suite for our last night here. She was super friendly and helpful every time we ran into her-she really set the standard for amazing customer service for the whole honeymoon. (THANK YOU AMY!) The Africa suite was a riot of animal prints and oversized lounging
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Send your group to Hotel Menage
Summary: We needed a host hotel for our Company Christmas Party this year.  The Menage was great in all aspects.  We had seemless reservations for all of our people checking in at all different times.  The rooms were perfect.  The area is freeway close and many of our guests decided to go to Disneyland the next day.  I would recommend the hotel to anyone lookin gfor a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear India S, We are thrilled you and your group enjoyed your stay and holiday party at our hotel! It was a pleasure to host you, and we hope you think of us again next year! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We arrived at the Ménage. First thing we noticed was the location right near a freeway. The when we entered the noise from the bar inside the hotel. We were given the key to our rooms and went upstairs. The rooms all faced either the freeway or the pool area with the bar noise. Even when we shut the door you could still hear the noise. Even though the rooms were clean and looked comfortable I would ask yourself if you can sleep through noise and want a hotel with a bar and close to the freeway then this is the hotel for you. Needless to say we didn't stay here! We checked out and went to the Sheraton Garden Grove. The plusses for this hotel would definitely be the staff behind the desk. They were very considerate and understanding. In fact outstanding. If only the noise hadn't
Manager Response: none

Summary: So I would like to start with we honestly booked because we got the best rate here. I would call it a motel also the lobby was lovely the room was ok- bed was comfy but there were pipes sticking out of the walls. Our phone didn't work so they moved us rooms- reeked of pot so they moved us again- get a room facing the pool it was quiet all other sides have a hiway and it's very loud.  My sons LOVED the pool because there was no one else in it. We had a better view of the DL fireworks from the pool than we did in the park that was fantastic. Staff was neither friendly or unfriendly just sort of there. The food in the restaurant was ok but mostly over priced for what u get- $5 menu in the evening was a perfect snack!  Shuttle to the parks is faaaast so very convenient- we must have
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear that you ended up in a room that suited you and your family, and we're so glad to hear that your sons had an opportunity to enjoy a private pool and fireworks show! Your feedback is very much appreciated, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you and your family again. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: A great price, a great view, a great time!
Summary: We spent a week here over Thanksgiving Break. The rooms were just right, with very comfortable beds after a day on our feet at Disneyland.  The shuttle system to and from Disneyland was an easy 5-10 minute trip each time, and the longest we ever waited for a shuttle was 10 minutes.  It is also in walking distance to Disneyland which we chose a time or two.  The outdoor lounge near the pool made it easy to order food while watching my boys swim.  I would highly recommend this hotel if your family is looking for a reasonably priced, comfortable place to stay for your trip.   And although we encountered one or two minor issues, the staff was helpful.  Sureya went above and beyond to make sure our issues were resolved and our stay was enjoyable.  I recommend asking for a room that
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay! Your compliments and recommendations are very much appreciated.  Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: It was very close to Disneyland (about 10 minutes brisk walking pace) and an area that has a whole lot of places to eat, some good and bad. The room we were in was on the 3rd floor but it overlooked the concrete barrier wall that ran along the Interstate 5 Freeway, which in itself was very noisy at all hours.Fortunately I had taken some foam ear plugs with me which I started using on my first night to enable me to sleep. We had breakfast 3 times in the restaurant The streaky bacon tasted like cardboard, but then when I had a Burger with a piece of bacon in it at IHOP down Sth Harbor Boulevard, the bacon there also tasted the same, So it must be the way Americans make bacon?.We were never told about the self service laundry/dryer when we arrived, I had to go looking for it after
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location, great staff and very up to date.  I was very impressed with this hotel, the staff and the amenities in the room.  Nice fun and colorful.  Front desk was a breeze and the staff went out of their way to make my mother feel welcome and answered all her "crazy" questions....  Thank you
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was my second time staying at Hotel Menage and it was again a wonderful place to stay! It is excellent value for money and the location is amazing. It's a short walk to disneyland or you can make use of the shuttle system available. The restaurant has great food and the bar by the pool has a wonderful happy hour with a great choice of cocktails. I would definitely stay here again and recommend Hotel Menage to friends and family. Thank you for making my stay an enjoyable one!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very close to Disneyland, clean and well appointed rooms
Summary: I stayed at the Hotel Menage for the first time when my other, usual Disney hotel was unavailable. The rooms are very clean and updated with very nice furnishings at time of writing. They are scrupulously clean and reasonably spacious.  The hotel itself has a bar and restaurant with a good sized menu and views of the Disneyland fireworks at night.  To get to Disneyland, you can get a $5 ticket (as many trips as wanted in a day) to use the ART shuttle system. It picks you up from the hotel and takes you straight to Disneyland. The only catch is that from Mondays to Wednesdays they merge Hotel Menage's line with another series of hotels and it takes a VERY long time to get back to the hotel at night (40 mins).   If you can't be bothered with the shuttle, it's a very easy 8-10 min
Manager Response: Dear Amy B, Thank you for your candid review. Your feedback and comments are very much appreciated. We hope to have the opportunity to host you and your friends again soon. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Bought online the hotel deal and I was pretty disappointed with my experience. I was placed in the ground floor even after numerous request to be placed at a higher flood. It's noisy beside the 5 free and with no phones inside the room. Far from disneyland with not so clean Rooms
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was my first time staying at the Hotel Menage but it won't be my last!  The rooms are comfy and nicely appointed.  The shower was great!  It had great water pressure, not that typical shower dribble!  ALL of the staff at the Hotel Menage are fantastic!  They provide great customer service and make you feel like you are a person of importance!  The staff goes above and beyond to provide you with everything to make your stay more comfortable and enjoyable!!  Everyone was very friendly, courteous, helpful and professional!
