This is the type of hotel and the kind of staff everyone hopes for when checking in and staying away from home!  I highly recommend this hotel ... and yet I can't help but hope it doesn't become too popular because I it's the kind of place you want to keep
Manager Response: Dear Barbara R, We are thrilled to read your complimentary review of your recent stay! Thank you for your kind words and compliments to our friendly staff. We look forward to hosting you and your family again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great short stay at the Menage!
Summary: My husband stayed here for our short weekend trip to Disneyland!  the location is great, walking distance to Disneyland (although if you have younger kids it would be worth it to catch the ART transit back to the hotel at the end of they day). They have a great breakfast buffet that was decently priced, also right across the street from a starbucks.   Pool and jacuzzi are 24 hours which is awesome. Room was clean, staff were very friendly. Only down side was it is right on the side of the freeway, although by the time we got back from our 12 hours at the park we were to exhausted to notice! I would go back again.
Manager Response: Dear Kristy w, Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our location, breakfast buffet and 24hr pool/jacuzzi. Your candid comments are appreciated, and we look forward to welcoming you back again! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: On the plus side, you get more bang for your buck not being right on the doorstep of the Disneyland entrance. Nice clean spacious room and reasonable amenities for the price. We chose to walk to Disneyland and it wasn't that far. We chose a top floor room away from the pool facing the Boulevard (not the Freeway). The room was reasonably soundproof so no big deal there.  On the negative side, wifi didn't work in the room. Had to go to the lobby to get access and even then had all sorts of problems with staff having to reboot the system. Also the concierge ordered us a fixed price taxi to go to the local Wal Mart which cost us more than the return journey where we simply hailed a taxi and travelled by the meter. Niggly things that just put a dampener on the stay.  Not a bad hotel,
Manager Response: Dear Micwa, Thank you for reviewing your recent stay. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your accommodations and the amenities we offer. Our apologies for a WiFi connection that was on the fritz during your stay... It is typically not a problem, and we appreciate the opportunity to look into ways to continue improving our service and amenities. Your candid comments are appreciated! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I spent a week in hotel Menage to visit Disneyland and California. I really enjoyed my stay. The staff is amazing and lovely. Amanda from reservation was awesome;she booked for me in advance restaurants and she gave me good tips. Breakfast was nice. Only issue, noisy room.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best Hotel I've ever stayed at!
Summary: This place is amazing! The staff is courteous, the rooms are super clean, the pool was awesome (salt water pool by the way) and the food and drink were yummy! We had a large group of people (everything from small children to older adults) with many rooms and everything went perfect - no check in problems and no confusions at all. The pool is 24 hours which I loved, nothing better than a night time swim! Great place for people who like to be around people, everyone is friendly - even the other guests. Its not often that I leave any place with a 100% satisfaction (almost never) so I'm very happy to say that I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone's trip in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa332013, We are thrilled to hear that you and your entire group was happy with your recent stay! Your compliments and recommendations are very much appreciated, and we hope to host you all again next year! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Got a great deal payed for 3 stay for 4nights , nice clean motel , wifi was bad hard to get , had to pay for parking other than that was great ..easy to get to Disney land and downtown Disney as well ,walking distance to restaurants and shopping
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: After two nights I had enough!
Summary: I booked a 4 night stay at the Hotel Menage. I had read the reviews regarding noise from the adjacent freeway so I was relieved that we were assigned a room facing the pool on the first floor. Our relief was short lived. Within 10 seconds of entering the room I knew this was not going to work. The music coming from the pool area was way too loud. We asked at the front desk to be moved to a quieter area. I must admit the staff is some of the nicest and most accommodating group of professionals I have ever experienced regardless of price.   We were promptly offered a different room on the second floor. Unfortunately this room was right above the outdoor bar. At close to 1:00 am I called down to the front desk to complain about the noise from the patrons in the bar. The noise
Manager Response: none

Summary: In sea of mediocre motels and corporate giants the Hotel Menage stands out as a break from the ordinary. Beside the decor, which is chic and modern, I love the fact that the pool is open 24 hours. The first time we stayed here it was in July and a muggy night. It was great to be able to come back to the hotel at 1AM and go for a dip to cool off. We also love the palapa bar at the pool area. It is one of the few or only pool areas geared to adults or kids.  The second time we stayed here was this past October for an event at Disneyland and again enjoyed our stay. The restaurant is great so that is a plus and the proximity to Disneyland is great.  The rooms themselves are not huge, but plenty big since we are seldom in it and quiet once we closed the door, we were never bothered
Manager Response: Dear scottca075, Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We are thrilled to hear what you enjoyed about your stay at our hotel, and appreciate your comments very much, as you are obviously an avid traveler ... 322 reviews in 87 cities ~ Incredible!  Your compliments are valued and have been reviewed with our team members. Thank you for your loyalty.. we look forward to welcoming you again. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: stayed two nights and got day rate to keep room on till we left at 5pm. pool area fab quiet and lovely area to chill. barman so helpful and snacks and drinks great. the room was huge big enough for us and loved the sink outside in the room away from the toilet and bath. room service great value compared to LA where we just left
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice but not worth the money...
Summary: Great service, lovely tiki bar and pool area but rooms and bathroom were a disappointment, if staying on the outside of the building you have traffic noise from the highway right below... Staff are friendly and helpful, food was average and very expensive. All in all. Nice hotel, but not worth the money...
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here on a quick get away to Disney ... Probably the best service I have every received from a hotel in a long time ... From the valet to the front desk it was great... Rooms are boutique with modern art on wall and overall modern feel .. Bathrooms were small but for a Disney vacation I can manage and the service overall is why I would recommend this place.. Parking is a cheap 10 dollars as Disney is 15 and they have a shuttle to take you to the park but the down fall is you have to buy a 1 day pass to board the shuttle as it's ran by the city.. Rooms have above avg amenities from soaps and shampoos.. Beds are a little on the hard side but not uncomfortable .. Over all I would stay here again and will start recommending this place as one of my fav stays in the oc
Manager Response: Dear Socali1983, Thank you for your review! We are grateful for your kind words and compliments to our friendly staff. Your recommendation is appreciated, and we look forward to hosting you again the next time you return to the Anaheim area. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 7 days me,my 2 boys and my husband, it was very clean,modern,spacious,we all enjoyed it .watch out for the bed posts on the bottom they stick out a little far and we all bashed our shins on them. We had a tiny stain on our sheets and it didn't bother me but it bothered my husband, they came up and stripped our bed and gave us a free breakfast buffet and it was very good, happy hour was good also, it was about a ten min walk to Disney but it seemed quicker and a 1 mile walk to wal mart, my kids loved the pool and our room was quiet overall it was really nice!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent stay at a boutique hotel
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights at Hotel Menage while on holiday to Disneyland. We picked it because it had the best reviews and was the cheapest on Trip Advisor. What a great choice. The hotel is beautifully set up with a lovely restaurant, outdoor Tiki bar and 24 hour pool. The actual hotel was more of a motel style with rooms located on outdoor verandahs, but the interior of the room was definitely not motel style. King bed, quite comfortable and modern furnishing, there was plenty of room to spread our stuff out and relax. The bathroom was small and the shower pressure was ok, not great, but not so bad it ruined the stay. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and the food at the restaurant was awesome! We ate there several nights. We did have the buffet breakfast one morning
Manager Response: Dear Broadahans, Thank you for your kind review.. We are thrilled to hear how you enjoyed your stay, as well as our restaurant and location. Your recommendation is very much appreciated, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you again! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary: Stayed for 12 nights recently. Rooms great, staff excellent, pool was the best. Best sleep I have ever had, beds were great. Fantastic location, freeway noise not a problem. Worst part was having to leave.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights whilst visiting Disneyland. It was a very enjoyable experience. Rooms were nice, pool and jacuzzi area was awesome complete with a bar and the in house resteraunt was so good we didnt even eat anywhere else. We would definately recommend this hotel to everyone. Plus at night you have the view of the disneyland fireworks.
Manager Response: Dear Nathan S, We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay! Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Beautiful, warm and sexy...it is the BEST!
Summary: My husband and I have loved staying here many times over the years, and there are so many reasons why.  We think it is the perfect place, especially for adults, with the fabulous beds and fine, high-def tv.  The pool is open 24 hours and is magnificent!  The restaurants and bar are REALLY good.  It has all you could want, including really frequent little buses that take you to The Land in like 3 or 4 minutes.  Can't close without saying how wonderful all the people are here.  They are so kind and friendly, and they are ALWAYS that way.  We want to thank them so much, and we can't wait to come back!
Manager Response: Dear SanDiegoPolly, We are thrilled to have you as a loyal guest of our hotel! Thank you so much for your kind review. Your compliments to our team members have been passed along, and are appreciated. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Their hotel restaurant greatly improved since my last visit, Oct. 2012. Their bottom floor rooms have no carpet, just painted cement and you can hear everything in the pool area. The top floor rooms are quieter but note, the hotel is right next to the freeway and you do hear the noise. The beds were lumpy on both my visits. Last year the heater didn't work, this year the bathroom fan was broken. Also, they do not have central air, just a wall unit that "provides" heat/cool. I found the housekeepers and restaurant staff more friendly than the front desk. Why did we return this year? It is close to DL. However, by no means is this a family style hotel; it's more like a single or mingle style hotel.
Manager Response: Dear shamuffy, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Your feedback regarding the different rooms you have stayed in is appreciated, and will be kept in mind as we continue to improve our hotel accommodations.  Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We stayed six nights at Hotel Menage whilst visiting Anaheim.  The hotel itself is located within a 10 minute walk to the Disney Parks.  It's very clean and has a great restaurant/bar down stairs.  Pool area was lovely, great for taking some time out.  Rooms were a good size, with a small bathroom but had a large vanity area just outside of the bathroom.  Our only issue was that we had a room on the 4th floor near the elevators and it was a bit noisy.  Also it only had one window in our room, which looked directly at elevators.  Meant we had to keep curtains shut otherwise everyone could look in and this made it quite dark all the time.  But staff were really friendly, food was delicious in the restaurant and beds comfy.  When you're in Anaheim you don't stay in the room much,
Manager Response: We are happy to hear you enjoyed your recent stay with us. Your comments and compliments are very much appreciated. Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback!

Summary Heading: Okay Stay but not the best
Summary: So me an my wife stayed here for 3 nights this past weekend, and here are my Pro's and Con's:  Pro's: Swimming pool and hot tub are open 24 hours.  You need a room key to enter the pool and elevator areas, felt safe.  Indoor and outdoor bar seemed to be opened pretty late,very nice after a long day at Disney. Bar offers great prices during happy hour Nice decor and quiet sitting areas throughout the lobby and pool area The ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) shuttle makes stops throughout the day for pick up and drop off at Disney. $5 a day.   Con's: Too close to the freeway, so traffic was really, really loud. Our room faced the freeway on the 5th floor.  Rooms seemed a little outdated, perhaps the fact that the walls were all white and you could easily see holes, dirt, and cracks.
Manager Response: Dear Frank S, Thank you for your comprehensive review. We appreciate your candid comments and feedback, and hope to have the opportunity to host you and your wife again.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Checked in for a 1 night's stay and it was great. Front desk and valet staff were helpful and friendly. Housekeeping staff did a great job cleaning the room and leaving the a/c on so it was cool and refreshing to walk into the room. My room was located on the 5th floor all the way at the end near the freeway. I was skeptical about the car traffic noise but as soon as I closed the door to my room I could barely hear it and slept just fine. I loved the location and the fact the hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Second trip and still love it
Summary: We stayed here 5 years ago and loved it and thought we would once again book in for our trip to Disneyland.  We had another wonderful stay, we love the 24 hour pool!! and the staff are always so friendly and outgoing.  The restaurant has changed since we were there last (we miss all the street food :(  but the food they did serve was still top notch.  The hotel is surrounded by freeways but we didn't notice it really, if you are a light sleeper plan to bring ear plugs otherwise it's not a big deal.  The trip to Disneyland is only a 10 min walk which we did on the way and home - a cab is only $6 if you are tired or jump on the hotel shutttle busses (stop at a few hotels).  The fireworks are easily watched from the balcony and the view is better then being jammed packed at the
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We are thrilled to have you as a loyal guest, and look forward to hosting you again next time you travel to Southern California :) Your compliments are appreciated, and have been passed along to our team.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel in a great location!
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for a week during June.  My friend and I were in Anaheim on a holiday and needed to be somewhere close to the Disneyland.  The hotel itself is clean, modern, fresh looking and the rooms are bright, airy, large and equip.  The staff were very friendly and accommodating of our needs.  I especially liked the outdoor bar, although the service could have been a little quicker.  The pool was lovely and warm.  It was never to crowded and I could always get a sun bed.  The breakfast was sufficient, although it would be nice if they had a variety of hot food available.  They have free computers to access the internet in the lobby, however they do not have camera's so you can't make video calls via Skype.  The location was wonderful.  You could walk to Disney
Manager Response: none

Summary: A great hotel, with fantastic amenities, not to mention the 24 hour pool.  The reason it's 24 hours is that no one could possibly hear you over the freeway and highway noise.  I mean no matter which way your room faces, you will hear highway and ambulance and police siren noise all night long.  And the walk to Disney is 15 to 20 minutes minimum.  Unfortunately, it's when you are super tired that you make the return walk and it seems like an hour..  The bar and restaurant and maid staff are great, and the hotel valet guys are the best in the industry. Just know whats coming before you book..I'll stay here again. But I'll have a plan B for coming home from the park...A-
Manager Response: Dear tobinardo, Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your experience, and we look forward to welcoming you back next time you visit Anaheim.  Your compliments to our friendly team are valued and have been passed along.  Thank you again for your candid comments.  Warm Regard, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: When organising a recent trip to the West Coast of the US, this was the cheapest place we booked.  We imaged it would be average, but as we were only in Anaheim for a couple of days to do the theme parks, we didn’t really care.  What a surprise!  This place was clean, friendly and had a few little extra’s you don’t get in the larger and more expensive hotels.  Beside free WI FI they also had computers with free internet (I had trouble with my smart phone) and really good flat screen TV’s.  The view of the Disneyland fireworks over the pool fence is a bonus, especially if you want to come home before the night time parade.  The pool area was great, with lots of shade and pool chairs to lounge in whilst enjoying happy hour every day between 4-7pm from the poolside bar.  Their
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are thrilled to know that you and your friends enjoyed your recent stay. Your compliments and candid comment are very much appreciated.. Thank you for your recommendation :) Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Hotel was very pleasant, food was good, staff were friendly an helpful, hotel foyer was dark and unwelcoming to enter but enlightened by the friendly, smiling, always helpful Chris, who made our stay so much more enjoyable with his knowledge of not only Disneyland but also the surounding area. Thank you Chis!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights as part of a dance tour group from Australia. Definitely not a hotel I would choose - advertises Wifi, however it's impossible to get in your room. The hotel is smack in the middle of highways, noise from the traffic is loud, but noise from the pool area is worse - especially at night, when you are tired and all you can hear is the music. Bathroom plug was jammed, contacted reception twice before it was fixed, however the "fix" was that maintenance just jammed it open.  Outdated, loud, and disappointing. Much better places to stayin Aneheim.
Manager Response: Dear bakem, We regret to hear that your recent stay was less than satisfactory for you. As we continue to strive for excellence, your comments and suggestions are greatly valued. Thank you for your feedback.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: A 10 minute walk to Disneyland the Menga Hotel was well priced and comfortable. It is between the freeways so if you are really light sleeper bring ear plugs but after 5 minutes we didnt notice the noise. Excellent view of the Disney fireworks from the balcony also. Jeffrey in the poolside bar was fantastic, and when we decided to leave a day early only so we could have extra time driving the Pacific Coast Highway, they gave us a percentage of our prepaid costs equalling the one nights accomodation back as a credit to use in the bar or restaurant which was unexpected and much appreciated. The on site restaurant serves wonderful meals, the beef was tender and tasty. Room service did a great job and we got a thankyou not each day from our housekeeper for our trip which was lovely.
Manager Response: Dear LeeAnn B, Thank you for posting your review! We are happy that you have enjoyed your stay. Your compliments to our housekeeping staff is genuinely appreciated. Thanks again for your comments and feedback. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Came here with family/friends. Really fun on the weekend, locals even come to the bar just to hangout. Staff at hotel were accommodating and did a great job continuing our stay. You can watch the fireworks from almost anywhere in the hotel. Poolside is beautiful. Only complaint is the food/bar manager. Rude, appeared to be unkind to staff, and the food is not as good as it was when K'ya restaurant was here the last time I stayed. The menu is much healer quality.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ok for Disney, Ok sums it up.
Summary: Hotel Ménage was our first stop on our tour of the West Coast of America. We arrived to be given a room on the ground level, right beside the pool and bar area. We asked to change rooms, as could tell that this would be very noisy throughout the evening. The reception staff changed our room for a quieter one right away, as if they knew we wouldn't like the room. We were so pleased to be given a quieter room without any hassle.   The breakfast and dinners are nice. Slightly over prices, but convenient.  The hotel is located on 2 main roads, however this noise is completely drowned out by the air con which is particularly noisey. It was far too hot not to have this on, but you become used to the noise after a while.   Disney is 10 mins walk, which is great. We would probably not
Manager Response: Dear KirstiLouse, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are glad to hear that the room we moved you to was more to your liking, as our only concern is that our guests be happy, comfortable and rested after a night at our hotel. Your candid comments are appreciated.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We got a deal on this hotel on hotwire.com.  It is definitely not a 3 star hotel.  Super loud!!  Right next to freeway.  Toilet clogged, cigarette smoke filled lobby, super cheesy pool area......... There were workers outside our door when I woke up.  Very horrible smells of paint lacquer? or something....
Manager Response: Dear lajollamom123, We regret to hear of your negative experience. I assure you, Hotel Menage is most certainly a non-smoking property. That being said, I am very surprised to hear of a smoke-filled lobby.  This is certainly not typical. Our pool has been remodeled to represent a tropical oasis in the middle of a busy city, and we are sorry to hear your opinion as "super cheesy." The majority of our guests enjoy our pool most of all! Thank you for your feedback. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: As the title suggests, this was our honeymoon and was our first stop.  We choose our hotel based on price, location, wireless internet availability and reviews from other guests.  Like most reviews there are always good and bad but overall for the price that we paid...we got what we expected.  If we were to return, we would not select this hotel again.    Service - the hotel staff were all very friendly and willing to help.   Location - approximately 10min walk to the front (bus entrance) of Disneyland and shops along the main road. You still need to walk a few minutes in further to get to the ticket booths.  It is a pleasant walk.  The hotel is beside the freeway so can be quite noisy as the design of the hotel is more like a motel style.  There is not much around the hotel
Manager Response: Dear AVKT, Thank you for your review. Your compliments to our team members is appreciated, and we are happy to hear that you were able to enjoy a free early check-in, even if was in a different room type than you booked originally. Typically, hotel check-in time is after 3pm.  We regret to hear that, despite our friendly service, spacious room, and good location, you have decided not to return. We hope you might reconsider, and give us another opportunity to show you the good value of Hotel Menage. Thanks again for your candid comments, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Nice price for such a good location
Summary: Seems to be and old building, but rooms seem to be reaconditioned. Has a big parking that you have to pay, it is a 10 minutes walk to disneyland or 6.50 for a taxi wich i recommend, public transportation is 3 dollars per person per way, and shuttles 12 per person. It is beside a highway so ask for a room far from it. Internet works poorly, it is complementary. Breakfast is very good, and staff is always willing to help. Rooms are clean but beds are a little noissy...
Manager Response: Dear Luijo, Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your stay. Your feedback is appreciated. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Really nice place, staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a great room and could not hear the highway (Request rooms that end in 28 on any floor). Pool was great and our child love swimming at the end of our days at Disneyland. The food was great and there was no wait time.  Great facility and would recommend it for families.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place does have a good location for me it was close enough to walk to the park,I don't have any children though.  The room itself is just alright. Nice tv , couch all that. The bed is awful I'm not to picky either.   I got this hotel for a great deal so I wasn't expecting to much.  I've seen a lot of people complain about the freeway noise. I didn't hear that at all really.  I wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again but it was not a bad place. Definitely more of a motel feel cause I believe that's what it was before.
Manager Response: Dear Disneytink, We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our location and that the noise from the nearby freeways wasn't noticeable to you.Your feedback is appreciated, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you again. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Thanks so much to the staff for being so, so accomadating to our huge group of 31!!! Close to the park, restaraunt very good, beds comfy, poolside bar great, happy hour, greater, nice hot tub and pool (open 24 hours) Really the only negatives are traffic noise from freeway in some rooms and bathrooms a bit outdated, but thats about it!! Thanks again to all the staff!!
Manager Response: Dear Ron B, Thank you for your kind comments! It was our pleasure to host your group, and we are thrilled to know you all had a great time here. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We arrived early and had our luggage stored by the friendly staff. Our room was comfortable, though the linen tired. I'd read about the noise from freeway and it hadn't really registered. It REALLY loud. If you have young children I'd say it could be a problem. So be warned.  The bus was okay however the wait proved problematic a few times and we gave up and walked. Cost per adult per day $5:00 very reasonable as you can have as many trips as you like. The walk to Disneyland an easy 10 minutes.  We had dinner on site and were impressed with the quality and freshness of what we ordered. Try the happy hour tacos they were impressive. Drinks by the bar and pool are a must after a busy day at Disneyland, the happy hour drinks and snacks a bargain. Try the pomegranate martini simply
Manager Response: Dear FSEMario, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Your candid comments are very much appreciated, Jeff at the bar is grateful for your "shout-out!" Thanks again for your candid comments. Warm Regard, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Great property. Stayed here for four nights.  Staff were more than willing to help with anything and everything we asked.  Walking into the lobby area was very welcoming with great atmosphere.  The rooms were very spacious with everything we needed. And very well sound-proofed as it can be noisy outside but that did not seem to bother us one bit. We received a great buffet breakfast spread in the morning along with lovely, tasty meal in the evening.  The pool and outside bar area was lively and well maintained. This area is also great to watch the Disney fireworks at night. Having the guest laundry available for use is also very good after having spent a while in America. There was a shuttle available to use to get to Disneyland but felt like we did not need to use it as it was
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've stayed here before and it's always great. You have to accept that it's near the highway and there's traffic noise, but with closed windows and AC on it's not bad. This is an easy walk to Disney and also a stop for Anaheim Resort Transport so you can ride to Disney or Knotts. More adult oriented than Disney hotels, with a great bar and restaurant, and pool. Excellent view of fireworks (with more noise - but that's part of the experience). All of the workers are pleasant and friendly. We'll stay again for sure.
Manager Response: Dear Cands2, Thank you so much for your continued loyalty to our hotel! We are thrilled to have you as our guests, and look forward to welcoming you back again soon. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Second stay for us at the menage,checked out early Monday. Thank you Patrick and Drew for making our morning and sending us off on a safe flight talking with you both were great and definitely jump started our morning in the correct manner, also if you eat or drink at the bar make sure you talk to the man they call frank!!Thank you again Hotel Menage and see you next time!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Horrific, Noisy Hotel - do NOT stay here
Summary: Just informed the drilling of the pipes here has to occur inside the hotel at 1:45am and nothing they can do... Must be done at this time in the middle of night.   Also Street/hi-way noise terrible!  Was lied to at reservation about sound.   I honestly think as a million mile club business traveler this is the worst hotel experience I have had almost.   Front desk also lied to my face about the noise level of the room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our second visit to Hotel Menage and again we were very happy.  A Bottle of wine for our 25th Wedding Anniversary was a nice gesture, our first stay was for our 20th.  The booking process was easy and they did their best to accommodate our request.  Easy access to Disney Land via shuttle and Restaurant and Pool bar have good food and drinks.  Ice machines available and washing machines and dryers are a bonus for travellers.  Staff were always willing to assist.  Fireworks display was always a highlight.  Rooms are a bit dated but good size and clean.  Good Value for money. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Disney Land.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Initial thoughts on the hotel, were disappointing as we were placed into a room with a fold out couch and a queen bed. however after a quick phone call to the front desk, this was later changed and we were placed into a room with two queen beds. the beds were very comfortable and room also has a laundry area and a fridge in the room. With only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and a great view point of the fireworks at night, its great for families, especially being away from all the hustle and bustle of Disney. The only disappointment was an afternoon in the swimming pool, where there were adults and children jumping/backflipping into the pool and the spa around young children, making it difficult for the rest of the guests to relax and enjoy the pool. Happy hour had great prices
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review of your recent stay. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your guest room with the 2 queen beds, and our amazing fireworks view. Our apologies for the energetic guests in the pool on that afternoon, as such jumping and flipping is not typically allowed in consideration for the safety of our guests.  We hope to host you and your family during your next trip to the Anaheim area! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: great hotel,excellent view of the fireworks.
Summary: Staff is energetic,helpful and respectable mannered.Excellent help by Erik L. from the front desk.He was very knowledgable on how and where to get to places,being from Canada really helped me and my son big time..Thank you Erik L.,you guys have a great staff.Will stay here again for sure,and would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family..
Manager Response: Dear Jay J, Your kind compliments to our staff are very much appreciated, and have been passed along. We look forward to seeing you next time you return to Anaheim! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: This is THE spot for your Disneyland getaway!
Summary: Short shuttle ride to Disney parks. Great young hip vibe. 2 bars, one poolside, one in lobby connected to a decent restaurant with good food and prices. Staff was efficient and friendly. Amazing view of Disney fireworks. The rooms are comfortable enough with wall mounted tv and all that, but that's not why you stay here. Secure parking but never used the car for three days because you don't need it! This is THE spot for your Disneyland getaway! Have fun...
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel wants to be upscale but just doesn't make it.  I've stayed here a few times now and have always found the staff at the front desk very unfriendly.  The hold on my bank account for 200.00 was ridiculous. They don't just keep your credit card number, they actually pull the funds from your account and then you have to wait 48-72 hours before you receive them back. Accommodations were clean and the bar service is great.
Manager Response: Dear Judy F, Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you have had unpleasant experiences with our front desk staff; your comments will be addressed with our team.   It is standard protocol in the hotel industry to authorize each guest's credit card for the full amount of your stay, as well as an additional hold for incidentals. This is only an authorization, in the case that a guest may charge room service, or food & beverage from the hotel restaurant and bar to their room tab. All hotels take this "Incidentals Authorization," however, the amount of the hold may be different per that hotel's specific policy.   If, when you check out of the hotel, you have not charged any incidentals to your room, the authorized amount is released back to the credit card. Your bank may take up to 10 business days to release the funds back into your account (this time period is determined by your bank).  I hope this helps to explain the amount we authorized for incidentals, then released after your check-out. If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact me directly.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services guestservice@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: Amazing hotel! Great location, friendly staff, COMFY bed, AAANNNNDDDDD 24 hour pool and jacuzzi!! Bar happy hour, very happy. The service was amazing from beginning to end. Can't wait to come back!  Huge shout outs to Patrick at front desk, his service and attention to detail was very precise.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a very nice stay at the hotel. It wasn't quite as nice as I thought it looked in the pictures, but really most places are like that. My only real complaint was that I didn't realized that the rooms were the type that open to the outside instead of a hallway, but really it wasn't too bad. The first night we got there we were able to watch the Disneyland fireworks from our room, that was awesome. It is on the freeway and can be very loud but I was impressed with how well the noise was calmed with the door shut. The service was great. Our room was always cleaned perfectly when we got back. The pool was nice, I wouldn't say great, but it did the trick. The fitness room was small, but yet again did the trick. Really for the price the place was awesome. It is a mid-grade level
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everyone was very professional and polite. Upon checking in this young man by the name of Erik gave me and my family the warmest welcome. We've been travelling USA for almost a month, his service stood up; very polite and informative the whole entire time we were there. Restaurant was amazing so as the 24 hr pool access. I also wanted to thank the managers Leo and Jessica for helping us with art bus and confirming our tours. We will be coming back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: So many great things about this hotel...the tiki bar with live music at night with Disney fireworks in the background and a fantastic happy hour every day, great staff with a true understanding of customer service, and the food is out of this world.  As a matter of fact, the food at the hotel would rival or better any of the 4 & 5 star resorts we have been to.  The guest rooms are in need of a little TLC but not terrible.  The bus to/from Disneyland was very convenient and we did not have to wait more than 5 minutes for it to show up. Conveniently close to Disney and super affordable.  Shout out to the valet/parking attendant who ran in to find us when the bus showed to take us to Disney and to the bartenders who went out of their way to make everyone comfortable.  Thank you for
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for two weeks in July, had a great time. The hotel is in a great spot, it's right by Disneyland and loads of different restaurants. Check in was nice and smooth and we got to go to our room right away. Our room was overlooking the pool, which could get a bit loud throughout the day, this wasn't really a problem as we were out all day and by night time it was quiet. It is a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, which is great as you can take a break in the day and go back out later. Our room was nice and clean and I got a good nights sleep every night. The hotel doesn't have a shop selling snacks but there are a couple of vending machines that are well stocked along with a garage across the road selling drinks etc. Staff were polite and helpful. Loved it.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hip Vibe and Great View of Fireworks
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for one night over Labor Day Sunday so we could get up early and visit Disney on Monday. I like this place much better than the Annabella, which we stayed at over our honeymoon, and it's about the same distance from the park, just on the opposite side of the property.   The ambiance is like a nightclub and very hip. When we checked in, the staff gave us a complimentary menu item coupon that we could redeem at either the poolside lounge or at the hotel's restaurant. Our room was on the second floor, facing the pool, which meant we had a great view of the fireworks, but it also meant we could faintly hear the pool's pop music until late in the night. It wasn't very loud and didn't keep us up, but if you are a sensitive sleeper, I'd recommend asking for
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed at the Hotel Menage on a short Disney trip. The hotel has great ambiance, wonderful pool area (can even swim and watch the Disney fireworks at the same time!), tiki bar area, and is well suited for not just families going to Disney but also couples looking for a nice resort type feel hotel.  Room was nicely decorated, very well equipped with safe, minifridge, ample linens and large flat screen TV. We loved it all until.....we tried to sleep. Hands down this was by far the worst bed I have ever slept in in all of my travels, including dubious overnights in third world countries.  The peaks and valleys in the king sized mattress indicated that it probably should have been tossed out a decade ago.  We slept with our two year old between us (as we typically do for
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great hotel for family's with children. I did meet a bunch of lovers also.  They gave us a spacious king size bed and a full size bed. Beds are nice and comfy with tons of pillows.  They gave us late check out at 1:00pm.  The last two hotels I stayed at refused to do that and seemed offended that I asked.  Those extra two hours of sleep or just relaxing are a wonderful gift. They have a very affordable 3 hour happy hour...top mixed drinks only 5.00 and variety of yummy foods for only 5.00 also.  The asian chicken wings were the best I've every tasted.  We walked past on of their suits and I asked the cleaning lady to let me see.  Beautiful. This was the african suite.  Tons of space and decorated really nice.  The price was from 150.00 per night to 300.00 per
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great value for money hotel close to Disneyland and California Adventure Park. Shuttle bus to parks for small cost. All staff very helpful and friendly. Pool and bar area great. Food at American Tavern fantastic and reasonably priced. Only concern was traffic noise but once door to room closed you couldnt hear much. Beds very comfortable. Would definetly stay here again and recommend to others
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our third year staying at this hotel and I wouldn't stay anywhere else. I have read a couple of other reviews one about it's dark and dreary it's GREAT it's the ambiance and I love it. The American Tavern is a great restaurant that I went to with my 3 teenagers, it was wonderful. There are restaurants in the area- Mimi's is great too! But why do I stay here every year? The hotel location is great and we can see the disney fireworks from the hotel but we like to be in the pool for the fireworks. GREAT perk! The rooms are large, beds comfortable and rooms clean! The staff is top notch. Andrew the conceirge is so friendly and wonderful! Grace, Eric, Dominc, Leo are ALL fabulous! They are friendly and very accomodating, Jeffrey and Haley who are at the tiki bar are also
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this property twice while visiting Disneyland. I enjoyed my stay until I checked out and left my Ipad. I called the same day I checked out. I am sure that my Ipad was there but was told, housekeeping did not find anything. The room was not rented to anyone so only housekeeping had access to the room. I guess whoever cleaned the room decided she needed my Ipad more than I do and just kept it. If you stay at this hotel, lock up your valuables and definitely do not leave anything behind---you will not get it back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Well located close to Disneyland, this hotel was a great choice for our time in Anaheim. Rooms were tastefully furnished, staff fantastic and facilities first rate. Shuttle service was fantastic and the drivers were really helpful. Would highly recommend!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Really disappointed with this hotel. Especially when we realised we had stayed there 17 yrs ago on a previous trip to LA ( under a different name). The hotel is very dark and depressing , a quick coat of paint would really make a difference.  However, can't fault the staff or the location for Disney, and good value for money. The fireworks can be seen from the pool and were excellent, and the pool area is nice.  Rooms need updating and how many times did we stub our toes on the bed?? Lethal! Beware of that! I was expecting a more up to date hotel, especially as the word ' boutique' had been mentioned a lot! Think the word ' dictionary' needs to be mentioned.   I would not stay again because it reminded me of a motel more than a hotel! If you are looking for a budget hotel in a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Close and short walk to Disneyland, but shuttle service is also available at reception. Pool is opened 24/7, pool bar had great cocktails & food during happy hour. Buffet breakfast was average at $12 per head from memory. Great access to view fireworks at Disneyland from. Otherwise, good value and great location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our first trip to Disney and we are so glad that we decided to stay at Hotel Menage. From the moment we walked through the doors we were made to feel extremely comfortable from the friendly and helpful staff to being able to order our drinks and snacks while relaxing in the pool/hot tub area and watching the Disneyland fire works show. The breakfast buffet was delicious and continuously stocked with fresh items. We loved staying here so much that we actually extended our stay for an extra day. During this process we realized that we had misplaced our credit card and Erik L., who was extremely professional and understanding, did all he could to help us during this time. Once again spectacular hotel with superb staff.
Manager Response: Dear Amber G, Thank you for your review! Your compliments to the staff are very much appreciated. We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay, and hope to host you and your family again :) Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Very clean and comfortable hotel only about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland!  Is was right off a highway so not the nicest surroundings but we were never bothered by any traffic noise.  Not too many restaurants around (except fast food) but there are some really nice places about a 10 minute walk away.  Cheaper than staying at Disneyland and perfectly nice.  Great poolside bar and outdoor atmosphere!
Manager Response: Dear Ash G, We appreciate you taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We're happy to hear that the local traffic hum wasn't a bother during your stay, and we hope you'll give our restaurant, American Tavern, a try next time.. We have a really great menu; you don't have to leave the hotel for a great meal! Thanks again for your candid comments. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: The only negative is the noisy freeway location
Summary: I was a bit nervous on reading some TripAdvisor reviews but I was impressed with this hotel.  Our room was very clean and recently modernised. The breakfast buffet was outstanding - really generous selection of fruits/eggs/bacon/french toast, etc.  Staff were super-friendly and willing to help.  The decor is interesting - 'boutique hotel' is an exaggeration, but it's not tacky or cheaply done.  The big disadvantage (along with the intermittent free wifi) is the location. It's adjacent a really busy interstate road. Having lived on a main road in London, I had thought the traffic noise wouldn't bother me. Wrong. The roar of traffic is pretty much incessant, and probably overwhelming in some rooms.  Plus, although the hotel is only a 10min walk from Disney, the walk to the parks
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros: -walking distance to Disneyland (would not recommend for small children), but I believe they had a tram.  -nice rooms -friendly staff  Cons: -walls were a bit thin. Might bother light sleeper, but it didn't bother us at all.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My last three trips to Anaheim have been made all the more enjoyable for having chosen Hotel Menage as my home away from home.  The rooms are always clean and comfortable, the staff is very accomodating with special requests, and the parking valet service is speedy and helpful.  The pool / Palapa bar area is fun and inviting, and the view of Disney's fireworks is just about as good as you would get inside the park.  As for getting to Disneyland, I find that walking is faster and easier than using a shuttle, although the hotel offers that service for those who prefer.  (For some reason, the walk TO Disneyland is much shorter than the walk BACK at the end of the day...) I initially did a lot of comparison shopping for hotels in the area, looking at pricing, reviews, ammenities,
Manager Response: Thank you for you loyalty as a guest, and for your review of you recent stay! Your kind words are greatly appreciated and your compliments to the staff have been passed on to them. We look forward to hosting you next time you return to Anaheim! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Very disappointing.  We checked out as soon as we looked at our room.  Found "hair" in the bed. The restaurant is basically a bar lounge, so not great for kids.  It was noisy and looked seedy. I would avoid this one.
Manager Response: Dear Cindy R, I'm so sorry to hear that you were unable to stay with us. I assure you our restaurant is a family restaurant, as we realize the majority of our guests are families with children. We also have a bar and lounge separate from the restaurant for our adult guests.  I apologize again that you left with a negative opinion.  Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Menage in August 2013 for 3 nights. We were visiting the Disney parks and the 15min walk from our hotel room to the Disney turnstiles was perfect for us - no need for a shuttle. If you do need to drive to Disney, the parking structure is just a block away.  The lobby/restaurant/bar area is beautiful, and in some ways can be misleading when visiting your room for the first time. We had no complaints. The rooms have been recently renovated. They definitely have an older feel but our room was clean with comfortable beds, a good sized-TV and plenty of hot water - what more could you ask for after a long day in Disneyland?  Our favorite part about this hotel was the happy hour. The outdoor tiki bar offers a good selection of drinks and apps for $5 -
Manager Response: Dear Rachel K, Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay! We are thrilled to know that you enjoyed your guest room, and that you were able to take advantage of our fantastic happy hour at the Palapa Bar. Your recommendations are very much appreciated, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you again! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I booked a room last November for myself and 2 friends and had no problems with this place. We were on the top floor directly across from the elevator, overlooking the inside courtyard/pool area. Being on the inside of the building we had no problems with traffic noise, then again, we were pretty much at Disney for 12 hours and then passing out, so we slept really well. But the room was clean, furniture was decent, nothing wrong with the bathroom or shower, and everyone at the front desk was really friendly. The only thing was the $10 dollar a day parking fee for our second car, but not a big deal. This place is a decent hotel, not fancy, but definitely clean comfortable and stress free. Also itś only a 15 minute walk to Disneyś Front Gate so you dont even need your car!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked 2 rooms for a week, and were disappointed right away,  We were unable to check in when we arrived, and told to come back in 2 hours.  When we came back, we discovered that the rooms were still not available, and it would be another hour.  When rooms were finally assigned, they were not adjoining as we had specified in the reservation, which took another bit of time to sort out.  Once we arrived at the rooms, we were disappointed in the overall quality.  They were fairly clean, but very old, run down, and uncomfortable.  The halls are very dark, difficult to find your way late in the evening. The bathrooms are very small, and the vanity area is right out in the open - not much for any privacy.  It does feel very much like a low end motel - very dark and dingy.  I don't
Manager Response: Dear Susan, Thank you for your review. We appreciate your compliments to Andrew at the Concierge desk, and have passed along your kind words. We are disheartened to hear of your overall disappointment. Check-in is guaranteed after 3pm (typical protocol for the hotel industry), as we need the morning and early afternoon to ensure rooms are clean and ready for the arriving guests. Since you had arrived so early, we offered you the first available clean rooms, but they unfortunately did not connect. We were happy to provide connecting rooms as soon as they became available for your check-in.  Your comments about dark hallways and maintenance issues in the room have been forwarded to the engineering manager. Thanks again for your candid comments, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Don't let the pictures fool you...
Summary: This was by far one of the worst places I have ever stayed.  Don't let the pictures fool you.  The property is directly next to the 405 freeway.  Noise was terrible, property was filthy (the dark lighting did not help).   The room was gross.  There was a huge wet stain (HUGE) outside the bathroom door.   The internet which I needed for business did not work at all in the room.  When I went down to have breakfast I found the 1/2 coupon I was given to try out the restaurant did not apply to breakfast although that was not stated anywhere on the .   Upon retrieving my car from the valet I found the car covered in huge white water spots.    What an awful and disappointing experience.
Manager Response: Dear Grantacg, We are sorry to hear your opinion of Hotel Menage. We appreciate your candid comments and they will be discussed in our upcoming management meeting.  I would love to speak with you personally regarding your recent experience, and encourage you to contact me directly at guestservice@casaresortsinc.com. I look forward to hearing from you. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Best Place To Stay Near Disneyland
Summary: Me and my partner have stayed here a few times. We have stayed at most the hotels nears Disney but by far the Hotel Ménage is our favorite. The room decor is modern and the hotel suites are just amazing. Eric at the front desk was very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good lower priced option, but expect what you pay for
Summary: There are many pros and also many cons to this hotel.   The service was good in a lot of ways, the front desk staff were very helpful, holding onto our bags for us when we arrived hours before the designated check in time, and giving us lots of information about area attractions. You're able to buy tickets to many attractions at the desk, which is convenient, though we had already prepurchased our passes to Disneyland. When we arrived back for our check in, the check in process was slow, and the girl at the front counter, though very nice, gave us way too much information when after a long day all we really wanted to do was just get up to our room. This might be an opportunity for further training on the hotel's part--try to read your guests and when they're weary from a long
Manager Response: Dear ascanada, We appreciate your comprehensive and detailed review of your recent stay! Your suggestions to our front desk staff are welcomed, and helpful for future training sessions. Your compliments to our valet and bell staff have been passed along - Thank you! Our housekeeping manager has been notified of your observations on room cleanliness. We have a training meeting scheduled to address these issues. Thanks again for your candid comments. We hope to have the opportunity to host you and your friends next time to return to the Anaheim area! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: This hotel is not up to normal, Anaheim standards of a full-service property.  It really is awful....It feels more like a motel instead of a hotel.  There are outside entrances into each room. Our room was on the second floor and as one walks out of their room, one is at eye-level with the highway.  The noise is horrific!  We moved after the first night.  Our friend had scum on the floor of his closet and the staff told him it was "hotel decor". He was on the first floor and when he walked out his door, he was surrounded by concrete walls and fences.  I do not like this hotel, not even one bit.  When the fireworks go off, you feel like the hotel is being hit by a demolition crane......
Manager Response: Dear Poobah, We are saddened to read your opinion of Hotel Menage. It is true our hotel was built with outdoor corridors, and the fireworks at Disney, while magical, are quite loud. But the fireworks boom is unavoidable and loud at all hotels located within easy driving or walking distance of the park.  We appreciate you taking to time to post your opinion, and apologize that we were not what you were looking for in accommodations during your visit to Anaheim. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: The people that work there were friendly and helpful, especially the bell staff. The first room they sent us too had mold in the window, and water stains on the window.  The second room was better.  They are nice big rooms, however if you're there with someone other than your significant other there is no private changing area. The shower/toilet area is too small to change. The vanity area was nice, but should have doors or a curtain to separate from the bed area for privacy.  It was basically clean, just older and very dark. One of the lights didn't work. The pool is open 24 hours, has a hot tub, bar, and live music. Always full. So, we liked the ambiance, but we really weren't there much since our main purpose was Disneyland.  They have a shuttle to Disney which you have to
Manager Response: none

Summary: Please believe the reviews about the highway noise. You can hear the highway very well from inside the room, all hours of the night. It does have a spectacular view of the fireworks at Disneyland on the pool side of the property. Not a lot of activities for children besides the pool.  Parking is $10/day self park and $12 for valet. It is on the local bus route for Disneyland and other venues in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your recommendations! We hope you enjoyed your stay and your trip to Anaheim, and we hope you will choose to stay with us again soon. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Friendly easy going - no fuss hotel
Summary: Enjoyed a few days unwinding at this hotel whilst between cities and travelling around the States! The pool area was great and plenty of room to enjoy. The bar has good happy hour cocktails.We enjoyed our stay here whilst sightseeing around the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: OK for Disney but the photos are very misleading
Summary: We stopped here for two nights either side of our trip to Disneyland. On arrival, the valet parking guys were very good; friendly and efficient. The lobby looked hip and overlooked the pool which our kids (11 & 7) were desperate to get into. But when we got to the pools edge we realised just how small it was. It was a bit scuddy-looking too so I decided not to get in! The kids enjoyed it but there wasn't much room once a few other swimmers were in too. The photos on the website make the pool & cocktails area look like the Copacabana - that it ain't!!  Once you got away from the lobby and up into the rooms, that's when the hotel started showing its wear-and-tear: it was perfectly serviceable but quite shabby and dark. The walls were thin too: it was easy to hear our neighbours'
Manager Response: Dear Monkeymoo68, Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We appreciate your candid comments and we evaluate all guest feedback in order to continue improving our property and amenities. Your compliments to the staff have been passed along and are very much appreciated. Thanks again for your feedback. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: This was a great place to stay for our trip to disneyland.  We were travling in a large group, with an RV.  The RV park was just one block away so we could walk back and forth easily.  They let us check in early so all we had to do was drop off family members at the front door.  The ART shuttle picks you up at the front door, so we walked there for breakfast and  to get the shuttle to disney.  Very clean place.  The pool are is very nice.  Staff is super friendly.  In fact when I called and made my reservation, they were extermly helpful and I got exactly what I requested.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for...
Summary: This was a quick add on to our coastal trip...with that said we chose a hotel for a good room rate.. The hotel was very dark and creepy for the desk to your room. Too much brown- the walls the floor the furniture...I get it hides dirt but you felt you were in a CAVE! Especially the front desk, just blends in with the rest of the brown walls. As for our room generally clean but the sleep sofa mattress was disgusting . Don't look, stained terribly! The pillows were awful-not like your usual hotel pillow, lumpy and old. Also request a room away from the interstate , very noisy( all day- all night). We also had to walk through a creepy tunnel to get to our room! They need to do something about that! Great for shuttle system to the parks. Your always last stop. And the valet guys
Manager Response: Dear TracynNoelle, Thank you for your feedback. Your comments regarding the colors used in our interior have been noted for future updates and renovations. We appreciate your notes about the pillows in your room, and the sofa sleeper mattress, and we will have our housekeeping team address these issues immediately. I apologize if this made for an uncomfortable nights sleep. Your kind compliments to our valet team are very much appreciated and have been passed along to them :)  Thank you again for your candid comments! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: What a great place! Enthusiastic and happy employees, great food and great live music. Clean, cool rooms and a terrific pool.  We will continue to visit at least once a year. This place is a gem in a land of cheesy hotels, it is like a mini Hard Rock.  Great for families, young couples and singles too. Very hip! The fireworks from Disney are SO CLOSE, it is so fun every night. Very reasonably priced. As someone said - an oasis in a midst of chaos!
Manager Response: Dear Thad J, I'd like to thank you for your continued loyalty, and let you know we truly appreciate having you back year after year. Thank you for your kind compliments and suggestions. See you next year! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We stayed at this hotel during a some sort of 3 day "in-transit layover" from Tokyo.  It is conveniently located and very close to Disneyland.  There is a Starbucks located just across the street.   I would not say this is a family hotel, it is more suited for young adults.  The overall look of public areas is nice and modern.  The room cleanliness aspect definitely had room for improvement.  The best part of our stay was the service provided by the valet parking guys.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: An oasis in the midst of chaos!
Summary: Out of the madness but close enough to see the fireworks show each evening poolside!  Rooms are adequate but real cachet is pool, service and food!  Loved breakfast in the coffee shop and the fact quick hot snacks are available after being at Disneyland all day.  Very reasonably priced
Manager Response: Dear Ianit50, Thank your for posting a review of your stay. We genuinely appreciate your loyalty as guests of our hotel, and we are looking forward to hosting you again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 7nights.  Rooms were comfortable, clean, and roomy.  Staff were helpful with shuttle service, booking outings, and offering schedules for Disneyland.   My 3yr old son had a great time in the pool!    The only thing I did have a problem with was the noise of the Fireworks from Disneyland.  LOUD!  But if you can't beat them, join them.  We watched the 9:30pm nightly fireworks from the balcony of the Hotel.  Versus the crowds at Disney.  This will definitely be a choice for hotel to stay at again.
Manager Response: Dear robinelisse, We appreciate you taking the time to post your feedback from your recent stay. I'm thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your week with us, and I'm happy to know that you ended up joining in on the fireworks show each night :) I can understand how loud fireworks are at our property, but we have found them to be a truly magical way to end the day.  Thanks again for your candid comments, and we hope to host you and your family again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Loved the hotel, and especially the location
Summary: Nice clean modern hotel/motel with a great pool.  The location is especially good for those wanting to visit the Disney parks in Anaheim.  It is a 15 minute walk, about 3 blocks to the entrance to the parks. You don't have to wait for a bus, park a car, just a nice easy walk. You would probably have to walk as far from the parking lot for Disney as you do to get there from this hotel, and their rates are reasonable.  The restaurant is very nice and not  terribly expensive.  I particularly liked the small plate of spaghetti with chicken parmesan. It was more than enough for an adult and inexpensive.  They do run a shuttle to the parks for a small fee if you don't want to walk. You can watch the Disneyland fireworks from the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This past month, we stayed at Hotel Menage for three days while my family took in Disneyland. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was its proximity to the park and that it was pet friendly, as we were travelling with our dog.  We found the hotel staff to be friendly and the rooms adequate for the price.  I will say that I was not a huge fan of the "motif" however.  Cement floors are cold, and we walked into the platform beds constantly!  One issue we did have was the noise!  We were booked into rooms facing the pool and the music was incredibly loud!  Even with the tv on in our room we could hear it.  Upon speaking with the front desk they said that the music would be turned off by 11pm each night, which it was; however, we then could hear the music from the lobby!  After a
Manager Response: Dear cathy1130, Thank you for your review. We have noted your comments regarding the volume of the music played at the pool and in the lobby. I've spoken with the manager and front desk staff to ensure the volume doesn't go above a certain level.  Your feedback is appreciated and we hope to host you and your family again next time you come to the Anaheim area. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: The online pictures are very deceptive.  My room was right next to a dumpster. Mosquitos in the room. Bathroom shower was leaking.  Restaurant food, music, and service was horrible. No bussing service and you have to beg for silverware.
Manager Response: Dear villegaa, We are so sorry to hear of your experience in American Tavern. I want to let you know this is not typical, and we are disheartened to know you had such a negative experience at our establishment. We have attempted to contact you directly to personally apologize, discuss your experience in more detail, and attempt to resolve your dissatisfaction. If you would like to speak with management regarding your recent stay and dining experience, please let me know. I hope to hear from you soon. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services guestservice@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: Hotel ménage is a very good hotel. Nice sized clean rooms. Nice pool and spa area. There is a laundry on site which came in handy. Shuttle service available to disneyland parks (for a small fee). Overall I would recommend you to stay here for a nice hotel, well located for a good price!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and comments! Your recommendation is appreciated and we hope to host you again soon. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Good standard hotel for a visit to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for three nights. This is one of many hotels in Anaheim catering to  Disneyland visitors. It's located close to the freeway off-ramp, a convenient ten minute walk from the theme park. The overall impression is that it is a solid place to overnight but not much more (contrary to the impression one might get from their glossy website). It's well worn as you might expect from a hotel that does a high volume of business with vacationing tourists. Our airconditioned room was ample but not roomy. It faced the busy intersection outside, which meant the room itself could not be considered quiet. The free of charge wifi was decent but insufficient if being used for business purposes. Cleaning was good but the linens and towels were well worn and in some cases stained, which
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros: Great rates in a nice and somewhat more adult-oriented hotel Restaurant is really good, try the Carnitas tacos very close to Disneyland Good service and nice staff Cons: You can hear the people next door, we couldnt sleep one night because of nosiy teenagers
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not what it appears to be
Summary: Had this hotel booked for me by my boss for a group of us because of a rate we got.    First off, the location, while being very close to many things including the Convention Center is also literally right on the freeway and has Harbor Blvd on the other side.  You can't get away from the noise.  On the one free afternoon we had we were sitting by the nice little pool they have listening to the exceptionally loud traffic noise outside and all you could do was laugh and pretend it was the ocean!  Walking in to check into the hotel, it looks a little like a disco.  Very glitzy, lots of mirrors.  They try hard to accentuate some positives maybe so they hope you overlook how tired and dated the rooms are once you get to them.    The only upside to the room (which was just as loud as
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked through Disneyland's website trusting them and their "good neighbor" program. It is obvious that Disney brass has not inspected this place in a while. Beds were hard as a piece of plywood, traffic noise was so bad i had to wear earplugs at night (of course not safe). Room was dated to i would say 1985. Upholstered pool furniture was terribly stained. Botched my reservation and were rude about THEIR mistake.  Since our stay I found some older reviews that have said the place has gone way downhill recently. I guess that is what is going on here. I would be cautious about staying here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the hotel menage for one night with the family on a mini vacation to Disneyland and to Baseball game. The staff was helpful and courteous. The room was nicely decorated and clean. The exterior of the hotel was well maintained. The beds were comfortable; however, wish they were queen size instead of full. But overall a good stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It was our first time in California and I was travelling alone with kids.  I was concerned about safety.  This hotel made me feel safe and secure.  Having to use my room key to access parking, the pool and sidewalks to my room was comforting.   There was a safe in our room to lock up our personal items that we wanted secured.  The room was clean and had plenty of space for the three of us.  We had a spectacular view of the Disneyland fireworks and great service.  Every request we had was handled quickly and professionally.  Although the freeway was right outside of our room, the traffic did not disturb my light sleeper, neither did anyone in the 24/7 pool or hot tub.    We choose to take the $5 shuttle to the Disneyland parks each day.  Shuttle passes were available at the front
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A Gem of a hotel with Gluten Free options!!!!
Summary: My husband and I were so impressed with Hotel Menage, we were planning our next stay before we even left! Our room was chic, spacious with a flatscreen, and a living area for in room lounging. We enjoyed cocktails poolside from the Outdoor Cabana bar and their menu had Gluten Free options!!! I'm in love!  Hotel Ménage is so close to fabulous Disneyland and California Adventure (btw-Carthay Circle Restaurant is a must do!!!) The fireworks show was breathtaking from the hotel. We are so glad we found our perfect getaway spot and can't wait to bring the kids!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: You can stay at a nicer hotel but it's gonna cost you plenty more.  If you want to save money but still not feel like you've been cheated, this is a good place to stay.  I have to say we didn't have a good experience since we had a plumbing problem and had to be moved to another room.  Mishaps can happen anywhere, no matter what hotel at any cost.  What counts is how management handles the situation and how friendly the staff is.  I found that to be a very pleasant experience as management went out of their way to accomodate us to our satisfaction.  The all-you-can-eat breakfast was great, and the valet parking staff is "service with a smile"!  Brandon was the bomb!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location and fabulous happy hour!
Summary: Extra for valet parking, no problem. Check in was a breeze. Happy hour great. Nice selections of  small plates and drinks. Room was average. Waking up to smell of sulfur at 4am is not cool. Ice machines were supposedly new but did not work. Checked every floor and even in the lobby. Finally got ice from restaurant, after calling and going to front desk. Would stay again because of location and price.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I have forwarded your comments regarding the ice machines to our maintenance engineer and they are functioning properly at this time. We are happy to know you will return, and look forward to hosting you again soon. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Two nights in Anaheim at the tailend of our USA holiday in June 2013 found us at the Hotel Menage. Checking in was no problem and the staff were helpful. The first thing we noticed (well the kids actually) was the pool (dad noticed the outdoor bar). The second thing we noticed was the freeway noise as we were staying on the 5th floor and faced the freeway but I have to say after closing the door this wasn't a problem. Overall the hotel has a great vibe and the staff are on the whole younger and very helpful. We took the shuttle bus to Disneyland on two days and had no problems getting there and back and you can buy tickets at the desk in the hotel. We ate breakfast at the buffet in the restaurant and it was fine and cheap. Dinner in the same place was ok too. The pool is
Manager Response: none

Summary: The lobby is basically a bar and very dark.  The bed and pillows were like sleeping on boards.  It is right on I-5 so the traffic noise is constant. We had a reservation for 4 nights (confirmed in writing), but the desk called my husband on the last night when we were at Disneyland and asked when we were going to get out of our room.  He then argued with my husband about the reservation.  Very rude!!    This is not a "boutique" hotel.  It is an old motel that has been renevated and basically has the feel of a nightclub.  There was a big loud party on the weekend that carried up to the walkways late at night.  Maybe fine for young couples, but not exactly where you want to stay with kids while getting up early to go to the parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We regret to hear that your stay was not what you had been expecting.  I apologize for the confusion regarding the length of your stay, and we've spoken with the front desk regarding the way they handled the situation.  We appreciate your feedback and candid comments. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Harbor Blvd is lined with hotel upon hotel providing the most sparse (but often perfectly satisfactory) rooms for Disneyland tourists.  This is a fun step up from those.  The hotel is well designed, thematically consistent (so rare these days) and up-to-date with a fun and active ambience.  We spent one day at Disneyland, but another at the hotel pool ... all day ... it was awesome.  The pool is 24 hours.  That may be a burden to rooms in the immediate vicinity, but we faced the pool from the 4th floor and it wasn't a problem.  The reality is that few use the pool very late, but it's nice to know that you can make use of this amenity for a quick dip after a theme park day if you want to.  I've read disparaging comments about the fact that they play a pretty strong track of music
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hip, Affordable, Relaxing Resort with Youthful Vibe
Summary: We visited Hotel Menage in April of 2010 and had an amazing time. My husband and I travelled with another couple and got two rooms side by side. The decor is tasteful and contemporary. Rooms are clean and spacious. My favorite thing about this resort is the pool. Beautiful and lush foliage surround a freeform 24 hour heated pool and hot tub. Beside the pool there are plenty of loungers and a quaint tiki bar with tasty adult beverages. I really feel like I get the best of both types of vacations when I stay here. I get the lounging, relaxation when I'm at the hotel and the fun activities at Disneyland. The one drawback is the walk. It was fine with just us (two couples in their late 20's/ early 30's) but I think it would be rather challenging with children or grandparents. Also,
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear how you enjoyed your recent stay! Thank you for your comments, compliments, and feedback. We look forward to hosting you again! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, Nice Staff, Cute Hotel
Summary: This hotel is very close to Disney and downtown Disney, which is great if you are going there for the day/night. The rooms were pretty nice. Ours was poolside and close to the fun tiki bar! Really good breakfast- worth the price!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Valet was not friendly, checked in with four people gave us a room with one bed. Asked for a different room and felt that we were inconveniencing the staff.
