Got a different room that looked like someone had kicked the door in. The door stayed close only because of the lock, tub and toilet leaked. Walls were paper thin and you could hear your neighbors. Asked staff for directions around the area and was told to get a map. Not friendly at all, stayed away from the front desk until check out which unfortunately we had booked 4 nights. Walk to Disney is taking your life into your hands considering you have to cross the freeway exit and entrance. Is not a 15 min walk, more like 30 min. Parking is not included in price, room not clean, very dusty. Not enough towels for 4. Drunks by
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear your opinion of your recent stay at Hotel Menage. Your feedback has been noted and passed along to the valet, maintenance and housekeeping departments.  Thank you for your candid comments. Hotel Menage

Summary: We have been at the hotel for a few nights now and will be soon checking out. I really like our suite however when we went to check in the room was not ready because maintenance was fixing the shower head, which was fine. The hotel gave us a $50 food voucher so we went and had dinner while we waited. We got to the room and it's a beautiful suite... But the shower head is still broken. Looks like they used cement to try to hold the shower head up but it still just hangs there. The shower is useable but it's a bit tricky to use. We told the front desk and she said she would get someone to look at it... That was 4 days ago. The other thing that really disapointed me was the restaurant and pool bars service. The first day was awesome when we had Jeff but after that it was crazy. It
Manager Response: Dear Travellergcd,  I am so sorry to hear of the lapse in good service during your stay. We truly appreciate you taking the time to provide your feedback. There is no excuse for the wait times in the restaurant and bar, and also for the lack of attention to the room service trays being left in the hallways.  Your experience has been been brought to the attention of the management and staff of these departments and we are holding a re-training session with the staff to ensure this does not happen again.  Thanks again for your candid comments and feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again, and to demonstrate the quality customer service we strive for.  Sincerely, Charlotte Gulley Guest Services

Summary: They upgraded us to a suite and gave us 40.00 in food and drink credit. Everyone and everything was great. Music by the palapa bar at the pool. Disneyland fireworks, a perfect view. Good food and courteous staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel lobby was beautiful and the pool and tiki bar were very nice! Bell service and valet awesome! Those guys deserve major tips! The room was dirty, rusty and paint was chipping. Not very 'boutique' at all. The decor is updated but besides that the room kinda gave me the hebe geebies. Made me wish I brought Clorox wipes to wipe down the white marks on the headboard! For being over $120 a night we won't stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your compliments to our valet and bell staff, and these have been passed on to them. Your comments regarding the condition of your guest room have been addressed with our maintenance and housekeeping departments... we are so sorry to hear that your room left you feeling less than comfortable. Your feedback is very much appreciated. Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I agree with some other reviews that this hotel stretches the idea of a boutique hotel. Pro's about the hotel are great vibe, friendly staff, walking distance to Disney (just over the freeway bridge) and cool tiki bar and pool area. If you happen to be there on a night for Disney's fireworks you will definitely get a great free show from the hotel view which is fantastic! Con's would be that rooms are average (screams motel) and freeway noise. There is a Starbucks walking distance across the street which is convenient and access to the freeway for your departure is right there. Valet guys were friendly and parking area was safe and lit up. From the advertisements and photos i saw for a boutique hotel i think my expectations were set higher, but reality of being there said to me
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and feedback. We appreciate your compliments and your point of view regarding our hotel and your experience.  We hope to have the opportunity to host you again, and wish you happy travels! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: This is described as boutique hotel. It is an old "updated" La Quinta. The bathtub and tile were painted which is now starting to peel off. The rest of the room was pleasant, but not pleasant enough to distract from the noise of I-5 which is 100-200 feet from the hotel. The staff was friendly, housekeeping was good and the pool/pool bar were nice, but the restaurant was awful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location, great staff, excellen value!
Summary: Recently stayed in room 235 for two nights. Good location for the stairs/elevators and for the gym. The hotel is located very close to the freeway, so there is noise but it is also very convenient. Room had a nice refrigerator and safe. King bed and Queen sleeper sofa with coffee table. It was just two of us so we had more than enough space. Second floor with pool view. Room was very clean. The outside walkways could have used a cleaning with the hose. Ice is a good distance away, but plentiful. There are two elevators, as well as stairs. A nice little gym. The pool has a little Tiki bar with fairly reasonable drinks - a Blue Hawaiian complete with orchid was $8.50 during the day. I ordered the same thing at night and it was much smaller, in a plastic cup, no orchid, same
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed 2 nights in room 533. The hotel is located practically on the freeway so there was a lot of noise.  We were in the "wing" closest to the freeway.    Room has been re-modelled and is quite nice, but the mattress could do with replacing (quite a big divot).  Also there was no fridge.   Disney tickets can be brought here and it is within walking distance to the park but we chose to take the shuttle seeing as we would be on our feet for two days at the park.  The hotel is the last stop to and first stop from the park and comes regularly.  Starbucks across the road was handy for brekkie on the go.  Very good pool and spa area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel by far exceeded our expectations. It was very affordable, very clean, and very professional. I sincerely believe it deserves a higher rating. My fiance thinks it's edging towards 4 star!  Anyway, we stayed here for 3 nights and it was amazing. Our rooms were not ready until official check in-time, and because we arrived earlier, we were waiting around for a bit and had to go get lunch. but it just shows how booked out they were!   The rooms are exactly as shown in the photos, and it is very clean. We stayed in the Standard Room. Because we were celebrating our Anniversary we got a room facing the pool- which meant we also saw the Disneyland fireworks each night! :)  The Bathroom is sufficient size and the basin is separate from the bathroom and toilet. There was also
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My experience at the Hotel Menage
Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Menage on 06/05/13 - 06/07/13 for our trip to Disneyland.  We really enjoyed our stay.  Twice I had to call down to the desk to get towels and a blanket and they were delivered in under 5 minutes, anyone who stays in hotels knows that is not usually the case.  The staff is very friendly and I want to give a shout out to some of them.  Grace, front desk, Brandon, Dustin and Patsa (sp?), valets.  What a great bunch of employees you have working for you.  Very friendly and went out of their way to help us.  Keep up the good work. Sincerely, Linda Pederson
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had 8 people total in our group and had one king room with a sleeper sofa (2 teenage boys used the sofa) and a double queen room.  We have no complaints about anything during our 4 night stay.  To be honest we were only at the hotel to shower and sleep since we arrived around 11:00pm the first night and were up bright and early to get to Disneyland the next morning.  That was pretty much our schedule for the next few days.  Not once did we hear loud music from the pool but we were always late getting back from the park so I cannot comment on that.  As far as the traffic noise it did not bother us.  The only thing I would change would be the lighting over the mirror.  It was kind of dark for applying makeup but other than that our room was clean and we did have a refrigerator.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel Menage sells a Disneyland package.  We had to pay 100% up front for 1 night at the hotel and 2 days in Disneyland with no cancellation privileges.  One of our party was in the hospital, so they did allow us a 6 month extension.  However, that pushed us into prime time with the summer crowds.  The hotel is not walking distance to the park.  Our times from the park to the hotel ranged from 30 minutes to an hour by bus.  There are motels right across from the entrance.  Our biggest gripe is the bed boxes.  The mattress is on a square box painted the color of the rug.  3 out of 4 in our group hit the corner of the bed hard enough to have major bruises.  They need to put rubber bumpers on the bed corners!  A big plus is the parking.  They let  us park before checkin and leave
Manager Response: none

Summary: My fiancée and I will be staying at this hotel in September. I wanted to stay here because they have an amazing room called "the Asian room". We quickly called to reserve our stay and there hotel administrative staff Sureya went over and above our expectations of making sure we got what we wanted for our honeymoon! Thank you very much Sureya for all your help!! I hope we can meet soon so we can thank you in person!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were two adults with our daughters (ages 17, 14, 9) traveling for a mother/daughter trip.  We stayed 3 nights. We called the resort ahead of time to inquire on adjoining rooms.  They advised us which rooms to book to get connecting rooms as this was very important to us.  We booked a king/sofa suite and a two queen suite.  At check-in we were given two rooms not connected but were quickly switched after we asked to be adjoining.  We really appreciated having connecting rooms as it makes it easier when traveling together with family.  The rooms were clean but quite noisy because of the freeway noise.  Not a huge issue but did notice the noise in the evening when trying to sleep.  We loved the pool bar happy hour. Good food and drinks!  We didn't spend much time at the hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hugh thank you to all the staff, especially Dani who made our recent stay so fantastic.  We always received a friendly welcome on our return from our days travels which made it feel like coming home. Rooms were clean. Comfortable beds.  Walking distance to Disneyland. Shuttle service to your door. The best restaurant food, with great friendly service. Would stay again anytime.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has friendly, helpful staff.  The rooms were comfortable, clean and well taken care of.  The pool was great.  location is great.  Food was the best we had on our entire trip.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone that asks.  I am not a 5 star guy but my kids and I felt like we were treated very special.  Thanks to all the great staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When first arrived it is a beautiful Hotel. Foyer large and inviting went to check in with a very friendly staff member but to be advised room wouldn't be ready for another 1-2 hours which is a bummer as I have a disability and needed to lay down staff member kept apologising but there was nothing that she could do. When checking in I advised them that I didn't have a credit card and was willing to leave money as a deposit which was fine but I was taken aback for the amount they asked for me to leave . Finally got into my room which was nice as it was on the ground floor not far from the room. I walked into the room I was surprised at the size of the bed as I have a disability with my legs I have been finding it hard to get my legs onto the bed. The hotel is nice and close to
Manager Response: none

Summary: The lobby is wonderful. It is very clean & inviting. Looks very clean & modern. The room could have been cleaner! The bathtub was in bad shape. Very chipped and found gross hairs! The walls need to be wiped down and the rooms need a face lift. The beds sit in a wood box that we were all constantly hitting our shins on. I am giving this a 3 because for the price & the view. We watched the fire works from Disney land all 4 days of our stay except for one because we actually were in the DL park. The hotel charges $10 per day to park your own car & $12 per day to have a valet park it. So add that to your bill. If you are not overly picky about cleanliness then you might look elsewhere. It was except able being as we didnt spend much time in room. Its about a 15 min walk to the DL
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed her for 5 nights in December.  Nice place, helpful staff.  Rooms clean and well appointed.  Close enough to walk to Disneyland, but also has a shuttle stop at hotel entrance.  Would definitely stay her again and would recommend highly. A bit noisy when fireworks go off at night, but you can see them from the hotel so that's nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Staff and Great Place to Relax
Summary: Once we checked in we went to our room and just our luck the battery from the lock had just given out so our keys weren't working. I went to the front desk so I can get some assistance. The staff took care of me right away. They got a maintenance worker to change the battery in a timely manner. The overall stay was great with comfortable beds and plenty of pillows. I would highly recommend this hotel for their outstanding customer care and a great value to stay since Disneyland is really close by that you can take a shuttle to get to it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback regarding your recent stay! Your compliments to our front desk and maintenance staff have been passed along and are greatly appreciated. We are happy to know your stay was enjoyable, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you again. Warm Regards, Charlotte

Summary: A beautful and clean place to stay.  Stayed in room with a king bed and sofa bed.  The sofa bed wasnt too bad.   The rooms are very nice and comfortable.   24 hour pool and the fireworks are spectacular from the hotel.    I found that booking early in the morning, I was able to find the lowest rates.   I will be staying here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had 2 nights here, the rooms are large and clean, even if our room safe was broken.  It is only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland or the shuttle bus comes every 15 minutes or so.  At 9pm, when the fireworks explode, the view is probably as the hotel says - the best view, it was fantastic.  The staff were friendly and extremely helpful, nothing was too much trouble, they held our bags and car the day we left, which was late and one of the girls at reception came to assist us as the concierge was very busy and siad we had waited too long.  The food we had there was good and one of the best buffet breakfasts we had on our trip, everthing was hot.  I would definately stay there again.
Manager Response: We are so glad to know you enjoyed your recent stay, and that you had the opportunity to watch the fireworks from our property - the view is indeed fantastic! Your compliments to our friendly staff have been passed along and are very much appreciated.  Thank you for posting your review! Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Let me start this off by stating that I stayed at this hotel about 3 years ago when my wife and I brought our two kids down to Disneyland. Back then about the only issue I had with the place was that the bathrooms had no ventilation and you could tell that they were constantly painting the walls to keep the mildew look to a minimum. Other than that we like our experience.   Recently I booked a Memorial Day trip for the family and thought it might be worth returning to the Menage. First impression was good. The parking attendants were very helpful and friendly. The  young man who greeted us at the front desk and checked us in was fantastic. I'm afraid it was a slow decent downhill from there.   The Menage is a hotel surrounded by a noisy intersection and a freeway, so noise is
Manager Response: I appreciate you posting your review and feedback. I'm so sorry to hear that your return stay was so disappointing. We have noted all of the points you made regarding service and cleanliness and will be holding an intense re-training session with our pool staff and housekeeping department. Guest feedback is very important, as it helps us to identify areas we may fall short.  Thank you again for your candid comments. Warm Regards, Charlotte Gulley Guest Service Manager

Summary: Beautiful hotel with fantastic service! Very clean rooms and a great pool area with a fun palapa bar! Professional valets and friendly staff! Extremely comfortable bed! Very close to great dining and entertainment! Highly recommended for business or pleasure!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and just loved everything about it.  We were on the ground floor so we did not hear any traffic noise and both slept like babies.  The staff is friendly, upbeat and always happy to serve or help you with anything.  Food is excellent as well as the drinks.  Great location from Disney, shuttle service quick and prompt.  You will enjoy the fireworks while sitting out by the pool or lounge.  We enjoyed viewing the fireworks more at the hotel vrs the park.  Fun place to stay if you are going to Disney or just come and relax.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear your enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you for posting your review :)

Summary: Spacious room excellent king bed. Wonderful bar by great pool area. Can stand on balcony and watch the fireworks from Disneyland. Walking distance to the theme parks. Breakfast could have been a little cheaper. Hotel concierge staff and bell boys offered lots of assistance.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Convenient location to Disneyland but terrible hotel
Summary: My wife and I booked a package deal to Disneyland on a whim. We arrived as per our reservation and the room was not ready. Kind of a strange feel when you walk into the lobby because the bar is right there and very loud dance music.   Since the room was not ready we went to Disneyland. The hotel offers ART bus passes but they don't tell you you can buy multi-day passes for cheaper.   When we finally got our room, the I-5 highway noise is absolutely crazy even with the window closed. Rooms are small and although renovated not very clean. We has empty bottles in our fridge and lots of dust. Housekeeping was terrible. Everyday was something. The elevator carpet smells worse than wet dog from drinks and pool water. Two days they took our towels and did not replace them until I
Manager Response: I am so sorry to hear of your disappointment in your recent stay. We take all guest feedback very seriously, and will be discussing the notated housekeeping issues with our Rooms Manager and the entire housekeeping department. These issues are inexcusable, and are certainly not typical for our hotel.  Again, I just want to offer my apologies that your experience fell below your expectations and our standards. Thank you for your feedback. Sincerely, Charlotte Guest Service Manager

Summary: I was looking forward to my second visit to the Hotel Menage after a year. Unfortunately , in my opinion the hotel was not as good as the last time . Arrived midnight after informing hotel of my late arrival , on checking in , my wotif booking was lost in the system and could not be retrieved, although i produced e mails from Wotif.com acknowledging my booking , the whoe booking in process took 50mins , no recompence was offered , even a free drink at the bar, which i thought was poor service Rooms clean and good choice of tv channels Breakfast very average Overall i think i will stay at a different hotel next time nearer to Disney
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear of the frustrating check-in you experienced! This is certainly not typical at our hotel and I will personally look into how Wotif.com communicates their bookings with us so this does not happen again. We regret to hear that this instance has deterred you from staying with us again, but we hope you might reconsider giving us a second chance. If you decide to stay with us again, please contact our Front Office Supervisor, Jessica Kim, directly; she will be happy to ensure you a great room, a seamless check-in, and the type of experience you had come to expect. Sincerely, Charlotte Guest Service Manager

Summary Heading: Close to Disney without outrageous price tag
Summary: Needed a quick over-night stay following my daughter's dance competition at Disneyland Hotel. Chose this location based on favorable reviews, location, and price. Let's start with the many positives: great location if you are looking for something close to park. Price was less compared to others just a couple blocks down Harbor Blvd. Service is fabulous. Room was what you would expect at this price point, and was very clean. Downsides? A little worn in bathroom areas, and the wooden frames around beds did get my toe once and could really hurt if you're not careful. Freeway noise is what it is. If you're noise sensitive, get a room on opposite end. We had actually requested to face disneyland for the fireworks and although you could hear cars, it really didn't bother us.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review! Your comments and feedback are appreciated. We are happy to know you enjoyed your recent stay, and we look forward to hosting you again.

Summary: Check in was great- really helpful and friendly staff.  We had been allocated a room overlooking the pool but the guy at check in moved our room as he said we may struggle sleeping with the noise.  He gave us a room just off the car park which I'm sure was noisier that the pool room would've been and we could hear everyone parking their cars, chatting outside the door and could smell them smoking there too.  Wish we'd asked to move but we were just too tired after a long trip for the hassle.  The room was big and comfortable and had everything we needed.  Wish we'd stayed in the main hotel a few floors up rather than right off the car park.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It is regretful to hear that the room recommendation our front desk agent made didn't work out as well as he'd thought. I apologize that this resulted in a frustrating night for you, but we appreciate your feedback, and hope to have the opportunity to host you again, in a quieter room next time. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: WOW! After being in Vegas for a week I have to say that the Menage was exactly what we needed! Immediately when we pulled up the Valet was prompt on greeting us. The girl at the front desk as also very personable and got us our keys in a timely manner. The hotel itself looks like it was recently renovated and is a very nice modern space. We also had the pleasure of eating at the "in house" American Tavern which was AMAZING. I had the "Messy" burger and it was probably the best burger I've ever had.. and I'm from MT. The onion rings were also to die for! The service all around was great and even though we were in a  hotel full of kids ready for Disney Land it was the most peaceful night rest we had on our entire vacation.  P.S. Love the leather comforter - very classy :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Cool and trendy for the family at Disney.....
Summary: This was a family trip to see the mouse and referred to by a friend in the anaheim area; great recommendation. You want a solid referral , ask a local..........   Check in was a breeze, the ladies at the desk were attentive and prompt and even let me know the stroller we rented had been delivered without me even letting them know. I had extended our stay a day and had no problem securing the room for the additional day. The ladies suggested the American Tavern within your restaurant as well as the outdoor tiki bar and little did i know they were going to hit a home run with both suggestions. BTW, my wife and I loved the music playing the in lobby area everyday.....brought back some good old memories :) The room had a perfect view for the fireworks Sunday night for our children!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had made reservations for this hotel before reading all of the reviews, glad I did. Some of the reviews were pretty bad; noise, smells, poor service and poor food, etc. I was pretty nervous about our stay but was pretty happy upon our departure. If you are expecting the Ritz or Hilton then don't stay here.  	 Having said that the service was very good, we arrived about two hours early and the staff did everything they could to get us into a room. I decided to allow them time to get the rooms cleaned and we drove around for a while, had some lunch and got a feel of where everything was located. The hotel is well within walking distance of Disney Land and several restaurants, the hotel does offer a shuttle if you don't feel like walking; $4 person.   Our room was on the second
Manager Response: none

Summary: My girlfriend and I stayed here following an Angels game and had a blast! All of the staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was great. Ashley helped us book the room and was AWESOME! Having a fridge in the room was definitely a great addition to the room. Jeff, the local cab driver dropped us off at the perfect spot to avoid the traffic getting to the game. After the game we had a few drinks at the outside bar which was a perfect way to wind down before heading to the room. The beds were very comfortable and both of us slept great. We will definitely be back!  PS- Try out the restaurant! The Thai Wings are awesome!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The property overall is a welcome oasis in the Disney desert. Meaning if you're here on business, or perhaps just don't want to be surrounded by 24 hours of Mickey, the Hotel Menage is a welcome alternative. It appears to have once been a roadside motel similar to the others you find in the area, but the upgrades have made the property one that I continue to return to. The freeway noise also might seem like an issue, but once inside the rooms that all goes away. It's very comfortable.   The service could not be better, as well. I was having one of those frustrating days where nothing seemed to be going my way, and Sureya at the front desk helped make my technology dreams come true assisting me to print out an event ticket that I could not seem to get to work. And I'm pretty
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in this hotel specifically to go to Disneyland, and it was fantastic. Roomy room with a lounge and comfy beds, we got there early and they let us check in without charging us extra. Good value breakfast $12 all you can eat. GREAT GREAT GREAT pool bar, happy hour $5 cocktails and they are yummy also $5 happy hour tapas, just what we needed after a big day at Disneyland.  Great bar tender as well. Nice pool area to hang out as well, and for $145 a night I think it was excellent value for money.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel and excellent customer service. Ashley helped us out in our booking and airport transfers. Her response to  all my inquiries were  prompt. The  hotel  staff are   friendly and accommodating.  There is a shuttle service to and from Disney. The buffet breakfast was excellent.Thank you for making our stay a memorable one.We will definitely stay in this hotel the next time we will visit Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Awesome place Sureya at the front desk is amazing she was so helpful and made my stay had a complete booking disaster she helped me re book my room for an even better price and got me complimentary  drinks for my birthday! when we got to our room it was so clean and nice pool is open 24 hours super close to disneyland definitely staying here again
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was a really great place go stay! A shuttle from the front door down to Disney land, and your there in a few minutes! Starbucks is located across the road. The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating, and the hotels restaurant had beautiful food and really reasonable prices!  The beds were great size, and really comfortable! With a nice long bench and desk!  Would definitely stay here again!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Given the proximity of this hotel near Disneyland, overall we were glad to have stayed there. However, two things really dampened the experience for us: noise, and bruised shins.  First, the noise. The hotel is right next to the I-5 freeway, which is quite loud, and that was somewhat annoying but certainly not the hotel's fault. The real noise, however, was the blaring music coming from the pool area (our room faced the pool) until 10:00 pm. We were there on chilly Sunday and Monday nights and there was no one - exactly zero people - in the pool area either night - so we totally don't understand the rationale for making the rest of the guests miserable. For a family with a child (our son is 4 1/2), that level of noise was a huge turnoff and will keep us from going back there
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Five Star Experience at Hotel Ménage
Summary: The Ménage’s staff is wonderfully hospitable and courteous.  Because of them our stay was so much more enjoyable. They made us feel very special, and exceeded all of our expectations, on our three day mini vacation. The Hotel Ménage’s property is nestled on the corner of South Harbor Boulevard & Ball, right next to Disneyland.  Grace (Front Desk), Andrew (Concierge), Sureya (Front Desk), Karyn, Jessica and Clariee all provided us with excellent service, that wasn’t forced but truly heartfelt and genuine. We arrived at the hotel around 9:00am, hoping to at least park there, and begin our fun filled first day at Disneyland. What a delight it was to find out that they had a room available, and poolside! Check-in was a breeze. Parking is inexpensive. The American Tavern Restaurant
Manager Response: none

Summary: Ok......I've stood before and would've given this a much better rating. However, my last visit was much "different". We just came back from vacation and decided to go to Disneyland before going home. So, since we had such a good experience before, we booked again. We stood in a room near the pool area. Bad idea! If you are looking for some rest make sure you choose a room facing Harbor Blvd. or Ball Rd. Otherwise you will interrupted by the loud music from the 24 hr pool (turns off at 10:00 but if you're super tired this may not be early enough) and all the people drinking at the bar. The bar has pretty good drinks. Blessing and a curse. Our neighbor was barfing all night so we kept waking up. This was not my prior experience so I will blame Cinco de Mayo weekend:) On the
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I went recently went up to Anaheim for a quick visit.  We chose the Menage strictly for the price point.  We didn't know what to expect.  We were pleasantly surprised.  The room was nice, the bed was comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful.  The American Tavern had a great happy hour.  The breakfast buffet was ok.  We especially enjoyed speaking with Frank at the bar.  We came in after a show around 11:30, the bar was pretty quiet, but Frank took the time to give us some good advice on how to save some $$$ in the area.  We really appreciated that.  All in all a very good stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Apparently I like this place, I keep going back!
Summary: From our first stay in 2010, it's been modern, clean, we've had great service, a lively atmosphere, and the pool area is refreshing. We used to enjoy the menu of 'flavours from around the world' but sadly those options are gone. The prices were unbeatable and the food was so good we actually drove over from Vegas to have supper. My husband and I first stayed at The Menage in June of 2010 when we got engaged. We brought our mothers back to plan the wedding in Sept 2011. This past November 2012 I brought my entire family for a trip to Disneyland. Amidst some wet floors and a room change, we were still impressed with the service from the staff. Not only did the front desk employees Grace and Sureya demonstrate excellent customer attention anytime we had a question or a request, but
Manager Response: none

Summary: I might be a little bias but here we go! Ok so a little preface... we made reservations at a different hotel and walked into the room and immediately asked for a refund and left that place... so compared to that other place this hotel was AWESOME!!   I called the Hotel Menage from the other room and they were very professional and courteous, they said they would take care of us... and they did! We pulled up and were directed by the valet to front desk. Got out room and were asked if we wanted valet we said no thank you, then they said parking was $10, and valet was $12... we went with the valet. They took care of everything from there, including our luggage. We paid what we would have paid at the super 8 so this service was definitely standing out.   When we got to the room, it
Manager Response: We appreciate you posting your review of your recent stay, and are thrilled to read your comparison to another hotel in our neighborhood. We are always striving for excellence and are happy to know you noticed and appreciated our good service, great rates, and friendly atmosphere. Thank you for your candid comments!

Summary: Stayed there with my brother and two kids over spring break (the week before Easter). The rooms were fine and the location was great. The pool is very nice, open anytime. The restaurant had just reopened and the food was outstanding, ate there twice. The Messy Burger was a good burger. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My only complaint was the music at the pool starting at 10:00 am.  I  just wanted to sleep in one day. Overall I would stay there again. Very pleasant trip!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a quintessential southern california property. Located within walking distance of Disneyland and next to the freeway.  The best part was the pool and restaurant area which is open 24 hrs and looks like a grotto with patches of tall palms trees and stones placed around the outdoor pool and bar. The nightly fireworks display for the park takes place almost over your head.  It is jammed with kids, families and couples with a common purpose.  DISNEYLAND! The staff operates like a well-oiled machine to move the multitudes through. The rooms were perfectly acceptable.  Well used but comfortable and tasteful contemporary furnishings and the rooms were relatively soundproof.  We were on the 5th floor and highest floor facing the freeway.  3 and 1/2 stars is an accurate
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post a review of our hotel! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. Thank you for your candid comments. ~Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, pool area and staff!!!!
Summary: Great place to stay with family. 24 hour heated pool with fantastic view of the Disney fireworks. Will stay here again!! Staff is very friendly and helpful. We have found our second home when visiting California.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best place for Disney and  relaxing
Summary: Begin by assuming it can be noisy near Disney when the fireworks go off -  big surprise! We were a little disappointed there aren't fireworks during the week in April. Otherwise the hotel, near the highway - isn't unusually noisy. But who goes to Disney for the peace and quiet? The convenient walk to Disney, the fewer number of small hyped-up children at this location , and a great restaurant and bar make this the perfect adult place to stay. The bar is excellent. You can go outside by the pool or inside where Frank makes great drinks and provides good conversation. We came for an extra day this year just to enjoy the pool and hot tub, spend time with Frank (great happy hour, too! ) and to eat at the restaurant.  The people here are all very pleasent, it has a relaxed welcoming
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty! We are thrilled you chose to return to our hotel again, and are happy to know you enjoyed your second stay. Your compliments to Frank have been passed along. We look forward to hosting you again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, and the staff at Hotel Menage

Summary: Like most people I read mixed reviews about the hotel and was not sure what to expect. The moment we walked in we were made very welcome by all the staff. The freeway noise is loud but is really dulled down once the room door is shut. The room itself was clean and tidy. The bed was huge and comfortable. The bathroom was a little cramped but clean. The restaurant was great but the breakfast a little bit more expensive than the short 10 min down to other options. The only downside was the music at the pool bar loudly playing until late at night. Special mention to Sureya who gave us a better room and Andrew the concierge who recommended great tours and went out of his way to help with anything we needed. Overall this hotel was great and we wouldn't hesitate in staying there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: came here for my honeymoon, we booked through Expedia and the moment we arrived the service was pleasant an very friendly we slept well each night. the only complaint wold be the large windows can hear people walking by. but was not too big of an issue, also the weather was nice when we were there so we walked to disneyland/ downtown disney only took about 8 mins or so.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are thrilled that you chose to stay with us during your honeymoon; it was our pleasure to host you during such a special time :) Congratulations, we wish you both every happiness! Warm Regards, Charlotte, and the team at Hotel Menage

Summary: This trip was a surprise 50th birthday present for my wife (Left the kids at home). We stayed for 5 nights at the Menage, and was fearing the worse from some of the reviews I have read on this forum. Our first point of contact was Sureya who checked us in..When informed it was my wifes 50th birthday trip, we were given complimentary cocktails at the outdoor pool bar..a lovely touch..The room we had over looking the pool was lovely..very clean and spacious. Yes, you can hear the freeway in the background, but when the room door was shut, We could just hear the background noise..The noise was not an issue for us at all. The Disneyland Fireworks felt like they were going off in our room..Spectacular..The general feel of the Hotel was very good..very relaxed atmosphere..lovely pool
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Friendly, convenient, great service and affordable
Summary: I was skeptical at first as this was farther away from the convention center. This turned out to be a really great place to stay. Getting a cab was very easy. The hotel staff were always friendly and helped me ship a package without any hassles. It was actually conveniently located near every amenity that you could desire - mall, movies, convention center, restaurants, etc. The atmosphere is modern and clean. The rooms were decent. But I would not get a room next to the trash compactor again. Also - the fireworks from disney land are pretty loud here. But overall - it's a decent hotel and I'd stay there again on business and even bring my family to stay there.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We are glad you enjoyed your stay here, as well as our convenient location to the many attractions in Anaheim.  Your recommendation is greatly appreciated, and we look forward to hosting you again, next time you return to the Anaheim area! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Good staff and service - freeway noise
Summary: Staff very friendly and helpful. Clean, remodeled room. Good and affordable room service was a pleasant way to end a day. Kids enjoyed the pool area.   Very noisy - located in middle of a traffic triangle: freeway on one side, two very busy roads on the other two sides.  Must pay for parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed here four times now and really enjoy my visit each time. The lobby is beautiful, the restaurant is good and reasonably priced, the rooms are modern and comfortable, there is a lovely pool and spa, and the fireworks view doesn't get much better. It's also within walking distance if you're on a budget or without a vehicle.   This hotel is definitely worth the upgrade from the bottom bargain basement motels in the area. The beds are far more comfortable and you feel as if you're staying in a much nicer hotel than what you've paid for. Like I said, been there four times and will certainly be back again.   Note: if you're early sleepers, the fireworks are literally a block away and will set off all the car alarms in the parking lot. This happens around 9:30 most nights
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed at the Hotel Menage for 3 nights on our American holiday. We booked through a travel agent and they advised it was a good hotel to stay at as you can see the fireworks at Disneyland from the pool. This is true but that is probably the only good thing about the hotel. We did arrive late as we had a coach trip from Las Vegas but the room we were given was next to the freeway and we never slept due to the noise. The room was average at best. The next morning we asked for an upgrade which was to a suite at an extra $150  per night. The room was larger but that was about all. The bathroom timbers were rotting, the room was not clean and the bed was terrible. The springs were sticking into my back. The hallways to the rooms are like dungeons. There was a pergola in
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your feedback. We are surprised to hear your opinion about rotting timbers, as we have not received a comment such as this before. Please be assured we have notified our maintenance engineer and I would like to note we have not yet been able to find rotting timbers in any guest rooms, nor any falling around the pool area. I apologize if any part of our property left you feeling unsafe. It is true we are located close to the freeway, as most of the Disney area is next to the same freeway. Most guests find our location to be convenient to Disney and the surrounding Anaheim attractions, however, I can understand your frustration with the sounds of the city around us. I'm very sorry to know you didn't enjoy your stay with us, and wish you happier future travels.

Summary Heading: Great Stay and Close to Disney
Summary: My family and I researched many hotels in the area and we kept coming back to the hotel menage. I called a few times to determine policies and always seemed to speak with Dani, she is an exceptional part of the team and always took time to answer all my questions. The rooms are beautiful the pool and hot tub are great after a long day at Disney which is only a fifteen minute walk. Come back and relax during happy hour with bar and food discounts. I highly recommend, everyone on staff is great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at the Menage 3 times and I can't wait to come back for a 4th. It's a great overall value considering the amenities that are available. I absolutely love the outdoor patio bar and pool. There is also a great restaurant, lounge and full service bar inside. I was initially worried that it might be too loud considering it's right next to the freeway, but once you're in your room you don't hear a thing. The park is about a 10 min walk to the park which isn't bad, the only down side is the sidewalk that is over the freeway is a little narrow which is kind of sketchy, or you can grab a shuttle thats cuts your time in half. I have to say the overall service has been remarkable. The last time I stayed, Sureya (I hope I spelled that right), went above and beyond helping me
Manager Response: On behalf of the team members and ownership of Hotel Menage, I'd like to let you know how much we appreciate your loyalty.  Your compliments to Sureya have been passed along, and are greatly appreciated. We're thrilled to know you how much you have enjoyed your stays! Again, thank you so much for your continuing business, and we look forward to hosting you when you visit Anaheim. Warm Regards, The Hotel Menage team

Summary Heading: Watch Disneyland fireworks from your room or the pool yard.
Summary: Prime location. Fancy place to stay!!  Close enough to walk to Disneyland. Ménage has a shuttle too. They do charge. Walking is less than 1/2 a mile (some uphill)  Hotel is very modern. Great pool. Fantastic location to watch the fireworks. Poolside bar as well.    Restaurant inside. Many restaurants within walking distance too.   Menage is Located on HarborBlvd. If you are up to a long day trip... Take the bus to the Fullerton train station and take the train to Los Angeles Grand Central Station. Red Line to downtown la!! See the sights. Train it back and bus back up to ménage. Fun adventure. Though in Cali... It's best to rent a car!!  Catch an Angel's game. Taxi with tip is maybe $20.   Lots to do in this area!! Save up before you come. California is super fun and quite
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had carpet beatles crawling on us in our beds.  Not clean.  Very smelly.  Unhelpful management.  The pool area was nicer than some other hotels close to Disneyland, but the actual hotel room was disgusting.
Manager Response: Please know we take reports of insects or bugs very seriously. Our hotel is routinely serviced by a professional pest control company to prevent such incidents. We appreciate your notification, and would like to let you know we have already had the appropriate inspections and maintenance done to prevent any further possible annoyance. Thank you for your feedback. Charlotte, Guest Service Hotel Menage

Summary: Mostly my complaint was with the upkeep, and with housekeeping. The management was responsive to our complaints, but we stayed an entire week here, and there were 3 adults in our room. Every single day we had to ask for one more coffee. Every day. Three adults. Three coffees. 7 days. We had to ask for more toilet paper, because we ran out. More towels because we ran out. The housekeeping staff was very unobservant. Garbage sat in our room for days unemptied. Our first room had no hot water. The shower was cold...literally. Someone was sent to fix it, and perhaps I noticed a 10 degree difference, but it was still unacceptable. So we changed rooms on the 2nd night. They told us they would be shutting that room down and working on it, but they had someone in there the next night.
Manager Response: Dear EvaPep, Thank you for posting your feedback regarding your stay last November. I am sincerely sorry to hear that our room attendants were apparently so unobservant that you had to ask for room supplies to be delivered to your room during your stay, when they should have been in your room to begin with. I'd like to let you know that, since your last stay, we have been doing additional training with our various departments to ensure our service standards are kicked up a couple notches, and that they remain high in all departments, including housekeeping. Our guest's comfort is our number one priority, and I apologize that you left disappointed; this is never our intention. We hope to have the opportunity to serve and host you again, should you return to the Anaheim area. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary: This one is in a pretty good spot for visiting Disneyland. We walked from the hotel each day - It's roughly 10 mins down the road. Our room was pretty close to the main road (4th floor) and I was worried that it would be noisy but we had no issues. We had heaps of room service and it was always super-quick. Great bar out the back to watch fireworks from each night too. Overall, great spot.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved our stay at the Menage . We felt very relaxed here . Nice pool and poolside bar . The staff was wonderful , very helpful esp Dani at the front desk - she helped us organize a day tour of LA when it was late at night for the next day. She went to so much trouble to get us on a tour that suited us and was always so sweet. The meals were good and we couldn't believe how low the final food and beverages bill was at the end of our stay.It was an easy 5 min shuttle bus to Disneyland and their was a friendly comradarie on the bus , one night it was actually hilarious We would definitely stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear about how you enjoyed your recent stay. Thank you for the kudo's to Dani... we have passed along a note of your compliments to her, and she is deeply appreciative. We look forward to hosting you again, should your travels bring you back to Southern California. Thank you again for your warm recommendation! Safe Travels, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Not the place to stay if you expect clean sheets!
Summary: Booked this hotel (more like a motel) trying to save some money. This was a last minute mini vacation for Spring break. I usually choose 4 star hotels like the Hilton and Marriott but I figured a 3.5 star hotel shouldn't be bad or motel quality. Checked in at 6:30 am after a long night of driving and the first thing I do in any hotel I stay in is to remove the duvet or comforter. I pulled back the sheets and immediately noticed how dingy the sheets were. There also was hair and a large stain in the middle of the sheets. The pullout couch also had food crumbs in between the sheets as well! I called the front desk and they sent up housekeeping to change the sheets. The first set of sheets the housekeeper brought up was also dirty so she went back downstairs to get another set of
Manager Response: Dear LeslieIvonne, We completely understand your anger and frustration regarding your recent experience at our hotel. You are right, and we agree... clean sheets are expected to be a given at any hotel. Please know we have brought your experience to the attention of our Room Attendant Manager, supervisor and staff, and have subsequently held an intense training session to ensure this does not happen again. We typically pride ourselves on the cleanliness of our hotel rooms, and feel very ashamed that we have slipped in this regard. We have our laundry outsourced to an outside company, and have brought this incident to the laundry company's attention as well. Your experience is unacceptable, and we are doing everything possible to make sure this is not repeated. Again, we are so deeply apologetic for our lapse in service and cleanliness during your stay. This is not typical, and our housekeeping department has a renewed diligence to provide a comfortable and clean stay for each and every guest, every day. Sincerely, Charlotte Gulley Guest Service Manager Hotel Menage

Summary: There were 2 of us staying in 1 room at this hotel. We were there just to visit Disneyland and meet a few relatives.   When we arrived at the hotel, it was really late at night. Our flight had been delayed so many times so we were very tired. The lobby was kind of dark and we weren't sure where the front desk was because the lobby was loud with music and busy with people. My first impression was "Wow, there's so much people here! Is this the right hotel?" We realized that the front desk was just to our side. It would have been better if we arrived earlier I guess. The front desk was busy with some rowdy guests. When it was finally our turn to check in, the front desk explained that there was a wedding reception going on. The front desk was friendly and we just wanted to get to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place and location! Stayed here many times.
Summary: Ok! So lets just start with disneyland fireworks, theyget better eachtime. Most likely because we're at the bar being served by a staff of friendly and knowledgeable bartenders =) but none the less awesome job and kudos to the night team/security and everyone at front desk we had spoke to about a small incident with our room. We had spoke to Jessica about it earlier that day but it was not resolved and all we got at the time was attitude but thankyou Patrick for completly resolving our problem as we returned extremely tired from the magical disneyland. Having stayed here many times before I know the problem with our room was rare but because it was not resolved right away with management im dropping a star from a perfect overall 5. I will return yet again thankyou all and make
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed her last week for spring break. I got a good deal online and booked a room with king and a sofa sleeper. I arrived at the hotel late from disneyland and I was able to check in with no hastle. The lobby was chic and hip with people at the bar. The front desked showed me in a map where to park my car located at the back. I requested for a quite room away from the street but I was still put in a room located infront of busy Ball St. The hotel is located on the cross intersections of the 5 freeway and Ball street. When I got into my room the first I noticed were what were missing inside, no microwave, refrigerator and also a house phone.  I went down to lobby to get ice and was not able to get to an ice machine. I ended up getting ice from the bar which was awkward with
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Horrible customer service! Do not recommend a stay!
Summary: First of all I went in with my room previously booked according to an employee by the name of Dominique and when I get there he's all confused about what room he put me in. I literally had my room changed about 4 times, he kept making up excuses for why my room wasn't ready instead of doing his job. Then to top it off when I asked for a manager he looked at me sarcastically, turned around in a circle, and claimed he was the manager. The customer service was so bad I didn't even care to get my money back. I simply left and checked into Marriott down the street. The cost was a little more expensive but the employees were a lot more professional. Make sure to train you employees not to drive away paying customers.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel for what you pay.
Summary: I stayed ther ine night to go to disneyland. The room were good. You can tell that it was an older hotel thats been updated. The downstairs pool bar is great and the walk to disney was not bad. Its not the best hotel ever but its certainly not the worst.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Loved the Hotel and Employee Clairee
Summary: The room was very clean, and contemporary, which is just my style. Pool was heated which was great nice at night it get a tad chilli and most of all employee Clairee was very helpful and very nice. i will for sure be staying there again
Manager Response: none

Summary: as first time guests, my family and i really enjoyed this hotel. just down the street from disneyland you would expect to pay twice as much. my wife and daughter really enjoyed the 24 hour heated pool and jaccuzi. i enjoyed the patio bar, look for john the bartender, he is great. the view of the disneyland fireworks were spectacular. it was like they were right in front of you and loud too, you can feel the concusion. we will be back. once again look for the bartender john, he is really a great bartender and very easy to talk with, fun and funny. great times.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay for the price
Summary: A friend & I stayed here on our trip to Disneyland.  It backs right up to It's A Small World so you can see the fireworks show well from a balcony or pool area.  It's a little bit of a walk to the park, especially at the end of the day when you're tired.  There is an affordable area shuttle that is worth it.   The rooms were average, but clean. Make sure to ask for a view if you want one. The bed was very comfortable.  Our room was right next to the service elevator which was pretty noisy early in the morning but not too bad.   We didn't eat at the restaurant or drink at the bars but the whole lobby area w/ restaurant looks really nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: So close and yet so far...
Summary: Dont let the French handle fool you - this is a Motel!  And worse, it is sandwiched between a busy highway and road and it is incredibly loud.  Traffic makes sleep elusive.   The room is tiny and the bathroom a decrepit shoebox - with peeling paint, crumbling plaster and a yellowed tub with leaking shower head.   Our cleaning staff was lovely and she did a good job with what she had to work with.  Pool area and outdoor bar were nice but it was the nastiest room I've ever stayed in and I'm a hockey mom!  Close-ish proximity to Disney but a long walk across busy highway.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was amazing! The staff were super friendly, and the 24 hour pool and jacuzzi is just what the doctor ordered. The restaurant in the hotel had some amazing food better than any hotel I have stayed in. Highly recommend to anyone in the Anahiem area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I would have rated this hotel even higher, as everything was just wonderful. However, they have neglected the bathrooms in the guest rooms during their updating. It's not gross or anything, but definitely old and "crusty", unlike everything else there. I'll definitely stay again. Shuttle service to Disney is regular and not a long ride coming or going.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Relaxing, fun affordable and excellent customer service
Summary: It's nice to have hotel staff look you in the eye, smile, say hello, and make you feel like a valued customer. It all started with Dani at the front desk and contnued through checkout the next day. Already have plans for our return in April/May. Very nice grounds, stylish and clean rooms and a great Saturday weekend rate. The bartender and poolside staff were wonderful. Watched the Disnelyand fireworks from the pool bar and made some new friends. Overall a very relaxing & enjoyable experience, walking distance to downtown disney. Would highly recommend staying & dining here. Very romantic, and family friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I took my business team here during a conference and it was miserable.  The lobby and rooms are nice but there is outdoor access to the rooms and it is NOISY.  Loud music at the pool all night long, busy roads with a lot of emergency vehicles and those beautiful fireworks from Disney that you read about go off right over the hotel so don't plan on any sleep until after 11 pm.  Breakfast of any sort before 630 needs to come from a vending machine or the Starbucks across the street.  They were sorely understaffed which is a shame because the food was tasty.  All the staff were nice and accommodating, but the cooks and room service need A LOT of improvement.  Ordered something special for 2 of my team and was told 5 times that it was delivered only to find out it wasn't after they
Manager Response: none

Summary: Well after a 14 hour flight from Australia was really unimpressed with the greeting we got at the front desk from Kent who told us check in was at 3pm I explained to him our travel agent had requested our room be ready  for early check in 11am he was at the least very unsympathetic so my son and I had to go out for 4 hours till our room was ready keeping in mind this is a very big hotel with many rooms and was mid week This was the first of three occasions I had to deal with Kent very poor people skills and very dissmissive of me and my son.On our return for check in at 3pm we were greeted by the most wonderful and pleasant young lady named Sureya cannot say enough about this beautiful young lady from that point on she made us feel very welcome, she was most  helpful and simply
Manager Response: none

Summary: Here we were getting ready to leave LA and head back to San Francisco...all we could think was......let's stay another day and do some Disney fun. My wife looked on our tripadvisor and there she found this wonderful hotel...Hotel Menace. The  price was perfect...the room was fantastic...location was so close to everything Disney.....bottom line.....one of the best  hotel experiences ever........you will love this hotel and its staff 100%…
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was picked as part of a package purchased off a travel web site. Considering that the whole package (airfair round trip from Detroit,car rental,and room for 4 nights) was just over a $1000. we really weren't expecting much.Wow were we mistaken. Upon ariving we were greeted at the front door by Dylan the valet,a very pleasent and helpful young man.Hotel was cleaner than most large chain hotels that I stay in for bussiness. Staff always cleaning.Our room was nice, with your basic hotel ammenities.Bed was comfy and the large flat screen was a welcomed upgrade from most hotels.What really surprised me was the fact that they clean your room every day. Most hotels just make the bed,change towels and dump trash on extended stays.Our room looked like the day we checked in

Summary: For the low price I paid on Hotels.com for this hotel I had pretty low expectations but I was wrong.This place was awesome!  It has a chic vibe to it as soon as you enter the doors.  I loved the cool chandelier and big bar that greats you. Very cool that the pool is open 24 hours but the best part was the food.  I had 3 little ones so I had to order room service but the food was inexpensive but AMAZING!!!! I ordered bacon wrapped dates stuffed with blue cheese. um yummmmm!!!! It has a few drawbacks like freeway noise and thin walls but would absolutely stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Some bads some goods but a fun place!
Summary: Upon arrival it looked like a nice place until we saw all of the painting and equipment up there.  But all that wound up being was a little eyesore.  Not a bad thing.  The valet parking is worth it!  Very easy.  Upon checking in, the desk clerk was very pleasant.  Got us checked in ok and was kind enough to offer upgrade us to a better room (pool view) and gave us a bar coupon.  It was our anniversary, and I asked her to send up a bottle of champagne while we were out so it would be there when we got back from dinner.    As we went to our room I was a little disappointed to find the previous occupants room service breakfast tray still outside our room at 830PM.    The room was suprisingly quiet being right next to the 1-5 freeway.  The drive to disneyland was quick and easy from
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotels location is effectively just over the road from the NW corner of Disneyland, the primary reason for my wife and I being in Anaheim, and after our experiences here (not all good as you will read below), my wife and I will certainly be staying here again next time we are in Anaheim.   Access to Disneyland is an easy 10-15 min' walk, else the hotel is one stop and only a few minutes away using the ART Buses. Two ART routes (#10 & 11) stop at This hotel and pass about every 15 min' all day.   Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet (with door closed), and the bed King size. All access verandahs facing the pool have a ringside seat to the nightly fireworks at Disneyland. This hotel has a great 24/7 heated pool and jacuzzi, comfortable and well shaded outdoor bar, decent
Manager Response: Thank you for posting such a great review of your experience! We appreciate you taking the time to describe your stay in such detail. Your shout-out to Patrick has been passed along, and he has been recognized for his dedication to great customer service. We are looking forward to hosting you and your wife during your next stay in Anaheim. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: My 2 friends and I headed up to Disneyland from San Diego and stayed 1 night here. It was a great location, super close to the park, we could have walked if we wanted to.  The room was clean and very updated. the bed seemed bigger than a queen for sure, and the pullout couch wasn't the worse ive slept in.   The best thing was the 24hr Pool/Jacuzzi, we got back from the park at 1:30am and the Jacuzzi was great after a day of walking. My only gripe was the pool towels were super skimpy/thin/small.  Also we left some bags in our room (237) and I called right after we checked out and they found them and held them till after we came back from the park. Definitively a great service!  4 and 1/2 stars if I could!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place, great customer service, great price
Summary: From the moment we checked in we were treated with amazingly friendly helpful staff. I was informed there was a $50 a night security deposit I wasn't prepared for so she made it just a one time deposit as opposed to a each night. That was great, then I was at the grocery store and couldn't remember if they had a refrigerator in the room so I called. The same young lady that checked me in answered the phone, and told me they have them and she could have it delivered to my room and if they didn't have one available I could store my stuff in her office fridge. Even better kudos. I needed to print something and fax it, she helped me with that, when the fax number didn't work, she scanned it fore and emailed it to me so I could email it to where it needed to go. These are little
Manager Response: none

Summary: Sureya,  at the front desk was beyond helpful with booking my room and was so helpful and just went out of her way to give me the best price for our room. Then a family emergency  came up at the last minute She did not think twice just canceled my room reservation and did not charge me. I promised her i would book my next stay with her directly... Following week I called and booked our room and she remembered me by name.. (you cant ask for better customer service) The room was nice and clean and affordable and the food at the restaurant was great and very affordable. I will only stay at the Hotel Menage I recommend this Hotel 100% and Say HI to Sureya as she is the best.   Jason K
Manager Response: Dear Jason K, Thank you so much for posting your experience! We are thrilled to have you as a loyal guest. Sureya says hello, and we look forward to seeing you and your family again soon! Warm Regards, Sureya and the staff of Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Great Value 10-15 min easy walk to disneyland
Summary: This is a no frills hotel . The walk to Disneyland is an easy 10-15 minutes. The rooms were clean. The staff was great . The pool is clean. The highlight is the restaurant. The food is great and the price reasonable. It was so nice to return from Disneyland with 2 tired 6yr olds and have a quick, healthy dinner and get them to bed. There is a $10/night parking fee. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking to save some money on your hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: stayed here for Valentine's Day with my boyfriend. we brought our dog. service was great location was perfect for what we wanted price could have been a little cheaper considering there's a fee for parking and to take the bus to Disneyland but overall great experience think super elegant Motel 6 with 24 hour pool and jacuzzi nice bars and restaurant
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Hotel, 10-15 minutes walk to Disneyland
Summary: I stayed at the Hotel Ménage for 7 days with a friend of mine.  I'll just summarise my review into point form outlining the pros/cons of the hotel...  Pros:  - Value for money - cheaper than other hotels close to Disneyland - Rooms are roomy and cleaned on a daily basis.  My bed was comfortable and I had 4 large firm pillows to sleep with. - Great view of the Disneyland fireworks from hotel room - Restaurant in hotel lobby, American Tavern Eatery & Drink, is affordable with great food and cocktails.  Happy Hour is good. - The people at reception are friendly and helpful. - Our relatives were initially charge $10 for parking, but was later refunded at checkout because it was determined that it was included in the room price.  (Before arriving, check whether parking is included in
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a good deal for the price. We walked to Disneyland, a 10-15 minute walk, except for when it was raining but the ART shuttle stops by regularly, so you can take either the #10 or the #11.  Rooms are clean, the pool area is nice although we never used it.  There's a bar and restaurant downstairs, and you can get a fridge in your room if you ask the front desk.  The hotel is right next to the freeway so there is some noise, but we couldn't hear it from inside the room.  Right across the street there's a Taco Bell and a gas station.  They have lots of parking but it is $10/night.  We would stay here again on the next trip, it's a decent hotel for the price and I'm betting it's better quality than some of the hotels right across the street from Disney.  The only
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to know you found Hotel Menage to be a good value for the price paid. Your comments and feedback are appreciated, and we look forward to hosting you during your next trip to Disneyland. Warm Regards,  Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Our stay at the Hotel Menage was unplanned! We were in town for a CIF sporting event, and the staff was more than accomodating to a large group of us- we asked for 6 rooms on a fri evenin/ early morning @1 am , and we recieved them. A HUGE plus was the fact that the pool and jacuuzi had no closure time, excellent for a group of HS boys who had just wrestled for 14+hours!! The rooms were clean, room service superb.  Couldnt have asked for a better place to stay. We liked it so much, we will be back, for a trip to disneyland, which this hotel was only minutes away, BUT away from the craziness of a huge resort ! Another big + . Thank You staff at Hotel Menage for a nice stay!
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear of your happiness with your stay at Hotel Menage! It was a pleasure to host you and your team, and we look forward to hosting you during your next trip to Anaheim! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I take my family of 4 to Disneyland at least twice a year, so I have experienced many of the Disneyland area hotels. Some nice, others not so nice!  We discovered the Menage and have not stayed at another hotel since!! It is a short walk to Disneyland and that in itself is worth staying here! (those of you who have dealt with trying to get a tram back to the parking garage after the fireworks with a child who is asleep and bags of souvenirs know what I am talking about!!) Yes, there are closer hotels to the park but none are a better overall deal!!  The rooms are very nice! Clean carpet, VERY comfortable beds! Very clean rooms! I will admit with the door open the freeway can be very loud but much to my surprise as soon as I closed the door, freeway noise gone!!  The staff at the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Average hotel with rooms that need a reno. We had a room that faced the freeway and was near the service area. They had construction (sawing and hammering) going on until 10:30 pm. They only stopped when we complained. We have two small children that go to sleep before 9pm so this was especially disturbing. Overall the rooms are a bit dated. The lounge area and pool are very nice and the staff are friendly. For these reasons, I would rate the hotel a 3. This my second stay at this hotel and I don't think I will return for my third. There are hotels closer to Disneyland at similar pricing in which you could come and go from the park. This hotel was a bit far to do that with small children.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post a review of your stay with us. I'd like to personally apologize for the construction noise going too late during one of the nights you stayed; the project has since been completed. Thank you for the compliments to our friendly staff.. we hope to have the opportunity to host you and your family again. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Convenient pet-friendly hotel close to all attractions and near "The Ranch"
Summary: With very short notice we were able to get a reservation in a dog-friendly, ground-level room. The room was clean a d the staff was pleasant. They charge for parking and we were not able to use the hot-tub or pool due to a special event and it was quite loud as the hotel is so close to the freeway. Overall it was a nice experience!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a great place to stay for an anniversery trip.  Excellent value and very clean.  The room was very spacious and comfortable.  It was a very nice 10 minute walk to the park.  The freeway is noisy, especially during the day but you are gone all day.  The rooms do a decent job of lowering the noise level, especially if you are on the first or second level.  The staff was very friendly and accomodating.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is THE place to stay with your family while visiting Disneyland. The best bang for your buck, lovely accommodations, restaurant and bar, pool and within WALKING distance to Disneyland and California Adventure. The staff is incredibly helpful, friendly and kind; especially and exceptional young lady named Grace. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to reduce their travel and accommodations costs but still impress their family with a more glamorous property! COme join the fun! Corey and Family
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel many times, and am staying again valentines 2013. Every time my girlfriend and I have stayed here, we stay in the North American Suite. Beautiful, nice, clean and the biggest suite they have. We stayed in a normal room once and even that was nice for the price.   This hotel is one of the ones I will and have stayed at with no questions at all. Even friends that need a hotel in Orange County, I tell them to come here!!!   Stay here!!! It's per friendly too!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I got married at Hotel Menage August 11, 2012. The Hotel was very accommodating  with all of our needs. They were able to set up a room block for our guests that chose to stay the night at the hotel for a wonderful discounted price. My husband and I got upgraded to a suite and the room was lovely; big and spacious!  We also had our rehearsal dinner at the Hotel. The food was GREAT!!! We had an amazing time. The only negative thing would be that the air-conditioning was not working properly on our Big Day (which was a very hot day).  Thanks Maria for working with us and we appreciate everything you have done!!!
