Summary: i'm from arizona and i haven't been to disneyland since i was a little tike. i am now 25 and wanted to experience adult disney. this place has bars everywhere, the staff is friendly, and security goes ABOVE AND BEYOND to ensure your safety and comfort. don't go to disney without staying here! this place is so classy we're forced to call it dapper. if you need help with anything? ask for earl. he is the DUDE! enjoy your stay! AMERICA!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and compliments! We are happy to hear you and your daughter enjoyed your stay, and we hope to host you next time you return to the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland at quarter of the price.
Summary: My family and I (a daughter of 9) stayed at Hotel Menage for 3 nights as from 22 November 2012.  Because we were doing a round the world trip we did not want the big costs of staying inside Disneyland.  This hotel is perfect.  A daily shuttle for around $12USD was okay or you coud walk which is an easy 7 minutes.  Excellent view of the Fireworks at night and a real pleasant stay.  Just remember if you are only staying for Disneyland then a good nights sleep is what this Hotel offers.  Staff where more than helpful, clean rooms and great service.  Restaurant food is substantial and breakfast is more than adequate for a great day ahead of you in Disneyland.  The staff were so helpful and friendly.  You can save money by staying here because the costs of the bigger Hotels inside
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I took our teenagers to Disneyland for the first time last summer and I am so glad we chose this location to stay.  The pool was absolutely wonderful and the hot tub was fantastic after a long day on our feet.  A few nights instead of staying late in the park we watched the firework show from the pool and that was just amazing.  You're not stuck in the middle of thousands of people elbow to elbow and it's such a treat!  Plenty of room around the pool - or in it - to watch.  The front desk people are so helpful and we didn't have an issue at all getting any info we needed.  We bought really reasonable bus passes after the first day of walking to the park and I would highly recommend that.  You actually can walk it in about 10-15 minutes but after a long day at the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: First Stay at Hotel Menage for our Disneyland trip
Summary: I have stayed in many hotels in Anaheim area and I was a little disappointed with this hotel. I gave it higher reviews because Housekeeping was wonderful, front desk was wonderful so over all customer service was awesome. Things I didn't like so much: I never stayed at a hotel that couldn't provide two cribs for my twins. I understand they run low but never had this problem. That was a struggle. I don't like the fact you have to pay for parking and pay for the ART to Disneyland. Although you can walk..... when you have a double stroller, back pack etc its not easy and not to safe crossing the freeway entrance and exit on the overpass. Last the rooms seem updated in furniture but bathroom need some updating as well as the paint in the room. Shower water was never hot enough but
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.Your compliments to the housekeeping and front desk staff have been passed along and are very much appreciated.  I apologize that your guest room was not in an ideal location in the hotel; we do our best to place our guests staying multiple nights in the more quiet locations of the property. Parking fees are common in most resort locations, and we have priced our parking fees to be competitive for the Anaheim area - $10 self parking, $12 valet. The ART shuttle is a separate business, not associated with Hotel Menage. They do maintain a very convenient stop right outside our front doors, and the cost seems fair for the service they offer - $5 adults, $2 children, for all day use around the city. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again; please contact us directly to ensure a room in a quieter area of the hotel. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: hotel menage in anaheim ca. is the best this our 3rd time staying there. The kids love going there they like it better than disneyland. lol. Its right off the freeway and you can walk to everything, we gt to leave our car at the hotel and walk to disneyland the next day the kids had so much, it was their first time during the christmas season, they had a blast.  The kids love to stay there, the pools are heated all night, thry have great service, great breakfast, and hook you up with good deals. There are restaurants within walking distance even downtown disney is walking disatnce. Looking forward to going back again soon.  sincerly, the aguirre family

Summary Heading: Awesom place to stay for kids and adults!!
Summary: Friendly and very helpful staff, always willing to help out with even the smallest things!! Will never stay anywhere else on our Disneyland vacations!! And great rates to boot!! Great bar great food pool is amazing and property is very clean.

Summary: We made our reservation just a few days before our stay due to some changes in our plans but still got an excellent rate for a Hotel near Disneyland park. The room was really cool, with modern furniture and nice size TV. Only thing I thought was missing was a small refridgerator would have been nice to have. They have a great "Happy Hour" that is kid friendly. My favorites though have to be the outside area around the year round HEATED pool and jacuzzi. It has a realy Island feel, with music playing and a bar area. Almost feels like you are in the south Pacific. Be sure to go swimming at night and depending on what time of year you are staying, watch the Disneyland fireworks from the pool or even your room door. Hotel Menage has the BEST view for watching them outside of the
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear your family loved our hotel, pool area, and amenities. Thank you for your review and feedback, and we look forward to seeing you next time. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Had read mixed reviews about the Hotel Menage so I was a bit apprehensive about what to expect. Well, I should know better, don't believe everything you read! I was most impressed. From the moment I arrived, felt very welcomed by the doormen. The checkin was very efficient and luckily for me, at 9am and after a 14hr flight, it was great that my room was ready. I had booked a superior room with a kind bed. Although I was travelling by myself, found the room to be huge. A sofa bed was included. I had no problem with the wash basin being located outside of the bathroom. It was between the bathroom and the (open) but smallish hanging wardrobe. I had read some negative comments about this. I can't see what the big deal is. Bathroom itself is small. It has a shower over bath, with a

Summary Heading: Friendly staff , good food , relax and watch disneyland's fireworks from pool side or balcony !
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Ménage! Very friendly staff .  Looking forward to staying there when its warmer to enjoy the pool! Can get a bit noisy with the free way bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper .

Summary: This hotel is amazing I enjoyed my stay so much the staff is great and respectful. I saw a homeless guy come in at midnight and the security drew was on top of it to have him leaving the property with the most respect and with out causing a problem he was polite and professional about it I loved my stay will be back for sure.

Summary: My daughter and I stayed here for seven nights, we arrived real late at 1am was checked in super fast, we were hungry and guy at reception offered to get the security guard to grab us some McDonalds for dinner at 1.30am!!!!  He wouldn't  take a tip or let me offer to buy him a meal even delivered to our room. Awesome service........  The rooms were nice and big and staff very friendly and helpful.  Only 10 mins walk from Disney or you can catch the bus which stops out front every 20 mins.  Nice big pool and spa didn't hear the road noise at night time.  Can see Disney fireworks every night which is cool.  Would defiantly stay here again and tell my friends to stay here. Key staff were young girl at reception, with unusual name really helpful and night reception guy and security

Summary: Very nice place to stay!  Arrived SUPER early and Sureya was MORE then gracious to help us get into our room.  (much different then the girl that started checking us in )  She was beyond honest about another room that she knew we would not prefer and even allowed us to go up and check and see it first.  She is top notch and has fantastic customer service skills!  Wish we had been able to stay longer to enjoy some of the amenities the hotel had to offer.  If we ever go back I would stay there again!

Summary: I was not pleased with this hotel. The room that we got was very noisy because it was located in front of the service elevator so every time the elevator opened, a very annoying ring sound was heard. In addition, the hotel is very close to the freeway and we could hear the freeway all night. We asked the second night to be moved to another room and the receptionist agreed to give us one of the rooms not facing the freeway. Apart from the noise, the rooms were small and bathrooms very average. We booked this hotel for a Disney trip with my family. There was a wedding going on at the hotel and many parties. It was not exactly my ideal family friendly hotel. In addition, there is a shuttle to Disney from the hotel but it takes a long time because the shuttle goes to several hotels
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review of your recent stay. I am very sorry to hear that your stay was less than comfortable due to the location of your room. Summary: I'm going to keep this short. We stayed here last Spring and will be going back next month. It is an unbeatable value, easy location, great food (and amazing happy hour specials). They are even dog friendly! The rooms are modern and classy (not amazing but really nice). It is a bit loud but we were right by the pool (bring ear plugs if your a light sleeper like me). It was nice because there was a mix of a fun (20s-30s) crowd and families. Since we have a young child, it worked well because it was a 10 minute walk to the park but you could also shuttle.  And you can watch the fireworks from the bar, or in our case our bedroom window. That was great for us (although they are loud from that close- our kid slept through them and we were able to enjoy them while the little one
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review of your last stay. We are thrilled you enjoyed your visit, and we look forward to your return next month! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Hotel Menage is a quaint, botique hotel located within walking distance to Disneyland. From the balcony outside our door, we had an awesome view of the fireworks! The rooms were comfortable and had all the necessary ammenities.  The bar/restaurant offers an excellent happy hour including drinks and appetizers. Everything was fantastic!  The staff provided excellent service, and although we didnt use the pool; it looked like many families were enjoying it.  It's a beautiful little property- perfect for families and business travelers alike.

Summary: Overall, the Hotel Menage was pretty decent.  It was a great location for going to Disneyland, never had to take the shuttle, just walked there.  We had a room overlooking the pool area and had a fantastic view for the fireworks every night of our stay.    The rooms were pretty good.  They were clean and a nice size.  Most of the staff were friendly and helpful.  Watch out though, there is one front desk female agent who works in the mornings who is a real B#$^H!

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights whilst visiting Disneyland and its a great location. When we arrived we enjoyed happy hour and food around the pool early evening and stayed put until 9pm when the fireworks started at Disney and we had a perfect view. The rooms are large and clean and well /tastefully furnished. We had breakfast at the hotel which was tasty. The shuttle to Disney is regular and reasonable in price. The pool area is nice and has plenty of sun beds.

Summary: An average hotel that is located close to Disneyland.  It's rooms are poorly lit and the edge of the bed (in dark wood) extends 15 cm from the end of the mattress. I hit its edge several times in my stay and fractured my little toe. Our friends and ourselves resorted to wrapping the white bed towels around the edge so that it's sharp edge could be seen and avoided.  Be warned. The door key consistently would not work and maintenance, after a week's sta,y had done nothing about it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback. I am so sorry to hear about your injured toes from the platform bed in your guest room. We are currently working on a solution to pad the corners of the platform beds, and hope to have this resolved shortly. Your candid comments are appreciated.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: My girlfriend and I stay at this hotel EVERY time we go to Disneyland. It is a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, but if you have little ones or don't want to walk they also have a shuttle as well. It is a little bit more expensive than other hotel/motels in the area, but you get what you pay for! The rooms are really nice-big flat screen tvs, nice decor, comfy beds, and decent sized bathroom. They don't come with mini fridges, but as long as they're not all taken you can call the front desk for one at no charge. I read some other reviews about noise problems from the pool area-I've never personally experienced that but granted I usually don't get back to the room until after the park closes so it's usually pretty calm there by that time. The pool and hot tub are nice, there's a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We truly appreciate your loyalty and look forward to continuing to host you and your family when you return to Disneyland. Thank you so much for your kind words. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Excellent service, but very disappointing property
Summary: We stayed at Hotel Menage over the Christmas holiday and were very excited, as my husband and I truly enjoy boutique properties and felt lucky to find one so close to Disneyland. The reservation process was wonderful and Grace was very helpful in booking our stay. Patrick and Dani were very friendly when we arrived and check in went well. We found the lobby to be lovely, but the elevator seemed out of place and very old, as did the lobby restrooms. We overlooked this and hoped the room would be more on par with the service. Unfortunately, that was not the case. The room we stayed in was very dark, the furniture was nicked and smudged-nothing appeared clean, the carpet was snagged in many areas and coming up at the entrance to the bathroom, the in-room dining menu and the guide
Manager Response: Thank you for posting feedback about your stay. Your compliments to the front desk and reservations staff are appreciated and have been passed on to them. Summary: After reading previous reviews, I was worried.  Yes the pool-side music is loud (to drown out the traffic noise), but if you call the front desk they will turn it down after 9:00 p.m.  Also, the room fan helps mask the noise of traffic and boisterous late-night guests.  The Disney fireworks are truly spectacular and we enjoyed them every night at 9:30.  Warning:  no fridge or microwave in the room (we brought our own).  The staff was generally responsive to any requests.  The best thing about this hotel is the location.  We walked to Disneyland every day (family with teens) and it was 1/2 mile.  We didn't find the freeway bridge difficult like some, and honestly the hotel is as close as the Mickey and Friends parking garage, but only costs $10/day rather than $15.  Really

Summary: Thankyou menage! We were just in from Australia and could not have chosen a better place to stay!! The door bolt on our room was missing two screws and the shower head leaked through the Teflon tape (we did not report this to the staff as we were preoccupied). The nice part of this hotel is the proximity to Disneyland. The first night we watched the amazing fireworks show from the pool area with the kids. It was spectacular and well worth watching from the venue we had. The breakfast buffet is overpriced but filling. The hotel sells

Summary: I have yet to stay at the hotel, but the positive attitude of the desk clerk when price searching made me me want to book a room. Just by an over the phone conversation i would recommend this hotel. The desk clerk Patrick, was VERY helpful on getting me the best possible rate for my time of stay. Very pleased.

Summary: this is a well hidden gem for a stay close to Disneyland...large hotel with a boutique feel.  friendly and helpful staff, beautiful lobby, nice updated rooms, good amenities, and a fabulous tike bar at the nice pool.  you don't get that "overrun with children" feel as you do with the other hotels in the area, and it is quiet. Manager Response: none

Summary: I was lucky enough to win a bid to this property on Sky Auction and we loved our stay!  We are in Anaheim every few months for some Disneyland and beach time and it seems like we stay in a different hotel each time.so this was our first time at this property.  We were looking forward to trying out the pool and tiki bar and viewing the fireworks from the property, as well as the proximity of the hotel to Disneyland and the 5 freeway.  Since my husband smokes, I usually try to find a  hotel room with easy access to an outdoor area.  I asked for a room on the first floor facing the pool area and it was awesome!  There are so many seating options in the groups of furniture placed around the outside, a great pool and jacuzzi opened all night, and the fabulous tiki bar and music, it
Manager Response: We are thrilled you were able to fully enjoy your recent stay with us! Thank you for the nice compliments, they have been passed on the the appropriate departments. We look forward to hosting you again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Clean with a good bed, but essentially simply a motor inn. Good in-room dining (quality was exceptional) and friendly staff on check-in and out. The property is not "flash" but it is functional and affordbale for families wanting something very near Disney (about a 2 min drive).
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review of your recent stay. We are a little surprised to hear your opinion of our hotel as a "motor inn," as we offer in-room dining, a large lobby bar and lounge, a full service restaurant, valet parking, and a beautiful tropical pool area open 24hrs. I have passed your compliments regarding in-room dining, room cleanliness, and the friendliness of our front desk staff. We appreciate your feedback. I hope you have a happy holiday season!Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Hotel is located walking distance to Disneyland. Great price for the amenities including 24 hour pool in a gorgeous setting. Right across the street from Starbucks was a plus too. Expect some freeway noise, but it is definitely more background noise. Hotel was clean and simply decorated. Ask for a room away from the elevators as they are quite loud.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed here twice now and absolutely love this place. The pool bar is fantastic it feels like you are in a fancy location but you are really just in Anaheim. At night you can see the Disneyland fireworks from there pool. It's awesome. All the staff is ultra friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We travelled with 3 adult children and stayed at the Hotel Menage for 2 nights and we loved everything about it.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean and beds very comfortable.   I actually booked this hotel based on the pictures of the outdoor areas and it did not disappoint.  It was great after a long day a Disneyland to go back to the Hotel and hang out by the pool area.  Yes there is traffic noise from the highway but the wonderful evening spent out by the pool far outweighed that.  There is a wonderful comfy sitting area outside where we brought our own drinks and were delivered an amazing dinner of short ribs.  As I said the staff were wonderful and bent over backwards to make our stay a great one.  Don't miss the breakfast buffet.  We did not
Manager Response: Dear Victoria91, Thank you for posting a review of your experience! We are thrilled you enjoyed our hotel, pool, and restaurant/bar. Your compliments are appreciated, and the tip about a cab to Disneyland is very helpful to other guests! We hope to host you again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Nice location and lots of parking.  Although renovated, a little tired and felt dirty.
Summary: Great location in Anaheim.  You get to see the fireworks from the balcony or pool.  It is a timeshare as well, so it is a little disjointed.  Rooms aren't in great shape but were modernized at one point.  Taps are a little leaky, carpet has some staining near the washrooms, and if you book for 2 + 2 kids, you get a queen sofa + a king.  Two queens is an upgrade of $20/night.  Parking is $10/night which is reasonable as it is cordoned off from the visitor parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and feedback. I have passed your comments regarding the maintenance issues on to our maintenance manager so they may be addressed accordingly.   I would like to clarify - Hotel Menage is not affiliated with any timeshare company. We do lease office space on our property to Shell Vacations, but we are not part of their timeshare collection. I'm sorry for any confusion. Hotel Menage is an independent hotel under the ownership and management of Casa Resorts, Inc. Thanks again for your candid comments and feedback.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Awesome Location, great service and amazing rooms!
Summary: We stayed here in July 2012 and We loved staying at Hotel Menage! It is so close to Disneyland, we walked there and it took at the most 10 minutes to get there.  You can see the Disneyland fireworks every night sitting by or in the pool!  The staff were so friendly and helpful, they gave us advice on how to get to places, what time to leave and were awesome at arranging transportation for us.  We really enjoyed the acoustic band that played one of the nights we were there, we were heading to our room after watching the fireworks and they were playing in the Lobby bar, and we spent the rest of the night listening and enjoying the band!  The rooms were great, super clean, spacious and really comfortable!  The only issue we had was the noise from traffic, but it wasn't enough noise
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are thrilled to know you enjoyed your stay. Your compliments to the front desk staff have been passed along and are greatly appreciated.  We wish you happy travels, and hope to see you again if you return to the Anaheim area! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary: Dark lighting and nice beding do not make a boutique hotel.  Good points:  Close to Disneyland and the interstate Great views of the disney fireworks from the pool  Bad points  Feels like a prison block. Dark passageways made me feel unsafe Close to the interstate, constant traffic noise in our room at least. Some bloke loading a van under our bedroom window at 6am Dispite leaving our curtains closed coming home each night to our curtains wide open and lights on so that any would be thief could see there was no one in the room
Manager Response: I must say, I was very surprised to read your review of our hotel - I've never heard Hotel Menage described as a prison block before! I'm so sorry about the negative impression and feeling you left with. We appreciate your honesty in stating your opinion, and will be addressing your comments in depth during our next management meeting. Kind Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary: Nice staff, especially the front desk men, girls were a bit curt and difficult to understand. Rooms clean, bed comfortable, not keen on shower in bath!! No fridge no safe in room, noise bad from traffic, hotel lighting poor, could not read menu in restaurant, which was temporarily in the foyer at the time of our stay. Tired furniture, need maintainance to paintwork, fittings etc. wifi did not work on the 5th floor, had to get password from staff, 1st password given didn't work. Not much round the hotel, ART was fantastic (transport) took us to a few places. But would stay nearer  to Disneyland next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your feedback. I'm glad to hear that you appreciated our friendly front desk staff, our clean rooms and comfortable beds.  I apologize that other aspects of our hotel were not up to your expectations. We are constantly striving to improve our property, which is why the restaurant was temporarily relocated to the lobby at the time of your stay. We have recently completed a full renovation of our restaurant, American Tavern, and it is now open for business again. Our WiFi internet is complimentary, but it's true, you must use a password to gain access, as it is only for guest use. We also have refrigerators available on request basis. Thank you for mentioning the things you noticed needing attention. I have forwarded your review to our maintenance manager, and we will be taking immediate action on your notes. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Great location but a couple of issues....
Summary: We stayed at Hotel Menage on October 12, 2012 for 2 nights.  We picked this location after having reservations at a different hotel that was not up to par.  We called their main number and scored a same day reservation.  Everyone at the front desk was great. There was a slight mix up but it was easily corrected.  The room was clean and very up to date.  The location was close enough to Disneyland that we walked between the hotel and the park. It was 15-20 walk to the park.   Even though we had to cross over an expressway, I didn't find the walk concerning at all. The only issues that we had were the noise from the expressway and some sort of construction that was happening at the hotel.  I would recommend this hotel. The staff was very friendly and made us feel very welcome.  I
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for our honeymoon in September and had an amazing time. We contacted the hotel via facebook to say it was our honeymoon and were given a room with a pool view, on our first night a complimentary bottle of bubbly was brought to the room within 15 min of arriving, a really nice personal touch. It was next to the freeway but we didn't hear a thing once the door was closed. The restaurant was closed during our visit but the limited menu served in the bar was still very good. We used the shuttle everyday to Disney which was cheap and easy to use. Pool area was lovely and great for relaxing in the evening, cocktails were fab. Would def stay here again if we visit Anaheim and would recommend!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Boutique Hotel has Mixed Bouquet of Offerings
Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Menage from Nov 3 - 10th, 2012.  The goal of our vacation was to have time away from the SNOW of Alberta, have fun at Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm, and have some fun hotel, sun and pool time with our two small children, ages 4 and 2.  We got two adjoining rooms on the 5th floor, poolside.  This hotel offers a fantastic location relative to Disneyland.  From door to door, it took us 12 minutes to WALK to Disneyland, and that's pushing a double stroller.  Across the street, minutes awayl, are quick and easy places to grab breakfast on your way into the park - McDonald's, IHOP, Starbucks, etc.  So in terms of location, it's truly prime.  They offer self and valet parking.  We chose valet for the extra $14 for the week.  They are FANTASTIC.  The bell hops
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a candid and detailed review of your recent stay. I'm so happy to hear that your experience with our valet staff and housekeeping staff was exceptional! Your comments have been passed along, and are very much appreciated. We are also glad to know that you appreciated our convenient location to Disneyland, our pool bar, and the pool grounds.  Your concerns about our pool/jacuzzi have been addressed. I completely understand your concern for the sanitary condition of the pool and jacuzzi, and appreciate you writing us an email during your stay. This allowed us to address the problem immediately, and I'm happy to inform you we have contracted a new pool maintenance company, replaced filters, and diligently have the pool cleaned twice daily. A hotel pool and jacuzzi can take some abuse, as so many guests use it throughout the day and night... Thank you for alerting the right people so we could take the steps to correct the situation. Thank you again for your valuable feedback!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Very disappointed. Needs a lot of maintence
Summary: In veiwing this site and seeing so many positive remarks I chose this hotel for myself and staff. The hotel could be great, but maintence and general look of hotel common areas are very out dated. It is clean but no maintence has been done for a while, and I found the staff not to be very accomodating at all. I had a pair of shoes stolen from beside the pool (old ones) strange. The pool bar staff never smiled nor made you feel comfortable, The pool was a huge plus, very warm and staying open late which became a great social area where to meet poeple, Spa is way too hot. no one could sit in. Over all un friendly staff, outdated reception and common areas I was disappointed. We had stayed in another local hotel for less money closer to disneyland only 2 weeks prior and I was much
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Your comments regarding maintenance are being reviewed and addressed. I also appreciate you bringing your thoughts and concerns about general service to our attention; we will be re-focusing our attention to bring back the great customer service we have always been known for. Thanks again for your candid feedback. Your thoughts and opinions are very important to us as we strive to continually improve our property and service. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Service Hotel Menage

Summary: Stayed here with our 8 year old daughter for a Disneyland birthday trip for 3 nights. Pros: - Location 15 min walk [across the 5 freeway] to Disneyland - Can buy tickets @ the hotel (retail price) - Shuttle to Disneyland every 30 mins ($5/per person/ per day) - Free wifi (but it messed up my tablet) - Pool and 2 bar (inside and out) - Allows pets ($25/night) - Good parking (mandatory $10-12/night) Cons: - Only 1 person checking ppl in at 3:30pm (checkin is @ 3pm) took me 20 minutes - They placed us in a room that didn't have any carpet and the room was really cold (rm 117) - Found HAIR in our bed (on the bed sheet under the comforter) - There is a SINGLE CUP coffee dispenser in the room and when i first used it, it exploded with steam and I almost got burned~! - Called front
Manager Response: Dear stonegyrl, Thank you for your comprehensive review of your recent experience at our hotel. I apologize for the seemingly lackadaisical service you experienced during your stay. Your comments have been passed on to the appropriate departments for review and will be addressed accordingly.  Your comments about the jacuzzi have been taken very seriously - a new pool maintenance company has been hired and we have doubled the cleaning schedule to twice daily; morning and night. Thank you for bringing this to my attention. We feel our prices for the buffet breakfast are quite reasonable, as most hotels in this area charge double for a mere continental breakfast. We offer a full hot breakfast buffet for $12.95/adult, $8.95 for children. We regret that you had an unsatisfactory experience, and hope that you will find a hotel that more closely suits you and your family. Kind Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary: The Menage Hotel/Motel was fine. We got a room on the inside, away from the freeway. We could still hear traffic but the noise was not objectionable.   It was cool. We turned on the heater but quickly turned it off as it smelled like burnt hair.   I had requested a room for four people with two double beds. We got one king sized bed and a fold out couch that was lumpy.  The pool was nice for the girls. I sat at the outside bar and had a glass of wine as the girls swam. I felt compelled to stay until our girls were finished swimming ( ages 14 and 16) as a few people at the bar had had too much to drink.  It was ok...we stayed in November when the hotel was not full. I would not want to stay there in summer.  It was close to Disneyland so we were able to save the Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent 6 nights here, rooms are nice and big with good amenities. Staff were always helpful and friendly - the hotel is a 10 minute walk to Disneyland or you can get the shuttle (easy to get the bus and concierge is always happy to help). The hotel is right next to the I5 freeway so can be noisy walking to your room but no issues in the room. It was good value and we would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A good hotel right next to Disney
Summary: I stayed at this hotel Friday-Monday for the Harry Potter Day at Disneyland (unofficial) weekend. I checked in around 5pm on Friday and checked out at 5am on Monday. I was travelling alone and had one dog with me.  I read the reviews on here before hand to get an idea of what to expect and I kept seeing that the pool area was quite busy and loud, so I requested a room on the first floor right next to and facing the parking lot. The room also faces the street, but I could not here any traffic. I could sometimes here a car door closing and people walking by, but nothing that woke me up (and I am a light sleeper).  The room (this may be different for non-dog rooms) was fantastic. The floor was a brown-gold concrete that had wonderful character (small cracks and such)...I thought I
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review and feedback! I'm glad to know you enjoyed your guest room and that you found it clean, quiet and convenient for your and your pup :) Your comments about the room service you ordered are appreciated, and have been passed along to the restaurant staff and management for improvement. Thank you for letting us know about your experience at the pool bar. Service such as the bartender offered is unacceptable, and we are taking this matter up with all service staff in the bar/restaurant. Please accept my apologies for the wait. We do charge for parking at our hotel, which is quite standard for all hotels in the Anaheim area, especially. Our parking fee - $10 self, $12 valet - is typical, if not lower, than most hotels in the area. Thanks again for your review! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Just stayed at The Menage on the eve of Nov 2nd. The accomadations are really pretty nice. We did not get the best rate available, but nevertheless  the room was very clean and well appointed with many convienances. BUT!, the noise factor though was absolutley terrible!!!! The loaction is very close to Disneyland, and situated just off Katella. and the highway. Very busy street noise at all hours of the night. So if, your a light sleeper, watchout. Not sure if the hoteliers have looked into new windows, doors, and sound boarded wall improvments,  but it could really help this location alot!!!! Otherwise the late night bar inside & out was very nice, maybe on weekends keep the late night menu going a little longer? The food was good! Service very nice! Im a light sleeper though,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I'm so sorry to know that you were unable to sleep well due to road noise. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed all the other aspects of the hotel, and appreciate your suggestions for improvement. We have already installed double-paned windows, but will definitely have maintenance check the insulating strips around the guest room doors. Thanks again for your feedback! Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary: We stayed here for a week in mid October. Our room was spacious and very clean. The pool area was great! Our only complaint would be they need a bigger hot tub or another one. It was very popular. Great view of the fireworks every evening. We enjoyed the buffet style breakfast, and thought it was a pretty good value @ $12.95 each. You can walk to Disneyland which is about 10 minutes away, or there is a shuttle that comes by every 20 minutes or so. You can purchase 3 or 5 day passes for the shuttle at a reasonable cost. The staff were friendly, happy and very helpful when ever we had any questions. We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: We are thrilled to know you enjoyed your stay. Your comments are very much appreciated, and we look forward to hosting you again soon!

Summary Heading: Everything you need close to Disneyland
Summary: I stayed at the Menage in April for two nights as it looked good on the Website and was close to Disneyland. Although it is next to the freeway, I did not hear any noise. The room was very modern, spotlessly clean and comfortable. It was about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland the first day. The second day I caught the ART shuttle which goes straight from the Hotel to Disneyland in just minutes. I found the staff at the Hotel to be very friendly and helpful. The only time I ate at the Hotel was on the morning I left. The only downside was I found getting to the room difficult. I felt they could do with better signage in the halls. Just my opinion. It is without doubt the best eggs benedict I have ever had. I would definately recommend The Menage. I felt it was excellent value for
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my review from when I stayed at the Menage back in May-June when vacaying by myself.  I stayed there for 5 nights after booking it together with Allegiant for an affordable rate and LOVED it. Though it's also a family hotel, I liked that it was very catered towards adults/couples. From the moment you step into the lobby, the light created ambiance and there were bars all around. Very classy-looking. It was the better choice compared to other hotels that are cheap and is more for family travels with screaming kids.  The concierge was very kind/friendly, I believe his name was Kent. After a bit of a long wait for some guests in front of me, he apologized when I finally reached the desk. He was very informative during my stay and helped out with a lot of shuttles,
Manager Response: We really appreciate your comprehensive review! I'm so happy to hear that you had such a pleasant experience. Your compliments to the staff have been passed along to each department. I'd also like to thank you for posting photos of your stay... this is so helpful for other potential guests who read reviews and shop hotels on Tripadvisor. Thanks again, and we wish you happy travels! Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary: Our group of 7 was impresses from the get go. We were able to check in early and when we did not care for our first set of rooms (next to the elevator). Lance changed our rooms to disneyland firework view. He was kind and aimed to please! Terrific customer service. The valets always opened the doors for us and what a nice treat for us after spending 12 - 14 hours at Disneyland. Housekeeping was amazing. Our rooms were cleaned and they took the time to arrange all of our special Disney pillow pets and stuffed toys snug on the beds. Thank you for that house keeping, what a special touch. Room service made a special order for my husband and son at 10 pm. And they loved it! Rooms are clean and quiet. We never noticed freeway noise with the door closed.
Manager Response: Thank  you for your review! We are thrilled to hear that your group enjoyed our hotel, services, and friendly staff. Your comments are very much appreciated, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you next time you return to the Anaheim area. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Service Hotel Menage

Summary: We had 6 nights here from 15 October 2012.  The hotel is a 10 min walk away from Disneyland.  There is also a shuttle which comes every 20 minutes. The room was newly renovated and was spacious, clean and comfortable. We were on the 5th floor and faced the freeway so if traffic noise affects you make sure you ask for a room away from the freeway.  We were all so tired after our busy days out that this wasn't an issue in order for us to sleep. Nice Pool and spa area great and pool is open 24/7 so a late night swim is ok. Restaurant was reasonably priced and served great hamburgers. Staff were fantastic.  Nothing was too much to ask.  Concierge were friendly and very approachable with great advice to offer on all our questions. The doormen were also very friendly and upbeat,
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at Menage several times and have previously thought it was good. I even gave it a good review before.  There were several problems this time and I will look for another hotel the next time I go to Anaheim. The receptionist wasn't very friendly when we checked in. I felt like we were bothering her or something. She went through things very fast and I really didn't catch what she was saying. I thought she mentioned the restaurant was available. We have always eaten there...but it was closed. She didn't mention the special pricing on the room service...I probably would have used it since it is kind of hard to find a good place to eat outside of the park without walking to it.  The room had no refrigerator. The elevators were not working properly. At one point, they
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I'm so sorry to hear that your most recent experience was less than satisfactory. Your comments regarding the receptionist have been heard, and we have taken action to improve guest service at the front desk.  It's true that not all our guest rooms have a mini-fridge, however, they are available on request at no charge. We encourage our guests to let us know if they need anything to help make their stay more comfortable; most requests can easily be accommodated.  The ART shuttle is not owned or operated by our hotel (Anaheim Resort Transit - www.rideart.org), however, they maintain at stop at our front door. The cost is nominal, and includes all day on/off privileges. We are also 15 minutes walking distance to the front gates of Disneyland if you prefer to save money on transportation or parking at the Park. Thank you again for your candid comments. We are so sorry to have lost you and your family as guests and wish you luck and happier travels in the future. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services Hotel Menage

Summary: Very trendy hotel. Staff is very nice. Rooms were always cleaned on time. Breakfast buffet was nice. Very pretty hotel grounds. Front row seats to firework show. Free wi-fi.  I'd stay again. Flat screen TV and huge beds. You do need to leave a $50 deposit per night during your stay but you get it back immediately upon check out--or at least I did. Cute outdoor bar that is family friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have a few complaints about our stay at Menage from Oct. 14-19.  We stayed there previously and had a good experience, but this time around there were many things wrong, and when we addressed our concerns, the manager on duty was not helpful or sympathetic.  We will NOT be returning.  First, when we arrived at 6:30 pm and went up to our room, there was someone in there, a maid, telling us the shower didn't work.  We would expect that with a check in time that late, everything would be in order, but it was not.  Second, we were disappointed the restaurant K'ya was not available.  We had enjoyed this aspect of the hotel during our previous stay and it was a main reason we chose to stay there again.  Nothing on the website or otherwise indicated it would be closed.  Third, our
Manager Response: Dear Kristin H,  I am so sorry to hear what a frustrating week you had with us, especially considering you had chosen to re-book after a previously pleasant stay.   I would like to personally apologize for the miscommunication between our housekeeping and front desk staff in allowing you and your family to check into a room which was under maintenance. As you probably understand, things can occasionally break down or go wrong in any space that gets used and abused as much as a hotel room does, however, you are absolutely right; you should not have been given keys to a guest room under maintenance. This has been discussed with the appropriate departments and I assure you we will not let this happen again.  Even though our K'ya Street-fare dining room was closed for remodeling, we still offered our full menu and dining options in our lobby seating area (just outside the dining room). Our kitchen was open for business as usual. It was only the dining room which was closed for renovation, and has since been completed and re-opened as the new American Tavern.  My apologies for the chilly pool... we must occasionally empty the pool for deep cleaning and refill it. It takes a short time to get back to temperature, but I'm sure all our guests appreciate a clean and sanitary pool when they stay with us. Also, I regret that the elevators can get uncomfortable on a hot day; luckily no one has to spend a substantial amount of time in them, as they do not have air conditioning.  The music we play around the pool area is typically turned down between 9:30 and 10pm. As with most hotels, we consider it very important to maintain a "Quiet Time" between the hours of 10pm until 8am. I'm so sorry if the music was loud later than 10pm!  Regarding the misunderstanding with the city's ART Shuttle, they have been promoting their new line, #18, on the tickets they sell, and I can see how this may have been confusing. What I can't figure out is how you ended up finding the bus #18, as this line does not pick up or drop off at Disneyland. The only lines that pick up at Hotel Menage are #10 and #11, and the bus number is clearly posted on each bus. The hotel is not responsible for any guest who gets on the wrong shuttle when leaving the park. The shuttle drivers are very knowledgeable about their stops and the Anaheim area, and are more than happy to answer any questions you may have upon boarding or riding the shuttle. There are also route maps that clearly define the shuttle stops according to bus number at every major shuttle stop around the Disneyland area. I believe our Manager on Duty acted according to hotel policy. We do not refund guests for the ART shuttle when they mistakenly board the wrong bus. I do apologize if she seemed unsympathetic to your situation - I can imagine how angry you must have been to find out the bus you were on was headed in the opposite direction of Hotel Menage, and the frustration you experienced in walking over a mile with a couple of tired, young children after a day in the park! This is definitely not the way any parent wants to conclude their day at Disneyland with their children.  We appreciate your candid comments. I feel terrible that you and your family had a bad experience at Hotel Menage, and we are truly sorry to lose your future business.  Warm Regards, Charlotte - Guest Services, Hotel Menage

Summary: The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. However, the biggest disappointment was no fridge and second the ICE COLD pool! It was quite warm outside, 90+ when we stayed but the furthest we could venture into the pool was up to our knees. The interesting visitors to the pool were enough that I did not want my kids to stay at the pool for very long. The gate to the parking lot is open to the pool area anyone can wander in.  As everyone has said the bed frames are evil and my entire family took out their shins at least once if not more during our trip.  We got a great deal on this hotel but would not pay above $90/night here we did not. It is enough of a distance from Disneyland that we will not stay here again even for a good deal. With young kids we like to leave the park
Manager Response: Dear KfamUt, Thank you for posting your review of Hotel Menage. I'm glad to hear that you and your family found our rooms to be clean and comfortable. I would like to let you know that we do offer refrigerators in our rooms on a request basis. Our pool was unfortunately a little chilly during your stay; we had just had it emptied, deep cleaned and refilled, and it does take a short time for the water to warm back up again. I apologize that it was uncomfortable, but we want our pool to be clean and sanitary for all our guests and this was just routine maintenance. I'm so sorry about the hurt shins from the platform beds... we are currently working on a solution to the hard edges, and they should be improved soon. Your feedback and comments are appreciated. We wish you happy travels.  Warm Regards, Charlotte - Guest Services

Summary: My wife and I stayed three nights here. She needed a refrigerator for her insulin and when had one in less than three minutes after calling the desk. Tony was a professional at the desk and Lance was a concerned and accomidating front desk person. This is why my wife and I stay year after year here!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Jessica went out of her way to help celebrate my wife's birthday!
Summary: My wife and daughter stayed at this hotel while visiting Disneyland.  I stayed home with our son.  I called and spoke to Jessica.  I asked Jessica if she can arrange for balloons and champagne to be delivered to my wife's room for her birthday.  Jessica said she would be happy to arrange and that it "is on the house".  Wow!  Very impressed...as was my wife when she received the nice birthday balloons and champagne the next day.  Thank you Jessica!  Ryan F.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Hotel Menage during your wife's birthday weekend at Disneyland. It was our pleasure to assist you in helping your wife have a great time in your absence. I have forwarded your appreciation to Jessica; thank you for the call-out!  Your review on TripAdvisor is very much appreciated!  Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services, Hotel Menage

Summary: Just recently went to this Hotel,  My travel agent booked our Hotel and being so far away you never know what you will get.  On our arrival the Bus boys offer to help with your bags, the first impression of the Hotel was the atmosphere of music, reception and restaurant and looking through the large glass windows into the Bar pool outside area , very modern.  I found the Hotel wonderful , rooms very comfy, clean and room service everyday. No kitchenette , or jug they do have coffee machine. Will give you a fridge if you ask for one.   We had buffet breakfast every morning , excellent . Lovely food to choose from cereal, fruit , porridge , sausage, toast, bagels, muffins, bacon, omelet, juices, tea, coffee plus more.  The service , staff all very good and very friendly. So happy
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We are so happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed our property, breakfast, and location. Your pictures are greatly appreciated, as "a picture is worth a thousand words!" Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services, Hotel Menage

Summary: check in was a breeze and so friendly! Pool bar was the best! drinks in the hottub? yes please! every employee was super friendly and cool! loved the vibe and the pool! Restutaunt wasn't finished yet, but the bar/restaurant area had sports on and great looking food! half price happy hour appitizers were a great deal! really close walk to Disneyland or a simple 5 dollar all day shuttle pass was super easy to get from the front desk! room was clean and modern!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at the Hotel Menage on 4 separate stays to go to Disneyland. The staff is friendly and quick to respond to requests. The beds are comfortable and the linens are very nice. The pool area is just beautiful. We requested a room so we could view the Disney fireworks and really enjoyed watching them from our room. There is a nice computer room where you can print of boarding passes for flightsl. The restaurant is very nice and the wait staff is incredibly friendly. We will be coming back in Jan 2013 to run in the Tinkerbell Half Marathon. Thanks Hotel Menage for a wonderful experience everytime!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review and your repeated business! We are thrilled to know that you enjoy staying with us, and we look forward to hosting you during the Tinkerbell Half-Marathon in January. Warm Regards,  The management and staff at Hotel Menage

Summary: This review is very late we stayed her June of 2011.  I just became addicted to trip advisor.  We stayed here for a week on our honeymoon.  Our room was beautiful and very well decorated, very clean.  We ate many many times in the restaurant.  This maybe my favorite restaurant EVER.  Amazing food and great prices.  Try thier iced tea it has a tropical taste too it.  After a hot day its wonderful.  The basil fries are great as well, then again no food that we tried the whole time wasnt amazing.  Great staff wonderful atmosphere.  Again dont stay anywhere but here!!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed two nights at the Hotel Menage while visiting Disneyland.  Service from valet through the check-in process was very prompt and polite.  The location is convenient to the Disney parks via a shuttle for $4.00 per person (round trip) or a 15-minute walk on a very busy street.  The hotel does not operate the shuttle – the hotel simply sells tickets for it.  Many of us stood around waiting for it longer than what felt was appropriate (50+ min}.  Although I acknowledge the “sketchy” schedule is not the fault of the hotel, it may be something to take into consideration when choosing a hotel specifically to visit Disneyland.  There is a $12 fee for valet parking and a $10 fee for self-park.  Although the hotel website states you can purchase tickets to the Disney
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for a two nights on our recent trip to Disneyland. We had a king room that was nice and spacious. The bed was a little firm for me, but there were plenty of pillows and the linens were nice. The towels were fluffy too. The pool area is large and it is open 24 hours a day, which is nice for a late night swim after returning from Disneyland.   The onsite restaurant had good food, lots of choices. The drinks from the bar were pretty good too, but wait for happy hour to get a deal on some drinks ($5 each instead of $8-9 each).  Most of the staff was pretty good. We had excellent service in the onsite restaurant for dinner one evening and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful with purchasing ART tickets. The bar staff were ok. They weren't rude,
Manager Response: We appreciate your review and pictures! I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and have passed your compliments on to our front desk and restaurant staff. Thanks again for your comments, we hope to host you again soon!

Summary: Firstly the good things - Rooms are spacious, pool area is lovely, view to Disneyland fireworks display is awesome.  Beds really comfortable, towels lovely and fluffy, very large flat screen TV.  Laundry facilities pretty reasonable ($1.50 for washer, $1 for dryer).  Easy access to ART shuttle which takes you to Disneyland.  Starbucks, good Foodmart at Petrol Station and Taco Bell just across the road - would suggest healthy eating options are good here.  Front desk staff excellent and really, really helpful.  Parking easy to get to and access to the I5 freeway only about 50 metres away either direction. However, housekeeping pretty random - sometimes bath mat, sometimes face cloth, sometimes tissues changed etc.  Staff behind the main bar and housekeeping don't speak much
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving us such a nice and detailed review of your recent stay! Your feedback and comments are appreciated, and we hope to host you again should you return to the Anaheim area.

Summary: Stayed here just after the Labour Day Long weekend for 3 nights with another couple. Our first night was a miss as we were given a room right beside the freeway, so I wasn't able to catch any zzz's. But when we told the front desk they moved us to two very nice rooms. The pool area is very nice, chairs are comfortable and very relaxing almost spa like with the waterfall. I was able to lounge in the chairs on my last day and I wished I had not waited so long. Even with the freeway on the otherside of the wall it was pretty nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel makes a good impression from the lobby.  It's really modern and loung-y.  We arrived late on a Friday night and there was live music in the bar and it was really lively in the lobby and bar and pool area.  The Disneyland fireworks went off right over the pool  which was really cool.  Our check in was a little "iffy" in the beginning as I had got our room from BookIt and they had only one reservation but they were finally able to find the other as the problem was a spelling error. Our room was adequate, but it wasn't equal to the impression the lobby made. It has a motel feel once you exit off the elevator, the rooms face outside. The room was clean but nothing special.  In the middle of the night we we awoke to someone banging on our door yelling, "Open the f****g
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I'm glad you were able to enjoy our lobby, live music, restaurant, and the fireworks from our pool during your stay. I am so sorry to hear that another guest disturbed your sleep (I'm sure they were mistaking your room for theirs). An unfortunate possibility of traveling and staying in any hotel is the potential other hotel guests have of impacting one's experience. I completely understand your frustration and bewilderment in the middle of the night. Please know we have a full time security guard who is always ready and prepared to attend to any guest needs; he just needs to be notified of your complaint.

Summary Heading: Nice lil place next to Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here for 4 days with the family on a Disneyland trip. The lobby and lounge is nice. The pool and jacuzzi is nice. I got a standard two queen bed room. The room layout is similar to a motel 6 room but slightly bigger and decorated. Breakfast was a buffet and they provide more than you can eat. Dinner was a little spendy for the amount of food you get. I only ate dinner once while I was there. The hotel is close to Disney but you will still want to take a shuttle. I tried walking it both ways the first day and you have to cross a freeway on and off ramp. Reconsider if you have kids. The price of everything is fairly expensive but that's no secret. Nice place overall.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Better than the reviews had predicted!
Summary: I booked our stay through Hotwire and was freaked out after I saw the reviews.  This hotel ended up being lovely and perfect for our 3 night stay.  Itt is not a kiddie hotel like right out front of Disney, but perfect if you just want a place to sleep/swim.  Our friends were staying right across from Disney/Camelot Inn and it is just as crazy there.  Yeah, we heard traffic, but it is everywhere there.   The hotel staff let us extend our check out time so we could shower after the pool and not rush.  I would come here again if we were here just for Disney.  It is a quick walk or use the ART shuttle which was easy and dropped us off right in front of Disney.  The beds were comfortable, the breakfast brunch $12/person, was decent, parking $10 in the hotel lot.   It is a lot
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear how pleasantly surprised you were with our hotel! Your comments and compliments are very much appreciated, and we look forward to hosting you again. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Disney good neighbor hotel, not really a family hotel. This is for the person/people who love disney but don't want to have to deal with children after a day at the park. Is about 10-15 min walk to main gate. ART busing available. Is next to the Freeway but rooms have double paned glass so rooms not noisey. If you can try to book one of the suites. Amazing. Dining area was under renovations and a new Chef has been brought on. Pool area was nice and again more for adults. enjoy the fireworks poolside.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have travelled extensivley and normally stay in the big chain hotels where we have found most recently to be to impersonal and predictable. Our stay at the Menage for a week was delightful the staff at this hotel were friendly and welcoming and all of our requests were met with a warm smile and promptly addressed, we were made to feel important and valued. The pool area was tropical and very comfortable and Jeff the Bartender makes the very best margaritas. A special Thankyou to Andrew who greeted us every Morning and for all the direction's(wish I could hire you!! great customer service skills) Also a Thank you to Mike,Christian and Dani fantastic service. I have already recommended this hotel to friends who will be visiting Disneyland with thier kids in the spring.And next
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review of our hotel! We really appreciate your compliments to the staff members who made your stay enjoyable and memorable. A big thank you for your recommendation to your friends, and we look forward to welcoming you back next time you find yourself in Anaheim! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Upon arrival from Vegas we arrived at hotel Ménage our luggage was unloaded and the guys manning the desk just watched us struggle in to the hotel foyer.Upon checking inn the girl was just doing her job and that was all.Room was clean but had no refrigerator. Had an ice bucket to keep your drinks cold.Asked if we could have a fridge and reply was see what we can do ,we spent 3 nights there,the restaurant if you wanted just snacks then this was what you received.Very average after spending 5 nights in Bellagio in Vegas.We were booked by a travel agency and asked to be close to disneyland,which it was ,only plus for this site.Though we used the shuttle bus to go to Disneyland.Overall performance of this hotel was very average.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently come back from the US visiting LA, San Diego and surrounding areas.  Hotel menage on Trip Advisor had great reviews, which is why I picked this hotel.  I usually look at things that people have written on Trip Advisor and think, "They're just being fussy" and "That's ridiculous".  But genuinly, this hotel was very disapointing.    Let's start with positives.  The cleanliness was exceptional, nice rooms, nice clean sheets, and very spacious. (Except the bathroom).  Great TV - Lots of channels, a wide variety, free in with the price.  The negatives:  - On the last night of our stay we thought we'd go down to the "24 hour" pool and bar.  However, somebody had left fecious in the pool (Probably a child but not the point).  Also, there was a gang of yobs hogging the
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your comments regarding your recent stay. We are happy to know you enjoyed your guest room.  Please know that we were made aware of  the incident in the pool and our engineering department immediately closed the pool for cleaning. I apologize for the inconvenience you experienced while trying to share the hot tub with other guests of the hotel. Our weekends tend to be busy, and everyone seems to really enjoy a long soak in the jacuzzi after a tiring day of vacationing.  We have security guards who walk the property every night from 11pm until 7am to ensure the safety and comfort of our guests. I think our security guards must have been mistaken for policemen, as they try to keep an eye on all areas of the property, including the pool area.   Thank you for your candid comments, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for...
Summary: Like the other reviews this hotel is right next to the freeway..right next.  Its also not a family friendly hotel.  Lots of late night drinking and random folks walking around the hallways.  The pool area also turns into some kind of bar/night club in the evening.  We booked our room on priceline and it was super cheap.  We got to the hotel late and was out of the room by 7am.  I would most likely not book this hotel again especially with kids but if you are looking for a cheap room it could do the trick.  I would also rate it as a 2.5 star hotel since the rooms are super old.  If you are traveling with kids I would stay away.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have just come back and we loved everything about this hotel. Staff were friendly, courteous,accommodating yet very casual and made us feel genuinely wanted to be there.Close to Disneyland,Starbucks across the road, their restaurant and casual bar prices were reasonable, their rooms were spacious and just had been repainted and refurbished. Well done to all the staff, from the doorman, concierge right to the cleaners, very polite and as i said accommodating, seemed like no was not an option. Strongly recommend it and would stay there again in a heartbeat Thank you Menage made our stay very pleasant from check in to check out.  Sam and Miriana Stamopoulos,Australia
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a pleasant stay a few yrs ago so decided to stay again and it was terrible. Cigarette butts all over the place as we came up stairs to our room and still not cleaned up next morning after we called housekeeping. Shower curtain did not keep water in and bathroom flooded. My daughter wanted to go night swimming after a long day at Disneyland so we were looking forward to the pool. It was a mess. Debris floating in water. Dirty towels everywhere, literally on all the lounge chairs. Cigars and all kinds of trash littering the ground. Will never stay again.
Manager Response: Dear keri33_9, I am so sorry to hear of your recent experience at our hotel. It's disheartening to know that your second stay was not as enjoyable as the first. Your comments and concerns have been discussed with staff members and we have a renewed vigilance to keep the property free of debris. We sincerely hope to have the opportunity to host you again to show our true intent to provide our guests with the comfortable, enjoyable stay they expect and deserve. Thank you again, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Nice hotel friendly staff and close to Disney!!!
Summary: Tip # 1 - Get the airport shuttles from outside arrivals at SNA across the road. $10 per person directly to your hotel. No need to book. Saved us like $40 if we had taken a taxi!!!  Was greeted by friendly staff at hotel and fast check in. Slight issue regarding breakfast on our itenary but promptly resolved.  Arrived a bit early so hung out in pool area.  POOL AREA - Very clean and nicely decorated. Pool was a good Luke warm temp as the weather was so hot. Hot tub was perfect. Nice background music playing that was filtering out highway noise.  Great small Hawaii bar near pool offering great relaxation opportunity with tv's. Bar staff very accommodating.  RESTAURANT - closed :(.  But they still serve food at the bar lounge and pool side. Limited food.     BREAKFAST - Good
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A great hotel in almost all aspects, except its located virtually on a freeway
Summary: The hotel is great in almost all aspects.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  There is a lobby bar and pool bar which do great cocktails and good happy hour specials.  The pool is nice and open 24 hours.  There is the usual vending machines with everything you could want.  The rooms are great, very modern which i love, the bed was pretty comfy although no mini bar/fridge.  It's an easy walk to disneyland from here. So the downside, the hotel is literally positioned on the edge of a freeway.  We were also unfortunately given a room close to the end which is where the fwy is and it is very noisy even in the middle of the night.  Although we loved the hotel we were glad it was only for one night as sleep wasn't great.  Shame as everything else is great.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! I'm happy to know you appreciated our friendly staff, 24hr pool, and modern guest rooms. Hotel Ménage is indeed located next to the 5 freeway, which can be a very convenient location for some, as that also makes us easy to get to, close to Disneyland, and simple to navigate the surrounding areas and attractions in Orange County. In most cases the road noise is not really noticeable once the guest room door is closed, however I do understand the constant hum of traffic can be annoying to some.  Thanks again for your comments, Charlotte

Summary: You can't really judge a property by it's name, location, or word of mouth sometimes. You have to be there to soak it all in. That's just what I did! From the moment I arrived at Hotel Menage, we were greeted by both the valet and bellmen and thanked for stopping by. Check in was fantastic, and Lance at the front desk made sure that every detail of our room was spot on. He was polite, quick, and at the top of his game! He's an asset to the property. The great revenue manager Ashley Lopez hooked us up with a room facing Disneyland's animation studios and Matterhorn mountain, which was quite the surprise. Thanks, Ashley! Once nighttime hit, we got to enjoy Disney's nightly summer fireworks show. Though we could have just watched them from our balcony, we got to enjoy them
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and compliments to our hard working staff. We have passed along your kudos to Lance, Ashley, and the bell/valet staff. We all look forward to seeing you both again in December!

Summary: Hotel Menage Review  We checked in at the Hotel Menage on September 7, 2012 with check out on September 8, 2012. From the moment I rode up I was very pleased! The outside of the hotel was beautiful. I was greeted before I even reached the door. The employee opened the door for me which was very nice. He didn't have to because there was also an automatic door. There was no line at the front desk. I notified  them of my name and that I had a reservation. At first she couldn't find our reservation., then I mentioned I had booked online and she found it immediately! I also notified her that we were going to need parking and she said she would add the fee for parking and allowed the keycard to be used for the self parking lot. At checkout I noticed we were never charged for parking
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel looks a lot better in pictures. Very disappointed with the room, especially the bathroom. Small and bad lighting. Internet service is horrendous!! Good thing it is free because it really sucks.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear of your dissatisfaction with your stay. Your comments have been noted and we wish you luck in your future travels.

Summary Heading: Just get Happy , in Anaheim CA
Summary: Grace , at the front desk greeted us with enthusiam , joy and attentively delivered  5 star service with grace !  Loved the happy hours at the poolside bar, awesome value , and interesting fare . Service was enchanting , from the footman at the doors , to the cheerful desk staff, and animated bartenders and waiters and attentive maids ! High five all around to the staff of the Menage ! We were thrilled to enjoy Disney's fireworks from our balcony or poolside, EVERY night, no fast pass required  !  Slept like beauties in our  spacious rooms with King sized beds ! Walking distance to the parks , simple , a mighty fine  holiday for us ! We were treated royally at the Hotel  Menage ! We just got Happier ! Maggie Kavanagh Ontario CA
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a suite that is the size of two standard rooms with nice floors/sitting area/small counter area with a refrigerator  -  the only  complaint: the shower....while huge it only has one head (and a un-adjustable hand held) that is mounted for the very short  - I am 5'4" and I had to stoop to rinse  my hair - the walk to Disneyland is over	I-5 but only a 10 minute walk  as this hotel does not have a free shuttle - there is some freeway noise but in the room we stayed we could not hear once the door was shut - pool open 24/7 - restaurant was under renovations but they did provide some bar typo food choices and appeared to have a nice breakfast spread  - there are so many hotels to choose from near Disneyland and I do feel that it could be added to the possiblities
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a joke! Every thing started with the reservation of the room, gave them my email address and asked if they would email me my confirmation, never received it, was quoted a price for military memebers at a flat rate (flat rate meaning no taxes) was not honored, asked for a king bed room, once arriving to the hotel I was placed in a room with a king bed and queen bed,the next day I was moved to a new room next to a room with children, I'll just say my girlfriend and I did not sleep well due to the noise coming from the room next to us, the walls are paper thin you hear EVERYTHING from the adjoining rooms, then the next day I called room service for a bottle of champange, was told ok that it would be up in 30 mins, received a call that the bottle I had order was out
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear of your frustrations during your recent stay. I looked into the email confirmation and found that, after being sent to the address provided, it appeared to be delivered. It may be possible that the settings in your email account routed the email to your spam box.  Regarding your military discount, we provided you the standard discount given to all members of the military. Taxes are required to be paid by all hotels on all rooms sold, and no one is exempt.  It is true we are a family-friendly hotel, and sometimes the energy and excitement of children going to Disneyland can be a bit overwhelming for those who aren't traveling with children.  Thank you for bringing the champagne trouble to our attention. We apologize for the breakdown in communication within the departments and assure you this will not happen again.  I invite you to contact me directly if you have any further issues you would like to discuss or resolve.   Warm Regards,  Charlotte Gulley Guest Services, Hotel Ménage guestservice@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: This hotel is just over the bridge to Disney and was 1 stop away on the ART transportation system. The hotel was clean and well maintained and had a funky eclectic style. Very fun. Restauraunt prices were reasonable and they had GREAT Chicken Tortilla soup. The one caution I would give is that if you plan on turning in before the 9pm firework show, KNOW that the sound is LOUD and you'll likely be awakened by it. Overall, a FANTASTIC hotel stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel Menage was truly magnificent, the service I received was 1st class.
Summary: Hotel Menage Truly wonderful, with so much to offer.Food was wonderful, the bar next to the pool was a delight. The pool was great, and the spa was heaven.  Hotel room was very clean and tidy, but wow after walking hours and hours at theme parks, the bed was so comfortable to sleep on. Service was great, staff was always willing to go that extra mile. The Hotel was in a great location and allowed us to watch the fire works from Disney land while swimming in the pool, a big plus in my books. Plenty of shopping near by, I'm looking forward to going back in the near future. Thanks Hotel Menage, and your wonderful staff for allowing our stay truly amazing. Mr. R Lawson ShellHarbour NSW Australia
Manager Response: Your gracious review is very much appreciated. We are thrilled to have you as a loyal guest and look forward to welcoming you back next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.  Warm Regards, Charlotte Gulley Guest Services, Hotel Ménage

Summary Heading: Good hotel great location after a horrible trip
Summary: This hotel was wonderful to us on our stay.  My parter and I we unable to board our plane from las Vegas to lax due to America's over booking system which no one seems to mention till after you don't get a seat in your flight. (a story for another review). We ended up driving from Vegas. What should of been a 4 hour drive ended up taking almost 8 as when we got to la we got lost. Having no map or gps it phone did not help.  Once we arrived we asked how we could get back to the airport to get our luggage. The staff gave me a number for a shuttle and a voucher for 2 free cocktails. I almost cried just from this gesture of kindness.  Food at the hotel was good. Nice to have some choice.  Pool area was nice and the bar by the pool was excellent. Location was great if you are going
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was all good until one night they threw a party in a room that they rent out until midnight our rooms where shakeing from the bass and then the manager was rude about and very hateful in my opinion
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Just a room with an amazing view!
Summary: I've stayed at The Menage twice and loved both trips there! When booking for Disneyland, you may need "just a room" but coming home to this place is a nice upgrade from some of the cheap places closer to the park. The walk is about 15 minutes, and uphill on the way back, but totally doable. If the walk wears you out get tickets for the ART bus from the concierge out front $4 a day. The Menage was very good about my requests upon arrival. Got a mini-fridge our second day there. They put us in a room facing the pool. Keep in mind pool-facing rooms also face the freeway, but for all the talk of noise I never heard a sound with the door shut and the air on. Another advantage to a pool-facing room is that you can stand on the balcony and watch DL fireworks most nights. My only pet
Manager Response: none

Summary: Service: Press 0 and they'll come right away Sleep Quality: Slept like a baby Cleanliness: Absolutely Location: Right next to Disneyland  and the Anaheim main street Harbor Boulevard Value: That's where it lost a star. Either don't charge $10/day for parking or include it in the room rate.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review of our hotel. We are glad to hear you slept so well and enjoyed our proximity to Disneyland. Please know that every hotel in the downtown Anaheim area charges for parking, and our self parking fee of $10/night ($12 for valet) is comperable, if not less, than similar hotels in the area.  Your comments are appreciated. We wish you happy travels!

Summary Heading: Great family friendly hotel. Really helpful staff
