Summary: Hotel Menage was reccomended to us by a friend and we were not disappointed. Our room was comfortable, good value and not too far from Disneyland with a regular shuttle to and from the theme park. The pool was great and accompanied by an awesome happy hour ($5 cocktails 4 - 7!) Jeffery was a great bartender. The restaurant was also affordable and delicious with lots of variety. The nightly Disneyland fireworks could be seen (and heard quite loudly) each evening with a great view from the balcony. The staff were a highlight for us - all so genuinely nice, up for a chat and welcoming.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to know you and your family enjoyed your stay! Your compliments to Jeffrey and the other staff members have been passed along and are much appreciated. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again soon!

Summary: We sayed here for three nights while we went to the theme parks. For the price we payed we were very happy. Our room faced the freeway, if you are a light sleeper this may bother you, but I did not find it a problem (12 hours at Disneyland, I could have slept through a tornado).The rooms are older but have been updated to a nice standard. Our room was large and bed comfortable. Ten min walk to Disneyland and food options to suit all budgets. Gas station across the road for snacks and drinks. Staff were friendly and helpful. You can see Disney fireworks every night from the pool area. Food and drink vending machines near the lobby. Only down side is the bathrooms are very small and have not been updated, however it was clean and did the job.  We ate at the hotel. HUGE menu and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not a bad place to stay.
Summary: I came across Hotel Menage on Priceline, where they had an online special. I wouldn't have seen this hotel if it wasn't for the feature on my phone. I was immediately impressed with the photos and reviews of this hotel, as it looked like an upscale Vegas inspired place. My boyfriend and I booked a two night stay. The lobby was beautiful and the front desk staff was friendly and courteous. It took a while to check us in due to priceline's miscommunication. Parking is $10 a day which we didn't see on the website, oh well. The rooms were okay, nice flat screen tv that didn't have a remote. Nice decor, no fridge or microwave. The rooms are a little outdated. Biggest issue was the restaurant. We decided to go down to eat lunch instead of room service. The hostess sat us and said our
Manager Response: none

Summary: Thank you very much for your hospitality!  I was part of a wedding party and the dinner, as well as the, room and pool were awesome.  Then the fireworks started!! Great finish! Grace definitely started things off right at the front desk.  Very cool-
Manager Response: none

Summary: My girlfriend and I have stayed here twice and we are ready for our next trip. The service is top notch, everyone that I met working here was a class act! The front desk is very accommodating, we usually arrive early in the morning before many rooms are available but we can check in and leave the car in the parking lot ($10 a day). When we return later a room is waiting for us.   The pool is great (open 24 hours) and the outdoor bar is where I get my drinks. The Bartender Shawn is great to chat with while watching a ball game. There is also a nice indoor bar but I haven't been to it yet. The restaurant has a lot of great food, we love to get breakfast here in the morning. The only thing that keeps this stay from a  5 star rating from me is the restaurant, it seems to be
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your continued business! We are so glad you have enjoyed our hotel, restaurant and pool bar, and we appreciate you posting your comments on TripAdvisor. We look forward to seeing you next time you visit Anaheim.

Summary: Definetly enjoyed this hotel! The staff were friendly and the food was delicious! Great value. Stayed here with 5 other girls in total all around 25. Pool was nice and warm and would def reccomend this hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for three nights while exploring the Anaheim and Los Angelas area.  The common areas of the hotel are nice, but the bar area by the pool was a little out of control for our taste during our visit.  It felt a little like spring break.  There was a group of "young adults" smoking pot out in the pool bar area for hours. The hotel staff made no effort to discourage them.  This is not the type of enviroment we wanted when traveling with our kids.  The hotel allows smoking and it seemed like many of the patrons take advantage of this...Not ideal if you are a non-smoker.  If you want a view of the nightly Disney fireworks, this is a great spot to view from.    We also wished the staff would have made more of an effort to keep the place clean.  There were rooms service
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. I must say I am quite surprised by your comments about "... a group of "young adults" smoking pot out in the pool bar area for hours." Our hotel does not condone such behavior in or around our property, and our staff members typically act immediately to put a stop to illegal or offensive activities of any kind. We have not had any recent complaints of excessive smoking in our records, and we sincerely apologize if this kind of activity went overlooked by our staff.  Your comments and suggestions have been taken seriously and are being discussed with the appropriate departments. Thank you again for your feedback.  Sincerely, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: This was a good location by Disneyland and price for the hotel you get. It has a shuttle that is run by the Anaheim Resort Transit. $4 dollars for adults, $1 dollar for kids, at the front desk will get you an all day pass for that ticket holder. The rooms were clean, and recently remodeled, I would say, within 5 years. Parking is $10 dollars a day. The pool is open 24 hours and has a hot tub and outdoor shower. Numerous lounge chairs and cabana loungers are plentiful. They have towels available. One of the card swipe doors never worked the entire time. We brought it to their attention while there. A man was working on it the next day, but it never did work.  The fireworks light off literally through the parking lot, but can be loud if you don't like that sort of thing. Some
Manager Response: none

Summary: My overall impression of this hotel was that it had a really nice feel to it, but not in a pretentious way. The exterior was very nice, the lobby, hotel bar, restaurant, and pool bar all felt higher end and yet comfortable. I really like the look and feel of this hotel, especially in the common areas.   The location was fantastic. We were able to walk to disney within 15 minutes about. When you consider how much walking you're going to do anyway, what's an extra 15 min.. Well that was our reasoning the first day, the second day we took the shuttle.. It only cost $4 for a round trip. The location was great for a day-trip into LA as well since it is right on the I5.   Rooms: It was nicely appointed with large leather headboard, and a nice look, but had a fairly worn couch, but it
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your time spent at our hotel. I'd like to personally apologize for the noise outside your room during your stay. I completely understand how frustrating it can be to have a room near the elevators during a busy weekend. We greatly appreciate your understanding, and hope to have the opportunity to host you again in a quieter room. Thanks again for your business, and for taking the time to post your candid comments. Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: Booked this hotel based on other reviews here. Only visiting Anaheim to go to Disneyland and this hotel was great. Stayed 2 nights. Walked to Disneyland which was only 10-15 min. They do have a shuttle bus tho. Food at hotel was good; big variety and affordable. Cheap laundry facilities also available which were awesome.  Had a room that did not face pool and it was quiet. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the second year I have been to this hotel and the second year I have had the most wonderful experience! Everything about it was wonderful, from the friendly front desk staff (Dani you were wonderful) to the great valet guys (Andrew you have been wonderful and so friendly) to the wonderful Concierge, Leo! The restaurant is wonderufl, the pool is wonderful! You are able to see the disney fireworks everynight. Do you want to have a wonderful stay at a wonderful place then you need to go to hotel menage! Ashley Lopez you have been wonderful, my kids and I and our extended family plan to be back next year. Thanks so much!
Manager Response: Dear Christine1711, Thank you so much for your continued business. It has been a pleasure to host you and your family, and we genuinely appreciate your personal kudos to our staff members. We are looking forward to welcoming you all back again next year! Warm Regards, The staff at Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Great hotel, friendly staff, super restaurant!!
Summary: Stayed here for a week for my son's wedding. Staff was very courteous and helpful even with planning the rehearsal dinner there at the hotel. Rooms very nice: clean and spacious. Great view of Disney fireworks everynight (whole family and friends group met each night to visit and view display)! restaurant has very varied, and reasonably priced menu, Overall, we had a great stay for a big group of people, banquet requests cheerfully received, and fun for all! I would recommend the Menage for family  or business stays. And you can walk to Disney in just a few minutes! Phil Demers, Ft. Lauderdale, FL
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with pool close to Disney
Summary: We stayed in this hotel to have easy access to LA but also the surrounding beaches but it would be a great location for Disneyland which was really close.  Rooms were nice and spacious with all the amenities you need (hair dryer, big tv, coffee maker, iron etc)  Swimming pool is lovely and in a perfect spot to spend a sunny afternoon with a pool bar.   There is also another bar inside and a restaurant which served nice food both at dinner and for breakfast. Recommend the buffet breakfast - $10 for a good selection of hot and cold.  Gym was basic but well equipped.  The hotel can be quite noisy around the bar area but is just people having fun and you can ask for a room on the other side as although it's close to the freeway you can't hear the traffic.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review of your recent stay. We are happy to know you enjoyed our hotel, and that you appreciated our convenient proximity to all the fun places southern California has to offer. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again next time you return to the Anaheim area. Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary Heading: Very good base for visiting Disneyland
Summary: This hotel provided us with a very good base for our visit to the Anaheim Disneyland/California Adventure park.  We found it to be very comfortable, friendly and clean, and has the great advantage of having a decent restauraunt on-site - not always the case! From the outside it's not the most visually appealing place - the open corridors reminded me of blocks of flats in Liverpool in the 1980's - but our room was comfortable, good beds, nice bathroom etc etc. On site pool and spa tub good too, if often crowded, but this is only to be expected. The Disneyland 'ART' bus stops at the hotel's front door every 10 minutes, and runs door to door, so there's no pounding the streets necessary.   The hotel's best feature however is the staff all of whom were very obliging and friendly and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Exterior property hotel near Disney parks
Summary: Smooth check-in and friendly front desk agents. Boutique hotel is an exterior property where all guest rooms are located outside vs. indoors. This is probably because the hotel was formerly a Holiday Inn. Rooms are OK. When we arrived and turned on the lights in the guest room, there was a child's underwear near the nightstand. Housekeeping should not have let that happen. Pool was nice. The hotel must be pet-friendly, since a lot of pets were being walked around the pool area doing their business.The self-parking was a bit confusing, since there was only one way in and out. Bath tub and shower head are both outdated.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the Menage for our honeymoon, and it was great! Great price for the quality. We ate at the restaurant "K'ya- Street Fare" a couple times during our stay and always had good service and good food. Even got room service and we never waited more than 15 minutes for our food. Very friendly front desk service as well as valet (only $2 extra per day). AMAZING view of Disneyland fireworks. Only thing that wasn't great was it's distance from the Disneyland Park entrance. We were told it was a 5 minute walk to the park, but it took almost 20, with no shuttle service available. So after walking to and from the park for 3 days, we were exhausted! But other than that, we had an amazing stay. I would strongly recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review. It was a pleasure to host you during your honeymoon :) I would like to note for your future reference there is a shuttle that maintains a stop in front of our hotel. It is a separate company and they charge $4 for an all day pass.  Thanks again for your comments. We are so happy you enjoyed your stay! Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: This newly remodeled hotel was decent and I would stay here again.  The restaurant, pool and bar were all nice.  We were going to Disneyland for 3 days and the hotel has a shuttle with a 3 day pass for only $12.  The rooms were decent but not great.  You could tell it was an old rundown place with a facelift.  The ac units were really loud and our room was facing the loud and busy street.  Other than that it was a good experience and we'd stay again for the right price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently got back from staying at the Hotel Menage for 7 days. It is a great place to stay for kids who like to swim a lot. The staff are very friendly and the bell hops are the best and will point you in the right direction everytime you ask. Great location from Disneyland and the hotel offers a shuttle to and from for $10.00 for a family of 4. The food is great and is reasonably priced! The rooms are ok but need new shower curtains as the water goes everywhere. The best view everynight to watch the fireworks. The pool area is great with lots of chairs to sit on. The water could be turned up as it seems to be really cold sometimes and it needs a bigger hottub. All in all my family really liked the hotel and we are already planning on going back in a few months for another
Manager Response: We are so glad your family had so much fun at our hotel! Thank you for your review; we are looking forward to hosting you all again in a few months time :) Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary Heading: Very Close to Disney, affordable, but a little dirty and uncomfortable.
Summary: The hotel is located very close to Disney. The walk takes 15 minutes or there is a shuttle bus for a small fee.  The rooms a spacious and look like recently renovated. Our room was unfortunately not really clean when we arrived and neither are the rooms really comfortable. You get into the rooms through outside halways, which means you can't open the curtains otherwise all other guests will always look into your room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize that your room was not to your liking in comfort and cleanliness. Your comments have been discussed and addressed with staff members. We appreciate your business.  Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here for a couple nights while visiting Disneyland. The room was clean and modern. We could see the fireworks from the park from the hotel. The small cafe inside the hotel was descent. Perfect for a cup of coffee before a big day at the park. You have to take a tram to the park which I believe was $4 per person round trip but I could be mistaken. Either way, it was worth it to not have to park. I wouldn't recommend trying to walk to the park from the hotel. The surrounding neighborhoods were not great and you have to walk over the freeway. Plus it would be a pretty long walk to add to your full day of walking once you get into the park. Overall, no complaints and a great trip!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the hotel Menage for three days during our vacation in LA.   Hotel Menage is the best hotel to stay when you go to Disneyland is my opinion. We had a suite with an extra room for the kids. Great views of the fireworks and only one busstop from the enterance.   Only point of critisism was the breakfast. Only fruit, yogurt and scrambled eggs without toast ; ( You can do better!  Excellent pool with great coctails for happy hour ($ 5)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location, great pool, not so great service.
Summary: We stayed at the hotel Menage 7/29-8/4.. Hotel overall was ok. I will start with the positives, location good, walking distance (but you do have to cross over the freeway) wouldn't suggest walking back too late. There is a shuttle for $4 a day that gives you front door service to DL and your hotel all day long. We walked one day and took the shuttle the rest of the days. You can charge the tickets to your room if you'd like.  Pool/pool bar GREAT!! Happy hour 4-7.. The mojitos are yummy. Pool area great, lots of sun, lots of places to sit, and a great view of the fireworks. They also play music poolside which I thought was cool. Rooms we're ok but small. We asked for two queens and got a king and a pull out. Pull out wasn't great, but it worked.  Rooms cleaned everyday, but
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I am a bit surprised to hear that you perceived our customer service to be our weakness during your stay. Our service and staff members are typically our strongest assets, however your comments have been noted and discussed with our staff. We appreciate your candid comments and hope to have the opportunity to host you again. Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great fun place to stay for a fun weekend at Disneyland
Summary: My husband took me here for my birthday weekend at Disneyland. It's a cool, hip place to stay. It's family friendly but felt more like a grown up hotel for us to hang out at in the evenings or Sunday by the pool bar. It can be a little noisy in the pool facing rooms but we were totally okay with that. It's definitely an older hotel remodeled but the rooms were spacious and comfortable and everything was very clean and modern.  I don't usually get to say this but the entire staff was really fantastic! From the front desk, bell hops, valet, bartenders, security and housekeeping were all very friendly and personable.... It was almost strange to have everyone be so nice and fun to talk to!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights this past week and from the get go I was very impressed with the staff. Upon check in the lady behind the counter was very friendly and open to giving advice on breakfast suggestions and other offerings. Everyone else was very helpful throughout the stay, even the housekeeping staff was helpful. The rooms are modern and have a great tv mounted on the wall. This property must have been like a quality inn or something in it's former life but the upgrades to the rooms make it feel so much better. My room had a couch in it along with the king bed. The mirror above the sink was from one end of the wall to the other which helped when shaving and having my girlfriend do her make up. The shower has both fixed shower head which moves in all directions and it also
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review! We are very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and look forward to hosting you again during your next visit to the Anaheim area.

Summary: The location is perfect, the rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is über friendly and the pool and bar are cozy. We have stayed at many different hotels when visiting Disneyland and this is our favorite. We can't wait to go back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: First time staying at the Menage, and it was great.. Frank at the bar was a great guy, as was all of the front desk staff. We stayed for 3 nights, 3 adults and a baby, and the room was just the right size.. Bathroom could use some updating, but still pretty nice.. Right across the street from Starbucks, and a short 10 minute walk to Disneyland! The pool area was awesome, lots of chairs, music and sun.. outdoor bar area as well! The only thing that was an issue was requesting anything from housekeeping, 1 out of 5 requests was met, and that was at 11pm, the day time crew never responded to towel, toilet paper requests.. and the front desk wouldn't give out extra towels... good thing for beach towels we brought...  We'll definetley stay again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I'm so sorry to hear of your frustration with receiving your requested items from housekeeping and have discussed your comments with our staff. We are very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay, and I have passed your compliments on to Frank and the front desk staff. We look forward to hosting you and your family again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services, Hotel Menage

Summary: Hotel Menage is a resort style hotel geared towards a younger crowd with music playing throughout  the main floor and pool area.  The hotel itself is nice and the rooms are clean but, they are starting to look a bit run down.  The entire hotel faces either Hwy 5, Ball Rd., or Harbor Blvd. and no matter what you do, you are going to hear passing traffic in your room 24 hours a day.  We had an adjoining room and could hear the people over there partying until 7 a.m.  We went to K'ya for breakfast in the morning and had the buffet which was pretty basic.  The wait staff were very friendly and accommodating but, somewhat slow.  The hotel is located within walking distance to Disneyland and you can watch the nightly fireworks from the hotel.  The front desk staff was very friendly
Manager Response: none

Summary: The two things that stand out most about the hotel are the pool and happy hour. Had a great time with my wife and kids lounging and recovering poolside mid-day and the day after our "Disneyland Adventure."  The happy hour food was really good considering it was only about $5 a plate. We had the burger, the spicy tuna handroll, and the blackened shrimp quesadilla.  The burger was a regular sized burger not a slider which most places proudly tout as a happy hour special.   I was hesitant about trying the spicy tuna handroll as most people should be when it's coming from a hotel kitchen, but no worries here it was  fresh and pleanty tasty. The Shrimp quesadilla was the unanimous favorite with my bunch. The big knock most review's have is the road noise seeing that it's less than 50
Manager Response: none

Summary: My best friend and I planned a girls weekend getaway to Disneyland. We decided on Hotel Ménage through hotels.com and a friend's recommendation. The location and accommodations were very nice, with a free shuttle to downtown Disney-just perfect! But the staff are what makes this place great. Jeffrey at the pool bar was friendly, warm and provided professional service with a big smile. Raul took great care of us at night in K'ya and then remembered me at breakfast the next morning. His smile and happy demeanor made us feel like we were old friends. Thank you so much for making our weekend wonderful! We will definitely be coming back, as we are annual pass holders at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice comments... I will pass your appreciation on to Jeffrey and Raul! We are looking forward to your return next time you come to Disneyland! Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great hotel for the budget and 10 mins walk to Disney Parks
Summary: Great hotel for the budget and 10 mins walk to Disney Parks. Good food.. Loved seeing fireworks from the hotel room and live music at the lobby.. Overall satisfied with the service. Restaurant employees were very nice.   The Spa is always crowded. They need to make it bigger.  I found the swimming pool is not heated enough for a night swim.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Hotel needs a lot of work. Our room was right next to the hwy, I could hear the cars passing by. It was horrible. They moved us to another room and we could still hear it. The room look like they tried to update it but it wasn't working. I had already prepaid for the room and couldn't get my money back. It was only one night, but I was ready to leave early. I couldn't wait to get out.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that your stay was so negatively impacted by the ambient noise from the freeway. While we are convenient to the major tourist attractions in Anaheim, we are also convenient to the major roads and transportation routes. Typically, once a guest is inside their room with the a/c on, they can no longer hear much noise from the outside. I apologize that this was not the case for you. Please feel free to message me with what "wasn't working" for you regarding the room design... it may be something we can address fairly easily! Thank you for your feedback.  Charlotte Guest Services

Summary Heading: The strange love child of the W and the Ramada Inn - Hotel Menage tries to be hip on a budget, with dubious success...
Summary: We stayed here for a week when my three young kids and I decided to tag along on a business trip with my husband. We changed our reservation from a nice, straight-laced place in downtown orange so the kiddies and I could be close to disneyland, and since this was a last minute trip in July, this is what we got. It was, frankly, a little weird. Some pros: the room was large and relatively clean, the pool is fine, the food is cheap, the guests are generally unpretentious, and the view of the fireworks is truly superb. Cons: in trying so hard to be cool, it becomes a little sad. We had spotty Internet. The service was inconsistent, and at times so bad as to be bizarre. In particular, I'm thinking of breakfast - when booking, we paid a premium so that breakfast would be included,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We appreciate your comments regarding breakfast service; they have been passed along to upper management and will be used to help us find better ways to accommodate families with differing schedules. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your room and the view of the Disneyland fireworks from our property.  Thanks again for your candid comments. We wish you happy travels! Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: The Hotel Menage really wasn't the best hotel I have ever stayed in. I defiantly wouldn't recommend it to anybody. First of all the room didn't even have carpeting! All it had was a rug...and the air conditioner was messed up so every time we came back to the room the rug was soaked! The shower curtain is just regular cloth so whenever somebody showered the entire bathroom and sink area outside of the bathroom flooded! It was soooo annoying! When we first got there they messed up our room. We were supposed to get a room with two queen beds. Instead they gave us a room with one Queen bed and a pull out couch, so for an entire week I got to sleep on the most uncomfortable couch ever! There are a few pluses to this hotel.  You can get a fantastic view of the Disneyland fireworks
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We do have a number of guest rooms decorated in a "Loft" style, each one uniquely designed, some with tile floors and rugs. We sincerely regret that we were unaware of a problem with an air conditioning unit, and have since had each air conditioner in our tiled rooms inspected and repaired accordingly.  The shower curtains we use are fairly standard in most hotels. We use fabric curtains that are completely water resistant - vinyl curtains are difficult to launder, so we opt for a more wash-friendly curtain for cleanliness. Our standard check-in time is 3:00pm. If we have a room available for an earlier arriving guest, we are more than happy to check you in as soon as you arrive. Our apologies that we did not have a room ready for your family earlier than 3pm. We also do our best to accommodate early arrival requests, so in your future travels, let the hotel know in advance of your arrival time if you need a room ready before check-in. Please note, requests cannot be guaranteed, but are given first priority whenever possible! Thanks again for your feedback.  Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: We are a Volleyball family that stays in Anaheim alot and Hotel Menage is the first hotel where I felt APPRECIATED as a guest.  My fridge was brought quickly and staffers Jennifer Hanzel & Ashley Lopez were exceptionally kind and helpful with any requests. The valets even volunteered to help me when they were busy! The Palapa bar & pool with oversized lounge beds made relaxing easy....Happy hour drinks & menu were a great way to finish a busy day of sports!   I reccommend this hotel if you will be at the American Sports Center which is only 1 mile away and you get additional 10% off
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fine stay but don't much too much!
Summary: This is a great low cost stay near Disneyland.  But it's not the hotel I would prefer returning to.  If you can get a great deal it's worth it.  You can tell they did a low cost renovation when taking over the property.  They did establish a cool vibe in common areas and you have a perfect view of the Disneyland fireworks from the pool.  But it seems a common theme for parents to drop off and leave kids and the pool.  Which means plenty of out of control kids with no supervision all over the pool.  So much so that my 11 year old daughter asked to leave because the other kids were so out of control and dominated the pool area.  The rooms are a fine place to lay your head at night.  But if you plan on spending time in your room you might want to look elsewhere.  The beds are in a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear that you appreciated the great service from our staff, and that you consider Hotel Menage a "great low cost stay near Disneyland." It is unfortunate that the other guests and children at the pool had a negative impact on your daughter's experience. I can understand that kids sometimes get a little excited and rambunctious when they are on a Disney vacation!  It's true that all rooms don't come equipped with a mini fridge and microwave, however, we do have them available on request. Please don't hesitate to ask our staff for anything you may need! Thanks again for your feedback.  Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: The Hotel Menage is a great hotel located really close to Disneyland.  I was concerned because some reviews said it was a 25 minute walk while others said it was 10-15.  I can tell you that while pushing a stroller and walking at a leisurely pace it took me less than 15 minutes.  Really convenient.  Also the beds are really comfortable.  I have a very difficult time sleeping in hotels and I slept like a baby at the Menage.  By the way,  the service was perfect.  From the Front Desk to Housekeeping it was top notch all around.  And for those who say it is a renovated motel trust me when I tell everyone it is much more than that.  Like all the hotels near Disneyland most have exterior entrances that face a common outside corridor.  However the Mendage has done a fantastic job
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your review. We are thrilled to hear that you had a fantastic experience; your compliments have been passed on to our staff. We look forward to the opportunity to host you and your family again, should your travels bring you back to the Anaheim area. Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: We are a young family and hate stuffy hotels. This was a good price for booking last minute. The room was nice and clean and they let us do early check in even though I called they said no but we went in and they had a room. Great view of fireworks from Disneyland. Half a mile to maingate. Easy walk or super fast tram($). Great food at a great price and even let us switch out the one meal we did not like. Kids eat breakfast free with paying adult. They did do some construction early on Saturday morning. We were up because of our young kids but If I had been at the bar the night before I would have be upset. I loved everything except for the wood frame bed that stuck out and I could not stop kicking. I am a little clumsy and those beds did me in! We had a carpeted room but
Manager Response: none

Summary: Don't fooled by the photos on their website and think that this a 'resort'. This property is a motel with a few upgrades.  The rooms were comfortable and clean.  We had a room with a King size bed and a pull out sofa bed.  A fridge was brought to our room when were requested it but this does not come standard.  The pool area was loud with music trying to drown out the 10 lanes of the I5 Freeway on the other side of the fence.  This was expected since we Google Mapped the property before we booked.  The pool area was nicely decorated and had nice lounge chairs but the hot tub was always packed with little kids and appeared to be quite dirty.  The restaurant in the hotel was good for breakfast and pretty well priced.  Value for the money was good for this motel.  We paid $80/night
Manager Response: We appreciate your review. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed the value for money spent during your stay at Hotel Menage. Thank you for taking advantage of K'ya Streetfare during breakfast. We hope you will think of us next time you visit the Anaheim area. Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services, Hotel Menage

Summary: thanks to staff for making our stay fun and confortable, from organising a my fiances medication to organising a town car to the baseball, nothing was to much problem. local was very good,room was comfy, couldnt fault staff, thanks
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value for family with teenagers
Summary: We stayed here the week of the 4th of July while we vacationed in Southern California.  The pool is open 24  hours a day which is great for when you return late from the Disney parks and need soak your feet in the hot  tub.    We had a  King size bed for us parents and the kids had a Queen Sofa bed.  This was perfect for us. The room was not cramped and  we felt very comfortable for a week long stay.  We were able to view the Disneyland Fireworks better from our room or the pool than inside the park.  Very relaxing.  This hotel has a nice restaurant on site that offers room service. We only ate their once.  It was very good.  ART transfer bus picks you up at the front door.    Can't beat this hotel for the price.  We will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our 15th wedding anniversary and awoke to the sounds of chainsaws and chippers outside our door at 8:45am.  The LOUD sounds continued after 2 calls to the front desk.  When we checked out, they told us they had to cut down a bunch of trees due to city compliance....and that they would refund all our money for our trouble.  It turns out that there were some really huge machines chipping up trees in the parking lot about 30 ft. from our window. Well, sure enough they charged us the full amount, but also an extra $10 for parking! We called and left messages, and we are still trying to get our money back.  If we were told that we would have our money refunded by the manager, then they should honor their word.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Checked in for 5 nights June 2012 after our long flight from Australia, 2 adults & 2 kids Queen double room. Friendly staff, room ok, although not a large bathroom. Great pool/spa area, excellent for watching the Disney fireworks each night if you are at the Hotel. Hotel staff not well versed in getting around town if you do not have a car. Checkout ART buses, easiest & cheapest way to travel. 5 min walk to Disney, Maccas and other restaurants. Hotel dining & brekky have lots of choice.  Definitely recommend for families, good value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Okay first you need to remember you are in tourist capital of the world and you are not looking for the Ritz if you are using a hotel for an overnight stay so you can visit Disneyland.  With that said, we couldn't find a better deal....especially using the military rate.  It's a "motel" atmosphere with the rooms opening to the outside and you are right next to the freeway, so yes, there is a freeway noise and not a just a little, but a lot.  However, turn on the air conditioner or tv and you all but drown out the noise.  The customer service in this place is better than some of the 5 stars I've stayed in...from valet, to front desk, to the bar to the restaurant.   Excellent staff!  We were on a "couple only" weekend to Disneyland (shhh don't tell the kids!) and this was perfect
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Your review was fun to read and your candid comments are very much appreciated! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your "couples only" weekend, and hope to be able to welcome you, (and perhaps the kids!), again soon.  Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in mid-May. As the title of this review suggests, it was OK. Nothing special but not bad or anything. I thought this hotel was not value for money and when walking to Disneyland past similarly priced hotels, wished I'd stayed at another.  The location was fine, just a 10min walk to Disneyland etc and the place was kept pretty clean but the real positive were the staff - always helpful and cheerful. Just too expensive for what it is.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked the Menage in April for a stay during the end of June 2012.  I called directly and spoke with someone at the front desk who gave us a great rate.  I told the woman that my friend would be booking a room too and asked if my friend could get the same rate.  She said "Of course.  Just have your friend call and ask for me".  My friend called that day and the agent was gone and never returned her calls.  So, my friend ended up paying twice what we did.  The hotel is old but they have made a good effort to update it.  The room was clean, a decent size with a huge bathroom.  The only complaint I have about the room is the platform beds.  They have very sharp corners and the furniture arrangement in our room made it painful.  When we would exit the bathroom we would hit our
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review of Hotel Menage. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Your compliments regarding front desk staff and service have been passed on, and your suggestions for housekeeping have been addressed. We hope to have the opportunity to host you and your family again soon!  Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary Heading: Hotel Menage offers great customer service, but still wanting more value for the money
Summary: My family of four had a pleasant enough stay here June 30-July 4 during our trip to Disney. I booked online and requested a pool view. Upon arrival we were assigned a first floor room but the front desk was able to accommodate our request for a room with a good view of the fireworks. The room was a king bed with a pullout sofa. Our bed was kind of noisy and the mattress seemed a little worn for our taste. My husband said he felt like he sunk in on his side of the bed. My sister slept on the sofa pull out and  said it wasn't the most comfortable experience either. The room seemed clean but there were still a few crumbs on the floor when we arrived. The room felt small, especially for four people. The bathroom was especially tight with a separate sink area outside. Difficult
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed during a conference left early because of problems in the hotel.  My first room had bad plumbing which I didn't find out until I went to take a shower and noticed the floor under the sink was soaked and the sink had dirt in it.  They sent up maintenance and moved me to another room, which was a Accessible room (no problem) but it didn't have any towels, etc.  I had to call down to have some brought up.  Other than that the room was fine, fairly large, but the sound from the fireworks at Disney are so loud it felt like they were in the room.  The restaurnat wasn't bad but I left after the first night.  The staff were friendly and accomndating and it seemed like lots of families with small children enjoyed themselves but for a business trip it might not be the place to stay.
Manager Response: We are so sorry about the unforeseen issue with the plumbing in your originally assigned room, and we appreciate you bringing it to our attention so quickly so we could send maintenance to have it repaired promptly. We also apologize for the noise from the fireworks display at the nearby Disneyland Park. They go off every night around 9:30pm for about 10 minutes, and the spectacular fireworks view from our hotel is one of the things most of our guests seem to really enjoy. They are definitely loud from any point in the downtown Anaheim area, and are unfortunately outside the control of any hotel. Thank you for your business; your feedback and review is appreciated.  Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for our trip to Disneyland. It is definitely an old motel trying to be something nicer but not really succeeding. We had a room on the 5th floor overlooking Harbor Blvd. This was the quiet side of the hotel. The other side was facing the freeway and 24 hour pool with music. Our room was not as clean as it could have been. I am pretty sure there was a blood splatter on the wall that wasn't cleaned the whole time we were there. Housekeeping could not seem to figure out that we had 4 people in the room and never left enough towels and washcloths. I had to call down twice for more towels. If you want to walk to DL, it is a long way and over the overpass. We drove to the parks everyday, not worth the walk. I would not choose to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear of your disappointment; your comments regarding housekeeping have been reviewed and are being addressed within the department.  For your future reference, there is an ART shuttle (separate company) that maintains a stop at our front door and has many stops throughout the surrounding area, including Disneyland. It is only $4pp for all day transportation, and can be much more convenient and affordable than driving and paying parking fees everywhere.  Thanks again for your feedback, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: We stayed early June on recommendation from travel agent....What a brillant hotel, all the staff were amazingly friendly.  We have three boys aged 14, 12 & 10 so had 2 rooms interconnecting.  The rooms are spacious and very clean.  The pool is open 24 hours 7 days a week so after a full day at Disney a spa at midnight was bliss.  They have a happy hour from 5-7.30pm at the pool bar, really nice and relaxing and a way to meet fellow guests, the cocktails devine.  Because it is situated between freeways it is noisey when you step outside especially towards the pool but in rooms you didnt hear it.  The restaurant prices are excellent, nothing over $10, again very friendly, helpful staff.  Getting to disney is not a problem, you can purchase a Anaheim transit bus pass for $4 adult,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: About what you would expect -- better pool area than most in this area
Summary: The good: For a family, especially one who might want a cocktail while the kids swim, this is a good place. The restaurant's kid-friendly wide-ranging menu never exceeds $10 -- you get what you pay for, but it is a good value. There is a nice bar adjacent to the pool area.  Staff are exceedingly well-trained in welcoming and thanking guests.   In the pool area, the noise from the freeway is compounded by the noise of the fountain and continuous music. You need to speak loudly even if you kid is just a few feet away.   Great view of the fireworks from the pool. Don't ever think of going to bed before the fireworks (9:30pm in the summer) -- then again why would you? The fireworks set off car alarms to add to the fun.  The not-as-good" I clipped this from a review below because it
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Hotel Menage and for your detailed review of your stay. Your kind comments regarding the staff and service are appreciated and have been passed on. We hope to have the opportunity to host you and your family again soon!  Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: Stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Menage to visit Disneyland in mid June. I was initially assigned to a ground floor room but requested a room on a higher floor and was duly assigned to room 207. The rooms above the ground floor can only be accessed through locked gates opened by room keys but rooms on the ground floor can be accessed by anyone.  The rooms are located on a long outdoor corridor. My room was facing the 24hr swimming pool however there was no issues with noise. There is free in-room wifi, a fridge, a large screen TV, hair dryer, air conditioning but no in-room safe. The bathroom is small with the basin located outside the bathroom.  It will take 15 mins walk along Harbor Boulevard to reach the front entrance of Disneyland. There is an ART bus that serves between the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here while going to Disneyland.  The pool area is nice, and the room is adequate. The hotel was a priceline win. I had a problem with my room key one morning, and they immediately sent up a maintenance worker (except did they have to do that at 7am?).  The maid service was spotty, one day we got 4 towels, the next day we got two towels and a bottle of cleaning fluid was left in our room.  I could watch the Disney fireworks from the hotel, and its only a quick drive to the parks. The pool area and lobby are nice, but be careful of which side of the hotel you get - it borders a major freeway.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place is perfect for trips to disneyland. The first night we watched the fireworks from the pool while drinking cocktails. Then in the morning we purchased our tickets near reception and got the shuttle to disneyland. It's the last hotel on the shuttle route before Disneyland so it only took about 5 minutes to get to Disneyland. The hotel itself is really clean. ALL the staff are friendly, the facilities are great and the dining/drinking is also good and affordable. The only thing I'd say is if you're not a fan of kids I'd look somewhere else. Didn't bother us so we didn't mind and would highly recommend for families.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value Hotel for Disneyland goers
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary so we would be accessible to the Disneyland parks.  Being the early summer, many of the hotels across from the park were booked.  After reading the reviews of Hotel Menage, we thought it would be fine for us.    It is about a 10 minute walk for adults without kids which was easiest although there is a shuttle that runs every 10-15 minutes if you want to preserve your sore feet.  The rooms were great, nothing flashy but clean nonetheless.  We had a slow draining tub the first day and mentioned it to the front desk and it was fixed by the time we got back to our room at the end of the day.  We had requested a room facing the park which was fantastic as we could see the fireworks so clearly from the balcony every night.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was extremely disappointed with my stay at the Menage.  The two good things were its cleanliness and the beds were comfortable.  However, we stayed there four nights and rarely got enough towels(we had to always ask for more), the fridge didn't open without a fight, and the walls were very thin.  Also, the first day housekeeping came, they took our one garbage can and we had to hunt someone down to replace it.  The people at the front desk were friendly, but they could never answer any of our questions.  I wouldn't ever stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A hip yet relaxed hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here while I attended a conference at the Convention Center. This stylishly redesigned hotel is cleverly tucked between three major highways across from Disnelyand. The tropical pool area is fantastic: waterfall, tiki bar and hot tub. The lounge has groovy niches for conversation. The restaurant is delicious and affordable.  The best part of our stay was our welcome from the friendly staff including Lance. This is a great value for couples and families.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Another great stay at Hotel Menage
Summary: We stayed for the Saturday Angels/Dodger game and first of all what a great staff all around. The live music (Tom Buechi I think) was fantastic. The food was great as always and the place looked great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This hotel is great if you are not a snob.
Summary: We stayed here on 6/16 for 2 nights.Clean,comfortable,and very reasonable! Transportation was no problem to and from Disneyland.Nice pool area! Very noisy traffic but with your door closed it went away. I would stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Value for what you pay
Summary: We came to this hotel based on a recommendation and had a very good idea of what to expect. It was also one of the best deals in the Disneyland area.  We rarely stay at hotels.  We typically try to stay at suites or condos since we have three small children and having a small kitchen is very helpful.  That said, if you can live with a couple of items, I think you will really like the Hotel Menage:  It is on the freeway. It is loud when you are outside at the pool and not so bad in the rooms... kind of a constant white noise with a few obnoxious motorcycles or semis thrown in. When you open the door to your room you can tell the difference... and those fireworks are LOUD. Your kids need to be in a deep sleep before they go off (9:30PM).  It is a motel style layout. That means
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here during Memorial Day Weekend.  We were greeted by the friendly valet staff who instructed us where to park and where to check in.  The staff at the front desk were just as nice and the check-in was a breeze.  The room has a very minimalist design which included no carpet, just a stained concrete slab basically, but we enjoyed the look as well as the very comfortable bed and the nice bathroom.  The pool area had a very nice jungle theme and we really enjoyed sitting and watching the fireworks.  The spa seemed a little small compared to the pool and compared to the amount of people they can accomodate at the hotel, but both were nice.  Having seen the fireworks many times while in Disneyland there is just something beautiful about watching the fireworks and then walking
Manager Response: none

Summary: My sister and I just returned from a 4-day stay at Hotel Menage, while visiting Disneyland, Universal Studios and the outlet shopping mall. The hotel's customer service was excellent, the staff going out of their way to welcome us and make our stay as comfortable as possible. We also highly recommend the hotel's on premises restaurant as a great place to eat.--Affordable prices along with a lovely atmosphere (with special mention of Alberto, our charming waiter ... :-)

Summary: We just got back from our second stay at Hotel Ménage in two months.  After our first trip durring Easter vacation my son asked "Dad, next time we go to Disneyland can we stay at the same hotel again"?    Once again Hotel Ménage exceeded our expectations and gave us another perfect stay.  The hotel offers everything you could want and more all at very reasonable prices.    The restaurant Kya' has a very extensive menu of items inspired from different regions of the world, and the best part is nothing on the menu is over $10 .  And to top that, they offer happy hour prices from 4pm-7pm on select items.  And breakfast... Kids eat FREE!  Room service is perfect.  The same full menu and no additional charges except for the standard 15% auto-gratuity.  Service is fast and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ok stay for an ok price
Summary: My wife and I along with our son stayed at the Hotel Menage for 2 nights while we went to Disneyland and and food allergy conference.  The Hotel is a little older than the pictures look but I was clean and nice.  I called the hotel at 8:00 am asking if I could park there while we went to the park since we were staying there that night.  She said yes and to come down.  She actually checked me into our room at 8:30 am which was fantastic.  The room was nice and clean.  Pillows weren't the best but we usually bring our own anyway.  Pool was nice and service was outstanding. If you are walking to the park it is a short 15-20 walk with pleanty of places to eat if you decide to. The only drawbacks are that you are right next to the freeway so it is very noisey.  Throughout the night
Manager Response: none

Summary: customer service is wonderful it's what every hotel needs, love the fact that the pool is open 24 hrs :) hotel was very clean!!!!!! my room was exactly what i had ask for and the food @ the restaurant was Amazing..I will definitely stay @ this hotel again...

Summary: I really enjoy my stay at this hotel. I stay here with my 8 years old son for 5 nights. Nice room, clean, comfortable beds. Great pool area, exactly as its look on a puctures. Open 24 hours. My son liked the pool more than a disneyland :-). Very clean. Staff is super friendly and helpfull. Hotell located very close to disneyland, max 10 min walk. You can take a shutle from hotel if you like but we walked. Hotel located close to I-5 freeway, but i never hear any noise, when inside of the room.I think its even to your advantage if you like to drive to Holliwood universal studios or see world San Diego. Manager Response: none

Summary: We surprised our daughter with a sweet 16 getaway to Anaheim, CA. to Disneyland. We stayed at Hotel Menage. Our stay at Hotel Menage was amazing, everything that was described by Getaway Today about Hotel Menage was EXACT! The rooms are very clean, roomy, and the comfort of home. We brought our dog, Moses and he was completely welcomed by the staff. Everyone at the hotel was polite, friendly, and helpful. There are a few people that stand out in my mind: Dani at the front desk, always pleasant & greeted us with a smile. Victor the valet parker we did not use valet but he was always friendly and helpful with information. Then Jose Aragon in restaurant, Jose is an excellent server. Everything was wonderful and the pool was perfect. I highly recommend Hotel Menage to others! My one

Summary: We spent five nights in the North American suite while visiting Disneyland for the first time. Yes, the rooms have exterior entrances and the hotel is right on I-5, but once inside the room you forget both! The suite was terrific--modern and spacious, with a comfortable bed, nice living area, and large bathroom with multi-jetted steam shower. The 24-hour pool was great and we had a good view of the Disneyland fireworks from just outside the room. The staff, especially the bellmen/valets and restaurant hosts and servers were friendly and helpful. You can walk to Disney, but we found crossing the freeway entrance/exit a bit daunting and made good use of the ART shuttle. You can buy passes at the hotel and there is a small sign by the hotel drive with a number to text for the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the hotel with my family who visited me outside of stats. We all found this place is really awesome. It's a walking distance to Disneyland, which was our main purpose of the trip. The hotel is nice. I l liked the design of the hotel, it looked like a boutique hotel and our room was nice and clean and spacious for three adults. The pool is really great and you can watch fireworks every night that happen across the street in Disneyland. It's really affordable place given the fact location of the place. Personnel was really nice there. The only drawback i noticed were elevator doors. I'd recommend to have the room further away from elevator otherwise no problems.

Summary: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel Ménage for your birthday. We had a great time.   The room service was great. The food was excellent. Nightlife and poolside great.  We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

Summary: This hotel was perfect for our needs.  Disneyland was only a ten to fifteen minute walk. The hotel is very close to a major highway, but I did not notice the noise inside the room.  The beds slept well.  The service was friendly and courteous.  The pool area was very nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was my second stay at hotel Ménage, and I was again pleased with my stay. It's a short walk to the Disney parks, is reasonably priced, and has great rooms (nice beds, flat screen tv, wireless Internet).  I've found in my visits that there aren't as many kids here, which is fine by me, at least not nearly as many as the hotels closer to the parks. They have a nice happy hour feature, and the pool is open late.  Overall we enjoyed our time there, and would definitely go back. Friendly staff, quick housekeeping and quick access to the park for a fair price. What more could you want?
Manager Response: none

Summary: I admit I was totally fooled by the glitzy beautiful photos of this hotel.  But once I set foot in what is really a very old weary MOTEL, I felt I had been taken for a ride.  And quite a ride it was.  The only thing to be commended here is the fabulous photographer they hired to make this place look magical.  Believe me, in real life it is a solid disappointment.    All the rooms have outside, old motel access through Holiday Inn style doors.  The carpet is musty and stinks.  The bathrooms are teensy to the point you can't get in and close the door without almost standing in the tub.  The towels are thin and small, the old cheap kind of an old Holiday Inn.  The pillows are the cheapest hardest foam  The rooms have been redone, yes, with a nice headboard and a nice vanity, but it
Manager Response: none

Summary: Love this place! It is a short walk to the park, and it is actually nice! It's nice to have a nice hotel near Disneyland that doesn't charge an arm and a leg. The pool is so nice, and it's rare to have a 24 hour one! The beds are sooo comfortable, and the tvs are nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don't let the pictures fool you!
Summary: Booked a room on Hotels.com and treated like a second class person. Upon check in I walked the room to find toe nail clipping's next to bed (should have been easy to see since the carpet was black in color). Bath tub had mold (black in color) again easy to see! I called down to the front desk to talk to a manager, no one seemed to even care-no sorry or I can room move you. The answer I got was all the rooms are like this. I would invest in a vacuum and bleach before I rent a room like that. I even sent a letter and no response! Stay at a Hilton or Marriott there are standards practiced there!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to the park, hip design
Summary: I came with my mom, cousin and uncle to visit Disneyland and celebrate my 21st birthday. The hotel upgraded my room for free for posting on their Facebook page and gave me a $25 gift card to the restaurant upon check-in as a birthday present. So they bought me my first cocktails! I walked to the park with my cousin every morning, mom and uncle took the super-convenient shuttle and met us around lunch. The hotel was very trendy. I liked the way it was designed and it was somehow perfect for children,young adults and adults all at the same time. The pool is open 24/7 which was awesome and the service was great. The valets were extremely friendly and gave us directions to Newport Beach as well. Perfect stay, will come back again and again. Don't hesitate to stay here!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great customer service, clean room and 24 hour pool and jacuzzi. We were able to check in early upon arrival at 10am. There is a shuttle to Disneyland for $4 a day. I would recommend staying here to anyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked accommodation here after stuffing up our booking at another hotel.  We read reviews and were a little worried about the noise factor.  We asked for a quiet room and they were very accommodating.  We loved the vibe of this hotel.  The pool area was great, the internet area was so cool, the restaurant was good - it was walking distance to Disneyland, but the shuttle was handy too.  The rooms were really comfortable for the 4 of us and we were surprised how much we enjoyed staying here.  The price was very reasonable.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay for the whole family!
Summary: We stayed here for our kids spring break. It was awesome! Very clean and modern. We had a first floor room facing the pool, which was a plus. The kids loved the pool. Another plus, we had a clear  view of the fireworks without the crowds. The walk to Disneyland was a little far especially after walking all day at Disneyland, so I suggest taking the shuttle which the hotel sells passes for. We had dinner at the restaurant and it was so tasty. I can't wait to be back in July!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at Hotel Menage 20-26 April 2012, 2 Adults 2 Children. This hotel is right near the highway although with the door closed you could not hear anything. The room was OK, but nothing like the website. The ceiling was leaking from the room above we called reception and they where quick to respond. Had Breakfast and Dinner at the onsite restaurant Kya and both where really good and pretty cheap and Children 9 years and under eat Breakfast free with paying adult.  Disneyland is about 15 min walk and there are plenty of restaurants near by. All in all I don't know if I would stay here again
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at Hotel Menage over spring break. We loved our room and the staff was great! The pool and bar area was a great atmosphere. We had dinner and breakfast at the restraunt and loved the food and service. We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel is average.  It is NOT walking distance to the convention center
Summary: I stayed at the Hotel Menage in May of 2012.  I was attending a convention at the convention center.  This hotel is NOT walking distance to the convention center.  There is a bus that you can take for $4 per day but it doesn't start running until 7 or 8am depending on the day.  The hotel is dated but the rooms are clean.  The hallways and exterior are average in terms of cleanliness.  The hotel is trying to be something it isn't.  They've tried to make the entry and restaurant chic but they just don't pull it off.  They have flowing curtains and a bar.  The hotel is old though...it is dark.  If you are going to Disney, it is close and convenient.  You could walk or takke the bus.  The rooms are okay.  If you turn on the AC, you can block out the road noise.
Manager Response: none

Summary: room was spacious with modern amenities. great location to everything convenient when you were travelling with young kids.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I took my daughter on vacation for her recent graduation from college.  We stayed at Hotel Menage.  Being from Chicago and ONLY having trip advisor to go by... I chose this hotel and hoped I made the right choice.  It was the BEST choice!!!! The staff is amazingly helpful. The hotel is absolutely clean. The rooms are unbelievably comfortable.  Our outdoor bartenders, Ashley and Sean were so accomidating and friendly.  Our flight got in late and we did not arrive until almost midnite.  I could not have been more impressed at the welcome we received!  After 4 days in this beautiful hotel with such amazing ammenities it was time to leave.  We packed in a rush and found out 3 days later that my daughter left her wallet in a hotel room dresser.  It had her checkbook, debit card,
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel many times before and it is always a PLEASURE to stay at. The rooms are above expectation, the pricing is great, and the guest service has always been exceptional. My boyfriend and I stay at this hotel most times we are in town, which is probably about two times a month. It is close to everything and the bus comes right to the hotel and is easy and convenient. The pool is 24 hours which is great! We love the happy hour here, the bartenders are always friendly and the food is good. I recently stayed here the past week and even with high expectations, they were beat. I always book through Hotels.com, and this time when booking I was booking a few different trips that we had planned. When I arrived at Menage to check in, they didn't have my information.

Summary: First off, the staff at this hotel are the BEST. Everyone was very nice, welcoming, and helpful,  especially Leo. The hotel itself is not to fancy, but very clean, decent, and modern. Summary: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The accomodations were nice....but the staff was fantastic. Very nice front desk girl and the bartenders were great. I would recommend it as a good stay for a single traveler!

Summary: the rooms were clean food was good and the valet parking guys were awesome andrew and victor were awesome best guys i have met and the fireworks over the pool were killer thanks again from your friends from CANADA EH

Summary: I like staying at the Hotel Menage when I'm in Anaheim.  It is only about a half mile from Disneyland so it is very easy to walk to. You can also watch fireworks from the hotel.  It is reasonably priced. The Kya Restaurant is fun....it has a great selection of food...tapas....so you can sample a number of dishes for a reasonable rate. Internet was free also.   The young lady who checked us in was very nice. The room was not lush but it was very comfortable and stylish. The bed was very comfortable and there were several types of pillows so it was a pleasant surprise to find an extra soft one. It was very quiet. I know we had people in the next room but I never heard them.  We were in a room that faced the pool. The one thing I wish they had was a refrigerator.

Summary: I thought the lobby area and cafe of this hotel were decorated beautifully, and the rooms were great! I didn't think they were dated at all. I even knew to watch out for it and I warned my friend, but I still ended up forgetting and slamming my shin into the frame which resulted in a pretty gnarly bruise.   The bathroom had a nice shower head that you can change to different settings. I heard zero noise from our room when the door was closed, even though we faced the pool and freeway. Seeing the Disney fireworks from the pool was awesome. The whole pool area was lovely and I liked that you had to have a room key to get into most of the doors and into the parking lot. Manager Response: Dear MojoM, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Your feedback has been recorded, and is appreciated, as we are continually striving to meet and exceed our guest's expectations.  Sincerely, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: We booked this hotel on line purely for price and proximinity to Disneyland and other Anaheim attractions. Granted the hotel has seen better times and road noise can be a distraction. The hotel is definitely not five stars but when you pay under $100 a night, can you really expect more. Jennifer (food and beveridge manager) and her team in the K'ya Street Fare restaurant deliver a delightful range of breakfast, lunch and dinner menus all served with a smile and personal service. Right next to the freeway, and so loud (this was my fault for not looking at map better) but when the fireworks went off in the park we thought there was an explosion going on in the hotel...it was so loud. Manager Response: Thank you for your review. To clear up any confusion, Hotel Ménage was originally built as a Holiday Inn (as stated here on our Tripadvisor page). Summary Heading: Good location to Disneyland for this price
Summary: I booked this hotel through Priceline and didn't find out the hotel name until afterwards. Had to go to Starbucks to have a better conversation without the call dropping out.

They placed me on the 3rd floor, poolside, which also has a view of the freeway. Yes, it is loud when you're outside, but once you shut the door to your room it is soo quiet. The room was really clean and nice, they had the AC on and ready for us since it was a HOT day. The beds were a little weird, they were suppose to be two queen size beds, but clearly one bed was bigger than the other, uh oh well, at least I got a bigger bed! I'd
Manager Response: none

Summary: I would stay here again.  We stayed for one night only, and for that one weekday night (we checked in at 9pm and out at 9am) it was a bit pricey, and the added $10 for parking was a nuisance, however we were allowed to stay parked there until we were done at Disney the next day (Disney was about a 10 minute walk)  Why I would stay again: -really liked the room & bed -view of the fireworks -24 hour pool -would love to check out the restaurant, happy hour and poolside bar.  Ideally I would go back with a group of friends, and take advantage of the fun side of this hotel! As just a place to lay our heads for a few hours, we likely should have chosen a cheaper option, but I'd like to try the amenities!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your one night stay, and encourage you to return so you can experience all the fun amenities that Hotel Menage has to offer.  Our $10 parking fee is low-average for the Anaheim/Disney area; it was our pleasure to allow you to keep your car in our hotel lot after check-out, saving you the Disneyland parking fee during your day at the park (another $15 in the Disney lots). We look forward to the opportunity to host you and your friends next time!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Good hotel but minimal "service" regarding front desk issues.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel (booked through Allegiant Air Vacation packages) for one week.  Due to a "problem" with our booking, our room was not waiting for us when we arrived.  This was, I hope, not the hotel's fault, and they were accommodating because I did have my paperwork with me to prove the booking.  Had I not had this paperwork, I wonder if the front desk clerk would have "found" a room in a full hotel?  We had our tickets to Disneyland delivered to the hotel via Dream Vacation Builders (who were amazingly helpful in all situations).  The UPS envelope with the tickets in them had arrived but the front desk could not find it.  We phoned DVB who had confirmed that the Hotel Menage did confirm receipt of the envelope.  At the end of the day, we got a call to our room to
Manager Response: We are very sorry for the frustrations caused by communication difficulties between the third party travel agencies and Hotel Menage. These instances are very uncommon, but booking travel/tickets with too many "middle-men" occasionally has the potential of falling through the cracks.  I'm glad that everything worked out, and that you enjoyed your Disney vacation after all.  Your comments/experience has been reviewed with our front desk service staff to ensure better handling in the future.  Thank you for your kind remarks, and for choosing Hotel Menage during your week in Anaheim!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I was very pleased by this hotel.Took less than 5 mintues to check in and get our keys even with the clerk on the phone helping other customers.The lobby alone made me feel as if i was in a 5 star hotel.The room was amazing.Had a huge tv,softest pillows and blankets ive ever had in a hotel.The Cafe had great food and fast service.The only problem i had was the $50 fee.It was unexpected and a lot of money.Honestly if i had known about if i would have chosen another hotel.Dont get me wrong this hotel is amazing but paying full price,a $10 to $12 parking fee and  $50 hidden fee is to much for any hotel
Manager Response: Dear William B.  Thank you for your kind review!  I must say, I am a bit startled to hear of this $50 hidden fee you speak of. We do not charge any fee of $50, hidden or otherwise.   This could be a possible misunderstanding - As a standard industry practice, we do authorize a guest's credit card at check-in for $50 for incidentals. Incidentals include, but are not limited to, room service, parking fees, restaurant/bar tabs, etc. If there are no incidentals charged to your guest room at check-out, this $50 authorization is released, and will drop from your credit card statement.  If you feel you have been charged for anything erroneously, please contact me directly so we can resolve this issue as soon as possible. You may contact me by phone at 714-400-9094 or by email at nermin@casaresortsinc.com. I look forward to hearing from you.  Warm Regards, Nermin Khalil Manager, Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Hotel Menage is an average quick place to sleep Hotel
Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Menage for one night.  The room was average, with a king sized bed and a queen sofa sleeper.  The room was rather small.  It was clean, but the shower head in the bathroom was dirty.  I wouldnt shower.  The walkway to the room is dark.  I wouldnt want to walk it at night alone.  Also, the hotel is right behind the freeway, so you hear traffic all night.  I booked this through Hotwire, since it was received 3 stars, I would give it maybe 2.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are sorry to hear your expectations may not have been met, however, our ranking of 3 stars on Hotwire is quite accurately maintained. We offer all services and amenities required of a mid-range 3 star property: on-site restaurant and bar, a great pool area, room service, quality clean rooms and bathrooms, 24hr guest services, on-site secured parking and valet, fitness center, business center, etc. All of this at a low to mid-range price point for our convenient location in Anaheim.  We appreciate your business, and wish you well in your future travels.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: What can I say; this is a gem within easy walking of Disney
Summary: We travel to Southern California every 2-3 years and it almost always includes a trip to Disney for a few days. Out of the many hotels we have stayed at the Ménage is the best so far, and if the prices stay reasonable will probably stay that way as we will continue to use it rather than try somewhere else. Best feature, besides it being within easy walking distance from Disney thus allowing afternoon snooze/swim; the restaurant is great and right on the doorstep. The rooms are very nice, of a good size and clean, the main attributes we look far as well as ‘value for money’.  As some reviews mention, the hotel garden borders I-5 and road noise can be heard but it certainly wasn’t sufficiently intrusive to bother us when behind the high garden walls or in the room with its doors
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here this weekend for a family Disneyland trip. I asked for a room next to the elevator for some handicapped family members and they were so accomodating! Staff was friendly and attentive and the rooms were clean and updated. The location was perfect. It was walking distance to Disneyland, Starbucks, and restaurants. I loved that the pool and spa were open 24 hours and heated. The restaurant downstairs was very affordable and great food. I loved that nothing was over $10 and this included the room service menu from the restaurant.   We only had one small issue. We pulled back the sheets to go to bed and noticed some drops of blood on the sheet. We threw that one on the floor and grabbed the second one as it was 1:30am and didn't want to deal with it. That one had blood
Manager Response: We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you for posting your review.  I want to personally apologize for your having to re-make your bed so late at night. We do have a process for recycling linens, and we are so sorry for the inconvenience caused by our oversight. Your candid comments and kind compliments are very much appreciated, and we are ready to welcome you and your family back any time!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Best choice. Moneys worth every penny
Summary: Best choice for hotel around Disneyland. Clean, quiet. excellent service, compare to hotel Wilshire in LA, that I stayed in las t night. This hotel have very helpfull staff, friendly and courteous. rooms are clean and neat. bathroom is a bit small, buy its ok. restaurant Kyle below is ok except for one waiter who only helpful to Spanish speaking people. Other than that this place is great and will satay and recommend it to my friends .
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Loved the hotel didn't care for the service at the front desk!!!!!!!!
Summary: We arived to the hotel around 11:00am on Friday february 10, 2012 and the front desk clerk was nice enough to let us park early even though check-in wasn't until 3pm but when we returned  around 8:30pm their was a different clerk and he was so rude and very un welcoming  so it put us in a bad mood real quick, it seem as if he just wanted to give us our hotel keys and get rid of us he was an older man in his forties wit a mustache :( but once we got into our room and changed into our swim trunks and went down to the pool to see the fireworks it just made us grateful we picked this hotel even though the service he gave us sucked lol but over all great experience Happy Hour is Great after a long day at Disney land :) I would come back again and one more thing if u like music and a
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your feedback. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our hotel, our pool, and happy hour. So sorry to hear about your experience checking in at 8:30pm... your comments regarding the front desk service have been discussed and addressed. Thanks again; we look forward to seeing you return soon!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Stayed at the Ménage recently. Enjoyed our stay...positives...good rooms, close to Disney..just a 10 min walk, very close to freeway so easy to get around, Starbucks opposite and store, very friendly staff. Negatives..very loud ! Freeway noise is 24 hrs a day ! As a previous comment stated, the door seal ain't great so can still hear noise in the room but you get used to it !
