We had a room facing the pool and the music was a little loud too but stopped early as winter and not too many in the pool at night. Dinner in the hotel was ok.   Overall a nice hotel but get a room away from the pool and freeway if your planning to spend time in the room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! It's always nice to hear our strengths along with our weaknesses, as it provides specific things us to target for improvement. I have passed your comment regarding door seals to our maintenance dept. so it can be evaluated and addressed. We strive to maintain an upbeat, fun atmosphere, as we are located in an upbeat and fun area of Anaheim. We appreciate your perspective, and hope to have the opportunity to host you again!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Rooms were decent. Nightime/weekend customer service was not good at all! All week they had playing loud,and I mean loud rock and roll everywhere you went. Even in the dining room where we were supposed to enjoy our breakfasts! I love rock but not at 7 a.m. when im  trying to have my coffee and eggs!The food was decent priced and pretty tasty. Enertainment was great!!! Great over all service! Good location to Disney Land. But no gas station or much of anything else in walking distance. Located right off of a highway and a busy street. kind of loud
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback. Please know that we have reviewed and discussed your comments. Thank you for your compliments regarding K'ya Streetfare food and service.  Your candor is appreciated, and we hope to host you again.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Hotel Menage was very good value. It is close to Disneyland, is clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast to the room was very good. We were there in winter so not as noisy as the warmer season could be. Pool area is lovely but on Friday Saturday nights loud music is played, while did not end up a problem for us because of the weather (not many people outside at night) it could be for others. We had a wonderful time there and would go back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We look forward to hosting you and your family again :)

Summary Heading: Good Distance to Disney, But LOUD!
Summary: When you first get to the hotel the lobby almost looks lounge/club. Very modern with couches, sheer curtains, and floor to ceiling windows. Then when you get off the elevator there is a HUGE difference between the lobby and the sleeping area. The hallways are all outdoor (but covered) and obviously much older. The major downside is that hotel is directly off the freeway and is loud all hours of the day/night. There isn't great sealing around the door and you can hear the noise come through. The decor inside the room does match the modern lobby, but fixtures in the bathroom are older and very small. The bathtub is very tiny and not very wide. Everything was pretty clean though so if you don't mind the a little background noise then this hotel is good. The restaurant and bar were
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had a Groupon for this hotel for $75 a night, plus 2 free meals in the hotel restaurant. What the groupon didn't cover was parking for $10 a night, but it's gated, and I felt okay with paying that. The hotel itself was clean, and pretty much what you expect for the price. It was by no means a 'resort' but it was a place to sleep after a long day at Disney.  The bathrooms seemed pretty cleaned, but could have been a little newer? I guess that's the best word. It seems like an older hotel that was remodeled in the early 90's.The pool area was pretty nice and the the reception was decorated quite upscale. Our room was right by the highway on the 4th floor, but once the door was shut you didn't really hear it. Maybe it was because I was so tired, but it was very loud with the door
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place for couples going to Disney
Summary: I had seen other reviews pertaining to loud freeway noise and partying.  Maybe those were from people with families.  The presence of a poolside bar as well as the one inside doesn't promote a family friendly atmosphere.  However, we didn't have any problems with noise, and our room faced both I-5 and the pool.  For adult couples and groups, this is an excellent place to stay.  The room was clean, functional, and well decorated.  If you're in relatively decent shape, you can even walk to Disney as we did.  The biggest surprise was the on-site restaurant.  It is really cheap, and the food was so good that we ended up eating there several times.  I want to stay here again the next time I go to Disney.  Don't listen to the haters!
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid comments. We glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and that you got to enjoy the food at K'ya Street Fare. We look forward to seeing you again next time!

Summary Heading: What you see is what you get, great for the Disneyland experience
Summary: Everything was pretty much expected in terms of location, room quality and service. Great for a family wishing to be adjacent to the 'happiest place on earth', roo s are basic but definitely satisfactory. Service a 4 out of 5 as all staff were very helpful in assisting us with all questions and advice on how to get around. Restaurant was also very good with a hearty breakfast menu required for a full day with 30,000 other people wishing to see all the same attractions as you. There's a Starbucks and 24 hour mini mart/gas station right across the road, as well as a discount tickets office for anaheim attractions.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel Menage is my favorite boutique hotel, the staff, the atmosphere, and the consistency this Hotel offers is why I keep coming back. I recommend this place for anyone that wants a quick getaway or even a place to stay at when visiting Disneyland. They have a shuttle that takes you to and from the park, very convenient and it's only $4 for the whole day. I would recommend staying in the lofts down by the pool if they're available, but all of their rooms are comfortable and clean which is very important. Also, their pool and spa area is open 24 hours, how great for all you night owls and early birds. If that wasn't good enough they also have a great bar outside with a great happy hour. Either way, Hotel Menage is a place for everyone to enjoy and relax.
Manager Response: Dear Huntley66, Thank you for your kind words. Your repeat business is so appreciated and we truly enjoy hosting you during your getaways to Anaheim! Looking forward to seeing you next time. Warm Regards, The staff at Hotel Menage

Summary: My wife, 6 year old daughter and I stayed here just after Christmas 2011 and had a great time. The pool and hot tub were great, rooms very clean with plenty of space. The hotel is an oasis next to some busy road intersections but there was very little noise. We were so tired after three days at Disneyland we could have slept through anything anyway. The location was great, you could easily walk to Disneyland, and the shuttle bus did help when our feet got sore after full days. We booked early and got a good deal. Service was excellent. The restaurant was really good, kids eat free off the kids menu, and there was a really good choice of food. This really helped as the food at Disneyland was a bit bland (and that is being kind). We would stay there again. And you don't need a car
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay, and look forward to seeing you again next time you and your family visit Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Spur of the moment Disney trip.
Summary: My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights. (Jan 2 2012- Jan 5 2012) The lobby is excellent! They have a shuttle that can take you to Disney, or you can walk, Its that close. The restaurant K'ya is delicious and affordable and its also in the lobby. The pool and hot tub are open 24hrs and you can take your own beer...(only in cans, no bottles) The room is kind of dingy and the bathroom is worse, but the tv is  decent size. The hotel is very noisy because its right by the freeway, the upside is you can see the Disney fireworks from the balcony. The staff is nice and accommodating. All in all for the price and location I think I would be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel Menage: You Can Do it!
Summary: We were standing in line for the INDIANA JONES ride when we booked this hotel on priceline with my husband's smart phone.     Honestly, we had stood in many lines. It was dark. We were tired.     In addition, we had laid out a great deal of cash to visit the "happiest place on earth" and were looking for a deal.    We wanted at least a three star hotel, near Disneyland, and we did not want to pay over $100 for our room, since we wanted our teens to have their own four walls.    Hotel Menage sounded like paradise.    Three stars, right? ---    In case you did not know, here are some amenities a three star hotel will have: -Near a major expressway ( We were RIGHT near the Interstate 5.) -Near a business center and/or shopping area ( We were just down the street from Disneyland and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Make sure you get it cheap!
Summary: Not impressed with the room.  The bed was okay but the rest of the room left a lot to be desired.  The doorknob on the bathroom door was falling off, the walls are paper thin so you better like your neighbors.  The freeway noise wasn't too bad but if you're a light sleeper...good luck.  For the positive, the grounds are beautiful.  You will love the pool which is open 24 hours a day.  This is useful for those long days at Disneyland.  We didn't have time to visit the restaurants but our friends did and they said the food and service was excellent.  We ended up with a charge on our credit card which we are working to resolve as we had paid in advance.  If you just want a place to sleep and don't mind if it's not luxurious, you will find this hotel acceptable.  Be prepared to pay
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Really wanted to like this hotel, but...
Summary: Before booking this hotel I read a number of reviews here on tripadvisor and was excited by all the positive points (24hr pool, not too tacky, walking distance to Disneyland, etc...) and rejected the negative points as petty and minor.  While all the negatives we noticed with the hotel were pretty minor, they did add up to a less than perfect stay.   Minor problems included: *The hotel shower included a hand wand and regular shower head, unfortunitly for us the shower head in our room was busted so all the water came straight out of the hand wand when turned on and soaked everything.  Not a good start to our stay! Their was no way to turn it back into a normal shower on our own, so we called maintenance and they did come right away and change the shower head for us. *Like others
Manager Response: We'd like to thank you for staying at Hotel Menage, and for taking the time to write your thoughts regarding your stay. We are always striving for improvement and complete guest satisfaction, and your comments are being reviewed and addressed by staff members in the appropriate departments. Thanks again for your candid comments, Guest Services, Hotel Menage

Summary: I am giving this hotel a five star rating.  Not because it is a five star hotel, but rather, it is excellent value for it's price-point.  I'd say it's a solid 3+ star hotel.  It's refreshing to find a hotel in Anaheim that is not pandering to kids.  No cheesy themes here, no free kid meals, etc.  What that means is that the hotel has a fairly 'adult' vibe here (for Disneyland), and they're trying to go for that smaller boutique hotel feel.  The constraints are the age of the hotel and the layout -- it's hard to escape a 'cheap' feel when the doors are all in an outside/open-air hallway.  That said, they seem to be trying really hard to give it a grown-up feel, kinda artsy, kinda chic, kinda modern  Given what they have to work with, they're doing alright.  The lobby is airy and
Manager Response: We truly appreciate your candid review. This is the most accurate description I have read, from a guest's point of view, of our hotel and property. We are definitely a solid 3 star AAA rated property, have gone through many upgrades and remodels, and strive to be a refreshing alternative to all the Disney themed hotels in Anaheim. We've put a lot of thought into how we could transform the property from the former Holiday Inn, into our vision of a larger boutique hotel, and we love how you have noticed the small things that make Hotel Menage a fun place to stay and play!  Thanks again for your comments and feedback, Guest Services, Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, but the Restaurant needs work!!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during the Holiday season.  Room was clean and spacious.  We had a room on the second floor along Harbor Blvd.,road noise was noticeable but did not keep us awake.  Kids had a great time using the pool and the grounds are very clean and groomed.  There is a charge for parking at this hotel but well worth the sense of security.  A room key is needed to access the parking lot.  We were able to benefit from the hotel's on-line special, buy 3 with the 4th night free.  Now the bad, not sure who is in charge of the Restaurant but they need help.  We ate dinner at the Restaurant the first night after a late check-in.  After our waitress brought us our drinks we never seen her again.  After a  15 min. wait we asked a wondering waitress if she would mind
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am happy to know that you enjoyed your stay at Hotel Menage, and have passed on your comments about service to the restaurant. My apologies for the apparent slow service in K'ya during your stay. We look forward to the opportunity to change your opinion about our restaurant during your next visit. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Just got back home after five nights a the Hotel Menage. Our experience greatly exceeded our expectations. We could hear the freeway but it did not stop us from getting a good nights sleep each night. Our daughter loved the pool and we enjoyed the bar and happy hour most days. We walked to Disney 3 of the days without any trouble (12-15 minutes, twice on the last day). After going out for pizza the first night we found that the hotel restaurant offered  everything we needed. The service was good, the selection and taste was excellent, and the prices could not be beaten. Any reservations we had prior to arrival were quickly dismissed. Check In was prompt, our room was basic but clean, and the hotel staff was friendly throughout our stay. For the value I would definitely stay here
Manager Response: We are so happy that we were able to exceed your expectations during your holiday. Thank you for taking advantage of all the great amenities we are so proud to be able to offer - our pool, restaurant, happy hour, etc. Your kind review is greatly appreciated. We will look forward to hosting you and your family again soon!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Perfect for what we were looking for
Summary: There were four of us that decided to go to Disneyland for the day and we needed a clean place to sleep.  My wife and I had stayed here before and we were happy there, so we decided that it was the place for us.  Basically, this is what I like about the hotel:  1)  Walkable to Disneyland  (So you can check in and walk to the park and not deal with paying for parking at the park.)  Also, it should be noted that although you can pay for a shuttle from the hotel, this hotel is the last stop for the shuttle when it returns to the hotel so after waiting for the shuttle and then riding it to the hotel, you could wait up to 40 minutes to get back from Disney to this hotel...Much faster to walk, especially after a long day at the park.  2)  The Rooms are large so you don't feel cramped.
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review and recommendations. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and we appreciate your repeated business.  Kind Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Not a hotel.... this is a motel.
Summary: Though conveniently located near Disneyland, we found this hotel to be less than promised.  First, it is a motel NOT a hotel.  All room doors face a street or freeway.  It is located where two freeways meet with a busy street… within a triangle or traffic noise.    The interior and bar attempt to be cool… but clash with the rest of the outside décor.   The rooms attempt to look like a “W”, but still have hard beds and flat pillows, with no refrigerator.    We kept saying “What is this place”.  Don’t think you are getting a great deal.  You get what you pay for with this one.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here in June and I forgot to write a review, which I will do now because it was my favorite hotel stay in quite awhile. The rooms were clean and large, the exterior hallways were a little strange but fine. The pool looked really nice, but we spent so much time a Disneyland we never swam. It was a very close walk to the park no need to take the ART shuttle. Really nice lobby and computer area. The best part about the whole place though was the onsite restaurant. It was really good, lots of variety and very inexpensive, we ate there for almost every meal and saved a bundle compared with eating at the park. There was a lot of traffic noise and the service was a little bit snotty. It is funny we didn't have a car but the valet's were really nice. Oh we got a fabulous rate
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are thrilled to be your favorite hotel stay! Thank you for your nice compliments regarding K'ya Street Fare; this has been passed on to the chef. We hope to host you again next time you visit the OC. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Menage from 12/19-12/21/11.  Truly a hidden gem, the rooms were updated and clean.  They have a nice restaurant, happy hour offers $5 menu which is convenient for traveling families.  All employees were very helpful and professional, to where I commend them!! The beds are comfortable and all amenities were just perfect.  Highly recommended!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and recommendation! Your compliments to the staff have been passed on and are much appreciated. We hope to host  you and your family again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Thid hotel is priced to appear to be a swanky place. The exterior is very nice, but the interior is that of a cheap hotel.   The bathroom area is of Motel 6 quality. Small shower, drains back up, and it gives you a feeling that it is just dirty.   The towels are thin and small and at might my wife got up to use the bathroom and when she turned on the light roaches fled.   I would not stay here again.
Manager Response: I must say, I am quite surprised to read your opinion regarding your stay. We work very hard to make sure that Hotel Menage offers the most economical rates in the Anaheim/Disney area, and we honestly believe our price point and our 3 star status fairly represent the property, especially when compared with other similar or "swanky" hotels in the area.  Hotel Menage does not have a pest problem. We employ a fantastic team who routinely do what it takes to prevent such problems. This is a complaint I cannot recall hearing from any other guest. I'm sorry that you were disappointed in your stay, and wish you happy future travels. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Traveled here again after visiting 2 years ago. Still a great location with a $4/day shuttle to Disneyland. Breakfast in the hotel was decent. I was a little disappointed that they put us next to the fitness room originally, but they moved us promptly when we asked. I do wish that they'd replace the mattresses. Ours was like sleeping in a bowl. Didn't use the pool this time but enjoyed the trip lots.
Manager Response: Thank you for your continued repeat business. We appreciate your kind words, and are glad that you enjoyed your 3rd trip to our hotel. We look forward to hosting you again. Sincerely, Guest Services

Summary: Overall, the hotel fits more with a Vegas scene then a Disney scene.  There were very few kids around, few, if any Disney props, photos or pictures but there were rowdy parties almost every one of our 8 nights there including one that spilled into the room next door at 4:30am.  Thankfully my kids sleep through anything but I don't.  The highway is very loud but can be muted with the fan from the heater / air conditioner.  The rooms themselves are large and spacious with a large HD TV.   We didn't use the pool or hot tub (due to the cool weather) but they looked nice.  The staff was friendly enough, fixing a few room issues promptly but our phone never did work even though the issue was brought up 3-4 times.  Not a huge issue as we had cell phones but still.  The walk to Disney
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently returned from 2 days at this Hotel and loved it. It was a family trip to Disney and there were 8 of us in 3 rooms. The Staff was friendly, rooms were clean, and walking distance to the park. We had a great stay and would definitely return, they have a nice Happy Hour at the bar every night too!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were lovely and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating! After 4 days of eating in the hotel restaurant, we should all have been sick of the food - NOT!  Everything on the menu was delicious and very reasonably priced! The Tiki bar was a fun place to hang out in the evening and as it's across the highway from Disneyland, we were treated to a fireworks display each evening!  I left some things in a drawer of the dresser and the staff boxed it up and mailed it to me in Florida!  That's a first! There were 30 or so of us staying there, holding a conference.  Only one person complained, but she always complains about EVERYTHING!
Manager Response: It was really fun for us to host your conference group! Thank you for your kind words. We hope to see you all again next year! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We went to Disney for my 33rd birthday & this hotel seemed perfect for us online, & it was "in real life".  Very impressed upon arrival with the decor & relaxing/fun environment & SUPER friendly staff.  The room was nice & the bathroom was huge, but upon closer inspection was in a bit of disrepair.  Small things like lose towel rack & loose screws, etc.  The shuttle to Disney was nice & ran often but not very late.  There was no shuttle to pick us up when the park closed.  The walk was a short 10-15 mins, but the shuttle was needed because of my broken foot.  I wish we were informed about this.  The bar outside was awesome & we could smoke (the pool & hot tub are open 24hrs/day - a rare find), & the lounge inside was relaxing.  The restaurant left much to be desired, but it is
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our hotel and your guest room. I'm sorry to hear that the shuttle did not run as late at you stayed at Disneyland... Unfortunately, the shuttle is not operated or influenced by our hotel, and their schedules are defined by the operating company. Hotel Menage is merely a stop along the shuttle route.  We hope your foot heals fast, and we look forward to hosting you on your next Disney trip! Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: still a wonderful hotel and close to Disneyland
Summary: this was our third time staying at Hotel Menage and it was great! everytime we go to Disneyland we try to stay at a different hotel but keep coming back to Hotel Menage because of the great deals we get! it's trendy and fun and about a 10-15 min walk to the park. the rooms are always so comfy and clean and we've never had any problems with staff or other guests. Thanks Jessica for making us feel so welcomed everytime we check in. We'll definitely always come back to Hotel Menage!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for the price!!!! will stay again
Summary: My husbang and I traveled with our 3 and 1 yr old to disney and stayed in Menage from 23-27. The staff and valet were amazing and so welcoming. We could watch the fireworks from our bed with our kids that were are disney, a tad loud but hey cant beat it right outside window. Also I5 is in back of hotel so that was a little loud, but Food was amazing, Bed was some sort of memory foam and we didnt want to get out of it. Hotel area with bar and pool was out of a resort. We will definitely stay again our next disney vacation! Wish it had more stuff for toddlers though thats the only downfall..that an no free breakfast :(
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is the best hotel for the price. I booked through hotwire it was a (mystery hotel). I was very impressed with the friendliness/ helpfulness of all the staff .The hotel was clean and very comfortable. We will definitely stay here again. This hotel is a great place for families.
Manager Response: Thank  you for your kind review. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay over the holiday weekend, and that we will have the pleasure of hosting you again. Your recommendation is greatly appreciated!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I stayed at this hotel back in Oct for a trip to Disneyland. I was somewhat concerned after reading some negative reviews but decided to see for myself. It defnitely did not dissapoint. Check in was really fast and the staff that I did encounter were very nice. I was a five minute drive to Disney and that's only because of a little traffic. The room was clean, the beds were really comfortable. I was traveling with my boyfriend and little sister and had orginally booked a kind bed with sofa sleeper. To my surprise we were given a double bed room which was fine (awesome for my sister since she didn't have to sleep on the couch lol). It took a while to figure out the A/C control to get the room at a good temperature but I have absolutely no complaints. Also the restaurant was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ok (if you know what you are getting)
Summary: We stayed here Nov. 23-26 2011. We booked it using Hotwire and got an excellent rate. We would have been very disappointed had we paid rack rates. The hotel was clean, staff was helpful and friendly. Not sure why they call this a boutique hotel though access to the rooms is on the outside. The lobby is dark, and is more like a club feel with a bar. Not so sure it's for families, although we did have children with us. We were only there to sleep and shower. The road noise was horrendous, even with ear plugs, which we brought with us, you could still hear cars. We did have a great view of Disneyland fireworks which was nice. We walked to Disneyland one day and used the shuttle the next. Walking was fine but we preferred the shuttle after a long day at the park we dreaded having to
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid comments. Your feedback is appreciated and valued.

Summary: This place is so terrible.  It is so loud.  We had 9 nights booked and checked out after 1 night.  I really hated this place like I have never felt anywhere before.  I would have preferred to fly 14 hours back to Australia and cancel our holiday if I had to stay here.   Arrived at 3pm check-in time.  The room was not 2 queen beds as booked, but just 1 bed.  Had to lug back to reception to tell them bed was missing.  They offered us a fold out bed in another room, I refused as I had specially booked 2 queens and that's what I wanted.  Also I had spoken to Ashley their reservations Manager before leaving Australia to make sure our booking was ready and she said our room would be upgraded to a view room of the pool since we were celebrating.  Being next to the 5 freeway who cares
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've stayed here six times over the last four years.  This year we've been twice, once in July with three kids and my husband's folks and once in October with just the two of us.  We are always greeted warmly and are well taken care of by the front desk staff.  I've seen complaints on here about them but we've never had a bad experience - in fact they've found a way to accommodate each of our requests including changing room categories on one occasion.    The rooms are unique here, modern, dark woods and several with hardwood floors.  The bathrooms are itty bitty but the water pressure is always good and the towels are plentiful (even when there were four of us in the room).  The beds are super comfortable and we always sleep great.  There is a fair amount of noise coming off
Manager Response: Dear Larissamorn,  We truly appreciate your loyalty to Hotel Menage. We have always, and will continue to enjoy hosting you and your family during your trips to Disneyland. Thank you for your kind comments.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: When I called to make a reservation over the phone, I was surprised to hear that the front desk agent did not sound enthusiastic at all nor care about any of my requests. Upon check in, I was surprised that the front desk agent did not greet us warmly and my friends and I had booked about 5 or 6 rooms and they did not accomodate to our requests nor made any of us feel welcome. It was terrible customer service, coming from someone that is a front desk agent at a hotel. I also ate at the restaurant they had downstairs, the waitress messed up our bill and took her an additional 20 minutes to fix it. All the rooms are located outside and I did not feel comfortable staying there. Even though our door was shut, you could hear the wind from outside and it sounded like the door was
Manager Response: Dear Michelle T,  Thank you for your feedback. We have always taken pride in our warm and friendly customer service, and I am so sorry to hear that you were disappointed in your experience with us. Unfortunately, not all special requests can be guaranteed 100%. Regrettably, there were a couple of special requests made by your group which we were unable to fulfill during your stay, and we are very sorry for any inconvenience experienced.  I assure you that customer service issues are not typical at Hotel Menage, and we sincerely value all of our guests and groups. Your comments are being reviewed with staff  members, and a renewed diligence to ensure every guest feels warmly welcomed is under way.  Thank you for your comments, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We were greeted with genuine enthusiasim by the parking and door staff. Andrew, a bellman, commented on our dog, an Italian Greyhound. My wife asked him if he knew of any dog parks in the vicinity. He said the he did not but would ask around and get back to us. The check in staff at the front desk staff was very pleasant and efficient at checking us in and explaining the hotels aminties. Before we could leave for our room, Andrew returned with a print out of a local dog park with some hand written instructions. Very impressive. We were so surprised at the spaciousness and beautifully decorated room. (a single king bed) We were on the ground floor closest to the I-5 Freeway and could not hear any distrurbing noise. The flat screen TV was a great size and was visable from anywhere
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Surprise! Surprprise! A really nice, moderately priced hotel near Disneyland
Summary: Ok:  it's almost on top of the San Diego Freeway, so it's, well . . . loud.  But that's mostly outside.  The rooms are wonderfully large and remodelled.  They are so comfortable, especially the king bed rooms with sofas.  There's coffee in the room, of course, but no 'fridge or microwave.    I brought a group here and heard not a discouraging word - unusual for 60 people.    One of the nicest things is the restaurant, K'ya, on property.  The food is really good, interesting, different. Portions are reasonable - not the huge piled on plates you get at some places - AND, the prices are great.  Most entrees come in at about $10.  I had no problem recommending it to my gang.  The Deli-Sandwich stop is excellent, too.  Immediately across the freeway is the parking structure from
Manager Response: Dear Jazzding,  It was our pleasure to host your group, and we are so happy to hear that everyone enjoyed their stay with us! Thank you for your review, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you all again.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: my daughters first trip to disneyland
Summary: I would like to thank Hotel Menage for making my daughters first trip to disneyland a wonderful experience.  I will definitely look into staying here on the next disneyland trip. thanks again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Made reservation through Expedia.  So, some people exaggerate. Unless I am not that picky.   So the only faults we saw were in the bathroom and one on the head of the bed. My BF works at a hotel in Carlsbad, California, he does maintenance, so of course he was going to notice little things, because he only does this for a living. The tub needed re-caulking and it was peeling. And the toilet paper holder was in a weird place, but whatever, I was able to reach for it. It seemed like they had painted the ceiling and some paint, little drops of paint landed on the head board. But that's it. (Maybe instructing the maintenance people to cover up a little more when doing paint jobs would be good.)  The furniture was in great condition, the bed was very comfortable and the pillows were
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review and feedback. I appreciate your suggestions, and have passed them on to our maintenance team. Your compliments to our valet staff and Lance at the front desk are much appreciated and have also been passed on. Thank you for providing your valid tips and suggestions to other potential readers... very valuable! We hope to be able to host you and  your family again soon.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: My husband and I stayed here while he was at a conference at the convention center. We booked late and this was the only hotel available. The photos online look much better than it does when you get there, but it's clean and relatively updated. It is literally right on the highway, so bring some earplugs. We got what was described as a "quiet room" when we checked in, which meant you faced a main road instead of the highway. To get to your room you walk through stucco like tunnels exposed to the outdoors. I kept getting confused which way to go. All the room doors are on these corridors facing outside. So are two large windows, so be sure to pull the full drapes or people walking by can look into your room. The room itself was much better than we expected. The bed was
Manager Response: none

Summary: Don't count on eating dinner here unless you want a burger. No steaks or real dinner meals. You will have to go out and drive somewhere paying you valet a tip of course. Also I agree with another writer here that said it was noisy. Could not hear the person at the front desk at all. She had to repeat things 2 and 3 times because the whole bottom floor seems to be a bar with a bunch of drinkers! Wonderful. gets louder when they get into the pool area. Coming into the Hotel don't think you are going to park on your own. You either have to use the Valet or park in the throughway and magically know that you are suppose to go inside and ask for a ticket so you can get through a gate out there and park. room is small. The price is right if you have AAA or some discount. Some people
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear of your disappointment with our restaurant and location, however, we do advertise ourselves to be very close to Disneyland and have the distinction of being a Disneyland Good Neighbor Hotel (a location attracting over 15 million annual visitors could very well be crowded at times).   Our restaurant is aptly named "K'ya Street Fare" because we specialize in bringing the casual finger-food vibe from the streets of cities and countries from around the world in off the street. While our selections do include a BYOB bar (Build Your Own Burger)... some other favorites are Tokyo Hibachi Salmon, Honolulu Hearts of Palm Salad, Loas Angeles BBQ Meatballs, Miami Beach Cubano Sandwich, Chicago Spicy Polish Sausage... and there is not a dish over $10.  We don't expect you to magically know things, which is why we have valet and parking attendants ready to answer any questions you may have before you even get out of your car. If you choose to self-park, we have clearly marked parking spaces available to use while you check in at the front desk (our parking lot is for guest use only, and requires a keycard for security). Parking for our hotel is fairly typical for any style of hotel.  Thank you for posting your feedback.

Summary Heading: Great place for a low price
Summary: You can't expect more for the low price.  I recently stayed for 6 days.  Perfect location, clean rooms, excellent service, comfortable rooms and nothing to complain about.  The pricing was excellent with 20% discount from Hotels.com and cost me only $78.00 per day for standard room.  The other patrons were respectful middle class looking folks.  (Important to those who wish to avoid low class people).  All in all, my wife and I were perfectly satisfied and I highly recommend.  (Disregard those other complaints I read about from others who had their own personal bad experiences).
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel for the value, right next to Disneyland.  The rooms were big and spacious and remodeled.  I felt very safe there with my 4-year old son.  We had a great time, and the staff were most helpful.  We stayed for 2-nights.  I might not recommend a week or more, just because there was no refrigerators or microwaves in the rooms though.  Close to the free-way, but you don't get much freeway noise in your room.  You can see the fireworks at Disneyland from the 4th floor balcony.  No complaints!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for my husband's first trip to Disneyland.  I would say it was family friendly without being steeped in more Disney, so I would recommend this hotel for grownups more specifically.  It's a bit of a walk to Disneyland, so keep that in mind when your feet are tired for the trip back.  It's true the fireworks were right there at the pool, so it was wonderful to lounge with a cocktail.  The restaurant was surprisingly good, given the wide variety of food available.  (Usually places that "specialize" in wide variety fail miserably, but not the case here.)  Breakfast could have been fine tuned a bit, I like more frequent coffee pours, and faster service to get the day going.  Hummus plate and smoked salmon bagel were dynamite, but the crab scramble had shell pieces (at
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review! Your compliments and suggestions for our restaurant, K'ya Streetfare, have been passed on to the chef and staff. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay, and appreciate your kind comments.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: This hotel is great.  We stayed here for 3 nights and will stay here again.  The staff was great, loved the resturant. The prices for the food were very good and so was the food, and there was a varitey of things to pick on the menu. It does sit right next to the freeway and it was kinda loud but we were so tired at the end of night that once we shut the door we didn't hear anything.  We did have to pay for parking but it was nice knowing that our car was in a gated parking area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed from Oct 15-22; last minute booking so overall were happy with the hotel.  Bell staff & restaurant staff very friendly.  Maid service was good.  Restaurant food was good & affordable.  Kids had free breakfast if we ate.  City run shuttle to Disneyland but not free and not very consistent with times....we walked most of the time.  We had a main floor room by the pool.  No traffic noise but music playing every night until at least 10:00 and sometimes later as there is an outside bar and sometimes events going on (one night there was a wedding & another night a Halloween party)  Kids enjoyed the pool & hottub but pool was pretty cold.  View of fireworks from the pool area was great but VERY loud.  Had 2 computers for guests but sometimes very slow and wireless network was
Manager Response: none

Summary: overall this was a good hotel there was only 1 thing i wasnt happy with but didnt let that ruin my stay for one i had read that the pool was heated and i was traveling with my 2 kids that love to swim and the pool was like an ice box so everyone was always in the jacuzzi which by the end of are stay need new water but the grounds around the pool where very nice and the hotel is very resort style so if you like music by the pool and a bar by the pool and wanna feel like your in mexico this is the place to be!! overall i would go back we stayed on the 3rd floor and enjoyed watching disneyland fireworks
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Menage over the weekend of October 21st.  Based upon Tripadvisor reviews, we requested a room adjoining the pool on the 1st or 2nd floor so that we could view the fireworks.  When we checked in they had us booked on the 5th floor, but were able to change the room to 2nd floor.  The bell staff and clerk were friendly.    When we returned from DL on our first night around 11:30 pm, there was a Halloween party in the pool area of the hotel.  The party/music was so LOUD that the pillows were actually vibrating!  We didn't need to worry about freeway noise or loud air conditioner noise...   On our return to the room the following evening around 11:30, the toilet was plugged.  We phoned the front desk and they said they would send maintenance if they were still
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Your comments and suggestions are appreciated, and I have passed these on to the various departments within the hotel. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Not what I was hoping for
Summary: Our stay at Hotel Menage was not what I was hoping for. We stayed for 7 nights. The room had only 1 king bed and a sofa bed. The front desk informed us that 80% of the rooms at this hotel have a king/sofa bed so we couldn't get a room with 2 beds, they were all booked. The noise from the traffic was UNBELIEVABLE!!! We honestly had to shout at each other if we were standing outside our room. In the room was better, but still quite loud. The kids had no problem sleeping but I really struggled.  The 24 hour pool and hot tub was a joke! The pool was SOOO cold that not even my kids wanted to go in it. And the hot tub was more like a luke warm tub! It certainly was not the relaxing hot tub I was looking forward to after walking around Disneyland all day. The first night we checked in
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your comments, and in an effort to continually improve our service and product, we have addressed the issues you noted above with our staff.  Thanks again for your feedback, Guest Services, Hotel Menage

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay. We used the pool drily and deck and pool were always clean. We noticed that thete were cleaners always doing something. Food was good and nice selection...my son had pancakes everyday. Had a problem with our rooom key 3 times but they had w tech up to fix right away. I will go back for sure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just love The Menage! Everything about this place is great, especially the beds!!!! The rooms are lovely and spacious, very clean and modern! The staff are very welcoming and the location is within walking distance to Disneyland! There is a diner in the hotel with GREAT FOOD for VERY CHEAP prices! I am vegan and it was no problem getting food here! The waiters are just lovely! Across the road is a Starbucks among a few other take out places. You can not go wrong staying at this hotel!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay, and look forward to the opportunity to host you again.  Warm Regards, Charlotte

Summary Heading: I would never stay anywhere else!
Summary: I absolutely **LOVE** Hotel Menage & their staff! They never disappoint us! Absolutely great customer service, HUUUUGE comfy bed, big spacious rooms, great pool, 10 minute walk to DL, you get front row seats to the weekend fireworks show from your room AND the bartenders are great! They have Pretty cheap prices at the K'ya even though you don't get huge portions- it does the job! The breakfast is DEEEELISH, The atmosphere is really laid back, very modern yet AFFORDABLE! Been there 4 times and would never* stay anywhere else! Stop looking & start booking!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Could do better for the price
Summary: I read all the reviews and was mixed about staying at this hotel but decided to give it a try.  We stayed from Oct 13-17.  We just got back.  It is a very average hotel.  Nothing special about it.  The rooms are small but decent and clean.    We stayed in room 247.  We had to small kids with us.  So we got the room with two queen beds but was given one with two double beds.   The front staff and the valet guys were all very nice.  The food at the resturant was ok - not great.  Nice that kids get free breakfast ! And the prices are great. The second night we got home and there was an industrial fan in our room ... no idea why so we called and they didn't know... but came quickly to get it....??  The walk to Disney is a little bit - up hill on the way there for the most part- and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and feedback. I am sorry to hear that you left unimpressed, but I am glad to know that your room was decent, clean, and that you enjoyed watching the fireworks from our nice pool area. Hotel Menage's unique qualities are not for everyone, and we hope you enjoy your stay next time at the Howard Johnson.

Summary: Mildew and sweage smell so we were transferred to another room. It was dirty and hair was in the sheets. The freeway along side the resort was annoying and we could not sleep. The pool was too cold and the hot tub was too small for how many guests it holds.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel Menage makes going to Disneyland even more MAGICAL. We discovered Hotel Menage the end of October of 2010, and refuse to stay anywhere else ever again when going to Disneyland. The staff, the food, the grounds and the location are all amazing. There is NO BETTER place to watch the Fireworks from Disneyland than from the BEAUTIFUL  pool at Hotel Menage…added bonus…watching the Fireworks from the pool under palm trees and with a Fruity Cocktail in hand! We stayed in a Standard King room that was spacious, very comfortable, clean and quiet. We requested a refrigerator upon check in, and it was brought to our room quickly, and there was no additional charge. The walk from the Hotel entrance to the gates of Disneyland is an easy 15 minute walk…that includes the line to go
Manager Response: Thank  you so much for your loyalty! I enjoyed reading your very detailed review and we all look forward to your return in December.  Sincerely, Charlotte and the staff at Hotel Menage

Summary: This was the first time we stayed at Hotel Menage and starting from the valet guys that greeted us so warmly, to the helpfulness, kindness and professionalism of the registration people, to the outstanding service of house keeping, restaurtant and bar employess, our stay was one of the most pleasant and enjoyable stays we have ever experienced.  Thank you to the owners and management of this establishment.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed four nights at the Hotel Manage for a recent Disneyland trip. The lobby, restaurant and pool areas of the hotel are nice. The restaurant had good food and was cheap. The rooms were in poor repair with paint coming off the walls, drywall seams were cracking. Bathroom part of the room was very old and in poor repair. Free Internet was so slow it was unusable. Water pressure on the 5th floor was so bad you couldn't rinse the shampoo from your hair. The bottom of the shower had some type of liner to prevent slipping but they are glued down and housekeeping does not clean under them. I lifted up the edge and was appalled on what was growing under it. The sheets were not changed daily. The hotel sits on the corner of Ball and Harbor with the i5 freeway on the back side. If
Manager Response: Dear Azbycxdw123,  We sincerely wish you had brought up your misgivings during your stay so that we could have had the chance to rectify your situation. I am surprised to read your comments, and would like to know which room you stayed in; I am not aware of a guest room in this condition, and if one of our rooms is truly in this state of disrepair, we must have the appropriate repairs done immediately!  Thank you for your feedback, and I hope to hear from you personally regarding this particular guest room.  Sincerely, Charlotte Guest Services, Hotel Menage guestservice@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: I liked the hotel, will stay there again next time I go to Disneyland.  The room was clean, decent restaurant and bar.  I would have given it a higher rating if it wasn't for the broken key card reader.  (room 215... Hope they read this and fix it).  We had to insert the key 20 times before the reader took it.  We went to the front desk to inform them of the issue.  They sent a person up there and it opened after his second try and he shrugged his shoulders and said there was no problem and walked away.  Gee, thanks for listening and understanding!  It was annoying to have to try the card reader 20 times in the middle of the night after being tired from a whole day at Disney.  I really enjoyed my stay there and thought the rest of the service was stellar.  Like I said, I will
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I appreciate you bringing the keycard reader to my attention. Upon further investigation, we found the batteries were getting low, causing the reader to function sporadically. After replacement, the reader is functioning with every swipe of a keycard. I am very sorry for the way maintenance seemed to brush you off; there are many instances when a key card is simply inserted incorrectly and he only assumed this was the case.  We have discussed better practices in assisting and identifying with our guests regarding maintenance issues.  I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay overall, and we look forward to welcoming you back for your next Disney visit. Thanks again for leaving your feedback.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We just returned from a stay at this hotel in the last week of sep 2011 and it exceeded our expectations. Highly recommended for couples and families.   Pros: - Large, well-appointed, tastefully decorated room, clean sheets, clean bathroom. The only missing element in our room was a mini fridge but we didn't feel the need for one. - Excellent restaurant. - Courteous, efficient, responsive and helpful staff. - The self-use washer and dryer costs only $1.25 a wash and $1 for the dryer. - The location though not walkable to Disney for little kids, is still convenient with a convenience store and Starbucks across the street, and frequent local buses and Disney's Anaheim transit shuttles getting you to Disneyland within 5 minutes.  Cons - The internet wi-fi signal is weak and slow if
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hi Fellow Travellers We have just got back from a trip to California and this was the last place we stayed before we returned home. Having read the reviews it seemed like a good place to stay with easy access to the local activities (eg Disneyland).  When we arrived we were checked in quickly and given a key to our room where we headed straight away as we wanted to get to Disney asap. The room was not at all what we expected!! It smelt like smoke even though it was a non smoking room and generally looked run down and dirty. There were hairs in the bathroom and we just didn't feel comfortable.  Having resided to the fact that we were only there for one night we headed down to catch the shuttle to Disneyland. The shuttle was not free but at $4 for the day it was reasonable,
Manager Response: Dear KL,  I am sorry to hear of  your dissatisfaction with your guest room on arrival. All our guest rooms are designated non-smoking, and we have always taken great care and pride in the cleanliness of our rooms. If you had brought your discomfort with your accommodations to the attention of our staff, I am positive they would have made things right for you. It is very difficult to solve a problem if a guest says nothing of their dissatisfaction.  I would encourage any traveler to say something if they are unhappy with their room, in any hotel.   The shuttle service to Disneyland is not owned or operated by Hotel Menage. We have no say in the fares they charge, or the timing of their schedule, and we don't believe that opinions of an unrelated business should be reflected in the review of Hotel Menage. We do, however, appreciate your tips and comments; it must be frustrating to wait for a shuttle for 45 minutes when the walking distance is only 10 minutes!   Regarding the mention of a taxi deposit of $11 - we do not charge a deposit for booking a taxi. Shuttle services to the airport require a deposit, but there is no hotel required surcharge for booking any type of transportation. I would appreciate if you could contact me directly to let me know who was trying to charge a deposit for a taxi; this is against hotel policy, and it would be helpful to know who said this to you.  Thank you for your feedback, and I hope to hear from you soon.  Warm Regards,  Charlotte Gulley  Guest Services, Hotel Menage guestservice@casaresortsinc.com

Summary Heading: Wanted to like it, but couldn't quite like it enough to return
Summary: I had a Groupon for this hotel so came here after three nights at the Embassy Suites. I missed the extra bedroom and free breakfast! The vibe here is more adult – there’s a tiki bar outside with lots of smokers, a (good value) happy hour, lots of tattooed singles sunbathing by the pool, and a strange red velvet decorated computer/business center (see photo!) that might be the right ambiance depending on what you’re looking at on the internet, but struck me as just weird. But there were definitely families staying here.  The on-site restaurant has a deli order at the counter menu for lunch, and then the food is brought for you. My group gave the gumbo a thumbs up, and the tortilla soup a thumbs down. The dinner menu looked much more interesting and is is served regular restaurant
Manager Response: Dear Beaglema,  Thank you for your detailed review and photos. You are right, Hotel Menage is not an Embassy Suites, and we do not claim to be. We do, however, claim to be a unique hotel offering a different atmosphere and experience than the chain hotels and motels of Anaheim, and we're glad to hear that you noticed the differences. We also understand that our sophisticated, modern vibe is not for everyone, and appreciate your perspective.  Thank you for your nice comments regarding our restaurant, K'ya Streetfare. We have passed your remarks along to the kitchen and chef.  Regarding the walk to Disneyland from our hotel, I would like to clarify for readers: it is a 1/2 mile walk (approx 10-15 minutes with children) on a pedestrian ramp over the freeway. It is in no way dangerous with or without children, and there has never been any danger in walking to Disneyland. The Disney shuttle bus is not associated with Hotel Menage, they simply offer a stop at our front door; a round-trip day pass is $4 per person.  Again, thank you for your review, tips, and feedback.   Warm Regards,  Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Good value, nice staff but not ideal for families
Summary: I stayed here with my friends for a bachelorette party. We chose this hotel because it provided an party atmosphere that was still very convenient to Disneyland. The $4 shuttle service was very useful and it was also just a 15 minute walk from Disneyland/ CA adventure using a well lit overpass over I-5. From Downtown Disney - it's an extra 5-10 minutes.  The K'ya restaurant was good for it's value. A great menu with a ton of variety. Awesome happy hour deals.  The staff was helpful and very considerate. Unfortunately - I had to ask the front desk to call 911 for a member of my group. The staff was very attentive. The person who represented himself as the owner of the hotel was not as considerate and appeared more concerned whether the hotel had any liability. Lucky for him, his
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I pride ourselves on how thorough we are on trip planning. This hotel was reccomended by a friend that worked at downtown Disney. We read the reviews all over the net, and were cautious about this place when the negatives kept popping up. Upon arrival though, all those nay sayers were silenced when the valets, and the front desk people greeted us warmly, with smiles. Multiple emails back and forth with the manager, Ashley, paid off greatly. Our room request was perfect, bottom floor, poolside. The room was beautifully apppointed with modern designed furniture and a large flat screen tv. The restroom was newer and clean. The couch and bed were very comfy as well. The ipod dock alarm clock with an aux cord was also a nice touch.  The pool area was perfectly designed
Manager Response: Dear Jon and Christine S.,   Thank you so much for your detailed review! Your tips and pointers are very insightful and we are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your guest room, our pool and pool bar.  It was our pleasure to host you, and we are so looking forward to seeing you both again in January!  Warm Regards,  Charlotte, Ashley, and the staff at Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Great if you get a good price
Summary: The location is great - just 15 minutes to Disneyland with little kids. The restaurant is excellent. While close to Disneyland, it's at the wrong end of Anaheim to the shopping malls. The air-con units are old and outdated but on the upside, the pool area and the view of the fireworks are awesome. We'd stay there again if we could get a similar price to this time - $65 per night.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to post your review! We are continuously working to improve our property and guest rooms, and your feedback is appreciated.  I am glad to hear you and your family enjoyed our location, pool area, and view of the Disneyland fireworks. Check back with us often, as we run many specials and discounts, especially in the off season! We look forward to hosting you and your family during your next visit to Disneyland.  Warm Regards,  Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: OK but they can do better with just a little effort
Summary: Plusses - large room, contemporary decor, cheap price, close to Disneyland (10 minute walk), not as noisy as reviews suggest  Minuses - small and dated bathrooms, charge for parking, almost no luggage carts, no free breakfast, free internet did not work in our room (and they weren't surprised when I complained but they haven't fixed the problem), housekeeping banging on the door late at night waking us up
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate that you did not consider Hotel Menage to be as noisy as other reviews have suggested, and that you enjoyed your room and great rate.  All hotels in the Anaheim area charge for parking; our parking fee is fairly standard for the area, being $10 for self parking or $12 for valet. We offer free breakfast for children under 9yrs, 1 per each paying adult.  Thank you for your feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to host you and your family again!

Summary Heading: Convenient to Disneyland and Orange County
Summary: My wife and I recently spent three nights at Hotel Menage and enjoyed our stay. The best thing about the place is its convenience: a great restaurant on site, gated parking ($10 per night extra), and a spacious room. The fixtures were a little unusual and the style added nothing to the functionality. (Shower head too low for this tall man; shower curtain bar was not convex as newer style suggests; sink stopper didn't work well)  However, they all worked.  Could have used more hanger space for clothes, but there was a large dresser and the flat screen television was nice. Bed was comfortable and room was cleaned faithfully. As others have said, this is within an easy walk to Disneyland and just off route 5.  However, it is a bit difficult to find the driveway entrance the first
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was very clean and tidy and good value for money.  Pool area was great and open 24 hrs. Restaurant was very cheap and staff very helpful and polite. Coming for Trump International in Waikiki to Anaheim was never going to be easy but Hotel Menage is good value and will definately come back next time I visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: We're happy to hear that you were impressed with Hotel Menage, even after staying at Trump Int. in Waikiki! We strive to be the best value in the Anaheim area, and are glad you found Hotel Menage to be a good value for your money.  We look forward to welcoming you back for your next Disney visit!  Warm Regards,  Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Clean and very close to Disneyland
Summary: I recently stayed here with my 9 year old daughter and we had a blast. The hotel is geared more for adults but the staff was very friendly, the pool was heated and jacuzzi was awesome. We watched the fireworks show right outside our door, it was amazing. The restaurant Kya was great, and the ART picks you up right outside the front of the hotel. All in all we had a very nice experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best value for the area - 4 star at 3 star prices
Summary: Best hotel in the Disneyland area for sure, I've stayed in a few.  Starbucks is across the street (awesome!) and the restaraunt downstairs is very good.  The outdoor bar has great happy hour specials and the pool area is very nice compared to other hotels in the area. Free wifi and coffee in the room too!  .
Manager Response: Thank you for your insightful review; the local transportation tips are good ones! It is nice to hear how Hotel Menage compares to other hotels in the Disney neighborhood from someone who has experienced a few of the options. We appreciate your kind words and look forward to hosting you again!

Summary: Menage was nice, clean and just a 15 min walk to Disneyland.  Staff was friendly and the price was right.  On the flip side, being on the corner of the freeway and Harbour Blvd, it was very noisy so bring earplugs.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Comfy, Clean, Close to Disney Without Paying an Arm and a Leg!
Summary: Hotel Menage is a surprisingly affordable gem so close to Disneyland!  The room was clean, the beds were comfy, and breakfast was awesome.  We didn't spend tons of time at Menage since our purpose was to do the Disney, but a good night's sleep was had by all and we started the next day of themepark-hopping ready to roll!  The staff was friendly and the pool area was most scenic (as we stumbled by too worn out from our time with Mickey to squeeze in a midnight swim).  The fitness room, although we didn't have time to work-out, was the size of two large hotel rooms rather than the run-of-the-mill one dinky room floorspace and was well equipped, had large windows, plenty of towels and fresh water (that I utilized to fill our portable water supply :)   Would we stay at Menage again?
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good for couples & friends who don't want to be 'Disneyfied'
Summary: Hotel Menage is the first boutique style hotel in Anaheim – I really liked it as it felt different to all the other hotels and would be good for people who were looking for a Disney alternative. I wouldn’t recommend it to families, I personally thought it was aimed more at couples or groups of friends travelling as it was very modern & funky.  The hotel has 244 rooms, some are quite noisy and located near the freeway, others were located closer to the lobby and were more quiet. Guest Rooms can have a Queen/Double, Queen/King or King + Sofabed configuration. There are also four suites – African, North American, Asian & European themed. Our Guest Room was very modern with a 40” flat screen tv and wide range of channels.  It has a 24 hour pool, and you can see the Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel Menage is a fresh, affordable hotel with great rooms, very modern decor and really friendly staff. The pool and hot tub are the icing on the cake. The suites are amazing and have the biggest showers I've ever seen. The staff are all very attentive and warm.  I didn't use the fitness center but it looked clean and well stocked.  While I wasn't going to Disneyland, the hotel is very close to the amusement park - I'll be bringing my wife and son back here for a Disneyland visit.  My only issue is that my IPAD had problems connecting to wifi in the hotel - all up I wish I had been staying more than one night!
Manager Response: Dear mikekb,  Thank you for posting your review of Hotel Menage. I'm glad that you enjoyed your stay... sorry to hear about the difficulty experienced while connecting your iPad to our wireless network.  We look forward to having you stay with your wife and son next time!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Relations

Summary: The room was big and comfortable. We were situated overlooking the pool right on the corner next to the freeway. I was surprised by how little road noise we could actually hear in our room. The pool was clean and big. You could even walk to Disneyland. The fireworks were really loud, however. I think this is because the hotel is situated behind Toontown which is where they are set off from. It didn't wake the kids up, though. We would absolutely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just returned from a 3 night stay. I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised for a 3.5 rating hotel as it was much nicer then expected for the price and after reading reviews from other web sites!!! Could not have asked for more for the price! The property did not look or feel like a motel/hotel with a square pool with a fence in a parking lot basically, as I did see with hotels that were closer and a more known national name brand. This pool is very nice and had a wonderful tropical look and feel. The rooms were clean, comfortable and well decorated. Not like my work travel experiences with Fairmont's, Best Westerns, Clarion, ect.. Which are not nearly as nice as this place.   I am a very experienced traveler both work and personal pleasure and stay at 5 star or better when
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid review. It's interesting to us to hear what a frequent traveler such as yourself thinks about our property. We appreciate your comments and recommendation, and hope to host you and your family again.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I stayed here for 4 nights to do Disneyland and what a fantastic location . Clean hotel rooms and have been nicely refurbed . They offer a bus for $4 pp to take you and pick you up from Disneyland it leaves about every 15mins. The staff were lovely and breakfast was good. I will be recommending this hotel to clients . Thanks for having me !
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Was going to say acceptable up until the minor flooding in our room
Summary: Up until the last night this hotel did the job for what we came for - which was essentially a place to lay our heads and shower in between trips to Disney. The food was okay, the room was okay, there was a lot of road noise but they tried to cover it up with the pool (reggae) music.The last night there the hot water hose broke under the bathroom sink which they were pretty quick to come up and stop before it made it to the main living area. Was a little disappointed they didn't even offer to buy breakfast or offer any kind of compensation after that. Needless to say, we will not be staying there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: a real surprise in this category, i will certainly return
Summary: i needed one night near disneyland for an am meeting the next day and dreaded my options.  i am a frequent business traveller, usually staying at hyatts and sheratons--  soulless but comfortable and no surprises--  wanted something less expensive and something about the menage caught my attention-- maybe just the french name--  it is not for every business traveler, tho, let me warn you-- but if you are tired of the dismal dreary vanilla experience of the corporate chains you should try this--  the red velvet "business center" looked more like a bordello than any business center i have ever seen, but the computers were fast, easy, FREE, including the printing of boarding passes and the environment amusing--  FREE wi-fi throughout the property----  the property itself, being an
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: WE LOVED IT AND WE CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!
Summary: We loved the hotel. I was surprised to hear that it was only 3 and a half stars it was sooo beautiful! The lobby is gorgeous, the pool is gorgeous and the staff was wonderful! From the valet parking attendants who were extremely helpful and courteous to the front desk staff who were knowledgeable, helpful and courteous! The food in the K'ya Street fare, restaurant was very good, and you got a lot for your money! The kids loved the tiki bar and being able to drink their soda's by the pool. They also loved the fact that they were able to be in the pool and see the fireworks from Disneyland! We saw them from various places in the park and in downtown Disney and the pool definately held the best spot to view them! I felt like we were family and I was actually sad to leave! If you
Manager Response: Dear Christine1711,  Thank you for your review. We are so happy to hear you and your family are new fans of our Hotel Menage. We will certainly look forward to hosting you during your next visit to Anaheim!  Warm Regards,  The staff at Hotel Menage

Summary: I chose to spend the night here for the price and location near the Angel's Stadium where I met a friend.  As someone mentioned, you walk outside to your room, which is fine.  However, there are locked gates you have to go through to get to them. The lobby is nice and the restaurant is cheap and good (I had breakfast there).  My room had a horrible view of parking lot, elevator and Freeway!  But that was a minor issue to me. The room was big, with a really nice comfy bed.  The decor was a bit bland.  If I could give half stars, I would give it 3.5, so I rounded up. The pool area was surprising pretty cool, and open 24 hours a day.  I felt like I was at a mini resort!, I hope I don't have to go back to Anaheim again, but if I do, I would stay here again. The Bell hops were
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great street faire dinner menu, Disneyland access, and fireworks viewing.
Summary: Very quiet rooms, considering the hotel sits on the corner of Interstate 5 freeway and Harbor Blvd.  Some guests walked across the freeway bridge right to Disneyland park. The street faire dinner items were excellent, and very reasonably priced. My mom lives in Southern California, and she plans to go back...
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Menage is lucky Yelp won't let me give less than a ONE STAR review..... We booked the Menage through Bookit.com. Good deal, good hotel, good price..... or so we thought. It's listed as a Hotel, however all the rooms are entered through the outside, sure there are locking gates but I believe that's a motel not a hotel. When we arrived, we got a King bed and a sleeper couch. I told them at check in we had two kids and two adults and we had reserved two queens, the girl actually told me that the King bed would accommodate four people if I didn't want the kids to sleep on a sleeper.... as if. I told her we had booked the two queens and she told me that if I looked closely at the reservation and didn't specify two queens then it was their call. I assured her I booked the two
Manager Response: Dear T H,  I am very sorry to hear of your dissatisfaction with Hotel Menage upon your arrival. I can understand  your frustration at check-in, as the hotel is always very busy during the summer months. We will be discussing some alternative ways to accommodate all our guest's needs and requests. Waste Management empties our garbage each day around 9-11am... We apologize for the noisy truck... annoying, but necessary.  You are right; there are 106 hotels in the Anaheim area to choose from, ranging from luxury properties at a luxury price to economy properties at an economy price. We know every style of property or guest room does not suit the taste of every person. At Hotel Menage, we strive for excellence as a clean, affordable, friendly, and unique hotel in a very convenient location to all that Anaheim has to offer.  Thank you for your feedback, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: What a great hotel!  Wanted to get off the strip and find a less congested alternative to the hotels which surround Disneyland.  This place was well priced, the rooms were spacious and clean and the pool was great for the kids and adults alike.  We were a group of seven (kids and grandkids) and the grandkids LOVED the pool. . .you can see the Disneyland fireworks while you swim!  Just a 5 minute drive to Disneyland.  Also has a small deli for the after disneyland need to graze.  Can't say enough about this place.  Go check it out!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here in July with 3 of my girlfriends and we loved it! The pool is open 24/7 so even if you come back late from Disney you can still go for a swim. The hot tub was a great place to hang out and meet people and the reggae music they played was amazing! This hotel has the perfect location for the Disneyland fireworks that happen everyday, you could see them from your room, the balcony, the pool...even better than if you are standing in the crowds inside Disney.  All of the hotel staff that we spoke to were very friendly and smiled when we walked by, and the food at the restaurant was DELICIOUS and very inexpensive! If you are around for happy hour definitely take advantage of that.   Some people are complaining about the loooong walk to Disneyland and I really don't see
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that you enjoyed  your girls weekend at Hotel Menage, and we are looking forward to hosting you again soon.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Hotel Menage

Summary: We stayed here again from May 31, 2011 to June 06, 2011.  As on our first trip, we had a great experience at the hotel.  We decided to stay here because we knew to expect a great service and very friendly staff.  Had no problems with our reservations or the type of room we requested.  We arrived around 1pm and our room was ready, 1 king size facing the pool.  We love the hotel and the atmosphere.  The pool and jacuzzi is open 24 hours.  This worked perfect after spending all day at Disneyland.  We enjoyed the "happy hour" at the pool bar, thanks to the bartender for creating special Martini for me.  We will be back again, hopefully next year. Thank you for great stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice rooms but I wouldn't stay here again
Summary: Pleasantly surprised with the rooms.  When you walk in, they definitely have a boutique look to them -- sharp, crisp, modern.  The beds were comfy.  Horrible water pressure in the sinks -- practically dribbled out.  Toilet clogged a few times for no apparent reason.  The biggest disappointment was the distance to Disneyland.  Everyone has their prioritties about what's important to them in a hotel.  Our big issue is proximity to the parks.  We do not want to pay to park at the Disney lot and then have to shuttle over.  It's a waste of time and money.  AND when you're tired in the middle of the day and want to just nap for an hour or two, it's such a hastle to wait for the shuttle to your hotel, etc.  It's a huge waste of time. Anyway, the walk from Menage to the main gate is NOT
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The very good, the bad and the freeway
Summary: Very good: The staff at the hotel were great, friendly and knowledgeable.  Had a blow up mattress in the room and the maid even made that up for us! Nice touch! Shuttle to Disney very convenient, could easily walk. Pool was fabulous...saw staff cleaning the chairs with disinfectant early in the morning..I loved that.  Bad: Difficulty with reservations. Had about 15 emails to confirm the correct reservations with a staff member of the hotel...not so efficient.  I thought that this experience may be a sign of how everything ran but it was not. Decor is nice but the beds are on a wood frame that sticks out farther than the mattress.  I think that everyone who went in to my room hit their leg on it and it really smarts.  Hotel says they are aware and are working on it...we will see.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Menage in April while visiting Disneyland for 5 days. I found it to be fine, the K'Ya restaurant I found the breakfast absolutely delicious, but the dinner tapas just ok. They are known for their inexpensive dishes at lunch/dinner, but I found it took too long to get our food, and then some of it was cold. We ordered about 7 dishes and the variety was good but quality not great, I would have rathered gone somewhere else to eat.  The rooms are ok, no Microwave or fridge, and they are dated, the updates which consisted of a paint job and new counter seemed a bit messy overall, but let's face it, we were here for Disneyland, so I didn't mind.  It is not a cloe walk to Disneyland, so make sure you know this, especially if you have kids. You need to pass over a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hip, clean, boutique hotel walking distance from Disneyland.
Summary: For what we paid I'm still in shock! This place is amazing and I plan on returning soon. Don't go to Disneyland without getting tips from the front desk (thank you Dani!) and a bus pass. Take a break and lounge by the pool while listening to reggae beats. Shaun the outside bartender was great. Breakfast was perfect with large portions, custom orders, and reasonable prices. Lunch was my only complaint of the entire hotel. I got a to-go chicken salad and they forgot the chicken. I had to turn around, come back, & I didnt even get an -I'm sorry for the inconvenience.  My fault for not checking the order. The rooms were funky cool and quiet. Get the upgrade for $7!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Menage for 8 days in July.  This holiday was my Husband and our grown daughter-----the hotel was nice--not fancy but because we booked the hotel as a "Mystery Hotel" booking, at Book-it.com, we were very happy with the $59 per night price.
