The hotel pool was beautiful and inviting and the view of the Disneyland Fireworks(from the hotel) was fantastic!!!!!  We only ate once, at the hotel, but the meal that we did have was lovely.  The hotel is about a 10 min walk to Disneyland, which, for us, was fine, but if you had small kids, this might be too far for them to walk. The Shuttle does take you right from the door into the Disneyland parking lot so this is not that much of a problem.  The staff, at the hotel, were VERY good, Always helpful and pleasant.  We
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel Menage is for adults. I felt like a bad mother when I saw what was going on in this hotel. I kept beating myself for not looking at any reviews before hand. Per our arrival some drunk girls coming from the club/bar approached my husband asking him if he wanted a date. I had to cover my 16 yr old eyes because these girls had no self respect showing nimples and all.   Parking was HELL.. pay the extra 2 bucks its sooo much easier. I think this is why management did it like this.  Beds: Beware the bed frames stick out at least 3in on all ends leaving alot of stub and bleeding toes.  Overall this hotel is clean and the beds are comfortable but as a mother of teens I think a better choice would of been better.  Towels: Rough and short
Manager Response: Dear preciousmommy44,  I am so sorry to hear how your husband was approached by the girls leaving the bar area... such inappropriate behavior is not acceptable at our hotel, which is probably why they were leaving! We don't really have an enforced dress-code for hotel guests and restaurant/bar patrons, but it sounds like it might be worth considering. I assure you this is not a common occurrence at Hotel Menage, and most guests really do consider our hotel very family friendly.  We are glad to hear that you found our property and guest rooms clean and comfortable, and hope that you will consider staying with us next time you visit Anaheim.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Fabulous pool and restaurant, so so room,more coffee please!!
Summary: OK first of all when I go to Disneyland I need coffee and several full caf cups!! I have come to expect either makings for a small pot of joe in the room or lobby coffee. There was one single serve cup of regular,one decaf-worthless for a day of Disney with my 7 and 10 year old!! The best thing here is the pool, its so warm and large and tropical with Reggae music to drown out the freeway beyond. Perfect for viewing the Disney fireworks, just as promised. I was not into the pool bar, but many others were, and they seemed annoyed with the kids as they were there to party. Also on Sun nite there was shouting and laughing at the 24 hr pool at 3 AM. On Mon morn, I really needed coffee!! The restaurant breakfast is very good and reasonable for park area,one kid free per adult.
Manager Response: Dear hart4july,  Thank you for posting your review of Hotel Menage. We appreciate your feedback, and we are glad to hear that your children enjoyed their time spent here.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Expected a lot more than what we got.  The hotel pictures are not what they appear.  I thought this hotel was an "indoor" type of hotel, not a "motel" looking one.  The pictures make it look very very elegant, but it's just an OK type of place.    The sheets in the room are the same ones, they don't get washed, i know this b/c i had spilled mascara on the sheet, and that very same evening (after the bed was all made up ), the sheets had the big black spot for the couple of days stay.  The shower head came undone as well.  Felt like a run by motel type place.  The pool area is loud with both guests and music playing into the wee hours of the morning.  The only reasonable thing about this hotel is the restaurant on site, it's pretty decent food at a good price.
Manager Response: Dear Flowers0529,  We are sorry to hear that Hotel Menage fell short of your expectations.   Along with many hotels across the nation, it is our policy to launder guest linens every 3 days for those guests staying multiple nights. We believe it is our responsibility to minimize our impact on the environment, and this policy helps us reduce the amount of water, energy and detergents we use daily. If  you would like your linens changed more frequently, we are happy to honor your request. We prominently supply a card in every guest room quoting this policy and the instructions to place the card on your pillow in the morning. All linens are changed immediately after a guest checks out, as cleanliness is one of our top priorities at Hotel Menage.  Thank you for your feedback, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: the physical appearance was awesome. viewing the fireworks from the pool was the best! But the pool water tasted as though it hadn't been changed all summer! It was extremely salty; it didn't smell of any chemical, just tasted absolutely horrible though.The maids were very nice, quick, and efficient. Although the girls at the front desk were wearing see through shirts all 4 days we were there, I'm a mom and didn't appreciate that.The mgr was very polite. Overall, the visit was pleasant for the price. Had I paid full price I'd be more upset!  Also, Disneyland was much further than their website advertised. This was confirmed by the employees themselves! I was vacationing there specifically for Disneyland and picked them because it was advertised as 1/2 mile away, this was untrue
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Another Great Stay at the Hotel Menage
Summary: This is our fourth stay at this hotel and we love it, the location is close to Disneyland, and the rooms facing the pool have the best view of the fireworks from Disney!  The happy hour food is really good, can't beat the price! We had 5 rooms and all of my family was satisfied!!! They continue to have a great rate!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pictures and the claim of "boutique" make it look and sound great. In reality, this is a tired old motel with some fresh paint in the common areas. Look past the shine and you'll find:  Parking - costly and not convenient to the rooms if you choose to save a few bucks and self park (not free but at a reduced rate from the valet option)  Smell - due to parking, came in through the back. Clearly where the trash is taken, it was stinky and the elevator around back was gross.  Pool - many of the furniture pieces were broken. Numerous wicker tables had uneven stance due to one broken foot of the table. Obviously the attempt to use duct tape to fix these wasn't working well.  Room - just had an old appearance. Lots of dings/dents in the walls, the bed I slept in seemed to be quite old
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A good hotel, trying hard, just one problem
Summary: I have to say, the Menage for me was memorable, it is somehow 'different' from the rest, it doesn't at all seem to fit the generic hotel template. Memorable in a good way, but not the sort of memorable that is 'wow'.   The building itself has a very unique character, a motel style layout which they have blended with stylish and chic decor. There is no doubt that the fit and finish is relatively good, most people will be very pleased with the feel within the rooms, restaurant and bar areas. The hotel is centred on a plus outdoor area with swimming pool and hot tub, sun loungers, and palm trees, contemporary minimal tunes play throughout the grounds.  Consider all of this, set against the stark physical location of the hotel. It is very much on its own, surrounded in all four
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: comfortable place to stay... if you can use the bathroom safely ;)
Summary: We enjoyed our stay for 3 nights. The rooms are big enough and beds are comfortable. It's near to the freeway but our room was on other side so it didn't bother us. The staff is helpful. Also, it's near to DisneyLand , I wouldn't recommend to walk if you have small kids, you can take bus , it's quite convenient , 10 mins ride.    But few things that bothered me were -  (1) Bath tub was not coated with anti skid, my 5 years old Son slipped and fell. Wife was about to slip as well . (2) No Refrigerator and Microwave ( may be true for all the hotels in this area) (3) I had to pay for parking ( may be true for all the hotels in this area)  Overall .. a  comfortable place to stay ... if you can use the bathroom safely ;)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We loved the view of view and will be back soon real soon
Summary: It was a great price great rooms great view like the flatscreen tv loved the it all it was a great location no far from disnyland or other attraction in Anaheim California the best of it all wore the 24 hr pool service it was amazing
Manager Response: none

Summary: reservationist meet online rate; quick checkin; shuttle (pay only service); room was clean, comfortable, wish there was a refrig (but think I could have asked for one); staff quotes walk to disneyland 10-15 mins, more like 20 but not bad (didnt have small kids to carry); POOL is awesome spot to watch fireworks; POOL bar has great happy hour specials.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lovely Trip and a Great Place to Stay
Summary: My wife, daughter and I Stayed at Hotel Menage this past week.  As part of a Disneyland trip, I would highly recommend the Hotel Menage.  The rooms were clean, the atmosphere was enjoyable(almost had a sort of Hawaii feel), the personnel were caring and professional(Dani at the desk and Jake and Joe at the Valet were outstanding) and the restaurant was excellent and reasonable. Room- Very comfortable for 3 people.  We had a King Bed and a sofa sleeper.  The bed was very comfortable and the sofa sleeper was more than adequate. Check in- Smooth and seamless and in fact, by far faster than our last stay at the Disneyland Hotel. Atmosphere- I would categorize it as primarily family oriented.  There are 2 bars, one poolside and one next to the restaurant, but there was no drunken
Manager Response: Dear kocenfamily,  Thank you for your review. We are so happy to hear that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay at Hotel Menage. Your kind remarks about our staff members have been passed on and Dani, Jake & Joe have been recognized for their efforts. It was our pleasure to host you and your family, and we are looking forward to hosting you during your next Disney trip.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We stayed one night at this hotel as part of our Disneyland vacation in July. I had booked this hotel using a third party travel site. We stayed  on the pool side. This hotel is rated as a 3.5 star hotel, mainly because they have a restaurant and pool. But in  my opinion it is a dressed up motel. I did like the modern decor and the rooms are not bad looking at all. But the bathrooms really need some attention as they need to be updated.  Pro's: Nice decor throughout the hotel, my fave hotel coffee (Rainforest..yumm) , awesome tiki themed pool..very nice! The restaurant was great as well. Cheap prices and good food! Cons: bathrooms need caulking, pool side is ridiculously loud! You WILL hear the freeway!! When I asked for a pool view room I was reminded by front desk and Asst.
Manager Response: Dear DisneyMomma74,  We are glad  you stayed with us during your visit to Disneyland, and appreciate you taking the time to write your review. We take all guest feedback seriously, and consider your comments valuable to our continuous effort to improve our property, service and amenities. Your review has been discussed and addressed with maintenance and front desk staff.  Thanks again, and we hope to host you again, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: we spent a week here with 6 other family members mid july and everyone in our group were happy with this facility.it is within walking distance to Disneyland and it is a great place to view the fireworks.  the hotel kind of has the feel of a all inclusive resort.most of the familys with small children seemed to be having a good time.  the restaurant in this facility was excellent with great value for familys and seldom very busy.  my only real complaint was the hotels proximity to the freeway.the only thing separating you from I5 is a 10 foot wall .otherwise you are literally on the side of the freeway.   the noise from this is constant and loud to the point of having to raise your voice to talk over it around the pool area.this is not a problem in your room which we found very
Manager Response: Dear Sunbuns,  Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear that your group enjoyed staying with us. It is nice to hear that you found your guest room to be very quiet, considering our close proximity to the highway. We sincerely hope to have the opportunity to host you and your family during your next Disney vacation.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: No good, quiet rooms. This place is just loud due to the adjacent freeway.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I was not wild about this hotel.
Summary: This hotel was not my favorite.  The rooms and furniture seemed really outdated.  Our room had a weird smell from the air conditioning.  We were only here one night so we did not make a fuss.  The pool area was nice.  I probably would not stay here again given the noise level and the proximity to the freeway.
Manager Response: Dear Rachsticle,  We are very sorry to hear that Hotel Menage was not your favorite, but we appreciate the high marks you awarded us for service. We wish you luck in finding your favorite property, and are grateful you stayed with us this time.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: What a pleasant surprise!  This place was part of a package deal so didn't expect too much.  It was fantastic!  Yes, it is on a freeway but the noise didn't bother me --Service was great, although you do sometimes get different answers depending on who you ask!  Food is  great and reasonably priced.  My picky daughter ordered one thing at the pool side and the bartender noticed she wasn't eating it so he brought her something else --no charge!   Bathrooms are huge and loved watching the Disney fireworks from the pool each evening.  Very friendly staff.  Am considering coming again this Christmas.  Can't wait.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel, good price, perfect for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights here with our 8 year old son, in a king room with sofa bed, whist visiting Disneyland.  We were very impressed overall with the hotel, especially considering the price we paid.  Staff throughout the hotel were very pleasant and helpful.  The room was clean and spacious, and the bed was very comfortable.  The decor was fine, although some of the paintwork was a little tired, but that really didn't matter.  The fact that the pool was open 24 hours was fantastic.  We were out all day at Disney, so didn't get any chance to use it during the day, but being able to come back from a long day walking round and still use the spa to soak our tired limbs at 11pm while our son had a dip in the pool was a huge bonus.  The public areas were very nice - clean,
Manager Response: Thank you for posting such a comprehensive and candid review of you experience at Hotel Menage. We always strive to offer the best value in accommodations in Anaheim, and we appreciate your comments. We are very happy to hear that you were able to take advantage of our 24hr pool... your reference to "soaking your tired limbs" after a long day at Disney is exactly why we keep it open so late!  Thanks again, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: This hotel is only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and offers all of the amenities you could ask for at a very affordable price. They have a full service restaurant as well as room service that offers breakfast, lunch & dinner. They also have 2 bars (one in the lobby & one by the pool). Every night we were able to watch the fireworks in plain view from right outside of our room. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Boutique style well worth a stay
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised by this Hotel . It was better value for money than the others in the area. The Hotel is boutique style and has a great looks and rooms. The pool is 24 hrs and has the warmest water I've ever experienced. About 15 mins walking distance to Disney and very close to main arterial routes to visit all attractions and beaches. Good value.good rooms, trendy looks but like all the other hotels in the area some traffic noise. Staff friendly and very helpful. Definately one of the best in the area as a base to visit south LA.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel itself is quite nice- comfortable rooms, great pool (very tropical), and friendly staff. I requested a fridge before we arrived, and was told because we were staying for 7 days we would have priority. It was delivered to our room the next morning after our late arrival. The biggest problem with this hotel is that the pool area is right next to the freeway. We had a pool view, but on the 4th floor the noise from the traffic was so loud. Luckily the air conditioning drowns out the noise in the room. The walk to Disneyland is only about 15 minutes, but next time I would definitely stay somewhere closer on Harbor Blvd, right near the entrance.
Manager Response: Dear Tamhic,  Thank you for posting a review of our hotel. We are happy to hear that you appreciated our property and your guest room. We understand that, for some guests, our convenient location to the freeway and Disneyland can also be a little disturbing with the traffic noise, however, we are glad you didn't find it to big of a nuisance once your air conditioner was turned on.   Also, thank you for leaving a "Room Tip", as this is very helpful to others who use TripAdvisor as a hotel shopping tool.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: My daughter and I stayed here for two nights.  We found the room to be nice and the bed comfortable.  Staff is friendly and efficient.  Best Feature:  The hotel restaurant is an excellent alternative to Disney dining.  You can purchase a hamburger meal for $6.95, be waited on and sit in air conditioned comfort or if you prefer at the Tiki Bar next to the pool. It was convenient to leave the park and take the shuttle back to escape the midday heat.  As billed, there is a terrific view of the fireworks from the pool.   You can hear a lot of highway noise when sitting pool side, however, I found that once in our room it was not a factor.  I would definitely return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have a great time with our children, ages 1.5 and 4. We loved our time by the pool both in the morning and afternoon. The food was great and the  in-house restaurant had a wide variety with very good pricing. Our room location was fantastic and we were able to watch the Disneyland fireworks from our balcony. You can also see them when you are pool side.   The shuttle was convienent to use to and from Disneyland and our daughters had a blast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was great!!! We requested a pool view and were able a room on the third floor. My daughter who is turning two had a great time at the pool and every night we would watch the fireworks from Disneyland while in the pool. The water was very warm so we stayed there during late hours. We would also order food from the deli / restaurant and the food was delicious. For the price that we paid for this hotel, it was hands down the best in the area. I highly recommend this hotel for everyone. Also, Disneyland was a very short walk away and I will be staying at this hotel every time we come back to this area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Value Hotel in Good location to Disneyland
Summary: We had a lovely stay here at the menage, we arrived early first thing in morning after a long flight and they took care of our bags for us until our room was ready for us, Front desk was very helpful explaining shuttle service and booking transfer transportation. Hotel is located opporsite disneyland but it is a decent walk to disney entrance we walked it twice okay and twice took the shuttle bus which picks up out the front every 15 mins it costs $5 for an all day pass each and picks up and drops off to only three hotels including menage which is good. Hotel has a good vibe with background reggae style music a lovely tropical pool area with balinese bar hut area and a afforable resturant. The good thing is if you don't feel like a heavy american breakfast from hotel starbucks
Manager Response: none

Summary: When I travel I look for a hotel that stands out. All hotels have beds, tv, etc. When I look for a hotel I look for people. At Hotel Menage I get great service by all. Just ask Lauren at the desk. She made my last stay outstanding. Very helpful and curteous. Thanks for another great stay!
Manager Response: Dear Gorilla6981,  Thank you for your nice comments about our staff. We will make sure Lauren is recognized for her efforts to provide excellent guest service. Thank you for the "shout-out" :) We are looking forward to hosting you again soon!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: The only reason we booked here was because my husband's mini-reunion was held in one of their function rooms.  $275+ for 2 nights plus $20 parking for 2 days.....I probably could have gotten a better deal elsewhere.  I requested a room with a view of the pool not realizing that it was next to the freeway; I would have appreciated if they warned me about it.  Good thing the AC kinda drowned out the noise from the freeway, so we were still able to sleep well.  Pool was open 24 hours, fireworks from Disneyland can be seen from the pool area. The room was really nice but the tiny cockroach in the bathroom was a major turn off! And they did not have free wifi :(
Manager Response: Dear Fuchsiapower,  Thank you for your candid review. We are so sorry to hear about the insect in your bathroom. We take great measures to protect our property and our guests from these little annoyances, but despite our best efforts, it seems one "slipped through the cracks!"   We DO offer free WiFi Internet access in our guest rooms and public areas. Information about this is in each guest room, and any of our agents would have been happy to assist you with access if you were having difficulties connecting. It is our pleasure to make each guest's stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible, and if you ever need anything, we hope you will feel free to ask for assistance.  Thanks again for your feedback,  Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We liked the Hotel Menage. It was not stuffy or overpriced and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have experienced. Although it is very close to Disney, we still took the convenient shuttle to save energy for the park. The on-site restaurant, KYA, was very good and has been written up in local zines as a "hidden gem" - and we would agree. It was also not overpriced. Because Disney is located between two very busy highways, it was a little loud but not to the point that it impacted our stay. The staff was very helpful and nice. I would also like to say that the pool area is gorgeous and very relaxing. I would recommend this hotel to a traveling family who wants to get the most value out of their Disneyland trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. We take a lot of pride in Hotel Menage, and your comments about the pool and restaurant are greatly appreciated. We will continue to strive to be the best value in the Anaheim area, and hope to host you and your family again.  Warm Regards,  Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We stayed at the Menage for 8 days in June 2011.  With 3 teen/adults and 2 pre school children and my husband and myself this hotel, was ideal for our family.  The staff were always helpful and friendly.  The rooms were clean and comfortable after a long day walking at the theme parks.  The location to Disneyland was great.  We never walked, the shuttle is much easier with small children, but it is walkable,probably take 20mins. The check in and check out was fast, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Pool facing rooms block out the freeway noise.  Across from Taco Bell, Starbucks and Conveiniance store, which is handy if staying longer, Request a fridge- no cost.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A touch of Hollywood swank amongst kidville at Disney with cool rooms, nice pool (and pool bar) and great food!
Summary: We've stayed here a few times. The rooms are clean. Beds are comfy. Service is great/ friendly/ helpful and the restaurant is always a delight. They have a varied dinner/lunch menu and a very good breakfast. Would be nice if they offered a free kids menu but still worth it for a nice meal (ESP if you are headed to Disneyland and will be eating nasty park food the rest of the day). An easy walk to/from the parks. Pool bar looks fantastic but we are always exhausted when we get back so have not been able to enjoy. :(.  A visit brings back the feelings of single or pre-children nights out. We need to find another reason to be in Anaheim (other than the mouse house) so we can really enjoy it all! Wonder if they offer babysitting?! They should!
Manager Response: Dear westsidecarrie,  I'd like to thank you for your repeated business with us. It is always a pleasure to host you and your family at Hotel Menage! I am a little surprised to hear that you are not aware of our "Kids eat free" special during breakfast: During our breakfast hours, one child per paying adult eats free! I hope you are able to take advantage of this money-saving offer during your next visit.  Thanks again for your valued business, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: went there with my boyfriend to stay the night so we could go to Disneyland early in the morning.  Wanted to get to DL in time to get a fast pass for the new star tours.  lame, i know.  We got in at around 6pm.  We booked for 2 queens incase our friends decided to drive up the same day as us.  When we were in line, there was a FD agent with a family and she had to let them know they didn't have anymore rooms with 2 queens, just the 1 king and 1 pull out.  She looked stressed and the family was SUPER disappointed.  she made them happy by lowering their rate.  When we got to a different FD agent, again, booked 2 queens but only 1 king available to give out.  It didn't matter too much b/c i found out our friends were just going to arrive in the morning, but it would have been nice
Manager Response: none

Summary: We checked into Hotel Menage on Monday and checked out on Saturday morning.  Our stay was pleasant and we would stay here again.  We were traveling with a nine year old and a three year old child. The Room:  Our room featured a king bed and a sleeper sofa.  I doubt that an adult would be able to sleep on the hideaway comfortably for more than a night, but for kids it was great.  The bathroom is small but large enough that you can kneel on the floor to bath a small child and the handheld shower nozzle is wonderful for exactly this purpose. The Service:  The staff is young and friendly.  They were happy to provide us with directions to local attractions, tickets for the shuttle to Disney (worth the $4/adult, $1/child per day), and always greeted us when we came back to the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: So I have mixed feelings..The staff is nice, rooms are clean and modern,there is a heated pool and hot tub. I read the reviews and I like to be open minded but sorry to say its true. yes you can see fireworks and also HEAR them..It sounds like bombs going off..no joke. My kids are afraid to come out of room and see fireworks. If u have kids its not within walking distance. The pool is great but hot tub is yucky..There was lots of foam at top. Yes it is party area all night since there is a bar and 24hr pool. That did not bother us at all..Unfortunately you can hear all other noise like people walking down hall,elevator opening,etc.Seems like sound echoes alot in the building. There is a parking fee..The hotel was not horrible but not great. We got a good deal on hotwire but
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm 18 and travelled with a 19 year old, and the design of the hotel get like it was really aimed for people my age. Very trendy decor, and all young employees to match. None of the receptionists or concierges seemed too involved in their job, but we didn't have any problems. The rooms were very comfortable and felt clean. The business center is very chic and convenient (they let you print for free). One complaint: someone puked in the ashtray on my floor and I had to notify the front desk. However, that's sort of the nature of the hotel, considering the popular bar and lounge. A tolerable walkto Disneyland, though much longer than I expected. I would recommend this hotel for twenty-somethings, but not at all for families with children.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: decent for the price but loud
Summary: if you are coming to disneyland and want a nice hotel about a mile or two from the park with killer fireworks views, hotel menage is the place for you. if you want peace and quiet then unfortunately not so much.   the hotel is right next to a very busy freeway, and the rooms are open air (akin to a motel's rooms, with the front doors outside). the rooms themselves are actually nice, with modern decor including flat screen TVs.   the best thing about the hotel besides the location was the 24 hour pool/spa. with lots and lots of families coming to the disneyland area to visit the happiest place on earth, kids abound throughout the property but thankfully most of the parents seemed to be responsible and had them in bed by 11.   overall i recommend this hotel for any family looking
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had three rooms for nine people including three school age children and a toddler.  The staff was wonderful.  The restaurant's food was reasonable and enjoyable even when serving a large group. Jessica Kim, at the front desk, was delightful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice lobby & pool.  Rooms on the other hand were awful. good job to marketing team for putting up nice photos on website. but room just didn't look clean & bathroom was quite filthy - motel quality.  Our room on freeway side are terribly loud.   Next time, i would definitely stay somewhere a lot closer to Disneyland - which still is they GREATEST adventure park in the world!
Manager Response: none

Summary: It was clean and neat. The only nuisance was the noise of the cars going by on the next interstate that was fairly loud and might keep light sleepers awake. However, by turning on the air conditioner, the humming of it would mask the other car noises. We liked the hotel. The early AM wake-up call was a PERSON knocking on the door! We never had this personal touch before.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised.  The last time I stayed here was when it was a Holiday Inn, coming back this time the rooms were really nice, modern, large lcd tv on the wall so it didnt take up space, pool and lounge were great. i was very happy and will stay here most definately next time we go. And it was very reasonable!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice lobby. Nice pool area. Aweful service. Asked for a fridge when we booked and they said call the day we are getting there. We called, no fridge. We asked again for the fridge and nothing. Finally got one after we called the front desk AGAIN. The tile and counter top in the bathroom was nice, but it looks like they spent all their money on that because everything else was cheap as it comes. The bed frame was splintering and the paint patch jobs were aweful. The toilet paper holder was hanging off the wall and they did an aweful job of cleaning. The glasses had an oily residue on them and you could see a film when you put water in the glass. The front desk staff was not friendly and refused to accept responsibility when we notified them that electronics had been stolen from
Manager Response: none

Summary: Me and my girlfriend stayed at hotel menage in june 2011. Pool area is nice but we booked a king bed room but got a queen and handicap room! Service was terrible, bad mood and not willing to help! Got my iPad stolen from hotel menage too. Called for room service to get my room cleaned and left my iPad on the bed and when we came back later that day the iPad was no where to be seen and we looked all over the room. So we went down to let the hotel know and they barley helped and did anything and blamed it all on us and said they couldnt do much. So we looked all over the room again on our last day and couldnt find it so told them again and wrote a report and all they said was well there was only two keys using to your room, your key and the maid, so its pretty damn obvious that
Manager Response: none

Summary: After reading other reviews I was worried about bring our 2nd grader and our high schooler to this hotel. We found the hotel to be a perfect balance of kid friendly stuff to do and a place for quiet time for us at the end of the day. If I had one bad thing to say (ok, maybe 2) it would be about the pool and room towels...yuck! The bathrooms in the rooms need upgrading too but the beds were quite comfortable and I found the hotel to be quiet and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I definately would stay here again and would recommend this hotel to friends.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: More like a motel than a hotel
Summary: My husband and I stayed here whilst visiting Disneyland for two days. It is literally right next to a busy freeway, and as the rooms all open to an external corridor, expect to hear the hum of traffic quite loudly all day and all night long.   The lobby was boutique, but that was about it. The bed was uncomfortable, the bathroom was far too small and the bath had mould around the seals. The internet was free, but it only worked sporadically.   That being said, it is only a 5 minute walk to Disneyland and it is usually a lot cheaper to stay in than at a Disneyland resort.  The valet staff were super quick and attentive, and at $12 a day, you can't go wrong there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We did a short trip (2 nights, 1 day at Disneyland) and I found the hotel to be nice. I rate it average because nothing was overwhelmingly good or bad about this hotel. The staff was courteous, the room was very clean. There were some common areas of the hotel that made you realize it is older (the elevators, some of the pool gates) but the lobby is really nice looking and I liked the modern styled rooms.  The menu to the restaurant looks really good, and I think we might check it out when we are in Anaheim again.   The downside is that it was a loud hotel. With the AC wall unit blasting, it ALMOST hid the sound from the pool/bar area. We were directly over the tiki bar and there were some people really having a great time; I may have even went down there to join them in the wee
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ok if you are READY TO PARTY!!!
Summary: So we had stayed at the Menage before and had a fantastic experience. However our last stay with them was not exactly so great.   --First of all, is the name. Every single one of my friends snickered when I told them where I was staying. Aside from that, the hotel itself is pretty and open. There is a little too much emphasis on the bar and lounge area, but the deli is a nice touch. The restaurant is amazing for breakfast, but scattered for dinner. I had spaghetti that was great, and chow mein that was disgusting.   --The rooms are a great size, and the beds are wonderful. But we were traveling with a very active fourteen month old, who is not content to just sit and not touch. The beds have very prominent, sharp edges to them. Even after covering them with towels, I still
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend for our disneyland vacation. We drove in pretty early around 11am so we weren't sure if we would be able to do an early check-in. We were, which was nice. The staff was very friendly from the front desk person to the valet guys, all very very nice!! I can't say enough about how great the staff was, they made us feel very welcome!  Our room was just like the pictures, very nice and roomy. The only downside to the hotel is the location of it, the highway noise is pretty loud, which was a little too much right when we got there and made me second guess staying there but after awhile we didn't really hear it anymore. We had no problem sleeping at night.  Their pool was big and was very nice but we didn't get to swim because it wasn't
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Pool - not quite a "boutique" hotel - but nice!
Summary: My husband, daughter and I stayed here in May 2011 during a Disneyland vacation.  The pro's - beautiful 24 hr pool and hot tub with lots of palm trees and seating. Very nice. Also an outside bar that served food  - the gyro was delicious. Beware though we got back from Disney around 11pm and they stop serving pretty early so no food for us. Restaurant on site where we ate breakfast every morning - very good and reasonably priced.  Within walking distance to Disney - however, at the end of a long day it was just easier to catch a cab and pay $5.00!  Cons, rooms are very basic but clean, internet was extremely slow and sometimes would not even connect. My husband had to do work and this was impossible. Beds were ok, worse things about them was they had a huge frame under them that
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our stay in Disneyland and had a great time. It was a bit of a walk to get there but shuttle buses come every 20 minutes. Because the hotel is in the middle of 2 busy roads and one freeway  the noise was a bit too much, however when you closed the door to the room it did block it out.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Outstanding stay, relaxing, very nice suprise, the kids had the time of their life
Summary: The hotel was perfect. I had kids 8,12,13 and they lived in the pool. Really quiet to have a 24 hour pool. 24 hour access to the pool with Kids is heaven.  We stayed downstairs right by the pool and it was great.  The rooms were really cool, comfortable. We were suprised by the fireworks at the end of our dinner. The amazing view of the fireworks were better than being at Disneyland. The food is great, a free breakfast for the kids is helpful. I will always try to stay at the Menange providing the price is right. I planned on a one day and stayed an extra day to enjoy the peace, the WARM POOL and the food. SOoooo relaxing. 5  stars from me and my girls!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived at Hotel Menage after a 15 hour Amtrak train ride.  The front desk worked hard to get us right into a room--even though it was only 7:30 in the morning!  We loved our room--we have never had a room with one king bed and one queen bed.  The pool area was not loud at all.  The freeway noise was not even an issue!  Staff was great!  Restraunt was great!!  Also--ART serves this hotel with two different busses--we never had to wait to catch it.  And..the walk to Disneyland is all downhill if you do want to walk.
Manager Response: none

Summary: it was overall a good stay. the rooms had an urban feel to it with exposed pipes (i don't think they were real working ones, may be just there for decor). It was kind of ugly. The name doesn't really shout family friendly either for being so close to Disneyland park. It is literally a hop and skip away from the disneyland parking lot so it is very convenient. I believe there is a shuttle, but we chose to drive there since we get free parking at the garage. Price was just okay. Had a resturant/lounge there. Right off the I-5 so its easy to get to.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Family Friendly with a chic feel, close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Menage during a recent family trip to Disneyland. The hotel is very close to the park entrance. Shuttles run every 15 minutes or so and you can come and go as much as you want. Adults ride for $4 a day, kids $1.  The hotel is the last stop of the shuttle on the way to Disneyland which great on the way there but a bummer on the way back to the hotel!  Ok, it's a bummer but not that bad!  Pool is great. Lobby, restaurant, and bar areas have a trendy feel, which is a nice change of pace from Disneyland. We actually wrote a review of Hotel Menage at FamilyTrek.org and you can read our full review at http://bit.ly/muRNBL
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: nice hotel, but couldve been better
Summary: I've researched alot of hotels before I decided to book this one. I decided on this one for the price and location.  First off, it seems pretty close to Disneyland, close enough to walk. Don't. Take a shuttle,though the hotel itself doesn't offer a shuttle, disney does I'm not quite sure how often disney's shuttle comes by but while we were waiting for our taxi we saw 3 shuttles come by within a 20 minute duration . Just like a couple of the reviews you may have read on here, people tend to hit their shin on the bed frame. It's almost inevitable to run into it, both me and my boyfriend ran into it. On another note the room I stayed in did have bed bugs, the bites showed up the day after I left the hotel. However I was the only one who was bitten (countless times) there's bumps
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best Hotel at the best price
Summary: Like most people I like to read reviews before I book a hotel and I am frankly amazed that anyone could leave a negative review on this hotel. From the moment we walked in the door we were treated with warmth and great service. We were upgraded to a suite and it was truly fantastic! The pool is wonderful, the outside bar great, the restaurant great food and great value for money and shuttle to Disneyland easy! Whats not to like? We were very pleasantly surprised for the quality we got for the price and we will always recommend this hotel to friends and family and will stay here whenever we come back to Disneyland. Thank You to all the great staff at Hotel Menage!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: THIS IS NOT A FAMILY HOTEL!!!!
Summary: THIS IS NOT A FAMILY HOTEL!!!!   I cannot say this enough.  If you want a very loud, VERY LOUD, hotel that has a lot of drunk people yelling in the hallways, then this is the place for you!  The hotel itself has a really nice lobby, pool area, and restaurant, but that is it.  The rooms remind you of a roach motel that has a recent paint job.  Very small, no fridge, and extremely loud!  Did I mention the noise.  This is my 4th night here, and I have barely gotten any sleep.  Last night I had to call security because a couple of drunk guys were yelling profanities right outside my door.  Really wanted my kids to learn those words!  Also the website says kids under 12 eat free at their restaurant.  They failed to mention that it is one kid that eats free with each paying adult.  We
Manager Response: Dear Jakeh56,  I can understand your frustration with the guests who were yelling profanities outside your room - you were right to call security! We do not want people like that staying at our hotel, and we pride ourselves on our distinction as a "Disneyland Good Neighbor Hotel." We do consider our hotel to be family friendly, and it is very unfortunate that you had unruly neighbors during your stay. I assure you this is not a common problem, and again, we thank you for letting us know about the disturbance they were causing while you were here.   It is true that children eat free in our restaurant, K'ya Streetfare - for each paying adult, one child under 12yrs eats for free. Our menu is very reasonably priced and this is a great value that most other hotels in the Anaheim area don't offer. It is also true that we charge parking fees, however, we try to maintain the best rates for parking in the Anaheim area. While some hotels charge up to $25 per night for parking, we only charge $10 per night. The added bonus is that you don't have to pay for Disneyland parking ($15) because we are within walking distance!  Thank you for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Not Bad, but Not Quite as Expected
Summary: This "hotel" is technically a "motel" since the room doors open to the exterior of the building rather than an interior hallway. I had no idea about this and wasn't expecting it, and was rather disappointed at first. The rooms are clean and nice, but the outside isn't very homey-feeling.  Staff was friendly upon check-in (only time we ever really had communication), although the lobby area is very noisy at night-time with people drinking and loud music. Location was close to Disneyland.  It was not a kid-friendly place. I would not recommend that you bring children here. The night we arrived (Saturday night) there was a lot of loud partying going on in our surrounding rooms. It was very hard to sleep. The other 2 nights the sound was much quieter - maybe because there wasn't
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice comments and for your feedback.  It is true, we do have outdoor corridors. This is a very typical feature of many hotels in Southern California, and especially in the city of Anaheim. I'm sorry you were unaware of this feature of our hotel. I have reviewed the many photos posted on Tripadvisor by other past guests, and I see that our outdoor corridors are pretty obvious on this website; however, you have helped us to identify the need to post more photos of the outside of our property on our own website, as well as sites like Expedia and Hotels.com.  We have many different types of travelers who stay here for many different reasons: families, business travelers, couples, wedding groups, bachelorette parties, road-trippers, and amusement park-goers, just to name a few. We are sorry to hear about the noise (loud partying) coming from rooms near yours on Saturday night.  We are always happy to quiet someone's party if it is going too late, or if another guest calls in the disturbance. We want all of our guests, no matter their reason for traveling, to have a great time while visiting our hotel.  Thank you for your valuable feedback, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you again!

Summary: I really enjoyed staying at Hotel Menage.  The Valet greeters were very nice and friendly.  The staff was helpful.  I enjoyed the style of this hotel.  It is pretty much a fancier best western.  I don't get all the negative reviews because in Anaheim, theirs no really nice places to stay besides the Embassy suites and Disney Properties.  The walk was about 10 minutes to Disneyland.  The restaurant kya was also great, I enjoyed the Hawaiian cuisine since i'm from hawaii.  I always plan my annual disney trips either staying at Disney Properties or this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: If this hotel were a person, it would be a prostitute.
Summary: The window dressing (lobby) looks good in photos, but inside the rooms it is a disgusting Motel 6!  The poor attempt to decorate this as a Boutique Hotel is pathetic!  There was no wireless access in the room and I had to sit in the lobby to get service on my iPad.  the noise level is horrid between the freeway, the loud heater, and the music.  Do NOT stay here!
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear of your obvious dissatisfaction with your recent stay. We would have liked to hear of your concerns during your stay so that we could have had a chance to address them with you personally in order to make your stay more enjoyable.  Internet access is typically good here, and if there is an issue with connectivity, we like to be notified while you are here, as there may have been a technical issue which is quickly and easily fixed.  Hotel Menage recently went through a multi-million dollar renovation in which we upgraded the bedding and furniture, replaced the TV's with 40" flat screens,  among many other upgrades throughout the property and pool areas. We are disappointed to hear that your interpretation of our hotel is "a prostitute." While we take all feedback seriously, we believe this statement is a bit dramatic and unfair. Your comments will be addressed in our next operations meeting, as we are always working to improve our guest experience.  Sincerely, Charlotte Gulley Guest Service Manager, Casa Resorts Inc.

Summary: This was my first stay at the Hotel Menage but it definitely won't be my last. From the moment we checked in we felt we finally found our favorite hotel in Anaheim. This isn't your normal Disney hotel. This place had so much style and was so sleek. The staff was so friendly and made sure we had everything we needed.  Our room so nice and modern, we had a great view of the pool and the beautiful trees out our window. Friday night we were treated to the most amazing fireworks show ever right outside our room, opened the door and just right in front of us....a free show! We oredered from the downstairs restaurant K'ya Street Fare, what an amazing menu. The menu offered any and everything you could ever want...especially at 10 pm. The chicken nachos were huge and did't get
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Menage perfect for both business and pleasure...
Summary: I stayed at the Menage for three nights both business and pleasure - one day at Disneyland/California Adventure and the rest of the time working.  Traveled with a friend.    The hotel was pretty much perfect in every way.  Anaheim is filled with less-than-stellar hotels, and the Menage is as close to perfect as you're going to get.  Staff was very friendly, parking was a BREEZE, the food in the restaurant was great and affordable, and the pool area was very nice.  If you're planning on staying there, check in early enough to catch the fireworks at night from Disneyland, they're launched from right across the freeway and explode pretty much over your head, they're close enough to feel it in your chest!  If you're going to the parks, you just walk over the freeway overpass and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed with our family (7 adults) while we enjoyed a long weekend at Disneyland.  We got a great rate at Bookit.com and for the rate, I'd give the hotel a perfect rating.  The hotel lobby is designed to have a nightclub feel and there is a bar just off the lobby, outside near the pool.  We spent nearly all of our time at Disneyland so we didn't use many of the amenities.  The hotel is 5 stories and the rooms are motel-like meaning the halls are open to the outside and you walk past room windows.  Our room overlooked the street side (not the pool) and the hotel is literally located next to the 5 freeway so you get a bit of traffic noise.  It's very constant but is low enough that it isn't disturbing; not one person in our party was bothered by it.  The rooms were
Manager Response: none

Summary: I will admit I was worried about this Hotel from the reviews..but when we arrived we were satisfied..  This is our seventh time to Disneyland.  I wanted a sheik hotel cause I was so tired of tan and gold cheessy hotels.  We have stayed everywhere.. Hotel Menage was perfect I will not go anywhere else and the price was perfect..We stayed in the loft, king and queen bed it was perfect. My sister in law stayed in smaller room which was just as nice.  My kids are 14,12 and 9 they loved it.  The 24hr pool was perfect after a long night at disneyland the music was loud but the next night it wasnt but we did not notice the music in our room.  We watched the fireworks from our room which was amazing.  We ate dinner at the Hotel Restaurant which we were not impressed my 14yr old ate the
Manager Response: none

Summary: You can take the shuttle or walk as it is so close 10-15 mins max. We actually enjoyed the walk :-)
Manager Response: none

Summary: After pondering over largley outdated hotels for our Anaheim trip I stumbled across this gem, and we were not dissapointed! The location was fantastic, a ten minute stroll or a very short bus ride away to Disneyland. The hotel ammenities were fantastic, my husband loved the gym and I often sunbaked by the pool listening to the background music. Upon checkin we were told our room was not ready, after explaining we had just arrived off a 13 hour flight from Australia she went out of her way to accomodate us a room early (much appreciated). The rooms were always exceptionally clean, and the cleaner always left a thankyou note for my tips which I appreciated.  Yes it is next to a highway which is noisy, what highway isn't noisy? Once you close your room door you cant hear a thing.
Manager Response: none

Summary: First of all, I've never had a hotel charge not only the full price of your stay up front, but a $50 PER NIGHT deposit for "incidentals," whatever those might be. I have to say that the website is very misleading, as far as I could tell we would be staying in an actual hotel with doors facing inwards, not a glorified motel with no insulation to keep out the noise from the freeway it sits next to. I'm currently still dealing with their pending charge for the 2 night stay in the room this past weekend, including the extra $100 tacked on for no reason whatsoever. Self parking was not included in the rate, either. The room itself was barely clean, with the previous occupant's hair still sitting in the tub and on the floor of the bathroom, and a urine puddle on the back of the toilet
Manager Response: Dear Chynna75,  Per industry standard, we indeed authorize each guest's credit card for their entire stay when they check in. It would be detrimental to our business (and any other hotel in business) to give room keys to a guest without first making sure they can pay for their stay.  The $50 per night authorization is for any possible incidentals, including, but not limited to: room service, parking charges, restaurant charges, in-room movies, telephone use, etc. If you charge nothing to your room, the authorization is voided and returned to your credit card. This is also a standard operations procedure in the hotel industry, although the dollar amount may vary at different properties.  I'm sorry that you felt misled by our website regarding the style of our properties architecture. We do have photos posted on our website which show that we have outdoor corridors. This perspective is most clearly shown in the photos of our pool area.  Regarding your comments about your room being barely clean: We take several steps in preparing each guest room for arrival and ensuring the quality of cleanliness. After a room has been cleaned, it is inspected by housekeeping, then double-checked by the housekeeping supervisor before being released for the next check-in. There are rare instances when something is missed, and if it is something as you mentioned above, we would hope the guest would bring it to our attention so that we can immediately address the problem. However, we did not hear from you regarding your concerns about the cleanliness of your bathroom. I am so sorry, and disappointed to learn that it was not up to our standard. I have brought your comments to the attention of our housekeeping supervisor and staff members, and a renewed vigilance is being applied to room inspections. Thank you for your feedback.  Sincerely, Charlotte Guest Services, Casa Resorts Inc.

Summary Heading: You could't pay me to say a bad thing about this place!!
Summary: From the time I got out of the taxi til the time I left 6 days later was amazing. Great property, great staff, great food and met great people! Felt like I was somewhere exotic. I travel alot and this was one of the better properties I have stayed at. Would recommend it to anyone and would DEFINATELY stay here again!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We were so happy to host you during your week in Anaheim, and we would love to see you next time you visit Southern California.   Warm Regards, the staff at Hotel Menage

Summary: My 15 year old son and I were due to stay here for 3 nights, we stayed for 1, we both hated the place. From waiting several minutes to check in while the receptionist answered the phone in preference to dealing with actual clients, on the walk to our room  there was a tray of food left outside a room that was still there 24 hours later, the horrendous and continuous  noise from the 10 lane (concrete) highway that runs along the length of the hotel, the background music that tries to contend with the highway noise, the lack of wi-fi access,  the building is more like a multi-story car park with dark dead end corridors and this was the only hotel out of 7 we stayed at during our road trip that charged for parking.   The only plus side was its location to Disney, a 10 minute walk.
Manager Response: Dear Huntvambo,  I am very sorry to hear of your dissatisfaction with our hotel and location. Having the advantage of being close to Disneyland comes with the convenience (or disadvantage - depending on perspective) of being near the I-5 freeway. In an effort to eliminate surprises, we have made sure that our location is clearly shown on all of the maps associated with our web advertising and points of booking. With this map feature, a person can see our physical location prior to booking their reservations.    Regarding parking fees, I can assure you that it is not uncommon for hotels in the Anaheim area to charge for parking. Our parking fee of $10 (self parking) or $12 (valet parking) is clearly stated on all our points of booking, and is the same cost or lower than all other hotels in the area.   It is also very common in Anaheim, for hotels in the same price-range as ours, to have outdoor corridors. We do our best to keep our corridors clean, open, and well-lit for our guest's safety and convenience. Since your review, we have spoken with our room service and housekeeping staff about keeping all corridors clear of room service trays - a tray in the hallway for an extended amount of time is unacceptable, and we appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  Thank you for your feedback,  Charlotte Guest Services, Casa Resorts Inc.

Summary: I recently stayed 4 nights at the Menage with my husband, 21 year old daughter, and three 20-something adults at the Menage.  The bright spot was the hotel staff.  Everyone was very friendly, and accommodating.  We had reserved a room for 3 girls and a room for 3 boys.  While the lobby tried to fulfill the "boutique" reputation, the rooms were tiny and tired.  The flat screen was nice, but the veneer on the doors was peeling in both rooms, and the bathrooms were very tight.  The pull out couch that each of us had one person using was pretty torturous.  We were disappointed in the lack of microwave and room fridge.  We were looking forward to the spa, but the first night had floating scum and too many people.  The second day was cleaner, but unless you were there very early in
Manager Response: Dear SenoraFlora,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We take your feedback seriously and have discussed your observations with our maintenance team. Steps have been taken to address these issues. Regarding your comments about our spa - we understand that sometimes it can be very popular and quite crowded. Please know that we have both our pool & spa cleaned regularly, and that we take extra steps to ensure water cleanliness, especially during such crowded times. We want all our guests to enjoy these amenities, and we take pride in the cleanliness of all aspects of our property.  Thanks again for your feedback!  Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: The staff were very helpful I had read some not so good reviews about this hotel but I would dismiss them as I found it great place and very well priced. The happy hour drinks and meals were very good also the restaurant was well priced. Just don't go to Taco bells across the road from the hotel the food is disgusting. Remember to watch the fireworks down by the hotel pool every night from Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel recently to awake with bites over my stomache in chest.  I was treated for bed bug bites.  The mattress was stained and yellowed.  This hotel is a must avoid.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked this hotel based on the mostly positive reviews.  When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised.  What a great hotel, clean, nice, inviting, friendly and affordable!  The food in the restaurant and pool side was great!  We especially enjoyed the happy hour by the pool each day!  Who doesn't like a $5 menu for drinks and meals???  The room was nice, the only downfall was the old bathroom, but that was so minor!  The pool was clean and open 24 hours.  The view from the pool to watch the fire works was spectacular.  There was some highway noise but again so minor.  Book this place it is so worth it and within walking distance to Disneyland. (12-15 minutes with a 5 year old).  The staff was very accomodating, we had a great time!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for 9 nights in July 2010 and thought it was a great hotel. The restaurant , in particular, was excellent. The food was of a good quality and very reasonably priced with large portions; we chose to eat there most nights. The pool and bar area were excellent too - from 4-7pm there is half price drinks and snacks. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are basic but practical. Beds are large and comfortable and they were kept very clean. The TV was also a nice addition. There are two communal computers with internet access but there is sometimes a short wait for these due to high demand. Disney is about a 20 minute walk from the hotel and this is a really good option for families to stay as it is not too far away but is great value for money. We didn't visit
Manager Response: none

Summary: Took my 5 year old and my friend with her 5 year old. I have been to the Menage 7 times now. This is first time for my bff and her daughter. HAD A GREAT TIME!!! She was so impressed by the service. She travels 1 week of every month for her job, and said it was the best customer service...ever! We got our daughter's bubble guns, and low and behold, they needed batteries and a screw driver to open it. Well, the maintenience man was coming up for another reason, the sink, and we mentioned it to him. He took them and not only opened it for us, but put in batteries!!!! Frank at the bar was awesome as always. He made the girls custom made sundaes and we felt like we were all on vacation. As soon as we walked in from long, a rainy day from Disneyland, he was there to greet us with a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You have got to be kidding me!
Summary: A hotel obviously attractive to Disneyland travelers and families decides it is going to renovate and become a Vegas style nightclub? I have never (including Vegas) stayed at a hotel in which the pool is open 24 hours and music plays on the intercom outside all night! Drunk fools all over the place mixed in with families on disneyland vacations is quite a weird mix. We had some sort of weird orgy like party going on in the room next to us and we had three different answers from the staff about the loud music outside our room. One staff member said they didn't know how to turn it off and another said they can turn it down upon request but not off!! We are talking 3:00 am in the morning and many of the rooms are surrounding the pool area!  The walls to the room are paper thin. The
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you're looking for a reasonable place to stay near Disney Land--this is a the place. The resort is with in walking distance. It's really close.  The hotel is clean, you can watch the fireworks from the hotel. Better yet, they have a great cheap restaurant on the premises. You'll appreciate this after a long day at Disney or right before you have to go there, because both dinner and breakfast are great.  In all. it's a great place.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We wont be staying here again!
Summary: Claims to have plenty of microwaves and refridgerators but during our stay we were told they only had 3 and people with disibilities and illness had senority. Claims to have comp. wifi service and were told some rooms didn't get it. Also some staff was really rude. Seems that all the staff had different answers to all our questions. Bathroom was super tiny and really low water pressure. When we returned home we were charged $115 more than our departure invoice so we are still trying to figure that one out......we wont stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place was really nice. We arrived at 10am and they were able to check us in early. Front lobby staff was very helpful with our check in and bags to our rooms. The ambiance and interior decorating was really modern. The food at the restaurant was absolutely delicious!! Rooms were quite even though we were right next to the freeway. First day we walked over the overpass to Disneyland, and it honestly wasn't that bad. The rest of the trip, we took the shuttle. All together, we are DEFINITELY staying at this hotel again. The price was a great deal compared to the overpriced hotels across the street from the Theme park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My girlfriend and I decided to spend Christmas day at Disneyland and while that might not have been the best idea I've ever had, our hotel stay was great yet again!  This is the 5th or 6th time that I have stayed at the Hotel Menage and everytime has been great thus I keep coming back for more. I usually drive in from Vegas in the early morning and each time I have arrived well before that check in time and everytime I am able to get a room immediately. The staff is great and he location is perfect. Walking distance to the parks and a 5 minute drive to Angels Stadium. I will be back over the summer!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I'm a big hotel reviews freak and I give this place a 2 thumbs up!
Summary: We got in a little early and the girl was very nice and checked us in and we got pool view second floor, awesome could see the fireworks from our room. The music in the pool area is a little loud for some other people but it shuts off at 9 and stays on in the bar area inside only, which by the way the bars are a plus happy hour, cool music and super friendly bartenders. The only thing I recommend is get the valet parking its only 2 bucks more and you don't have to worry about looking for parking since its a little tight on spaces. The restaurant is so good an affordable I recommend the chicken nachos excellent :) I most definite will stay here again my 12 year old daughter loved it and will bring swimming attire next time since the pool is heated and open 24 hours.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beds were soft, very clean, decor a liitle to dark. Poolside music was blaring from roughly 10 - 9pm which I could hear in my room. If you tell the front desk, they will lower the music. The hotel is right off the 5 freeway, so you can hear the traffic, maybe that's way the turn up up the music?   I picked this hotel because they accepted pets although they did not state that on their  website or when checking in that there is $25 per night fee for pets. When I checked in, I signed a pet waiver form and that did not state there was a daily pet fee only that there was a fee if there were damages. It was upon checking out when I found out about the fee. While most hotels do charge a pet fee, I just assumed this hotel didn't because it didn't state it anywhere like other hotels.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: DON'T BOOK--WORST EVER-DON'T RECOGNIZE OUTSIDE BOOKING COMPANIES
Summary: Checked in-room not ready.  requested 2 double beds, pool view, which was in my confirmation.  Came back 6 hrs later after Disney-got a ground floor parking lot room. We could hear every word spoken from the rooms on either side of us-including a couple's nightly activities.  Horrible and embarrassing with family in the room.  Please DO NOT book, if you must- call hotel directly.  Poor customer service if you use an outside company-which they even stated.  I used bookit--never again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good value, but what's with the music?
Summary: Good value, especially the restaurant which is super cheap.  But what's with the 80's soundtrack pumped loudly through the whole hotel? If you get a room facing the swimming pool, be prepared for Chris Rea on loop ALL day long.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We checked in around 5pm.  The valet parking was $12 which is reasonable but we self-park.  The lobby is not impressing, but the front dest receptionist was very friendly.  She told us about the amenities of the hotel.   The room was very nice and smells fresh.  The flat screen TV was great, my son loved it.  I also loved the black long table and the bed & headboard.  The bed frame however is a little dangerous.  My husband keeps hitting his toes on the foot frame of the bed and he hates it.    The room is very spacious, i like it. We were able to watch the fireworks in the pool area which is great.  The distance between the hotel and disneyland is about 5 minutes away.   Will stay here again...
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel, location, service, price, & restaurant
Summary: Booked this hotel on Hotwire (less than $60/night) and were very pleased with our stay. We called ahead of time and asked for a room on the pool side so we could watch the fireworks from our room. Although the freeway was a bit noisy, we were so tired by the end of the day I hardly heard a thing. The music during the day (by the pool) is quite loud and covers the sound of cars. We arrived at 11 AM and with a bit of waiting were sent up to our room, very surprised with its overall cleanliness and comfort. I had no intentions of spending very much time in the hotel as we came for Disneyland (a 10 - 12 minute walk away, no need to wait for the Shuttle, save your time and money). The neighborhood is safe. The pool is heated (warm), but the hot tub is not scorching. Family friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of the best places I've stayed!
Summary: So I had read some mixed reviews about Hotel Menage before our stay and most were positive and pretty much summed up their trip with it being noisy due to the freeway or the 24 hour pool.  So it wasn't enough to make me book somewhere else.  Check in time was 3pm, but we arrived late, around 7:30 pm that night.  Immediately I was impressed by the cleanliness of this hotel.  I was greeted by the valet attendants by the front door (I parked our own car, saved us $2 bucks lol), who opened the door for me and pointed me in the direction of the front desk to check in.  The gentleman who was checking in the couple in front of me, right off the bat, impressed me because of how he interacted with them.  Any questions they had, he had an answer and it was answered with a genuine smile.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Two broken toes on poorly designed beds
Summary: Overall our perception of this hotel is good.  The room was quiet, affordable and close to Disneyland.  The room service was quick and the food was reasonable priced and good quality.  The parking valet staff was very courtious.  Less than one minute into our stay, my daughter smashed her toe into the foot of the bed, which sticks out past the end of the mattress.  The bed legs have sharp corners and are dark in color and similar in color to the carpet.  When we asked the staff where the nearest hospital was because our daughter had cut her foot badly in the room, they asked if she had hurt it on the bed leg as this happens often.  Seems that if this is a common injury, they should change out the bed frames.  Our daughter has two broken toes and we have a whopping medical bill.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are visiting with a large group, and I was shocked to find out that our rooms were not available upon check in.  Several members of our group were not able to get into their rooms until after 4:30pm, and the staff did not seem apologetic at all.  We sat with several small children for hours awaiting the room availability.  When we did get our keys, we found the rooms to be clean, but run down.  The handle on the sink came off this evening when I attemped to wash my face.  The towel bar fell off of the wall when I dried my hands.  The 80s rock music is currently loudly playing outside of my room.  Really, it is ridiculous.  There are no people outside, because it is cold and a Monday night....does the music really need to be blaring so loudly that the windows shake?  The only
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Didnt want to get out of bed!
Summary: This was my first trip with my boyfriend ever. We did a two night, three day stay and were planning to go to disneyland during our stay. We arrived there after 3, we were confused about parking but the nice valet parking guys were super helpful and told us what to do. We bought the 14 day advance reservation online and when we checked in it was a breeze, we requested the microwave and refrigerator, they gave us our room key, told us where the best place to park by close to our room and that was that. We found our room and they gave us exactly what we asked for, a pool view room, and it was just right there in walking distance.  We checked out our room before taking our bags in and I realized we had gotten two beds instead of a bed and a couch with a table. I called the front
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel Menage was surprisingly pleasant.  I liked the laid back feel as well as the pool area and bar.  Check in was smooth and the restaurant K'ya next door has good food at reasonable prices.  There is also a shuttle that takes you to Disneyland and the pass is valid for 24 hours.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Surprisingly hip!  True to the reviews
Summary: My 18-year old daughter and I were doing our first Disneyland visit.  Reviews of this hotel suggested it was good for older teens, twenties, thirties.True!  A large group of twenties was having a big Valentine's Day party in the restaurant Sat. evening--looked like they were having a great time.    We thought it was pretty cool when the piano singer was performing Citizen Cope in the bar area.  Yes, the noise from the highway is a little loud and the bathrooms are older. But for the value, this place satisfied us with its hip style. The pool and hot tub areas are nice. The outdoor bar area and restaurant serve tasty and very affordable food.  Nice bartender outside!  We walked and also took  the shuttle to Disney.  See the amazing light and water show at the California theme
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing - loved Happy Hour. Such helpful people
Summary: Stayed here in October after booking through Hotwire, i was so please to have got this place it was lovely.  This hotel is Fantasic I have just booked back in for may to stay for 6 nights along with 23 other guests that are travelling from the UK to come to my weddin in Vegas. We loved the happy Hour $8 for 4 drinks (alcholic) fab! The foods was to die for the Hot wings and sweet Potatoes Fries. You can hear the fireworks from disney on some nights but it just adds to the excitement of it being on the doorstep!! Very Nice boutique hotel, lovely pool and sunbed area......bedrooms are amazing too so clean and the huge leather bed is great after a 11.5 hr flight  Checkin was painless, plenty of spaces and easy to get to.  Mcdonalds and Dennys just around the cirner and Chevron and
Manager Response: none

Summary: The positives: 1.  Nice pool area (with amazing views of fireworks - better than watching them IN Disneyland!) 2.  Good breakfasts and decent tapas (especially the eggs benedict) 3.  Nice staff - friendly; great housekeeping 4.  Good mattresses, big flatscreen tv's, decor is modern and pleasant and does a good job of masking the age of the building. 5.  15-20 minute walk to Disneyland and close to other restaurants, hotels, etc. 6.  Loved the dj's 80's music round the pool and in the lobby  Negatives: 1.  Offer a fridge to us for goodness' sake!  There wasn't one in the room and it wasn't until the end of our stay that we saw one being brought to another room. 2.  Thin walls between rooms mean that if your neighbours are arguing or watching tv in the wee hours, you can't escape
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of my favorites, with only a few "flaws".
Summary: I wanted to write this review to rebuttal the nay-sayers out there, 'cause we really loved this place! My two teeanage children and I stayed here for a few days after school had ended in June. I booked because other reviewers said it was a good choice for older kids, had a great restaurant, and the pool is open 24 hours. Yes, it seems true that it is an older motor-type hotel that is trying its darndest to be something special. If you can over-look the old bones of the place and see the beauty that is there, you will love it. They have stylish and comfortable furnishings in the lobby, hotel, and bar and have done a nice job landscaping and making the pool area seem like an oasis with tons of comfortable lounge chairs. I was impressed!  Some people complain that the music that is
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel 2 times now since 2008 when it first opened. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well appointed. The pool is open 24 hours which is a plus! We didn't have any trouble with noise (previous reviewers have noted this as a problem) other than the fact that the hotel is next to I-5. The rooms are well insulated and on our most recent visit, our room was right next to the freeway and we couldn't hear the freeway at all with the window closed. The bar/food service is great as well. The staff have always been very helpful and friendly. Another big PLUS; if your room faces Disneyland, which is directly across the freeway, you have an incredible view of the fireworks! Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel !
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: If you want rest, keep looking.
Summary: Staff were friendly; we even got upgraded to a suite because we were on our honeymoon. Kya' restaurant was reasonable to for quick bite.  We appreaciated the ability to grab a simple meal for a decent price.     However, it was very, very loud.  I mean loud.  This is a motel style place with a 24 hour pool which most rooms face.  The rooms are poorly soundproofed.  Combine this with drunken yellling and music, sometimes until 430am = no rest.  It was so loud in the room that I kept thinking that a window was open somewhere.  There is also signifigant noise from the highway.    We also were not impressed with the rooms shotty reno job.  It looks nice in the pictures but not in real life.
Manager Response: Dear Shoegal3, We would like to take this opportunity to thank you for taking the time to post a review about your experience at our hotel. Your comments help us continue to improve on the things that are most important to our guests. We are very sorry to hear that you experienced so much noise during your stay. I can understand how that noise could keep you up at night!
