In anticipation of this possibility, we have taken significant measures to reduce the ambient noise coming from the highway and pool area by installing double-pane windows and fan units which can provide white noise when turned on.  In any case, it seems that while some guests enjoy our most convenient location to local attractions and surrounding routes of transportation, other guests may consider the same to be a nuisance.  Again, we sincerely apologize for the noise you experienced during your stay and we hope to have the pleasure of hosting you again, in a quieter room. Sincerely, The Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Blaring Hard Rock and Rotten WiFi
Summary: This hotel plays loud, hard driving, hard rock music 24/7 in the entire ground floor including the entire lobby and restaurant. Everywhere.  Really loud. There is no escape from it anywhere, anytime on ground floor. We had a breakfast in the restaurant, which included the constant hard rock music, good and loud.  I still have "Highway to Hell" ringing in my ears. The same music is played outside at pool, good and loud, from 10:00 am to 10:00 pm and it's easily heard in the rooms fronting pool (which is most of rooms). Rooms are nicely furnished. Great HD tv. Service and food in restaurant was great, price was great but we couldn't wait to leave due to noise level. And although it was promised to work, the WiFi was non-existent in my room (#408) and was non-existent in 90% of the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed here several times in the past two years and I've recommended the hotel to a friend and her family and they loved it too.   This is a great hotel to stay at for adults or families with teens traveling to Disneyland.   This is by far my daughter's (age 16) favorite hotel.  She likes the music playing in the lobby, the pool, the food and the room.   This time we had a room with a view of It's a Small World which was all lit up for the holidays.  We even watched the fireworks from the walkway.    The food is so incredible and such a great value.   For this trip we stayed part of the time at a timeshare hotel and we drove to Menage for dinner at their Kya restaurant 3 times while we stayed elsewhere.    Read the reviews, this hotel isn't fancy and it isn't boring.  So if
Manager Response: none

Summary: I loved this hotel! It was beautifully renovated to be a sleek modern motel. It is an older motel but for the money I think it's a good deal. The view from our balcony was amazing, overlooking the pool and tiki bar and across the road you can see the lights from Disneyland. Our first night we arrived we spent in the pool watching the fireworks. They were so close they set off a few car alarms... but so beautiful. The lobby has a club like feel to it but is nicely done. I thought the restaurant was quite fast and the waiters were friendly... the room service was really slow. Obviously they would concentrate more on the people in the restaurant.... not a big deal though. It was a little noisy at night with the 24 hour pool but as we didn't go with children it didn't really matter.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It's walking distance from Disneyland and the restaurant 'K’ya' they have at the hotel is amazing! the food is just fantastic! The room was clean and comfortable and you can see the fireworks from the pool every night. I was very pleased with everything and would recommend it to anyone who is planning on staying in Anaheim.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: It is a motel like hotel, walking distance to Disneyland.
Summary: I stayed here with my family (w/ 2 little kids) for our after-Christmas-Disneyland trip for 3 nights.  The good things about this hotel: 15 minutes walk to Disneyland, good and fast service on valet parking, fast check-in and check-out, and 40" flat screen tv and big beds (a king and a queen in our room).    The bad things about this hotel: noisy (next to highway); the coverlets are dark brown and look dirty; chipped bathtub; the toilet paper holder is about to fall off the wall and dusty; new paint and old paint are shown in the bathroom (poor paint job); there is a handheld shower head in the bathroom but can't figure out how to use it and it is very old style; the shower only have a cheap fabic curtain liner and the curtain liner stick to my body when I take shower; tiny
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Just a short stroll to Disneyland!
Summary: Our entire stay was during the week of torrential rain in SoCal, but we troppered on & made the best of it! Hotel Menage is located just across the 5 from Disneyland, a 15 minute walk to the maingate. Our room I'll give a rating of B-; we were on the 5th floor w/ pool view and could see California Adventure, but the road noise was always present, not annoying, just a constant drone. The bed was a king; very comfortable (firm mattress) with ample pillows and a couch instead of table & chairs ... nice for kicking back & watching the 42" TV. Desk & workstation were excellent with high speed internet & plenty of outlets to recharge laptops & cellphones. The downside was the bathroom, this is where you still could see its Holiday Inn past. Usable, but not impressive like other
Manager Response: none

Summary: First of all, the staff at Hotel Menage were top notch.  We stayed here for Disneyland, but one night we had such a fun time at the pool with the happy hour special that we didn't bother to leave.  We booked our stay with hotwire, and when deciding to extend by one night, the front desk gave us an even better rate! The room had clearly been refurbished, or something a long that line, and smelled strongly of new carpet/carpet cleaner.   It wasn't super glamorous but it was super fun!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about us.  We appreciate the business and look forward to seeing you back soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: The size of the bedroom was reasonable but the bathroom was tiny.   This hotel is located next to the freeway and it is quite noisy. It's also about 15-minute walk from Disneyland Resort.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write the review.  We are close to the resort enhancing our location.  We hope to see you in Anaheim soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: WARNING TO FAMILIES - DO NOT STAY HERE
Summary: I just stayed at this property this past weekend.  Please let me warn you!  Please read this if you do enjoy sleep and a good night's rest.  If you want some peace and quiet and some actual sleep for you and your family, DO NOT STAY HERE.  This is the worst hotel experience I have ever had, and I travel quite a bit for both business and leisure.  The bar is filled with loud abnoxious people that stay up all hours of the night.  You can literally here drunk people running and screaming down the hall way.  We stayed at room 426 and both Friday and Saturday night we had loud talking, screaming and running until 4am.  Additional cons:  When we returned from Disneyland, we found tha both eleverators were OUT OF ORDER, we were instructed to use the service elevator where we had to see
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear of your experiences, most of our guests enjoy our hotel.  As far as the noisy people are concerned, I'm not quite sure what was going on that night, but I assure you it is not acceptable.  Regards,  Hotel Menage

Summary: This is our 6th time staying here in 3 years. We go to DL twice a year with the kids (5 and 8). This place is great. Wonderful, inexpensive food. Superb happy hour after a long day at DL (glass of wine for 2.50!) VERY kid friendly. The kids love the fireworks show over the pool. Kids eat breakfast for free with adult. Never a problem. Free coffee refill with a smile to get you on the shuttle to DL.The noise is not noticable once the door is shut. Great rooms, Great flat screen. Super pool area (heated and open 24hrs). Very roomy. Asked for a mini fridge, it was in the room in 5 mins. Andrew the valet had cupcakes for my kids. He has been there for a while. Frank is very nice and helpful at the outside bar. Street Fair menu is the best ever and soooo inexpensive. Like 5 dollars
Manager Response: Wow, I'm so glad that your experiences keep getting better.  Thank you for your continued business and loyalty, let's not stop at 6 visits.  I'm sure both Andrew and Frank will be grateful to hear your kind words.  We strive hard to ensure value for price paid with exceptional customer service, and I'm so glad you experienced this with our hotel.  Thank you for your comments, but most importantly thank you for your business...  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Menage soon after they opened and were impressed with the room and location.  We paid around +/- $100 per night each time which is a GREAT deal.  It is a 10 - 15 minute walk to Disney which is convenient.  Rooms are big, clean, and modern.  You could easily have two kids sleep on the sofa bed as well.  We also tried the restaurant downstairs this time as we were desperate for some vegis and non-fried food.  Well out desperation led us to one of the best places to eat around Disney and at a reasonable price.  The food is street food around the world and while it is supposed to be small servings, we actually found the dishes very generous for the $5 price tag.  We tend to eat a lot and three dishes (under $20 total) was plenty for us.  So we'll stay here
Manager Response: Thank you for your repeat business.  We appreciate your loyalty to us and thank you for your kind words.  I'm very glad that things, in your mind have not diminished in both quality and value.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: This hotel was perfect for our Disneyland needs.  The hotel was clean, the beds were comfortable.  The restaurant food was great and incredibly reasonable.  The week after Thanksgiving is a slow weekend for Disneyland so we ended up with a great rate at the hotel.  I will not hesitate to stay here again with my family when enjoying Disneyland.  The hotel has a bit of a trendy feel to it, which my 7 year old son thought was cool.
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear of your pleasant experience.  We strive to make it not only cool for your 7 year old, but a great value for all families, couples, and business minded customers.  We offer value for price paid for both our rooms and our restaurant, and I'm glad you had a chance to experience both.  We look forward to seeing you again soon and thank you for your business.  Regards,  Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Great Stay for Disneylanders, or Young Adults
Summary: My wife booked this hotel online because it looked like a very nice hotel and was reasonably priced and close to Disneyland. When we arrived, it was close to Disneyland, only about half a mile walking distance from front gates. I was impressed with the lobby and decor, nice style, great lounge area. Service was excellent from the front desk. Sylvia and Kristina were very accomodating and got us the best rooms possible. Extremely polite and attentive service. The rooms were nicely decorated, nice flat screen TV. The rooms we got were nice and overlooked the pool area. Unfortunately, they also overlooked the I-5 freeway, which is seriously just over the hotel parking lot wall. Because we have a family, we actually liked the white noise of the traffic during the night. If you are a
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review.  I will have our engineering department look into the wind noise, I'm not too sure where that is coming from.  In addition, I'm sure the front desk staff will be glad to hear their names mentioned.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: the property is ok, lots of security, and you feel ok, i botter to review this hotel, because i didn't like at all the service, poor, bad temper, like if they were doing you a favor, i had an issue with something i missed there, and they never help me solve it, besides, the price is high considering other options that doesn't charge the parking, and they gives you breakfast, here no, nothing at all, but what upsets me more, was the personal, rude, NOT FRIENDLY AT ALL, nad if you have a problem, it is your problem, not theirs, is better to go to an hotel of a brand, because they don't let them do that, and here they do what they want, i don't have the name of the guy in reception, but if you go, don't let him to attend you, you are gonna be dissapointed, oh, and don't trust the
Manager Response: I'm truly sorry about all issues you experienced during your visit.  Trust me I will personally address this with the Hotel Manager and the team.  This is not the way we want to be remembered and we really do work hard to strive 100% customer satisfaction.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: We live just 40 miles from Anaheim and went to meet my visiting daughter and her friends for breakfast. The rest of the day was like a getaway mini island vacation in the Menage.  The front Desk welcomes you with island music and friendly staff. the feel is of a large hotel. The rooms were wonderful for two of us, plasma, internet and the shower, a great shower! The 24 hour pool reminds us of one you would find in a 4 star resort including outdoor furniture and a poolside bar. We meet couples that lived even closer then us who stayed their when visiting Disney on their annual pass. At 9:15 PM Disney puts on a fireworks show..for YOU. Poolside gets to see a wonderful fireworks show with no obstructions. Very Nice. We are very surprised at the negative reviews. The price, service,
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.  I'm glad you truly got to experience our hotel services and amenities.  Our hotel is truly a great relaxing get away for anyone in the local area, and I know our team will enjoy reading your review.  Thank you for you time, business and loyalty to Hotel Menage.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: Staying in the hotel now booked it through priceline thinking it was a Marriott! Wow were we mistaken. We got to the hotel our rooms werent ready. We finally got our rooms and wanted two double rooms one for us and one for our kids. The gave us a room on one end of the hotel and my kids a room on the other end of the hotel. Basically this hotel is a Best Western remodeled trying to come off as high end. The rooms are dirty. Ours had no fridge, we asked them to bring us one they did it looked like it fell off someones truck. They put us in a smoking room wihtout telling us. There are stains on the bed spread. The Coffee cups had scum in them, the music plays all night very loudly probably to cover up the freeway noise since you are right on the freeway....and the people that are
Manager Response: I'm sorry about your recent stay with us.  I'm not quite sure why you thought you were booking the Marriott.  Priceline has certain restrictions and cancellation policies that we do not have any control over, hence your dissatisfaction with us.  As you can tell the majority of our guests really enjoy the hotel.  We did work hard to provide value and top notch service, and again I apologize if you did not experience this from our team.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: I found this hotel on line by searching hotels close to Disneyland.  The price was great.  When we arrived around 1:30 we were able to get a room on a third floor, facing the pool.  The room was great.  We ate at the restaurant, food was great.  Same day we walked to: The Shops at Anaheim Gardenwalk.  The walk to Disneyland was only 10 min and very easy to get to.  The bartender at the papapa bar made the best pomegranate martini I've ever had.   We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel.  I'm already looking at booking our stay in May/June 2011. Thanks for great stay. Kashka Poligaj
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyal business to Hotel Menage.  I'm so pleased to hear that everything you experienced was to your satisfaction.  I know our staff will be greatly appreciative of your comments and most importantly for your repeat business.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: DO NOT STAY HERE!  My husband, children, and I stayed here for 4 days.  I left my wallet in my suitcase not wanting it to fall out of the diaper bag and get lost while we were at Disneyland/California Adventure.  At the end of our trip, I discovered $200 was stolen out of my wallet.  Immediately I called the hotel and let them know what had happened.  They told me they would do some checking with their housekeeping and the log of who may have entered my room.  I was told to file a police report, and I would be contacted by  their "Insurance Company" within 24-48 hrs of receiving the police report.  I filed a police report then never heard from the hotel again.  It took at least a week to even hear from the insurance company.  When I heard from the insurance company, they told me
Manager Response: I'm sorry about your experience.  There are certain protocols to take when claims of cash are missing.  Unfortunately it was not resolved to your satisfaction, however I will address your concerns with the team.    Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: At first I loved this hotel. Great location, great restaurant and rooms seemed nice enough for the price. But after a long day at disneyland and a long night at downtown disney I came back to my room to find bed bugs! I called down to the front desk where I was told they had a long line of people checking in so I needed to come down to the front desk to get a new room (mind you this was 2 in the morning) I went down got my new room and that was that. Was never asked if I needed help moving my things from the beg bugs room to our new room. Next day there was never any follow up from management to check on us. It wasn't until I checked out that I had to ask the lady behind the desk if anyone ever took a lot at our old room. She did not know. She apologized and took $40 off our
Manager Response: I assure you that we do not have bed bugs.  I know that our Hotel Manager has been in touch with you directly and I hope all was resolved to your satisfaction.  Lastly we have discussed this issue with the front office team and I am truly sorry about your experience with us.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: Excellent location, 10 mins walk to Disneyland.  Rooms are very spacious, clean and modern.  Very comfortable, the only negative is the bad lighting for the mirror in the bathroom and the noise from the highway is shocking.  Other than that the pool area is great, friendly helpful staff.  I would definately stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you, thank you, thank you.  We are extremely pleased to hear of your experience at Hotel Menage.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: Hotel is nothing like the pictures. More like a motel WiFi did not work for us at all for the five days we were there and the front dest said that they would have to have someone come check the reciever but it would not be till the next day but he never showed. Housekeeping didnt leave fresh towels or new soaps even when they took the old ones and we had to call down to the desk many times for things that should have already been there.  Very close to the freeway so pretty noisy. Overall I was extremely dissapointed in what we got for the price.
Manager Response: First and foremost, I'm am ashamed to hear of your experiences.  We strive day to day to ensure each customer is 100% satisfied and I'm sorry about your visit with us.  I assure you the Management team will work to ensure this does not happen again.  Thank you for your time and I do hope you'll give us another opportunity to serve you again.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel, I don't understand the bad reviews
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for a 9 day disneyland vacation and I was a bit reserved after reading reviews on here that it was noisy and not accommodating for families with younger children.  I got an awesome deal on expedia so I couldn't say no.  Upon arrival you are greeted by the valets who are so helpful and friendly and this continued throughout our entire stay.  The hotel was lovely as was the pool area.  Our family went swimming almost every evening and there were other children there.  Don't get me wrong there were couples without kids, but no one bothered us.  We even met some great people hanging out in the hot tub.  Oh and did I mention you get an amazing view of the fireworks from the pool area.  Now I don't know about you but I would much rather be relaxing poolside in a
Manager Response: We don't get it either...  It's a great hotel to be enjoyed by families, couples, and young adults.  Thank you for taking the time to express your feelings about Hotel Menage.  Our team will be happy that you found value for price paid for both the room and the food and beverage of our hotel.  We look forward to seeing you again soon and thank you for your business.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Thumbs up for the Hotel Menage
Summary: Our family (including a teenager and two younger children) greatly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Menage.  Despite concerns about noise, our rooms turned out to be absolutely fine.  It is very close to the freeways, and there is the constant drone from those once you are outside of your room, but we soon got used to it.  Maybe we were lucky, but we didn't have any problem with music from the pool/party goers etc.  We wouldn't have been very happy if we had, but our expeience was pretty positive all round.  Our rooms were great, the pool area is fantastic.  There was a heatwave when we were there, very very hot, and the long pool hours meant we could just fall into the pool after a long hot day and late return from Disneyland.  Loved the grass and planted areas there.  Above all
Manager Response: Thank you for your review about our hotel.  I'm glad you enjoyed k'ya street fare, our restaurant.  Our team worked very hard to ensure both quality and service were up to the standards of our customers.  We will work on the attentiveness of our front desk team and I assure you that this is not acceptable.  Thank you for your business and we look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Top Notch Service but "Loft" is deceiving.
Summary: Our group consisted of my husband, self, 2 young adult children and married daughter and her spouse. We had 3 rooms on different floors. We came to Anaheim for a wedding. We were disappointed to find out the "loft" room was on the bottom floor, especially when they boast you can see the park fireworks from the loft rooms, and by the doors facing the outside. Our loft room was also directly across from the pool/bar area. A few hours later we requested a room that would not be so noisy and give us a better firework view and we were accommedated quickly. We were surprised how quiet our new room was since it still overlooked the pool, on the 4th floor, and was close to the freeway. Our daughter kept her "loft" room on the 1st floor and had no sleeping issues. Our kids on the 5th
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review.  I will make sure that both Silvia and Leo hear of your accolades for assisting you and your family during your visit.  Our loft rooms are all on the same floor, first floor, so I am truly sorry if you had the wrong impression of what these rooms offered.  It seems you and your family were all on different floors and different areas of the hotel, and as you noticed the noise is not bad.  Thank you for your time and most importantly thank you for your business.  We look forward to seeing you, your friends, and your family back again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: We stayed at the Menage for 8 days.  We booked late in the game, many of the other places near disneyland had filled up.  We had some concerns based on earlier reviews.  My wife and I ended up being very, very pleased.  The staff was without exception friendly and helpful.  Our room was just fine--roughly on a Holiday Inn level.  The restaurant had decent food and excellent pricing--a great value.  Room service is available, at a small surcharge  Other reviews had mentioned noise--it was no problem for us.  We stayed in room 212, which was on the Freeway side, but there was a noise wall by the freeway,   It is possible that the noise situation might be different elsewhere....if it is a concern, try to get a room in the vicinity of 212.  Though we didn't end up using the pool and
Manager Response: Thank you for the glowing review...  We enjoy hearing about experiences like yours and the team will be ecstatic to hear of your great stay with us.  As you stated once inside the room, the noise is non-existent.  We continually strive to create both value and an environment that will exceed our guests' expectations and I am truly glad we accomplished that during your visit.  We look forward to being your hotel of choice in the Anaheim area.  Thank you again for your business, your review, but most importantly your loyalty.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: We were upgraded to their "urban" room with a king sized bed, which was very nice and spacious. The hotel lobby was very modern, and the restaurant within the building offered very nice food at reasonable prices.  We couldn't pick up the signal for their free wireless internet in our room - we found out later that their wi-fi does not work on all ipads and iphones anyway, which was a shame. However, there are 2 computers in the "red room" for public use.  The air conditioner in our room was ancient, and was extremely noisy when it's on - luckily for us, the weather was not too hot at night during our stay. During our first night, we could hear the traffice noise very clearly. Unfortunately, it was also a Saturday night, so there were partygoers constantly walking past and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write the review.  The noise from the outside is not bad at all from the guest rooms.  I'm sorry that you had some noise from people outside of the hallways.  We are very proud of the service and the value we provide for our clients, both in the restaurant and the hotel.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: What am I missing?  How can Disney call this a good neighbor hotel?
Summary: This hotel is more like an off strip vegas hotel and not something you would expect at Disneyland.  The hotel is overrun by college age kids drinking, smoking and cursing and worst of all it lasts all night as the pool and spa are 24 hr.  I did see one other person with a kid at the pool but even he had 3 super big gulp can's of domestic beer.  I honestly felt like I was in high school again.  The noise is stiffled a little bit by the roar of the highway which you almost spit on from your room but as I mentioned that turned out to be a good thing.  When we got to our room it stunk of smoke, we called the front dest and they kept assuring us it was a non smoking room speaking to us like we didn't know the difference.  We got another room without the stink but some of the lights
Manager Response: I am truly sorry about your experience and hope that you will give us another opportunity.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Anaheim's 'best kept secret' for a reason. . .
Summary: I opted for Hotel Menage based on price, but I should have known I would be getting what I paid for.  There's just no taking the "motel" out of Hotel Menage.  They tried to spruce the place up, but all they really did was add valet parking so guests could pay an extra $10/day for parking.  It is still a crummy motel!  Buyer beware.  We will not return.
Manager Response: We are sorry you felt this way about our hotel, we do get some really good reviews as well.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: Stayed here with extended family for a wedding.  The wedding reception was on the pool patio.  Food was catered by the hotel restaurant.  The hotel staff bent over backwards to please the bride and make the reception and stay memorable for her.  There is a great pool area with several areas for lounging, outside bar area with fantastic bartenders.  Inside reception area/lounge.  One area flows into another.  Great rate, walking distance to Disneyland.    Kids in our party had a blast here.The only reason I didn't give higher marks on sleep quality is our room was right above the tiki bar outside and we could hear the music and talking until the bar closed.  The location was a drive to any shopping areas.  Would certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great words.  I'm glad the wedding went well and congratulations to the bride and groom.  We do have great value for price paid and we appreciate you stating that.  Thank you for your review, but most importantly thank you for your business.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: This is not a 3 1/2  star Hotel!
Summary: This hotel is not worthy of 3 1/2 stars, but more like a 2 1/2 star motel!  After reading the reviews and viewing the online pictures, I thought this would be a good hotel for my family to stay in while visiting Disneyland.  I was prepared for it to be noisy even after requesting a quiet room.  This didn't bother us, we turned the AC on and wore earplugs, not a problem.   The room was just a big disappointment, basically an average motel with a few cheap contemporary pieces of furniture.  The room was fairly clean although we had a bed with a questionable brown stain on it the first night.  The cover was changed the second night. The location is about a 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland but be prepared to cross a very busy uncontrolled freeway on ramp to get there.  I would not
Manager Response: I'm sorry that you feel our star rating is lower then it is, we do get a lot of great reviews.  I assure you we will address the issues you brought up on your review.  Thank you for taking the time to write.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: I stayed at Hotel Menage for two nights as part of a block reserved for a wedding. "Motel" Menage would be a more apt name, as the rooms open to the outdoors, not an interior hallway. As a female traveling alone, this set-up does not make me feel secure. The walls between the rooms were thin---I could hear my neighbors' TV, though I suspect the volume was not turned up high. The lighting in the room was inadequate. Even with all the lights turned on and the window coverings open, I had a difficult time seeing how much makeup I was putting on my face. (This was of utmost importance, as I was getting ready for a wedding.) Oh, and the nightly fireworks from adjacent Disneyland are deafeningly loud. It sounded like bombs going off!  The pool area was awesome. The pool is heated,
Manager Response: I'm sorry that it's been just okay.  The fireworks and the proximity to the park give the bang from the fireworks.  The pool is nice, but I'm sorry that your were not satisfied with the rest.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: Prior to arriving at the hotel we viewed the photos online and it looked like a nice hotel.  We also read many of the reviews.  I was concerned about the noise level as was noted in several reviews.  Upon arrival I was suprrised to see that this was more like a "motel" than a hotel.  The doors to the rooms were all open to the outside (no inside hallways).  We asked for a room away from the freeway.  Our room was on the first level, walk up from our car (had we been able to personally park our car outside our room - but no - that was for valet only - which we paid for.) The valet was very gracious and did let us park close to our room when we had sleeping children in the backseat.   The rooms was one large room and the door openned directly into the room  -- close to one of the
Manager Response: I am truly sorry about your experience and your disappointment with our hotel.  We really strive to make each and every guest 100% satisfied.  Unfortunately we fell short on many levels.  I do hope you'll give us another opportunity to serve you.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Great hotel - shame about the freeways
Summary: A really nice hotel. Great rooms (serviced daily), clean, comfortable and fridge provided on request. Great pool, the kids loved that it was open 24 hours! Hotel restaurant great for breakfast and dinner. Only downside is that the Menage is nestled between two freeways, making it a little noisy - and LA streets never sleep. If traffic noise doesn't bother, it's great value. Oh and it's a 10 min walk to Disney - no major roads to cross.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate the time you took to write your comments.  It is a little noisy, however with the door closed most guest find it okay.  We do provide value for price paid and we appreciate your kind words.  We look forward to seeing you again soon and thank you for your continued business.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: Hotel Menage is in a great location only 10 minutes walk to Disneyland or for a small fee there is a bus that picks you up at the front of the hotel. The rooms are very comfortable & clean. Was a bonus to find washing machines & dryers. The staff are very firendly & are happy to help & answer all your questions. The 24 hour pool & spa were great along with the pool bar serving delicious cocktails. My husband & I quickly fell in love with the hotels restaurant "k'ya". It was so cheap to eat at (breakfast, lunch & dinner), the food portions were huge, staff amazing & we did not have one bad meal there over the 4 days we stayed. We would highly recommend Hotel Menage to all family & friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for your glowing words.  We do have a great value for price paid and we are very please you experienced this during your stay.  Our team will be happy to hear of your experience.  I'm glad that you are telling all your friends and family and look forward to seeing you again.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but no internet in rooms and noisy partygoers
Summary: I have just returned for a fantastic holiday in the USA and stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a trip to Disneyland. I booked this hotel at the recommendation of my sister who stayed there in Feb this year over all the negative reviews I had read on TA. I will start with the positives. It is a nice hotel with lovely gardens and pool area. The food in the restuarant was very nice and reasonably priced. The rooms were clean, however ours was a little small for our family of 4. It is next to Disneyland however the walk from the hotel to front gates of Disney took exactly 15 mins. The negatives: The interenet never worked in our room from the moment we got there. I complained 4 times and it still didnt work by the time we left. I see from reading more recent reports it seems it is
Manager Response: I'm really sorry to hear about your experiences.  We are correcting the internet issues as I type and assure you this will not occur again.  As far as the parties are concerned, we had an event in our ballroom and apparently they took it to our pool.  Again I hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you.  Regards,  Hotel Menage

Summary: We have just returned for the Menage, and I would love to rate the hotel more but am  disappointed by the service.  I wasn't expecting a 4 or 5 star hotel room but something that was comfortable which it was but other factors let this hotel down.  All through our stay during the USA everyone has been super helpful and when I accidentally booked one night extra through the website the hotel staff didn't even try to compensate me. I understand the terms and conditions of web bookings but every hotel I've ever stayed at has bent over backwards to help rectify and credit honest mistakes. I got a blank look and no help, or sorry I'll fix this for you??   The hotel is in a good position and a 10min walk to Disneyland.  The rooms are tidy yet as people have mentioned it's a paint
Manager Response: I'm sorry about your experience with our hotel.  I assure you customer service is our main priority, please contact us if you need assistance with the extra night that you did not stay.  We do hope you'll give us another opportunity to serve you in the future.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for how little we were there
Summary: I don't expect much out of a hotel when I'm headed to Anaheim specifically to visit Disneyland, mostly because I'm at Disneyland for 14 hours per day and only stop at the hotel to change and sleep. This hotel fulfilled that need. There were some rough spots, as would be expected from a hotel being remodeled.  The Good: - Nice TV, bed, padded headboard and lighting - Road noise isn't noticeable with the door shut and the a/c is turned on - Very nice lobby bar and restaurant - Plenty of green in the pool area and outside bar with music playing loud enough to drowned out the road noise  The Bad: - Told about free internet, but the signal was at best 6% signal strength in our room and wouldn't actually work (but the 2 free computers near the lobby worked) - The shower head is fixed
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  Your correct the noise is not bad once inside the room.  I have our IT person checking on the internet, so I assure you it will be fixed as soon as possible.  I know we had some repairs that needed to be done in the corridor, but I'm sorry it was exposed the way it was.  Thank you for your review and we look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Overall happy though a few issues of concern.
Summary: Was a little worried when I booked - read this site after making the booking. I must say I was impressed with the room (even though some of the lights just did NOT work), good size, very clean (might have something to do with the tips we left?) and the pool was good. Check in was fine without any hassles. Danny on concierge was just SO helpful and deserves a payrise. The Valet guys were also always friendly and cheerful. And Wendy at the restaurant was very nice. Now to my gripe. I just wish the cheerfulness of concierge and valet carried over to check in staff. I have never met such sour, disinterested people in my life. For a country that is currently in a deep recession you think they would be nice and friendly and pleasant and GRATEFUL to have a job. It was such an effort
Manager Response: Although your rating is good, it concerns me to no end that you had issues at the front desk.  Trust me this will not ever happen again.  We do pride ourselves on exceptional service and what you experienced is totally unacceptable and my displeasure the front desk will be fixed.  Your right in this economy everyone should be happy, and I am truly sorry about your experience.  I'm also glad that you had some great service, but I assure you the training will continue and this experience will not occur.  We want everyone to execute as valet and the restaurant did.  As far as the internet, I will have my IT person check on this immediately.  Occasionally we have had some T1 issues, but I thought it was fixed.  I do hope you'll experience a better visit the next time out...  I assure you will.  Thank you for your business and your comments.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Do not stay here - terrible road noise and no internet
Summary: We stayed here for one week in Feb 2010; It was a trip with myself, mum and sister. The hotel staff were friendly and the rooms nice however the internet did not work, the road noise is unbearable when trying to sleep and some days our rooms were not attended to until after 5pm by housekeeping. The restaurant downstairs & bar ia quite nice and we ended up eating here a bit as you cannot walk to anything and need to get taxi's. The hotel also ordered us a taxi one night and they ripped us off as it was not a metered taci and cost well over $100USD for a 20 min ride.  Would not stay here again or recommend the hotel.
Manager Response: Occasionally technology is not at it's best, but I assure you our internet does work well.  I am sorry that you felt the room was too noisy, but enjoyed the restaurant.  I do hope you'll give us another opportunity to serve you in the future.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel and it was the worst hotel I could go for. As you find your room, it feels like you are in a cheap motel and not a 3.5 start hotel. I don't know which idiot gave them 3.5 stars cause they certainly don't deserve it. the only thing that was worth it was valet service. other than that this hotel deserves a 0.1 star.
Manager Response: I'm really sorry about your experience.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Great for partying, NOT for sleeping
Summary: Hotel Menage doesn't look like much from the outside but once inside it is beautiful. My husband called it "swanky". The lobby, restaurant and outside bar and pool area are fantastic. The rooms themselves leave a lot to be desired. We stayed in a basic King room which looks nothing like the picture. The room is spacious with a convenient sink/vanity separated from the toilet/shower, lots of storage, a comfy bed, couch and coffee table, and very large desk underneath a mounted flatscreen TV. Traffic and pool noise are greatly eliminated once the doors are closed and even more so if you leave the fan running. However, our room had a dirty shower/tub that did not drain well, a bathroom light that only worked when it felt like it, and lots of areas where the paint was coming off or
Manager Response: I am truly sorry that you experienced what you did.  This is not the impression we want to leave for any of our guests.  I assure you, I will be speaking with the team to ensure this does not occur ever again.  I wish that we could have stopped the people from running in the hallways, we do care about each and every guest.  I hope you will give us an opportunity to turn the thumbs down right side up.  We hope you'll come visit us again.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: The hotel itself was very nice, the rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable and the pool area is nice, and is always open. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone who is a light sleeper, like myself.   The hotel is located right off of I-5 so the noise from the hotel kept me awake ALL night, however, my fiance was able to sleep through the noise.  I would definitely recommend this hotel for someone who can sleep through the noise, it's a good value and really close to Disneyland, but I will not be returning.
Manager Response: I'm sorry that you will not be returning, but most of our rooms are quiet with the door closed.  I do hope you'll give us another chance, however we do appreciate your business.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: My family and I traveled to Anaheim for the Disneyland 1/2 marathon and was impressed with the hotel.  We researched hotels near Disneyland on the web and everyone you looked at had bad reviews.  We kept our fingers crossed.   It actually turned out to be the best hotel we could have chosen for the start of the race.  We walked there faster than the shuttle would have taken us in the morning.  When we first walked to our rooms near the pool and freeway area, we were a little concerned.  As soon as you close your door...the noise disappears.  It was very impressive how the noise basically disappeared and if you had your a/c on, you didn't hear anything at all outside.  People that have given bad reviews for the freeway noise must have been sleeping with their door or windows
Manager Response: Your review is correct, once inside you don't hear the exterior.  I'm glad you chose us during the marathon, I'm sure you went to bed early and got up early to enjoy your run, but I'm so pleased to hear you had a chance to enjoy or restaurant.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: This was definitely a good start for our vacation. The lobby area is very trendy and modernly decorated. Staff are helpful and resourceful.  The hotel was full of kids but it was quiet enough when sleep time rolled around.   Although this hotel was not far from Disneyland, we took the shuttle bus anyway. Round trip for a small price.   Clean and spacious enough for two people.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review.  I'm glad your vacation started on the right foot with us.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: A beutiful hotel with great service next great fun!
Summary: A few years ago I had to perform at the Anaheim House of Blues. We had people coming in from all over the country so we had a list of recommended hotels near by. Hotel Ménage was one. I was a bit skeptical. The photos of the pool, rooms, restaurant and bar looked way to nice for the price. There had to be a catch. Well, that year I foolishly decided to use a different hotel. I now have a regular commute between OC and LA and I pass by the building often. With its warm colors, and big palm trees it definitely caught my eye as I drove up the I-5. I really wanted to try the place out, so I called and made reservations. My sweetheart and I stayed there just to get out of the house for a few days during Fathers Day weekend. The staff bent over backwards to accommodate us and make
Manager Response: I know Chris in Valet will be greatly appreciative of your compliments.  Thank you for giving us a chance, we appreciate the business and your time to write this review.  We look forward to seeing you again soon and keep the reviews coming.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Classy Hotel, Awesome Outdoor Pool Bar w/ a 24 hours pool & spa. I'll be back
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights on our week long honeymoon.  The hotel was well above what I expected for a hotel with a 3.5 star avg.   The restaurant is reasonably priced and the breakfast menu was  perfect.  They have shuttles to disneyland every 20 min that run $4 for all day.  The staff was awesome.. After hearing it was our honeymoon we came back from the park to find a bottle of champain in our room on ice.  Out of the many hotels i have stayed in close to the park.. This is our new favorite.  Oh and dont forget about thier happy hour from 4pm to 7.  $4 margeritas and 1/2 price food.  A much needed recharge before retuning to the park.  Thanks again Hotel Menage for making our honeymoon so enjoyable.
Manager Response: Congratulations on your nuptials.  We are glad that we could be a part of that very special time in your life.  I know our team will be happy to hear that you we are now your favorite hotel in the area.  Thanks for your business and please tell all your friends and family about us.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Disney style fun at family style prices
Summary: The Ménage is a boutique hotel with comfortable beds, and 24 hour pool & hot tub.  After a hot day doing the Disney Adventure it is wonderful to kick back in the pool & hot tub no matter what time you get back to the hotel.  The best amenity is the balcony view of the Disney Firework show at 9:30 every night.  The thunder of the fireworks is the only sound that makes it into the quiet rooms. You can not get closer to the show without standing next to the launchers.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time on trip adviser, we appreciate your kind words.  Our 24 hour pool is for all to enjoy after a long day out and about, so I'm glad to hear you enjoyed your visit.  We look forward to serving you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: I read alot of reviews on this hotel before booking, so will cover the points other people have made. Our Family stayed here for 14nights, in August. Firstly, yes the hotel is right next to the freeway, we had a room overlooking the pool and freeway and I can honestly say once you shut the room door you can not here a thing, this goes for the music they play around the pool as well( i think they do it to drown out the sound of the traffic)once the door is shut you can not here anything. The pool is lovely, it is open 24hours and it is quite a lively area, (day and evening) sometimes people were in the pool until 2am. During the day I did notice some adults had been drinking alcohol for most of the day and were sat on the side of the pool, with a beer bottle and smoking, thought
Manager Response: Thank you.  Once in the room, your review is dead on.  The noise does go away.  Our maintenance department really works hard to ensure each room is detailed to the tee, but with our recent busy season, it's been difficult to get in to do the repairs.  We are working hard to make it all new again.  Bottles are not allowed in the pool area, it could have been the aluminum bottles we serve and we work hard to ensure safety is the number one priority for every guest.  I will ensure our team knows of your concern.  In addition we do have overnight security so I know safety should not be a concern.  k'ya our restaurant, is the best value in town and our food has been rated time and again as, exceptional.  Our location is key as we are very close to all major event areas for Anaheim.  We appreciate you giving us a chance and hope everyone follows your advice.  We look forward to serving you again soon...  Thank you for the business.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: My family and I stayed here for our family vacation to Disneyland on 8/18/10 to 8/21/10 and got a great rate on Hotwire for this hotel and were so pleased!  It had a 3 1/2 star rating, and we felt we got an excellent rate at $53 a night.  We did not swim in the pool, but it looked fabulous; we did order from the K'ya restaurant which was wonderful food (totaaly loved the cobb salad and salmon dish!), as well as service, and we did walk to Disneyland as well as ride the transport.  The walk took about 10-15 min. with 4 little kids. The transport took just as long, even longer in the waiting, understandably, and we paid a good rate of $11 for our whole family for the day unlimited use.  Parking was $10/day self park, or $12/day for valet, but we saw many of the hotels we've stayed
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your glowing review.  We have done some great specials online, hence your rate and value were exceptional.  I'm glad you got that rate...  Thanks for taking the time to write and you are correct every hotel charges for parking and we are the lowest in town.  In addition, we work very well to ensure k'ya restaurant is the best deal in town.  I know our Chef will be very happy to hear your experiences.  Thank you again for the review, but most importantly thank you for your business.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Nice decoration, but with noise from hwy 5 and hidden fees
Summary: They market themselves as a boutique hotel, but this gigantic hotel is a boutique hotel like walmart is a boutique store. The main plus is nicely decorated and well equipped rooms. The hotel is close, even a walking distance, to Disney. However, the hotel is located between a highway and two main streets, and receives constant VERY loud noise from them throughout the night (even in the rooms that are far from the highway). Also, it is well hidden that parking is $10 a day and the shuttle to Disney is $5 per person.   Overall, the location is convenient but if you have a car I'd go to a hotel 5 minutes driving from there which is probably cheaper, more quiet, and with free parking.
Manager Response: I'm sorry that the noise was not to your liking.  Unfortunately and due to our proximity to Disneyland, we are next to the freeway, however most guests do not have issues once in the room.  Our parking charges are $10 for self park and $12 for valet and we really are the lowest cost for parking in town.  We really do not hide our charges and I'm sorry you felt that way.  I hope you'll give us another opportunity to serve you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: This was the first time visiting your hotel, and will now most likely be part of our future Disneyland itineraries.  The staff was great, ESPECIALLY a lovely bartender by the name of Jessica.  We ended up spending our entire Saturday night enjoying her food recommendations and sipping the BEST Mojito's.  Had it not been for her we may have wandered out.  Poolside fireworks are a plus. 24 hr pool was a little chilly.  Food was great, rooms were large and functional.  We will be here again!
Manager Response: I will make sure Jessica gets the pat on the back for her exceptional efforts during your visit.  Thank you for your business and continued future visits.  We are glad you will make us your local destination for the Anaheim area.  Thanks for your business...  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: My husband and I stayed at The Menage for 8 nights. The room was very clean-so was the bathroom(this is #1 in my book).The bed was pretty and quite comfortable. The rest of the room was like an  average hotel room (Mini-fridges are available. Ask when you arrive).The bathroom was pretty small but fine.   The public areas are nice. The pool/hot tub area is large,and again, very clean. There are plenty of lounge chairs in the sun or shade. And a tiki bar that has a great happy hour. Their on site restaurant is fabulous! Breakfast portions are huge and super fresh, at great prices. Dinner portions are smaller but just as good. Getting around without a car is easy, if you don't need to go too far. They have a local bus system that is great. It takes you to Disney, Target, The
Manager Response: The fireworks are quite loud from Disneyland, however they are seasonal and people do enjoy the view from the pool area.  Thank you for taking the time to write such a great review.  We appreciate your thoughts and I know our team will be glad to hear you enjoyed your visit.  We look forward to seeing you again soon in the Anaheim Area.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel. Except For the Sounds on the Freeway.
Summary: My daughter and I stayed 4 nights and 5 days on our Disneyland vacation.  Looks like they shot the view of the room with a long angle lens for the website.  I thought my room would be larger.  Everything was sort of cramped together. The chair needed to be repaired and the coffepot needed a serious cleaning. The beds were nicely decorated and the flat screen tv was great.  Other than that, it was average.  At first, I was really disappointed but my daughter made me realize it was a nice, comfortable room.   I was concerned about the noise from the freeway after reading other reviews. The other reviews were right.  Our room was right on Harbor and Ball.  You could hear cars all night long.  Thankfully, my daughter is deaf (she really is deaf) and I am a solid sleeper.  When I did
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write the review.  I'm sorry about the coffee pot and the chair, I've personally addressed it with our Housekeeping Team.  I do hope you'll be back to join us again soon and thank you for your business...  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Amazing staff, for a lovely place away from the crazyness!
Summary: So I've stayed at Hotel Menage before and thought 2 years later, being back this way I'd stay again after my previous stay.  This time however, we planned on staying a fortnight rather than the shorter stay last time.  So, I'm here right now, halfway through my stay, and had to share my experiences so far.  Things didn't start off so good, my partner is extremely fussy about what she wants in a hotel/motel, etc. So we checked in, and immediately, she didn't look happy. She didn't feel the vibe in the room, I asked what it was and she couldn't pin point it.  Needless to say, I wandered downstairs and had to wait to speak to someone at the desk (they were very busy) when I finally was about to talk to someone they were confused as to what it maybe, and it occurred that the room
Manager Response: First and foremost, thanks for your continued business, we appreciate every single guest.  Our team works hard at service, we may lack certain things for a full service hotel, but as you noted, once in the room it's quite cozy.  Thanks for taking the time, during your stay, to commend the team.  I know they will be happy to hear about your experiences.  k'ya, our restaurant, is quite nice, the value for price paid is what we strived to do, so again, we are very pleased you experienced what we created.  Thank you again for all your kind words and we look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: Went to Anaheim to see Bad Brains at the House of Blues and decided to make a short overnight trip of it. Hotel Menage was the perfect place to do that -- the service, the room and the amenities were all fantastic and a great value.  The hotel interior is beautiful, with a great restaurant (K'ya) and bar right off the lobby, a lounge/computer room (w/red velvet curtains) to the right of the front desk and a view of the palapa bar and pool area. Like others have mentioned, the pool area is awesome! Plenty of lounge chairs and circular wicker sofas (big enough for two or even three if you're small), plus a covered area with seating, towels and restrooms. Though we didn't use it at night, the pool and jacuzzi are opened 24 hours. The palapa bar is opened 'til about 2AM and the
Manager Response: Thank you, thank you, thank you.  We are a no attitude establishment and we work hard to provide excellent customer service.  We strive on ensuring quality for price paid, as well as value and your experience proved that we succeeded.  Thank you for your review and thank you for the future business to our hotel.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage

Summary: Drove six hours to get to Anaheim for a vacation with my daughter before she returned to school.Booked the hotel thru hotwire so wasnt sure what to expect.Was pleasantly surprised when I got to the Hotel.Walking distance to Disneyland,24 hour pool and hottub,happy hour half off drinks and appitizers from 4-7,nicely set up pool area with large round lounge chairs, extremely courtious staff,nice location even though close to the freeways the disney fireworks show was right overhead.The restaurant on site has food from all over the world and was priced surpriseingly low. All in all my daughter and I had a great time at the Hotel Menage and would like to stay there whenever we return to Anaheim.Thanks Hotel Menage.
Manager Response: I'm so glad we were worth the 6 hours to get here.  I am also very glad to hear of your experience with our hotel.  In addition, our restaurant is very value oriented and offers a wide range of themed food.  We pride ourselves on value for price paid and excellent customer service, so it's always exciting to hear our guests experiencing what we work so hard to accomplish.  Thank you for your review, but most importantly thank you for your business.  We look forward to seeing you and your family again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage

Summary: It was 4th of July weekend and my partner and I were bummed we were stuck in LA.   We decided we wanted lots of pool time, drinks and amazing fireworks. Disneyland offers the best fireworks show but we had no intention of actually going into the park. Some of the reviews of the Disneyland hotel pools had us nervous since some travelers recounted times when the pool was shut down, due to a child using it as their personal potty.   Hotel Menage fit us perfectly! It's a cute refurbed hotel with a pool that is heated and open 24 hours. Sure it's not the Mirage in Las Vegas but its definitely worth the price! We had a AAA discount...although I don't recall the rate at the time, it was worth the value. Yes, parking is extra each day but they are very up front with that.  The service
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.  We are all that you say and more.  We do provide the city shuttle service to and from Disneyland and it is quite convenient.  Your detailed remarks will truly make others visit our hotel and it is greatly appreciated.  Please keep telling your friends and family about us and we look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you for your business and continued patronage.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: Ok, so I have just returned from 5 nights at the Menage- let's just say that it was so bad that upon arrival my bf and I trawled other hotels looking for a room at Disney, to find they were fully booked.  Where to start- whilst the hotel looks modern and clean on the website and at first appearance- it really is not! A flat screen TV on the wall doesn't suddenly make this a good hotel, correction- motel. First room- second floor- above the bar and noisy! Would have dealt with this but after sitting on the bed I got badly bitten! Change of room -only one available 502, top floor, right next to the freeway, which is as busy as the M25. Really. Disney firework noise not an issue as we were the park to watch them- freeway, whole new ballgame! First night- no sleep at all- in the end
Manager Response: I don't know where to begin.  Most of our guests find our hotel the best in town, but it's really unfortunate about your visit with us.  I am truly sorry about your experience.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Great for adults going to Disneyland
Summary: We are two adults who love Disney but wanted a slightly more adult atmosphere and still be able to walk to the parks.  Menage fit the bill.  We opted for the first floor, high ceiling rooms.  It cost a few bucks more but was worth being so close to the pool and the hotel entrance.  I don't think the rooms are any bigger than standard rooms--just taller.  Yes, the hotel is adjacent to the highway, but that really wasn't a big deal.  We did suffer noise problems the first night when they didn't turn off the pool stereo system at the right hour, even though we went to the front desk.  The same issue happened the second night, but they turned it off immediately after we made a phone call. The pool is the big plus.  Great atmosphere--nice service from the pool wait staff and while
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review.  Although we are great for adults, families do enjoy the feel and look of our hotel as well.  Our value is better than any other place in town.  As far as the music is concerned, we have addressed it with our team.  Everything you noted in your review is dead on.  We are very close to the park and the fireworks literally look like they were meant for our hotel.  In addition, our team works diligently to ensure every customer has a great experience.  We look forward to having you visit with us again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: The Hotel Menage, is one of the best hotels in the Disneyland area! The warm greeting we received from the valet service and the entire staff set the mood for my wife and I, celebrating our 20th wedding Anniversary! Soon as you walk in the door and look at the lobby you feel like a King and Queen; and once you see the Restaurant, Pool area, Fitness room, Inside & Outside Bars and then your Beautiful Room. " You will know that you are a KING & QUEEN" Respectfully, The Turner's
Manager Response: Thank you!  Wow, we are very happy to hear of your visit with us and Happy Anniversary.  Please tell all your friends and family...  We look forward to seeing you again soon, hopefully before your next anniversary.  Regards,  Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: We would stay again but we still have a few complaints
Summary: First impression was good.  Lobby was really nice.  Reception people were very friendly.  When we walked to our room the first time I felt as if the halls, corridors were dingy and dirty; could have used a good washing.  When we walked into our room my daughter was very excited.  it was very impressive looking -- not at all like an econo lodge or motels I have been in in the past.  Our toilet kept gurgling all night the first night and when we went to use it, it was clogged.  I called the  front desk and they said someone would fix it while we were at DL.  It was fixed.  Toilet gurgled all that night.  Next morning it flooded all over the floor.  They sent maintenance again and when we got back from the park it was fixed.  Next morning it was clogged again and the front desk
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write this review. I'm extremely disappointed on your experience to get the toilet fixed, trust me we are taking corrective action so this does not happen again.  In addition, I have addressed, with our team, on how we resolve and follow up on issues like yours.  Lastly I'm very pleased to hear that you will be joining us again even after the mess ups you experienced.  We look forward to ensuring your next visit is not like this visit.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: Booked hotel through Expedia.com. The room was OK, pool was nice, good restaurant and close to Disneyland. HOWEVER, I always travel with my Mac laptop because I have my own business and need to use Skype and email many times a day. As soon as we arrived (we were celebrating my daughter's 9th birthday with a trip to Disneyland), I tried to connect to the internet. Went down to front desk...was told system was incompatable with Mac OSX. I lost money and clients because I couldn't connect to internet. Called Expedia.com....they said they would call hotel and resolve problem. Neither Expedia not the hotel did anything. Arrived back from Disneyland at 11pm to this continued problem. Had to find another hotel and move everything on Monday (Expedia was no help!). Leo at the front desk
Manager Response: I too have a Mac and have had no issues with the internet.  I'm really sorry that you had some issues, unfortunately, at times, we cannot control technology.  I am currently having our IT personnel look at this to find out what the issues may be.  I do hope you'll give us another opportunity.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Above average rooms and pool at Hotel Menage
Summary: The Hotel Menage was renovated to resemble a boutique hotel.  As other reviewers have indicated it is a hotel/motel, superior to a motel, better than some hotels but not on par with the big city boutique hotels.  Exterior corridors are the main reason.  The hotel is clean but looks not dated, but  less polished than it should be.  Front desk staff were nice and helpful.  Overall, for the money paid the Hotel Menage represents good value and amenities.  Except for my lack of overall interest in Anaheim, I would stay again.  Pros:  -Very comfortable bed in room (pillow top) -Good size HD TV  -Free wireless internet - Large, comfortable room with plenty of outlets for electronics. -Very small refrigerators available (if available) at request and without charge -Housekeeping very
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear you enjoyed your visit at Hotel Menage.  Your detailed description will only help to improve our standards, in particular the controllable issues (i.e. linen).  I'm very sorry about this.  I have addressed this with our Housekeeping staff and assure you that this is not acceptable.  We do hope you'll come back to the area again soon and thank you for taking the time to write a great review.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: My son and daughter inlaw and my 4 yr old grandon stayed at Hotel Menage for 5 days while visiting Disneyland. Although the room with a queen and king bed was crowded, and the furnishing were a little outdated, the customer service couldn't be beaten by any other hotel. The front desk staff were the most friendliest I've come across, as well as the valet employees outside. Sylvia and the other girls in the front lobby were ALWAYS CHEERFUL, KIND AND VERY HELPFUL. My family and I decided that we would not stay any where esle when we are ever in the Anehiem area  due to the fact of how special the staff made us feel.
Manager Response: I'm glad you experienced our wonderful service.  We strive to provide both value and a great experience.  Thank you for taking the time to write this review, but most importantly thank you for your business.  Lastly, we are grateful that you and your family have decided to make our hotel your only choice in the Anaheim area.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: Booked online, tried this hotel based on reviews. Great location, nice contemporary designed rooms for a reasonable price and OUTSTANDING SERVICE! We will be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for your great and to the point review.  We are happy that you enjoyed everything during your stay.  We look forward to seeing you again soon, please tell all your friends about us...  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Too much highway traffic noise, too far from DL, extra fee for parking
Summary: We just came back from Disneyland and stayed at Menage last week. The highway noise was too loud, too far to walk to Disneyland, and it charges $10 each night for parking (too expensive). It has free Wi-Fi internet, but the connection was not stable. We will NOT stay in this hotel next time when we visit DL.
Manager Response: I'm sorry about your experience at our hotel.  We really work hard to ensure every guest is 100% satisfied each and every day and provide value for price paid and most of our customers experience this.  We do hope you'll give us another opportunity to serve you again.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Second time here and will stay here again.
Summary: I dig the Hotel Melange.  Yes it is an old refurbished Motel.  Yes there is noise from the freeways.  Yes I will stay here again.  Why?   The pool area is great.  Huge lounging sofas, great reclining chairs.   The lobby is cool and has a great bar & wait staff.  Food is good and cheap, especially at happy hour.  I had the carnitas tacos ($1.50) & the hummus "bowl" (olives, roasted red peppers & tomatoes, pita & hummus - $2.50) and was full.  This became my dinner as it was plenty.  I tip the scales at a buck 90 so I'm not a waif when it comes to food.  The room decor is very comforting and new.  The place is clean and, yes you can see remnants of the motel days but they've done a pretty good job of making it chic. I dig the fact they've taken a motel and made it into a place
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review, I'm sure a lot of people will find it helpful to hear of your experiences.  We strive to provide value at a good price point as well as excellent service.  We are ecstatic to have you and your family as loyal guests of our hotel.  We look forward to seeing you again soon and thank you for your business.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for my HS reunion.  The lobby/bar area is quite nice, as is the area around the pool.  The room was large and utilitarian.  Not quite upscale, but certainly a step up from a budget hotel.  The room rate was very reasonable.  Right off the freeway and down the road from Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We do want to provide value for price paid and I'm glad you experienced it during your visit.  We look forward to having you in Anaheim again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Dark, noisy, trying too hard to be trendy
Summary: The best thing about this hotel is being able to watch the fireworks from Disneyland.  The restaurant is also fun and the food is decent and reasonably priced.   I stayed here twice in May 2010 (for 2 nights each time) - because I had business meetings in Anaheim and needed an inexpensive room in the area.  The rooms look "trendy and new" but hidden behind the veneer are broken toilet paper holders, falling tiles in the bathroom, and cheap towels.  Walking in the lobby, pool area, or the "business center" (red velour walls with two computers) I felt like I was in Key West in the 1980s at a party....it is loud and noisy.  The parking lot "houses" many homeless people, yet parking is $10/day.  The staff is young and not very helpful.  There is absolutely no customer service.  On
Manager Response: I'm truly sorry about your experience.  We do want to be something for everyone and most reviews come out quite nice.  I'm sorry about what happened in your room, trust me I will research what occurred and will fix the issues.  We do hope you'll give us another chance.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: Me and my Boyfriend stayed at the Hotel Menage July 21-26th and absolutely loved it! We have stayed in many different hotels near Disneyland and this one truly is a hidden gem! It is approx 10min walk to Disneyland or there is a shuttle that you can take directly to and from Disneyland at 3$ a day or 10$ for 5 days. There is a bunch of restaurants and fast food places nearby such as McDonalds and IHop, but the Restaurant at Hotel Menage (Kya) is amazing and soo cheap! Especially during Happy Hour 4-7. The pool is also great, there is a hot tub and big pool with plenty of comfortable lounge chairs surrounding it as well as a great pool bar.The staff was amazing so friendly and helpful. Our room was located on the 4th floor facing towards the pool and we couldnt hear a single bit
Manager Response: Your review exceeds our expectations, and I'm so glad we exceeded yours.  We read every review and love hear all comments, good or bad, but yours truly is exceptional.  Thank you for your comments and your business.  I know we'll see you and your family again soon, please tell your friends about us...  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: This hotel is the worst hotel i've ever stayed at.  Don't be fooled by the website!  We kept hearing the elevator all night long, kept hearing kids run around outside early in the morning and the noise from the freeway was driving us INSANE!  The hotel is just super ghetto.  When I checked out, no one even asked me how our stay was.  The website made it look like a nice hotel, but it was the complete opposite.  I really wanted to leave and go to another hotel.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you felt that way, most of our guests are quite happy with our hotel.  I hope you'll give us another chance.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Good Disneyland base, shame about the highway noise
Summary: Stayed here for four nights.  Got a good rate of $49 a night plus taxes.  Hotel is 15 minutes walk to Disneyland door to door but you have to cross the busy highway entrances and exits.  Hotel has a pool and jacuzzi but we didn't use this.  Breakfast is expensive but adequate.  Be warned if you a light sleeper as the highway noise is very bad.  The rooms are ok but the bathroom is on the very small side and needs updating.   If possible ask for a high room away from the highway so that you get a good view of the fireworks.
Manager Response: I'm sorry that the noise was bothersome.  Most of our rooms with the door closed are quiet, so I don't know what occurred during your visit.  We do hope you'll give us another opportunity to serve you in the near future.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: A few of my colleagues and I stayed at the Menage for an Anaheim conference. I was originally skeptical because a) it wasn't at the hotel our conference was at, and b) in pulling up to the hotel it reminded me of a motel. But my skepticism was off base. The customer service was great. Their was free wi-fi throughout the hotel (including pool area). The food was inexpensive and clever/good. We were in walking distance to Disneyland AND could see the fireworks from the pool. The pool was also great as well as the hot tub. Last but not least, the room was nice and had a great, large high-def panel tv.  The only thing missing was a hotel store for toilettries, etc, or for quick snacks. Really nice stay over all. Also pricey parking, but makes sense because of proximity to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your glowing review.  I know that what you experienced is what I hope many business travelers will experience as well.  Our complimentary wifi, great food with a wide selection, and location makes it a good choice when in the Anaheim area.  We did add a vending area in the lobby to assist with the after hour toiletry needs.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: My family and I enjoyed our overnight stay at the hotel.  The staff, from the bell desk to the restaurant, were all very friendly.  We loved our room.  It was spacious enough for the 3 of us.  My husband loved the pool area.  The music that played and the ambiance was very relaxing.  He could have stayed by the pool all day.  The hotel is so close to Disneyland that the fireworks show is AMAZING!!  Just like being at Disneyland, but without the crowds.  My 2 year old loved it!!!  We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves as a family.  The resort is very kid friendly.  Loved the food at K'ya.  There is something on the menu for EVERYONE!!!  Can't wait to go back for a getaway with my husband.  You would not be disappointed if you stayed here for business or pleasure!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are pleased to continually hear good reviews from families as well as couples, so it's a great way to take a much needed break from the world.  Your right on with our pool, music, and restaurant and our team will be very happy to hear of your great experience.  Thank you for your business.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Good Alternative to the Big 5 star Hotels with 5 star customer service
Summary: I stayed at this hotel, which was a nice alternative to staying in 5 star hotels and good value for money.  Very friendly, good position (5-10 minute walk to attractions, or shuttle bus avail for $3.00 per day from hotel).  Across the road is a service station selling the cheapest water and sweets in Anaheim.  Staff went out of their way to help out on everything.  Very clean and nice relaxed out door pool area and bar (Tropical theme).  Good for families also.  The only problem would be some of the rooms face the busy freeway, and may be a bit noisy for some, however, staff found a nice quiet room for me facing the pool (no pool noise and no car noise or very minimal and I'm a light sleeper).   Great little restaurant in hotel, affordable for all the family.    Gayle - Sydney,
Manager Response: With all the cookie cutter hotels, we did want to stand out.  As you noted our service really stands above and beyond the rest so I'm very pleased to hear of your experience.  Thank you for taking the time to write the review and we look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: Pleasantly surprised at accommodations, facilities, and prices -- lots of fun!
Summary: After quickly booking Hotel Menage with coupled airfare on Allegiant Air, we were dismayed and perplexed at some negative reviews floating on the internet. But we decided to stick it out for two days. Wow, were the reviews ever wrong. The "Tiki style" pool bar with Kristen was excellent. Three big screen TVs. Happy Hour = 50% off drinks and appetizers from 4-7 PM daily. Walk to Disneyland or take the $4.00 all-day shuttle.. Excellent exercise / weight room on the 2nd floor. Easy valet car parking or park yourself = not a problem. The menus were perfect. Items included delicacies from China Japan, Mexico, Korea, and, of course, the US.
