Again, sorry about the experience and our Manager will be in touch as soon as we can.  Regards,  Hotel Menage

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay near SNA
Summary: We were referred to this hotel by a travel agent as a great place to stay near John Wayne airport. I was a little leery of a hotel near Disneyland and between two freeways, for $130 a night including tax. I am happy to report that this place is a little gem near disneyland. Was the food great? No. Was the pool amazing? No.. but everything was certainly great for the price and convenience it offered. We ate at the restaurant and considered the food servicable, but nothing spectacular. That being said, for under $100 including drinks, appetizers, main entrees, and dessert and tip, it was worth the money we spent. The rooms were a little small, but nicely appointed with plasma (like 48") TVs, couch, desk, and bathroom. Considering all of the tourist traps out there, espeically in
Manager Response: mhaynes,  Thank you for your kind words.  We appreciate your review and thank you for the recommendation.  If you can detail more specifically the problems with the pool and the food it would give us and opportunity to improve.  We have two k'ya's in the Orange County area and have been Zagat rated, so we definately want to improve.  Thank you again,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: We booked a bunch of rooms for our family and friends for our wedding in January. The staff was great and even helped us set up a welcome basket for our guests. Everyone I talked to loved the place. From the service to the clenlibess it was great. They also liked the big screen plasmas in the room as well. This is a classy hotel but you don't pay the price for it. Right across the freeway from disneyland, and a great pool area with a secluded pool bar for the adults. You should stay here. consider this 10 reviews instead of one.
Manager Response: weluvtotravel2,  Thank you for your kind words, we appreicate your business and look forward to seeing you back at Hotel Menage...  We will definately pass on your kind words to the team!  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Menage during mid-July and had a great time.  The decor, friendly staff, location, and price were all unbeatable.  This place definitely stands out among typcial branded motels and hotels that are so boring and predictable.  We especially enjoyed the pool area which I think is the best in the city.  Thanks Hotel Menage for a wonderful stay....we'll be back!
Manager Response: JWL009,  Thank you for your kind word, we strive to ensure each and every guest has an experience like yours.  We look forward to seeing you back at Hotel Menange,  Regards,  Management

Summary: Place is a dump!  Food at the restaurant was horrible!  STaff is not professional!  Just horrible!  Worst hotel experience, not even comparable to a MOTEL!
Manager Response: stevekim1043,  We apologize that you feel this way regarding the hotel, If you could be more specific we can work on "correcting" the issues you may have had.  Regards,  Hotel Menage.

Summary Heading: The place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: This hotel beats them all.  If your tired of the same old Franchise hotel environment, then this is the place for you.  Property was fresh and fun, well designed and the service was first class.  All staff was willing to help at any turn and gladly answered the same old Disneyland questions that they hear 1000 times a day as if it was the first time they heard the question, and that is rare.  The kids loved the outdoor pool and we took advantage of the on-site laundry to get out the ice cream stains.  The kids ate breakfast free in lobby restaurant and we all had full egg/pancake/bacon hot breakfast for under $20 for a family of 5.  Outdoor pool bar was fun and convenient on the hot days, and bartenders kept us entertained on out "night out".  I'd recommend this hotel for anyone
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great for all types of travellers
Summary: My daughters (13 and 15)  and I just returned from a 5 day trip to Disneyland and our hotel experience was great. The rooms were clean and quiet - we were on the 3rd floor next to the freeway. From the poolside of the hotel we had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks each night. The walk to the parks was a quick 15 minutes, or there was a shuttle every 25 minutes. The pool complex was not your standard crowded rectangle in the ground surrounded by cheap furniture. It was a beautiful pool/hot tub surrounded by tall palm trees AND it was open 24/7. it is a great hotel for both families and couples. The staff is friendly and helpful. The restaurant was reasonably priced with good food.  Highly reccommended!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I found this hotel online and was really impressed with the pictures I saw. The pictures seemed to live up to the appearance of the hotel. There was a couple things about the room that could have been better. The bathtub was cracking and peeling in spots and the toilet could have been replaced. The room service never replenished the coffee packets, also our carpet was always soaked next to the air conditioning unit.  The freeway is right next to the hotel and the higher you are at the hotel the nosier is gets, we were on the second floor and I could barely hear the freeway traffic. The pool music plays till about 11pm as well. Parking cost $10 a day for self park, $12 a day for valet. There is a shuttle to Disneyland for $1.50 each way for adults and $.50 each way for kids,
Manager Response: none

We bought Disney's two-day park hopper tickets and decided we needed a nearby hotel that was comfortable but a good value for Thursday and Friday nights.  The Hotel Ménage was formerly a Holiday Inn, and not too long ago.  They're still undertaking some long deferred maintenance on the place.  What struck us most about the hotel upon our arrival was its very close proximity to Disneyland.  The property is directly across I-5 from the green Team Disney buildings at the north border of Disneyland.  The walk on Harbor Drive is only about 10
Manager Response: none

Summary: STOP SEARCHING!!! If you are from out of town or a so cal resident, there is no other hotel in Orange County to stay at than HOTEL MENAGE.  My name is Gregg and my Fiance and I are so cal residents and like to visit Disneyland very often.  Like others, I myself spend time online looking for great rates and quality rooms when we stay in Downtown Aneheim.  It is unfortunate that my fiance and me have stayed in dozens of hotels and even resorts before finding HOTEL MENAGE.  I was blown away when even their  room rates  start at $100 - $120( wich is one of the most affordable prices in the entire area). It's like each standard room is a suite. they have king beds with a sleeping sofa and flat screen TV's in evert room. It is seriously incredible. They have by far the most beautiful
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was referred to this hotel by my travel agent.  I had brought a tour group down of over twenty.   First of all, the hotel was extremely accomodating in arranging we all had rooms on the same floor.  Second, we were able to order food in advance and it came out hot and on time and delicious.   This is a great hotel for any group.   BIG pool and hot tub, and nice restaurant and bar.   Really enjoyed the stay and highly recommend it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Me and my girlfriend loved this hotel.  It was the best experience we had.  At check in the front desk staff were nice and friendly.  Our room had a beautiful view of the Disney Land park.  The pool was heated and very clean.  The Resturant was the best food with wonderful prices.  The loung/bar area was the perfect relaxing atmosphere with hip music all the time.  The rooms were spacious and made me feel like i was home.  The tv were huge and were in high definition.  Absolutely loved this hotel and wont stay at any other when i am in Anaheim.                                                                                         Kauai
Manager Response: none

Summary: The management at this hotel is horrendous. I was assigned to a smoking room, when I CLEARLY made sure that they knew I was allergic to smoke. When I complained, the management said there was nothing they could do because all the other rooms were booked.  SOOO I went on the non-smoking floors, and started banging on everyones doors... No one was answering... I tried a couple of hours again, and still no one was answering.. After attempting again to change my room and being denied, I went over to the Marriott.  I explained my revolting experience to the Manager there, who was more than glad to take our business. Not only were they kind and courteous, he also offered me a discounted rate for my disastrous experience.  Don't waste your time at this "hotel". Clearly it was a motel
Manager Response: InternationalTriper,  I apologize for the experience you had at the hotel.  The entire hotel is non-smoking, so I don't know what occured with your room, however I assure you that we are dedicated to making everyone's experience perfect.  Please accept my personal apology for what occured...  Regards.

Summary: Lots of nice amenities, good food.  Staff was very helpful.  Only negative was amount of white noise from highway
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Another great stay at Hotel Menage!
Summary: I am a business traveler that regularly visits north Orange County and have stayed at Hotel Menage on my last half dozen or so visits.  I prefer to stay at this hotel for several reasons...a top notch restaurant, attentive staff, beautiful pool area (with poolside bar) and a conveniently accessible location.  During my last visit this summer they were putting the final touches on their new suites, (I found out they have four), so I requested one of the new suites for this visit.  I was given the Africa suite (named for it's safari decor) and I was blown away.  The room had a very cool vibe, low slung sectional couches covered in faux tiger skins, not one but two flat-panel televisions, DVD player with surround sound and an iPod dock.  Probably the coolest feature of the room was
Manager Response: none

Summary: hotel was not up to standards!!! you could hear cars pass by, rooms were "okay", beds slightly stained, dusty underneath drawers ect.  Me and my family stayed here when we went to disneyland. We went to the pool and found something very unusual at the bottom of it. Come to found out, its POOP! Very very gross.  Rooms were small so we upgraded to the larger rooms. "Concrete" floors and visible pipes above made us wish we hadnt made that decision.  Vallet workers were kind and the food was pretty good.  Those were the only good things there.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Young, fun, vibrant hotel in great location!
Summary: My wife and I recently stayed at Hotel Menage and found the hotel to have a vibrant, young, hip, feeling and had a blast there!  The food was great (fresh made sandwiches, the meatball and calamari appetizers where spectacular).  The bar was fun and the bartenders were very friendly.  They had a DJ spinning and there was some late-night dancing.  All-in-all, a very hip place to be and very close to Disneyland!  I can't wait to get out there this summer when the whether is nice to be by the pool & pool bar!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very Loud and Not Like the Pictures
Summary: We stayed here for a two night business trip to Disneyland.  When I saw the photos on the website, I thought we scored.  The lobby is very nice, as is the bar area.  However, our room was not what we expected and it didn't look like the photos.  Our room was on the 5th floor and it faced the freeway.  The traffic was so loud we had to run the fan in our room all night long.  There's no central heating/cooling/thermometer, very disappointed there was no internet (not wireless or wired).    If you're looking for a basic, clean place to stay near Disneyland, then the Menage hotel will fit your needs.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have never been so pleasantly surprised with a hotel in my life, and I am in the hospitality industry.  We stayed in one of the loft rooms right by the pool.  Neat room, great TV, cool bed, all very spacious.  We could even watch the Disneyland fireworks from our door!   We were originally planning on heading to Downtown Disney for dinner but could not pass the great menu and reasonable prices at Ky'a, the hotels restaurant.  Dinner for two, with an appetizer (Amazing flash fried calamari), and a bottle of wine was $60.  The service in the restaurant and at the front desk was great.  We ordered breakfast in our room the next morning, (a french toast plate was $7),  it was at our door in 15 minutes.  I wish we could have stayed for lunch because they had a whole Panini menu,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: 5+ Stars, We WILL return, Great for Kids, Close to Disneyland!!
Summary: We just got back from our first "family" vacation to Disneyland.  We were wavering between this hotel and another hotel.  We opted for Hotel Menage and were very glad we did.        The hotel is decorated in a very modern but comfortable way.  The staff did an excellent job making us as parents of young kids feel welcome.  We needed some extra stuff, like a crib, and a room with easy access and they helped us right away.  The menu at the Kya (the restaurant in the hotel) was affordable and top notch food.  I highly recommend you go there for breakfast before heading to Disneyland.  The bar was great for afterwards also, cheap happy hour and a good feel.  Here's a hint, go with grandparents or other couple and take turns watching the kids, that way you can go down to the bar for

Summary: The staff here was just awesome; the noise from the freeway is loud as is the music from the tiki  bar.When I called to ask the front desk to turn it down, they did right away and were so nice.  We do not like waiting for the Anaheim bus so we are branching out.

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Menage for a quick two night getaway. I booked directly through the hotel website and since we were staying on a Wed & Thurs night we got a killer deal of $69/night (everything else within the same proximity was $119+).   I travel quite a bit and have stayed in a few hundred hotels in my life time and this one was average as far as ammenities but will stay on my radar based on it being so different in atmosphere from your normal run of the mill 3 star hotels. It was unique in theming and of course as many others have said the pool was pretty amazing.   The staff definitely leaves something to be desired, but I get the impression that most of them are new and will chalk it up to a learning curve. When we got there on Wednesday, we made it in time

Summary: Great atmosphere.  Newly remodles rooms with big flat screen tvs,  Excellent restraunt.  I stay here monthly for a "vacation day".  Landscape around the pool and spa make you feel like your in a vacation resort in Maui.  I love it!

Summary: The Menage Hotel is very clean and seems to be youth-oriented (ages 21-35).  The room cost was $59.00 a night which was very reasonable.  I was told rack rate for the same bedroom (2 queens) was $89.00 a night.   I got a price break since I booked through Hotwire.  This hotel was rated as a 3.5 by Hotwire but personally I think it is more a 3.0.  Our room was larger than most in size (for this price rate), very comfortable beds with 4 pillows (loved that feature) and a huge flat-screened TV mounted on the wall.  It was clean and safe.  Even though Interstate 5 runs directly on one side of of this triangular-shaped property and Harbor Blvd and Ball Rd on the other two sides, our room location was above the lobby area overlooking the pool so traffic noise was not a big issue. Summary Heading: Great Food!  You'll truly enjoy your dinner dining experience
Summary: A very warm and friendly place.  All the staff are friendly and helpful.  Yes I would rethink the music coming through the lobby, bar and pool area.  Way too loud and annoying.  Art deco is the theme here and a very nice change of scene from the ordinary hotel lobbies.   Pool area is wonderful, but again that music never ends!   Watch the Disney fireworks display from the pool area, very impressive.    I would definately stay here again, and enjoy my dining experience with excellent choices and very nicely prepared dishes that are quite tasty too and inexpensive for the quality of the food and presentation.  The room is a room, you get over the 7' headboards,   the presentation is very nice, but a room is still a room.  Loved the big screen tv!

Summary: The first thing that hits you when you come upon the Menage is confusion at how a hotel (Motel?) with catwalks can be listed as a 31/2 star property. This is a hotel suffering from an identity crisis.  It can't decide if it's a run of the mill Motel or a chic, upscale hotel.  The lobby leads you to believe the latter. The rooms have updated, modern furniture with a huge flat screen tv but the room is basically a Motel 6 room with a noisy old fashioned air conditioning unit and a very tiny, old bathroom. Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed at a lot of hotels, but never encountered a nicer staff than at the Hotel Menage. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. Many boutique hotels have an attitude, but this one was welcoming and comfortable from the moment we pulled up. From the valet to the chefs and the front desk workers - everyone was great, and it really makes a difference.  The hotel itself is clean, comfortable and stylish. Would definitely go back.

Summary Heading: A Hotwire.com Surprise- what a find!
Summary: I booked this on Hotwire- and was a little leary. I got it for just $59 a night- and was pleasantly surprised on how nice a place it was. I wouldn't really say it's much of a family spot though- the entire lobby is like a swinging singles and mingle bar scene. WONDERFUL beds with lots of pillows and upgraded linens. But the bathrooms really need to be updated- the bath was so shallow, it was like sitting in a puddle! The pool is great, quite large. The panini bar was good for a quick bite. The ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) stops right in front- and it's a quick 5 minute ride to/from Disneyland. Would stay here again- but I'd like it if there were little fridge's in the rooms. And 1/2 the vending machines were broken- or out of choices. But there is a mini-mart across the street

Summary: We booked this hotel through Hotwire for a good price.  It was a nice hotel.  Staff was very accomodating, it was very clean, had a great pool area and was close to Disneyland.  The only thing it didn't have was a continental breakfast.  We would have loved that!  We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Summary: I made this reservation based on a great price I received on their website.  We stayed from Oct. 9 to 12th, and were very happy with the room and hotel in general; with their strongest attribute, its employees.  From the time of check-in to check-out the staff was wonderful.  They were always very helpful and friendly and when a problem did arise, they rectified it immediately. The rooms were a nice size with plenty of room to store all of our stuff and my teenage kids really liked the flat screen TV.   The hotel is right in between the Interstate 5 and Ball RD.  This makes the traffic noise very noticeable outside of your room, but once in your room it is only slightly noticeable and the air conditioner helps to mute the outside noise. The music in the pool area is very loud

Summary: The grounds (pool/lobby) were beautiful, but the rooms were just ok.  The stark white walls, loud old wall airconditioner were in sharp contract to the modern design of the furniture and decor.  It was probably a good thing that the air conditioner was loud because there was quite a bit of highway noise (it was drowned out by the air conditioning unit).  The pool was great.... loved the drinks poolside in big comfortable lounge chairs.  The staff was all very friendly, and accomodating.  We got a 2 queen bed room (we were traveling with 2 small children), and they only had 2 bath towels in the room (wierd?).  Couldn't reach housekeeping but the front desk was more than accomodating.   Overall, I would stay there again if we go back to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: If you like traffic and parties...go to the Hotel Menage

My Mom booked the hotel directly, as she is a travel agent.  The hotel check-in staff was well aware of this fact considering that she was getting her travel agent discount.    Usually, hotels like to make the best impression on travel agents, as that is one of their ways to get business. Hmmm, they must not have gotten that memo.  When we pulled into the hotel, I was asked if we were there for the private party.  I said no and was directed to a parking spot for registering guests. Summary Heading: Fabulous Stay at a Clean, Fun, Excel Food Hotel
Summary: Chosen for the close proximity to Disneyland, this hotel went above and beyond our expectations!! You enter a circular drive with a beautiful waterfall announcing HOTEL MENAGE, pleasant and welcoming staff at valet, opening doors as well as registration. Staff were well informed and very helpful, something we feel is a "must" when traveling.   Beautiful colors and a very hip interior in restaurant, lounge, computer area and rooms! The comfort continues outside with a very slick and fun tiki bar and the pool is awesome. The most comfortable poolside lounges we have experienced. Unique large round sunbathing lounges as well as private cabanas available. Water fountain fun for kids and great music outside. Several families having fun in the pool made for a great ambience. This hotel is modern with lots of personality while offering all the luxuries of some of the most expensive hotels that we’ve stayed at. THE ROOMS:   With much research of all the hotels in the Anaheim/ Disneyland area this is the only hotel I found that didn’t have rock hard beds with horrible multi–colored comforters that are about as comfortable and inviting as hospital beds. Summary: I stayed at this hotel cause it was near Disneyland.  It's got an excellent resturaunt for dinner and breakfast..  The lobby is very modern and it has a great bar with friendly staff.  My son loved the swimming pool and the tiki bar and bungalows around the pool makes it a very relaxing atmosphere.  Even if you're not going to Disneyland, is a great location in Anaheim and easy access to main freeway.  The rooms look new and clean.  Especially liked the HD flat panel televisions in each room.  The hotel is well made for families and younger people who want to have a good time.  Oh....at night you get a great view of the fireworks from Disneyland by the Tiki bar and pool.....very nice!  Will stay again.

Summary Heading: Not all it is cracked up to be
Summary: The hotels website is fantastic, first of all - they must have hired a fancy photographer to make the property look that good.  When you actually get there you know immediatly it is a remodeled Holiday Inn. It is nice, dont get me wrong - but it was not what I was expecting at all, especially after viewing the website.  My husband & I brought along our little chihuahua/pug mix dog & it is nice they accept pets, but I was suprised when I checked in, dog in tow, that I was given no guidelines as to where to take the dog to go potty, not to take the dog to the pool, leave her in the room unattended, etc.  I think they spent alot of money on the room furnishings though, as they were very nice - but the fixtures, such as the tub, sink and toilet were old and seemed out of place with
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don't let the lobby fool you - It's a Total Dive
Summary: We stayed there in May 2007 for one night. We walked in to find a beautiful lobby and friendly staff.   When we got to our room, it was like a completely different hotel. The room was musty with  dirty carpet - there appreared to be blood stains near the sink area. The bathroom was completely DISGUSTING.   It wasn't that cheap either - we paid $200 for the ONE NIGHT.   It looks like they put all the renovation money into the bar area, lobby, and pool. The actual rooms are completely nasty!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: stay here if you like having a night club in your lobby
Summary: There is one word that comes to mind STRANGE! Stay away!  I stayed at Hotel Menage one night for a work conference. The hotel is both good and bad and my guess is everyone's experience will differ. It is very evident that the hotel has invested a lot of money into updating the exterior, the lobby, restaurant and bar.   Exterior: The hotel has the typical earth, red and brown tone paint. The paint appears fresh and the building seems to be in good shape. As you drive in there what appear to be several gigantic gray lava lamps. Only one of the lamps was working. The cab dropped us off and a bellhop greeted us. He literally said hi and then stood by watching us pull our luggage out of the trunk.   Lobby: The lobby is decorated in dark brown shiny colors. There was techno blaring
Manager Response: none

Summary: In my business I attend a lot of conventions  So, needless to say, I have stayed in my share of "convention hotels".  I was so thankful to have stayed at Hotel Menage during a recent convention at the Anaheim Convention Center.   The lobby was impressive upon entering.  I found the rooms to be modest but clean!  The hotel was going through renovations, but what was completed (restaurant, pool area, and lobby) looked great!  There is even a cool business traveller area right off the lobby which has areas to work on computers or just hang out.   My favorite part of my stay was eating in the restaurant K'ya (love the name!)  I feasted on salmon and fantastic wine.  The wait staff was attentive, and the manager even came to my table to see how my stay was.  After a fabulous dinner,
Manager Response: none

Summary: I came out to take my daughter to Disneyland for the weekend. We arrived late friday night and had no troubles checking in. The front desk staff was friendly and quick. We got to our room and found it to be a very nice basic hotel room. We didn't plan on spending much time at the hotel as there is so much to do nearby but after seeing the pool area we decided to at least spend time there. The pool is great and after watching the fireworks from a crowded main street on saturday we decided to watch from the pool deck the next. all in all we had a great time there. The lobby is really cool and although i didn't visit the bar it seemed to be popular and had a fun atmosphere.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was one of the absolute worst hotel experiences I have ever had. Ignore the comments from the manager that they are "updating" the hotel -- we stayed in April, after the basic "renovations" were complete -- and it was hideous. The lobby was dark (black) with candles and loud blaring music -- it looked like something suited more towards Las Vegas than next to Disneyland. The service was terrible, you could barely hear the desk attendant over the blaring music, and there were a few scattered drunk people all over the lobby (not a family destination spot by any means). And that was the GOOD part of the hotel, as it was at least redone and looked modern. The pool looked nice as well. However, once we went to the back part of the hotel to go to our room, the horrors began.  We
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay at the Menage was pretty good.  Check in was quick.  The lobby is remodeled and very hip and nice.  Our room was not remodeled.  I asked about remodeled rooms which were beautiful and was told that that would be an additional $60.  We passed on the upgrade.  Our room was a basic hotel.  Maple or light wood furniture.  Two queen beds, sink and bathroom.  All were clean.  The pool area was very nice and landscaped.  The fireworks are easily seen from that side of the building.  The breakfast was wonderful!  Unfortunately our second morning they were only serving a buffet so we passed on it.  Overall, for the price the Menage worked very well for us.  It's an easy walk to the parks.  The walk is quick and not nearly as crowded as the places 'across the street'.  I would
Manager Response: none

Summary: Do NOT under ANY conditions stay at this hotel. This hotel is NOT adjacent the property unless you feel 12 lanes of Freeway traffic means adjacent. The room was dark, smelled of smoke; it was marked non-smoking. Occassionaly relieved the "wisp" airfresher would go off. Everything in the room was either dirty or way to old to be in service any longer. "Drapes", bedding, & carpet. TV, remote, phones, "game boys"....mostly non-functional. The bathroom was so small the door had to be closed to go to the loo. The door opened in, so to do this required stepping into the tub. The towels were Dollar store feature items. In the bathroom there was so much mold and peeling caulk it was hard to distinguish which was what. The tub tap could not be turned off; it dripped loudly throughout the
Manager Response: Dear SuthsideLady,  Thank you for taking the time to write this review and express your concern about Hotel Ménage. I am very concerened and am truly sorry to hear about your stay with us and to read about the quality of your room. It is true that we are currently going through a full renovation of our guest rooms. Casa Resorts purchased this property in late August 2006 and have been working towards the guest room renovations ever since. We have approx. 100 rooms renovated at this point and by June, we will have a brand new product to offer our guests. The entire room will be changed and brand new. The fireworks from Disneyland are very close and have been a great topic of conversation and enjoyment for many families. I am again sorry if any children were terrified by them. I would love the opportunity to speak with you about this in person and try to rectify the situation with you. I can be reached via e-mail at stay@casaresortsinc.com Thank you again for your time and opportunity to invite you back to experience our beatiful new product Rob - Casa Resorts

Summary: Our trip was last-minute, and we didn't have reservations. We found this hotel just by driving around. The lobby was contemporary chic, with glass tiles, a hip vibe, and a cool bar. Staff was very friendly.   The pool area is also very pretty, well-landscaped and inviting, with plenty of seating.  And that's the end of the pretty stuff.  We stayed in the family suite, which was HUGE--living room, large fully-equipped kitchen, and great big bedroom and bath. Immediately upon entering the room, it felt filthy. Walls were dirty, the sofa was ripped, closet doors were barely hanging on, the marble coffee table had stains all over it. Doors were cracked, broken, with sticky filthy handprints and wipe marks everywhere. I didn't want anyone to touch anything. The lovely exterior had
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The pool area is great but....
Summary: Check in went smoothly but after getting into our room we discovered that the 2 queen beds were really 1 queen and a fold-out shaped like a V. There was a private event in the lobby the first night of our stay that we were unaware of until we got back from dinner to find that they were only valet parking. Waded through the guests in the lobby to get to our room. Was kept awake late with the thumping beat music from downstairs. We were on the 4th floor. In the morning while getting ready to leave for the day, our sink started backing up with raw sewage and was necessary to evacuate to a different room that was closer to the freeway so we could hear it  more clearly. For our trouble we were offered a free breakfast which we didn't use for loss of appetite. When we went to get our

Summary Heading: Absolutely do Not stay at this hotel
Summary: From the outside, this hotel looks pretty nice.  But Beware.  The toilet in our room was clogged upon our arrival.  Within 5 minutes of letting ourselves into our room, we had to call housekeeping to unplug the toilet.  Later that night, we discovered the tub didn't drain properly so we were standing in 6 inches of water every time we showered.  The problem was not new as we could tell that other travelers had tried to fix the problem by pushing down on the handle that should unplug the plug, checking, as we did, to see if it was somehow jammed.  There was mold floating around in our shower water and because we were on the 4th floor, I am assuming that the pipes couldn't handle the water running down and it was backing up but I can't be sure.  I called the front dest about this

Summary Heading: Not the best, but not the worst
Summary: The service and personnel at this hotel are great.  They were always willing to help you with whatever you needed.  The K'ya restrauant was excellent and the staff there was great too.  After a long wait to be seated and to have our order taken, the manager advised us that our bill would be taken care of by the hotel.  The rooms are nothing to write home about and are in need of updating (the hotel is in the process of renovating) we did not get an updated room.  There was a private party on our Saturday night stay, which we were all forewarned about upon check in.  The hotel limited the use of the lobby, restuarant, bar and pool areas from the hotel guests during this private party.  What they didn't warn you about was the noise level.  The loud thumping noise and vibration was
Manager Response: none

Summary: Walking into this hotel, we were actually a little impressed.  Really cool "boutique" feel that we were not expecting. Checking in was fairly straight forward and went well. When we checked in to the room, we were not impressed with the prime view of the dumpsters and what seemed to be a fair amount of garbage on the ground below us, but it seemed like construction garbage and was shrugged off pretty much right away.  Walking into the room, it was just that; a room. Nothing special.  Two beds, a wee bathroom and a sink, all in a box; definitely nothing to write home about. Walking into the bathroom, the back of the door had a chunk out of it, making it look rattier than it probably is.  (Although today, walking in the bathroom there was a nice stain on the floor that wasn't
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a beautiful hotel - much more attractive and luxurious in person than we expected from the photos. The room was large and comfortable (really comfy beds and pillows!), and the hotel featured a beautifully designed/landscaped outdoor pool and bar area. The only drawbacks were the noise level, due to the motel-style exterior hallways outside the rooms. Even though a weeknight, the music piped into the pool area was so loud that we had to request a new room. Another drawback was no continental breakfast - but a mile or two down Harbor Blvd. are some of the best donut shops around! I would definitely recommend this hotel for its chic good looks, spaciousness of rooms and overall value. The perfect place for couples and families alike!
Manager Response: none

Summary: stayed there for 5days  .3families .  Me & my family loved d hotel. we got there at 11 am n they let us checked in our room.they're doin somethin in d lobby but d next mornin it was magic . It was beautiful! as if were'nt in d same hotel. great job guys! had some breakfast i recommend season berries. the staff  in bar n restaurant are very friendly, polite, n  honest. it was so convenient to everything food, store, theme park,shopping n airport.what more could you ask for. to everybody in hotel menage thank you for a wonderful stayed in your hotel .keep  up the good work. hope to see you again n God bless....
Manager Response: none

Summary: Probably the most uncomfortable and filthy "three star" hotel I have ever stayed in. It should be rated a one star at best. The beds are so uncomfortable that prisoners would not sleep on them. I actually slept on the floor. The sheets were stained as was the couch.  The staff were pleasant enough, but spoke little english. I am going to ask to talk to the manager and see if I can get out of the rest of my stay and find a better hotel (shouldn't be hard).
Manager Response: Dear Sixcolors,  on behalf of the Management Team, I apologize for your experience here. As I stated in my previous response. Casa Resorts/Hotel Menage is going through full renovations. We purchased this property (as a Holiday Inn) and are transforming it into an upscale (modern) boutique hotel. We have completed the lobby/public space and are starting the guest rooms next week. We are completely "gutting" the rooms and purchasing new beds, linens, plasmas Etc.  I understand about the current conditions of the guest rooms and would like the opportunity to rectify this situation with you personally. I am here at the hotel and would like to speak with you personally. I would also like to invite you to come back and see the finished product in a few months.  Thank You Hotel Menage

Summary: I decided to take the optimistic route and favor the "good" reviews over the "not so good" ones. Besides, the room rate was too good to pass up. For $79 a day I got free parking, a newspaper by my door, free wireless internet service and a free breakfast. I was very happy with my three night stay and plan on returning. The hotel is under new management I was told.   I usually write short reviews but there were many things to mention. I was there on business so I can't comment on the Disneyland stuff.   I was surprised to find a beautifully renovated lobby that was "hip" decorated with blue neon,  paintings and designer furniture. The restaurant was also refurbished with the same upscale theme . The tiled mosaic lobby bar complimented the overall theme. A side room off the lobby
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have never been to a hotel restaurant that a Chef or I think he's the manager ask you if everythings alright or is there anything he can do for you especially for a 3 stars hotel. I am really impressed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here one night on the way to Vegas. Rooms spacious and clean. Bathroom big. Didn't go to Disneyland, but I'd say it's a 10 minute walk to the Park on a sidewalk on a busy highway. I certainly wouldn't want to walk the kids to the park using this route. The pool was really nice after a long journey, but it's spoilt by the very loud traffic noise from the highway just yards away. Staff very friendly and helpful. Fast food joints are pretty much opposite the park. Recommend Tony Roma's for excellent burgers. There are plenty of hotels closer to the park, but if you don't mind a slightly hazardous walk, this hotel is not too bad at all!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were there in the middle of renovations, and they took EXCELLENT care of us. The rooms do need a little TLC (our toilet rocked, and the tub leaked), but it was clean and comfortable.  We had booked a room overlooking the pool, but the WIFI didn't work in our room, so after trying 5 different rooms, my husband found one...that overlooked the kitchen roof. Yeah. But the hotel staff made it right by giving us coupons for a free adult meal everytime we went up to the counter for the "kids eat free" coupons.  The restaurant food was excellent, and the staff was great. I will definitely recommend this hotel, and we would defnitely stay there again.  Also, on Friday and Saturday nights, Disneyland sets off fireworks, and from the pool it's like having front-row seats.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were a little worried about staying at this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but we had a very nice stay overall.   We arrived at 2PM an hour before scheduled check in and only had to wait a few minutes to get a room.  As priority club members we were given a reserved parking space right by the front door.  We received $10 off breakfast every day, and of course all meals for the kids were free.   We ate several meals in the restaurant, Poppy's.  The food was always excellent and most of the time the service was VERY fast.  The only time it was slow was on our last day when we slept late and went to breakfast after 9:30.  They were very crowded and slow then.  The shuttle was great.  $2 per person daily gave you unlimited rides, and dropped you right in front of the
